We also had a night tour with Clemencia that encompassed the theater district and were able to catch a live band at a Milonga. BA is a city that requires tapping into the soul of the city to truly appreciate and understand it. The private tours definitely were able to catch this aspect of BA.

Simply great. A slightly different review here as I can't comment on the tour or guiding services she provides but can give a great example of customer service. I contacted Mariela to help with an issue I was having with a local store. I bought some custom made shoes back in March, and the store told me that they would be sent to me within a week. A month later and nothing but static, alarm bells started ringing. So I contacted Mariela in order to have a local to check the situation out. Truth be told I was hoping that having someone go to the store would be harder to ignore than yet another email from the English chap half a world away. Even though this was somewhat of an odd request she got involved and within 4 emails had contacted the store, overcome the language barrier, and my shoes (which if I am being honest I thought were never going to arrive) were in the post and I'm writing this review having just received them. If this is how she handles odd requests I think she is a decent bet for handling her bread and butter services. Next time I am in BA I'll be looking her up!

Super flexible and knowledgeable!. I only had one afternoon and wanted to see as much as I could. Clemencia was a pleasure - a real porteña! I didn't know what that meant until the guided tour, but now I do - knowledgeable, friendly, extroverted and proud to hail from Buenos Aires. She made the afternoon super fun and was able to customize the time on a moments notice. Mariela runs a great business - really easy to work with and flexible with scheduling! I would sign up again in a heartbeat!

Above and beyond the rest. Specialized, personal service down to where to go, what to see, what to do, and even souvenirs to take home! This is our 2nd visit to Buenos Aires, and we couldn't have enjoyed it more! Clemencia was charming, knowledgeable, gracious, helpful, lovely....well, there just aren't enough superlatives for this tour. If you are looking for an intimate glimpse into the food, culture, art of Buenos Aires, you just have to contact Buenos Aires Concierge. It's a NO BRAINER!

very knowledgeable. if you're looking for a higly personalized concierge-type service for your buenos aires stay, mariela definitely fits the bill. from hotel bookings to restaurants, she'll make the arrangements to your specifications. she also has many contacts who can help you with specific requests from city tours to breakfast talks about the country by local experts, and tango shows and tours. really added to the quality of our time in this great city.

Outstanding!!. Excellent tour all around! Mariella is very professional, passionate and knowledgeable tour operator. She was very helpful in assisting us with all of our questions and concerns before we arrived in BA and also arranged a good transfer service for us from the airport to our hotel.We were dissapointed that she was busy on the day we needed a tour of BA...but she promised us that we would be just as happy with her colleague Clemencia. She was not kidding...our 7 hour tour with Clemencia was outstanding!! We really appreciated Clemencia's knowledge and depth of BA. She is a very personal worldly young woman.We would highly recommend Clemencia to anyone looking for an outstanding private tour of BA. Thank you Mariella!

Best way to experience Buenos Aires!. I can't speak highly enough of Mariela at Buenos Aires Concierge. Buenos Aires was only a stopover for me as this was a trip to Antarctica. I had one afternoon to visit some of the highlights of Buenos Aires. My Spanish is non-existent and I was hesitant to tour on my own. I was impressed from the first email - quick response, friendly, helpful. Then after I arrived, right from the introductions I knew I would have a wonderful time. Mariela is friendly and personable, and very knowledgeable. She adapted our plans easily when the protests affected our taxi plans, and she involved me in the animated taxi driver's conversation which was fun! And of course, as well as having a wonderful time, I learned about some of the history of BA, how its citizens live, and its wonderful sights. We had hot chocolate and churros in Cafe Tortoni, visited Caminito, and had a wonderful stroll through Recoleta Cemetery. I would not hesitate to recommend Mariela - my only regret is that I didn't have more time - I could have easily spent days chatting and visiting around Buenos Aires.

Buenos Aires City tour. Mariela at Buenos Aires Concierge.com provided an exceptional experience for us with just 3 days to experience the highlights of B/A. We thoroughly enjoyed the selected venues and she arranged reservations for dining, tango shows, shopping for leather and some marvelous malbec wine. Book early and you will not be disappointed!

Incredibly Knowledgeable, Capable & Personable Concierge. Mariela is truly an amazing concierge. She is exactly who you want to help plan a trip to Argentina. I contracted Mariela to act as a professional concierge for a business trip to Buenos Aires. It was an usual request in that I needed her to arrange meetings with nightlife venue owners and Argentinian lifestyle experts. During my trip she acted as my translator, personal advisor, and overall BA immersion expert. Mariela has an incredible knowledge of the city and amazing personal contacts. She seemingly knows everyone and everything in Buenos Aires. She has phenomenal recommendations for cafes, restaurants, bars, clubs, fitness facilities and more cultural pursuits. Please note that this is not meant to be hyperbole. I’ve used concierge services for similar projects in other cities and, without a doubt, she is the best I have ever come across. Mariela is not only great at what she does but, she is also incredibly personable and an absolute pleasure to be around. By the end of your trip, you will likely want to include her in your plans simply because you enjoy her company. Highly, highly recommended…

How to make BA go from great to truly awesome!. We’re a group of 12 friends who hired Mariela to take care of us while we stayed in BA for 3 days. We wanted lectures by professors in economics and history, given in our hotel over breakfast. We wanted tours of various parts of BA. We wanted to go a bit faster, then a bit slower. We wanted to eat and drink and rest. And on our last day, after we had said good bye to Mariela, we needed more advice, guidance, and phone calls made, and she cheerfully answered her texts and delivered what we needed. Truly, she made a huge difference to our stay in BA.One of the service providers who was inexperienced quoted us a price which we accepted (from Canada, because it seemed reasonable), which ended up looking too expensive once we got to BA. Mariela, on her own initiative, bargained him down after we had received his presentation and paid him, and the next day showed up with a refund that she got from him without ever being asked by us.When Mariela gave us tours, she was well-informed, professional, and presented very well. For example, I’ve been to the Recoleta cemetery several times in the passed and still missed out on a lot of the interesting sights that Mariela pointed out to us.Mariela charges by the hour for her tours, and given the quality, the price seemed exceptionally reasonable. In addition, she provided information, help, support, translation, arrangements, often via telephone, email or text, all without any additional charge.She really went above and beyond what we expected.

Excellent tour provider. Mariela and her driver met a friend and me at the airport during a layover of several hours. We had a flight from the US and had to fly out of a different airport near downtown. Mariela took us on a very nice tour of BA during the brief time we had available. She is very gracious and fun. We enjoyed the walking tours of the city center. We also took us for a wonderful meaty Argentinian meal. After the tour, she and the driver took us to the downtown airport to catch our domestic flight. Mariela's introductory tour in BA really made it special for us.

Insightful and Flexible. Outstanding, knowledgeable and sincere guide. She was able to tailor our trip to our specific interests and was extremely flexible in accommodating last minute changes. I would highly recommend Mariela's services to anyone who wants an intimate view of Buenos Aires.

First Class concierge service in Buenos Aires. Mariela provided our group with an exceptional tour of Buenos Aires. She provided unique insights into the city and it was a real pleasure have her as our guide. She was able to tailor our tour to our interests and was incredibly flexible in making last minute changes to our itinerary at our request. I highly recommend Mariela's concierge and tour guide services to anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

A great guide to Buenos Aires. We arranged a day tour of Buenos Aires with Mariela. She was very helpful and easy to deal with in getting everything set up before our trip. On the day of our tour it was very warm and she was quite flexible in revising the tour to accomodate us. She was also helpful in making suggestions for other activities and restaurants that we might enjoy while we were there. I felt that if a question or need arose that I could contact her for help. I would highly recommend her. She is knowledgable and very friendly and pleasant. We had lunch with her and quite enjoyed the conversation.

Most amazing tour guide in Buenos Aires!. My sister and I just came back from an incredible 2 week trip to Buenos Aires. I can't even begin to describe how amazing Mariela is! She started helping us to set up our trip a few weeks before we left for Buenos Aires. She arranged a complete itinerary for us that included all of the following: Transportation, local money exchange, City tour, Countryside day trip, tickets to the best Tango Show, guided shopping, bar and night club tour, great restaurant recommendations and so much more. One of the highlights for me since I am a ballroom and tango dancer, was the personal recommendations for tango schools, teachers and the best Milongas. She even helped make appointments with teachers before I arrived to make sure they had time for me. I am so happy that we chose Mariela as our guide and concierge for Buenos Aires. Our trip could not have been more perfect and I can't recommend her enough!! BEST TOUR GUIDE EVER!! :)

Best guide in South America!. I just came back from a 6-city solo tour of South America (my first visit) and one of the best memories of my amazing trip was the day I had the pleasure of spending with Mariela. I engaged private guides in every city that I visited (Rio, BA, Lima, Santiago, Cuzco, Aguas Calientes) and Mariela was the best guide I had - by a wide margin. From the time that she met me at my hotel (right on time!), I had the most incredible seven hours getting to know Buenos Aires. We traversed the city by taxi, subway, bus and on foot to see the key sights (Recoleta, San Telmo, La Boca, Palermo, etc.) but what stuck with me most was the brilliant conversations that we had. Mariela gave me incredible insight into her city - what it was like to live there, the good bits, the bad bits and everything in between. I really felt as though a friend was showing me around her home city and this gave me an appreciation for Buenos Aires that I could not have experienced any other way. She recommended a great place for lunch (I can't remember the name), brought me to the city's most famous cafe for delicious coffee and pointed out fun facts and sights at every other street corner we passed. I had a great time and would recommend her to anyone visiting Buenos Aires who wants to see a side of the city that you would never experience through a guidebook or bus tour. Thanks Mariela!

Fantastic Guide. My wife and I cannot say enough great things about Mariela. I had been communicating with her for several months via email and Skype discussing what to do and see in Buenos Aires. She recommended and setup for us transportation from and to the airport, comments and suggestions on the hotel and area we were staying at, restaurants, tours, money exchange, etc. All her advice was spot-on and led to a great experience in the city. When we met her for a tour of the city she instantly made us feel a part of her family. Her knowledge of the country and city was extensive and provided us with an understanding we would probably not have gotten elsewhere. As a result we loved our stay in BA and highly recommend using Mariela!

Phenomenal Help in Buenos Aires. Car, Driver, Tour Guide- all arranged professionally and with timliness.4.5 hour private tour with great english speaking tour guide+competitive rate= happy first day in Argentina for me and my wife celebrating our 20th Wedding Anniversary.Mariela is more than happy to offer advice and help book activities as well as provide a great tour experience.Truly a gem.

A wonderful guide to the city. This was my first time to BA and Argentina, and Mariela helped to make it a great experience for our group with wonderful restaurant recommendations and reservations, wine tastings, bike tours and general advice and translation help. I would highly recommend using her for your next trip.

Great times in BA. I have been to BA 3 times before this last trip. This was by far, my favorite trip and the biggest reason was related to our concierage. She had fantastic recommendations for meals and helped us with ideas for everything from wine tastings to bicycle tours in the middle of the city. I would definitely recommend using this company.

My visit as I wish. When I moved to Argentina I was carrying a mix of doubt and panic feeling , but after first meeting with the owner of Buenos Aires concierge "Mariela" in the first day, every thing has been changed and I saw the mysteries of lovely city of Buenos Aires from all corners either heritage or modern sites.

Perfect tour through Buenos aires. Mariela is the perfect tour guide. She has a great knowledge about the city and adapts the tour to your personal requirements. I can only highly recommend her as she offers a lot more than the standard city tour. She is a lot of fun to be with, and can tell a lot of stories about the city. Apart from attractions and historical sights she also gives reccomendations on restaurants, bars, cafes and shows.

The best experience!!!. Mariela was terrific and just what we wanted - having shared our experiences with others on the cruise from BA she was just what they wanted too! So this is to let the rest of the world know about this gem. We write as a mature couple who safely wanted to access the best of BA with only 5 hours to do it before tucking into a steak and glass of Malbec!! M was the solution and via email we devised an agreeable itinerary. Her English is excellent and her email replies were full and prompt. She is intelligent, honest, good humoured and very aware for our safety. We met at the cemetery and her immense knowledge made this an amazing experience (we later found we knew far more than other visitors who had just accessed Evita's mausoleum). We walked and used the underground to access the main attractions, punctuated with wonderful cafe stops and the itinerary included El Ateneo (library in a theatre), which we would not have thought of. We then took a taxi to save time to be able to explore the colourful and exciting La Boca. M ticked all the boxes, she even made reservations for our evening meal and gave fine wine recommendations. We cannot sing her praises enough. Thank you Mariela for a very memorable visit.

She's the best!. Mariela is a wonderful tour guide. I hadn't been to Buenos Aires and had a couple of days on my own before a friend arrived, so I hired Mariela to show me around the city for 5 hours. Not only was she knowledgeable and eager to fulfill her client's wishes, it was like spending the day with a friend - sharing stories and laughs as we wandered the streets. Even after our day of touring, she kept in touch with me throughout the week and provided additional ideas for restaurants and things my friend and I might enjoy doing. Her costs were very reasonable and absolutely worth it! Track her down now!

Knowledgeable and Professional. Mariela lived up to her well-deserved reputation. First of all she arrived promptly to our hotel, getting us off to a good start. Although she had a number of places on her list for us to see, she exhibited flexibility, substituting some of ours for hers. She has an engaging personality and good command of English. She even sent us some follow-up information the following day. I highly recommend her for touring Buenos Aires.

Invaluable. Mariela is an invaluable contact in Buenos Aires...and a delight to work with. We contacted her because of Trip Advisor, and were so glad we did! She arranged our transport to and from the airport, advised us on currency to bring, sights to see and places to eat, and escorted us for an afternoon to the cemetery, bookstore, botanical gardens and more. She was just great - always available via email with any questions, and even assisting us when I left a cellphone in the car at the airport (the car company contacted her and the cellphone was delivered to the United lounge a couple of hours later!). BA is very far from home, but Mariela makes you feel like you have a good friend who lives there and knows it inside and out.

Personalized shopping excursion. I had a tour setup by Mariela to tour the Recoleta neighborhood in search for most excellent shoes, wine, shirts. Paula helped me find all the great couture shoe stores and then we moved on to a perfume laboratory, a Pata shirt (national sport similar to Polo), an actual Polo store, chocolates and lunch.Mariela was super super responsive with a few options even though I contacted her only two days before my desired tour time.

Very intimate experience from a real porteno , first hand knowledge about current events. Tailored tour to our schedule , guide was knowledgable in current events and history of Argentina . It was very interesting for us to get the first hand experiences from a real porteno

Great Time in Bs As. We had two tours with Mariela and her people during our stay in Buenos Aires. The first was on the first day. It was a wonderful introduction to the city and what is available to do and see. What an awesome begining to a wonderful trip! The second was a tour of great pizza, Argentinian ice cream, excellent coffee in an old world setting and ended in a milonga. The milonga was an incredibly, exciting experience of tango in the local setting. The band was incredible. I have some really interesting pictures and videos. We observed the locals dance a variety of tango routines. The professional dancers which came out later were impressive. There is nothing hotter than two tango dancers performing, other than three tango dancers performing. If you go to Buenos Aires and you should indeed, connect with Mariela and her team for an experience of a lifetime.

Best tour guide, bar none. Traveling through BA for work, I was fortunate to get a weekend in this amazing city before continuing on my travels. While I came to town well-prepared for work, I was grossly under-prepared for how to spend the weekend.Mariela was an invaluable resource from the outset - I literally had nothing planned on arrival, and emailed her after checking in to my hotel to send me a tour suggestion as soon as possible, as I didn't want to spend half my weekend researching. Within a half hour of my email, she sent me a detailed itinerary that was fit-for-purpose to my requested duration and location.The tour itself was fantastic. Mariela's comprehensive knowledge of the city and its landmarks coupled with being culturally and socially in-the-know made for a truly unique experience. I originally had planned for a 3 hour tour; I ended up enjoying the insider's guide to BA so much that we ended up going an additional 2 hours (another ad-hoc decision by me that she was able to accomodate seamlessly). Logistically, she was also able to help me with money exchange and acquiring a sim card - being a non-Spanish speaker, these tasks would have taken me considerable time and stress to do independently. We got both tasks done in about 10 minutes.I realize this review is long-winded, but I felt compelled to give credit where it is due. Mariela's genuine passion for her work was evident throughout the tour, and I ended up walking away with a healthy admiration for the city of Buenos Aires and an excellent culture education.

Great Buenos Aires Evening. Mariela did a great job. We wanted a true Buenos Aires & Tango experience. Mariela came through, authentic Argentina Pizza, best ice cream in town and fabulous coffee cafe. Then off to a Barrio Tango Club. Mariela was engaging, friendly and made sure we all had a great time. Just like having a local friend that shows you the sights.

Mariela is the Best!!!. If you are traveling and want about Buenos Aires, AR. You must hire Mariela. She was so knowledgeable about the city and gave us so many options. She took us to see one of the best Tango shows and later we met the lead singer back stage. She is the best!!!!

Incredible Experience. Mariela (of Buenois Aires Concierge) is such a great person with a wealth of knowledge of Buenos Aires.I dont consider myself to be a "tour person" or a touristy traveler. I typically like to plan activities myself and do my own research. That said, Buenos Aires is a huge place and if you don't have the right information (restaurants, bars, activvities, etc.), you will miss out on a lot of opportunties and experiences. I was fortunate enough to reach out to BA Concierge and was able to maximize my time (and energy) in BA. Do yourself a favor and take advantage of Buenos Aires Conierge, you wont be disappointed!

Knowledgable, warm and friendly...perfect tour guide!. We began emailing Mariela several weeks prior to our trip to Buenos Aires and she was instrumental in planning our entire trip. Mariela is very knowledgable about all aspects of her city and what makes her even more special is her warmth and friendliness. She's very easy to communicate with and had no problem doing reservations for us prior to our arrival and in some cases having to make last minute changes. This makes a trip to a foreign city much more comfortable when you really don't know how to budget your time for different days. Having Mariela plan every detail of your vacation makes for a very stress free visit. We met with her at The Recoleta Cemetery for a walking tour of the city. Her tidbits of information throughout the cemetery made for a very interesting tour. She is so easy to talk to, intelligent, witty, well traveled and with a very sweet disposition. We needed to change dollars and she took us to the place she knew best to get a better rate which is apparently only known by the locals, a place we would have never found on our own and the difference in the exchange was significant. That was greatly appreciated. We had coffee in one of the oldest, most traditional coffee shops in Buenos Aires and lunch in a local place in Palermo that had the most delicious food. These are things that tourists, without the benefit of a local's guidance don't get to experience. After a long, leisurely lunch, we felt as though we had made a new friend, one that we would recommend to anyone visiting Buenos Aires!

Our wonderful Guide. Mariela was the key to making our stay in Buenos Aires become one of the best holiday and travel experiences we have had. She is very engaging and well versed in the city, it's history and where best to go and not to go! We started off with a guide and ended up with a friend and were truly grateful for what she did for us.

Mariela is a top notch tour guide. On our first day of arrival we met Mariela in front of the Recoleta cemetery and started our 3 hour tour their. Both my husband and I were beyond pleased with Mariela's knowledge of everything and her easy going disposition. She went above and beyond with us and answered any questions we had of Buenos Aires, even if it din't pertain to the tour. We highly recommend her!

An essential part of a great Buenos Aires experience. My wife and I hired Mariela for our first day in Buenos Aires, she was simply fantastic. She is well educated, very bright and extremely knowledgable about Buenos Aires. In our time with her, we learned so much about the culture and how to get around and had a lot of fun. She is also a great evaluator of restaurants/bars and things to do. She is very responsive to emails with any questions during your stay.In our opinion, arranging for time with Mariela at the front end of your trip to Buenos Aires is a must do for a great experience in Buenos Aires!!

Mariela is a terrific, knowledgeable tour guide.. My wife and I greatly enjoyed touring Buenos Aires with Mariela. She speaks English extremely well, navigates crowded areas very efficiently, and plans a great tour of a beautiful city. We would highly recommend her.

Fantastic!!!!. I spent three days in Buenos Aires and only my last day with Mariela, what a mistake I should have hired her everyday. Mariela is son fun to be with, she is very well educated, has traveled the world and she is so fun to be with.My day, rainy and cold, started with a walk through the cementerio, what a great place. Then coffee and beer for me at La Biela a great cafe that makes you think what Buenos Aires must have been when Jorge Luis Borges was around. Then she took me by sub ( an added experience) to Casa Rosada and San Telmo to see antique shops, what a place. Then she told me to Boca and the to lunch at a great local place called el Desnivel where we had Bife de Chorizo and enjoyed a great conversation. After a break for siesta and to watch the soccer game at a bar called Las Ramblas in Recoleta she picked me up at my hotel and took me to see a fantastic tango show at Casa Gardel. What a fantastic Sunday!If you go to Las Ramblas, right behind the Hotel Alvear, order the sandwich de lomo, a steak sandwich to die for.I would highly recommend Mariela to anyone looking to have a great time in Buenoas Aires.

Mariela Cavallo - a wonderful trip advisor. My wife and I recently had the pleasure of using Mariela as our trip advisor to Buenos Aires. Mariela is everything you can want for an advisor- she is young, energetic, informative and responsive. At the same time, as she shows you the sights and sounds of Buenos Aires, she allows you to absorb the context of what you are experiencing. I would not hesitate to recommend her to any of my dear frieds.Mike Abrams

Passionate about her work, a gem I have found!. Mariela is not your average tour guide. She not only knows about the history behind the places you visit but she adds a personal touch to it. Her passion for her work is evident in her enthusiasm in introducing the places of interest and the paths less traveled. Based on my personal preferences, she suggested really good itineraries and many good places to visit on my own (which I hoped I had more time in Buenos Aires to visit them all). Corresponding with Mariela is a breeze, she responds via email quickly and is very patient with all my requests. Meeting her in person is even better! She is so friendly, so down-to-earth, so exciting, so refreshing and really beautiful! I engaged Mariela's services for 3 days and it was such a memorable experience. Mariela felt like my long lost good friend from the other part of the world despite just being with her for 3 days. If you want to view the city from an exciting and refreshing perspective, go for Mariela. If you want to be introduced to this city by a friend, go for Mariela. Because as a friend, she looks out for your best interests and touches your heart in a special way. I was a solo traveler, first time traveling half the world, without any knowledge of the Spanish language and I was feeling really disconnected, lost and lonely. Mariela helped me to break into this new culture and made me feel as home. I strongly recommend her!

Amazing Intimate Tour. We had a great tour of Buenos Aires with Mariela. She is a very friendly and pleasant person. She has alot of current information that are not available in guide books, etc. Very quick to respond via email and she had so much knowledge on the Recoleta Cemetery which is definitely recommended. If you need recommendations on restaurants, bars, etc. she is a wealth of information. When we return to Buenos Aires, we are definitely doing another outing with Mariela.

Great Tour. Mariela ia wonderful tour guide who knows lots of information historical and current information about the locations she showed us. We particularly liked the tour of the cemetery. She was a delight to work with and we enjoyed the half a day we spent with her.

Amazing experience. Mariela was an absolute blessing. She was incredibly patient with my emails (more than 10 email exchanges) prior to my trip and answered all my queries succinctly. I book a day tour with her where she gave me an excellent overview of Buenos Aires taking me to the key spots and I particularly liked the local insights she provided. We had coffee at a charming cafe and lunch at this secret restaurant tucked away in a little corner. She also went the extra mile to assist with organizing a 3 day trip to Perito Moreno that occurred without a hitch. For the rest of my days, Mariela also took the time to ask me what other activities I wanted to cover e.g. shopping, tango shows, horse racing, and gave me all kinds of detailed tips to plan my entire trip. My Buenos Aires trip absolutely would not have been complete without Mariela.- Alicia

Insightful and fun tour. Our tour guide, Mariela, was very insightful and fun. She was very knowledgable about Buenos Aires and Argentina. She also has travelled a lot herself which gave good insight into comparing Argentina's sites and scenes to other places in the world.The tour price was very reasonable and only slightly more than a group bus tour. In my opinion, the value of the private tour was WAY more than a huge group tour. Also, we were able to go at our own pace. Mariela had a planned schedule and route but was willing to work with us to edit for our interests.Must book tour!!!

WONDERFUL experience!. I am currently studying abroad as a college student in Buenos Aires, so I took a tour with Mariela when my mother and grandfather came to visit me. Despite the wide range of interests (and ages!) amongst the three of us, we all thoroughly enjoyed the experience. Mariela is energetic, enthusiastic, interesting, and interested. She wanted to know what kinds of things we liked, and listened and adjusted to accomodate them. She also knew tons of "legends" and local stories, especially regarding Recoleta Cemetery, which added a nice local flare to the experience. Mariela provides a unique and personalized tour of Buenos Aires that actually felt more like a great conversation with a friend than a tour from a stranger. I highly recommend!

Great way to see Buenos Aires. It was great fun spending the better part a day wandering through Buenos Aires with Mariella. She seemed to relish sharing her knowledge and love of the city she knows so well. We enjoyed her thoughtful and colorful explanations of the sights and neighborhoods she lead us through, and also getting to know a bit about her full and interesting life. Mariella was one of the highlights of our trip and we highly recommend her.

Personal and insightful tour of Buenos Aires. Mariella did a wonderful job telling stories and showing unique spots throughout Buenos Aires.I highly recommend using her for experiencing the city. You can't go wrong!

Mariella es fantastico!. Mariella was not only the consumate guide and hostess for our MBA tour from a professional perspective, but also as a cultural and social representative of her beautiful city. Her local insights were exceptional. She is the best!

Wonderful and insightful tour. Mariella provided a great tour for our group from Colorado. She organized everything, from the van and driver for our meetings to conducting a personal and extremely insightful tour of many of the wonderful sights of Buenos Aires. Highly recommend her to all that visit this wonderful city!

Buenos Aires City Walking Tour. Mariela provided us with a four hour tour of some of the main sites in Buenos Aires. We started at the Recoleta Cemetery and walked to other sites in the Recoleta barrio before taking the subway to the Plaza de Mayo square where we visited the Cathedral and then walked to the Tortoni Cafe. We ended our tour in Palmero at the Botanical Gardens.Mariela provided us with insightful information about the various sites and at a pace that was comfortable for my wife and myself. Instead of lengthening her tour and charging us additional fees, she suggested that we tour the San Telmo and La Boca barrios on our own given that she felt that would work better into our schedule for the week. She also offered and followed up with information for us on other places for us to visit, polo matches, etc. that we had discussed during our day.I'd rate Mariela's tour service as good value and give her great points for treating us fairly and following up afterwards with additional information.

The only way to see the city!. My daughter and I spent 9 days in Buenos Aires and wanted to see as much as we possibly could and get as much of an authentic, not too touristy experience possible. Mariela was a lifesaver and organized everything! She took quite a bit of time to get to know us and what our interests were and what might be the most enjoyable activities, sites, and restaurants during our stay. Upon meeting she immediately started making recommendations and within a couple hours of leaving her, she had already emailed me with a full itinerary, a wealth of interesting information and plenty of suggestions as to how we should spend our time in her lovely city.  She was extremely easy to deal with and had a great vibe to her. She was full of energy and had a clear passion for what she does. She so obviously wants to help people get exactly what they want out of their visit. The itineraries she set out for us were really well thought out and easy to follow, with flexible options in case we had extra energy that day or were not feeling particularly ambitious. She truly made the trip a great success! I am fluent in Spanish and had done some research before our arrival but even so, we never would have found some of the fabulous places she recommended on our own. I can honestly say that we would not have been able to see nearly as much, nor would we have enjoyed ourselves quite to the extent that we did had it not been for the Maravillosa Mariela! She takes all of the work out of it so you can just enjoy yourself and all the city has to offer.

Tour Guide BA. Great tour guide. Tailored to your needs. Visited all the attractions and more. If you are looking for a knowledgable, fun and reliable guide in BA hire Mariela. he showed us around town the day after we arrived, hitting all of the high points. Best of all, she gave us great local insight into BA, the people, and countless tips on where to eat, what to see, and how to get around. She has expert knowledge of her beautiful city, both of the history and of current affairs.

Mariela is one of the best things about BA !. Here is the best advise you will ever receive. If you are looking for a knowledgable, fun and reliable guide in BA hire Mariela. She showed up right on time, had a private driver and bus with her and led us around BA in perfect English. She knows her stuff and my adult kids thought she was very cool.

Great way to start our BA adventure!. When we arrived in BA, we knew very little about the city, what to do, where to go, etc. Mariela was a life saver. She showed us around town the day after we arrived, hitting all of the high points. Best of all, she gave us great local insight into BA, the people, and countless tips on where to eat, what to see, and how to get around. I'm pretty sure we would have been lost without her. To top it off, Mariela was incredibly kind and responsive - she emailed me with ideas before and after the tour and did plenty of things above and beyond the call of duty.If you're thinking about visiting BA, you should definitely talk to Mariela. You won't be disappointed!

Mariela Cavallo - Fantastic Buenos Aires Guide. We spent three days exploring Buenos Aires with Mariela and enjoyed every moment. She has expert knowledge of her beautiful city, both of the history and of current affairs, and she is a very charismatic person with whom we very much enjoyed spending our time. We asked to see less touristic areas of the city, as well as some of the highlights, and were also interested in eating as the locals do. Mariella went above and beyond to ensure that we did everything we wanted to and in the manner we wanted to do it. When we return to Buenos Aires, we will most definitely continue our explorations of the city and surrounding areas with Mariela by our side.

Mariela Cavallo. Mariela was extremely knowledgeable, charming and generous with her time. She helped us hit the highlights of this incredible city, without rushing us and allowing us to fully enjoy the sites.Her choices of places to visit and recommend were well thought out, and she followed up with an email about some questions that we had during our tour. If you are looking for a young, vibrant native to tour the city with, Mariela is your person. She was also very helpful in assisting in our planning of the trip.

Do this tour when you arrive to Buenos Aires. Many thanks to Mariela who arranged a tour guide and private driver for us with virtually no notice. The tour took us all over the city and we really felt as though we saw the highlights. Our guide's knowledge of the history of Buenos Aires was impressive. My only regret is that we didn't book the tour in the first couple of days of our trip. For newcomers to Buenos Aires, this is an excellent way to get acclimated to the City. Special shout out to our driver Carlos who arranged to get us to the airport for our flight home.

VIP treatment. Mariela gave us VIP treatment even though we only contacted her the day before arriving. She met with us our first day to find out what we desired and customized our visit perfectly. She arranged a last minute day trip to Iguazu Falls and we were treated like royalty and had a really fun, wild time. Our boat went right up to the powerful falls. We will never forget this great trip to Buenos Aires thanks to Mariela.

Excellent walking tour in Buenos Aires. Mariela Cavallo took a group of friends and I on a wonderful 3-hour tour of Buenos Aires. She asked us where we wanted to go and customized the tour for our needs, ending on a lovely cappuccino from a famed cafe in Buenos Aires. She spoke perfect English and was very knowledgeable on all subjects. She is a very sweet person and shows you exactly what you want to see. I would highly recommend Mariela to show you around the city!

Best concierge in Buenos Aires. I usually do all necessary destination research before I travel anywhere but a crazy work schedule necessitated different measures, especially as I was only going to have only 6 days in Buenos Aires. I found out about Mariela through Trip Advisor and I'm thankful that I engaged her service. She put together an itinerary of things to do, just as I’d requested, providing options for both day and night. Here are the things I like about Mariela:1. Punctuality and professionalism - Mariela returned emails and calls on time and when we planned to meet she was right on time.2. Her knowledge of Buenos Aires - Now anyone can search the net and get information about a city. A couple people I know actually used someone's itinerary that was posted online. They knew of the main attractions but did not grasp what was right for them so they spent very very long days running all over the large city. With Mariela's help we were able to get the maximum value over a short time and were able to avoid the parts in which we were not interested.3. Personal touch - You know that this is not just a job. Once she figured out our needs and demographic (we are young professionals), she actually got us involved in all sorts of events, including things she attended. Translation: we got the real thing4. Commitment - even when we'd left and Mariela thought we were still there, she was sending updates on current happening events I will definitely ensure that anyone I know contacts Mariela if they are visiting Buenos Aires!

perfect start for our South America tour. without any experience travelling in South America Mariela was a perfect opportunity for us to get helpful impressions of Buenos Aires. Interesting informations of culture, people, history and characteristics of Argentina during our guided tour and enough time to make our own experiences exploring the city after getting useful advices where to go by ourselves - a perfect mixture, many thanks Mariela ...

Excellent Service. We had only 2 days in BA and looked for an individual tour. The booking by email was easy, the main agenda was defined upfront. In BA we found Mariela a very competent and charming person, flexible enough to adapt the agenda to spontaneous requests. And last not least the value for the money was very good. Thanks a lot for giving us this excellent tour in BA.

Great City Tour. Mariela provided a perfect city tour for our group of 18 friends. She is knowledgeable, friendly and speaks perfect english. We loved all that she arranged for us and recommend her highly.
She answered all our questions and was very helpful with recommendations for dinner restaurants in our area. Great tour guide!

Feeling guided as well as free.... Coming from Austria we (two couples) had little time, few knowledge about Argentina and many quetions about history and present times in the wonderful city of BA. Mariela completly answered our questions in these two days we spent together as well as in advance by mail. She was even so helpful in advance by mail! As an expert to the history of her country she allways was able to refer to our interests and questions in detail, showed us parts of the city we would never have found on our own, quoted lovely restaurants and showed us how to move best in this large city (we also went by subway - great impression!).She allways referred to our wishes what to do next (have an ice-cream :-)) as well as having ideas what was important for us to see. Also important: she was easy to understand (not to take granted for german speeking visitors!). Many thanks to her for having a great time together!

Outstanding!. Mariela worked with me to plan the perfect itinerary, provided an excellent tour, and was also very generous with great bar and restaurant recommendations during the rest of my stay. You won't be disappointed!

Mariela is kinder than she is beautiful. I wanted to have Mariela to plan my entire itineraries in Buenos Aires because of the reviews from trip advisor, however we had only one day walking city tour of Buenos Aires since she was already occupied. However, she was kind enough to email us the details of how to navigate the rest of the Great City of BA. and also she recommended the restaurant where we had the best meal throughout our trip. She is not only knowlegeable but she made us feel like we are truly the Buenos Airesian.

Buenos Aires...Don't Leave Home Without Her. My wife and I recently spent a week in Buenos Aires. The highlight of our visit was a day spent with Mariela. She knows Buenos Aires better than I know my home town of Atlanta after living there for 72 years. I would use her services at least once a month even if I lived in Buenos Aires. Did I mention she's also the most beautiful lady in Argentina and surely one of the most informative... maybe in all of Latin America!

Best tour around!. My friends and I were visiting Buenos Aires for the first time. I had read many reviews about different tours and many on trirpAdvisor recommended Mariela. I am so glad we took that advice. Mariela has a wealth of knowledge about Buenos Aires and makes the tour fun with her enthusiasm and friendly manner. She goes above and beyond the call of duty and provides suggestions and ideas even though you have already completed your tour. Our time with Mariela made the trip special. You can do a big bus tour, but this is the way to go because you can have one on one interaction with Mariela. Simply put, she is the best!

Excellent guide! More valuable then all written travel guides to Buenos Aires together. Mariela took me around the city for a day. Although I was in Buenos Aires for a month and a half already, she showed me a lot of great spots I hadn't seen yet. Mariela can build on a lot of travel experience and perfect English, but where she really stands out is dedication.Dedication to Buenos Aires and Argentina to start with. Tell her your interests and travel experience and she'll know where you want to go. She'll suggest you what to visit, where to eat, drink, which specialized tours to take, where to dance tango, see a tango show or watch locals dancing tango where no tourist goes. She knows where to go next, where the best hidden carnavals of Argentina are, where to eat the best stake, where to find hidden information on the internet... Hell, she even knew what books I wanted to read :-)And dedication to giving her guests the best possible travel experience. She really cares about you having a great time. She realizes that different travelers have very different expectations and she's devoted to give every one of them the best experience. Best guide I had so far! And probably the happiest too, which makes it even better.

Mariela is THE BEST!!. My daughter and I visited Buenos Aires for the first time and we had arranged a tour with Mariela for the first day. She was knowledgable about all aspects of Argentina, from history, culture, other activities to do, government. Her English is excellent. The bonus was that she is adorable and so fun to be with. We ended up having a lovely lunch with her and thoroughly enjoyed her company. Within an hour of completing our tour, Mariela emailed me suggestions of other fun activities with prices and links. She is a professional and I would hire her again in a second. Mariela was certainly a highlight of our trip

Quick tour in BA. A couple weeks back, I had a few days in BA with little compass of the city. At the last minute, I contacted Mariela for a quick tour and she was able to fit me in the next day. Despite just finishing up a long morning tour and hot temperatures, she hung with me for 3 hours and gave me a useful overview of the city and plenty of neighborhood highlights. Just as useful was her constant contact over the next few days with suggestions or answers to my questions.Her English is great, her understanding of your needs are spot-on and the rates are more than reasonable. It was obvious from go that she loved both her job and her city. Really glad I got in touch and definitely would recommend to anyone.

Make your Buenos Aires visit a memorable one. We were a group of nine friends from South Africa all visiting Buenos Aires (BA) for the first time. We didn't have a clue of what to expect from the city or what to do on our visit, and to add to our woes none of us speak Spanish! Thanks to the concierge service of Mariela, my holiday in BA became one of my most memorable oversees trips.Mariela prepared a full week itinerary, which became our life-line to the city. It included recommendations for restaurants, day-trips, tourist attractions, and clubs; thus containing something for everyone. Mariela spent a couple of hours with the group, taking us through the itinerary and explaining the intricacies of the city. Throughout the week she then made the actual bookings and final arrangements for our chosen activities, which included tango lessons, a bike trip to Tigre Island and polo lessons. Her help with the bookings was invaluable given the Spanish language barrier. For the bookings, and general communication, Mariela's correspondence was always prompt, friendly and professional. To guarantee that you get the most from your visit to Buenos Aires I would highly recommend her services. It's a holiday investment worth making.

Exceptional Buenos Aires Experience. My Buenos Aires visit became one of the most fun and memorable trips, and that can be greatly attributed to Mariela.I had several email exchanges with her before leaving for BA, and she always came back with great proposals and valuable information. We decided to sign up for walking tour with her, and asked her to book Tango show and private Tango lesson.City tour with Mariela was just as if a local friend, a very knowledgeable and professional one, is taking us through the highlight of the city as well as local places that you can easily overlook. Just what we were looking for. Throughout the tour we enjoyed getting lots of insight from her on what’s going on in BA in the real life. Even after the tour she sent us a recommended full plan for our last day, which we followed and had much fun. It was truly above and beyond.It would be the best if you start contacting her well ahead of your departure, since she will give you a lot of good ideas and you might want to adjust your plan based on her feedback. I also recommend asking for a walking tour with public transportation to get some safety tips, which are good to know when you take a stroll by your own afterwards.I'm glad I made a great choice for my first visit to Buenos Aires, now I know who I should turn to for my next visit.

The Ambassador of Buenos Aires!. Buenos Aires Concierge provided me and my friend (both from the United States) with an amazing experience during a walking tour of Buenos Aires. Our guide, and owner of the company, Mariela, was extremely knowledgeable about the city, its sights and history. In particular, her knowledge of the Recoleta Cemetery was nothing short of impressive. It was clear that she was not working from a script, as we asked her question after question about mausoleums, most of which she was able to tell us about! This theme continued for the duration of our tour.Not only that, but she was stopped several times on the street during our 4-hour tour so that people she knew could say hello to her. This has earned her the distinction of the "Ambassador of Buenos Aires" in my mind.When considering a tour of BA, don't hesitate and don't think twice...book Buneos Aires Concierge. Certainly the best money we spent on our entire trip!

Professional and friendly, a must in BA. It was our first visit to BA, and as we don't know the city, we decided to find a guide to help show us around. I was so thrilled that we chose to use Mariela's services!We spent an enjoyable morning with Laura, one of Mariela's excellent colleagues who, despite the truly awful weather, gave us a real taste of the city. We did a 3 hour tour but I would have been happy to do more if the weather would've been more conducive to it. We were given a real overview of the city, and Laura took us to a wonderful coffee house for the best hot chocolate, then to an fantastic atmospheric restaurant where we enjoyed fabulous steaks alongside the other seemingly local (rather than tourist) customers. Most importantly Laura conveyed the warmth of BA through her friendly and approachable manner, she was well informed, but it felt more like a friend of friend showing us around than a tour guide!The following day Mariela had arranged a Tango lesson for us. This was the highlight of our time in BA! The teacher Cyrena was superb and whilst we were not the most talented of Tango dancers, she certainly gave us a feel for the dance and we had a lot of fun. She even taught my 9 year old daughter the moves! Everything went completely to plan, the services on both days I found to be friendly, professional and punctual. Thanks to Mariela's wonderful expertise, we did not feel like strangers in BA!

Amazing Tour Guide. We had previously been to Buenos Aires about 4 years ago and thought we had seen many sites! Boy was I wrong Mariela gave us 2 days of touring without going to the typical tourist attractions. Mariela was a pleasure to be with and gave us an insight of the country which we enjoyed. When we return in our travels Mariela will be our first call. I'm truely sorry we didn't use her on our first visit I would have enjoyed it much more. Mariela was accomodating with our schedule and surprised us with 2 wonderful restaurants for lunch. I couldn't recommend her services more highly! You won't be disappointed.

Excellent BA Visit.. This was my wife and my first visit to Buenos Aires. We had just finished an extended cruise in Ushuaia and was looking forward to stepping back onto terra firma. We had found Mariela through Tripadvisor prior to our trip and made all the arrangements for our one day tour. She was prompt in her responses and eventually even helped us select & book an excellent boutique hotel in Palermo (plus arrange for other walking tour guides for our next stop in Santiago, Chile).Mariela was very knowledgeable of the city, culture & its people; and we enjoyed her guiding style and pace. In fact, we felt like our niece was showing us around town. In the evening after our tour, she sent us additional suggestions & tips of other places to visit. We would recommend Mariela to anyone visiting BA without any hesitation.

Simply the Best!. My husband I used Mariela's services extensively on our recent two week vacation to BA. We started by booking some time with her for a couple of afternoons, but soon we were happily 'addicted' to her excellent services, and in the end used her for six afternoons in total. She was incredible in every way --- truly a 'one in a million' individual. There are far too many details of her impressiveness to go into here, and in any event most of her fantastic qualities and services have already been fairly extensively gone over in other reveiws. Suffice it to say that she exhibited every quality one could ever want in a personal concierge, and both my husband and I have absolutley no hesitation in giving her our very highest recommendation. If you book her, I can promise you that you will not be sorry!

Reliable. Mariela and her agency know where to send you and make you happy.My mum and I took a trip to Valdez Peninsula which was organized with 1 day notice and then a tour of the city. I am doing two more tours in the next couple of months. In these turbulent times in Argentina, this is someone who can be relied upon.

Excellent guide in Buenos Aires!. I spent two full days in Buenos Aires with Mariela, and had a really fantastic time! Mariela showed me the sights and hidden gems of the city, and we covered a lot of ground. She also made some great recommendations for restaurants and bookings for a tango show. She was very attuned to my needs and interests, and extremely fun to be with. It was like having a good friend showing me around the city! I would highly recommend Mariela as a guide if you're in Buenos Aires - she is knowledgeable, communicates well and very responsive.

Excelente / There is no comparison. I am ashamed to say that our trip was back in September , but if you can take my still ardent recommendation of Mariela and her services even after so much time has passed, I assure you it will not go unrewarded. First of all, being a native Latina I can tell you that Mariela's depth of knowledge, translations (for my English-speaking husband, and passion for her country and all it has to offer is genuine. This was our first time in BA and our first time using a private concierge/tour guide - and my husband (who is not usually keen on spending in this area) was impressed by Mariela and her services.Mariela took her time to explain her services and answer more than dozen question even before we landed - prior to money exchanging hands! Once we arrived she confirmed our itinerary with us and met us at our hotel. Not only did she have everything planned but she allowed flexibility for any last minute changes and "wants." Even after her guided tour she gave us many recommendations on other things we wanted to do and we were so enamored by her and the wealth of knowledge we just had to have her for another day. Having Mariela at your side is like having a friend that is waiting for your arrival to show you all the sights. She puts your interests up front and has an innate sense to guide you to see knew things that will truly match your personality.Mariela knows she has won us over as clients and we cannot wait to go back and visit BA (with her at our side) again!

Highly Recommended. We met with Mariela a few days after we arrived in BA. We had a 3-hour tour during which we hit many city highlights, and covered a lot of ground; both in terms of sites to see and advice, insights and suggestions. While we obviously hit some typical tourist sites, she was also well prepared with places that reflected our interests . She's a lovely young woman with excellent knowledge of the city, both geographically and historically. Mariela also followed up later that same day with answers and suggestions to our endless questions we asked during the tour. We would have missed so much of the city, and struggled with getting things done, had we not taken the tour with her! Very highly recommended!

Buenos Aires' best and hardest-working ambassador: wonderful. I'm so glad we decided to start our stay in BA with Mariela to show us around. She started with our immediate neighborhood in Palermo, making us instantly confident about the best walking routes, buses, locals' favorites and hidden gems - then took us on an excellent city tour. It was clear that she had been thinking about us and our interests. It certainly wasn't the pre-packaged march around obvious tourist spots and 'friends where you can spend money'.Later, after I lost my iphone, she even made sure that my office IT dept was able to wipe it, and made sure I got the confirmation (going so far as to offer lending us an old phone of her own while we were here).Then, two days after our tour, she emailed us to say that, even though our dates meant we couldn't catch the big weekend polo games in the city, there was a set of private club matches at the Association of Argentinian Polo headquarters in Pilar. An exceptionally nice polo instructor took the two of us for an unforgettable afternoon there (feeling like welcome guests, mingling comfortably with the small crowds of friends and crews!).It goes to show, that if you're lucky enough to be looked after by the right people, wonderful things can happen. We'd recommend Mariela without hesitation.

Trip to Beautiful Buenos Aires. Mariela was a fabulous guide. I was looking to learn as much as I could about the city, the culture and history or Buenos Aires while I was there. My husband had a business meeting so I was on my own. Mariela asked me generally what I was interested in doing and then after just a few questions, took me around the city to see all the most intresting things. We visited Recoleta Cemetary and monastary, with all its stories, and then walked all around the city, saw the most beautiful book store that use to be a theater, had coffee and a sandwich at Cafe Tortoni, which was like stepping back in time, and ended up in San Telmo. The afternoon was so nice and Mariela is beautiful inside and out! She is thoughtful and knows a lot about Bueno Aires and the Argentine culture and also current politics. Very interesting and fun!!

Wonderful Experience!. Mariela Cavallo not only took the 4 of us on a fabulous walking tour of many sights in Buenos Aires, but she also gave us extensive information on additional sights to see, and excellent restaurants in Palermo and San Telmo for wonderful dining. Her tips proved invaluable. After our departure from BA and while we were touring the Salta region, she sent additional info on excellent restaurants to visit while in Salta. Her information and service went above and beyond our expectations. We highly recommend a tour with Mariela. You will not be disappointed!

Best you can do. If you want to learn about B.A and Argentina ask for Mariela. After 3 hours I had the impression to know all about this town and country. I'm on a business trip and did not had more time. The places she showed and her open, funny and friendly way made this half day an unforgettable experince. Whenever you are planning to go to B.A -> contact her.

Excellent Experience. Mariela was fantastic and added background and information I never would have had. For example, she took me to the Recoleta cemetary (I had been once before) and it was like I had never been. She knew so many stories and which structures to see that it made the visit so memorable.

THE BEST. We were in Buenos Aires last November for a couple of days and chose Mariela to be our city guide. After meeting at the Cemetary, we spent the day walking our legs off except for a slight break for a wonderful lunch. Mariela made sure we not only saw the important cultural sights of the city, but also gave us a wonderful history of the city and the country. When we left to go to Patagonia, she was kind enough to lend us a cell phone when we couldn't find one to rent. We recommended her to my good friends who went out with her just a few days after we left.

Mariela - best B.A. resource!. meeting Mariela was a great introduction to Buenos Aires. She gave us an extensive detailed tour of the city and was very courteous and extremely helpful giving us insight about the best places to go based on what we wanted to explore. We had an amazing trip and many of her referrals were not available in the books we had so we were so grateful to have her help! She had great recommendations on restaurants, shopping and night life. She is passionate about her work and truly cares about making sure you are well taken care of! Hope to see you again Mariela. Thanks again! TMatta

Don't visit Buenos Aires without using Mariela. Mariela was wonderful ! She helped me decide where to stay (Palermo), got me in contact with a local travel agent to make arrangements for a trip to Iguazzu Falls, arranged a fabulous tango show and gave us an extensive tour of the city. She gave us a list of her recomended restaurants, made reservations for us and all of them were absolutely great. But it did not end there - as she made herself available for questions throughout our visit and was just the best resource you could hope for in visiting Buenos Aires.

Can't go wrong. Mariela was a pure delight, communicating with us before, during and after our trip to Buenos Aires. She helped us book a darling, well-located studio apartment in Recoleta and had a car meet us upon arrival at the airport. We met her for a three-hour walking tour, which was wonderful as she showed us highlights of Recoleta Cemetery as well as bus stops,shopping areas,good coffee shops and out-of-the way restaurants and answered all our questions. We had her book a reservation for her recommended tango show the next night,and it was one of our best evenings -- flawless pickup and return to apartment, great seat for a great show in a truly beautiful theater. She then emailed us detailed suggestions for other things to see and do on our own, including best times to do them. After we left Recoleta, she sent another email reminding us of a free concert at Teatro Colon and how to get the tickets.She is truly a professional who knows and loves her city, speaks perfect English and goes out of her way to accommodate her clients' desires and needs. We totally recommend her services!

Mariela is a star!. Many thanks to Mariela for taking us around Recoleta, the cemetery and up to the Plaza de Mayo. It was the best couple of hours spent learning about the history, where to dine and shop. Mariela is a charming, knowledgeable guide and very generous with any follow up questions we had. I would highly recommend her! Gracias Mariela!

EXCEEDS EXPECTATIONS. Mariela (Buenos Aires Concierge) exceeds all expectations in her concern for ensuring that first-time-visitors to Buenos Aires like me will have the best possible experience in exploring the many treasures this great city has to offer. n my own case, we had planned a private tour of the city on a a day that turned out to be so rainy that it would have ruined the entire experience. It was Mariela herself who suggested that the tour day be changed to another day and gave FREE advice on what to do instead on such a rainy day, in this case a visit to the MALBA museum. And so it was all along: when I told her of my interest in attendiing a concert in the Teatro Colon, she informed me of a free matinee concert and made suggestions about what else to do afterwards, what to visit, where to eat etc. During the entire week of my stay in Buenos Aires she stayed in touch to ensure that I found things of interest to explore eventhough she did not gain a penny by giving of her own time. And not even once was I disappointed in following her advice. On the contrary, Mariela not only "knows" this city, she loves it passionately.I did do the city tour on another day than the one we had originally agreed upon and cancelled because of the rain. Because Mariela herself was busy with other bookings, she send another guide, a young lady by the name of Laura, in her stead. Laura turned out to be the best guide one could asked for, not only in terms of her knowledge but also in the sense of being the most pleasant person to be with for four and a half hours. There was not a minute where I was bored or did not learn something or we did no t have something to talk aboiut. Laura showed the same enthusiasm and passion for this marvellous city as her "boss". It was like walking the streets of Buenos Aires with a "friend", rather tan with a guide who was being paid for her job.  Besides the tour of the city, Mariela also suggested and booked a stunning Tango show for me. And every time, she would send an email the next day to inquire whether I had enjoyed what she had suggested. Though in the end we never met, I felt as if I had a "guardian angel" who ensured that as a stranger to her city I was comfortable and had a pleasant experience in visiting Buenos Aires. And that I certainly did.Mariela and Laura, thank you both so very much for the memorable visit to your beautiful city. As an independent traveller I rarely use guides or guided tours, but you both contributed immensely to my enjoyable visit to a city that on one's own can be rather overwhelming.

Great help !. Had made the right choice in choosing Mariela to help me to settle in Buenos Aires. I stayed there three weeks and we met a few times during my stay. I needed some guidance in getting by in the city and she was a great help. Friendly, flexible, she just understood my needs and I was very happy with her services. Will get in contact again when I come back to BA.Catherine

MARIELA-THE BEST TOUR GUIDE IN BUENOS AIRES!!!. me and my wife spent 2 days with mariela to see BA .she was amaizing- show us all the highlights of the city and teach us a lot about the history of the city.she know all the best places in the city and she gave us the best reccommendations for lunch and dinner.even when we finished our 2 days with her, she is all the time stay in touch and take care for evrything you need.thanks a lot mariela !!!

Thank you, Mariela. This is highly recommended. Mariela shows inspiring passion for her city, and really brings it to life. I had a wonderful private tour with her around the tourist sights and less conventional sights in BA. It was like being shown around by a friend! Her English is perfect as well as her grasp of history and memory, although her tours are the right side of studious and always entertaining. The places she showed me were a perfect introduction to a city she clearly loves. I only had a day there but I would have loved to have seen more of the city in her company. Mariela is a charming, beautiful companion to a wonderful city. Essential

California sightseeing family. You can throw away your tour books if you are fortunate enough to link up with Mariela. We are a family of 5 from California who spent a wonderful week in Buenos Aires. The smartest decision we made during the entire trip was hiring Mariela to show us the city and help us with other arrangements such as the nightlife and out of town excursions. We have 3 young adults in our family and they loved Mariela because she was so much fun to be with, enthusiastic, extremely knowledgeable and very professional. Mariela is well educated and we enjoyed interesting conversations with her. She told us many interesting stories about Argentina and what life is like in this beautiful country.

Do yourself a favor and explore BA with Mariela!. I benefited from Mariela's services during my trip to Buenos Aires last month. Mariela coordinated all of my activities for two days and included both the "must-see" sights as well as the more off-beat and local experiences (alfajores cooperative in La Boca, classic bookstores, products made from recycled cardboard collected by the famous "cartonera" industry).Mariela was responsible, patient, personable, and genuinely interested in giving me a good time. She knew all neighborhoods, restaurants, and transportation options throghout the city. I would strongly recommend Mariela to anyone searching for then authentic BA experiences! Mariela's rates are fair and the experience will be unforgettable! One other point worth mentioning - Mariela is well travelled to both developped and developping countries. This led to some very interesting and insightful conversations, and she really understood the difference between "traveler" and "tourist" - a point that made a big difference for me.

Can I give six stars?. B.A. Concierge gets 6 stars. Mariela is an absolute gem, look no further for the perfect guide and friend in Buenos Aires. She is professional, punctual, flexible, knowledgeable, and FUN too. I would not make travel plans to Buenos Aires without calling her. Really. It was my first time in Argentina but even if it was my 100th, she would have a new story about the city on every street we traveled. It is hard to imagine anyone better at what they do-so if you want to learn the city, or you know the city and want to learn something new, or just need someone to call about any questions or help-contact BA Concierge/Mariela, and enjoy your trip!

Excellent Day with Mariela. Just spent an excellent day touring all over Buenos Aires with Mariela. She is warm, friendly, and very knowledgeable. I took a four hour tour which we extended to 6 - 7 hours. We visited all the top sites in the city and spent a few hours in the Sunday market. She provided valuable advice on best buys in the market and shops. Our tour included Floralis Generales, Recoleta Cemetary (very, very interesting), El Ateneo Grand Splendid (an amazing bookstore in a restored theater), Tortoni Coffee Shop (beautiful!), Caminito (a quaint, colorfully painted artistic neighborhood), and the Sunday market. She even brought mate, hot water, and sugar, so I could share in this Argentinian tradition between friends! Highly recommended! You will not be disappointed.

Best time ever in Buenos Aires. The services provided by Concierge allowed me to experience Buenos Aires in a completely different level. rather than spending a lot of time looking at travel books and websites, Mariella from Concierge is an extremely friendly person that knows everything that is great in BA. From low budget restaurants with great food to cool fancy bars in Palermo. The repertoire of activities and restaurants provided by Mariella made me change my trip from 4 to 16 days !!I recommended to all my friends to use Concierge on their next visit to Buenos Aires.

Four Canadians that couldn't be happier!!!. We found this service on line and emailed previously to arriving in BA. Cecilia met the four of us at our hotel the second day and the rest of our fifteen days couldn't have been better. Cecilia arranged a tango show and recommended several restaurants in BA. Then she arranged our flight to Iguazu Falls with airport transfers and accomodations in a wonderful jungle lodge. We spent the next day at the falls with a private tour guide also arranged by Cecilia. Then it was off to Mendoza wine country. Cecilia again arranged flights, transfers and accomodations. We spent two magical days touring wineries with lunches and private guides all arranged by Cecilia. When we initially met with Cecilia she really listened to what we wanted to experience and that made our trip all the more memorable. We didn't even really have to think about anything because she pre arranged everything so well. This is a huge feat in a country that language could be a barrier. We would recommend this service 100% whole heartedly!!!!!

Good introduction to Buenos Aires. We had 36 hours in BA before touring Patagonia and then came back to BA for a week at the end. Mariela arranged for us to be met at the Airport and the next day took us on a tour of BA, which introduced us to the sights, manners. tempo and culture of BA. This gave us both a historical and a comtemporary insight into the city and its attractions and allowed us to plan for and to use our longer stay in BA more effectively. We have never useda service like this before but we would now recommend it as a rapid way to come to grips with a foreign city on your first visit.

Wonderful trip support. Our family of four (two college-age kids) spent a week in Buenos Aires. Cecilia was a wealth of helpful planning information and support during our visit. We emailed for several weeks leading up to the trip, exploring all kinds of possible activities (soccer match, polo adventure, music, side trips, tours, etc.). Cecilia answered all our questions about each option, then helped arrange the ones we wanted. She also arranged our transfers, which worked flawlessly. While there, Cecilia checked in with us several times to make sure everything was going well. And her prices were always good - she even suggested that we skip the arranged transfer to the local airport for a side trip to Igauzu and just take a cheaper taxi. Through all our questions and plan adjustments, she was consistently positive, helpful, and a pleasure to deal with. We recommend her highly for quality and value.

8 Gringos in Buenos Aires. We were 8 guys showing up in Buenos Aires for a Bachelor party, we had no idea what to expect and no idea what we would find. All we knew is that we were looking to have the right mix of culture, dining, and partying at night. And Cecilia and Lara delivered. Cecilia arranged transport for us from the Airport to our hotel BeHollywood (click to see my review of this hotel). Once we got to the hotel and settled in Cecilia came by to check on us and to arrange some of the festivities to follow. She gave us recommendations of places to go eat and places to go hang out and grab a drink or 2 or 3 ... I lost count. Day 2 - Enter LaraCecilia instructed us how and where to meet up with Lara and we met her for our tour. The tour was great. We took it a little slow (our request) because we were all a little shell shocked from last nights Shenanigans and they were very accommodating. Kudos to Lara for being able to keep 8 tall loud rowdy Americans "boys" in line and interested, she was great Cecilia joined us half way through and the hilarity continued. THe raucous laughter could be heard echoing through the hallways of Recoleta cemetery (a must see, I know it's a cemetery but it's still pretty cool). We made our way thorough some more of the city and ended up cutting the tour short so we could eat. They took us to this amazing steak restaurant ( steak in Argentina, hmm ). We ate drank wine and had a great time. We elected continue the tour the next day because there was so much more to see and Lara and Cecilia were insistent that we didn't miss out so they totally freed their schedules to give us the tour the next day. Lara left and Cecilia walked with us for a bit and then we all went home to get ready for the nights festivities. Cecilia recommended some places and decided to come with us. This place was great and we had a blast.. I forget the name of the place but then again I don't remember much of the nights in B.A. Day 3Today was tour day party 2 .. oh whoops .. it rained so tour canceled and what did they do rescheduled again and cleared their schedules again to be able to finish up the "must sees" in B.A. Day 4 No rain today, up and ready to go for it. We meet up with Lara who's happy to see her "boys" as she referred to us; and we finish the walking tour, the Pink house, some famous church, La Boca, some huge famous soccer stadium, and then this little restaurant where she made us all Matte and ate cookies. It was awesome. Cecilia met up with us from there and we hung out for a little. We went home and got dressed and Cecilia took us to the most AMAZING restaurant. The food was out of control. Great service, drinks, food.. ummm such a good night. Then Cecilia took us to another bar/lounge and we closed the night out partying like rock stars. All along the way the ladies were always very willing to shift their schedules and move things around to accommodate our curiosity about Buenos Aires. Offering to get us tickets to this if we wanted to go, or take us there if we wanted to see something, letting us know that they were proud of their city and excited to show it off. They wanted to make sure we had a great time and we enjoyed our trip and we certainly did. Thanks, so much Cecilia and Lara.

Cecilia and Laura are amazing!. We hired this concierge service as part of a bachelor party in Buenos Aires. We were a group of 8 guys and considering how many different personalities Cecilia had to contend with as well as different likes and dislikes, she was amazing. First, Cecilia organized a one day walking tour with Laura. Laura was extremely knowledgeable and patient with all of us and made sure we were all entertained and made sure the pace of the tour was to our liking. Her English was also impeccable and she was also not shy to teach us common Spanish phrases. When we grew tired, she was able to schedule another day with us in order to complete the walking tour. She also asked if we preferred a fast paced tour or more of an in depth walking tour. Considering we were such a large group, we opted for a quicker paced tour and Laura was eager to oblige. We ended the tour with a group drink of yerba mate, a local herb tea that is very popular with Argentineans. Again Laura had us try different types of the mate and made sure we all got to sample the local Argentinean tradition.Cecilia also organized many dinner reservations and her restaurant choices were excellent. We enjoyed her company so much we asked her to stick around and enjoy our last evening in Buenos Aires.
