She not only was a great asset and guide on our trip, she became a great friend!She also arranged for a laundry service to come and pick up some clothes I had and arranged to have it dropped back off at the hotel pressed and folded. Great Service! Much cheaper than the hotels rates! Cecilia even followed back up with me after to make sure that the laundry was done to my liking.I was also traveling solo to Brazil and Cecilia said that once I arrived at my destination, If I need anything, do not be shy to email or call her and she would help me if I needed anything in RIO or Iguazu Falls. I cannot say enough about how great she was to us. We were a bunch of crazy guys on a 5 day trip through Argentina and she made sure we were all taken care of and we all had everything we needed. You cannot go wrong with hiring her.Thanks CC!

Trip to Argentina. We were so fortunate to attain Cecilia as our concierge, she orgainized many events for us in BA. She also set up our trip from BA to Iguazu Falls, flights, hotel, tour bus and guide, our guide Micheala was outstanding. Then we had a flight to Mendoza, hotel, and 3 wonderful wine tours,our guide Ieda and Alberto supberb superb, then a return flight to BA. Cecilia was an amazing person to deal with, very helpful and ver patient with our requests and sometimes of changing plans, her and our friend JD made this trip most memorable and a definte return to South America and will definitely be using Cecilia as our concierge. Thank you so much.Mandy & TomBetty & JD

Amazing tour. Cecilial and Laura were fantastic. We had a group of 8 on a bachelor party and they did a terrific job showing us the city. Half way through the initial tour it started to rain and they happily agreed to continue the tour the following day. They catered the pace to what we wanted and it felt like a great friend showing you around the city. I'm not normally a big fan of tours but this was really terrific. They also went above and beyond recommending great restaurants and lounges for us to visit in the evenings. Overall it made our trip extremely enjoyable and I'd highly recommend them.

A great whirlwind tour. Mariela led our group of 32 on a tour of Buenos Aires on a beautiful Sunday afternoon. Not only did she hit all the top spots, but we never felt rushed. She was able to give us an "insider's" view of one of the most beautiful cities in South America. Although I've been to BA before, we saw and did some things I'd missed before. Thanks, Mariela!

That was perfect!!!. I went for a wedding to Buneos Aires in March. Got in contact with Buenos Aires Concierge just 2 weeks before I left. I planned to stay 7 days in BA. And my plan was to watch a Boca Juniors Game, taking Tango Classes, exploring the city, visiting great restaurants and bars.Well we started with e-mails and just met after I arrived in BA. It was fantastic - all the things I wanted todo have been organized in a professionell and lovely way!!Thx so much - I highly recommend this - Thx Mariela!!

Excelente Excelente Excelente. Mariela is a GREAT guide for BA. Not only because she knows all the hot spots and places to be, but it also does not feel like having a guide around. It is like a friend showing you around town! And I can assure you, that you are going to have a great time! I loved it and ist made my stay in BA so memorable! Thanks again!

Great "Friend" in BA to Show Us Around. Mariela was like having a friend show my group around BA for our short visit there on a half-day tour of the city before we boarded another flight and headed to Ushuaia. She was so consciencious about the size of my group (32) that she had two of her female friends join us to help her with the tour. She was on time, very informative, and not-rushed as she pointed out the highlights of her city. I would not hestiate to use her again as she was full of information.

UNFORGETTABLE - The best tour of BA you could have!. My first trip to BA has left me with so many unforgettable and magical memories and that is mostly down to the beautiful Mariela. She is so passionate and enthusiastic about what she does and she loves to teach people about the places you can visit and the activities you can do in BA. In our case she ensured we had some great activities planned every day like visiting art galleries, Tango lessons, a Tango show, horse riding, as well as visiting the famous cemetery and book shop. There was really something for everyone and she made sure we all got involved and had fun. Mariela was knowledgeable about every area of BA and she explained it with a sense of humbleness, humour, and pure passion for what she does.In short Mariela was absolutely delightful and a perfect host. Not only would I recommend her to be your tour guide, I would also not put any other company in front of her.x

The perfect person to know when you come to Bueons Aires!. We did a walking tour with Mariela because it was included in our VRBO rental! This was our second time to Buenos Aires. We travel a lot and don't usually do organized tours or concierge services but after meeting Mariela yesterday for a walking tour.....we have changed our minds! She was an amazing... great personality and her english was perfect, (which was not easy to find in Argentina), and she had great recommendations for the last few days of our trip. The only downfall was that we had originally scheduled to meet with her the second day we arrived in Buenos Aires but it rained and we had to postpone. We wish we met her earlier in the trip. Definitely use her services at the start of your trip! We highly recommend her and when we return to BA she will be our first contact!

The best and most beautiful tour guide Buenos Aires has to offer!. I recently went to Buenos Aires with my family and had an incredible time. When visiting any city, it is essential to have a great tour guide to ensure you do not miss out on all the sites and history behind them. Mariella was the perfect tour guide...she accommodated our every need and was happy to do so. By the end of the days she felt like a part of our family! She ensured we soaked up in the local culture and explored everything the city had to offer ranging from restaurants, crematoriums, galleries, cafes and bars, tango and horse riding! With that list- she made sure we didn't miss a thing! We would all highly recommend her!!

Mariela is a great asset in planning your trip to BA!. I found Mariela through Google, when planning a 4 week trip to BA for my parents in law. Mariela became an instant friend, she helped us out so much. She provided us with tons of ideas, inside tips&tricks and answered all of our questions quick and good. Once my parents in law were in BA she guided them around, helped them with last alterations in their trip and they had the trip of a lifetime! So, if you feel like visiting BA make sure to contact Mariela, she will help you have a unforgetable trip!

Wonderful inside access to Buenos Aires!. When my wife and I elected to stay in an apartment in Buenos Aires rather than a hotel, we realized that in addition to lack of room service our decision would also result in the lack of concierge services.I was very pleasantly surprised to find that there was an independent concierge service available in the form of buenosairesconcierge.com. Before we left home I had both e-mail and text message conversations with Mariella, who is, in fact, buenosairesconcierge.com. We arraged a walking tour of the city during which we received a nice orientation to the city and to the Buenos Aires subway system, the Subte. Mariella also introduced us to a delightful, small restaurant off the beaten path.Mariella later was able to arrange for us (with the assistance of a local travel agency with whom she works) excursions to Tigre and to Cataratas Iguazú. She also found a local cooking class for my wife and me to attend.We were VERY plesed with the assistance and local insights provided by buenosairesconcierge.com. I would not hesitate to use them again and would recommend this service to anyone visiting this great city, especially for their first visit.

Concierge service is "must have" for first-time BA visitors. We have visited Buenos Aires several times (this city calls you back), and we wish we had used this service the first time! Mariela Cavallo is a real pro and handles all the things that do-it-yourselfers would rather not worry about, especially when travelling with a small group as we were. She handled airport pick-up, show and restaurant reservations, and conducted a delightful city tour in such a professional manner that ensured our visit was effortless and memorable. A comfortable private van, expert driver, and interesting as well as knowledgeable tour guide definitely beats taxis, buses, backpacks and guidebooks, and Mariela's personalized and personable service was well worth the modest expense.

Superb all-service Concierge!. In preparation for spending three days in Buenos Aires prior to catching the Holland America VEENDAM for a cruise, I checked TripAdvisor and very fortunately discovered Mariela's concierge firm. After my initial email Mariela answered me promptly, completely, and frequently. She arranged our transport from the airport to our hotel; she hosted our group of six for a fully entertaining and informative afternoon city tour with van and driver; she recommended a great parrilla restaurant and tango show (and secured us superb seats in the box position); she made recommendations regarding some great Argentinian wine to buy and take aboard ship to accompany dinners - every request was answered quickly and completely. She is very patient, friendly and engaging, and you quickly get the sense that she's an old friend- that's how comfortable you become as she shows you the charms of Buenos Aires. Her fee structure is very reasonable. Mariela has to be everyone's FIRST STOP for tour/concierge service in Buenos Aires!

Mariela - Awesome Buenos Aires Concierge. My wife, son and I had an awesome experience employing Mariela as our tour planner and tour guide during the first week of February, 2012. We learned about her in mid-December 2011 on Trip Advisor while checking for hotels in the Buenos Aires. After viewing her reviews and her web site, we decided to engage her to host a one-day tour of Buenos Aires. We exchanged several emails in making the arrangements and establishing the costs. Her fees are very reasonable and worth the cost.We decided to pay the additional modest cost of transportation for the tour in case of rain and to see more of BA. She was in constant contact with the driver which allowed for seamless transitions between walking and driving segments of the approximately 6- hour tour. The tour was a nice sampling of Buenos Aires sites and her knowledge of each of them added interest to the tour. The tour of Recoleta Cemetery was especially fascinating due to the stories she shared about many of the unbelievably ornate Mausoleum. Mariela did a nice job in being both an informational guide and an engaging, energetic host. She has a sparkling personality and was fully engaged with us during the entire tour, including being an occasional photographer along the way to capture photo-opportunity moments on our cameras. After being with her during the tour and learning a little about her family background, we can attest to her honesty and trustworthiness as a concierge and recommend her to anyone who desires a fun and informational tour of BA or other sites in Argentina.Mariela also arranged for a taxi from Orvitur transfer services to pick us up and take us back to the airport from the Buenos Aires Hilton. She provided email and texting contact information in case of flight delays. This turned out to be very beneficial because our flight was delayed 11 hours due to aircraft mechanicals and later storms in BA on approach. I emailed the taxi service when we arrived at the airport and received an immediate reply with the name of the driver and confirmation that he was waiting for us. Both drivers were friendly and competant taxi drivers. An Orvitur representative emailed me the morning of our departure to confirm time of pickup. Having trustworthy taxi service was very reassuring to us as first-time visitors to Argentina, with limited knowledge of Spanish. Mariela made this happen.Mariela offers tours and other concierge services far beyond our one-day tour for those who need them. But for the limited time we had available for site-seeing during our visit to BA, Mariela made helped make our stay a memorable one.

Easiest way to learn about the city with Mariela's Concierge service!. Mariela is a local and she is very knowledgeable about her city Buenos Aires. If you don't speak the language and don't have a lot of time, you have to go on one of her tours. I enjoyed her company and she helped to make my tour and visit to BA one I will never forget.

First Time in Buenos Aires, Mariela is a must!!!. I was traveling solo and never been to Buenos Aires. I found Mariela on Trip advisor and e-mailed her. I told her to provide me some information about the city and different excursions I can take. She came up with a list of ideas based on what I wanted to see, ie tango, soccer game, a day trip to Colonia Uruguay and a day trip to Iguazu Falls, and other items such as horseback riding, other cities and fun things. She also provided me a good list of places to go for food, dancing and other excrusions to fill my weeks up. Mariela speaks English and has a personalized city tour which was informative and great, we walked around, took the subway and had an overall good time. You can't go wrong booking with Mariela Cavallo, she is very good and never pressures or gives you ideas that you don't want. She is your one-stop shop for everything to do not only in Buenos Aires but other places.

Don't miss Mariela's Tour. We were two couples traveling on the Star Princess. We found Mariela on Trip advisor and e-mailed her. Her responses were very quick. We told her that we wanted an all day tour by van and we were mainly interested in the culture and famous sights of Buenos Aires. She came up with a customized tour that was just what we wanted. Mariela speaks beautiful English and has a love of her city and it's sights that just made the tour wonderful. At the end of the dat we felt as though we had made a friend. You can't go wrong booking with Mariela Cavallo.

If you only have one day for Buenos Aires.... Since I only had one day in BA having a one-on-one tour was the best way to see the city. I felt I saw in three hours what would have taken me two or three days on my own. Mariela is well informed, knows her way around the city, made great recommendations and is fun to be with. Remember to bring your walking shoes & camera - and enjoy Buenos Aires.

The only way to see Buenos Aires. Mariela was an amazing guide and helped to make our experience in BA just amazing. She not only plans a personal itinerary, but will go with the flow as changes are requested or necessary.She also provides knowledge that others just don't have. Throughout the Recoleta Cemetery, she pointed out amazing and interesting facts that made the experience even more unforgettable.And the cost was a bargain.

My walking tour of BA. Mariela's English is very good and she gave us a very informative tour of the city in a pleasant and relaxed way for five hours visiting many of the major attractions of BA.We would recommend her to other people who would enjoy a walking tour of the city.

Best Tour of BA. Mariela Cavallo gave our group of 7 a fantastic tour of Buenos Aires the day after Christmas. Despite it being holiday season, Mariela treated our team with first class attention. It wasn't just the historical background and site seeing that made her tour great. Her service and attention to our groups' needs was impeccable. She arranged for a very affordable van to pick us up and drop us off throughout the day. She made sure that we all were comfortable and had a nice time. Most importantly, after our tour, she followed up with us throughout the week to see if we needed any other help our guidance in making plans. Mariela was charming, fun and energetic. I would highly recommend her to any individual or group for a tour of Buenos Aires.

Professional, Knowledgeable and She Speaks Good English!. Mariela was the perfect guide, developing a plan to meet our specific requests. Before our trip, we exchanged a number of emails to set our itinerary. She sent out a long list of Buenos Aires attractions, with significant detail. At our request, she picked us up at our hotel in the Palermo neighborhood, and we took public transportation and walked throughout the tour. We saw so many things - everything in Buenos Aires that was the biggest, widest, tallest, oldest, and so on!!! She offered interesting stories to describe the attractions along with current information and news in BA. She charges by the hour at a reasonable rate.

Absolutely fantastic! Mariela gave an indepth educational experience in BA. From the very first "Hello, Mr. Heinz" to the tearful goodbyes, Mariela displayed a thorough understanding of her City. She shared with us the highlights and lowlights of Buenos Aires. We had history, interesting side lights, all in all, a very enjoyable experience!

Extremely helpful, responsive, and our last minute trip wouldn't have been the same without her!. We were a little bored on our trip to Santiago and decided last minute to squeeze in a trip to Buenos Aires. We hadn't researched or planned any attractions to visit because we literally decided to visit BA the day before we arrived. We really wanted to do a tour of the city so we searched trip advisor and saw great reviews for Buenos Aires Concierge. We called Mariela up the morning that we wanted to do the tour and she was able to meet up with us a few hours later to start our tour. We decided that we wanted to hire a car so we could see more, so she was able to call a bunch of her contacts and secure a car and driver to be there in less than half an hour. We ended up having a great time and saw all of the top highlights! Mariela also secured tickets for us to see Argentina play in a world cup qualifying round which was one of the highlights of our trip since we are huge futbol fans. She also recommended a fabulous tango show that we all enjoyed very much. Lastly, she knows a lot of WONDERFUL restaurants and continued to recommend fabulous restaurants throughout our trip! We had some amazing food that we definitely would not have known about if it wasn't for Mariela's recommendations. Overall, our trip to Buenos Aires was amazing and it wouldn't have been nearly as successful without Mariela's help. We highly recommend her to anyone who is looking to make their trip extra special and she went above and beyond to ensure that we had a great time in her city!

Argentina trip. I spent 2 weeks in Argentina visiting Buenos Aires, Iguazù, Cordoba and Las Sierras.It was a great trip around a beautiful Country, so I want to come back soon!In Buenos Aires I did a nice guided tour in Recoleta with Mariela Cavallo.She's owner of "Buenos Aires concierge" providing services like itinerary planning.She's very professional and a lovely person too. If you need any tips about the city, flights in Argentina, hotel and so on, she's the right person!The website is http://buenosairesconcierge.com/Cristina

Mariela provides an excellent personalized introduction to BA with walking tours. Mariela is an excellent concierge, who really makes an effort. She also demonstrates a lot of energy, insight and imagination with her walking tours. Highly recommended. She has some great restaurant recommendations too.

Energetic, enthusiastic, educational......and lots of fun.....that's Mariela!. What a girl!!!! We must have walked a bazillion miles in our 5 hour tour with Mariela.....and in 94 degree heat to boot, but we barely noticed because we were having so much fun. Mariela makes history come alive (especially in Recoleto Cemetery) and even knows a terrific place to stop for empanadas when one is ready to drop. We fell in love with her just as we were falling in love with her city. Wear good walking shoes and make sure your camera is fully charged and with a big enough memory card, but don't miss Mariela's tour!

Don't Hesitate - You Need Mariela's Service!. All the previous reviews are quite correct. Because of our interaction with Mariela, we had a wonderful time in Buenos Aires - starting with our excellent walking tour, and completed with a series of excellent restaurant recommendations, as well as shopping advice and even suggestions for hairdressing appointments. When we moved on from Buenos Aires, we met quite a few other tourists, many of whom complained about Buenos Aires as a destination. Quite simply, they had visited the city as tourists, without a local adviser to help them make the right choices. We did have the opportunity to recommend Mariela to one couple who have yet to visit the city, and I am sure that they will value her contribution as we did. It is simply folly to visit this city without availing of Mariela as 'your hostess in Buenos Aires'.

Simply the best personal concierge in Bs As..charming, delightful, knowledgeable, insightful.. Look no further. Mariela is the best in class!... and worth it. We spent a week in Bs As recently and hit the ground running with Mariela as our personal tour guide and planner. She did an amazing job hitting all the right spots from Recoleta, Subte, El Ateneo book store, Ave de Mayo, Casa Rosada, Cafe Tortoni and on and on and on...in the first afternoon. I would have loved to have her show us around another day. She was efficient, flexible and polite enough to allow whatever time we wanted while still moving us along to see and hear great stuff. We stopped at the end of the afternoon and she wrote out a good plan for the week for us. Be flexible though because you may not get to it all. We could have used another week just on the restaurant list...the best of what you are looking for. She knows what's going on in the city and will make excellent recommendations for events, shops, restaurants. She put us on some free tickets to a performance at the Colon, recommended a semi- finals Polo match and gave us countless restaurant and shopping recommendations. She was also very responsive to follow up questions during the week about shops, places and events.

A true urban sophisticate.... Although we came somewhat prepared with a loose itinerary for the total of 6.5 days we were spending in BA, it did need some tweaking and Mariela's input was invaluable. She met us on our 2nd day and gave us a tour of the Recoleta Cemetary, the neighborhood, Plaza de Mayo, Subte linea A and ended up at Cafe Tortoni. After the tour, she reviewed our plans and gave her honest assessment about the plans we had which made us shuffle around days for certain neighborhoods and even nix some activities altogether. Her knowledge of the area surpassed any of our expectations and she's very friendly, easygoing and passionate about her city...a pleasure to work with. We did appreciate how she really listened to us and tailored her recommendations to our likes and budget and was prompt with any follow up emails answering questions we had about events, neighborhoods or restaurants. As for restaurants, we got 6 recommendations from her, but only were able to visit 3 (La Olla de Felix, La Cabrera and El Preferido de Palermo) which were spot on. With this being said, I enthusiastically give her my endorsement.
A very competent and enjoyable tour guide!. Mariela is terrific. Great knowledge and a pleasure to tour with. This is the way to go Amigos! Go for the personal guide program.

BA like a local. Mariela was fabulous! We were staying in a condo and hadn't given a lot of thought to restaurant bookings for the latter half of our time in BA. Everything she recommended was fantastic and her attention to detail was second to none. I would recommend her to all English speaking travellers to Argentina.

Mariela and BA Concierge are a "must" for getting the most out of BA!. Mariela meets with you to review a plan -- a great way to get started and leave the worries about planning at home. Then same day she can send you her prioritized thoughts, suggestions and arrangements. And you have a resource to write or call throughout your trip for assistance, reservations,,,whatever. A great value, a good "insurance policy" for a good trip...just do it!

Got my trip off to a fantastic start.... Often times, I wind up traveling solo and I do my own planning, but my trip to Buenos Aires was last minute and I wanted to find someone who could get me acclimated quickly. Not only did Mariela provided an incredible customized tour (based on what I requested) but she also provided great bar and club recommendations for the rest of my stay here. You won't be disappointed.

If you're going to B.A., you MUST use Buenos Aires Concierge!. Planning a trip to Buenos Aires? Stop what you are doing right now and email Mariela at Buenos Aires Concierge. You could spend hours planning a trip remotely, trying to weigh the advice of different guidebooks against each other before throwing your hands up in the air and just "going with the flow" or employing a sub-optimal itinerary. Forget it! I had a free weekend in Sao Paulo and on one day's notice, I decided to hop over to Buenos Aires. I had no time to plan anything and would only have a day and a half in B.A. ... so I emailed Mariela. Within hours, my entire trip was planned - sites to see, restaurants to eat at (with reservations made!), activities to do, things to buy. Mariela literally planned everything for me and even found a way for me to enjoy drinks and revelry Argentinian-style the night before the national election, when alcohol sales are prohibited nationally. Mariela provides two different types of services:1. "Concierge services" - Basically, Mariella will take care of everything for you so that all you need to worry about is enjoying yourself. And believe me, that won't be hard if you trust Mariela's suggestions. She has lived in B.A. her entire life and knows the city and surrounding areas like the back of her hand. 2. "Tour guide services" - Mariela will personally show you around, taking you to all of the best spots in the city while providing historical, social, and political context. She's an authentic porteña, speaks perfect English, and is a genuinely cool girl who you will love hanging out with as she wows you with the incredible sights, sounds, and flavors of Buenos Aires. Mariela charges on an hourly basis for either of her services (unlike hotel concierges who have to rely on commissions from the places they recommend), and she is genuinely committed to making your trip spectacular. Her hourly rates are completely reasonable (I could even say cheap, but that's a matter of perspective) and I walked away from Buenos Aires having had an experience that I will never forget. All this from a vacation that I spent zero time planning and decided to take only a day before. Yeah, Mariela is that good! Put down the guidebook and shoot her an email.

For the Ultimate Buenos Aires Experience!!!!!. My colleague and I traveled to Buenos Aires on business and we had a very compressed time to actually see and experience the city. We met Mariela the day we arrived and she took us to the must see locations in Buenos Aires, including setting up a polo lesson for us. What I loved about seeing the city with Mariela as our guide is that we got to understand not only the culture and customs, but all the nuances that you cannot read out of a Fodors. This enhanced my overall experience so much that I felt like I was able to become part of the culture. I decided to stay an additional day and immediately contacted Mariela to accompany me on my shopping spree. When we met, she had the itinerary in hand, knowing exactly where to take me to accomplish my goal (Christmas shopping) and she was an incredibly valuable resource getting around and translating my very poor Spanish. The biggest gift I received from my two days traveling around Buenos Aires with Mariela? A great new friend..... I highly recommend her.

See Buenos Aires the right way....get some help from an experienced porteña. My colleague and I had limited time in Buenos Aires. We were very, very happy to have spent that time with Mariela. Although we took a whirlwind tour through the Recoleta, San Telmo, and La Boca we did not feel rushed and felt like we got an insider's view of the city. There was just no way that we would have been able to take in as much as we did without Mariela's help. Mariela speaks excellent english and is well traveled herself so you get the added bonus of interesting lunch/dinner conversation if you choose.My colleague enjoyed the experience so much that she hired Mariela to guide her on a shopping tour the following Saturday! (Sadly, I had to leave on Friday night).

Best tripadvisor EVER!. Actually I met Mariela when I was living in Buenos Aires. I met a lot of her clients at party's or fun places and they were always really enthusiastic about her.The best you can have as a foreigner in Argentina is that you can be part of the life Mariela is living. She loves her country and she knows where to go so she can definitely give you the best time ever!

ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS SERVICE. I have utilized Mariela's services for a number of years, and she has been the absolute best. The Concierge at the Alvear Palace Hotel (Five Star) can not do for you what Mariela can. She is very well educated, efficient, and totally reliable. I spend 4-5 weeks a year in Buenos Aires, in a short term apartment rental. Having a private concierge, such as Mairela, available makes a stay in Buenos Aires all the more enjoyable. She can open doors that only locals can. Trust me on this...Mariela will make your visit, to one on the greatest cities in the world, a memorable experience.

We had a fabulous week in Buenos Aires thanks to Mariela. Forget whichever guide book you are using ... you can't beat the advice from a local! After Mariela got to know us via some emails and a meeting over a drink, she gave us excellent recommendations in restaurants and activities, based on we liked to do. By day she had us doing some adventurous activities like playing polo, cycling, kayaking and even cooking classes, while at night she booked us into some of the best restaurants in the city. She gave us lots of information with things to do in town, including shopping and the best places to see tango. She listened to what we wanted, and tailored a schedule to suit us. Throughout the whole week she was easily contactable and gave us daily updates about what was happening in town - new restaurants, wine tastings and live music. Buenos Aires is not a city with a huge list of "tourist attractions" to traipse around, it is a city to live in ... and for that you need the advice of a local like Mariela. I would recommend her concierge service to anyone wishing to make the most of their time in Buenos Aires.

Mariela made our trip WONDERFUL!. I have worked in Latin America for many years and have also worked many times before in Buenos Aires. This time I brought my wife and daughter (20 years old) for a week. I originally would have never considered a walking tour but my wife insisted that she wanted to show our daughter the "real" Buenos Aires through an Argentinian's eyes. I am so glad that I acquiesced and listened to her. We contacted Buenos Aires Conceirge and we quickly had a plan through Mariela. Mariela exceeded all of my expectations of what a walking tour entails. She was exceedingly professional, insightful and polished. She started out by asking us what we were looking for in a walking tour and what we enjoyed. She then custom tailored our tour to match our needs and expectations. Not only did we see all of the wonderful sights that one might expect, but I also received, after asking, insight into the economics and politics of the city. My wife and daughter enjoyed Mariela so much that they spent another day with her while I worked. I kept thinking on our tour and when my family went out with Mariela that it was exactly like having a good friend in the city showing us the sites. Mariela was accommodating, engaging and just supremely helpful and enjoyable. I know we all now regard Mariela as a friend of ours and we look forward to seeing her again.

4-star concierge without 4-star hotel prices. mariela is a wonderful person and was a great help to us in our month-long buenos aires & argentina vacation. she steered us towards a wonderful apartment, that we rented for length of our stay, and had ideas and suggestions on a multitude of things to do, and help to offer when we needed it. she loves her city and she loves what she does, and it shows. thank you.

You make your city proud!. After spending some time by myself in Buenos Aires, I recently hired Mariela for a four-hour tour of the downtown. I wish I had done it sooner! We started at the Recoleta Cemetery and ended at Plaza de Mayo, often leaving the beaten track to visit places she knew would interest me - from a music store that doubles as a Jazz café to a bookstore so grand it must be seen to be believed. I was amazed at how much ground we covered without it feeling like a formula.Mariela is very knowledgeable, but what really made the difference was her enthusiasm. It is obvious that she loves both her city and the chance to show it off. She is also very much a people person and I enjoyed her company so much that I almost forgot it was raining! Thanks for a great afternoon, Mariela!

Simply PERFECT !!!!. Every time I travel I search someone to make my trip perfect, without problems and every detail even the most minimum perfect and with some person trust in. Well I found the perfection when I went to B.A and knew Buenos Aires Concierge with Mariela.She constantly looks in your pleasure to be happy and without problems.She makes you feel like in home.

Mariela is a contact you must have in Buenos Aires!. A friend recommended me to contact Mariela when I was already becoming desperate that I wouldn't find a nice apartment for temporary rental in Buenos Aires.So I contacted her and only a few days later, Mariela found a beautiful loft in Recoleta for me at a very decent price!After that, she took me on a city tour. Anybody can show you La Boca or San Telmo, but it's little things that really count and rest assured that Mariela knows all details and cute places of this beautiful city.On top of it all, Mariela is a great person, smiling all the time while she is doing her job, showing that she really enjoys doing what she's doing and that's why she provides such a good service to her clients.Need not look further - Mariela is the best concierge in Buenos Aires!

Mariela takes great care of your stay in BA. Due to work commitment I could only stay in BA for a day. Nonetheless Mariela was such outstanding that she tailor-made a tour which enabled me to explore the city as much as possible despite my short time in BA - it's a tour with a mix of architecture, culture and local life. She has very deep knowledge on the city and great passion. She must be one of the best guides you can encounter in BA for sure - especially for those who cannot even speak a word of Spanish like me!One thing worth underlining: Mariela is so nice that she sent me an email recapping all the spots we went (with short intros and history). During the tour, I bought mate tea cups as souvenirs - she also sent me a clip showing how mate tea can be made! She cares about every detail!

Best service in Buenos Aries!. I used BA Concierge while in Argentina, and it was simply amazing. The advice I got from Mariela was first class, and truly made my experience in South America great! Everything from restaurants that are the "hidden gems" of the city to booking fabulous cultural events and tours around the city. I was able to get the most of my time in BA, and I have this service to thank. Mariela, te estrano!

Mariela Cavallo-a "must" for planning your Buenos Aires Vacation. January 2011If you are visiting Buenos Aires and want to know the best things to do and best places to eat…I highly recommend using Mariela Cavallo.She basically planned our whole itinerary for us…from advising us on the best place to stay to putting together daily agendas.She also found us a Spanish tutor who would come to our apartment every day to teach our kids….who was excellent.All of our day trip excursions were fantastic and she was able to get us into restaurants where there was usually a line outside the door.I highly recommend her for any of your concierge needs while in Buenos Aires.The Pola FamilySan Francisco, California

BEST CONCIERGE SERVICE IN ARGENTINA. Whether you need accommodation arrangements, guided tours, restaurant reviews and reservations or simple advice about local events, Buenos Aires Concierge is definitely the best service available. Mariela, provided us with excellent information and tips during our stay , which is key for a memorable visit to Argentina. Overall, I couldn't be happier with the service provided by Buenos Aires Concierge. I'll happily use them again and absolutely recommend them to my friends and coworkers. If you want the best Buenos Aires Experience, contact Buenos Aires Concierge, (at the very least test them out)!

Enjoy your trip to Buenos Aires with Mariela. I found Mariela through a link on our holiday apartment's website. She responded to my email months ahead of our visit and suggested things which we might like to do. Once we arrived she provided us with a walking/taxi tour of Buenos Aires in Recoleta, Microcentro, La Boca and San Telmo. She is a fountain of knowledge and enthusiasm about Buenos Aires and we thoroughly enjoyed a very hot Sunday with her showing us around some most beautiful areas, explaining the history and significance in perfect English. Her restaurant recommendations were spot-on, the tango show a spectacle! And the best suggestion of all was to go to a milonga and watch the locals dance - lots of fun! I highly recommend that if you can't speak Spanish, then Mariela will take away all the hassles and your holiday will be wonderful. Muchos gracias Mariela we'll always remember Buenos Aires.

If you don't speak Spanish, you need Mariela, BA Concierge. We found Mariela through our apartment rental agency, and what a find. She's smart, fair, and has a rare ability to quickly assess her client's likes and dislikes. We had a real problem with good food in BA, so Mariela came up at short notice with a list of good restaurants. We tried most of them and they were fantastic. She talked us into flying up to Salta in the north west of the country, and we are extremely glad we took her advice. Salta and Cachi over the mountains is a very welcome change from the noise and bustle of Buenos Aires. I don't know how we would have organised flights and hotels to Salta and to Colonia in Uruguay if it had not been for Mariela. Everything she did for us worked well and we would recommend her to all English speaking travellers to Argentina.

Mariela is a must!. I arrived in Buenos Aires on very short notice and Mariela was able to put together a wonderful day of touring Buenos Aires AND a last minute decision to see a tango show. She is smart, lovely and charming. She makes you feel like you are with your good friend and she is showing you the best of her city. I would recommend her on your next trip to BA or anywhere in Argentina.

Thank You Mariela!. A big thank you to Mariela for helping my three friends and I plan a week long trip to Buenos Aires, planned completely last minute. We found Mariela's contact information online and emailed her promptly. Her services included airport pickups, restaurant recommendations, knowledge of the local clubs and doormen, activities outside the city (polo match) and within BA (tango show, English speaking city tour). We didn't realize at the time, but we could have used her to book our living accommodations as well...In addition, Mariela went about and beyond the norm by meeting us in person over lunch/dinner to discuss said itinerary. She also invited us to several parties during the week with her friends and other American expats, making us feel very at home.All this for a very reasonable fee. Once again, thank you Mariela! you made our trip a success!
This is the best service I take ever.... She did very good things to us to make our holiday enjoyable...

In a palabra, tremendo!. Mariela is everything you could ask for should you want and be able to afford a one-person support staff for your visit to Buenos Aires. This city is a maelstrom of activity and individuality. Getting beyond the most superficial level of tourism is not a simple thing to do. Being able to access one person who knows so much and is able to understand that which interests you uniquely, makes all the difference. Also, as a single traveler, having someone to walk and talk through the city added so much to the experience. Whether you are a large corporate group needing macro logistics or an individual seeking to explore a unique angle of the this very diverse city, Mariela can help. Professional, personable, industrious, trustworthy. HIGHLY recommended.

Great service!!. She always gives great information on anywhere you want to go! Whether you headed in and around the city of Buenos Aires or even around the country as well! Def look her up if you are looking to go to Argentina.

Great service!. Mariela is the best! Very organized and friendly. She made our trip so much easier and hassle free. She also had great recommendations for the top clubs and tango shows. I strongly recommend her services.

Mariela is a human Amex Black Card. I came to Buenos Aires(I live in New York) and met Mariela through a friend. She literally acts as a personal concierge service which makes you feel way more important than you actually are. She always responds promptly(even at 11pm when you are at dinner and looking for a quiet lounge in the area) and is always so detail oriented. My friends literally demanded that we take her to dinner to say thank you because she was so amazing. I have come back to tell everyone about her.  Before the trip even began, we were having issues finding lodging. For some reason, we would go on the various sites and find a place we liked (have the site say available) only to find out later it was already rented. Mariela helped us pester the good people of ApartmensBA.com and find which places were actually available and we ended up saying at a nice 2 bedroom apartment right across from the Botanical garden on Las Heras in Palermo Soho.   Through various emails, Mariela had also basically given us a sample itinerary for our trip based on what I told her were our likes/interests. I'm not even sure "thorough" is fair enough an adjective. She gave us choices, options on what nights were the best to go to certain clubs, where to eat and offered help in getting any reservation we wanted. Every bit of advice she gave us was perfect. My favorite meal of the trip happened to be her highest recommended restaurant(Tegui). Even better were her nightclub recommendations. We felt like we were at the best party every single night. Finally, she put us in touch with an agency to get us futbol' tickets to see BOCA play . Just Amazing. Buenos Aires is now my favorite city in the world by far and I have to think Mariela was a big part of that. I love it so much that I am going to go back for a month in November. You can bet my first call will be to Mariela. If you are not from the area, I would say Mariela is someone you ABSOLUTELY HAVE TO TALK TO if you want to have a great trip. I really can't say enough about her service. If you have any questions please send me a personal message and I'd be glad to answer them...Kwesi

Wonderful Time at BA. Mariela helped me to find a nice and well located place to stay in palermo soho. Told me and a friend of mine good spots to go, good restaurants and also arranged a known driver to get and take us back to the airport. Wonderful weekend!!

Totally reliable, dependable and ethical...... I've known Mariela for many years and you won't find many people that are more knowledgeable than she is about Buenos Aires. She studied tourism and has a degree in it. Since she started her company, I've referred many clients and friends to her company and they have all raved at the quality services and assistance provided by Buenos Aires Concierge. I wholeheartedly recommend this company.

Mariela is the best!. Buenos Aires Concierge is the best source for information, tours and cool things to do in Buenos Aires (and throughout Argentina). Mariela is a local who has her finger on the pulse of the city. She has all the right connections and can design an amazing trip for you. Mariela helped me with a trip to Iguazu Falls and Salta. Needless to say, both trips were super awesome and I had her and Buenos Aires Concierge to thank for the memories!

Delightful Walk . I did the morning Recoleta Walk with Janet. I recommend it to anyone, she was witty, charming such a delight to listen to, time flew. Don't miss out, it was much MUCH better than a citytour we had taken the day before with my husband. A to do for sure in BA.

Excellent tour. We went from Congress to Casa Rosada (Government Palace). The tour was in the afternoon and it was amazing. Maru the tourist guide was wonderful. She delighted us with history and local stories. I truly recommend first time visitors or any person in Buenos Aires to take this tour and learn about this culture and history.

Nice walk together for solo travelers . My first walking tour was in Santiago, Chile and as it was really awesome I did the same for BA and this time twice - one day for morning and the other for the afternoon. Both were really nice visiting different sites - as sun gets hotter these days it's not very easy to walk maybe for the whole 3 hours but there are from time to time pauses and when the guide talks we find shades. I especially appreciated that a lot of not been told stories are offered through this tour by very knowledgable young energetic people. Thanks Juan & Victoria for such a wonderful guide! Definitely recommend for all but especially for this who travel solo. :)

Educational and entertaining!. Mario is an amazing guide. He hits all the high points in Recoletta and provides interesting, little-known information about the sites. One of the best walking tours I have ever done. Highly recommended but don't forget to tip!

A definite must do. We did the Recoletta and Recoletta cemetery tours. Both were highly informative and entertaining. We saw a number of sites but the best part was having it shown to you by a local who can explain the historical, socio-economic and political significance of events. Martín was knowledgeable, frank and funny.

Work and play. I would fully endorse these tours if u have a morning or afternoon free. Besides being cost effective, the style of the tour guides is more conducive to learning about the city from the perspective of a local. For many frequent travelers this approach is more appealing, as discovering the city in its reality is far more important than the typical tourist trap tours. And inevitably the important landmarks are encountered so its really a win-win situation. A disadvantage, if at all, is that you are subjected to the personality of the tour guides infiltrating the theme of the tour. If you are lucky to have one who is interested in architectural history then you will be in for a treat. If however you end up with one who was hurt by the economic revolution then watch out, it's history class time for the rebellion. One piece of advice, the walks are three hours long so, comfortable foot wear shouldn't be neglected and hot days are a burden even though they are beautiful days. Enjoy!

Buenos Aires Walking Tours. We did both the free Recoleta tour and the Recoleta Cemetery tour this week. Both were excellent. The guides were knowledgeable and entertaining and we enjoyed our time in Buenos Aires much more than we would have trying to see things on our own. We highly recommend these tours.

All 3 tours. I started with the afternoon city centre tour and ended up doing all 3 of the tours offers by the end of my stay in Buenos Aires. Martin was the guide for the afternoon tour and he was great. So much information about the history, economics and culture of Buenos Aires and Argentina. I went back for the morning tour which was given by Mariano and was also very good. The cemetery tour was also run by Mariano and was very interesting. The cemetery is amazing place and it was great to hear a bit of history and some very strange stories about its inhabitants! I've done quite a few free walking tours around the world now and theses were among the best. Definitely recommend.

Great walking tour through the city center. We did the pm walking tour on Sunday 30/10 to the city center. The guide was very informative, friendly and funny. We learnt a lot about the city and saw nice sights. Would definitely recommend this tour.
Fantastic tour, . We loved this tour. Martino (not sure about his name) was so interesting, engaging, funny and charismatic.Worth every penny you give him and more.

Muy bueno tour!. Amazing tour with Maria Eugenia Bob! She knows everything about Buenos Aires and Argentina and could manage to show us different historic events from different points of view in argentinian society. It was a fantastic history lesson! I absolutely recommend!

Great way to get to know the city!. We did two walks in two different days. Have in mind they start 10 minutes after the specified hour, so in case you are late you have the time to catch the group. First we did the afternoon City center tour. It took around 3 hours and we made one stop for 15 minutes in a nice cafe. The guide was very good, he told us a lot about the history and the current situation in Argentina. The next day we did the morning walk through Recoleta. It was raining really heavy so the walk was no more than 2 hours, again with short stop in a cafe with delicious empanadas. I recommend both walks but if I have to choose only one, it would be the afternoon one.
Cool tour. Liked it a lot. Informations and storys with a good portion of humor. Guide with good englisch skills.
Great way to see the city. I did the morning walk today and it was great. It's not strenuous and you get to see lots and understand more about this lovely city. Do it!

Great tours. We did both the AM and PM tours in one day and we were very happy with the information and sites. The guides were great and entertaining as well as passionate about their city. Can't go wrong with these tours. If you don't like it, walk away! This was great for us since our flight was delayed getting there and we didn't have to have something booked.

Great experience with a lot of information and stories.. we did the morning tour from Teatro Colon to Recoleta Cemetary and learnt a lot about Argentinian history . The guide ( Janet) is a briliant storyteller and gave us great tips.

Great info, wonderful way to see the city. I took the afternoon tour from the congress to the Casa Rosada. The tour is conceived in a coherent manner, showing different aspects of the Argentinian history with a balanced perspective. Our tour guide Ivan, was very knowledgeable and friendly. I hope the Spanish group get its own microphone, just as the English group does.

Amazing free walking tours!. I did both the morning tour through Recoleta (with Mariano) and the afternoon tour in the city centre (with Juan Cruz) they were both brilliant guides! They knew so much information and made the tours fun despite the rain! I learnt a lot about Argentinian history, culture and people, and the guides were more than happy to answer any questions, they even gave people tips for other things to do, or where to eat or see tango. I would highly recommend doing one or both of these tours when you're in Buenos Aires.

Brilliant tours with Martin. I did the afternoon tour with Martin and he awoke my interest in this amazing city. His information scopes history, economics, social climate and culture. Most of all, his passion for his city comes through. I learned so much about Buenos Aires and went back and visited places after to get to the deeper levels he talked about. I went on his morning tour a few days later, which takes in even more of the city and just loved it. As an ex-tour guide, I appreciate how difficult it is to make a tour seem fresh, but Martin keeps it that way. The Free Walks are a great asset for visitors and I told everyone how much I benefited from them, and especially what a great guide I had with Martin!

Great . We did the Recoleta tour with Martin and no regrets. Tour takes 3 hours and Martin never stops delivering information enthousiastically. Tells you a lot about the history of Argentina also and his opinion on political events which is a great insight. Highly recommened.
Waking tour . Really informative, learnt about lots of history and current topics in Argentina. Good way to get oriented to the city.

Fantastic. I did both walking tours with these guys during my stay in Buenos Aires, and the only reason I didn't do the cemetery one was because I had already been a few days earlier. Both guides were very knowledgable about the city's history, and provided plenty of humour along with the facts. Fantastic way to see some of BA's highlights.

Amazing local tour . We took the city center afternoon tour today and absolutely loved it. Martin our guide was very informative. The tour was super informative and Martin shared so much information about the history and current state of the country. I was a little worried that we would be too big of a group (around 40 people). But the size was never an issue and Martin has a microphone so his voice projects. I highly recommend doing these tours. You tip at the end based on your experience. We gave $40 for two people and that was definitely on the high end. Most people were giving $10-20 which was very much appreciated by Martin. We are going to take another tour now because we loved it so much.

Did both morning and afternoon - both excellent. We did both the morning (Recoleta) and afternoon (city center) in English on the same day. Both Juan Groz and Fernando were great and spoke excellent English. Very knowledgeable and fun to walk with. The others on the tour were from all over the world and fun to meet. They separate the groups into English/Spanish which works well, rather than having to have them repeat the same thing twice.Unless you are in good shape you might want to separate these on different days but we did not have the time.Each of the guides has his own stories and opinions on various things which makes the tour very informative.We also have done "free" tours in other cities and it is a great concept. You pay what you think the tour was worth, you can quit anytime if you don't like it. They tell us the average tip is about 150 pesos so it is WAY cheaper than some of the commercial tours and you don't have to drive all around picking people up, you just show up at the starting point and get going.Walking is a much better way to see the city at least for Recoleta and City Center which are fairly compact.
the best!. Maru was great with us during the tour, with a lot of patient and helpful. We could ask her a lot about the place that we visited. I recommend it to everyone!
Great. Great tour. Martin was fantastic, very informative and interesting. Would highly recommend this tour.
Great tour. Francisco great guide.Very interesting for both foreigners and Argentinian fokes. I personally recommend it. Punctual and not long at all.
Excelente!. Martin was excellent and very knowledgeable. I spent 3 months in Buenos Aires and learned more from Martin in 3.5 hours.

Amazing tour with Francisco!. I took the Recoleta and Retiro tour with Francisco. Amazing experience! He was really kind and shared everything he knew about those neighbourhoods of Buenos Aires. I will repite the experience soon! Thank you Francisco!

Excellent introduction to Buenos Aires. I did both the morning and afternoon tours over two days. There are two guides, one who speaks Spanish and the other do speaks English. They separate the groups so you're not hearing the tour in stereo. The tours take 3 hours, and they always arrange a stop point about half way through at a cafe for coffee, wifi check and to use the toilet. The city is reasonably flat so there's no issue with keeping up. Some of the stop points are a little noisy (due to road noise) so the guides carry equipment to amplify their voices if necessary. Basically, you get a really good introudction to the history, politics, culture and architecture of Buenos Aires. The guides are really well informed and their stories, which include personal anecdotes, are interesting and entertaining. Basically you pay them at the end based on what you think the tour is worth. If you don't like it, you pay them nothing but I doubt anyone would be of that view. I would highly recommend using these tours. I also did their paid tour of Recoleta cemetery, which was fascinating.

Second tour as good as the first one. Having tried the morning tour last December IiItried the afternoon one on my return visit and it was just as good.The guide was very knowledgeable and had a good manner. He also coped extremely well with having to deliver part of his spiel on Av de Mayo when a mini version of the Rio carnival was going on to celebrate Brazil's independence dayLike the other tour it combines architecture with political and social history, and even a bit of gossip. i found the part about Evita Peron especially interesting

Didn't disappoint at all. I've done several of these free walking tours now all over Europe and have found them mostly to be excellent although with a couple of weird ones chucked into the mix! My main concern with this one (since our group was a big mix of Spanish, English and French speakers) was that the English would not be up to speed, but our guide Vicky was great. She was local to BA and had loads of interesting and sometimes personal facts about the city, as we as some great insights into Argentinian culture as a whole, which was just what we needed at the start of our 3 week trip. We even kept her back at the end to get a few more tips for our next few days and she didn't seem to mind at all - she was all too happy to stay and help out and gave us an excellent recommendation for the evening. It was a great way to get a taste of Buenos Aires as the locals see it - I'd probably even do the tour again!

Highly recomended. We did the morning tour in recoleta as well as the afternoon tour in the microcentro (on different days), and they are both highly recommended. The guides tell a lot about the city, as well as the history and economy of argentina. They were porteños (born and raised in Buenos aires) and knew a lot about the city. I really enjoyed both tours!!

Excellent tour (guide), thanks Maru!. We loved our first tour with Maru so much that we decided to come back the next day for the Recoleta tour. We did many free walking tours in South America and this one was clearly one of our favourites. Maru studies and is passionate about history AND loves what she's doing, it clearly shows! Great job!

Excelent, amazing experience!. I did the Morning Tour (Recoleta and neighborhood) with the guide Juan Cruz in english and the Afternoon Tour (City center) with Javier in spanish. Both were spetacular, friendly and professionals. Lot of stories about the Argentina history and "behind the scenes" tales told by them...Congratulations!

BA Free walks: Best way to explore the city!. My BF and I were in BA for a week so we had the chance to do both tours: Citycenter and Recoleta. Our guide was Javier in both, we did it in Spanish and it was really good! Javier is really fun and knows how to teach some of the history of Argentina in a way that keeps you interested all the three hours of each tour! I really recommend anyone whos thinking about a walking tour in BA to join this orange guys! Thank you so much Javier for making two days amazing for us!

Afternoon tour. Martin was our tour guide and gave us an interesting insight into Argentinian history and politics. The walk is easy going and visits some intriguing historical sights. Duration 2,5 hours.Well done guys on an innovative idea and I hope that you are well rewarded afterwards with a generous tip! A really good way to start your visit to BA!Kevin Stevens South Africa

Great tours, very informative . Great thanks to Martin our guide for Recolota tour today and our guide yesterday (im sorry I can't remember his name) for tour of historical centre. Fantastic walking tours, much recommended over those provided by hostels, as I did both and these are far more informative. Recolota cemetery is possibly the most bizzare place you will ever visit, and it's great to have a guide to explain it! Bring a jacket it gets windy and cold in spring!
Best way to see the city in just a few hours. Martín was an excellent tour guide, his energy and drive providing an excllent insight in to the history and life of the city.

Fantastic!. Martin was our guide yesterday for the walking tour in BA. He was very well educated, opinionated .. yet funny! A great mix of knowledge he shared to us of the history and politics of BA. He kept the group together well and shared wonderful energy. I highly recommend this to everyone. Thank you!

A must-do...can't beat the inside knowledge these guys offer. Guidebooks and internet can only tell you half the story of a city such as Buenos Aires. You can't beat the facts and stories that Martin imparted on us. From detailed information about the financial situation in Argentina (wish we had done this tour on the first day we arrived rather than learn about how to deal with it 3 weeks into our trip!) to quirky historical facts...all with his funny, easy come easy go attitude. Had a blast
It was very good!!. Martin was our guide , he was very nice , interesting and helpful! If you in buenos aires it really a recomrnd thing to do

Great tour with great guide!. I had a great tour with an amazing guide! He showed us the most interesting places in the city and was always very happy to answer questions. I was a bit worried at first when I saw that the tour was three hours long but it was not one second too long - there are many stops so you don't need to be a marathon runner to survive the walking tour! :)

A must-do thing when visiting Buenos Aires. We learned so much!!!. Me and my wife were very impressed with Mariano's enthusiasm, professionalism, and I guess most importantly his knowledge. Also, not only we learned a lot about the sights we visited, but what I found particularly interesting was that Mariano told us a lot about Argentinian people, their history (immigration etc), the local culture, things which Argentinian people find important/care about etc. To hear the insight of a young man who was born and raised in Buenos Aires, was definitely most interesting. We liked Mariano's tour so much that we immediately signed up for the special Recoleta tour in the afternoon - and we were so glad we did! It was also great that the different tour guides from this company all did a great job, so the quality of a tour is guaranteed with this company.We highly recommend the tours.

An excellent tour . We did all the free tours offered by this company. We had Martin both times and we were not disappointed. He was very knowledgable about his beautiful city. Throwing in facts , fun stories and a bit of personal opinion / humour. Highly recommend both the city tour and the Recoleta tour! Muy Bien!

Awesome tour. I had an awesome tour with Mariano in BA!!! He gave us great information and historic facts. I did the tour on my last day and I'm sad that I did not do his Tour on my first day because I'm sure there are many other places I would have chose to visit! A three hour walking tour sounded like a lot but Mariano kept it very entertaining! I also met some very nice people from all around the world on the tour! This tour is a must-do when in when in Buenos Aires and the best part is it's free!!!

Mauro was great! Wonderful way to see the city and practice Spanish! . I was only in BA for a day and half so wanted to see as much of the city as I could. My hostel made me aware of these daily free tours and I'm so glad that I did them! I did the morning and afternoon tour in the same day which was exhausting (nearly 6 hours) but totally worth it! I couldn't believe that these FREE tours are so long and the guides were extremely knowledgeable! I learned so much about the city and had a blast doing it! I especially enjoyed my tour with Mauro. She was friendly, funny, a walking encyclopedia with her own personal stories sprinkled in, and very easy to understand - I took the Spanish tour. They also offer the tours in English. Although the tours are free you're asked to pay what you'd like if you'd like to. Most of the tour guides are students and I'd imagine this is a big part of their income.

Love BA even more!. Mariano, Thank you so much for the wonderfull BA experience! I met beautiful people in a beautiful city with amazing stories! Thank you so much for sharing the way you do! Very 'serious' at the justice building :D! Love to San Martin, Evita y Buenos Aires!Abrazo grande,Ingmar @ Palermo
Informative tour. We had a great tour with Martín, it was very informative and a great way to get an introduction to Buenos Aires.Definitely recommend as one of the first things you do in BA

Amazing!. We did both the afternoon tour with Martin and the cemetery tour with Mariano. I would highly recommend both these tours! These local guides were full of information and passion about their city, and we learnt so much about the history, politics and economics of Buenos Aries! You don't have to pay, but these tour guides are the best I have had on any walking tour! A special mention must go to Mariano for doing the cemetery tour in the pouring rain, but managing to keep everyone's spirits up, and keeping us laughing!The passion is unreal in these young, fun loving tour guides, and I seriously recommend going on both tours if you are in Buenos Aries !

A great way to discover Buenos Aires!. We did the city tour with Fernando and the Recoleta Cemetery tour with Mariano and both were excellent guides. Very knowledgeable and full of stories you won't find in the guidebook. Highly recommend!

Highly recommended! . We joined the city center tour on Saturday and the recoleta tour on Sunday. Both were interesting and informative. I would strongly recommend to take one of the tours when arriving in BA.

Excellent and informative tours with engaging tour guides!. We went on both the free City Centre and Recoleta tours offered by the company and found both to be engaging, insightful and a great introduction to the history, politics and culture of Buenos Aires and Argentina. Both Martin (City Centre) and Fernando (Recoleta) provided us with an informal yet informative insight into their city. I would highly recommend these tours to anyone wanting to see the real Buenos Aires from people who know the city best.
Great tour!. Martin was a great guide entertaining and informed. Really enjoyed the personal take on the current and historical political situation, much more than just regurgitating facts.

Fantastic walking tour. Martín, our tour guide was fantastic - friendly, enthusiastic and exceptionally knowledgeable and passionate about the history, politics and culture of Buenos Aires. Excellent tour. Highly recommended.

Free walks morning tour. . Delightful and informative. A great way to get to know the city and the country, know about the people and their history as well as local things like bars and museums and money and other tours. Warmly recommend this!
Good time investment. 2h or 2 and a half tour with a lot of information about, culture, history, architecture and other useful tips about the city!

Great way to learn about the history. I did a walking tour of the central area including the Casa Rosada. Our tour guide was Juan Cruz, and he was excellent. He had a lot to share about the history of Buenos Aires and Argentina. He was enthusiastic and friendly and engaged everyone in the group. I felt like I learned a lot and got to see some of the city's most important buildings.

Buenos Aires free walks. My husband and I did the tour this morning with Martine. It went for 3.5 hours, stopping at a cafe for lunch and toilet break. It was very informative and entertaining. The tour ended at Eva Perons grave site. Highly recommended.
Great walk. We had Martin as our guide. He was extremely knowledgable and passionate about the history of Buenos Aires and Argentina. Very worthwhile tour of the city area.

Great introduction to Recoleta. Martin our tour guide was very informative and enthusiastic during our walk through Recoleta. We learnt a lot about the area as well as about the history of Argentina as a whole. Highly recommended!

Good tour 3hr tour of downtown. This was well done. Option of taking the group in english or spanish (split group). Tour guide very passionate and knowledgable. Only negative is we stopped at various points where it was very hard to hear the guide as it was very loud. I think choosing quieter spots when the specific location is less important is probably an improvement.
Awesome day!. Today we did the recoleta tour followed by the cemetary with Mariano, he was amazing and full of information!

Great overview. These tours are well run and you get a great overview of the city. Over the course of two days, we took the two free tours and then we took the paid tour of the Recoleta Cemetary. Our guides were Fernando and Mariano. They are both knowledgeable, passionate about their city, funny and personable. For the tour of Recoleta, you can go I your own but without a guide you won't have the full history and flavor of this place and you won't understand the significance of what you are seeing. It was well worth the $150 pesos, which is roughly $10USD. For the free walks, you give the guide a tip, whatever you think is fair. They both speak English and their is always another guide who speaks Spanish. The two tours run simultaneously. Go and have fun!

Review for the Morning Tour. I made both free tours with Free Walks. We are from Brazil and in a morning we made Recoleta and Center Tour with Maru (Maria Eugenia) in Spanish. She is amazing! She has a lot of knowledge on Buenos Aires and Argentina History, curious facts, myths and more! She was very excited on presenting us the city. Also, she is graduating in History, so you can trust her. The morning tour lasts about 3 hours. Awesome! It's a MUST for those who want to see the city around and learn about the History.

Our first free walking tour experience . The orange jackets made us love this kind of getting to know the town. Once we started then we kept on looking for free walks in Santiago, Cordoba, Valparaiso, Lá Paz etc and... None of them was able to beat the first one. Nome.The level of historical introduction plus personal connection with everything that had happened all together were astonishing. M created an atmosphere of listening to a friend's story not a guide's lecture. I am sorry that I don't remember your name after all the other trips. I think you have said that if we don't like it we should write Mario as your name, but the case is you were the best free walking tour guide we have ever experienced. Really high level difficult to beat!

Excellent free walking tour. Our guide Mariano had excellent English, was well informed, friendly, articulate, interesting and humorous. It was three and a half hours well spent. We gained an excellent insight into the history of Argentina in general and Buenos Aires in particular. It was far more than just a tour of the sights. The walking is flat, so does not require anyhthng beyond an average level of fitness

Interesting tour. The Recoleta walking tour lasts about 3 hours with a 15 minute break in the middle. Martin guided the group through the streets of Recoleta stoping to point out important buildings and monuments. During the tour he talked about Argentina and Buenos Aires' history, politics, economics and architecture. It was both informative and entertaining. One of the best walking tours I've taken.

Walking Tour - Juan Cruz - entertaining, insightful and fun. The tour was a great experience. Juan Cruz made the tour entertaining, insightful, and fun. My wife and I did both tours at 1030am and 3pm. We were in the Buenos Aires for 10 days and doing one of the tours is a great way to get a local perfective of the city. It make the difference because cities that don't have walking tours take more time to get aquatinted with. I would recommend doing this tour!

Great way to learn about the city. WOW!!! This was on of the most unique and mixed up cities I've ever visited. It was a mix of aristocratic buildings inspired by vintage Italian, French, English, and Spanish designs. But also as the city developed newer designs were mixed in. So on 1 corner you can see a new building, a vinage one and 2 mid aged ones. We took the free walking tour on our 2nd day. It was great and taught us a lot about the city. There were 2 guides, 1 who spoke English and the 2nd spanish. After about 3-4 hours of walking we ended at the cemetery. It was on of the most visually amazing cemeteries I've ever seen but the stories of why it is so were a lot less beautiful. The tour is well worth it but bring some money to tip the guide as thats how they get paid.

Fantastic!. We ended up doing both the morning and the afternoon tours in one day because they were that good! The guides were so knowledgeable and passionate about sharing the ins & outs of BA! We learned so much about the city while seeing some incredible sights!
Big thumbs up from us!

Buenos Aires Free Walks was BRILLIANT. The lads that did the tour were sound out and very interesting to listen to. EXCELLENT tour! Thanks lads. I signed up especially to TripAdvisor today to give me first ever review because I felt these lads fully deserved it. No Bull I don't work for them or anything. I'm from Ireland and was traveling South America and found this to be Quality!

Excellent company! . Our first tour with these guys was the Recoleta morning tour, it was with Fernando and it was great! They were easy to find, and we had beautiful weather and it was so interesting learning about the history of Argentina and this area in particular. I love how all the free walks have a pit stop for refreshment and this one needed it as it lasted 4 hours! really really great. It finishes at the Recoleta Cemetery so we stayed on and paid to do that tour, which I would highly recommend as we were told so many interesting stories about the tombs and the families that own them, and more history as some really important figures are laid to rest here! We ended up doing a third tour with Juan the next day, the afternoon city tour which was also really great. He is obviously very enthusiastic about the current political climate here in BA and I found this tour just as informative and you learn a different set of information and see all the major monuments and sights around the Center. Thank-you guys! Keep up the good work.

Amazing tour with Martin . We joined the free walking tour leaving at 10:30AM with Martin as our guide. Lasted until 14:30 and goes from Theatre Colon to Recoleta. Really worthwhile! Not only for all the sights you get to see during the time but also the guide, Martin, is from BA and extremely knowledgeable about the area and sights. It was also really interesting to get to learn about the history, culture and politics of Argentina by someone with so much passion. And excellent English! Thoroughly recommend the tour! We are planning to do the afternoon tour after this one was so good!

Really interesting!. We went on the tour today and it was so interesting learning all about the politics, history and the current inflation in Buenos Aires. The tour guide was wonderfully passionate about the city.

Very interesting. Today I had a tour of the city center, with a rather small crowd, amid intense rain. It had everything to go badly, if it weren't for Martin's enthusiasm and knowledge. Several interesting facts and conjectures were presented as we walked from Congresso to the Plaza de Mayo. Martin certainly has his own firm perspective of how things transpired in Argentina recently, and while I retain some healthy skepticism regarding some narratives that sound rather familiar to me (being another fellow Latin American), I definitely respect opposing opinions and welcome new perspectives on history. Much better than a common fact reading tour, that way.All in all, a well deserved 5 stars. You guys rock :)

Excellent. We went on the walking tour as an introduction to Buenos Aires. Our tour guide was Martin who was very friendly, enthusiastic and knowledgeable on the city. We throughly enjoyed the day and learnt so much. Would definitely recommend.

Great tours with thought provoking guides. We took the afternoon city tour with Delores. She put the different periods of history of the city into context, entwining this with the architecture. She was welcoming and happy to answer my questions.The next morning we took the Recoleta tour with Martin. He was good at explaining difficult concepts (e.g. the history of the Argentine economy) in simple terms. I enjoyed his passionate views and again he weaved the history in such a way so that the events were put into context.I would wholeheartedly recommend these tours.

Afternoon City Center Tour. 'Deplores' the English speaking guide very friendly with a great and passionate knowledge of her city. Found this tour very interesting. Had done the Morning "Walking Through Recoleta Tour" which complemented the afternoon tour.
AM and PM tours. Very worthy. They know all about the city and are very friendly. I recommend Maru and Janet as tour guides ;)
great way to explore city and learn more about BA. go for both tours excellent tour guides and lots of information and great way to get a better overview of city

Excellent value tours. We took an afternoon tour with Fernando the first day we arrived and it was great. Fernando was engaging and gave us plenty of information about this great city. It was miserable weather and even rained towards the end but no one left the tour as it was intriguing. Two days later we were lucky enough to find ourselves being walked around with Fernando again on a morning tour. Again it was so interesting we stayed on and took the tour through the Recoleta Cemetery. This tour is not free but well worth the 150 pesos it cost. We could have wandered aimlessly around and I guess we would have eventually found Evitas tomb but Fernando bought the place to life. His passion was contagious and his stories about so many of the tombs were fascinating. Definately not macabre or scarey. A great experience and thanks Fernando for sharing your time and knowledge with us. This tour is a must!!
