Tour with Juan-Cruz. We were able to go on a 3pm tour with Juan-Cruz. We have done many free walking tours around the world, and he is the best tour guide that we've had so far. He attended the school of architecture, so was able to point out many interesting buildings in buenos aires during the tour. He is also very engaging and a great story-teller. We learned a lot about BA from him. After the tour, he even sent us a map of all of his favorite places in BA, which was such a nice touch. Thanks Juan-Cruz!

Good tour for those with little time, there is room for improvement. We had only 2 days to visit Buenos Aires, so we decided to go with Buenos Aires Free Walking Tours. It is a good options for people who don't have much time and want at least a general sightseeing of the city, with some interesting and fun stories in the middle. We took the morning tour with Janet, who was nice and warm, and provided us with curiosities and short stories about key spots in Buenos Aires, like the Torre Monumental, Plaza San Martin, Teatro Colon, the Jewish Sinagogue, Retiro and Recoleta barrios and ending in the Recoleta Cemetery at Evita Peron's tomb. I think they could improve if maybe they could leave earlier than 10:30 am, as this leaves more time for people to go get lunch and then take the afternoon tour with them, which visits other parts of the city such as Casa Rosada, The congress, etc. As well, they may think about extending the visit to Recoleta a bit more, as the cemetery is really nice but other than Eva Peron's tomb, there is not much to see if you are not that knowlegeable on argentinian history.

Informative, intersting tours. Took both the Recoleta and city centre tours. Guides Juan-Cruz (city centre) and Mariano (Recoleta) were extremely knowledgeable and gave us great lessons on the history, culture and architecture of this amazing city. Mariano had a dry sense of humour which I liked but may not be to everyones liking. Juan-Cruz was superb - engaging throughout.A great way to pass a few hours and see about the place

Free walks Buenos aires tour was amazing. We did a 3 pm tour with Fernando and it was amazing. The guide was very informative, friendly, funny and provided so many interesting facts about the city's history and culture. I would definitely recommend this tour if you are visiting Buenos Aires.
Very good way to know the city . I had a great time doing both tours, with Maru and Ivan. The guides know lots of history and are very informative and kind. Super interesting. Highly recommended.
great tour. enthusiastic, engaged guides. Was a bit hard to find them at first but worth it- Lots of tips too about where to go culturally and food, very knowledgeable!

Yanet gave an amazing tour!. We had Yanet on our Recoleta morning free tour and she took us on a 3-hour-long tour of the best parts of the city. It being cold she always tried to bring us into the sun, and always found seating so we could rest while she spoke. She told us inside stories and history of the architecture one would never know, and we even played a little game in one plaza. She is incredibly sweet and knowledgeable and made everyone feel comfortable, no matter what country or native language. She also did not force you to tip or even expect it, but was extremely gracious when we all did tip her. We had a nice walking pace, not too slow to be boring and not too fast to be tiring. She still had an upbeat attitude at the end of the tour as well. Would highly recommend!

Excellent and informative tours. All tree tours offered by Free Walks Buenos Aires are great way to introduce yourself with the city. Guides are knowledgable and fun and overall atmosphere positive. It is also good way to meet other travelers coming to Buenos Aires from all over the world. Highly reccomendable.

Great tour!. Did the morning Recoleta tour with Janet. Its very informative, covers most of the neighborhood and a lot of fun. It gives some insights about the history and stories behind buildings and places in this part of the city.
Fab :) . Great tour, very informative and enjoyable. Good balance between walking and talking. I'd highly recommend. Christina from Ireland.

Very informative tour. I've done an amazing tour with Maru, in the afternoon's tour, she was very informative and passionate about the local history.
It's always better having a local as a guide.

Really good walking tour!. The tour is really good, not to long, and it gives you a big insight in the development and architecture of the city. Definetly worth going! And also Juan was an excelent guide!

Meh. We were in BA as the departure city for our Antarctica tour. We went there four days early to experience the city. My expectations weren’t too high since I’d seen several lists of the top 10 things to do in BA and going to Uruguay was always about half way down on those lists. Because we’d had such good experiences with these “free” walks in Europe we didn’t hesitate to do both of them here. We did the afternoon walk with Martin and the morning walk with Mariano. Both made sure to ask us to give their tour a five star rating on TripAdvisor. If you are going to pick one tour, I recommend the morning one. There seemed to be more things to see. Both of the tours are heavy with talk of Argentine politics and monetary problems. I would have been happier with substantially less discussion of these subjects. I’m sure the guides appreciate being tipped in US dollars, British pounds or euros. Thanks for reading; I hope you found this helpful.

Great and very informative! . Absolutely amazing! Very informative, very interesting and passionate presentation of Buenos Aires. Of course all depends in the guide you get. Since these guys work for tip, believe me, they really WORK for it. Martin is 100% excellent! Would do any tour with him!

Perfect way to see the highlights of BA!. I took the morning tour with Martin and decided to take the afternoon tour the next day because it was so wonderful! Such a great way to cover a lot of the city in a short period of time, especially if you are only there for a few days. The tour guides were well versed in the history of the city and monuments as well as the political climate in BA. I was impressed with their knowledge and desire to share as much information as possible. The tours are about three hours, but they go fast and the walking is easy when you are enjoying it as much as I did! There is no cost for the tour, you tip as you see fit at the end. Well worth the money!!
Morning tour of BA. Great tour with a fantastic guide. Mariano was knowledgable and entertaining, so much so that we did the afternoon tour the following day. Highly recommend this!!
Fantastic. Just did the afternoon tour and it was fantastic! Loved Fernando!!! What a babe!! V engaging and interesting!!

100% recommended. My guide was Maru and she was great. There are 2 tours, I recommend to do them both, with these tours you will get a lot of information about Buenos Aires and all the magic that involves this city.

Great introduction to the city. I took this tour on the rainy last day of a business trip, and wish I had a chance to have taken in at the beginning of my trip, as it highlighted places that would en great to return to and explore further. The guide was clearly very knowledgeable and funny- but his accent and the fact that he talks rather quickly made it difficult for non-native English speakers in our group to understand.

Definitely worth it. We did this on the first day which was great to get some direction and knowledge of the city. The tour was approx 3 hours at very easy pace and the guide was excellent even singing with a guitar along the way. The actual tour was good, but the information was better, gaining knowledge of other tours and free activities. Well worth it.

Great intoduction to Recoleta area. We did the Recoleta waling tour with Juan Cruz, which lasted around 3 hrs. At the start of the tour, they split you into English v Spanish speaking groups. We had around 15 people in our group. This was a great way to get a overview of this area of the city. Juan Cruz was knowledgeable about the architecture and city. I would have given the tour 5 stars if it had gone into the Recoleta cemetery (Juan stopped outside the cemetery but the Spanish guide took her group into the cemetery we say later). While this is a tip based tour (no fixed cost) the guide recommended 150 pesos per person. I thought this was a reasonable amount for a 3 hour tour. The amount to tip was a pretty light sell and there wasn't a lot of pressure behind the amount to tip.

Great way to learn the history of the country and city. Great tour, it roughly lasted 4 hours. Tour talked about the immigration of the early days, the wealthy past of the country and where it stands currently. Tour ended in the Recoleta
Great tour . We had a tour today and it was really great. Very informative and interesting history of Argentina. It got cold by the end so make sure you wear a jacket to stay warm.

Awesome Recoleta tour. We did the Recoleta tour in spanish with shanet and it was great - when you meet at 10:30 there are two guides (one English and one spanish) and they split you into two groups. We learnt so much about the city and were so glad we went for this walking tour!

Franco and his guitar. A couple of large groups, Spanish and English, tour was great, Franco was good, his guitar was ok. Worth a trip just a tip is required, takes around three hours and there are different tours in the morning and afternoon, check with your Hotel. BTW the underground now requires a green card which you can get from most shops, you can no longer just turn up and pay. All changed two weeks ago. Enjoy.

A perfect intro to the city. Went on this tour with Juan Cruz who was wonderfully helpful and informative. A great way to take a look around the central city and learn about the history of Argentina, get an insight to the culture and to understand the monuments around Buenos Aires. I would definitely recommend doing this tour if you're new to town!

Informative, but cheesy songs were a bit too much.... We did the Recoleta tour with Marco in the morning. He was quite engaging and very knowledgeable, and his English was excellent. He did have a large group though, so didn't get much of a chance to move off the standard script. It felt like his USP as a guide was to use local musical forms to enhance the information and experience. This would have been great, but he seemed to want to shoehorn in some cringeworthy lyrics about the tour. I would have preferred it (and I think it would have been better too) if he had just sung the songs with their original content. It was a lovely day for the walk, which took a little over 3 hours and did include a lengthy (and welcome!) stop for lunch and toilet break. We did the walking tour in central Buenos Aires through the other main free company, so I'll comment on that separately. In comparison, this one offers slightly more content, but is less engaging (the cheesy songs didn't help, and we were part of a much smaller group on the other tour). That said, some people really seemed to enjoy the songs (maybe they were tone deaf....) and it only slightly detracted from a very informative and enjoyable walking tour.

Very informative . We did the free tour through Recoleta on a Saturday in April. The weather was nice so there was a very large turn out-- about 40 people. Even with such a large group, our guide (Martin) did a good job of keeping everyone organized. He had all sorts of great facts and kept the tour entertaining. Our only added thought is that it could likely be shortened by 30 minutes. In the end we paid the equivalent of about $7 USD which was well worth it.

A great way to start the trip. We always try to take in a walking tour to orient ourselves with a new city. This one was well worth it for a quick lesson on places and neighbourhoods. Our guide was entertaining and informative. We took the morning tour to recoletta with a coffee break half way through. It did take a lot longer than the advertised time but we had lots of time. If you need to leave part way through its not a problem.

Best walking tour so far!. We did 2 tours with this company and they were both fantastic. Martin and Fernando were our guides and they were incredibly informative. We have done quite a few walking tours on our travels so far and while they have all been great these ones were the best! I would highly recommend these tours.

Extremely informative!. I went on the historic walking tour with Maru (Maria) and it was exactly what i was looking for. Really interesting, in depth information about the city, so you came away feeling like you had got a true insight into the culture and politics of Argentina. A passionate, friendly and very knowledgeable guide - if you like to get to know a place, go on this tour!!!

Very good tour, informative and fun. Totally recommended.Went two times, because the first time, was on the 24 March, and the streets were full of peaceful demontrators and we could only make a small part of the tour, modified.I knew about that beforehand, as I had read it on Facebook. (the tour organizers had informed on time, about the change). And the guide that day talked more about things that were related to what was happening around us and so it was extremely useful.Must monuments, very interesting stories and you learn a lot.Don't miss, if you can go!
Interesting, authentic and good guided walks. I did all the three different walking now tours. All good experiences. Would recommend all of them!! It's a no-brainer!
Great tour. We just had a great tour today with Martín from Freewalkingtours, it took about 3,5 hours including a stop at a snack place (with nice empanadas and sandwiches).

Buenos Aires Free Walks. I personally think that walking (and taking the public transport system) is vital to one understanding and to getting to know how a new location is, works, how are the locals, how do they behave, loud or quiet, happy or polite, rude or busy etc.That is why I always try to join the walking tours. You get a decent overview of the city, you walk by it (which is a completely distinct feeling from the one you have from the inside of an AC van that goes around).Anyway, our guide was Martín and the tour was spot on. Although apologized a lot when talking about the history of the economy of Argentina, there is no way one could understand this city (and country) without learning about the inflation, hyperinflation, locked exchanged rate, blocked saving accounts etc. (all part of the reason why Argentinians have the "USD fetish")With also politicized comments about the city, it was good to have a sociologist delivering the tour.Also giving hints about the city upon request, they deserve a 5 star.

Excellent tip-based tours in BA. I took all three tours - the two free ones and the new paid one (only 150 pesos) of the Recoleta Cemetery. All of them are REALLY good! The free ones are great to get a sense of the city when you first arrive, and to hear some history. The Recoleta Cemetery was honestly my favourite because of all the interesting stories about the people who are buried there. Highly recommend!

Take this Tour !. We took both tours the one in the morning and then another day the afternoon. tour . Each covers different areas of Buenos Aires . Martin our guide ion both tours was knowledgeable , enthusiastic , passionate and fun. . The first tour took about 3 hours , the second tour was more like 5 hours . But both were great . You are given a great inside to Buenos Aires , it's history , culture , past and present . We had so much fun , after the tour Martin gave great recommendation on where to eat where to go , a cool guy who loves the city he lives in .
Amazing tour. Tour was great! our guide Martin was knowledgeable and funny. He showed us a lot of sites and hidden gems we wouldn't find on our own. Definitely worth going to.
Juan Cruz is an excelent guide!. The walking tour was joyful and gave me and my friends the opportunity to know plenty about the local culture and history.

sharp and excellent free walking tour. Martin W - charismatic and interesting speaker, giving synthetic information about the city's landmarks in a very interesting and attractive way. highly recommended.

Highly recommend the Recoleta Cemetery Tour: LOTS of information, all of it interesting!. This was a great tour! Mariano is a great tour guide and really knows his stuff; tour is available in English or Spanish. Our American family of 4 were the only ones on his tour yesterday afternoon; we all enjoyed it and learned quite a bit about Argentina's history and culture. I can't imagine trying to find our way around the cemetery ourselves, there are no "street names" or directional markers, and we wouldn't have known much about the stories behind the graves. This tour charges a small fee (different from the "free" city tours also offered by his company), but we more than got our money's worth.

Interesting and fun. Iván Bustamante and Ariel, you are 5 stars guides. Your insight gave us a better understanding of the history of the city and your jokes make the walk really fun even under the rain. Thanks!
Great tour. Very informative. Históric. Nice way to get to know the city. Use confortable shoes. Multilenguaje tour. Interesting

Exelent Walk. My daughter and I joined the tour after it was started and shared the rest of it. They were very helpful with us when trying to find the group.Enjoyed the places, the walk and the explanations. Very informative.Being from Buenos Aires (but no longer living there) enjoyed the view of the city as a tourist very much!

Everything you want to see!. I did the afternoon tour followed by the morning tour 3 days later. A lot of repetition in the commentary, but all the sites are different. If you can only do one I suggest the AM, the Recoleta cemetery is the definite highlight also the local view of the Falklands War was very interesting. It is a distinct advantage to speak Spanish as their guide (Janette) is beautiful!

Great tours even when it rains!. We did both tours. The 10:30 tour with Dolores and the 15:00 tour with Martin. We spread this over two days. The 10:30 tour is more about historical buildings and included a good 3.5 hour walk. It rained very hard, but Dolores made the best of it with a nice story and made sure everyone was as comfortable with the weather as possible. The tour ends at the cementary, so take some time and definitely go there. A bit creapy on a rainy days (in a good way).The tour at 15:00 tells more about Argentina's politics, economics and other history and included less waking (also because of the bad weather). As he starts his tour he explains that he will tell you his side of the truth. It was very interesting to hear Martin's side of the story and learn about Argentina's politics and economics changes. Great tour with lots of info with enthusiastic and friendly guides. Definitely a must do in Buenos Aires!

Informative and fun . Did the morning tour with Mariano and the afternoon tour with Manuel(?), both portenos and happy to share inside information mixed with cultural/historical and fun stories, really enjoying

Amazing tour. The best way to visit this gorgeous city. In a couple of hours u learn lots about argentinian culture, history and so on!We have done both tours they offer and the guides share with you lots of knowledge and most important thing.... They love what they do!

Excellent. My husbund and I took both free walks, and we really enjoyed them. Both guides knew a lot, answered all the questions we had. Congratulations to Loly Fraga this morning, she was top of her class!!!!!

Excellent. We had a walking tour with Juan Cruz. He was excellent - very interesting to hear his opinion on various landmarks and buildings in Buenos Aires. He gave a very good summary of the history of Buenos Aires, ranging from the city's foundation several hundred years ago, through the political minefield of the 1950s - 1970s to the present day. The tour started at 3pm in front of the congress building. Highly recommended.

Worth the time!. Mariano was a wonderful and comical guide. We learned much about the history of BA and many of its buildings, as well as the culture and recent historical events. We didn't know what to expect from this tour, but we were very impressed by this tour and what we learned.
Excellent Tour. Juan Cruz was an awesome tour guide. Learned a lot about the history of BA and Argentina. Definitely recommend and it's free!

Fantastic must do. We did both walks Recolleta over 3 hours in the morning and city tour at 3 pm they do a Spanish or English tour.We had a bit of trouble finding the starting place but probably our fault the tour was so informative and the tour guides were very passionate about there country.Make sure you wear comfy shoes long walk and some tipping money as it is a free tour but payment as tip whatever you think is fair
un perfecto dia... free walk recoletta & historical center. Hi, had a perfect tour to the historical Center with Juan. ***** GraciasBuenos Aires Free WalksReiseleiter

great way to learn the history of the city. I took the Buenos Aires Free Walks 3:00pm "City Center Tour" a few days ago (note that Buenos Aires Free *Walks* and Buenos Aires Free *Tour* are different organizations). It was easy to find the group gathering in front of the gate of the Congresso. The tour was interesting and well done. Kids would probably not last long - it is more adult oriented with lots of historical details. Be prepared to be on your feet for around 3 hours (no bathroom break). There were a lot of people in the tour but Dolores did a good job with her portable mini-speaker ensuring that everyone could hear. At the end you tip what you feel the tour was worth. Definitely worthwhile.

Great insight into local culture and history. We took the morning Recoleta tour. It was 3.5 hours so wear comfortable shoes! We really enjoyed the tour and it gave us an excellent insight into the recent history and politics of Buenos Aires and Argentina. Our guide was clearly very passionate about his country and did inform us that some of what he was telling us was his view and that others may have different views around some of the more sensitive political issues such as corruption. We loved hearing his perspective, it felt very real and not like a sanitised 'official' version of events. Highly recommended.

Informative.. We've done quite a few walking tours but I think this is probably the most informative. I really felt I had a better feel for the place after it. The only negative was the size of the group.
Great way to see city!. Great tour guide and way to see the city. Highly recommended to get some history and background on this wonderful city.

Great informative tour!!. Did both the morning and afteroon tours, and both were awesome! Martin was super fun and shared many history about Argentina that i didnt know about! Franco wasgreat, even played guitar and sang traditional argentinian tunes for us! Fun 3 hour walk!

A must! Walking tour with Janet. The best way to know the city! My family and I went to 2 different walks: one in the Recoleta neighborhood, one to the city center, both with Janet, a charming and funny guide who gave the tours in Spanish. Totally worth it, we learned a lot and had so much fun!!

Amazing and Informative Tour of BsAs. This was one of the highlights of my trip to BsAs. Our guide, Juan Cruz, was incredible and so knowledgeable. Having an architecture and design background made his tour that much more special, as he focused on the unique landscape and cityscape.

Best way to get to know the city!. We took the morning through the city center and also afternoon tour through Recoleta on two consecutive days. Our tour guides were very knowledgeable and also took enough time to answer any questions from the group. They were both also very engaging and gave the tour their personal touch.Make sure to bring comfortable walking shoes as both tours take several hours: 3.5h for the Recoleta tour including a short snack break and around 2.5 hours for the city center walk.I would definitely recommend doing both tours (especially at the start of your stay) as it's the best way to get to know the different parts of the city and its interesting past!

Informative, interesting, met great people. Loved our guide Martìn W. for the 3pm El Congresso walk on a Saturday! Learned about the economic situation in Argentina. Got a sense of downtown quickly. Did both tours. Bring water, wear comfortable shoes, a hat/sunscreen, and a snack.
walking tours. Excellent tour highly recommended. Our guide Martin was very passionate and informative about his city.

All the walking is worth it. Great way to get to know Buenos Aires. The guides are really friendly and helpful. I took both of the tours on different days... I recommend to take the Recoleta tour first, and the next day the Centro Historico after. The guides have a lot of knowlegde of Buenos Aires and they share with you very interesting facts. If you have time, don't hesitate and take the tour
Great tour. We loved our first experience of a free walking tour in South America! Our tour guide Martin was great, the tour was very informative, and was a great introduction to Buenos Aires!

Very entertaining and informative tour!. I did the tour with Martin today and it was a real pleasure. It was a very interesting lesson of Buenos Aires history with a personal touch, which made it all the more engaging (though not everybody might like this; I really did!). I wouldnt hestitate to recommend this tour to friends and family.

Recoleta tour with Mariano. We had a great walk around recoleta with our guide Mariano, who was very friendly and knowledgeable. The group was quite large, but Mariano brought a little speaker with him, so there was no trouble understanding everything. Buenos Aires is an amazing city, which can be quite overwhelming due to its size, so the Free Tour principle is a great way to get an introduction. We'd recommend it to anyone!

The best tour in Buenos Aires. I took a city tour with Juan Cruz and it was great. Juan is fun and easy to understand and he knows all there is to know about Buenos Aires and the history of Argentina. After the tour he has been kind enough to send me a map with pins of his personal recommendations - more than that he took the time to send me restaurant recommendations. Thank you Juan!

Free walking tour in Buenos Aires. We joined the 3pm tour which started out at Plaza San Martin. We were an all English speaking group and our tour guide, Sol, was a brilliant guide. She is one of the founders of the free tours in BA and she was passionate about her city and gave us great insights into the character and culture of the local Portenos. We learned about the history, architecture and also about local contradictions in behavior. We thoroughly enjoyed the tour and highly recommend it.

Great Morning Tour; Disappointing Afternoon Tour. The tours are easy to find & are provided in English & Spanish separately. We really enjoyed the morning tour which allowed us to see everything downtown that we had hoped to see & more! The guide was funny & engaging. Unfortunately, the afternoon tour was BORING & long! If you love history & want to know every little detail about B.A.; you may enjoy this. However, half of our large group was disengaged & bored. I was surprised that the guide didn't notice or maybe care that half of his group was yawning & wandering off. He had a major case of verbal diarrhea! We should have left halfway through but stayed to tour the Recoleta cemetary. The worst part was he ended the tour upon entering the cemetary; I was expecting a guided tour of it. He didn't even take us to Evita's grave! Overall, I'd recommend the morning tour but try Buenos Aires Free Walking Tours for the Recoleta tour.

Juan Cruz gave a great tour!. My friend and I have been touring Argentina,and Juan Cruz's afternoon tour was great! He was very knowledgeable and ran a very organised tour. In addition he was funny and shared a lot of personal opinions. I would definitely recommend it!
Great tour, must do!. This was an amazing tour & Martín was a great, knowledgeable guide giving us plenty of detail on he political, cultural & economic story of Buenos Aires

Juan Cruz is the best!. I really enjoyed this tour! The route goes along very busy thoroughfares, but Juan Cruz did a great job of stopping in places where we could gather around to hear him (plus he uses a microphone). Juan Cruz told us a lot about the history of the country and its formation, as well as the current political climate. It was very interesting and enjoyable!
morning walk. it was a very good walk, gives you a chance to see and hear things on BA.very intresting and the guide was very helpful

Morning Tour. We joined the walking tour at 10.30am with Mariano as our guide. He was born in BA and knows his city very well. The tour was conducted in English & was very informative. All points of interest were explained as well as a lot of history of Argentina. A great way to explore the city, especially if your time is limited. Definitely recommended.

Fascinating insight into Buenos Aires. We did the morning and afternoon tours today and both were excellent. We leant so much about Buenos Aires and saw so many wonderful things that were made more fascinating by the information given by the guides . A must do in Buenos Aires .
City centre tour. Martine, our guide, was fabulous with good humour and lots of knowledge about this fabulous city. Highly recommended.

Great, Enthusiastic Tour Guide. We did the City Centre (morning) tour with Martin, and it was great! He was very passionate about history and politics - he has lots of strong opinions on the Argentinian government, which were interesting to hear. It was about 3-4 hours long with a 20 minute break at a nice cafe. The tour ends at the Recoleta cemetery. We learned a lot about the history of the government and about different events that have taken place over the years. It was great to visit lots of different parts of the history. Would definitely recommend to anyone who wants to see the city and hear from locals!

City Centre one the best. We did both tours - the city center one the first day with Andrew, and the Recoleta one the next day with Martin.We really enjoyed the tour with Andrew. He spoke really well and kept all of us interested. Very personable guy. An easy walk straight down AV de Mayo. Really enjoyed the sites and Andrew's explanations and history. We didn't enjoy the morning tour with Martin as much. It may have been because we had just done the tour with Andrew; perhaps leave a day between if you can. We found there was a lot more walking and less sites in this tour. Martin also spoke very fast English and at times it was quite difficult to understand. If he slowed down it would be much better. In hindsight, we should have told him this from the outset. We didn't enjoy the 20+ minute talk about inflation, especially because Andrew had succinctly covered the topic in less than 5mins the day before. Definitely do one of the walks in Buenos Aires!

Good tour. We were very happy with Recoletto tour that we took with Mario. The tour took good 3.5 hours. We had a break in a half way in nice cafe for 20 min. Mario provided good information and answered all our questions.

Great way to see the highlights of BA. We did both the morning and afternoon walks in one day!! The tour guides are great and provide a lot of information on a variety of topics (historical, architecture, currency, etc.). These are quite popular so the group size can be large, but they use a microphone so it's pretty easy to hear (except in a few noisy spots).

Enjoyable tour, excellent guide. Our tour guide Martin made this walk a truly enjoyable and informative experience. His English was excellent, he was amusing and most importantly, was enthusiastic about his city. Don't miss this one!
Gteat Tour.. This was a great tour. It was very informative and given with the passion that the city deserves. It is a must do for all lovers of city life culture...Must do...Give it a go.
Informative walking tour around BA. Good tour, friendly guide with good English and A lot of knowledge of Argentinian history and the downtown city area. A great way to find out about this city.

Pretty good. I went on three tours with them (the same one twice) and the guides I had (Fernando and Mariano) were both quite knowledgeable and interesting. Fernando had more background information and was more charismatic but both were definitely worth the walk.

Great guide!. Martin was my guide. He was super funny and informative. He taught us a lot about the history and political situation in the city. He seemed very passionate and was very humorous throughout. I did the City Walking Tour. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to learn more about Argentina.

Passionate, informative guide. Brilliant walking tour with Martin. I wish we'd done this on the day we arrived in BA because it gave you a great feel for the city and its people. Martin explained Argentina's more recent turbulent political and economic history in a very accessible and passionate way. Really good.

Dolores made Buenos Aires come to life. Did the free tour from Theater Colon to Recoletta. Our guide, Dolores, made it VERY interesting and relevant. Excellent 4 hour tour. I would highly recommend this tour to others who want to learn more about the history and the "here& now" of Buenos Aires.

A must to do when in Buenos Aires. We took the Free Walking tour with Alfredo on a Sunday afternoon. It was brilliant to have the local knowledge and have a friendly interesting guy to show you around the high lights and give you some background into this wonderful vibrant city.

Interesting and engaging tour!. I had two excellent tours with Maru at Buenos Aires Free Walks! We first went for the morning tour and enjoyed it so much we went for the afternoon tour another day, and we were lucky to have Maru on both tours! She is extremely knowledgeable and engaging, and also speaks very clearly: a bonus for me, as I took a Spanish tour for practice. The morning and afternoon tours cover completely different areas of the city, so I would say that it's worth it to do both (although maybe not in the same day as they can be tiring). It gave us a great insight into the history of Argentina and ideas for things to do later in our trip. Thanks, Maru!

Tours. It was really an amazing tour! We walked for like 3 hours! The guy who showed us around was from the city and he explained a lot about it! And I can tell you behind every building theres an amazing story with connections to the city. He also explained us the Argentina economy for us to understand why certains things work in a certain way! I would really really advice you to go and if you can choose the guy who does the tour, choose Martin!!! He is great!

Martin is the best guide!. We loved the free walking tour this morning. We arrived yesterday in the city so this was our first activity to get our bearings....which is a perfect way to start your time in BA. It started at 10:30 and went until roughly 2:30. We learned a lot about the economic history, architecture and various areas of the city. Martin was extremely knowledgeable and entertaining! Highly recommend this

An interesting new take on BA. We were in a group of about 20 people for the afternoon central tour, which lasted about 3 hours. The guide, Juan Cruz, was excellent. He explained all the history, politics and architecture of the city with passion and enthusiasm, pointing out things I would never have otherwise noticed, and giving more background to more well-known historical buildings. It definitely gave me a whole new way to look at the city. I would highly recommend this to anyone who is new to BA.
Great walk. We had a great walk. We saw all of the places and heard great explanations. The guide spoke English very clear and we had a lot of fun.
Interesting. I really enjoyed the tour, it took about 3 1/2 hour but it didn't felt like this.It was really interesting we learnt a lot of the history but in a funny wayand we saw a lot of things.

Great way to see the city . We did the 10:30 Recoleta walk with Martin and on another day did the 3:00 walk of the centre with Loli and both were great! We learned so much about the history of Buenos Aires. Quite impressive actually all the knowledge they pop into a tour while also seeing amazing buildings. Both guides were also helpful to recommend local attractions and activities and Martin even have out his personal email should any questions arrive after the tour. I would highly recommend taking in at least one of these tours.
Excellent tour with Loli. Really wide ranging talk which covered a lot of Argentine history along the way - thoroughly enjoyable - and her English is very good too!!

City walk. A nice stroll through one of the major streets of the city, made far more interesting by hearing the background and small insights that Juan Cruz told whilst constantly holding his speakers up! Very nicely done!

I love it!!!. I took the tour with Martin, he was great! He was clear, concise and fun .I usually go to many tours around the city, i live en Bs.As, and it was the best of all!!! Thank you Martin!!! Really nice to meet you...

Great walk from Teartre Colon to Recoleta. We took this 10:30 am walking tour on 23/2 with Dolores. Despite the hot and humid summer day, the excellent naration of the colourful histories of the neighbour hoods by Dolores keeps us going!

A Wonderful Introduction to Buenos Aires!. Today, our guide, Martin, met us promptly at 3:00 o'clock today and, despite the sun and very warm weather, the group of 36 (my husband counted) never flagged in their focus on the stories and descriptions given by our passionate, articulate, and erudite guide. Our trip began at the Congressional Building and ended at the Pink Palace and along the way we learned about the history, culture, finances (incredible tales of monetary inflation), music, and fierce independence of the people of Buenos Aires. Martin is a talent, condensing so much information into an enjoyable and easily digestible almost 3 hour tour. Bravo!!!

Excellent. Excellent walking tours! We took both morning and afternoon tour and I can recommend to everyone! It was funny, informative and interesting. Especially the tours with Maru and Ivan. Muchas gracias! Lujza&Oscar

Great way of sampling Buenos Aires. Took the 10:30 tour with Dolores. Even though it was hot, this was a very enjoyable tour. At each stop Dolores' commentary was very interesting and informative. Dolores made sure we were in the shade whenever we stopped. There is no formal charge at the beginning of the tour but there is an expectation of a tip based on your valuation of the worth of the tour.

city tour. Great walking tour, very interesting, giving a quick history of the city and ArgentinaContinued with daily life, customs, why and how of the city and it's people and their lives. Guide was Fernando excellent.

Great way to get to know the city. We did the 10:30 AM Recoleta tour with Franco and the 3 PM City Center tour with Juan Cruz in one day. We found the tours to be very enjoyable and a great way to get us orientated to the city and learn about the culture and history of the city. Both guides used a microphone which really helped bc the groups were large and some of the streets can be very noisy. They also tried to stop and talk in the shade when possible as we did the tour on a very hot day. Both tours were about 3 hrs and covered a decent amount of ground so wear comfortable shoes. Franco brought his guitar along on the tour and we really enjoyed his music at our stops! He was a great guide and very friendly. We also enjoyed the rest stop at the little empanada restaurant near Plaza San Martin. Juan Cruz was also a great guide and did a wonderful job of pointing out various architectural details throughout our walk. I also enjoyed his talk at the end when he described some of the political situation in Argentina and went through some of the changes to the currency. These guys are great. Be sure to bring cash to tip the guides at the end. Well worth it!!

Great tour with lots of political views. Great tour with Martin today. About 3 hours it total, with Martin keeping us in the shadow, out of the sun, the best he could.Amazing insight into the history of Argentine, critisism on the regimes that have tarnished basic rights of the people for freedom - and left the economy shattered. Martin canditly aired his strong political views, rigtly criticising the recent regimes.Only remark is on Martins last comment on how we should comment on TripAdvisor! Dont worry Martin, the tour was great, so trust me - the reviews will also be great. Your guidance on our opinion is not needed. Just trust us, the people...

Great Introduction to BA!. We went on the afternoon city center tour with Dolores. Great experience... Our tour guide was extremely informative with great insights into the history and politics of Buenos Aires. We would definitely recommend this to anyone who is visiting Buenos Aires for the first time.

Both tours in one day!. We went to both tours (morning and afternoon) with Mariano and Loli respectively. It was a great way to see the city and learn more about it. We enjoyed it a lot! Both guides know their city and they were funny too! Which it's great when you're walking so much (not really, you can't even feel the blocks when you're absorbing the beauty of this city!)Totally recommended. We would do it again!
Best tour!!. Martin was the best guide I ever had. Im a native of BA and I felt proud this represents my city. Tip based, honest and unfiltered.
Great guide Martín. This guy knows everything about Buenos Aires, its history, matters, political and social skins of Argentina. Recomend the tour and Martín as a guide.

Interesting tours by well informed guides.. We took both the morning tour & the afternoon city tour. Both were informative and interesting. They are quite long (on average 3 hours), so be prepared. The tours gave us good insight into the past and present history and political climate of BA. Definitely recommend it when you are in BA. I would like to add that these guides do this on tip basis only. If you do go on the tour then don't be cheap when it comes to tip time. This is a third world country with a very unstable economy. So really think about how much is fair to give and consider what you would like to be paid if you had just spent three hours guiding a whole group.
Great information. Juan Cruz was a very informative and interesting guide with great knowledge of the architecture of Buenos Aires.

Highly recommend. I went for both: morning and afternoon. This is the best way to get introduced to the city in my opinion. The morning tour with Martin was simply brilliant: super informative, passionate and knowledgable. He also gave us mullion different extra tips on where to go and what to do, so you are pretty much sorted with activities for the whole stay
Great content, massive group. We had about 50 people in this your on a tuesday afternoon. Good content, but way too many people they should have at least 2 more english guides
With Martin: a must!. With humor, a nice walk in the streets of Buenos Aires. Interesting facts to know, far from the official picture you can get al museo bicentenario...

Great way to get to know Buenos Aires and understand its history. I took the morning tour (in Spanish - in order to practice) and we had Janet (I hope I write this correct, if not apologies) as a fantastic and enthousiastic guideshe shared a fantastic mix of socio-historical and cultural facts with tips for a great evening out (in order to find out yourself take the tour)In the afternoon I also took the other tour, with Javier as a guide who again did a magnificent job, which is a good addition while both tours are very compatible

Fantastic!!!. We were part of the English group, a large group that could have been split into two. Nevertheless our guide Loli was excellent, so knowledgable and enterntaining. It is the best way to get to know about a city by having a local passionate tour guide. We will do the afternoon tour too, todays experience was well worth it!

Excellent tour!!!. Our tour was absolutely fantastic! The guide was so knowledgeable and extremely well prepared and able to answer all our questions. We did the morning walk through Recoleta and it actually went so long that we didn't have time to get to the start of the afternoon tour. We were part of an exceptionally large group so it probably took longer than normal. The large group size also meant it was hard to hear the guide at times. We were part of the English speaking group and there was so many people there that it easily could have been split into two groups. All in all an absolutely fabulous tour
Fantastic tour. The guide, Martin, was excellent and presented the different parts of Ricoleta very good. The final story about Eva Peron was fantastic.

Great!. A really good way to see the city and learn more about its history. Our guide María was terrific and seemed to know everything there is to know about Buenos Aires. Would highly recommend doing the tour with her!

Excellent introduction. We had been in BA a few days and had been around bait, including some tours. This one covered a lot of ground and gave a very good background for the city from true portenos. Highly recommend this to someone who wants to get a flavor of the city.

A free tour for visiting the city!. I did this tour with a friend some days ago and this is a really useful service, the guide mariano was really good and played guitar with typical music too. It's a free way to see the city and an excellent way to know people from all the world!
Martin was a perfect guide!. Very informative, clear explanations, witty humour and great English: Martin was indeed the perfect guide. Highly recommended.
Great!. Great tour!! I had learned a lot of history and interesting details of the city with great guide called Martin!Totally recommended!

Juan Cruis was an amazing guide!. I always take free walking tours wherever I go and this one was one of the best! We took the afternoon tour from the congress to the pink palace and we learnt a lot. Our guide Juan Cruis was really knowledgeable and fun at the same time.

Such a great way to see the city. We did the morning tour during our recent trip to BA and really enjoyed this experience. The guide was knowledgeable about everything and his English was perfect. It was such a neat way to experience the city and meet other travellers. Highly recommend the morning tour!

Maybe we got unlucky with our guide. For me this walk was uninspiring and I spent much of the time trying to work out an exit strategy. Maybe we had a poor guide, there was not much value added from the guide who simply pointed out they style of the architecture we were passing without any historical background of the city or anecdotes. I could have easily walked the same route myself and would probably have enjoyed it more. (Nonetheless please remember to tip the guide for their time).

Martin was a great tour guide. We had a wonderful and an informative experience on the tour. The tourguide did a good job keeping us in the shade and moving a fairly large group along. I also liked that Martin was sharing personal experiences. That made the tour more memorable.

Two great tours, 4 months apart. Free Walking Tours is great! I took their tour when I first moved to Buenos Aires in September 2015, and then again at the end of January when my best friend came to visit. My friend doesn't speak any Spanish, and the English tour was perfect for her. It's a long tour (about 3 hours), but you're welcome to leave at any time throughout the tour. Their very friendly and knowledgable about the city and the history of the country. Definitely recommend!

Fabulous morning tour with Martin. Martin Wasserman was a very passionate and informative guide and an intro to many things Argentinian during the 3-4 hr walking tour through the city to Recoleta. The city is complex and immense, and he really made a difference in bringing the info to life so do try and catch his tour if you can! (I took another walking tour in the afternoon covering the city center and unfortunately, was horribly disappointed by a different guide who not only didn't know his stuff, but repeated jokes). Thanks Martin!

interesting tour. I saw a few free walks in the city online and wasn't sure which one to choose. I went on this one due to the time of day (I did the 10.30 tour) and not needing to sign up in advance. The tour was great not staying too long in one place but enough info that if you had time you could go back to the place and find out more. The guide spoke great english and serenaded us with a few songs on the guitar along the way. I wanted to do the 3pm tour too on the same day however I didn't have time to get something to eat for lunch and get across town to the start point by 3pm. The first tour stopped where there was a craft market on saturday so I wanted time to look around the market before I tried to head for the second tour and I just didn't have time and no other days in Buenos Aires.

Great walk. Did the afternoon tour with Franko on Sunday. It was perfect. Franko is the singing guide, which was fun, even better he has a microphone so we could hear every word. He was also very considerate and made sure we were in the shade when we stopped to listen to him, and we could see what he was talking about. Good information too. Thank you

Martin and Juan Cruz gave great tours. We took a morning tour with Martin and an afternoon tour with Juan Cruz. Both were excellent. Each gave a great deal of information about the area being covered, and each spoke impressive English. The morning tour covered more the city center, the afternoon tour the more expensive district to the north. I recommend taking both tours, they do not overlap areas. Great job, Martin and Juan Cruz.

Fantastic tour guide. With only 3 days on BA we decided to take the morning tour with Franco, the singing guide. He was fantastic, knowledgable and friendly. The next day we took the afternoon one. Greatly surprised to see Franco was our guide again. I would recommend these tours as they are fun, well informed and give a brief history of BA. Sufficient info to take on on a walking tour, without being overloaded.

Good choice. Throughly enjoyed the Free Walks tour. Our guide was very knowledgeable and pleasant. Appreciated the "stop " at Starbucks . It was. 4 hour tour. Definitely a must upon arrival in Buenos Aires. Gives you a good feel for the city and history. I highly recommend this tour .

Recommend going on a Sat or Sun not during weekdays. After reading others reviews I must have had a dud guide or a dud day. I had high expectations of doing a walking tour in BA after having done at least 30 walking tours world wide. The guide contextualized everything we were looking at really poorly. In fact half the time myself, my friend and the group just look bewildered and had no idea at the actual Bulding or piece of street art he was talking about most of the time.I did feel sorry for him as it was a big how up of over 30 people and whilst he had a microphone and sound box he was constantly drowned out by the noise of cars etc on the main streets. I lost interest in the first 1.5 hours as it was difficult to understand him and also hear him. Others in the group did too.I would purely recommend people attend this on a Saturday or Sunday as this part of the city is almost a ghost town so it will be easy to see and hear what is going on. My feed back to the company would be to restructure the tour and content to be out of the way of the major traffic. It just doesn't work. Even potentially have a folder of pictures of the buildings and talk about them in quieter side streets and plazas and then walk past them so people can see them in real life. Limit the group sizes to no more than 20 on a week day and / or come up with a good audio solution for people eg blue tooth transmitter so people can use their smart phone to hook into a blue tooth channel and use their headphones to listen ...

Really Awesome Guides!!!. The Recoleta and City tours were wonderful because they provided us with the history of the country and the evolution of its politics, architecture, and economy. Both guides were incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about their city. This was my first trip to BA and I was amazed by the confusing architecture. French architecture followed by a crumbling eye sore and then followed by an Italian inspired building. They helped me to understand and appreciate it - thank you, especially Juan Cruz, you were awesome.

Good Walk - great guides!. I took the morning tour with Mariano (cultural tour) and the next day I took the afternoon tour with Franko (historical) the singing guide. As "portenios" (people living in Buenos Aires), both men were great ambassadors of their city and very knowledgable, although they made it fun and interesting.

Great introduction to the city. Interesting walk around part of this beautiful city. Would highly recommend to any visitors wanting to know more about the historical as well as current features of Buenos Aires.

Wonderful Free Tour with Great Guide!. We decided to tag along to this free walking tour on our first full day in Buenos Aires and let me tell you, it was not a disappointment! Our guide who's name escapes me, was really knowledgeable about the city having been born and raised in Buenos Aires. He was also super funny and didn't drag out the history for too long like on many other tours, so you could pay attention and not be bored. The tour took us about 4 hours to complete but there was plenty of time to stop for water and/or snack and to take photos and the guide always made sure to stop in the shade. This is a great way to see the city as you're under no obligation to remain with the tour for the duration and you can decide at the end to tip or not to tip. It was really nice to be able to meet people from all over and I would definitely recommend this tour to anybody travelling to Buenos Aires, especially those on a small budget.

Great walk. Franko was our guide from the national congress down avenue de Mayo to the Cassa Rosa. He was very knowledgable and sang some songs too, what's not to like ! Free but a large group (60?), we tipped of course but would have been happy to pay and have a smaller group.

Very interesting and a great introduction to the city. We covered a lot during this tour and it was a great way to see some wonderful buildings and learn about the history of the city Martin was a very interesting guide and although the tour was quite long it was paced well enough for us to keep up. It was well worth taking. We asked Martin to recommend a place for us to have lunch after the tour and his recommendation was excellent - a local moderately priced restaurant with great food.

Best free walking tour I have done!. We did this tour on Christmas eve with Fernando as our awesome tour guide! He was extreemly knowledgeable and entertaining and we learned a great deal from him during this enoyable tour. At the end of the tour Fernando stayed around and chatted with us for another hour giving us tips and suggestions for our time in BsAs and Argentina! Very good tour and highly recommended!

Free Walk in Buenos Aires. This tour was advertised at our hostel. Our guide was called Martin, he was so knowledgeable and made the whole tour so interesting. He gave us facts and details that would have possibly been missed if you just read a brochure.
highly recommended. Our quide Martin told us many interesting facts not only about the architecture and monuments we've been visiting, but a lot of history and facts about ordinary life in Argentina.

Definitely worth it . The experience rely on which person is carrying the tour (which were very pleasant in both tours I took), but the overall sightseeing of different parts of the city is definitely worth it. You'll get to see different architecture styles, monuments and historical facts from Buenos Aires and Argentina. As for the tipping range, I'd recommend something between US$ 5 and 10 (per person, if you're not alone), or the equivalent in ARG$.

Very informative and enjoyable intro to BA. After arriving early AM and checking into our hotel, we did this walking tour. Nice size group of about 20-25 people...about average says the guide, but he has had as many as 70-80. Our guide spoke very good English and gave us a wonderful overview of not only the history and politics of Argentina, but also of BA including it's interesting architecture. This was our first visit to BA and doing this tour from the start gave us the intro needed to explore further on our own. The tour lasted about 4.5 hours, including a brief stop at a cafe for a snack/beverage. Our guide earned a nice tip afterwards.

Juan Cruses was an incredible guide. I did the 3:00pm tour and was so impressed with the guide. He is a designer and really brought the tour to life with his commentary on the history and architecture of the city. He pointed out details on buildings I never would have noticed, He is passionate about his guiding and his city. This tour was great and I learned so much.

Very good information but think the political views were a little biased?!. We had a very large group on the morning of 31st Dec 2015. A little too many people! However, good information and a good walk. Liked the tip that all 100 peso bills are not legal so watch out for the fakes! Our guide was very passionate about politics but when it came to the Falklands War, his information was not correct! He needs to read up the proper facts about legal discovery, the Pope's decree, French occupation, Argentina's short stay ending in abandonment in 1811 etc. Britain has governed continually since 1833. However, they actually tried to give the islands to Argentina twice in the previous ten years.... and his comment about Maggie Thatcher was totally wrong.... she cannot be equally compared to an Argentinian dictator. They need to get their facts correct if you are going to share them as gospel truth!! We gave a good tip but would liked to have given him a history book!

Passionate guide!. The morning tour was fantastic, starting at teatro colon and making our way across the city through parks monuments palaces important buildings with snippets of history politics and economic woes along the way, finishing in recoleta cemetry about 3.5hours later. Martin is a very enthusiastic passionate guide. I would highly recommend.

Great way to learn about the City. We learnt about these on Tripadvisor, and have to say it was one of the best guided tours we have been on. Paid guides too often just go through the motions. In this case our guide was incredibly enthusiastic and deserved the tips he received from everyone at the end.

Excellent. What an excellent way to learn about this great city and to get some exercise at the same time. Ours was a very large group but our guide held most people's attention for almost four hours. He told us much of the history of the city and pointed out a plethora of the main sights. We were not hurried, but neither did we daudle. A great all round experience. I hope everyone rewarded him in a well deserved way.
Walking tour. Fernando was an excellent guide he made it so much more interesting than walking around on your own, adding stories & observations you can't get from a guide book!

Amazing!. One of the best free walking tours I've ever been to! Martin is such a wonderful tour guide! He knows a lot of things about the history of the city, speaks about it with a passion, is very helpful and open. Thank you so much for such a wonderful experience!

Great walking tour - from Teatro Colon to Ricoleta.. Martin was the best tour guide ever: knowledgeable, funny, and very informative. Beyond history and architecture we learned a lot about current trends and developments with the city and Argentina in general, with a big dose of politics of the past and present... Getting a quick lesson about counterfeit pesos was also helpful, to say the least, esp. considering our own experience with the crooked BA cab drivers. You'll walk a lot, but then you'll rest and enjoy the best ice cream at Persicco near Ricoleta cemetery where tour ends with a ton of advice from Martin about food, tango lessons, underground restaurants and speakeasies, etc. Thank you, Martin.

Group was too big!. We had a free walking tour with the founder of Free Walks in Buenos Aires on January, 4th. The group was just too big with more than 60 people (!!!!) so we ended up waiting on every traffic light for the missing people. Luckily our guide was using a microfone with loudspeaker so at least we were able to understand his explanations. We expected to get a bit more insights of BA by a local guide but with such a big group you were not able to ask too many questions. He should definitly try to find additional guides to split up into smaller and more personalized groups.

Prepare to walk a lot. Personally I find the tour too long because it starts from 1030 or 11 (cannot remember) to about 2-3pm (depending on situation and pace). The tour itself covers many area of interest and the tour guide speaks with passion. However, please ensure you have a good breakfast although there is a 15 min break in btw at a designated cafe. But you will be hungry. You will walk almost 100 blocks across many streets. Just be prepared.

Martin the guide was amazing. best walking tour in south america. martin was very very easy to listen to. Great and informative walking tour without all those useless information.
We've been travelling through South America for 2 month and went to 7 free walking tours and this one was the best by far. Would recommend it to anyone.
Was more then happy to tip a good amount!

The first thing I did when I got to Buenos Aires. After a 24 hour flight and about 8 hours of rest, I did the morning tour and two days later the afternoon tour. In both cases Martin, a native of Buenos Aires, was our guide. His English is very good and his stories great. I would definitively do the tour. I have done these types of tours all around the world; this is one of the better ones around, and they are all good,.My only recommendation is to possibly split the English group into two. We were 50+ people and fir example crossing streets is not easy with such a large group. I know you do not know how many people o expect but there must be some kind if trend ... They split groups in Sydney, Stockholm, Edinborough etc. But all in all a great job, so full marks!

Great walking tour. We did (on separate days) the afternoon/city center tour and the morning/Recoleta tour. Both were fun and informative. We have done several free walking tours and these are among the best. Highly recommend.

Best Walking Tour EVER!. This was, by far, the best walking tour I ever did. Our guide, Martín Wasserman, was very funny and had all the historic details every tourist wants to know. He even takes a picture with the whole group at the end of the tour. I did the morning tour, by the way. If you ever in town, please make sure to do all your walking tours with him. :)
Great tours!. Both, the morning and afternoon tour can be recommended and give a good overview of the city. Well-informed, funny guides!

Our first walking tour. This was the first free walking tour that we ever did, and our guide Juan Carlos did not disappoint. As he was a architect student, he gave us a look at the city from that perspective . At the end of the tour he addressed the group to advise us that this was a free walking tour, but he does work on tips. He said that he knows that some people in our group were on budgets and some were not, so tip accordingly. We thought he handled this topic very diplomatically.

Free walking tour . Lovely free walking tour of the city! I did the morning (10:30 am) tour, which lasted quite a while- until 2:30-3:00, with a bathroom/quick snack stop at a Starbucks. We were also serenaded by our guide, Franco, on his guitar, during the tour!!
Free Walk Afternoon Tour. Very knowledeable guide with nice backgrounds in the City and argentinian lifeDefinitely more than worth giving a good tip

Free Walking Tour. Ever since I came back from an amazing trip in Europe early this year in which I got to know marvelous cities through Sandeman's Free Walking Tours, I had the obsession to find something similar in my lovely Buenos Aires. I found that with beautiful awkward Loli during her Recoleta Walking Tour. She was amazing throughout the tour, readily receptive to questions and never imposing towards the many points of view that this incredible country may home in politics, economics or football. Loved her and her awkwardness.Don't miss the opportunity to get to know the history behind this amazing part of Buenos Aires. And do it early on your visit because you'll get the tips to make the most out of your, I guarantee, little time in the city.

Excellent walking tour, don't miss it!. I went on both of the free tours they offer - of the historical congressional area & Recoleta, both were great! Both of the guides were wonderful, and did a great job incorporating the fascinating Argentinian history into the tour. Warning: These tours are fairly long (2.5-4 hours, depending), and aren't lying about the walking part. It was pretty hot when we went, but the guides were great to give us plenty of time to get water, rest, etc. Definitely don't miss it!

Definitely Recommend these tours. I did the afternoon tour with my fiancé and our friend that has been living in BA for about 8 months. We loved it so much we also did the morning tour a few days later. Highly recommend the tours. The guides were incredibly informative not only about BA's history but its current cultural behaviours. Martine was pretty entertaining as well. Bring good shoes and some suntan lotion and you will not be disappointed.

Loved the BsAs free walking tour!. I took both the morning Recoleta and the afternoon City Center walking tours today. Together it was a long day, but my time here is limited and it was so worth it! The morning tour is longer, but there are frequent stops to hear about what you are seeing and even a stop for a snack and a bathroom break. The afternoon tour with Martin was especially interesting with all of the political and economic changes happening in Argentina. It was a wonderful opportunity to hear the perspective of a real Porteno. I highly recommend both tours to enhance your visit to Argentina.

Informative and fun!. After being in BA for about a week, I decided that it was finally time to learn a bit more about the history of the city. I had the pleasure of attending the morning tour with a small group (we started out as 8 and ended up as 4) and a wonderful tour guide, Chanel. Chanel was very easygoing and had a natural energy that made the tour fun while also very informative. I would highly recommend that you spend some time on the tour, as it's a great way to learn about the city and pick the brains of a local!
Great walking tour!!. Martin Wasserman is the best guide!! He is so detailed, and very patient dealing with many questions

An excellent tour. Our guide, Dolores, was very informative, often very friendly, and coped very well with a lot of questions. because there were a lot of questions the tour over-ran, and after 3.5 hours I had to leave to go to the airport, so I missed the very last stop, but despite the long time it never dragged and I learned a huge amount.She approached the issue of the South Atlantic War very sensitively, and was especially informative about the reasons for the blue market If you want to learn about Argentinian society and culture as well as the buildings then this is the tour for you

Perfect way to learn more about The city!. I went with The 3.00 pm tour, The guide was really good. Very informative and lots of fun facts. Great advices in general how The city and The country Works. You could tell that he enjoyed his job. Most important, he never spoke more than a few minutes at every stop, and then he let us be interactive.

Martín Magnifico!. Starting your trip in Buenos Aires with the freewalking tour is a great option! especially with Martín, he managed to entertain, inform and interact with us at a great level. He does his job with a lot of enthousiasm and humor! He also gave us some tips where to go and what to do!!!

Absolutely magnificent!. As a tour guide by trade in Washington, DC, I can say we are the hardest critics of each other professionally in areas and nuances that the average tourist might not notice. I can whole heartedly endorse this tour in terms of info, engagement, safety, relevance, time management, and orientation. I did the half day afternoon tour with Martin and the half day morning tour with Franco. Both had different styles but were equally captivating, relevant, and entertaining! If I could give 10 stars, I would. Breaking up the tour over 2 days was a good idea so my body would have a chance to recuperate and process the experience. Please "run to then take the walking tour" with Buenos Aires Free Walks.

Perfect way to start a trip. I started doing the Walking Tour that starts at Teatro Colon and I enjoyed that tour so much I did the second tour the next day. The history and information you get on both the tours gives you a great introduction and background to the city and helps give context to everything else you might see/experience on your trip. I cannot recommend it highly enough. It is definitely a lot of walking so tennis shoes are best.

Great tours to learn about the city (and the portenos). With so many free (or pay what you want) tours to choose from, we had a hard time deciding which one to take. Their very similar names did not help either. (Come on guys, be more creative with your names and make yours stand out!)We ended up with Fernando in the morning, and was so impressed that we returned a few days later for an afternoon tour with Martin. There were a dozen or so in our English speaking tours. To cover the areas and the topics, the walks were brisk, and the delivery was rapid fire. They had good command on English, but sometimes I could not catch everything they said when their accent and speed got in the way.These guys were knowledgeable, passionate, sometimes funny and opionated about Argentina and Buenos Aires. Not only did we learn quite a few things about the Country and the City, we also had a glimpse into the psych of portenos like them.They both seemed to share:- Disdain for the wealthy founding families of BA, in particular their bad taste in art and architecture.- Appreciation for Eva Peron's reaching out to the underprivileged.- Frustration (even dispair) about their government's ineptitude in handling the economy.These guides were not compensated by their company, and only earned from their tips. Treat them well. They are far better deals than those tours that charge $$$USD.

Martin was awesome. - Unique perspective from a local about the city's history, culture and politics
- Mixed with a bit architecture tour
- Fun, personable, caring and attentive to details (waiting for the long light to make sure the entire group can cross safely, etc)

Excellent tours!. Did the afternoon tour of the city on our first day and it was really useful to get orientated to the city and get some background. Our guide Dolores did a great job despite the protests / celebrations through the streets. The tour was so good that we did the morning tour of Recoleta the day after with Martín which was even more impressive because of his insights into the political / economic situation in Argentina which gave some great context for the rest of our stay. Would definitely recommend to anyone travelling to Buenos Aires.

Walking thru Time in Buenos Aires with Dolores. I had the opportunity to take my second Buenos Aires Free Walk with Dolores starting at the Congress all the way to Plaza de Mayo, a walk through history, architecture and life in BA. Dolores was able to not only share history but her personal perspective as a Porteno (native of Buenos Aires). She was excellent and the tour was well worth it. I highly recommend it!

You should really do this your first day in Buenos Aires. 10:30 AM. I am a fan of city walking tours and this is an excellent one. I did it the day after I arrived and it not only gave me my bearings, it also was a great local introduction to the culture, history and even dialect of Buenos Aires. You can do this walk in English or Spanish. I chose Spanish because the group was smaller and actually learned a lot just about some differences in Argentinian Spanish vs Spanish Spanish or Mexican Spanish. The tours go on for like 3 hours and they are free though you tip at the end. And you really should tip because your guide is working his/her tail off to tell you all about their city. I also recommend this because I found out about so many places to go during the tour that I saved for later. This was one of my favorite activities I did while I was in BA. I highly recommend. So educational, cultural and fun! Also good exercise and a great way to get to know the city. Enjoy!

Great way to start the day. Free walks are a great way to get familiar with any city and this one in BA was one of the best ones I did so far.Our morning guide (Martin) was so fun and informative that we decided immediately to come back for the afternoon "session" as well.Both tours were very nice, with a lot of "insider tips" about the city from the locals who know the place and love it and do a very good job in spreading that love to the visitors as well.

Fantastic knowledge. Martin was really an exceptional guide, showing us the great sights that the city of BA has to offer. His knowledge of politics, economics and history was quite remarkable, and all delivered without a script. It is simply the best tour I have been on, anywhere in the world. During a five day stay in Argentina, it was the real highlight. You must take this tour when in the city!

Everything you need to see in the city center. This tour takes you to all the important sites in the city center. Our guide was very insightful and suggested what other places we should visit. He also mentioned what sites had their on tour and if they were worth it. The 3 hour walk was very pleasant and the guide made an effort to stop in shady places as it was a very hot day. I would definitely recommend this tour to someone who hasn't been to Buenos Aires and wants a general overview.

Great tour. Did both the morning tour and the afternoon tour which is a great way to jump into BA. Martin, our morning guide was exceptional and very passionate about his city.First time we've done free walking tours and based in this experience, we'll do it again.Just a suggestion, these guides only make money if you tip. Australians don't really tip so we never know what's an appropriate amount, but most people gave between 100 and 200 pesos. I gave a bit more because I figure that a 3 1/2 hr tour anywhere in the world will cost USD 40 + and these guides were worth it. Just be respectful and tip something, I was saddened to see people not pay anything at all.That aside, you'll definitely enjoy the experience.

Very interesting. Even though we were a huge group, we enjoyed the tour a lot. Martin told us a lot of very informative, interesting and funny stuff and the tour was better than most paid city tours I've done so far.

Interesting, enjoyable, knowledgeable guide. Juan Cruz was our guide for the afternoon tour of the Microcentre and we enjoyed the tour so much. Starting at the National Congress and down the main avenue until the Pink government house, we passed by many important landmarks. Juan explained to us their architectural, historical, social and political significance, and gave us more background about Buenos Aires society in general. He was super friendly, humourous, and full of useful tips about the city. We were a big group but he had a microphone so we could hear him fine. Great introduction to BA, highly recommended - thanks, Juan!

Great tour. We were able to take 10:30 AM and 3:00 PM tours. Both tours were excellent and the tour guides were knowledgable and informative. We would recommend it to anyone traveling to Buenos Aires.

Really informative and worthwhile. Did the morning walking tour through Recoletta etc finishing at Recolletta cemetery with Martin - huge group >60 which was a nuisance as there were some slow walkers so the tour took quite a bit longer. Martin however was very informative, not short of political comments and kept it interesting.Juan Guiz did the afternoon walk which was more socio-political, similar very large group but not quite as interesting. Maybe we were tired after the morning walk and jet lagged from arriving from Australia only yesterday.Very worthwhile introductions to BA

Worth doing but big group. I would definitely recommend this. We did the recoleta tour. We learnt loads. The group was about 50 people which meant the walk took 4 rather than 5 hours. The lunch stop wasn't great as there was only 1 option but we still really enjoyed it. Take water! :)

Very good...but very busy!. Our group was huge!! Probably at least 50 people to one guide. Although the guide tried his best, there were times when you couldn't hear everything and getting around places was a bit cumbersome. Nevertheless, the guide was excellent and had a lot to say about the area. Would recommend.

Best way to start your visit to the city. Do this as soon as possible after you get to BA. I did the morning tour which takes in a lot of the microcentre including Recoleta Cemetery. Really interesting and helps give you a navigation sense of the city.

Great Private Group tour of Recoleta Cemetary. We booked a private guided group tour for 14 pax to visit Recoleta Cemetary. We are very glad and fortunate to have Mariano from BAFW as our guide, Mariano made the session very lively, gave detailed explanations on history, social, and architecture about the cemetery, and told great anecdotes about personalities who were significant to the cemetery. Thanks Mariano, for the wonderful walkabouts in one of the most beautiful cemeteries in the world.

Amazing!. We did the 10:30am tour and had Loli as our guide. She was knowledgeable, fun, and really loved Buenos Aires. She gave us some great tips for exploring the city that we wouldnt have been able to find out ourselves. Buenos Aires is an amazing city and is even better when seen with a local's experience.

Depends on the guide. I was in both free tours: from 10.30 in Retiro and Recoleto with Fernando and from 15.00 in Av. De Mayo with another guide (I don't remember his name). I have done walking tours in many cities so I can compare guides. Fernando was very interesting guide, he really loves what he is doing, he can keep attention of the group for several hours walking around many streets of the center. He takes care about his group, try to find shadow on the hot day or the place, where people can sit and have a rest listening of his stories.
