Fernando knows a lot about Buenos Aires, Argentina and can answer to all questions. Another guide knows about his city and country too, but he can't tell these knowledges to others interesting. He do it very monotonically and quite boring. It was very hard to keep attention standing under the hot sun for a few hours.
Good Overview of Central Buenos Aires. A good overview of central Buenos Aires. Guide spoke excellent English and was very knowledgeable. I would recommend to first time visitors to Buenos Aires.

Take the free tour! . We loved the tour so much that we ended up squeezing in time for a second one of a different area during our stay. It was informative, interactive and entertaining. This is a "must do" if you are of good health. Loved it more than any of our paid tours. The start times are pretty on point but the guides will typically wait ten minutes or so before taking off. We visited during a less busy time of the year so our group was never more than five people. Tours are about 2-5 miles depending on your selection.

Group too large, boring guide. I've done walking tours in over 50 cities and this one was really disappointing. We took the 10:30 am tour with Fernando; there were 55 people so it was really hard to be close enough to the guide to hear anything. Plus, Fernando speaks extremely quickly and his accent is really thick. If you're not concentrating, it's too difficult to understand him. We usually love walking tours, but this one was super boring. The next day, we did a tour (two actually) with the other free walking tour company and it was really interesting and fun!!

Ok walking tour, group too large. We went on the walking tour of the historical center with the plan to do the walk around Recoletta with the group the following day as well. We like doing walks of different parts of the city with the same tour company as they usually plan effectively so information is not repeated (too much) from one tour to the other. Not so for this company - we found most of the information was the same on both tours so I would suggest only going on 1 tour with this company. Also our group size was over 40 people. 40! Some people gave up since it was very difficult to hear everything, so that by the end of the tour we were down to just over 30. Still too big. Wish we had tried one of the other companies since I expect they would be smaller groups.
Great overview . Dolores ('Loli') gave us an informative, entertaining, challenging, insightful look into the history architecture and politics of Buenos Aires. Highly recommended.

One of the best free walking tours!. During our travels in South America we did a few "free walking tours" and this one was definitely one of the best tours! We did the morning walking tour with Fernando and it was great! Fernando explained a lot about the city and the different places we visited and you could tellthat he really likes "his" city. He knew a lot about the city and had so many facts and stories to tell us about Buenos Aires. The tour was around 4 hours which is more than the tours we did in other cities but Bueos Aires is so big and the length and route of the tour was perfect to get a feeling about this great city. The place where we had a lunch break was great and the food there was so delicious!We had a great time and would definitely recommend to do this tour - if you're lucky you get Fernando as a guide!

Knowledgable guide and tour. I enjoy walking tours of cities as they are usually informative and interesting and you get to see some of the main sights in the city. This was no exception. The guide was knowledgable and kept it entertaining. It was a warm day when we did it and people were tired by the end but almost everyone stayed to the end which tells you they were still enjoying it. I would recommend it to those looking to get a better understanding into Buenos Aires.

Really good . This is one of the better walking tours I've been on. They have two options, a morning and an afternoon, and j recommend you do both options. The guides really know their stuff but they also make the tours fun as well as informative!

Excellent tour with great guide. Martin really took us on a great walk through the Argentinian history and the storytelling was captivating. He gave us information about the city and things to do keeping us interested throughout the walk.
Just excellent. Very knowledgeable guide. Provides very complete information covering architectural and economical aspects. A not to miss opportunity to get better insight in this city

Great tour. Don't miss it.. I did the City Centre Tour with Martin. I'm from Argentina, and after experiencing several walking tours around the world, I wanted to see what my city had to offer. I was mind blown by how much I had missed all this years living in BA. And the guide gave very deep and accurate detail of why Buenos Aires is the way it is, and why we the locals are the way we are.

Excellent Guides. We are experienced travelers, we are on our first trip to BA. We typically like to explore on our own, but we thought getting some local insight on our first day might be a good way to get a better feel for the city. We turned up for the afternoon tour and had such a good experience we did the Recoleta tour this morning.The guides for both were exceptional. Mariano and his team clearly share a passion for their city. As they share stories at each stop along the way, they give you a great feel for the pulse of the city and the popular opinions of its people.We learned a lot, and really appreciated the dry sense of humour our guides provided. If you are okay putting a file miles on your sneakers you don't want to miss this one.

One the the best walking tours, ever . I have been to numerous walking tours around Europe, and this one is clearly inspired by them. However, our guide Martin delivered a performance way better than any other walking tour I've ever been to on both the morning and the afternoon tour. The morning (Recoleta) tour is a bit more about sightseeing, but gives a great insight to Argentina's current situation and near history. The evening tour is more about politics and social issues, which I thought to be even more interesting. I highly recommend both of these tours, just don't do them on the same day as there's A LOT you'll learn.

Great way to see Buenos Aires. We did the morning tour of Recolata. A great and fun way to see Buenos Aires and learn more about the country and the city. Very knowledgeable and honest guide (thanks for the additional cemetery tour!). Totally recommended!

A great tour to start your trip. Yesterday we did the Recoleta tour which was interesting, a good length and informative. It took us from the Colon theatre through Recoleta to end up at the cemetery. I would definitely recommend it especially to get your bearings of the area. We liked it so much we are going to do the central tour today!

Great way to discover Buenos Aires. Those Free Tours are amazing to discover the city, to know more about the history of Argentina, and the actual happenings in the countryI did the morning one and the afternoon one, both are worth the walk! The guides are full of energy (if you go for the micro center one, Maru will keep you wide awake the whole tour and drench your thirst of all types of knowledges!!) and they give loads of tips and advices!Don't miss the free tours !!

Worth the Walk. A great way to see BA. Martin was a well informed, well spoken and highly entertaining guide. I understand a whole lot more about the history of Argentina now. Martin was also helpful regarding other places to visit in Argentina. The guide is paid by tips from those in the group.

San Telmo tour. Today was first day of San Telmo tour. Although is not free it is very cheap and was run by Mariano. I first took free tour of Ricoleta two days later tour of downtown and today San Telmo. I could walk in San Telmo for a year and never learn that much. You have to live in the city to understand it so well. Also Mariano has great sense of humor and is very knowledgeable. Thanks

Amazing BA City Tour!. This tour was amazing! I did this tour on the second day of my trip to get a better idea of the city - and it worked! The guide was incredibly informative on the culture and the history of the city. He was able to bring the city to life and really help our group to understand how the city came to be what it is today. He even recommended an AMAZING tango show for the evening. I would highly, highly recommend! Thank you!!
Excellent tour. Must do. . This is an awesome tour to learn a lot about ba. Our guide Marien (or something like that ) knows very much about the city. Cementario de recoleta is very impressive.
Amazing!. Really great walking tour!!! Guides are interesting, entertaining and very knowledgeable. I would highly recommend to anyone visiting Buenos Aires!!

An informative and fun walking tour with Martin!. Our tour guide, Martin, was the most knowledgeable, funny, and honest tour guide we have ever encountered. Martin did a great job explaining the culture, government, and economy of Argentina. He was very passionate when telling us his personal views on various aspects of life in Buenos Aires. I usually get bored listening to tour guides after five minutes but not this time. My wife and I really enjoyed our tour and would highly recommend it. Gracias y buen trabajo, Martin!

Free Walks Morning/Afternoon. It was the first time i visited buenos aires and so i decided to take part at the free walks. i visited the morning tour as well as the afternoon and both were very good. you get a insight of argentinas history, a lot of funny ironie and also facts about every important building. and the guide (jenny) was also "muy bonita" ;-)i can recommmend it everybody

Comprehensive introduction. Recommended this tour in our hostel. Met and greeted by the tour leader, Martén. We're provided a lengthy and comprehensive tour of the sights and some history of buenos aires. A must do for an overview and orientation to BA. Guide also provided excellent recommendation for lunch after the tour.

Worth of Time & Money!!. I did the afternoon free walking tour with Juan Cruz and it was wonderful. He is not only knowledgeable about the history and the architecture but very passionate about his job. We walked for almost 3 hours throughout the city and he kept smiley face while answered all questions. Absolutely recommended! Good luck :)

Recommended as soon as you land . The free tour is a good option to start your stay in buenos aires. The guide explains the different architectural influence of buenos aires. The tour is really interesting, the guide introduces also the portenos culture and people. Airless bit of history as well. All things considered, this tour is a must to do

Must do once in Buenos Aires!. We had a great time going out to both tours in Buenos Aires. As a fellow tour guide, I can highly recommend to do both tours, so you could have a great overview of the city. Both Mariano and Juan Cruz did a great job, explaining everything in detail, in a very entertaining way! Thank you guys!

Highly recommend Free Walks - informative, engaging and fun. We did the afternoon tour on our first day in Buenos Aires, and the morning tour on our second day. Several people from our first tour enjoyed it so much they also came along for the second. Both guides, Juan-Cruz and Mariano were passionate advocates of their city and showed us things we wouldn't have seen otherwise (the house on top of the is high rise building, for example). Remember to tip at the end, this is how they earn their living.

Great tour around BA. Our guide Martin was very knowledgable, and the tour showed us very beautiful places of the city, while telling interesting storyies from the rich past of BA.very recommended for everyone, i myself have been in BA many times before but i still really really enjoyed it!

A must do in BA. Great afternoon tour with a great guide- Martin was extremely knowledgable and able to convey all information with wit and confidence. A must for anybody interested in the history, culture and politics of this great city.

One of the best!!. My wife and I have just arrived in Sth America after spending 10 weeks in Europe, having done at least 10 other free walking tours!Our guide Martin was fantastic. He is passionate, knowledgeable and friendly, we learnt so much and after 2.5 hours we were disappointed to end!Highly recommended!!

Worth the workout!. We did both the morning and afternoon tour (on the same day!!!).Both were excellent, interesting, fun and informative. We have been doing free walking tours in cities all over South America and these were easily two of the best. I highly recommend these two walking tours. I think our morning guide was Martin and I'm sorry I didn't catch the name of our afternoon guide. Many thanks.

Free Walks Buenos Aires. There are two tours daily in Buenos Aires, one beginning at El Congreso and covering la Avenida de Mayo and Plaza de Mayo with the Casa Rosada. Loli was a great guide! Lots of energy on a cold and rainy day--but we love to walk, so this was perfect. We did Recoleta the next day with Mariano, a musician by night who gives free tours by day. He, like Loli, was very well informed and knowledgeable about his native city. The tours are free, but it's customary to give a generous tip. These folks earn it!

Morning free walking tour in buenos aires. We took the morning tour, It was very interesting. Our guide Martin is a terrific guy he gave us a nice background of the history and he really knows what he was talking about. We will be taking the afternoon walk tomorrow.

Must do in BA. So good was this experience that I felt compelled to leave a review for the first time! The tour guide (we had Martín) was incredibly informative and, without trying to sound corny, brought the city alive. Highly recommended for anyone interested in Argentinian culture/history.

Walking Tour in Buenos Aires. The walking tour with Buenos Aires Free Walks was enjoyable, though the large tour group made asking questions or hearing at certain points difficult. If you have several days we would recommend maybe taking one of their free walks as well as hiring a private guide to get a more detailed and personal tour. Martin the guide we had was friendly enough. Tip based service.
Awesome Tour!. I really really enjoyed the tour, the guide really likes his job! It was funny, there were many interesting facts and the whole atmosphere was grear!
Martín was an excelent guide. We've had a very enjoyable tour visiting an amazing city. We'll try to do the recoleta tour also. It was worth to spend three hours walking with this marvelous guide.

Fantastic . I went with my girlfriend on the afternoon walk, the guide Martin was just the best, he is really friendly and he knows a lot about the city, just what I expected from a tour guide. I recommend it to anyone interested to learn about BsAs.

I learned a lot and had a great time. I went to the morning tour at 10:30 am with Maria Eugenia Bobadilla (Maru) and to the afternoon tour at 3 pm with Martin Wasswerman. I learned a lot about the city, its architecture and history. Maru knew a lot, as she studied History in the Uni. The afternoon tour was all about economics and politics in Argentina, and Martin, who is a sociologist gave us a really good overview of the issue and how it has afected the life of the people. I loved it. I had never go in a city tour as I found them boring and slow, but I really like it.It was a great idea to have this tour with them! So, 5 stars. They also gived me great tips to have the best experience in Buenos Aires :)

Best way to see Buenos Aires. Having completed my first walking tour in Budapest I was excited to try the Buenos Aires Free Walk on my first trip to South America. I was not disappointed. I actually ended up doing both tours, the morning one on the Friday and then the afternoon one on the Saturday. Both were informative and thought provoking and served a great purpose for a solo traveller - meeting people! Both Martin (PM) and Mariano (AM) were great guides and were more than happy to give tips on the city and places to go, which is very useful when you have limited time and you're on your own. Thank you for a great introduction to the wonderful city of Buenos Aires!

Great experience to see and learn about BA!. It was my first time traveling solo to Buenos Aires. This walking tour was a great way for me to discover the city of BA. I did both tours they offer (city center and Recoleta). The tour guides were very knowledgeable, and helpful. This tour definitely requires A LOT of walking, so make sure to wear sneakers. I also liked they stay after the tour to offer help and recommendations to travelers.

Excellent way of seeing the city. Fab tour guide who took us around many great sites and had great stories. Spoke great English and even sung us a few songs on his guitar. It was a free tour that started on time and I was more the happy to pay what I thought it was worth. I will definatly do one of there others very soon.

Both tours offered by this company are excellent. This walking tour company has the style I prefer where the guides provide not only the historical facts and details but their own views on historic and current issues facing Argentina. We had each of Martin and Fernando and they both provided for an interesting and educational tour as well as great food/attraction recommendations for our stay in their city. A very worthwhile tour.

Do not miss!. We did the morning walk with Fernando. Newly arrived in Buenos with no idea where to start this gave us a great beginning to our week. The tour was four hours and included a stop at a cafe for us to buy coffee and food. It rained the day we went but Fernando's tour was informative and entertaining so the rain seemed insignificant. Would highly recommend this experience. The bonus being you meet other travelers and hear their stories!Thank you Fernando! We plan to do the afternoon walk now!

Great chat!. We were lucky enough to have Fernado for our 3 pm tour. His English was great, jokes were cheesy just like you want and he was full of interesting stories about the capital city. The tour covered a lot of ground which is good. We liked it so much we are off to the morning one tomorrow!
Very fun way to get to know the city!. Did both the historical and cultural walking tours and enjoyed them a lot. Guides are very passionate and give a lot of information. Highly recommended!

Informative, funny, personal -- highly recommended. The tour was very interesting yet funny. Perhaps most importantly, it conveyed lots of very balanced, unideologic information about how the people of Argentina and Buenos Aires feel. Martin, our guide, did a great job. The orange jackets are a bit ridiculous.

Wonderful tour. Went on the tour with Martin, he is very knowledgeable and passionate about the city. He gave a great tour encompassing the cultural, economic, and sociological highlights of the city. Highly recommend!

Great tours!. I did both tours and found them both very interesting. The morning tour was with Laura and took us through the Recoleta neighbourhood. The tour started at Teatro Colón and ended at Cementerio de la Recoleta (10:30am - 2pm). At the end of the tour I had time to look around Recoleta Cemetery for a while and then walk over to the start of the afternoon tour (National Congress). My guide for that tour was Loli. The tour started at 3pm and ended at Plaza de Mayo. Both of the guides were very good and did a great job teaching us about Buenos Aires and Argentinian history. They both spoke excellent English, were very clear, and did a good job taking groups through a busy city.There was almost no overlap between the morning and afternoon tours so I am glad I did them both. The morning one was in the less busy Recoleta neighborhood whereas the afternoon one was in the busy and packed city center. If you are planning to do both in one day, don't plan on a long lunch since it is about 2.5-3 kilometers between the ending point of the first tour and the starting point of the second. Overall, I highly recommend it if you want to have a nice, entertaining walk through the city.If anyone is interested, these videos show the highlights of the two tours: morning Recoleta tour (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s_H2bsmKOs0), afternoon City Center tour (https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tCb23xD7Mnc).

Recommended. Did the morning tour with Laura. Her English was very good, lots of stories and insights. Did Teatro Colon then up to Recoleta. Everything is indicated on the website. Did a nice break at the bakery Medialunas del Abuelo. Cheap and very good empanadas and pastries plus of course coffee and bathrooms. Would have been nicer to have had quick introductions of each group member though.
Excellent!. I did both tours and both were amazing. Very knowledgeable guides covered history, politics, culture.

Morning walking tour with Franco. I joined the free walking tour that at the Colón Theater and ends up at the Recoleta Cemetery. Franco was our guide. He was friendly, knowledgable and humorous. Most memorable for me were the original songs that he sang for us accompanying himself with the slim guitar he carried on his back. The tour gave a good sense especially of the architectural development of the city and key moments and figures in its history. It was well paced, with a stop at a café along the way. ¡Muchas gracias, Franco!

Fantastic walking tour. Did the tour with Martin and it was excellent. It was a great way to see the city. His tour was both informative and fun. I have done a lot of walking tours and this was one of the best.Well worth doing to give you an insight into Buenos Aires

Go on both tours!. I went on both tours while in Buenos Aires and I can't recommend them enough. Guides are beyond intelligent with wonderfully fun personalities. Better than tours I've paid for. The tours are longer than I expected, 3-4 hours. Every second was entertaining, but it's nice to know so you can schedule your time accordingly. These tours should be a requirement for all who visit.

Great way to explore the city. Arriving in Buenos Aires can be quite overwhelming. Such a big city I didn't know where to start! I did the afternoon tour which takes you around the main city attractions, providing a better overview of the city. The guide is also extremely helpful, providing a lot of information regarding both Buenos Aires and Argentina's history. Would definitely recommend!

3 oclock tour. Enjoyed the 3 hours with our guide. He was an architect major and showed us a lot of the city via looking up! There were so many things I would not have noticed without the guide. We ended up in front of the Pink house near Plaza de Mayo.

Great and informal introduction to the city. Great, tip based free tour that allows you to see some of the city and hear some local history with an English speaking guide. Helpful as very little of the sites and monuments in BA have English translation. Our guide Martin was witty and responsive to the group. Definitely a good thing to do early on in your stay.

I've had better guides.... This is a sad review for me to write- I have visited Buenos Aires in the past and had amazing guides (Mariano and Fernando. Wow!) But this time around, my guide was less than engaging. Nothing really terrible- just a quiet talker (Buenos Aires is a loud city!) and not much of a story-teller. Very sweet guy, but the tour seemed pretty long. I sort of wish I had bailed and did my own thing.
Very good tours. Tour lasts about 2 hours, the guide named Adam speaks English very well. He can also advice you smth about the city, if you need.I highly recommend this tour to everyone.

4 hour tour with Fernando was the best. This was one of the best walking tours we've ever been on. Packed with great history if Buenos Aires, Fernando made the tour both highly entertaining and educational. Highly recommended.

Super tours!. We joined both of the walking tours, first the morning one with Lolly in windy and freezing cold conditions and the next day in the afternoon with Martin in nice conditions. Both tours were very interesting and the guides were both knowledgeable, enthusiastic and good at choosing what topics to tell about, including personal opinions about i.e. politics and fun facts. We can only recommend to join these tours.

Do Both Tours!. You might be thinking, do I really want to risk a tour that's free because maybe it's led by some crappy guides to some crappy parts of the city. Well tell that little voice in your head to stop talking and walk to the starting point of either the AM or PM tour because these guides know what they're talking about and they take you to the most historic parts of the city. After our first tour with Martin we were completely sold (rather, convinced because this tour is free, remember?!) He spoke perfect English, was funny, and was also very passionate about the city. It was awesome, so awesome that we went the next day for AM trip. Fernando was our guide and he too was very knowledgable of the city, humorous, and spoke perfect English. They welcomed any questions and also gave us great information on Tango shows, restaurants, and exchanging money. Wear your walking shoes and bring cash to tip these fantastic guides.
Free walks. We loved the free walks in BA! We did the morning and the afternoon tour and got to know BA much better. Ask for Fernando! Great guy!

Did both tours. Martin and Loli both ran excellent, entertaining, and informative tours! We'll worth the time! A great way to start learning more about the city.Make sure you tip, some woman from Texas left halfway through to go join the other tour - without tipping. Don't do that.

Top tour . After a few sub par walking tours I was a bit skeptical about getting another one that lacked interesting information. But this tour in my opinion was fantastic. We did the afternoon tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. Our guide was incredibly informative and gave a strong opinion when it came to issues of Argentinas past and current economic and political situation. A great way to get a deeper understanding of the city.

Great Walking Tour of BA. I was traveling with three other people and we all really enjoyed our Centro walking tour. One of our companions had lived in Buenos Aires for several year and even he learned a lot from our tour leader, Yollie. I have done a lot of walking tours and this was up there with one of the best.

Martin is wonderful!. We had such a phenomenal time on our first tour that we decided to come back for a second with our same guide. We did the afternoon tour first and then the morning tour a couple days later. We saw amazing sights of the city and were given great historical information. I encourage anyone who has the chance to check this out - you won't be disappointed. We did a free tour in Quito which was lovely but this one wins out for sure on the better of the two. The tour operators are passionate about their city and culture and are such great resources. Highly recommend!!

The best free walking tour we've had in South America!. We did the morning tour in English with Fernando, who is brilliant! You get to find out extremelly interesting and fun information about BA. This was our first free walking tour in South America and it raised the bar very high! After 5 more walking tours it's still number one by far. Don't miss it!

Great start to Buenos Aires holiday. We stumbled upon this tour the first morning we were here & it was the perfect way to get a sense of the city & its culture. We did the morning tour- guide spoke good english & was very informative. Covered a number of key tourist spots. Would highly recommend.

Amazing!!!!! A must for Buenos Aires. I did both walking tours & was lucky enough to get Fernando as our guide both times. Fernando is amazeballs! So much information in that head of yours. Very informative & entertaining walking tour. Up there with the best ive done. Thank you!

Excellent! So informative and a great way to see the city. My friends and i did the afternoon walking tour in english. There were only 5 of us on the tour which was great as it meant it was easy to walk around as no big group and it was easy to ask lots of questions.Our guide Lolly was really excellent. She was so knowledgable about the city and her english was practically perfect!Thanks so much Lolly for showing us around your city - i particularly enjoyed the political background to the city.Would highly recommend. Only wish i'd had time to do the morning one too!

Buenos aires free walks. The two walks were excellent. Martin and Fernando were knowledgeable,passionate about their own country. They are both kind young men. These walks are a must for visitors to BA --and maybe residents too? They are worth generous gifts. Brilliant.
Each about 3or 4 miles easy walking.

Highly Recommended way to get to know Buenos Aires from a porteño!. I did both the morning tour in Spanish and the afternoon tour in English and had a great experience both times. The guides I had, Martin and Javier, were so informative and told us interesting details about the history, architecture, politics, culture and more in Buenos Aires in addition to helpful tips about changing money, restaurants, tango shows, etc. In both experiences, the tour was well planned, well executed and well presented. It is about 3 hours long and there is even a snack/bathroom break built-in. I was very impressed ! It is a free tour, but I would definitely bring some money if you can to give a tip and if you want to get a snack at the break.

Nice walk through the city. We had great tour with Martin through Retiro and Recoleta this week. It took almost 4 hours but we didn't get bored at all. He showed not only main sights but also shared where to get best ice creams, how to get to secret bars and etc. Would definitely recommend this tour. Thank you, Martin!
Very fun and informative. We did the afternoon your with Loli. She was awesome, we learnt heaps and really enjoyed our afternoon! Best way to learn about the city and history.

A must do while in BA!. We went on the 3pm walk through the city centre exploring all the historical and political points of interest. Our tour guide Loli was extremely informative and her stories made Buenos Aires come alive for us. Her English was superb! Our stroll through through the streets ending at Plaza de Mayo lasted approximately three hours. This walk should be on the top of everyones to do list while visiting this city! Thanks Loli for a great tour!

Best Overview of Buenos Aires!. Took the morning tour with Martin, he was extremely knowledgeable and happy to share. We learned so much about Argentinian history along with the sites in this tour that I could say this is a must do tour if you're only here a short time! Thank you Martin and Free Walks

Great Tour. Today I did the free walking tour in the center of Buenos Aires. Our guide Juan Cruz told us a lot of good information about this part of the city. He was a great guide who made this tour instead of boring, an interesting siteseeing!

Very informative and fun. I did the morning tour and it was good for orientating myself with the city as well as providing a great insight into the city. Would highly recommend, the guides provide some very good tips for tourists and are very friendly.

Friendly, informative guide, highly recommended. We did the afternoon 'City Centre Tour', and were met by friendly guides in orange tshirts. We chose to do the Spanish speaking tour to practise our Spanish, and our guide was very friendly and encouraging. He was very patient and answered our questions when we were walking between sights. We highly recommend this tour as we learnt a lot about the history, politics and culture of BA, and the many beautiful sights we saw along the route.

Do this tour if you can!. We walked on Sunday with Loli and it was a great choice, not only because she is a great and engaging tour guide but also because we did not have to endure the usual traffic and crowds that prevail in central BA on business days. Really enjoyed the insights and the informal discussions.
Recoleta tour. Mariano is interesting. Well informed and totally engaging. A great time! Knows tons about architecture and the tree!

Morning Recoleta Tour. We did the free walking tour with Martín. There are frequent and lengthy stops but Martín is an engaging and well informed speaker. He discussed the history of various sights and monuments and thoughtfully, and sometimes scathingly, compared it with the present day. The walk was well paced and doable for most fitness levels. Interspersed with the usual sightseeing were useful tips for being a tourist in BA, e.g. The current use of the blue market for currency exchange. A definite 5 star experience especially given that you are only paying a tip to Martín.

A Walk to Remember. I went on the walking tour the second day of my stay here in Buenos Aires. I went on the Morning: Walking Through Recoleta Tour. The tour was amazing. My tour guide name was Martin and he was super cute ( to all my single ladies). I'm going on another tour this Saturday. I would suggest this tour. It's free. P. S walking shoes is a must.

Informative, funny. My husband and I went about half way with the walks until we got to the resting area and the restaurant only accepted cash. We went to another restaurant quickly and then lost the tour. The tour is very slow though, it takes 3 hours to do a 30-50 minute walk. They are very informative and have great humor though.

Ptobably the best way to know the city!. I did the morning tour with Loli. The tour is fun and very informative, it was great to know all these stories of the buildings and about Buenos Aires in general. It lasted almost 3.5 hours but I didnt feel tired at all! Now i will try to go to the afternoon tour before i leave!
Great way to get to know BA!. This is free and all the tour guides we had were great...did the morning tour and the next day the afternoon one. They always have an English speaking guide.

Fernando,s tour. We had a free walking tour in English with Fernando today. We began at12.45 and finished at 3pm. It was informative, goodhumoured and friendly. There was abrief meal break in themiddle. It is a relatively new initiative and deserves support. Goodvalue andenjoyable.
Great way to see the city . We did the walk in the morning with Martin and it was great. Highly knowledgable guide with lots of interesting stories about the city

Great Way to Tour the City. We did both morning and afternoon with Fernando...enjoyed the first one so much we went for the second one two days later. Fernando did a great job teaching us about the history of Argentina and Buenos Aires. He made sure the stories were information and fun. The best way to see the city. There is no charge but the tour was so great you are happy to tip the guide - he works hard and earns it. He made sure he stopped about half way through where there were washroom facilities and a place to get refreshments (water) if needed.

What a fantastic way to learn about the city!!. Loli was a brilliant tour guide, knowledgeable about the city as well as interesting and fun. The tour was brilliant and such a great way to see the city and learn its history and culture. I would highly recommend it!!

Great Tours of the City. We did both the morning tour (with Laura) and afternoon tour the next day (with Fernando) and found both guides to be friendly and incredibly knowledgeable about the city. Highly recommend BA Free Walks as the best way to get to know BA.

Highly recommended!. Great way to see the sights and learn about the history of Buenos Aires. Fernando was very knowledgable, and made it entertaining. We went on the morning tour -started at 10:30 and ended about 3:00.
Afternoon Tour. Andrew does a great job of explaining the great variety in architecture and the history of Independence Avenue. We enjoyed it greatly.

Super cool!!!!. Highly recommended!! Tours in english and spanish at the same time, walking all around the main sights and leraning a lot about the history of the country. Very friendly and funny guides!

worth the tired feet!. We took both the free tours; the morning in Recoleta with Martin and the afternoon in Centro with Fernando. Both were excellent. Each guide was proficient in English, was knowledgeable about the city and freely shared his personal experiences and insights on B.A. living. They both exhibited a keen sense of humor and a shared love of their city. These tours are long; wear good walking shoes because you will cover a lot of ground. Thoroughly enjoyable and worth the price!

In-depth experience, great value. I've always been a huge fan of doing free walking tours when I first get to a city, and this one did not disappoint.My fiancé and I did the afternoon tour with Martín, which took us to a number of the main political sites and also took us to some of the main arteries of the city. Martín was very passionate about his heritage and even spoke about his personal experiences with some of the more recent protests and struggles of the porteños, which was super interesting to me. We learned a ton and had a great time, I'd definitely recommend the tour to anyone visiting for the first time!

Highly recommended!. This was my first free walking tour, and I can only hope others are as good! I did the morning tour, and Laura was an amazing guide. Funny, approachable, and knowledgeable. What more could you hope for? The group was easy to locate at the starting point, and then we split into two groups; one for Spanish speakers, and one for English speakers. I'll definitely be doing the afternoon tour before I leave.

Great introduction to the city. I did both morning and afternoon tours. Both had a good range of info - culture, history, things to do. Both worth doing if you have the time, there's some overlap in terms of broad strokes of BA and Argentina history, but they cover totally different parts of town.

Enjoyed a lot!. I took the BA free tour and the BA free walks - and the "free walks" are the best! The guide Fernando was brilliant, with huge knowledge and funny stories. The walk itself was really long with so many interesting places on the way. I think everybody on the group really enjoyed it. I highly recommend these free walks, and don't be cheap on the tip... they deserve it.

Great way to see the city and get your exercise too.. My husband and I took each tour on two separate days. Both were very well done.Our first one was the afternoon tour, starting at the Congress building. The group was divided into two groups, those who preferred English and those who preferred Spanish. Our Engish group walked with Andrew, a charming young American who had come to learn Spanish three years ago, and fell in love with a young Argentinian lady and stayed. He was informative, friendly, spoke loudly so everyone could hear him and kept the interest of the group. We walked from the Congress to the Casa Rosada and it took about 2 1/2 hours. There was a 15 minute break about half way through and we stopped at a gelato shop where you could buy ice cream if you wished and to use the bathrooms. Wearing comfortable walking shoes is a must as there are quite a few cobblestone streets along the way.Our second tour was the morning tour of Recoleta. This one starts at the Theatre Colon and goes to Recoleta cemetary. It was a long day beginning at 10:30 am and we finished at 2:30 pm. It turned out to be a very hot day, so it was a good idea to carry water with you as you walked. Mariano was our guide (once again the tour was divided between the Spanish and English speakers) and he is a native Porteno. Enthusiastic, knowledgeable, and kept the group moving. We stopped for our break at a place where you could buy Empanadas, which was a good idea as the tour partially took place during the lunch period. Both tours were very good, interesting, and come recommended. We learned something from each one and enjoyed them both. Comfortable shoes, bringing water and money for snacks and your tip will make your day a pleasant one.

aftrnoon tour. I attended the 3:00 pm tour that began at the nacional congress and ended at the cass rosada. It was about 3.5 hours long and Andrew, our English speaking tour guide was full of historical facts and fun information. It was one of the best days of my trip and I highly recommend the walking tour. Don't forget to tip the tour guides as this is a free tour!

Don't miss this tour. We did the morning tour with Dolores and the afternoon with Martin. Both were excellent. Their knowledge and insight into life in BA is excellent. Martin in particular is very passionate about the political life in Argentina and the recent history. It was very moving.Both tours had large groups but this was not a problem.We would recommend doing the tour on your first or second day as the info you get is very useful. Thanks to both guides You are a credit to your nation.

Great experience, highly recommend it. I stumbled across the tour at Avenido de Mayo, where the guide(Fernando) was telling the story of Edita with such great passion, that it just captivated the audience. Since the tour was heading towards the same direction I was going anyway, I decided to join the group(it beats walking on my own with the travel guide in hand). AND it was AMAZING! perfect mix between history, social cues and trivia, and just funny anecdotes about one thing or another. Overall great experience, highly recommend it! Please don't forget to tip your guide at the end!

You will see a lot in a short amount of time!. My husband and I had just two days in Buenos Aires before a longer trip to Antarctica so we looked into the free walking tours to try to see the city highlights in a short time. We had an easy walk to the meeting point at Libertad and Viamonte, near the Teatro Colon, for the morning tour. What I liked about this free tour is you don't have to sign up ahead of time--just appear if it fits into your schedule. There were quite a few people so they used two guides, each group having about 20 people.Fernando was very enthusiastic and full of information. He spoke loudly and clearly and you could hear him without difficulty. The tour covered a lot of ground, which we appreciated, as our time in BA was limited. We really loved the Plaza de San Martin, which we found more picturesque than Plaza de Mayo. And lo and behold--what an amazing sight! We stumbled upon an induction ceremony for new ambassadors to Argentina! Band, honor guard, red carpet--the works! So exciting!The other highlight of the tour was at the end: Recoleta Cemetery. Located in an affluent neighborhood, this cemetery is filled with the mausoleums of Buenos Aires' wealthy and famous. Each person tried to make their final resting place even more extravagant than the previous. The result is an over-the-top display where row after row of mausoleums create a type of cemetery city. Really quite a sight. Evita Peron is buried there. The tour did not go inside the Iglesia de Pilar (next to the cemetery) but it is worth a quick visit.I highly recommend this tour. We would have done the afternoon one as well if we'd had time. Enjoy!

Above expectations. I joined the afternoon tour (in English) starting from the gate of the Congress. The group was quite big and this made me doubt it could turn out to be an enjoyable experience. Luckily there were no reasons to doubt. Martin, who led the tour, made an amazing job in keeping the group together and setting the right tempo. He stopped in places that would not be of hindrance for other people and spoke in a clear and loud enough voice so that everybody could hear him. Above this, the information he gave was interesting and engaging. I joined a couple of these concept tours in the past and usually the information I received remained anecdotal and more superficial, aimed at entertaining more actually informing. This was not the case with Martin: he delved into several historical events and their ongoing developments , the economic crisis and its social effects, architecture, the birth of tango and much, much more and not once I felt bored or disengaged, but, quite the contrary, I felt increasingly captivated by what he had to say.I recommend it without hesitation.
Walk through Recoleta. Great Guide, beautiful Area.Laura told us a lot of great stories and made the tour informative and fun. Definitely recommendable.
Must do. Went on the morning tour, and it was really good. They always tried to bring something else. One of the best walking tours i have ever done.

Terrific. Went on morning tour with Maritin who made this tour come alive, with his passion for the city, the history, politics and general knowledge. He answered every question with aplomb and nothing was too much trouble. Would highly recommend.

Definitely worth doing. We did both the morning and afternoon walking tours. They cover different areas and are both totally worth it. The two guides that we had we so well informed and told us about the history of Argentina and Buenos Aires, politics, the style of buildings and all sorts of other things. They also went out of their way to answer any other questions we had. Would absolutely recommend and is a good way to see Buenos Aires.

Awesome Tour!. We took the morning tour with Laura and the afternoon tour with Dolores and both were fantastic! Both guides were super knowledgeable and fun. I go on a lot of these tours and these were excellent.

Wonderful Tour!. We did the 10 am tour with Fernando and loved it. He was so knowledgable and entertaining. Not only did we learn about beautiful sites around the city, he also explained many important parts of Argentina's history. We are so happy we found this tour and met Fernando, it was a great way to learn more about the city. Add this to your list in BA!

Amazing !. We did the afternoon tour with Javier. Frankly speaking, it was the best free waking tour we've ever had!!! Javier has in-dept, profound knowledge of the history and economy of the country, he's not only knowledgable but also inthusiastic and charismatic which and makes you get carried away and dive into the life argentina. I don't reccomend this tour, but I consider it a MUST do!

Excellent Way To Spend A Couple Hours and Learn About BA. 4 of us joined Frederick this afternoon for this free tour. Frankly, my expectations were not very high, but Frederick was an EXCELLENT guide! Good sense of humor, good sense of the history of the town, complete with "hidden back stories," good projection of voice so we could all hear him (about 30 in the group overall). I would consider him the ideal guide around town.Be sure to go if you are in town!
Great experience!. The 3pm tour was top notch. I really recommend it. Martin was an awesome guide!I liked the afternoon tour better than the morning tour.

Can't miss it. We did the onñy the morning tour with Loli (Dolores). It was a very full 3 hours. The walk is not difficult there are lots of stops for the guide to give all the information. She was great, funny, explaining lot of stuff and hey, she is very good looking (which also helps :P)After doing it we wanted to do the afternoon one, but didn't manage to get it in our schedule.We had quite a bit group but everyone seemed to enjoy it a lot and could hear everything even though the stops are on some very noisy streets.

Very talented guide. It was the first free walking tour i took in South America and I loved it. I even ended up taking both tours: the one in Recoleta and the one on the historic city center. It is really worth it, as it allows you to see the city differently and have a better understanding of it. The guide (Dolores) was funny and likeable, but most of all extremely knowledgeable and she told the best stories.

A must do in Buenos Aires. We did the afternon walk with Martin. It was a very full 3 hours. The walk is not difficult there are lots of stops for the guide to give all the information. Martin was excellent, his knowledge of the city and the social and political situation of BA was vast. You tip what you think it is worth as that is the guides' payment. We had quite a bit group 30ish but everyone seemed to enjoy it and could hear everything even though the stops are on busy noisey streets.

Excellent walking tour. I went on both the morning and afternoon walking tours. I really enjoyed learning about both the architectural and political histories of the city and both Martin and Mariano were excellent, knowledgeable and friendly guides! I would highly recommend the tour to anyone wanting to get to know about Buenos Aires and Argentina!

Great way to visit and understand BA. We did two free walks (morning and afternoon) during our stay in BA and it is definitely worth it. Javier and Ariel were great guides and allowed us to experience BA in another way. You need to do it !

Brilliant tour. We did this walking tour of Buenos Aires with Laura and I have to say that as someone who has done these tours all over the world she was exceptional and very knowledgable about her city. The 3 hour tour passed by very quickly and we thoroughly enjoyed it.

The best way to get to know Buenos Aires. I really enjoyed learning about Argentine political and architectural history from the walking tour today. Dolores was our guide, and she has impeccable English and a lot of passion and knowledge about her city. Despite being a really large group and the sun being rather intense, she delivered a really good, funny, informative and energetic tour and we all learned a lot. Gracias, Dolores!

Knowledgeable and passionate guides. Joined both tours, 10:30am and 3pm - different guides, both knowledgeable and teaching us lots about their city with passion. Walking pace is a little quicker than in most cities where we've joined free walking tours but that suited us fine. Highly recommend both tours, personally I think I enjoyed the afternoon tour more because of the sights which were covered.

Worth doing. Did both the walk options and both are worth doing as allow you to get to know the city centre well. Our first guide was brilliant and deserves 5 stars, but the guide for the other tour we went on made mistakes.

First thing to do in BA!!. I attended a tour on my last day in BA and enjoyed it very much, but I regretted not having attended it the first day. Our tour guide, Martin, made the tour really interesting giving us at the same time insight of the history of city/country/ buildings and info on everyday life of portenos, as we walked around the city. It is a great way to get to know the city and especially with the recommendations of the guides you will better plan your stay according to your interests. Definitely a must-do, and to get the best of it- put it in your schedule at the very beginning of your stay in BA.

Free Walks Buenos Aires. This is one of the better free walking tours I have taken and that number is easily over twenty. Mariano introduced himself as one of the founders of the local group and it was clear he has put a lot of effort into the route plan as well as selection of topics to cover. The route covered Recoleta in a morning tour. The group is easy to spot at their start point, orange umbrella and t-shirts. One tour in English another in Spanish. It includes many points of interest made even more interesting by Mariano's commentary. There is a mid walk break which makes the three hour walk enjoyable for anyone.

Loved it!. We did the tour with Loli. Totally loved it! Her English is close to native, she was very competent, talked about history, architecture, traditions... Looked after the group. We got to know not only the city, but also some facts about the country in general. Very informative! Would strongly recommend it!!! Thank you, Loli!!! You did a great job!!! :)

Great way to get to know the city and its history. We did the afternoon tour with Fernando and it was fantastic. He spoke excellent English and had great knowledge of the city and its history. We also did the morning tour with Mariano which was also very enjoyable but if you only have time to do one make it the afternoon tour. I would highly recommend to make one of these tours your first stop In BA as it will settle you into the city very quickly.

Great experience. All I can say is just go. Mariano has thought out itinerary. He is entertaining and he looks after the group. Great 3 hours and then perfect time to have lunch and look through recoletta

A good way to get to know the city!. Knowledgable guides, interesting history and a LOT of walking! A good way to get to grips with the city. A good thing to do if you have little time in Buenos Aires; you will see a lot in a few hours!

your first stop in Buenos. This tour opened my eyes and made a bit of order in the big city of Buenos Aires. To those of you who like to know a bit of the story where they go, this is a must.The guides also give recommendations of things to do, places to eat etc, and you can ask them all the questions you would like to ask a local about Buenos and more.

Excellent tour!!!. I did the afternoon tour yesterday with Maru and absolutely loved it. I am a lover of History so the whole thing was a great experience, I learnt a lot about BA's past. The tour guide is a student of history therefore she was very passionate about everything. This tour is a must!!!

Free Buenos Aires Walking Tour. On Jan. 12, 2015, while we were waiting for our cruise to depart late in the day, four of us took the free 10:30 am walking tour in BA with Laura as our tour guide. She gave us a wonderful tour of the city (Recoleta) and we thoroughly enjoyed it, despite the heat and humidity! She loves the city and was very eager to share it with us. Her English was excellent and she paced it well, stopping partway through at a little sandwich shop where we bought sandwiches, pastries, and drinks, and used the restrooms. It was like having a good friend give you a tour of her home town, with lots of helpful tips and facts. Our only regret was that we didn't have enough time to take the afternoon tour as well. Because there is no fee for this, remember to tip well!

Great tour!. We love walking tours when we travel and this one was very good!! Laura was funny, engaging and very knowledgeable about BA. She was a lovely tour guide and we were never bored throughout the tour. Definitely recommend it. I wish we coukd take the afternoon tour but we planned a wine tasting so we only did the Recoleta tour with her.

One of the best tours I ever had. My most sincere recommendations go to these girls who guided our tours. Both morning and afternoon tour with Laura ( english tour, Recoleta ) and Maru ( spanish tour, City center) were excellent. Very informative and higly captivating speakers, they will make you always want to listen to them more. We were already tired when taking the afternoon tour but Maru managed to make us forget about that and she kept our attention for 4 hours! !! She is very knowledgeable ( a history student ) and she provided us tons of information but in a very interesting way with lots of energy and passion for what she does. Also she carries a book with lots of pictures of how some buildings used to look like and of popular events and demonstrations that took place at squares we visited. That is how dedicated to her tours she is. I loved her enthusiasm and also her neutral position on burning matters as she would provide us all the information and let us make our opinions on the subject. I have to add that Laura's morning Recoleta tour was highly amusing as well. She is really funny and i believe she could make any topic sound interesting. Both girls are very warm, generous and helpful, willing to adjust their rhythm to our needs, answer all the questions we had and their effort for providing us a very informative yet interesting and amusing tour is very noticeable. Their contribution to our BA visit was immense. Take these tours, wear comfortable shoes, bring watter with you and there is no way to regret it...

Best way to discover Buenos Aires !. We made both afternoon and morning tour with Fernando and Dolores. They both were very interesting and involved. Very good english and the walk was really well made. A nice way to discover Buenos Aires, Argentina and their history !

Definitely take this tour. We took afternoon tour in our first day. It was 45 degrees outside, but those 3 hours passed very quick thanks to our guide,Andrew. The tour was very informative about Argentina history, culture, art etc. We learned some interesting facts that we can't find on internet easily. Also our guide gave us some tips about our trip. This tour is the best way to learn about city unless you are a local :)

Best Way To Hit The Highlights. I took both the morning and afternoon tours (on different days), the morning tour goes through more of the north of the city, including Teatro Colon, the various court buildings, and ending up at Recoleta Cemetery. The afternoon tour hits the major sights in the city center. Both are fantastic and you get so much more out of seeing this things when you have a knowledgeable guide to take you around. The guides have tons of good information and interesting stories. Definitely the best way to see and learn about things in the city.
Great way to see the city. The tour provided a great introduction to the city, they cover the history, architecture and plenty of tips on what to do and see in the city.

Very nice walking tour by locals. Buenos Aires Free Walks is definitely worth attending; you get to see around with a local guide giving information on the history of Argentina, important people etc. also some places that you may not be able to discover by yourself. We took the afternoon tour and were very glad we decided to do so. There is really no need for a private tour to see around the city center of Buenos Aires - this tour is free (you only leave tip as much as you can) and gives you well enough to discover and in case you want to spend more time in a certain location, you can always go back..

Groups too large. If I was reviewing the guide Fernando I would rate 5 stars. However the group size was far too large at over 30 people which made it very difficult to hear when standing on busy intersections. I did a walking tour in Valparaiso Chile and they split the large group which I think was much better. By reading some reviews the large group on my day wasn't a one off, and this company should think about doing something similar. I did a walking tour with a rival company for Reitro etc and it was more enjoyable due to group size.

Both tours were good. We did both the morning and afternoon tour on different days. The guides were both good who knew lots about the city. I have to say that I preferred the afternoon tour purely due to the fact I found the content more interesting but both tours were to a very high standard.

Great Tour. We did the afternoon tour and it was great! We learned a lot about Argentina's history and saw many sights which we wouldn't have had without the tour! It was one of my favourite free walking tours in South America. We will definitely do the morning tour too!

Great free tour of the city. My friend and I joined both the morning and afternoon tour, and it was the best thing to do in BA. The tour guides are very knowledgeable in their city, especially Laura (not Mary), she made the tour very informative and interesting for us. If there are any film directors or casting personnel reading this, please ask for Laura if you join one of the tour. They will take you around the most significant spots of the city that are within working distance and will be able to advise you where else to go in your own spare time. Overall, a very enjoyable activity to do and thank you Buenos Aires Free Walking Tours for showing me your lovely city.
Excellent. Informative guide and great history.. Political coverage enough without being overly dramatic. Should tell you it takes from 10 30 to 2 pm. It's a long time but not that far to walk.

Great way to know BA. To be honest, i was a bit negative towards such offers....whenever someone offeres you something for free, by the end its more expensive than it should be....here, this was not the case....i took the tour from Congress to Plaza de Mayo (3 pm - 6pm). The guide was great (Fernando), he spoke a lot, relaxed, not boring....there were a lot of stops so the walk was very easy....by the end i expected that even though it is free he will highlight that we must pay something (even trought a joke) but not, a guy finished the tour and didnt say a word regarding the tip and he bought me with that....of course, we gave him a tip....i will go for another one in Recoleta...recommendations!!!

Tumbs up for amazing Laura!. We've had the best tour in our trip (all over south America) Tour guide Laura is an amazing speaker and even if the topic doesn't interest you, she 'll makes it interesting!

Best activity in buenos aires . Those free walks are best thing I did in buenos aires (OK maybe it's a tie with the tango show) I did both tours the one in the morning and the one in the afternoon. Both were really interesting and I learner a lot about the history of Argentina and the city of buenos aires. My preference goes to the morning walk. Maybe because the guide laura was really fun and entertaining.If you are visiting buenos aires, start with those walks, you'll see a lot of the city and will learn a lot. I also did a bus tour and it was boring in comparison.

Excellent afternoon tour. Had a great afternoon walk today as we explored the city with our guide. Since it was a big group he spoke loud and was therefore very good to understand. Also he managed to keep the group somehow together while crossing all the streets and the busy traffic. The information he gave was very interesting and not online historic facts but also tips and reflections of the daily life of the Porteños.All in all an excellent tour!

Historical free walking tour was amazing. Thanks Martin for giving us so much and so good information and made my trip more colourful in Buenos Aires to understand the background behind and the history of this Amazing city. Although it was raining, people were celebrating the 13 of December he kept going with such an enthusiasm, i got so surprized and overwealmed with all the information we attained. Thanks again Martin, you were unbeliverble. He kept going for 3 hours and really gave us so good advises to cope in Buenos Aires by our own too.

Great way to see the city. Dear travellers, I would highly recommend you to take part in this tour. The guides really know their city and provide you with lots of Information, including restaurants etc. for your remaining time in BA.I took part in both, the morning and the afternoon walk and both are equally very recommendable.

Interesting, informative, fun an a great way to meet people!. The meeting point is easy to find, close to Lavelle Sube stop and te orange shirt was easy to spot. The guide spoke fantastic English and kept us entertained throughout the 3 hour walk. It was a very hot day and he was great at finding shady spots to stop. Although the group was huge I thought he did an amazing job at keeping everyone informed and engaged. The route explored some of the northern parts of te city before ending in the big cemetery. I ended up meeting some great people to explore the rest of the city with. A fun way to get to know the city, plus it's free! Was very happy to tip as Fernando was a great guide.

Superb introduction. Mariano our guide was really sexy and intelligent. At least that's what he told us to say here. In any case an exceptional introduction to a small section of central Buenos Aires (basically hitting 3 parks going generally North from the meeting point, with focal point the gomero, a piece of lazy fauna imported from Australia), giving plenty of background. A 3-hour tour turned into 3.5 but no one seemed bothered. His English was very understandable and loud for the large crowd to hear. One of the better free walking tours I have done. I won't miss the afternoon tour tomorrow....

Fantastic experience. We joined the afternoon historical tour with martin and it was absolutely the best thing we could have done on this trip to buenos aires. Recommend doing this tour on the first or second day of the trip to get acquainted with Buenos Aires history. It's a lot of walking so pick a day with cool weather and definitely bring water. Our guide, Martin, was really first rate. Don't expect some cheesy, touristy overview of the city - Martin is a sociologist and ex-professor who is passionate to share his knowledge of buenos aires' past and present with his group. You feel like you are attending an intellectual study abroad program at university! So thankful we looked into this walking tour and unbelievable that this is a free activity. Tip generously, they are worth it!

Nice way to get to know Buenos Aires. BA Free Walks runs two tours in the morning and afternoon. The impression to me is that the morning one is more about architecture and history while the afternoon one is more about political side. We joined both tours the second day we got to BA. Both tour guides were very passionate about their job and gave a wonderful and lively introduction of the city. As a visitor, it's also an opportunity to get in touch with local people. We spotted some interesting attractions during the tour and went back later on our own. Overall, it's a great way to start the trip in Buenos Aires.

Great Tour. I would highly recommend this tour. We done both the morning and afternoon tours during are stay in BA. The guides were very informative and knowledgeable. It is a great way to get an overview of the city and you can then return to the main attractions you liked. Also the guides were very helpful with recommendations for restaurants, shows and other tours you may wish to pay for.

Great way to fall in love with Buenos Aires. Loli was our tour guide for both and we loved her passion and enthusiasm for the city. Buenos aires is such an unusual city and without the knowledge of the history of BA it would have been hard to appreciate our time here as much as we did. Would definitely recommend this walking tour and the price is right! Don't forget to tip your tour guide, they deserve it!

A great way to orientate your self in BA. I went on both the morning and afternoon tours with Dolores and Martin respectively, and I found them to be informative, enthusiastic and charming tour guides. Make no mistake, these guys are true professionals and know their stuff. It was a great way to spend the day with the whole group and I would encourage anybody if they are new to BA or have been there for a period of time to take this tour, one thing is for sure you will not be disappointed. I would really like to thank Dolores and Martin for such a great day.Cheers garrym

Best way to see the city. I did the morning tour with Dolores and the afternoon tour with Martin - both very good overview of the major sights of Buenos Aires, with a good mix of the historical background, culture and day-to-day life of the Argentinian people. You won't spend much time at each sight, however you can always come back to the places you are interested in, thus in my opinion it's really helpful to do this tour on the first day of your stay in Buenos Aires.They are also quite funny and happy to answer our questions. Both tours last about 3 hours and can be a bit tiring especially with the very hot weather in summer, so make sure to bring water and put on sunscreen.

Great Tour!!. Really enjoyed the walking tour of Buenos Aires, it was a fantastic mix of history, architecture and local folklore all delivered by a great tour guide Dolores (aka Loli). Thank you so much for a wonderful tour,highly recommended.

EXCELLENT tour of BA!. I can't believe this tour is offered for free (guides work on tips only)! The 2.5hr walking tour was an incredible intro and lesson on the history of Buenos Aires. It was interesting to hear of the different struggles, both now and historically, and gain insight into the different architecture, buildings, etc. I definitely would not have enjoyed my visit to Buenos Aires as much without this tour. I cannot say enough about how great it is.Our guide, Loli, was amazing. She was very knowledgable, funny, her English was perfect, and she did a great job managing a very large group. Despite the traffic, we never had trouble hearing her. She was just as enthusiastic in the beginning as she was in the end. She answered everyone's questions and was so patient and kind! I'm going back for the morning tour with her in a few days.
Excellent tour. Excellent tour, the guide (Loli) was fun and knowledgeable. Apart from answering our tour-related questions, she was happy to help with the general planning of the trip

Extraordinary!. Great tour! An actual eye opener if you're familiar with BA.. Tells a lot of peculiar stories about the city in a fascinating humorous manner! I have to say our tour guide Guille was absolutely OUTSTANDING!Made rapport with each and every one of the group (we were around 20), showed he really cared, used a lot of sense of humour and made the time go by in a second! What I must say I loved the most, was the fact he didn't try to be politically correct. He offered a variety of different points of view as well as critisism when needed- and that my friends is the true beauty!

Super interesting tour. We took the 10.30 tour with Martin, who did a great job.He explained every stop on the way clearly, with insight and humour, and took 15 minutes at the end of tour (about 3 hours) to answer our questions on eating & drinking places & further trips.Abs Fab

Fun Free tour. This was the second free city tour of Buenos Aires we went on, the other being with Demasiado Tours. Both were good in their own way. Buenos Aires Free Walks was much more informal and free flowing, while the other was more structured. Like a previous reviewer mentioned it would have been nice if the guide has spoken louder or told us the information in quieter areas since it was sometimes hard to hear over the traffic.

Good tours. We've done the morning and afternoon tours on in be day. Both were good, not super but certainly not bad. Some things that annoyed me a buit: BA is loud, so in order for the whole (big!) group to understand you, the guide sometimes had to yell. It would be better to go to a more quiet place before a long explaination. The afternoon tour could also use a break somewhere in between. And lastly, there are a couple of ways to tell history, one of them is rambling of all the facts and the other is telling the story. While both tours certainly did their best to tell the story, they went back to rambling of facts alot. But again, the tours are certainly recommended.

Very, very good information (and good jokes)!. I did the tour at 3pm, the best I did in this city till now. Our guide was very good, had loads of information und some good jokes. We learnd a lot of Buenos Aires history and how the city is now. This tour is a must!!After the tour we made a group photo. Then the guide helped us with the bus or subway conections. Told us about the best restaurants. Gave us some tips for traveling argentina. And much, much more.So, do it! And it's free, you only pay a tip if you liked the tour!

Highly recommanded. Great way to discover the city and its history. We did two tours in one day and both tour guide (Loli and fernando) were very funny and knowledgeable. Just make sure you wear comfortable shoes!

Really interesting tour, enthusiastic guides . We liked the fact that you can just turn up with no booking. Look for the orange clothing. We did the morning tour with delores (lolli). Tour lasted over 3 hours. It was in depth and interesting. Delores was happy to answer any questions we had . She was enthusiastic and spoke perfect English. You could also do the tour with a Spanish guide if required. Can't recommend this tour enough. We enjoyed it so much that we also did the afternoon tour with fernando. Again he was great tour guide.

Quick but in depth BA. I did the morning and afternoon at the same day with the given time limitations of my trip and both was great Morning Tour with Loli and afternoon w/Fernando both passionate enthusiastic tour guides. I did the tour Sunday so it was perfect without crowd and traffic. Free but one wants to honor the effort of young sympathetic guides . Definitely recommend.

Awesome way to discover the city. I did the tour this morning with Dolores and I highly recommend it. She will guide you through the city, telling you a lot about the history and politic. Really fun and enjoyable. Don't hesitate !

Brilliant fun. I did both the downtown and recoleta free walking tours and thought they were brilliant! They give you a great feel for this beautiful city. There was always a good story, a joke or even s song to keep you entertained. Highly recommend it....

Excellent tour. We did the morning tour with Guillermo (not sure about the spelling!). This guy is amazing - brilliant clear presentation in perfect English by an intelligent, knowledgeable and amusing young man. Loved it! Please tip well if you do this tour - they are doing a great job.

Very informative, but depends on the guide. We did both tours - morning and afternoon to learn the most about the city.Morning tour was probably the best and was taken by a guy called "Keeshee" (spelling?)He was really fun and a great guide with plenty of knowledge and wit.He also recommended out best ice-cream ever on the trip - Arkakao.The afternoon tour was also pretty good, very informative, but maybe a little long - and the guide wasn't as fun. Still worth doing though.

Wonderful Informative Tours of Bs As. I did both of their walking tours (not on the same day... you'd be insane for trying that), and both were amazing. Unfortunately I can't remember my guides' names (both men), but they were both very knowledgeable about the city, country, and their history. Having this knowledge really help you appreciate the city a lot more. Both tours ran a little long - 3.5 hours each when I went, so don't pack your schedule. Tip well!
Best Free walking Tours 11am $ 5pm. Great Guides Both Woman. And gave you the History of the Area we covered, very good. Do not miss these Tours

It all depends on your guide.... We took the 10:30 am tour and had a male tour guide, his name escapes me but it started with an M. He was difficult to hear and understand at times and had a very dry sense of humor and personality. We tried to stick with the tour but after about 2 hours (and only 1/2 way through the tour) couldn't take it anymore and departed ways.

THE introduction to Buenos Aires. I did both the 10:30 AM tour (Retiro, Recoleta) as well as the 3:00 PM tour (City center). I would highly suggest doing these tours in your first two days in BA - the information grounds you in context (history/culture) that would enrich the rest of your trip.There is some overlapping information (BA history) in the two tours, but the focus is very different. The 10:30 AM tour is much more focused on architecture and general history. The 3:00 PM tour seems much more focused around politics/city history of BA.

Forget the bus tour and do this instead. I stumbled upon this company during my second visit to BA, after a slightly dissatisfying experience with the paid for city tours, especially the open-top bus when I was last here (lengthy queues, superficial commentary) which meant I still didn't feel I had any handle on the city. The walking tours are very much the opposite experience. Although they are notionally a tour of a particular part of the city, the locations you visit are really prompts for the guides to talk about the history of the city and its people. There are two tours and while they visit different areas, the guides seem to have agreed to cover different subject matters on each tour.The morning tour starts from the Theatre Colon and makes its way via the war memorial and the English Tower to Recolleta Cemetery. The commentary is more about the culture and the people. The afternoon tour starts from the National Assembly and ends at the Pink Palace. As you might expect the commentary here is more about the history, politics and socio-economics.The tours are advertised as two and half to three hours, but our morning tour ended up taking over four hours as we picked our way around strikes, demonstrations and protests by the indigenous peoples at the war memorial. You certainly get a feel for Argentina’s turbulent politics and economics.Just a couple of pointers; tip generously at the end, bring comfortable footwear and something to drink. Also I think these tours are not really for families with young kids, they probably will get bored. And most importantly don't wear a union jack t-shirt when you’re visiting the war memorial (as one of our group did!)

Must do if visiting Buenos Aires. You simply must do this if you visit BA, the afternoon tour with Martin was a great trip through the history and politics of the nation, and the morning tour with Guillermo runs through the structures and culture that were built by those responsible for shaping the nation. Much better than any paid tour guide, and very honest and unfiltered. Both guides had excellent recommendations on food, activities, etc that also worked out well for us. 5 stars, so glad we found this.

Keep up the good work Guys!. Fernando is just all that BA is about: funny, lively, cultivated, knowlegable and cool! He can give his own insight of the city as a local should. Just enjoyed it a lot and the 3 hour walk went by in no-time! A must if you want to know a bit more about the historical, cultural and architectural aspects of this city, from the Discoveries to recent Contemporary History.

Great Way To UNDERSTAND Argentina!. As I've written in other reviews, I think it's a good decision to book a tour of a new city with a local as quickly as possible. Some tours will take you through churches and museums, while others will give you an incredible, inside perspective of the country and city you are visiting.Martin was our guide and he was tremendous. He's well studied, thoughtful, engaging, humorous, and incredibly interesting. He provided an explanation of the history of Argentina and its current status in a remarkable way. He's passionate about sharing his historical acumen and explaining the subtle aspects of the culture especially in Buenos Aires. If you are an American taking this tour - bring dollars. It's a free walking tour, so they work for tips. You pay whatever you think the experience was worth. Given the instability of the peso, I think paying in dollars is a special way to share appreciation for such a memorable tour.
Enthusiasm. Maru kept the group going even through a massive street protest march! Big lungs in a tiny smart package. Well done and worth the time.

A must-do! Especially good for the beginning of a visit. Interesting and insightful tour. Especially good at the beginning of a visit so you can take note of places you want to return to. Be advised- tour is 2.5ish hours
