The most informative and interesting tour of your life!. I thought this tour might be quite short and give me just a little insight into Buenos Aires interesting mix of buildings... But it was so much more than that. It was a captivating recap of Life as a BA local, an Argentine and a brief history of all the political scandals and romances that have plagued BA since it was 'discovered' by Europeans.3 hours later - I could have stayed listening to Martin (a porteno born and raised) for three hours more. Well worth the time & well worth giving them an enormous donation. It is knowledge I hope to take with me.

Great time and interesting information. I did the morning tour with Maru. Our group was very small and she made the experience fun and very interesting. She is a history book! Loooooved how she explained small details about the city and she never had a problem answering all our questions. The afternoon tour with Guillermo was fun as well. He is upbeat and givea you fun facts about the city.Tour absolutely recommended and if you can do it with any of these guides, your experience will be even better.

Go and discover Buenos Aires!. Our guide was Dolores, I never saw a person telling so enthusiastic about her city . It was nice to discover new small places in Buenos Aires and getting a lot of information. I will recommend this tour to all of my friends!

Best walking tour. This was the best walking tour that I and my wife have taken. Guillermo made the tour outstanding because of his knowledge and energy. He not only explained everything but encouraged discussions. You had to be impressed.

Strongly recommended!. I have took the afternoon tour with Martin. I was already expecting a lot after the morning one taken previous day but this one even better. He gave a lot of information that allows to understand the Argentinians better. I got a background abour history staying in the historical places and now I remember what they really are.I reccomend to take this tour on your first day of staying in BA.

Excellent tour. Great concept. A great tour, with a superb guide ("Lolly"). Struck a good balance between informative and fun and gave an interesting insight into the history of the city without feeling too much like a school lesson! On our first day in BA we tried to see the city using a map and our guide book, which ended up being a long, tiring and unproductive day. Don't make the same mistake we did and do the tour first, then explore under your own steam.
So, so good. A must-do. We did the city tour (recoleta tour is on the agenda for today). It was so informative. Loved the political, historical, social-political info. And: our guide maru was great.

Awesome!. Great introduction into the city! The tour guides are local, young and energetic people willing to show people what is the best in the city. They are speaking with a passion, giving the overview on the history of this beautiful country to make us understand how it influenced the architecture, the clture, the political decisions etc... each of tours lasts ca 2-3hrs, depending of the group needs. For me it was the best way of initial city exploration!

Excelent!. An excelent free walking tour in Buenos Aires! We were a big group of around 35 people and the guide Guillermo was fantastic and cool he knows perfect and clear English he is very funny and had the answers for every question! he showed us the city at it best parts and didn't leave before each one of us asked him a few questions about what we can do later to enjoy the city! really good guide and good company I would recommend! Have Fun!

Great walking tour. Fantastic tour. William (if that was his real name, he gave a few..) was great, very energetic and funny and presented the information in a very entertaining way.This tour was the best thing we did in BA.

Good Walking Tour of Tribunales, Retiro and Recoleta. The tour was quite good and covered a lot of ground with well-spaced stops and great explanations from our guide, Loli.The best part was the excellent historical-political commentary from Loli. I am Argentine (was doing the touristy thing for the benefit of my non-Argentine wife) and found her explanations of the political system, the class divisions, and especially the Malvinas-Falklands conflict to be excellent, neutral, and nuanced. On these touchy topics it is hard to be both an engaging tour guide as well as an accurate historian. Loli was excellent. You will learn a lot about Argentina, not just about the beautiful buildings and parks.I asked privately and was told that the average tip is 55 AR$. I thought the tour was worth a bit more (and tipped commensurately, in dollars).
Perfect tour. Dolores made a great experience of Buenos Aires for us. She's very professional, kind and full of energy so this is what you get in this tour.

A great morning walking tour. It was a beautiful sunny day and Guillermo who was our guide was very knowledgeable, funny, very willing to answer everyone's questions and even recommended a great tango spot that night. It is a great way to see the city and I will be going on the afternoon free walk this afternoon. Guillermo is a great guide!

Fantastic free walking tour. We did the walking tour today with William (although he gave us so many names I'm not sure if this is even correct?). He was a great guide, very knowledgable about BA, funny and always made sure everyone was having a good time. At the end of the tour he hung around, answering everyone's questions and giving great recommendations. We have done a few of these walking tours in south America and this one was definitely one of the best! Highly recommend.m

Must do in BA!. My husband and I went on this tour at the beinning of our trip and it was spectacular. Guillermo was unbelievably knowledeable, enthusiastic, thorough and highly entertaining as well. We learned so much about the city and its people. Highly recommend!

Informative and fun. This is a fun, free and socialable way to get to know BA. Dolores is really smart and she can answer any question. The two tours shows yoh a variety of thing- culture and history. You also meet a lot of travellers
Informative and fun tour. Guillermo was a great guide. He's knowledgeable and funny. It was a long tour, and on other tours, I might have gotten a bit bored, but I enjoyed the entire tour.

This is the way. Fernando was excellent. These guys are the people you need to know. It was fun, interesting and very professional. You don't even notice how much you walked on this tour, you feel tired maybe at the end, but not during the tour because they are so much interesting. Bravo...

Both tours... Both excellent!. We did both walking tours and found them equally as interesting, the guy that did the historic tour was extreamly knowledgable about every minor detail of his tour...excellent! Personally I actually preferred the Recoleta tour but tgat was not to do with the guide in anycwY just because I was more interested in the area... The only thing I eould mention on the Recoleta tour is that you shouldn't take us to a "frappe" shop but then recommend not to have a frappe as they take too long... Just arrange to stop somewhere else!Well done guys!

My number one recommendation in BA . I did both the morning and afternoon tours. Both were extremely informative in terms of history and architecture, while also lots of fun with great local advice. Both guides were from BA and spoke perfect English. I would suggest doing the afternoon tour first, Then the morning one the next day or something as the afternoon one is a great introduction to the city. But either way, don't miss either of these tours!!!

Unforgettable!!. Very good presentation by speakers Dolores and Martin! There is no better way to get to know history, architecture and touristic points in Bs As!!! Really loved the experience. Strongly recommend.

Terrific tour and learning experience. The free walking tour was very enjoyable few hours and we learnt a lot about the history of Buenos Aires and Argentina. Fernando was a great guide and loved cracking some bad jokes! Haha. Definitely recommended.
Great experience. It was a great walk and we learned so much about the city and Argentina. So many interesting places and stories.Thank you Guillermo for being our Google machine this morning!

Two very good walking tours.... We did both the morning and afternoon walking tours. Two guides with very different styles, but both friendly and knowledgable. Very hard to argue with the price when you can decide what to give after the event.Recommended.

Free Walk morning tour. Do it with Guillermo, i began to understand the espirit of Buenos Aires after this very profesionnal and entertaining tour. He is going to slightly introduce you in the culture mentality of this city in a way taht you will get to love Buenos Aires

Both Walking Tours. I really enjoyed the first one that I did on September 18 2014 in the morning. I believe I had Loli. She was really great, her English is amazing and she had great fun facts for you and she welcomed more questions and was very knowledgeable.The afternoon tour I took on September 19 2014 with a girl who it was her first time doing the tour and her English was not the best. Therefore it was hard to understand her and she needed to project her voice more. She was really nice, just I think with more practice her tours will get better.

Perfect walking Tour with Loli. Our morning walking Tour was absolutely perfect. Loli was very knowlegable and had interesting stories about Buenos Aires history and architecture on our way to Recoletta. She really went out of her way telling us all about Buenos Aires. It was the best free walking tour we ever had. Strong recommendation!And: unlike others, this walking tour is actually really a free walking tour. We were never asked about a tip, but we were happy to give an appropriate amount at the end of the tour.

Great Introduction to BA. The morning tour gave us a great introduction to Buenos Aires. The tour guide was great, thank Guille (Guishe)! Although being in a very large group, he managed greatly, not losing anyone and making sure that everyone could hear him. He delivered great explanations and histories of BAs, gave us great tips and answered all the questions of group (40+ persons). Would definitely recommend the tour!

Excelent way to know the city. I did the Recoleta tour and I enjoyed so much because I could see some parts of the city by an Argetinian guy called Guilhermo. He is a very funny guide, that could show us interesting informations about the places we visited. I recommend the walking tour.

Tour around Buenos Aires.. I took the first toor on my first day in Buenos Aires. I was fascinated because we had a professional tour guide. His English was sort of British and always being extremely funny. He didnt even told us the story of the monuments, also a bunch of information about Buenos Aires and Argentina. If you travel alone is a great opportunity to make friends just like I did. I took one morning tour and another day one noon tour. They gave me the best impression of Buenos Aires. I highly recommend this tour for people all ages. All countries. No matter what your native language even if its spanish. By the way, I follow them on my facebook and it seems that they will have Spanish tours coming soon. How cool! I was there during the polar wave in July. So make sure for winter to take something really warm with you otherwise you wont enjoy the tour that much. You need to tip them whatever you feel like.

Great way to see the city. We did the morning tour from Teatro Colon to Recoleta with Dolores. She was excellent - really enthusiastic and full of historical knowledge of the city. Highly recommended!

Free Walks always the best!. I recommend free walking tour for all of my friends!!! The best way to enjoy the place is do the free walking at the first day of the trip!!! You have the chance to ask for your guide important things that really make difference, you can make friends from other countries and share experiences. Guilhermo, was a fantastic guide... hope met him again soon!Thanks!!!
Great view of the city!. Did the morning tour with Lolli and it was great, can really recommend it to anyone who wants to see the city by feet and at the same time get historical inputs! :)

Best Walking Tour yet!. My review is a bit late, but that means nothing, Lolli did a fantastic job! There were great sights, loads of information and history, but best of all we had the best guide! Loli is so enthusiastic and welcoming, it was an absolute pleasure spending time with her. Anyone visiting BA should do this tour.

Great walking tour. Great tour with Fernando! We walked around the Recoleta area for almost 4 hours. One could thing it is too long but Fernando made it just great! We learnt about the history of Buenos Aires but he also shared fun anecdotes which made the experience super entertaining. I def recommend trying it out :)

Awesome tour guides. Guillermo was an amazing tour guide, extremely knowledgable and entertaining! This was a great way to get jntroduced to the city and to learn a lot about the past, present, and future of Buenos Aires.

Connects all Buenos Aires. Great tour! super clear, in 2 hours you get to understand the main touristic points of the city, and connect the history, politics, and arts of Buenos Aires! Great tips for places to go visit later!

Overview Tour. This walking tour was a nice way to orientate yourself in Buenos Aires. We saw many landmarks and learned about the history in just a few hours. As a sidenote, we also did a paid city tour later in the week with Buenos Aires Concierge and felt they were similar quality tours.

Interesting way to know the city. The tour is interesting if you want to have a special vision about the city and know more about its history and you are gonna have a chance of knowing different people.
nice way to discover the city. we did both the morning and the afternoon walk. Martin and Dolores did a great job in explaining many details and also some funny stories about the city

Free walking tour with Hernando. I have recently participated in the Wednesday morning walk and the Thursday afternoon walk around Buenos Aires. Hernando's personality and knowledge combined with his skilled presentation of all the interesting information made the time very enjoyable. His interpersonal skills brought the group together. So not only did we learn and enjoy our few hours learning about Buenos Aires and Argentina, but we had the opportunity to meet and talk with fellow travellers. I highly recommend you join in with Hernando on one of these walks.Anne, Australia
A lot of walking fully worth it. Best option to see quite a bit of the city and get aquainted with BsAs architecture, history and politics!

Informative guides. This was a great way to explore the city and meet fellow travelers. We did the morning and the afternoon tour (not recommended to do both on the same day). Both tours were great and both guides were very informative. Really relaxed atmosphere and great way to meet some other people. Gives you a good overview of the city and it's history.
Great way to see the city. Had a fab three hours wandering round the city. Saw some very cool bits of architecture and visited places definitely off the main tourist routes. Highly recommend.

Discover B.A. in a fun, relaxed way. There are two different tours offered of Buenos Aires (morning and afternoon); I took the morning one. It was very extensive, very informative, and very interesting! The guide (Dolores) was very knowledgeable, about more than just the historical attractions. She also offered helpful travel advice and tips, and offered very comprehensive and interesting explanations of the history and culture of Buenos Aires, including current perspectives. She was a very captivating personality and really inspired lots of group camaraderie. I ended up exchanging lots of helpful information about other cities with other members of the tour and really felt like I had made new friends when the tour was over, not to mention I really have a grasp on the founding of Buenos Aires, and its evolution through the years. If you want to learn a lot about the city in a fun and relaxed way, I highly recommend this tour! (Just one final recommendation: be sure to bring plenty of money with which to tip the guide -- trust me, the quality of the tour and service will make you want to tip big when the tour ends!)
Brilliant way to start your time in Buenos Aires. The guide Delores (Lolly) was wonderful! She was knowledgable but with a great sense of fun. A great start to our time in BUenos Aires!
Best way to discover BUE off track. Dolores was just great, good entertainer and interesting person.Great job Lolly and I look forward to do the afternoon tour on my next visit in October

A great service to Buenos Aires. I did both the morning and afternoon tours with Fernando and thought that they were amazing. Firstly, Fernando is a great guide: friendly, funny and informative. He makes a real effort to get to know everyone on the tour and remember where you are all from. His English is exceptionally good too. And I have to mention here, in reference to a previous reviewer, he DID NOT at any point mention tipping or money at all. And if you don't like what you're getting, you are free to leave the tour at any point!The tours last around 3-4 hours, but you do not feel exhausted by this at all. On the way, you get to see the different architectures, visit different neighbourhoods and learn political and cultural history. We got to go in some of the buildings that I imagine would be difficult to do without the tour guide. For example, we got to go in Cafe Tortini, the oldest coffee house in the city that has maintained its original features. The queue for this coffee house was down the block, but Fernando arranged for us to go in small groups to take pictures. On the afternoon tour there were 20 people and on my morning tour there were 12 people. Although the afternoon tour didn't feel crowded, I preferred the morning tour as we seemed to jell better and get on more. What I really loved was meeting and chatting to different people from all over the world and I loved the fact that there were people from Buenos Aires who wanted to improve their English, meet new people and experience their own city.Fernando was a great guide and clearly passionate about what he did. When the tour ended he offered up loads of tips and recommendations and was happy to answer any questions (throughout the tour too!) I thought the tours were fantastic and donated 200 pesos.

Great tour.. I took the morning tour yesterday and it was great and very relaxed. The guide was informative and funny and the city its just beautifull. I recomend it for everyone visiting Buenos Aires.

A highlight for Buenos Aires. I joined the morning tour without much expectations and within minutes of meeting our guide you could feel the passion she has for her city. Loli is a wealth of information about Buenos Aires; its history, culture, and the psyche of the people. She pointed out many interesting facts along the way that one would never notice otherwise. We were a large group of ~35 walking through the busy streets of BA, Loli was attentive to each person and made sure we could all hear. The tour was very insightful and enjoyable. I returned the next day for the afternoon tour and lucked out with Loli leading the tour once again.
A real must for off track visitors. Dear Dolores, also called Lolly, the walk this morning was just great.We could feel your passion for your city. Gracias.

Excellent city tour !. We had a great tour with Fernando who was very funny and informative. Gave us a lot of insight into the history of BA and pointed out many great places to visit. Would recomend this tour to anyone.

Great way to get to know the city. Quick and fun. Great way to get to know the city if it's your first time: the guides have some pretty interesting pieces of information and as they're locals, they feel proud of their own city so that makes it even more interesting and they can advise you on anything you need because they completely know what they're talking about.

The best way to visit Buenos Aires!. We already knew free walking tour and I think that the idea is fantastic if the guide is up to the situation. And Dolores, our guide was absolutely one of those!She is a very enthusiastic and well prepared girl that introduces us into the atmosphere of the city mixing history and architecture with many interesting stories of the city! We join her at the morning tour and although the tour was quite crowded she was able to be listened from everybody and to satisfy every curiosity!Absolutely a not miss!!!

Great Experience. I did a morning walk that was really nice. The guide really knew his architectural history and made sure to connect with everyone in the group. He was thoughtful in that he stopped in places with shade or sun so people could be comfortable with either. I'm planning to be back in a few days and am going to do the afternoon tour as well. You won't find these tours in the major hotels because they want you to pay for their own tours, you can't go wrong with these - tip what you think the tour is worth.

Free tour. Very knowledgable guide, our guide Fernando knew about the history of the city extensively and seemed to really have a passion for sharing it with us. The only criticism I had was that the day we went there was quite a large group and it was hard to hear the guide and was a little uncomfortable walking around with so many other tourists.
Awesome sightseeing. Very fun and educational walking tour around Buenos Aires. Fernando, the guide was great. Highly recommended! :)
Awesome. Best way to really understand Buenos Aires history and to see the city as it should be seen :) wonderful experience ... Highly recommended

Amazing way to see the city. I did the afternoon tour and I have no complaints. It was a great and informative way to see the city and doesn't cost anything. With that being said, everyone should definitely tip because the guides are so knowledgeable and they allow you to see Buenos Aires from their perspective. I've already recommended the tour to my friends and family and will continue to do so! Thanks for making my stay in BA much more enjoyable!

informative tours. I took the morning tour of the Recoleta neighborhood. Fernando was our guide and his English was very good. Very friendly as well and wanted us to get to know each other too so we were not just a bunch of mutes "stalking him" as we roamed the streets of Buenos Aires. He takes you to all the major sites but then also takes you to things you would not be able to see from the main roads. Fernando (as I am sure all the guides too) knows a lot of information about the history so feel free to ask the guides questions. The tour ended in Recoleta Cemetery and i thought we would part ways there, but they actually take you inside and show you some of the mausoleums and tombs, including the one of Evita. At the end Fernando also gave us some recommendations of places to eat and how to get there. I have done walking tours before in South America and this was one of the better ones I have done!

Brilliant way to see the city. We did both the morning and afternoon tours with BA Free Walks and were glad that we did. It was the perfect way to get the history of the city, see the sights and meet some people all at once. The guides had excellent English and were clearly very enthusiastic about the city. Mariano in particular had a wealth of knowledge to pass on and his afternoon tour was one of the highlights of our stay. Would have no problem recommending these tours to everyone.

Amazing tour!. We went for the morning Recoleta tour with Mariano, which last for as long as 3 hours, but you wont even notice it! The tour guide sure does know his way around Buenos Aires, and knows his Argentine history! What I´ve found to be the highlight of this tour is the part where he takes you through Kavanagh passage right next to Plaza St Martin right into a HIDDEN (beautiful) church, which is unheard of by most porteños!!! I definetely reccomend this walking tour! Since it´s a free walking tour, you are expected to tip the tour guide at the end!

A wonderful experience!. I've taken free walking tours all over Europe, but Mariano and Guillermo put on two of the best. Make a day of it and do both tours! They really pay attention to you. I'm a history teacher and Mariano gAve me a recommendation on a book about Juan Peron. You get to see all the major sights but you get to learn why they're important from a local eager to share their city. Well done!
Great Tour, Enthusiastic Guides. We did both of the free tours with Free Walks and loved them both. Really fun, groups a good size and really knowledgeable guides.

Amazing. We took the morning tour, and cannot recommend it enough. Buenos Aires is beautiful in itself, but when you have a friendly and informative guide to take you through and explain what you're seeing, it increases the experience x10. Myself and my wife were blown away by what we were seeing and would like to thank Loli for the experience. Very highly recommended.

Good city tour. Had a nice time on this tour with Loli. She was friendly and told us about the history of the city and culture. It was a nice way to start off our stay in Buenos Aires. Like the name suggests this was a free tour, and is tip based, so you only pay what you feel it was worth. Highly recommended.

The best tour. I went for the afternoon tour, our guide was Dolores. She was amazing story teller and very enthusiastic. We heard a lot of interesting stories about the city and country, she was able to answer all our questions! I would definitely recommend this tour to everyone who is visiting Buenos Aires.

Fantastic Tour. I have spent a lot of time in Buenos Aires but I have never been on any tours. This was GREAT! Guillermo our tour guide was such good fun and informative we all had a great time and a bunch of strangers parted as friends. I had a thoroughly great time and I highly recommend this tour. But I would strongly recommend you ask for Guillermo you will not be disappointed or bored for one second. Thanks for a great day! Teresa

loli is the best!!. we had a great time doing the walking tour with Loli! Its the best way to get a good basic understanding of the city and to see many of the best sites in a morning. Loli was smart, funny, objective, and very insightful about the city, its history, and culture! I would recommend it to anyone!

Great tour. I really enjoyed these tours. Did both morning and afternoon tours with the same guide Guille. He was very informative and you could tell he was genuinely interested in the information he was giving you. Not just reeling off information that he had read in a guide book.  I can't speak for the other guides in the company but I would strongly recommend these tours with Guille.

Good walks. This is a free walking tour. We went on both the morning and afternoon walk. Each was about 3 hours long. Fernando in the AM and Onno in the PM were our guides. They were both very informative. The walks center around the history of BA and the architecture. If that is what you like I highly recommend Free Walks. They do a great job and it is free. Of course you should tip them well since they don't get paid.

Best free walking tour in town. I strongly recommend this activity. Both tours are very good, the morning and the afternoon . Interesting and complete. The guides are very friendly and know lots of stuff.The best thing is that if you are traveling solo, this is the best way to meet your next travel buddies!

Best free walking tour in BA. We had Guillermo for a Sunday morning tour and we really enjoyed it. He was a very talented guide with impeccable English. His passion for his city was infectious and he gave the best overview of the city's past we encountered among many such tours. He also spent a very long time after the tour answering questions and drawing maps for everybody, way beyond the call of duty. A word of advice for any readers, do this tour immediately upon arriving in BA. They will give you so much advice on what to do during your stay that it would be foolish to leave it until the end when your time may be limited. No matter how much research you do yourself it will not come close to what you will learn from Guillermo and his colleagues.

You just can't lose!. Guys... absolutelly the best option for tours in Buenos Aires, the guides are very good trained, they know A LOT about the history of the city, art, architecture and varieties. The plus is that they can give the tour in english, which is a plus for those ones that don't speak Spanish. They can tell you about everything at the city with a big smile in their faces... just lovelly guys!A very good option for all the family, backpackers and travellers of all ages!Don't give tips under 100 pesos, PLEASE! totally worth it!Guillermo es un Genio! Congratulations for being such a great guide!

The morning tour!. Really joyful and entertaining! Dolores was a great host! Would recommend to anyone who ask... A 3 hours walking where you can see the most historical places in BsAs... Can't wait to take the second tour!
Walk through history. A walk through the history of latin america, miss Dolores, although the painfull name, made the walkthrough without any suffer.Nice activity to do at porteno's city
Dolores is the best. We had such a great time with Dolores, she made the trip very light but at the same time with a lot of information!! Really great to have this tour

Highlights in Bs. As.. It's much better than I imagination. I attended both morning with Fernando and afternoon tour with Mariano. You won't believe how informative and knowledgeable they are. They are just like the one who build this city. I highly recommend to join this tour. It will be one of your unforgettable memories.

A great cultural and informative introduction. For me this tour was a summary of the lonely planet for buenos aires. We visited the typical touristic attractions but were also given advice on great places to wine and dine and go out. We were also advised on safety and common scams that can happen in buenos aires. It is perfect for every type of traveller from the budgeting backpacker to the business man as you can pay nothing or tip as much as you want depending on how much you think it was worth. Our guide Guillermo was great he had really interesting facts, good jokes and spoke fantastic English. I would really recommend doing his tours on your first day in buenos aires and then the other days you can visit Palermo and other places.

fabulous. That's a perfect way to learn about the city! Our guide, Guillermo, presented us the information in such a way (mixed with jokes and laughing and not overloaded with formal and hard to memorize data) that I still remember most of it! And I really feel that I've got a better understanding of Buenos Aires and its citizens. And my only regret is that I could only visit the Recoleta tour and had no time for the Center one. Thank you so much!

An adequate tour. We went on the Recoleta tour and were somewhat underwhelmed. The guide was nice, but not hugely engaging. The places this tour visited were ok, and the information given gave you an overview, but I didn't feel like I learnt much interesting information for my 3 hours. Definitely wouldn't be rushing back for another tour with these guys.

Buenos Aires free walking tour. We took the afternoon city tour in English. Our guide was Onno, a tall Dutchman. He had great knowledge, clear delivery and passion for the city. Simply the best city guide we have ever had anywhere. The tour is not free, you are expected to tip. This was a 5 star tour.

An experience you don't want to miss out on!. I was born in Buenos Aires but have lived abroad. I didn't have many expectations but I was amazed by how interesting, fun and informative the tour was. I would highly recommend this tour to everyone.

Astonishing!! wonderful tours. We joined the afternoon tour with Loli and it was great. She gave us an excelent tour a perfect dosis of history architecture and fun. The balance between information and funny comments was very good so the tour didn't lack a good historical perspective of the city but was not boring or overwhelming. The second day we joined the morning tour with Guille, a very enthuasiastic guide that hold our attention for three hours without failing in answering all the questions our group was throwin him (almost 20 ppl), The morning tour is a little bit longer but we made a stop at a nice cafe to rest for a while. We recommend doing the tour as soon as arrive to the city as it is a perfect introduction to understand everything you can find in BA. Also remember that guides rely on their skill to earn their tips so award them well if you are satisfied (as we did)

Excellent walk - highly recommend. Mariano was very clear in his English, spoke loud enough to hear and kept the right balance of enthusiasm for subject, humour and interest.Good pace & blended historic with amusing and interesting facts about life in BA Finished near the famous cemetery so perfect spot to end as could then do tour of that area tooHighly recommend.

Free walking tour with Fernando at 3pm. The free walking tour in the afternoon at 3pm was fantastic and well worth it. We did both walking tours on separate days (10.30am and the 3pm) and much preferred the 3pm one. Fernando was very informative, charismatic, funny and spoke excellent English. He thoroughly explained about Argentina´s history, economy, politics, culture and architectural structures. He encouraged us view Buenos Aires in an interesting way. I would definitely recommend this tour, especially with Fernando!

My best experience in BA. I live in the province of Buenos Aires very close to the city, so I know it very well. My brother came from Europe and he told me about the free walking tours so we just looked for one here and we joined the BA free walks. Our guide in the morning was Mariano and then in the afternoon Loli. Both of them were really kind and funny and did a great job, obviously as an argentinian I knew many of the things told about argentine history but we got really surprised because they showed us some hidden stories and interesting facts and also we realized how amazing is the city for any one coming from the outsise. Basically as a local there are many things you normally ignore but after joining this tour my way of seeing my own city changed. We are really thankful to the BA free walks stuff for such a good insight to our city and amazing lesson of history and architecture with an excellent balance of information and fun!!

The Antique Market every Sunday. If you ever go, there are of course many things to see and do, but no matter what take a cab ride to Plaza Dorrego. Here you will find the greatest flea market of all times and everything is very old, coins, books, locks and keys, jewelry and even some great local food.

Great Morning and Afternoon Tours!. We did the afternoon tour with Guillermo and the morning tour with Dolores the next day. Both guides were very charismatic with excellent English, interesting anecdotes and happy to answer any questions about Buenos Aires and Argentina in general. Would recommend these tours to anyone new to Buenos Aires.

Great overview of BA's Golden Age neighborhood. I did the morning tour through Recoleta with Mariano and he did a great job. Great blend of anecdotes, information and historical information. He even managed to talk about a bit of architecture without being boring! He has a subtle sense of humor, which I appreciated.Also did the afternoon tour with Guile and he was awesome as well. Although really animated, loud and fun, he still conveyed a lot of interesting information in a clear and understandable way. This tour covers aspects of the dramatic political history of BA, but also includes stories about some sights and buildings and general cultural information.

The perfect way to learn more about this beautiful city. I walked around the city the day before i went on the afternoon walk with Guile. It was great to go to some of the same places and then be able to learn more about the things i had already seen. Guile was a great guide. He spoke great english and was always open for questions and discussions. I recommend bringing water and wearing good shoes.

Great Morning Tour. After doing a bus tour we decided to pick up a walking one. We joined the morning tour to Recoleta of the BA free walks, and it couln't be better!! Our guide mariano was very funny and knowledgable showing us some of the most beautiful sights of Buenos Aires with really good explanations mixing history, architecture and some personal opions about local's culture! The only thing we regret is that we couldn't joint the afternoon tour because we had no time! This tour is tip based so anyone can join, we tipped as BA free walks provided us with a great tour.

Informative and entertaining. I've walked round a lot of BA, however on the tour with Guille I saw things I hadn't noticed and heard the history behind the buildings. The tour was well paced and fun. Guille has very fluent English and really brought the city to life. It was a wonderful few hours.
Nice tour excellent guide. Morning walking with Mariano was excellent covering some history along with architecture. we really enjoyed it.

Excellent free walking tour with "Lolli" Doloris. My colleague and I had 4 days in Buenos Aires, so how would we get to know a city like Buenos Aires? My colleague saw a free walking tour and asked about it. So the next day we went to meet Doloris at the congress and had a special tour through history and architecture. I highly recommend the tour and especially with Doloris. Thank you again!

Melhor Tour de Buenos Aires. This is great way to see the city by foot and hear historical facts from local tour guides. We did both the morning tour with Mariano and the afternoon tour with Guille. Don't miss out on this great opportunity!

Free Walks Buenos Aires Argentina. We are visiting Buenos Aires for 10 days and Free Walks tour has been a highlight of our trip. There is a morning tour and afternoon tourthrough different areas lasting about 3hours each. Our tour guides Mariano in the morning and Dolores afternoon were fantastic, very knowledgable about any questions we had . Wonderful history and archtecture lesson and highlights the important areas to see in the city. Both tours were filled with people from other countries, all ages so that was fun!Highly recommend these tours!

Recomendo. I don´t like doing those expensive tours that all tourists do, and when I saw the flyer of this free walking tour I immedliatly liked the idea. It´s a much more genuine experience. I did the morning walk with Dolores (Loli). My recommendations are that people should take water with them and some snacks, and be prepared for a long walk, because the tour takes almost 4 hours and if it is too hot, it can get tiring.

best way to see BsAs. Me and my travelmates went to both tours, morning and afternoon with Mariano and Dolores. BsAs is already a great city to get to know by foot, but with these two guides it was even better. Their stories and jokes are great!

Excellent tour! Do it!. What a perfect way to see Buenos Aires. Guile was a superb guide--lots of personality, great English, you could hear him well, and he had great stories that brought the buildings and sights to life. I had only one free day and was so glad I did this tour. The morning tour was so fun that new friends from the tour and I shared a cab to the afternoon tour. Wear tennis shoes. Thank you!Elizabeth from Frisco, Texas (visited March 2014)

Great experience!. I took the morning tour on the southern part of B.A, and it was great ! Our guide, Dolores, was really enthusiast about sharing her knowledge and her love for the city. She knew a lot about the building and the history of this beautifull city and had a lot of intersting fact to share about it ; plus she has a really great sense of humour !I really enjoyed visiting the city with the walking tour, it was a great way to meet new people from all around the world and sharing about our travelling experience. Wish all the best to the crew of the freewalkingtours; hope many other will be able to enjoy this great experience with you !

Great way to see BA. We did both the morning and afternoon tours. Both our guides (Dolores and Anna) were enthusiastic, knowledgeable and entertaining. A good way to see BA up close, and to see/understand things that might easily be missed otherwise.
Do it. Did the afternoon tour. Great guide, interesting stories and insights, lots of fun. Don't miss it. What else is there to say?

Great, professional, informative and well managed. Great thanks to Free walks. Yet another fantastic and lovely walking tour.Special thanks to the guide of that day - Loli. She was one of the best guides I have ever had ( I traveled to over 600 cities ).Loli was very inteligent, highly informative, able to link various historical events, movements within history of art and architecture. Very confident, well projected voice, funny and wise sense of hummor. She managed technical aspects very well; pace of the tour, location for exlpalantions.Highly recommended

Tour was so good we did both the morning and afternoon tours!. Highly recommend this free (tip based) walking tour. I have been to more than 6 of these types of tours in Europe and elsewhere and this one certainly lived up to my expectations. We first did the afternoon tour with Guillermo and liked it so much we did the morning tour with Dolores the next day. Each tour covered completely different parts of BA and both guides were friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful.-Rod from NYC
Great tour!. We enjoyed every minute of this great tour in Buenos Aires thanks chiefly to our guide Dolores. She had great knowledge of the city and pretty perfect English. We loved it!
Great tour. I did the morning and evening tours 2 weeks ago with loli, both was great.Very recommended for on budget travelers

Tour with Loli. It was really nice 3 hours tour with Loli,beautiful girl from BA :) , who explained everything during the points of the tour. she was answering our questions and was having jokes with us. She offered us good places where we can eat, places to visit not included in the tour. BA is very big and there are a lot of things to be seen. I definetely recommend this tour and I am waiting to go to the afternoon one. Thanks Loli :)

Don't miss this free tour . Thank you Gaustin for your insightful tour of Buenos Aires. It was lots of fun and very informative. Don't bother with the travel guides , 2 hours on this tour and you will learn everything you need know ranging from the history of BA to how to order a coffee Porteno style.

Excellent introduction to BA!. I did the morning tour to Recoletta and it was great. The guide was friendly and informative giving lots of historical and architectural knowledge of the route and the city. I had already walked all over the city and saw everything but these tours are great for giving you some context and information that you just can't pick up on your own! Plus with this tour you have the afternoon to wander around the cemetery or the art museum nearby both of which I would recommend.

Great tour, great group, great guide. We took the afternoon tour with Guile. We was very very funny and had a very nice way to conduct our group with a strong personality and good sense of humor making us enoy every minute of the 3 hour walk. He told us about the argentine history from the colonial period to the last military dictatorship and we were impressed by his description of the terrible abductions during the las dictatorship. We were really moved. Thanks Guille and BA free walks for the amazing experience!!

The best Tour Experience. Here you will learn interesting facts about Buenos Aires that not many people now and that you wouldn't get in a regular guided tour. The guides are just so awesome, fun and engaging. From the meeting point to the last stop, it is great. Nothing like the regular, non stop boring useless information. The stories and facts they tell are precious.

Wonderful Morning with Mariano. Though the length of the walk was a bit of a stretch for my old body, I loved every minute of it. Mariano gave a wonderful history of the architecture and social mores of the lovely early 20th century inhabitants of Recoleta, the Micro Center and the Theater District. The concept of free tours for tips worked perfectly in our group of people of all ages and nationalities. Not only did we enjoy Mariano's commentary (no problem projecting with our group of 18) but we really appreciated his little tips (try an Alfajor, for example,) and his suggestion of the perfect place for empanadas for lunch. If you can walk briskly for 3 hours, this is the tour for you.

It´s amazing how well you can hear him!. In addition to all the other great reviews I´d like to point out that our guide, Guillermo, was able to speak with amazing volume and clarity. We had a large group of 30 people (including some locals interested in learning more about their city). Throughout the great tour Guillermo was able to make himself heard by the entire group despite horns, traffic, barking dogs, and sirens.

wonderful tour. Great tour with Guillermo! We did it our first day in BA and it was a great way to get acclimated to the city and learn about history and architecture. We saw sites and buildings I wouldn't have appreciated otherwise. I felt the pace was just right, not rushed at all. Great tour, especially for being free - I would have gladly paid for it!

One of the best things to do in BA. We took both the morning and the afternoon tour. In both cases the staff was very honest and knowledgable making a good balance of historical facts, opinions about argentine economy and politics, funny stories and architecture. Also the guide gave us his personal view of a character like Eva Peron- wich is quite complex- in a very clear and sincere way. The historical perspective of the city helps a lot to understand almost anything you will find in the city and the guides are open to receive any questions off topic and personal feedback. After doing several free tours in Europe we think that BA free walks matchs the standar of a high quality tour of this type. Great Job!!

Great Tour With Lots of Background. We had a great tour with Guillermo (Willy) this morning. We did have a little difficulty finding the group due to inaccuracies in Travel Advisor's BUE city guide app map. We were very glad we noticed the group forming on a corner about 4-5 blocks from where the Trip Advisor map said the Theatro Colon should be.Guillermo was very knowledgeable and engaging sharing information about the history and politics of the city. It was a great way to get an overview and background of the areas we visited. Now we have the opportunity to decide if we want to tour any of the sites in more detail. Guillermo made himself very available to answer questions about Buenos Aires and Argentina. He even would mark participant's maps for recommendations or if they were interested in visiting a particular site. The only fee is the tip amount you decide. We paid what we would expect to pay for a paid walking tour. It was worth every penny... errr peso.We stumbled upon Buenos Aires Free Walks completely by accident and are very happy we did. Highly Recommended!

Guides were the best!. My wife told me this idea of joining a free walking tour. This was my first time joining a tour of this type, and I was really surprised by the attituded of the guides who were funny, open minded and gave us a very good historical perspective of the city. We took both tours with Willy and Mariano, and I can imagined the thing we would have missed without them. An important thing to know is that they just work for the tips so it is remarkable how they try to do their best all the time! Obviously we tipped them well to thank them for their great job! Thanks!!

Highly recommended!. We took both tours (the morning and the afternoon one). Our guide in the morning was Guillermo, a very enthuastic porteno (local) who should us many of the beautiful buildings of BA in the way to the neighborhood of Recoleta. He gave us a very good perspective of argentine history and many things that helped us having a good introduction to what to see in BA. His explanations we really clear with a mixture of facts and jokes making the experience relaxed and informal in comparison to a traditional tour. The next day we took the afternoon tour with Mariano (also a porteno as Guillermo). He demostrated that the BA free walks has an excellent staff and all their guides know how to guide really well making the walk enjoyable but without skipping any important historical or political facts!! He was very enthusiastic with a different style and he was very knowledgable about architectural styles showing us the highlights of the city center.Both tours took around 3 hours, we recommend taking both of them in different days. Well done BA free walks, great job!!

A great way to know the city. We spent the morning walking around the north side of the center of Buenos Aires with Dolores. This young lady is an amazing guide. Her knowledge, her fluent English, her manner of presenting the information, her stories and her easy going made the three hours and a half tour pass by fast and easily. This was our second tour in the city and it complemented the first tour to the center perfectly giving a broader view of them city.

Can recommend. My wife and I took both afternoon and morning walks. We started on a rainy Sunday afternoon by Congresso. We were only 2 on walk and had a very personal tour with our guide and I believe a owner of the company.I imagine a tour with 2 participants and 2 guides is not the norm! Anyway we did have a more than excellent tour. The guide was pleasant, knowledgeable, had sense of humor and English was fine.Our second walking starting at Pl. Vaticano by Teatro Colon, the morning tour, was in hot sun and had about 11 participants.The tour was OK for sure, only negative was far too long a stop in some cafe. A quick first stop just to buy some water or cold drink at a kiosk was OK, but we didn´t want to sit almost a half hour in the cafe.Also the tour starting by Teatro Colon should start under big tree across in park to provide shade or shelter from rain.Thanks anyway for 2 really good tours at whatever price the participant wants to pay.

Best way to get to know a wonderful city!. Knowledgeable and friendly guide. Details and architectural gems about the city that aren't in the guidebooks. The best way to get oriented in the city -- on foot. I travel a lot and found this to be an excellent tour. I recommend highly!

Superb!! Lost of information and fun!!. We took the morning tour with Mariano (our guide). First of all he introduced himself and explained us the path of our tour, how long it was going to take (between 3 and 3.5 hours) and what a free walking tour is. He also made a special emphasis on the fact that we could ask him whatever we wanted even if it was something off-topic. We started in front of the Teatro Colon with a small introduction to know why Buenos Aires is called the Paris of South America, wich was very useful for us to understand every later in the tour and the consecutive days we explored the city by ourselves. In Plaza San Martin he told us about the rich families of the old aristocracy of BA mixing information with some jockes and urban leyends on the way. We also had a very good local perspective of the Falklands war. We finished the tour at 2 p.m. (after a little bit more than 3 hours). The distance is fine for any average walker and you won't get tired as there is a stop in a cafe to rest for a while and go to the bathroom in the way. After we finished, Mariano gave us the best recommendations of what to see in Recoleta and we liked so much that he said he would remain in the place (even after the tour was finished) as long as we need to answer all our cuestions and for anything that we needed. Great Job! Highly recommended!

Dolores was great. Wish we had done this earlier. Dolores pointed out a number of things along the way that we had not noticed when walking the same streets, and was also informative about the history of the city and the nation, proud to be Argenine and porteno without being arrogant about it.BCK

Great introduction to B.A and the "porteños". When I travel i always try to do as much as possible to enjoy where I am, so I decided that I also wanted to live that way in my city. So i decided to do the walking tour to learn a little bit more of B.A and to see what is said of this city to people from around the world. Truth is I was impressed, not only because of the guides Guille and Mariano ( they are very funny and very informative as well) but for the rute they chose, showing and explaning everithing you need to know to understand all of the sides of Buenos Aires. A must do if you're in this city for a great introduction. PLus they also give you great recomendations of places to visit after the tour that are close to the locations and other ones thatyou don't want to miss while you're in this city. Top class guys, keep it that way

Great Intro to Life in BA!!. I heard of this walking tour company from a friend and thought I'd try it out on my first day visiting BA. I was not let down! Our guide (Guille) had an outgoing personality and told us lots of interesting facts about the local sites and also included tidbits on the the ying-yanging Argentine economy. I really had a wonderful time and would recommend it to anyone wanting to gain a better understanding of the area's history and culture.

Great guide, great walk. Great walk with "william"our guide or Guilliame his real name I think. Lots of history and explanations given from a passionate knowledgable guide. This is great way to start a visit to Buenos Aires.

A different way to go on a tour. I ´ve been in Ecuador last January, travelling with my friends, and I realised I never took the time to see my own city. That´s why I decided to take this free walking tour. I took both tours with different guides (Loli and Mariano) both of them really different from each other but very informative in their own ways. The tour mixes history, arquitecture, social bacground and lots of friendly advices of how to manage in the city of buenos aires. Also the guides were particularly funny and friendly.

Great introduction to BA. After discovering free walking tours in Europe we now search them out. We really enjoyed this walking tour, with guide Guillermo, taken on our first morning in BA. A great introduction to the areas close to where we are staying in Recoleta, but also to the culture, history politics and economics of the country in general. The anecdotes lend a depth to the experience of visiting a new city, and we will definitely do the afternoon tour as well. Guillermo was knowledgeable, enthusiastic and entertaining, features that seem to be common to these great free walking tour outfits.

Great Free Tour. I took both the morning and afternoon tours. A great way to learn about the history of Buenos Aires and the people that live there. Our guides (Ana & Loli) were both knowledgable and passionate about their city, and their enthusiam was infectious. A must do in B A.

Great!!!. The best way to know the city.( eso es el titulo) I live on the province of Buenos Aires and i only travel to the city to do paperworks and stuff . The thing is a friend of mine from brazil came to Buenos aires and we decided to go on a free walking tour last week. The guide (loli) was super funny and very well informed , she mixed information , with advices and very funny stories. It´s something you MUST DO in Buenos aires!!!

Great free tour. Very informative and interesting insight into the history and Architecture of BA with an enthusiastic and knowledgable tour guide. Good for everyone since you can tip whatever your budget will allow.

Cultural and Fun activity to do in BA!. I love free walking tours and I've taken many all over Europe. Hardly ever have I had so much fun as in this one. Our guide was lovely: friendly, passionate about her city, true to facts, but also willing to speak her own mind about controversial topics, making of the tour a rich experience. I'd really recommend it to any traveller. It's a perfect mixture of history, culture and fun-facts about Buenos Aires and the porteños (the people who were born and raised in BA).
Perfect guide!. Informations about history, architecture and a great attitude to the tourists! Mariano spent with us much more time than was supposed to. I recommend! :-)))

Great way to maximize limited time in BsA. I only had a weekend in Buenos Aires with one day being guided by local friends. They suggested looking into the BA free walking tour for the second day and so glad they did! Ana was our tour guide and she was knowledgeable, witty and gave us a lot of fantastic tips and information. She was at the gate by the Congress building 10 min before the meeting time and greeted us with enthusiasm. At one point when we were by the Casa Rosada, she even gave us insights into a personal history of her mother losing many of her university friends during the military rule, which helped me have a connection to Argentina beyond what I would have gained just by sightseeing. Highly recommend this tour!

History, Culture, Facts & Fun. The guide we had was a native BA & spoke fluent English. She was well travelled, friendly, knew her city in depth and was open to discuss the culture, history, attitudes, money (yes, this is Argentina were even the black market price for dollars is listed in the newspapers) and had some fun facts to keep our group upbeat. She was open to any questions and also showed an interest in getting the group to share facts or experiences about what we had done/seen in BA & Argentina. I believe (forgive me if I am wrong) that her name was Linda/Lydia.

Decent - guides simply stick to script. I enjoy waking tours as it provides an excellent way to get a feel for the city on the first day, so that you can explore it deeper on subsequent days. The tours given by BA Free Walks were decent - and they worked hard so we tipped well still - but we had been spoiled by free walks in other cities including Valparaiso and Santiago that we thought provided much more content. BA Free Walks guides threw out a lot of names and dates but there was a lot more walking than talking, and unlike previous tours where you can tell the guides do a lot of extra reading to teach us random facts about the city - or relevant cultural references - the BA Free Walks guides tend to stick close to script. We did two separate tours and there were a lot of repeated information.

Very Good Tour!. I enjoyed to have an idea about all locations and sightseeing in Buenos Aires and I recomend to all visitors, our guide was very good and we enjoyed a lot as my first time in Argentina

Don't miss it. If you can, take this tour. We went with Guille and he was so fun and informative and passionate about teaching people about this wonderful city. We learned lots. It's a "tip what it's worth" at the end of the tour and we were more than happy to pay. My tips: do this tour at the start of your trip and get lots of advice from the tour guide. Also, take water and sun cream, we wore sun cream but still ended up red!
Great tour! Very interesting!. Willy was a great guide! Funny and interesting. We had a lot of fun. just remember to bring water, sun screen and a hat in the summer, cause its hot!

Find me some shade!!. Had an enjoyable walk in the BA sunshine of 36C this afternoon through the city centre. Luckily managed to find some shade but was hard work. Regardless the tour was great with a knowledgable guide. Loads on the history and architecture and was very knowledgable on building styles. A few more random anecdotes about the sites would make it feel like they are telling secrets you only find out about from a local.

Just do it. My friend and I did both the morning (Recoleta) and afternoon (City Centre) tours with the founder of BA Free Walks, Mariano. His passion for and knowledge of the city was clearly apparent and well expressed in an interesting and sometimes humourous way. He took us to sights and told us anecdotes we wouldn't have experienced otherwise. The pace, number of stops, and routes have been well thought out and appropriate for an average walker - and leaves plenty of time for other activities the same day. It really helped us navigate our way through the city when we were on our own afterwards. We are very happy that we took a tour on foot rather than in a bus. You see so much more and there are many more opportunities to take photos, meet local people, get a good look at architecture and monuments, and experience street life in BA. In an effort to find some constructive suggestion, all I can offer is that the noise of BA's streets occasionally makes it difficult to hear the guide - but that is very minor compared to all the positive aspects of a tour with BA Free Walks - and is easily remedied by standing closer. I hope they expand their tours to other parts of the city by my next visit. I recommend doing both tours - but not in the same day. Please do tip the hardworking guides. Overall, VERY well worth it.

Fantastic way to explore buenos aires historical core. We took both the morning and the afternoon tour with William and Ana .  Both were very knowledgable and super enthusiastic and done a great job to make the tour both fun and informative The tour route covered the major sites . A must do when visiting buenos aires . Thank you willi and Anna .
Excellent tour!. A very good tour to have a glimpse of aregentinean history and important buildings in a very short time. Mariano was a very professional guide!. I recommend this tour.

Great way to get to know B.A. We toured with Dolores during the morning tour. It was so informative, interesting, and we could hardly believe when the three hours were up. We were so happy we took this tour.

its a nice thing to do!. i enjoy my day with my housband and kids, the guides are greate and the information was very useful, i strongly recomend to anyone! lots of good wishes to all! i am in cambodia right now and i really miss buenos aires!!

Best Walking Tour in Buenos Aires. My wife and I went on the free walking tour on December 29. We were interested in learning more about the history of Buenos Aires. Our tour guide Gville made the tour interesting and fun. The tour takes approximately three hours to complete. You get a chance to visit a few of the neighborhoods in Buenos Aires. I personally would recommend this tour for anyone visiting Buenos Aires and if you can take the tour with Gville. He works on Tuesdays and Thursdays. You will not be disappointed.

couple from the US. Just took the afternoon tour. The tour guide Mariano (I believe that's how you spell his name) was super informative, funny and friendly. I couldn't believe this tour was free. I strongly suggest that anyone visiting BA takes one of these tours. Don't miss it!

"Best free walking tour in the universe!". We did the morning tour this morning with Mariano. The tour lasted about 3 hours and we found it to be very interesting. Mariano provided a nice mix of historical information and fun facts. It was very hot, however, he did a good job of stopping at mostly shady spots. He is very knowledgeable of architecture and BsAs history, and shares good information about today's BsAs.This tour packed a lot of information (and a lot of ground - wear comfortable shoes!) into 3 hours and it was a great introduction to Buenos Aires. Highly recommend!

Informative and Fun Tour of the City Center. This was a great way to start our stay in Buenos Aires. It's such a large city, it seems easy for the history and details to get lost in the shuffle. Our guide, Mariano, was knowledgeable and funny and spoke great English. For three hours he took us from the National Congress to the Obelisk, trying to keep us in the shade as it was sweltering, and answering all questions. We tipped him at the end for a job well done.P.S. Also a great way to meet fellow travelers. In addition to the two of us from Seattle, our group consisted of a Swede with her Argentine friend, an Australian, and two South Koreans.

Great start to an incredible city. This is best thing I could have done at the start of my trip to BA. I did this on my second day in BA and our guide Mariano was knowledgable, funny and always helpful. I really recommend this tour to understand the history and culture of this beautiful city.
BA Free Walks. This tour was really good. The guide, Willy, knew what he was talking about and was able to answer all the questions I had about the city, itś people, and itś history.

Amazing. Willy is fantastic. He took us around for 4 1/2 hours told us a lot of the city and the politics as well as the history of the country. For example, he told us the truth about "Evita" who is unlike the person of Madona's Movie...He made a lot of jokes. We recommended the tour to everybody.

It must be all about the guide!. We went on the city tour in the afternoon. We did not have the same guide mentioned in the previous reviews. Our guide did not seem very knowledgable about the tour. We left the tour after one hour as we were so bored. I think our guide spoke for about 5-10 minutes during the hour we were on the tour. Other than telling us the name of the buildings she did not provide much more information. I have been on many free walking tours of cities and I have found them to normally be if a high standard but this was terrible. The next day we went on a walking tour recommend by our accommodation (Buenos Aires Free Tour) it was excellent. It is a free tour so you can vote with you tip, or lack of. I felt the need to review this as the fantastic tour that I went on the next is rated lower than this tour and we did lose an afternoon that we could have used to see more of the city. Free Walks - ensure your guides are all trained to the standard mentioned in previous reviews.

Outstanding!. This tour will be the most informative, and fun, three hours you will spend in Buenos Aires! Our English speaking tour guide, Guille, provided us with history, facts and fun stories and was an absolute delight! The tour ends at the Recoleta Cemetery which we then toured on our own. This is a must do.
Awesome! !. It was a fabulous tour!! I highly recommend this tour.. :) best of best!!

First walking tour, not last. The tour was great. Our guide Guille was full of knowledge, fun and creative. He certainly has the time of day for you and made sure we were enjoying it. I planned at the beginning to bail on the tour if it was crap but proved to be very worthwhile. Highly recommend this.

A great time to spend part of the day!. My boyfriend and I love to do walking tours and especially enjoyed this one in Buenos Aires! Our tour guide Guillermo was fantastic! It was a rainy day but you wouldn't have even noticed because he made it very entertaining and was very informative. I highly recommend anyone go on this tour and take in the beauty of Buenos Aires :)

Revealing and enjoyable. We had already taken a bus tour of Buenos Aires but were glad that we decided to take the walking tour also. The guide was knowledgeable and enthusiastic about his city. His interest in the varied architecture of the city, culture and history helped us see the city in new ways, and afterwards, we noticed features we would otherwise have missed. An enjoyable walking tour.

Awesome tour. Gellermo (hope i spelled his name right) was amazing. Knowledgeable, funny, energetic, and a great tour guide. I typically do prepaid tours, but no more. In addition, the people i met on the tour were super friendly. We had lunch afterwards, and all shared travel stories. I would recommend this over a "paid" tour any day!
Fun time spent. Had a fun and very interesting time. Showing you most of the important things in walking distance and gives further recommendations for eating and going out

Just do it. Having lived in Buenos Aires my whole life, I really got impressed the things I learned at this tour with Guillermo. I've done lots of these tours around Europe and this one is one of the most complete and entertained tours you can do. Don't think twice, just go for it.

Half a day fun & health. I only have half a day to kill and I bumped into this alternative tour. I have done segway/ bicycle tour but this is my 1st walking tour. Mariano is fun to be with & resourceful. He provides some story not commonly known, even by Porteños (we have one in our group :)). We started 15 minutes late as Mariano expects people to come late anyway. The walk itself is not tiring, as there are many stops and the area that was chosen are easily walkable. You can see the route from their website and bring your camera (there are strength in group :)).All in all, I enjoy this tour & it's nice to meet people from different countries.
Karim. We really enjoyed the tour, our guide was Guillermo who is really friendly and passionate about his country. Thanks a lot !!!

lovly !. i really like the day i had with these people, they love what they do and they really put the hard on it. I really love the experience, i strongly recomend to my fellow friends back home!!! Please tell me when u made the second tour ! i will be there!!

Fun & unique experience. I saw a bit if Buenos Aires before taking the walking tour and that gave me a good idea of how much better it is to walk around and take in all the sights with a local who knows the city better than a guide book. We were introduced to the unique architecture of the city that one would miss because it's not on any commercial map and we got to know the local quirks and real perspectives on what's it like to live in BA. Highly recommend taking this walking tour, just come prepared with energy and good walking shoes :)

Excellent walking tour of Buenos Aires!. We just did our second free walks tour and we loved it. Muchas gracias Mariano! Our guide was very knowledgeable about his home city and we appreciated learning about the history and architecture of BA. My Spanish is not good as I am just learning, but Mariano spoke English fluently which we really appreciated.
Brilliant :). Free walks was an amazing tour! The guide was super knowledgeable and kept everyone engaged at all times! Would defo recommend to everyone who comes to Buenos Aires :)
Great walking tour in Buenos Aires!. A great (and free!) walking tour in Buenos Aires. A lot of useful information to get to know the city and its culture. Highly recommended!

Excellent tour - highly recommend it :). Such a great tour! This was the first time I did a free walking tour like this, and it set the standards high. Buenos Aires is a beautiful city with so much to see and do. And Mariano was fun and informative, chose a great route to walk, and you can tell he really loves his city and has a wealth of knowledge about it. I loved the tour and highly recommend it to anybody visiting (or living there, we had some porteños in our group as well!)

Excellent, highly recommended!. Hi all! i just sign in to trip to wish my best to de Free walks crew! i have an incredible tour with Mariano, we trip between streets history and incredible storys about buenos aires. Fully recomended!!

Awesome free tour!!!. This is a must do tour if you are visiting Buenos Aires and want to hear about the city. Guillermo was awesome and helpful throughout the entire tour. Guaranteed to learn some awesome facts and see some of the city's best sites.

AWESOME!. Free Walking Tour in Buenos Aires could not be better! Mariano is such a great person and a non conventional touristic guide, who makes him even better, cause he could show us different places and stories that are unknown ones.Would come back again to have the tour and find out new places!Thanks to him.Cheers,Pedro, Brazil.

Great tour with a great guide. I've only been in Buenos Aires a few months and have already been on a few tours of the city, however this tour was fantastic, not only for the sights, but also for our guide, Mariano's, great insight into the city. The route was perfect, taking in some of the city's most interesting sights, as well as some hidden gems. Over the three hours, Mariano kept the whole group entertained with his sense of humour and interesting facts and stories, which is no mean feat for a group of over 20 people! I'd highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting the city, you won't be disappointed.

Excelent tour!. I did this tour a week ago and it was fantastic! The sights we covered and the way it was delivered by our guide Mariano was incredible! This is a must for tourists that want to get the most out of their days in BA! I live here and i was shocked with how good it was!

Great Tour through very beautifull areas. This was my first Walk with this kind of Tours and was really fantastic; the intinerary was very good, and the way that Mariano did was amazing, the 3 hours and half passed by very fast.I was born in Buenos Aires and I could rediscovered this part of the City.I strongly recommend this tour not only for tourists but for Portenos as well.

Great Tour Very professional. This was my third walking tour during my SA trip and by far the best. I like a tour to keep moving but not feel rushed - 5 this one was on target. Without a guide the charm of the road to recoleta would not seem as interesting. Great way to get oriented to the City.

excelente!. It was so lucky to use this. Our guide was very passionate and he tried to show every aspects of Buenos Aires. I loved this and strongly recommend this to other travelers! Have fun in BA! BA is an awesome city!

Fantastic tour!. As a resident here I've had the chance to go on many walking tours but this was the first free walking tour I've done and it exceeded my expectations 10 fold. Our local guide spoke perfect English, was very funny and knowledgable and even took me round areas of recoleta I hadn't seen, and i used to live there! The pace of the tour was perfect and I didn't feel overwhelmed with information, all in all it was perfect! I recommend bringing a sandwich with you to keep you going over lunchtime as we didn't have a chance to stop anywhere to eat but that was my only gripe about a truly excellent tour. Would recommend this to anyone new to BA as a great way to see the city and meet new people

Wonderful way to spend a morning. I thoroughly enjoyed my tour this morning. It was informative and we covered a lot of ground, not only in the city but through history. Even though its a little long than most walking tours its worth it see so much of the city and finishing at Recolletta is really convienent to see the cemetary, the silver flower and the art galleries.

Excellent city tour of Buenos Aires. I love walking tours, and Buenos Aires Free Walks did not disappoint! I did the tour with Mariano, and he did a really great job of introducing the city to us. The tour covered a lot of places and it did not feel rush at any point. I highly recommend Buenos Aires Free Walks to anyone visiting the city.

3 plazas - 3 hours. Yesterday's tour was really good. I'm glad the group waited at the Colón, because we were running late - I would have regret it!Informative tour about architecture and history of the city and state, hidden places and of course Buenos Aires' dogs secret ;)to be recommended! :)

Great city tour from a local. Our tour of BA was really good. Our guide being born and bred puertnos new the ins and put of the city and had an answer for every question we threw at him. We were informed of the history of BA and sites in the city as well as some other sites off the beaten tourist trail. We ended the tour in recoleta so we could continue ourselves through the cemetery and surrounding areas. Recommend the company after hearing of other dud tours of the city from other travelers in our hostel. PS walking tours are different in South America to ones we have taken in the US so go with an open mind and have fun!
lovly. I really enjoy the day with the guides, they really really love what they do, i recomend the experience to anyone new in buenos aires! lots of good wishes to Barby a great girl!!

I like it a lot!!!. i really enjoy the day with Barbara she was greater guide than the official places! I stayed in buenos aires between 4 to 10of Aug 2013 and really I felt like im at my home I arrived with Greeted warmly and much care about them guests the tour was great i will say i recomend it!

Great day in Buenos Aires!!!!. I love these kind of tours, they are free for you to attend and if you have found it enjoyable then you give your guide a contribution at the end. This means that you get a fabulous guide who provides an excellent tour and delivers it with humour alongside personal anecdotes; Mariano was no exception Also, walking around the city gives a great perspective on a city that often you would not see whilst travelling on the public bus. I have now experienced these tours in Amsterdam, Berlin, Edinburgh and now London - they are definately worth seeking out. Strongly recomended!!!

love it. We enjoy the walk on the 3 hour Free Tour with Mariano which gave an excellent overview to the main sites of Buenos aires and also a synopsis of the city's history. He was very informative and entertaining. We enjoyed the tour so much that we invite him a cofe so he can answer all the questions we have of buenos aires and its history! do the tour with him, the tour is highly recommended.

good introduction to the city. Never having been in Buenos Aires before i decided to do this on my first full day in the city to give me an overview of the place. The tour did not disappoint. The guide, Mariano, was friendly, informative and gave us a interesting tour of the city for 3 hours. It gave me a chance to decide on which other places i wanted to go and see later. This comes highly recommended.

fantastico. My spanish is terrible so I'm going to write this review in english -- I participated in the Buenos Aires Free Walks Tour on 9/1/13 with Mariano as our guide. He was professional yet relaxed and extremely knowledgable about the city of Buenos Aires. The tour is brisk allowing you to see many of the most important sites in the city in a three hour period. I give this tour and Mariano my highest recommendation.Thanks again for a great experience. Peter (USA)

Great tour, definitely do it. I'm studying abroad in Buenos Aires for 4 months, and at the beginning of my stay, my abroad program took us on many tours throughout the city. After doing so many, I felt that I knew a great deal about the city and the information the tour guides could offer me. About a week ago, a friend of mine suggested doing a Buenos Aires Walking Tour. Already having been here for a month, I was hesitant to participate; however, last Sunday, I decided to give it a try.
