I I thought knew a good deal about the areas I passed on my bus and walking routes each day, but I was pleasantly surprised to find that I still had more to learn. Not only did Buenos Aires Free Walks tell me new information about places I visited each day, but my tour guide did so in a kind and relatable way. She even shared her mate with the whole tour group! Furthermore, he tour guide was personable yet professional as she shared the history and tales of Buenos Aires. Overall, I recommend this tour because it was I great way to see the city with young and local people.

Great tour, awesome guide, incredible city!!. I joined Buenos Aires Free Walks and had a blast!! Mariano, our tour guide was a fountain of knowledge, he keept us going for over 3 hours sharing all kinds of interesting facts, stories and jokes about Buenos Aires. We took some amazing pictures and got to learn so much of the history of the city. I highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting BA and I know I will join them again on my next visit to Argentina. There is no better way tyo experience Buenos Aires than with the guys at Free Walks!

Excellent tour. This is a great way to discover Buenos Aires. Mariano has a fantastic knowledge not only of the history and architecture of the city but also of its people. My favourite anecdote was why the Kavanagh building was placed where it is! It´s very funny. I have to add that Mariano was the most helpful person even before I got to Buenos Aires! He was able to recommend me a good place to stay. Thank you so much!

Gr8 tour ever!!. YOU KNOW How TO guide!! Best day in BA I've experienced. we have the awesome company of ower guide Mariano, nice and busy atmosphere. All the people on tour were all ready for a great day, it was well organise and I took crazy pictures of Argentina capital city! Thanks a lot for a magical expirience!!!

Best day ever!. It's the BEST free tour in America! We loved it! My friends and I had an amazing time because it gave us the chance of listening to great things about Argentina and meeting great new people from all around the world in the tour. Our team leader was called Barbara (even though he allowed us to call him Barby ) and he was so so funny! I highly recomend doing it because you will never regret it! We are definetly going to come back!

Entertaining & Insightful. On my trip to BA this was definetly one of the high notes. I'm really interested in knowing details about the places I visit, small stories and facts that only people that live there can provide, and this tour was one of them, but never being dull in the process. The guides were entertaining and carismatic but without leaving out important info facts about the places we visited. like for example the great stories and myths in Plaza San Martin about the aristocratic families that lived there at the begginig of the XXth century and all the info about the beautiful architecture that reminds every visitor that BA is the Paris of South America Don't miss the tour when coming to the city as I can't recommend it enough.

A walk to remember !!. Coming to a new country, a new city, the first thing that came to my mind was to explore the city. And how better to explore than take a walk around the city and know its history, culture, people, cuisine. And Buenos Aires Free Walks just hit the right chords. I am already in love with BA, Buenos Aires Free Walk and my guide Mariano just made my love stronger. I suggest Buenos Aires Free Walk to everyone visiting BA !!!! Awesome & memorable tour I had !!!

A great tour to discover and have fun!. I was surprised by the amount of information that our guide had, we learned a lot about history, architecture and the life of the citizens of Buenos Aires. The guide told us secrets and myths of the places we visited in our way to Recoleto, with a mixture of serious information and fun facts, and very nice jokes! The guides work only on a tip basis so you can decide based on your experience. We liked it very much so we left a very good tip.

¡Absolutamente un éxito!. On a cold day in July, when the sky looks the same at 9a as it does at 4p, I had no idea what to expect. All I knew is that I wanted a tour--especially since it was my first time in Buenos Aires, and it wasn't looking like the plans with friends were working out. I had tried several options listed in my guidebook, but I hit a wall every time. So it must have been serendipity that I stumbled upon Buenos Aires Free Walks in the plaza outside Teatro Colón on a cold Sunday morning. I didn't even know for sure what was going on, but I suspected something when this guy was standing there looking around, trying to show his bright orange T-shirt in the cold. I took my chances and came up to him: "You don't happen to be a tour guide, do you?"What a great decision! Mariano with Buenos Aires Free Walks was perfectly happy to show me around, even though it looked like I'd be the only one on his tour. We covered many of the major landmarks around Plaza San Martin and Retiro, ending outside the Recoleta Cemetery. But Mariano did much more than just point out the important landmarks--he clearly had done his research, pointing out prominent examples of architecture from a number of different periods, then interweaving it with funny anecdotes. More than happy to answer questions and equally comfortable bringing his personal experience as a lifelong porteño, Mariano is clearly a committed guide. Whether you visit this great Argentine capital alone or with a group, I encourage you to swing by Teatro Colón on your first day and join in on one of the Free Walks! You of course decide how much you're willing to pay, but I suspect you'll feel impelled to loosen that wallet quite a bit. A great way to learn about the city!

GREAT Tour of BA!!!!!. The guides were fun and knowledgable. All of them are locals, so they really know the ins and outs of the city. They tell little anecdotes that make the tour more personal- my favorites were the stories about the fights that occurred between the old aristocratic families. Very fascinating! They also go into great detail about the architecture (mainly in the Recoleta area). My family and I are big architecture buffs so we really appreciated this. The tour is top notch and the tour guides are just as great. I definitely recommend Buenos Aires Free Walks!

Ganz Toll!! Very Good!. Es hat mir viel spass gemacht! Ich habe viele sehenwürdigkeiten gesehen und wichtige information gelernt!I had a lot of fun! I learnt many things and seen nice places!I would reccommend it! :D

Experience a different side of BA. As an appreciator of street art and graffiti for years, I was eager to see what artists and writers were doing down in BA vs. my home here NYC. And our guide Luisa, delivered. She was not only lovely but passionate about both the art and the neighborhoods we visited - ones that I normally wouldn't have seen or known about. The insight she provided into the different pieces we saw really brought them to life. It's fun to draw your own conclusions, but she brought the pieces to life by providing richer background into the artist's interests and their thinking behind the murals and pieces we saw. It was a great way to spend an afternoon in BA - as well as a great way to support a stellar community effort by this organization to encourage collaboration amongst artist and neighborhoods in Buenos Aires. Highly recommended if you're into exploring new neighborhoods and immersing yourself in the communities you're visiting.

Eye opener!. I was impressed with all the background info of some amazing murals. Obviously there is so much more than "just looking" when it comes to street art!Our guide Lucia was both professional and passionate about what she was showing us.

Highly Recommended!. I took part in the 'biggest mural tour' with BA street art tours twice. Incredibly interesting and insightful. The guides are extremely knowledgable and willing to answer all questions. Would definitely recommend taking a tour with these guys. Fantastic!

Different and passionate points of view about BA.. I enjoyed a saturday afternoon with Master Anderson in BsAs streets... it was wonderful. This is about fine street art, how do artists shows their way of living and thinking through art, contestatory art, the behind the scenes, friendship between artists and artists that just want to show you something pure and raw. You won't regret!!!

Informative and passionate tour. I booked the industrial side of the city tour. 24 hours before the tour day, I got an email saying that only 2 people have signed up and that it will likely be cancelled due to the costs of the mini-bus. They could not arrange a tour for just the 2 people due to higher taxi transportation costs running into almost US $100 compared to US$30 per person in a mini-bus. However, they offered a tour in another section of the city. It was a great tour and the stories and context explained by Mariana was awesome. You can really feel the passion from the BA street art folks. Kudos for making this happen. I highly recommend this tour and hope you get a chance to visit the industrial side of the city for their massive murals.

great street art tour. one of my favourite things to do in a city is to see its street art - as soon as I got to BA I booked this tour.Great tour given by a great knowledgeable tour leader - and English gent to boot! he has literally written the book about BA street art, and no question was left unanswered.great afternoon :-)

Eye-opening. I have been living in Buenos Aires for 10 months and never got around to doing a street art tour - so glad I did! Our guide, Anderson, did a fantastic job explaining the history of street art in BA and showed us a variety of work. Everyone in the group enjoyed it. I would recommend to both visitors and those living in the city long-term as a must-see.

Changed the way I see the city. I’ve been living in Buenos Aires on and off for two years now and in just two hours, this tour changed the way I see the city. Our guide, Anderson, took us around Villa Urquiza, an up-and-coming hotbed for Buenos Aires street art. Luckily for us, Anderson actually lives in Urquiza, so we really got a local’s perspective on the area. He showed us some breathtaking murals and stencils—some stretching entire buildings, others hidden on side streets or on storefront grates. He seemed to know everything about the history and artist behind each piece. Now whenever I’m walking in the city or am sitting on the bus, I can’t help but look up at the tops of buildings, in search of hidden gems and sometimes I can recognize the work of one of the artists that Anderson showed us. If you want to get to know the streets of Buenos Aires, you’ve got to take this street art tour. Well worth the two hours and twenty bucks!

See a different side of BsAs!. If you want to see a less touristic part of Buenos Aires that's equally beautiful while checking out some incredible street art, you MUST do this tour. Lucia was awesome, very friendly, and knew TONS about every artist, mural, background story, etc. Worth every second of it, wear comfortable shoes, take water! Lucia will give you a run for your money to get as much art in as possible! LOVED this tour!

Awesome. I took this tour last weekend. My guide Anderson was knowledgable about the artists and the history behind street art in Argentina. There is street art everywhere in Beunos Aires but this tour shows you the best there is... It would have taken me weeks to see it all without a guide. And for 300 pesos it was a total bargain.

Day out with a difference!. Would definitely recommend doing this street art tour! Not only will you see some incredible art, you will learn about the history of street art in Buenos Aires while exploring some unique places. Our guide, Lucia, was fantastic and really brought the experience to life. Her passion for the craft was evident and she squeezed in as much as possible despite the looming rain! Gracias Lucia!

Must do and must see ☺. This afternoon we had a wonderfull tour in the north part of the city. Our guide Lucia was very nice and she knew a lot about street art. Her stories about the art we saw where very informative. If you stay in BA just book this tour. Thanx again Lucia!
Excellent tour!. We took this tour with teen daughters, we all loved it! Fabulous tour guide, very informative. A great way to spend the afternoon and view BA from a local's perspective.

Must activity in Buenos Aries. I spent an afternoon with Matt (Director) and drove around to different sites. This tour was worth the cost. Matt provided excellent insights on each mural including on the style and artist. I highly recommend this tour.

"I had a blast!". I booked this tour for my students taking a college course here and it was amazing. Our tour guide was great, extremely knowledgable and enthusiastic for the whole tour. I will do it again the next time I bring students. Thanks BA Street Tours!!

Wow. This tour was fantastic! It was great to know how the organisation contributes back to artists and joining the community with them. The girl was fantastic! She had such passion for it and really got me to think and.appreciate each piece. Highly recommend!!
Extremely informative,. This is aa great tour, great art, very knowledgeable tour guides and a wonderful afternoon of enjoying great street art.
amazing!!!!!!. the tour is really incredible! for people who like art it's an unmissable tour! not too short, not too long, i had a great experience!

Fantastic Tour of Street Art. If I could do any tour again in Buenos Aires again it'd be this one! Grizzly old rainy day but it certainly didn't put a dampner on our afternoon.Met at a traditional style cafe so make sure you go a bit earlier and have some lunch before the tour. Matt was great and very passionate about the street art and it's great to know that his company has a vested interest in the artists and the art around the city. Such a diversity in styles and techniques and interesting stories of the artists and their art. The area we walked around was also intriguing as it was so different from the central city of BA. Tree lined streets with almost English looking houses as opposed to the high rise apartments found more centrally.Finished up at their small gallery underneath the cool NYC Bar in Palermo and after such an interesting tour bought a small picture by the artist Luxor. Neat momento of a great afternoon and Matt went out of his way to deliver it the next day to our hotel. Super service!! Thanks :)

Knowledgeable guide and great art . Matt was extremely friendly & knowledgeable and works in partnership with a lot of the local artists and therefore was able to explain the artists motivation for each murals we saw. At the end he even extended the tour to show us some extra stuff as we were a small group. Would highly recommend the tour!
GENIAL!. Really good experience, Matt is really passionate about Street Art, he knows all the secrets :) I spent a nice afternoon ! I recommand this tour without any hesitation !
Fascinating tour, highly recommended!. Excellent tour, great murals and lots of interesting details provided by Sofia, our knowledgeable and enthusiastic guide. Thank you!

Fantastic tour. I was very pleased with how knowledgable the tour guide was about street art, in general, and Buenos Aires street art, specifically. The tour varied in the size of pieces viewed which made for an more interesting tour, especially if you plan on photographing the pieces. Also, I'm disabled, so I was particularly pleased with how accommodating Matt was to my needs and went out of his way to make sure I was enjoying the tour. If you enjoy street art or are looking for something to do on a Tuesday, Thursday, or Saturday afternoon, I would highly recommend this tour in any trip to Buenos Aires.

Extremely knowledgable guide and fascinating tour. My boyfriend and I did the tour around Colegiales/Coghlan with Sofia as our guide and LOVED it. She was extremely knowledgeable not only about the street art that we were seeing, but also about Street Art culture in Argentina and Argentinian history. Our tour also featured visiting an artist at work which was a great bonus! Best tour of a city that I have ever done!

Discover buenos aires and great artworks in an amazing way. The tour is really complete in all aspects, in 3 hours you discover a lot about art, the city history, the inspiration and profile of various world famous artists and their Artworks, that probably without this tour you will never get the chance to discovery by yourself. Besides all that I belive that what make the experience so amazing, is the passion and dedication that Matt, the guide and owner of BA Street Art Tours, shows us in his words. I would say that for sure, this is one of the best programs for an afternoon in Buenos Aires, for travelers and locals from all backgrounds.

Beautiful Murals!. It was a great experience, it´s my first time in this kind of tour, I love it! I didn 't know that there are so many street artists . You can see beautiful paintings, full of colors, creativity, done with different techniques I have learned a lot about artists from all over the world that came to Buenos Aires to express themselves in "non prohibited or allowed walls". We finished the tour at a cool street art gallery in Palermo called BA Vault Gallery and I bought a small artwork by a local street artist at a very affordable price.").

Amazing street art. What a sensational tour! Three hours of socio-political information about this city with the most wonderful art in every nook and cranny As our guide, Sophia, says, often you just don't see it but once you have done this tour, it is everywhere. Sophia is brilliant and this tour takes us to places we would never normally go. We learn about the artists, the people of the barrios, the resistance and everyday emotions and struggles. Well worth the money. We did the tour with the mini bus which took us all around San Telmo, Boca and Barracas. One of the best tours I have ever done

Street Art at its Best. BA is known to be home to some of the worlds best street artists & the Tuesday tour to Coghlan & surrounding areas with Sofia as a guide provides a glimpse of that world. Sofia has excellent knowledge of South American political history which is so inter-connected with a lot of BA street art. This type of insight helps us foreigners understand the complexities of the fabulous art.

Amazing tour!. One of the best things we have done on a long trip. The tour is worse the money, as you see street art in places that you would never have found on your own. Beside the street art you learn a lot of stuff about the country. It is perfectly organized and if you don`t know street art before, you definitly wanna see more after the tour.

Great Street Art Tour. We did this tour on a whim and it was really great! Matt's organization actually helps to set up artists with blank canvas buildings so he knew a lot about each piece that we saw. As a bonus you get to walk through Coghlan, a very sweet little residential neighborhood that you'd probably not visit otherwise. Well worth it!

Fantastic. Sophia was very professional, knowledgable and passionate about the street art we saw on the tour. I highly recommend it as you get to see amazing art work as well as seeing different neighbourhoods in the BA area.

Fantastic. Great tour. Highly recommended. Sophia was excellent, very knowledgeable and enthusiastic. Great art. Wonderful to walk around a different neighbourhood and hear the stories of how artists create and display their work.

Nice & intering way to see & experience Buenos Aires. Nice and interesting way to explore the city and hear and see the backgrounds.
Safe,
Good combination of walks and stops

Fantastic way to spend an afternoon. I knew very little about street art, so was a little unsure what to expect when I signed up to this tour. I ended up learning a great deal, and having an excellent time in the process. Our guide was US, so the tour was conducted in English throughout. I have spent several months in BA, but on the tour explored neighbourhoods I would otherwise not have seen. We visited a number of varied murals which were all interesting in their own right, but really brought to life by the knowledge of our guide. She was also very knowledgeable about the history of Argentina and Latin America, and the context she provided help me get the most out of this.This was an excellent tour. I would highly recommend giving it a go if you have a spare afternoon in BA.

Great tour! Exciting artwork!. It was a great way to experience the exciting Street arts of Buenos Aires. The work we saw was from some of the best Argentinian and also Internationally known artists and the tour guide was very knowledgeable and helpful. Overall the tour was a great experience! Highly recommended!

Highly recommended. Great guide with tons of information and passion for the subject. Matt had a lot of information about the artists and their techniques and inspirations. This tour was a highlight in a city that is pretty much all highlights.

Great tour of art scene and much more. Sophia was amazing. She was really knowledgeable about the history of Argentina, the social and political movements, as well as the art scene. Also nice to have absolutely no language barrier for us Americans. Great tour and if you have the time I highly recommend.

Literally off the beaten path. Great and different tour for three of us out-of-towners, in English. Matt was an engaging, informed, and generous tour guide. We immediately hopped a train (which I wouldn't have done otherwise) and walked through several residential areas (which also, I wouldn't have seen otherwise). We learned about the history, techniques, and social significance of the street art we saw. Highly recommend - very good value.

very intersting, learnt a lot, good value for money and had great fun!. I went on the street art tour with a few friends as we have recently moved here and wanted to grasp a clearer understanding of the city and its street art. Sofia our guide spoke fantastically, she was very knowledgable and open to all questions. The art around the city is amazing and we will probably look into doing another one in a different area or even the stencil workshops BA street art offer. Highly reccomend it!

Informative tour of street art & the socio-political environment in BA. Very interesting way of learning about street art in general, its development in Buenos Aires and South America, the political and legal context (the influence of dictatorships, resistance in art, the Afro-black history in the country etc), as well as the forms & techniques used. The tour covered 2 neighbourhoods, Villa Urquiza and Coghlan, that are not usually visited by tourists. A visit to the organization's gallery to end the tour provided an opportunity to speak with one of the street artists himself, as well as the founder of BA Street Art tour. That was also an informative part of the tour. Enjoyed it and I recommend it if you are curious to know more about street art!

Utterly fantastic street art tour - THE real deal. The street art tour or graffiti tour with BA Street Art tours was absolutely fantastic!Friends had recommended that I do one of the walking tours as they had thoroughly enjoyed it. They also run private mini bus tours but on this occasion I was on my own and so the walking tour suited me just fine. The tour was extremely well-organised and the tour guide Matt, had a fantastic first-hand knowledge of the street art scene. In fact, I really felt that we were being given more of an exclusive "behind the scenes" look at things as Matt mentioned his BA Street Art had actually commissioned/organised some of the murals and of course knew the artists personally! We got great insight into the story behind the murals and the way the artists actually approached the work.I would definitely recommend it to anyone that is visiting Buenos Aires! It's a fun way to explore the city that everyone can enjoy!

There must be better graffiti tours. The graffitimundo tour was my first choice, but they were fully booked. I settled for the BA Street Art tour instead.The two 20 something guides were US expats, so no language problem. The walking tour was in Villa Urquiza and Coghlan, two neighborhoods I would not have visited otherwise.The tour started with two huge murals covering several stories of two buildings. One was hardly legible from fading. The rest of the murals on the tour were nearly all on 8 - 10 feet walls. Very disappointing. After the tour, a long walk to view some graffiti art hanging on the walls inside a bar was a waste of time.I look forward to a graffitimundo tour the next time I visit BsAs. With their minibus as transport, I expect to see those huge murals scattered in more neighborhoods.

Very beautiful tour. Buenos Aires happens to be one of the most interesting, beautiful and unique cities that I have ever had the pleasure of encountering. One of the things that makes it so unique is its sense of expression. BA street art does and excellent job at showing you this very aspect that makes this city so special. It´s vibrant art that comes to life on the streets of the city. The art was breathtaking and definitely worth it!

A different type of tour. A great way of visiting some of the wonders of street art. A guided walking tour by a well informed english guide. The walk extended over 3 barios and some very interesting art by some of the worlds famous street artists. Quite a long 3hrs on a very hot day overcome by some of the works visited. If you're into street art or just curious about it, take the trip, it's worth it.
Buenos Aires Street Art - Minibus Tour. Highly recommend this tour for anyone that appreciates art. This tour makes it easy to see the best and biggest murals around BA. Guide was very knowledgeable.

North City Street Art Tour. Great tour. Awesome murals. Sofia, or guide, was a wealth of knowledge on both the art and the city. She also gave us a list of other murals to visit in the South. Highly recommended.
Great tour!. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and passionate about street art. It was definitely time well-spent.

Super interesting visite. Thanks to Anna we spent a really interesting day! It was a chance to see all that street art with the explication and the explication of the artist's life. Only sad thatsometmes we couldn't gat out of the bus to take pictures... Felt a bit like a safari. However perfect guide and nice descoveries

Great tour which opened my eyes to street art. I went to on the tour as I had become interested in street art and all the murals in Buenos Aires walking around the city. The tour was fantastic and opened up the world of street art to me. Our guide, Sofia, was very knowledgeable and passionate. The tour I did was in the north of BA, an area I wouldn't have visited otherwise, and the murals were amazing. I thoroughly recommend it.

Learn About the History of Buenos Aires through its Street Art. Awesome!. We did this tour on our first day in Buenos Aires and from it learned so much about the city's history and people. Sofia was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic on the subject, and the afternoon flew by. She has given us information on other murals in the city to check out, so we will be continuing our Buenos Aires street art experience during the rest of our stay too. Thanks a lot:)

Amazing tour, highly recommended!. Living in Buenos Aires you can't help notice the abundance of murals and graffiti that saturate the walls. To find out more about them, I spent two days with BA Street Art Tours visiting walls in the north and south of the city. Both Matt and Sophia have an infectious passion for the art and a talent for telling the stories behind the work. The first day we did a walking tour around Villa Urquiza. BA Street Art have worked with artists like Martin Ron to create a amazingly colorful spaces that lighten up the barrio. The second day, we went to the South of the city to the more gritty areas of Barracas and La Boca. We took a mini bus around the barrios and stopped at the more iconic street art images, like Martin Ron's turtle. We were also fortunate to see one of the painters in action on a wall in an industrial estate. Thanks BA Street Art for opening my eyes to something new in a city I thought I had done everything in. I can't recommend the tours highly enough.

Highlight of my trip. Something different to do instead of doing all the same old touristy stuff! Sofia our guide was extremely knowledgable. I knew nothing about street art before this tour but now I have a new found appreciation for the art. Plus you get to explore a neighbourhood that you probably would not have visited! Highly recommend doing this tour.

Fun way to learn about street art!. I really enjoyed the street art tour. I didn't know anything about street art, but afterwards I had learnt a lot! It was a very enjoyable, relaxed 3 hours walking around lesser known neighbourhoods of BA!

interesting and fun. a very good day was had by all. we were about 15 people from many places. i think everyone would say it was a well managed, informative, time. i would say that ordinarily a tourist would not see this part of BA so that makes it all the more interesting and worthwhile. do it.

Fun outing. Took the street art tour and had a fun, educational and informative afternoon. Sofia is a great host and guide. She was well informed and gave a broad historical overview of the genre. Her comments were funny, insightful and showed a genuine interest in the subject. We would highly recommend this tour to tourists and residents alike. We often don't know the treasures that lie in our own cities.

Excellent insight into the culture that drives creativity on the streets of BA. Having done a few similar walking tours, the easy thing is to just show the murals and talk about the artists. What I really liked about this one though was Sofia's in-depth background knowledge on the social and economic forces which lead to an impassioned group of artists taking their craft and their message to the streets. She has a real interest in this part of BAs culture and she makes the tour very engaging. If you get a chance to do this tour, do it.

Interesting tour , a lot of useful information and opportunity to make a nice photos .... The tour was interesting, guide was OK with the knowledge but not well organized ... each time she started to provide information before the rest of group arrived at new spot ... also should be given us a more time to make photos

Inspiring aspect of Buenos Aires by BA Street Art Tours. Well, if you ever been to Buenos Aires, this is the activity that you must join. This a great city with great collection of local and World street artist's works. Full of inspiration, full of information and background. We had some time afterwards to talk about the organisation and supports for art which is really precious. Matt, has enough knowledge about things going on, thanks to him. They are really caring about your condition and safety which is a important point if you're totaly foreigner.

Highlight of our BA/Argentina Vacation. We spent a little over two weeks on vacation in Argentina over the Christmas and New Years holidays, split between Buenos Aires and the northwestern Salta region. Hands down, this tour was the best three hours we spent anywhere on this trip. What made it so great? First, the art is AMAZING. But the real answer lies in the quality of the tour guide, Sofia. She was able to bring a passion and knowledge not only of street art but of the history of Argentina and Buenos Aires within which this art exists. There was the context of street art within the social and economic climate in Buenos Aires pre- and post dictatorship (which ended in 1983). And there was detailed explanation of each of the artists, their individual philosophies and references to other art they may have created elsewhere in the city or, in many cases, throughout the world. Yes, these artists are known worldwide, perhaps not to the same level of acclaim of artists whose works land in museums, but they are rightfully recognized and celebrated nonetheless. This art medium is accessible to anyone, but you have to know where to find it. Buenos Aires Street Art not only took us there but made it, and Argentina, come to life in a way that made it the highlight of our vacation.

Fantastic Off the Beaten Track Tour. I'm a fan of street art and this tour was one of the best I've taken! Matt took us to Buenos Aires barrios that we probably would have missed otherwise and that would have been a real loss. The art is magnificent and varied. It is interesting to hear about the artists and their creations. Matt has a lot of passion about the vibrant Buenos Aires street art scene and this adds to the tour. It's a delight for anyone interested in art and photography.

Really Nice!!. I just loved it
Matt is intresting and has a great ability to share his knowledge.. Plus he's really kind and funy! JOST GO ;)

One of my favorite tours... This tour was one of my favorites... after 3 weeks of travelling around Patagonia and South America. First, the company was great.... I booked a private tour for my family rather last minute. .. I made an inquiry very late in the day Monday asking for a Wed. morning tour. The company responded to my inquiries Monday night and then to some questions I had first thing on Tuesday... Second, the guide, Matt, was fantastic. He is extremely knowledgeable (he co-wrote a book on BA street art, knows many of the artists and actually had a hand in getting some works done by either finding the space for an artist or an artist for a space). Matt also was extremely accommodating in showing us art and locations that he specifically thought we'd be interested in... and he was right BA has AMAZING street art and, if you are visiting, you shouldn't miss the opportunity to see some with BA Street Art Tours where they can explain, in many cases, the background of the piece, the materials used by the artist and the artists themselves.

One of the memorable ones. I've been on quite a few tours in my day from South Bend to Siem Reap, and I've noticed that there some qualities that really make certain experiences special - This one has all those qualities! Let me summarize 3:1. Passion: I hate it when I can tell our guide is doing it for the money, or because they were working those particular hours, etc. Our guide for this tour, Matt, is not like that at all. He has been embedded in the BA street art scene for quite a while and it shows. When he describes the pieces, you can tell they mean much more than the next stop for him.2. Knowledge: Yes, all tours should be informative but Matt showed off his background as an ex-journalist here. What a piece means, historical context, medium, technique, odd stories are all explored within this 2.5 hour excursion.3. Uniqueness: It was one of those things that I truly felt that I couldn't have gotten anywhere else in the world, from anyone else. As you will hopefully be seeing, Buenos Aires is a perfect storm of street art - this tour gives an organic view of the lesser explored parts of the city, and is great for street art enthusiasts and simply those who are curious about it.

Best tour in Buenos Aires. The BA Street Art tour, led by Sofia, was by far the highlight of my visit in BA. We visited at least 10-15 murals, many of them quite beautiful, in a quiet neighborhood off the beaten path. The tour provided a lens for understanding the history of Argentina, current socio-political issues, as well as the contemporary street art movement. Sofia was an extremely knowledgeable and fun guide. She brought interesting facts about the neighborhood into historical context, including a car with historical significance (used by the military dictatorship to “disappear” people). The murals were made by artists from all over the world using various street art techniques. This was a thoroughly enjoyable way to learn about the city-- bring your walking shoes!

A Great Experience!. I thought that this was a simply excellent tour which was well paced, led by a guide (Matt) who was knowledgeable in the subject matter (he has a book on the subject and it is well written - we bought it) and very pleasant. Group was a very manageable size, unlike a competing tour that I noticed was running at the same time. Very clear that the tour was offered by someone with real interest in street art, had local expertise and was able to pitch the presentation at various labels. Highly recommended. Also appreciated the company's fast response to reservation requests and ability to be flexible on options. I wish all walking tour operators were like this.

Excellent tour and a fun experience. This tour was a surprise highlight of our visit to BA. Our tour guide Sofia, our guide was personable and knowledgeable. We saw parts of the city we would never have seen. We highly recommend this tour. Sophia and Matt know many of the street artists personally and give background about them.
great tour. Great tour, super knowledgeable, and interesting! Got to see some really cool street art around the city and hear about the buenos aires art scene

Street Art is not graffiti. Sofia, our guide for this tour, was amazing. She was very knowledgeable of Street Art and the history of Buenos Aires. I learned so much about street art on this tour that as we traveled throughout South America, I now looked at Street Art as art and not graffiti.

Fabulous afternoon spent on the streets of B.A. I recently did this tour with my family (including 2 teenage children) from New Zealand. The tour was amazing and we saw some stunning art and learnt how street art can really change and enhance the environment. The tour was perfectly timed with trains, easy walking distance and pace, packed with information about artists, styles, back stories and history of the area. Finished off with an ice-cream and a train trip back. A fabulous way to spend an afternoon in an area of B.A we didn't even know existed let alone one hold such an amazing array of street art.

Fab street art tour. Spent a great half day with Miles visiting street art in Coghlan BA. Amazing to see Argentinian and international artists' work. Even an Australian - Finton Magee! You'll love this tour if you like good art.

Graffiti Tour in Buenos Aires given by Street Art experts. Really interesting tour of Buenos Aires street art. We visited the Barrios of Coughlan and Villa Urquiza. Great insight into the process behind the making of some of the most iconic murals on show in Buenos Aires.

Thoroughly enjoyable . Wonderful afternoon spent meandering through some of BA's barrios which I would never have discovered if it wasn't for this cracking tour. Fascinating artists on display with the underlying stories brought to life by a knowledgeable guide. There's a relaxed approach, it's great value and I'd not hesitate to recommend it to anyone wanting to do something a little different or who enjoys art combined with a pleasant afternoon stroll.
great experience !. The tour is a great opportunity to get to know the city from a different perspective and see amazing street art.

Very good tour! Recommend it fully!. The guys bring you to areas where you do not cross when you are on your own in BsAs. They know a lot about the local street art scene and are very easy going. Would defenitly recommend the tour!

A tour worth doing. not just for the art but to see a different neightbourhood.. One of the good things about this tour is that it goes to a part of the city that we may not have visited otherwise. We saw some art we liked and some we didn't! This is definitely worth an afternoon of your time. Matt was also very helpful in emailing me the addresses of other large murals in the city and other areas that are good for street art. There are some new pieces we would not have found otherwise. Sofia was lovely, but I secretly wished that the tour could have been conducted by an Argentinian rather than an American! We were probably slightly spoiled by our street art tour in Valparaiso which was done by a young Chilean guy who was himself a street artist. That gave a very different perspective. I think a slight improvement could be if Sofia was more aware that we wanted to take photos of the whole wall. She tended to get to the wall, stand in front of it with the whole group, and then move on to the next one leaving some of us trying to get photos of the wall without people in it. By the time we had caught up again we had missed what she was saying about the next one. If she was a bit more aware of the photography that would be good.

A new perspective on BA! So much more than a tour.... BA is an amazing city and doing the BA Street Art tour on Saturday really opened up my eyes to a side of the city that I hadn't experienced before.Sofia our guide was excellent. She showed us some fascinating and beautiful murals. Her commentary was full of interesting facts about how street art has been influenced by the story of Argentina - it's history of immigration, the politics and the economic environment. The tour not only let me explore barrios of BA off the tourist trail but has also helped me understand more about the country and the people. A definite recommendation for anyone wanting to see and learn about the real BA!

a Highlight. The BA street tour was a highlight of my trip to Buenos Aires. Guide was excellent. We went to a pleasant barrio I would never have gone to otherwise. And the art is world class. this is not 'graffiti' but cutting edge contemporary art, some by internationally known artists. Highly recommended.
Great experience!. Really wonderful tour to see some wonderful art and different, off-the-beaten-path parts of BsAs. Highly recommended!

Afternoon well spent!. My boyfriend & I went on the tour and loved the unique insight into the Buenos Aires street art culture. Sophia was our guide and she was really passionate and knowledgeable. We enjoyed getting to know her and some of the other tour attendees while seeing a good number of incredible murals! We captured so many great photos and will never forget this afternoon touring BA!

Great B.A. Tour for the Art Lover. This is a must for the art lover visiting the city but also great for a visitor who wants to see some parts of the city off the beaten path. I really enjoyed all of the murals and the historical/political context of them. The tour guide was really great and knew her stuff. One thing I also enjoyed about taking this tour was seeing an area I wouldn't have found as a tourist. We made our way to the outskirts of the city and the architecture and homes in the area were really interesting. Another benefit was meeting other art-minded travelers.

Wow Factor Tour!. I went on this tour with two Canadian friends, on the recommendation of one of them who had recently completed the tour, but wanted to do it again. Sofia was a great tour guide and the graffiti we saw amazed me! The tour was informative, interactive and fun and I have since developed a new found love for all the graffiti in and around Buenos Aires and an appreciation for the artists who have taken the time to add a new dimension to the city! Well done to Matt and his team for this wonderful tour. A must see in Buenos Aires!

Excellent Tour! A must see in Buenos Aires for any tourist!!. In Bogota I went on the street art tour there due to the multitude of graffiti, and so when I came to Buenos Aires, I got so excited to see that they had a similar graffiti tour. So I went. The tour was excellent. Well priced, the guide was well informed, and the art was beautiful. This is definitely a MUST do for any tourist visiting Buenos Aires. It is not the usual tourist activity and you learn so much about history, politics, art, and current events in Buenos Aires and Argentina. Plus at the end they take you to a bar where you can purchase some really cool works by well known street artists from all over the world. Also there's a pit stop for ice cream...delicious. Definitely a great tour! Thank you BA street art for the fantastic afternoon!!

Very knowledgeable. My wife and I had a very informative tour of the street art in the Palermo area.Sofia was prompt and had the transport times at her finger tipsI follow street art in Perth Australia and there were a couple of artists who had work in both cities.Sofia had a lot of knowledge at her finger tips Great afternoon

Fantastic Tour!. The tour was great! Is a fantastic way to explore the city of Buenos Aires! I am argentine and I discovered more about my culture! The foreigners that did the tour with me really enjoyed it! Is great that they give us the possibility to explore other neighborhoods, like Villa Urquiza & Coghlan, that foreigners are not familiar with! I recommend this tour 100%!

Walking Art, History, and Culture in Buenos Aires. This tour was a great introduction to the rich city of Buenos Aires, and a refreshing addition to the city's more traditional touristic attractions. The tour guide, Sofia, uses the prolific street art of Buenos Aires as a platform to discuss Argentine culture and history. The whole city is a free outdoor museum, and this tour is as much a lesson as it is an exploration of the significance of various murals and tags. Sofia is generous with her knowledge and time, and I came away with a much more layered and nuanced understanding of both the street art movement and the city of Buenos Aires.

Great way to spend an afternoon in Buenos Aires!. A fascinating glimpse into the vibrant street art subculture of Buenos Aires. Very interesting to leave the more tourist-trodden parts of the city and have a chance to explore some less-known neighborhoods. Sofia the guide is engaging, and very knowledgable and helpful, and of course the artwork is incredible!
Amazing. Wounderful time having this tour. Learning about international and local graffiti artists was amazing. 100% recommended to everyone. Thanks Sofi.
Street art . Such a nice experience, you get to know another face from BA and specially how the street art works. Sofi the tour guide was super helpful.
Art. Had a fantastic afternoon taking this tour. It is a must if you visit Buenos Aires. Don't miss it!!!

Street art tour . Despite the torrential rain this was a superb tour and I thoroughly recommend it to everyone. The guide, Sophia was really knowledgeable but presented the information in a very accessible manner for non experts! Great to see different neighbourhoods and the pace and amount of information was exactly spot on. Also a great way to meet other like-minded travellers.

Great Tour!. I took this tour on July 23rd. Our guide Sofia was friendly and very knowledgable. I had zero knowledge about the subject before the tour and left with a decent understanding. I highly recommend this tour. Thank you, Sofia!

Entertaining and informing. The tour was entertaining and informing. The guid gave valuable informations about the art and its surroundings.
Grate tour fore both children and adults.

Amazing art!!!. I couldn't believe my eyes...such amazing street art by various artists from around the world. I did the 'North" tour which started off in the Palermo neighborhood of Buenos Aires. I should note that this was a walking tour with a couple train rides in between, nothing strenuous.

awesome street art where every picture tells an incredible story. We were very skeptical starting this tour. We said if they are 15 minutes late we are gone. They were late but what a wonderful tour. I have a new appreciation for amazing art and the depth of passion these artists put into their work. It is not just punks having it out with a wall vs spray paint but instead a wonderful depiction of someones life or urban legand. I will never look at "grafitti" the same again,with the exception of tagging I will look at it with respect.

Interesting Tour. Did the tour with my 17 yr old daughter who is interested in Graphic design and my 12 year old son. Tour was very informative. Learnt a lot about street art, Murals, Graffiti,tagging, the various artist, their style and the meaning of some of the art work.
Amazing tour. Learned a great deal about street art in general and the Buenos Aires variety. The guide was very knowledgeable and eager to explain. Recommended

Amazing Art and Culture Lesson. I went on the Street Art Tour back in January and it was amazing! The murals were stunning and my tour guide, Sofia, was able to give in-depth detail about the mural composition, the artist, and the culture meaning behind each piece. I was surprised by how much I learned about BA and it's art scene. It was also a great way to explore the Palermo barrio. I went solo on the tour but was quickly making conversation with everyone in the group. We even got drinks and dinner afterwards!

Increíble tour!. I really loved the Street Art Tour! I have been living in Buenos Aires for 7 months, but the guide Sofía showed me parts of the city I had never seen before. I didn't know that Buenos Aires has such a wonderful and diverse street art scene and I was really impressed! The tour was informative and funny at the same time and the guide transmitted her passion for street ART to me.

Unique art experience in city of museums!. I am student studying here in BA for the semester and wanted a different experience than the usual tours. I had a great time learning about not only street art in general but some of the more specific pieces unique to Buenos Aires, especially since they were primarily located in neighborhoods that are not very touristy. Sophie was an amazing tour guide who spoke perfect English and also gave us recommendations of more pieces to check out if we wanted to. Very, very impressed and would suggest anyone looking to see some of the less conventional art Buenos Aires has to offer should check this tour out

Best city tour we've taken in 6 months travelling South America!. We took the Street Art Tour this afternoon and it was absolutely amazing! Our guide, Ollie, was incredibly knowledgeable and a great speaker. Sooo nice to not have a canned speech, but one where the guide simply knew his info and could just talk to us. Loved it that the organization actually knows and works with many of the artists so they could tell us the meaning and the stories behind many of the murals firsthand. Really inspired us and we hope to take one of their aerosol classes during our visit! After all, how many times does an American get the chance to paint on the side of a building legally??? Highly recommended.Details: it was $20/person and ran about 3hrs. It is an outdoor walking tour, so definitely wear comfortable shoes and have sun protection if you need it. We took the train twice and that was included in the cost.
Off the normal tourist trail. A different kind of afternoon to see an off the beaten track parts of Buenos Aires and it artworks. Guys are enthusiastic and knowledgable and I would highly recommend.

Could do far better service to the selected artworks. Well, in summary:- the artworks selected were nice and in a part of town you wouldn't discover otherwise. - most of the times, though, the tour lacked depth and social perspective. - we were herded from wall to wall, only to hear that the guide "was not sure exactly what the piece meant, but he thought it related to"... (insert brief explanation).- the explanations were most of the times "as you see, this is pretty cool", "kind-of-indigenous inspired thing", or just the technique used by the artist (brush / stencil / aerosol). It gets pretty boring to see about 20 different artworks and only hear that they were made by combining aerosol spray and stencils. - at times guide didn't know what he was talking about: in front of a mural of Karl Marx he said it was Stalin; mosaics were "invented in Paris in the '70s" (I suggest the guide to go to Italy and see some mosaics from the Roman Empire period), etc. I wouldn't take the tour again.

DO THIS. This is a must during a Buenos Aires trip, people. You will walk through neighborhoods you never would have known otherwise; you will see a form of art that is unfortunately not very common in the United States; you will feel like you can grasp just a bit of this big, beautiful city. I highly recommend this tour.

A Virtual Art Museum. The tour was great. Neighborhoods and buildings transformed by street art. We went to a suburban area of BA, and walked through a neighborhood where there were breathtaking murals on every block.

Unique tour with stunning murals. I had such a great experience with BA Street Art Tours. They were very professional, but also showed us some very unique and inspiring works in two lesser-known areas of Buenos Aires. It was a great way to see other art, besides the ones you always see walking down main streets in BA and our guide was extremely knowledgeable about the history of the area, and each piece we looked at. I learned so much and loved the whole experience!

Awesome tour and tourist guide! :-). Sofia is a passionate street art tour guide. She explains everything incredible and she has a very deep knowledge in all related to street art artists and the city of BA. I highly recommend this tour to everyone! A tour for people who don't like tours! :-)

Fascinating Tour. This was a really enjoyable tour, taking in some lesser known residential parts of the city, that happen to host some great street art. The tour guide's knowledge of the art and the artists behind it was first rate. We got to learn about the history of the city, the political context for the art and the social context for the art. There was plenty of interesting additional information available if you wanted to follow up. The guide's knowledge was of the entire South American scene, hence we were able to follow up on great street art we'd seen in Santiago and Valparaiso. The tour finished with a nice beer at a good bar in Recoleta. It was well worth the time and the money.

BA art comes alive!. Incredible insight of street art in BA. Total passion by Matt. Enjoyed his company. Most knowledgeable. Liked the walks and pace of the tour. Would certainly do it again. A try advocate of local Art and culture.

great way to explore BA, knowledgeable guide. the guide Matt is super knowledgeable about the BA street art scene and the tour is a great way to wander around parts of the city you might not otherwise see. highly recommended

Upmarket Art. Excellent tour. It may seem ironic that behind the burglar bars of these upmarket neighbourhoods of BA there are people dying for graffitti street art. Many of the works are commissioned by the house owners. In fact on our tour one octogenarian from the neighbourhood was complaining that someone had defaced the paintings done the night before. Interesting and informative with Sofia and a group of North Americans intent on taking pictures - wonder what they do with them!The highlight was understanding the paintings and the stories behind and realising that Buenos Aires has embraced a form of contemperory culture that some European cities still criminalise and treat as non art. Says something about the Portenos! Like the disliked and see where it takes you- nice places for sure.

Great Tour. Buenos Aries has some amazing street art and this was the tour to go on to learn about the art. Matt and Sophia were both very passionate about street art in BA and supported the local artists. They did a great job explaining the art work, the artists, and showing off the beautiful pieces. There was possibility of rain the day we went on the tour, a van was hired to transport the group around. Matt was very considerate even provided mosquito repellant and warned of mosquitoes. Overall a must do this was a highlight of my trip in BA. I would definitely come back for another tour!

The best $20 you'll spend. This tour was the best $20 I spent on this trip!! Sofia was amazing and was so passionate about the street art in Buenos Aires. I enjoyed spending my afternoon (even though it was scorching), wandering through the more residential parts of the city. The street art is everywhere and thanks to this tour, I understand it a bit better. The ice cream stop halfway was well worth it! VERY HIGHLY recommend this tour. Also made me notice and appreciate the art I saw throughout the rest of my trip.

Something Different.... This is a definite worthwhile tour that gives a flavor of the Buenos Aires culture and an unique art form. Small groups so you don't feel like you are traveling around in a huge tourist pack or being rushed around. Guides very friendly and knowledgable. Great tour!

A Must Do!. Buenos Aries is famous for its street art and this tour makes it very evident as to why. The street art tours that Matt and Sophia do are awesome! They show you so much and even give you other locations to check out if you have extra time in Buenos Aries. Both are so friendly and knowledgable. This was a highlight of our trip!

Extremely captivating . Having lived in Shoreditch (East London) for the last two years, I was a little unsure of what to expect from the BA scene. Well it's fantastic, original and some of it totally breathtaking. Matt and Oli were brilliant guides, engaging, interesting and good crack. Definite recommendation for those wanting to see some beautiful and captivating pieces.

If you thought it was just graffiti this will open your eyes!. I was completely ignorant. Didn't know the difference between street art and tagging. Needless to say this tour was an education. The art itself was between impressive and astounding, and it is almost unbelievable that most of it was created within a matter of days. Matt has written a book about street art and is now a 'curator' and advocate, often acting as a negotiator between those who want to create and those who want a creation. Well worth the money.

A very interesting tour. I loved this walking tour. Matt the owner is very passionate about Street Art, and has written a wonderful book. The murals and their history were fascinating. We started at a cafe, toured, had ice cream, and ended in a cafe/bar where we had beers. Our group was very fun. Sofia was a very knowledgable and passionate. I am not artistic, but learned a lot about techniques and the artists who created the murals. At the end of the tour we encountered five people from Columbia who were painting a mural. I found this interesting. Tour last three hours, costs $20 US dollars, and used the city train. It is a must, and different from anything else you can do in BA.

Great tour. The best $20USD I ever spent. We had a great tour with Sophia as or tour leader. Fantastic tour that began at a small cafe near the train with a short two stop train ride to the Coughlin neighbors. Incredible street art and my wife and I enjoyed every minute of it. The tour concluded at a small bar in Palermo Hollywood where we had a beer and shared some great conversation with our tour group. A must tour if you are in BA.

Great tour - a must for street art fans. Living in Shoreditch in London (where we are spoilt for Street Art) I was a little apprehensive but I shouldn't have been and soon see why BA is also considered to be one do the Top 10 cities to see street art by Fodor's. Our guide Sophia was excellent and safely got us on the train so we could reach Coghlan where we spent the next couple of hours admiring street art from the likes of Blu, Martin Ron, Primo, Fintan McGee and Primo. Perhaps the most interesting part was seeing the murals on house walls which have been 'commissioned' by home owners. A definite must tour in BA

Street Art Tour. We are big art collectors and street art fanatics, so a street art tour in one of the most famous cities for this medium was a must. Matt showed us around Palermo and Colegiales and explained the history and cultre behind the pieces we saw.

GREAT GRAFFITI TOUR!!!!. Had a wonderful time & saw some amazing graffiti & murals. Recommend this tour to anyone who loves graffiti & street art & exploring new places off the beaten track. Thanks to Sofia for a great tour!

Great tour!. I went on this tour on the recommendation of a friend; I didn't previously have an appreciation of street art. The tour - and Matt, our guide - we're great - and I've now been noticing street art in a way I never did before.

Unique and out of the ordinary cultural. A must see!!!!. This is one of the best tours, of any kind, I've been on. It's super original and unlike most graffiti or street art tours anywhere else in the world. Our tour guide Matt was super enthused and knowledgable about the artists, the history of street art in Buenos Aires and the techniques used to paint. If you're in Buenos Aires and want something super fun to do! check this tour out!

Awesome Stuff!. I highly recommend checking this tour out. Really cool, unique art. Tour guides were super knowledgable, I thoroughly enjoyed hearing the stories behind the art. All in all, a fun few hours.

A must for street art fans!. I loved that we explored barrios which you wouldn't usually visit as a tourist - there are mind blowing giant murals waiting around every corner! Our guide Sophia explained the background of the relatively young street art scene in Buenos Aires and gave us an introduction into the different techniques. It was a perfect insight into local street art and I highly recommend it for everyone who's interested in graffiti or street art!Thanks Matt & Sophia for the great tour!

Unique and Amazing. I would recommend this tour to anyone who can love and appreciate art or if you are looking to experience something different while in Buenos Aires. For an even more unique experience I also recommend taking the class. This was really the highlight of my trip. To create my own mark on the streets of Buenos Aires was like nothing else. And of course everyone back home was in awe.

I learned so much!. I had a great time with Carolina and Matt who taught me so much about the street art scene in BA. Also, they taught a class on how to do street art with aerosol spray paint. What a different experience for an American. It's not something that is allowed there! I learned so much and was impressed with the professionalism and organization of this class. Thanks for a great experience!Kirk

A unique and inspiring experience!. We did the private tour and were really happy we did. Our tour guide, Matt, picked us up at our hotel in an air conditioned van, with a knowledgeable driver. Matt knows the city very well, and was able to show us murals that we would have never been able to access on our own. It was great to learn about the political side to the graffiti on the walls of the city. We always felt safe and entertained. I would recommend this tour to anyone with an interest, and I would take the tour again because there is so much to see and the work is constantly evolving.

BA street beat. We had a super chill, proactive and knowledgeable tour guide which made for an amazing experience! The street art was astounding, and it was interesting to learn about this unconventional art form and the sociopolitical context it holds in BA. Would highly recommend it to anyone looking to immerse themselves in the contemporary urban culture that this city has to offer.

Street art that will blow you away. If you, like me, love graffiti and street art, this is the tour for you.You get to walk around in areas you probably wouldn't have gone to on your own. I probably would not have found my way there, had it not been for the tour. It was really cool.There are a lof of very cool buildings too. You get to see some really cool street art and graffiti ,from various artists. The guides are knowledgeble and tell you about the different artists as well as the techniques used in the paintings. Unfortunately 3 hours are not enough, Buenos Aires has so much cool street art to offer. You could probably walk around for a week and still find new art.This tour is a must for the graffiti /street art enthusiasts.

"Street" art gets its own tours. If I'm a street artist I'm not sure if people making more money off a single tour than I earn on single "painting" would make me too excited. I'm told that some of the money helps fund other projects, so I guess that's a good thing.Our guide was did do some meaningful interpretations of the works but it would have been nice if she started with some context for street art more broadly and as it applies locally. I would have liked some historical context. Some of the works were impressive but I somehow expected to a be a little more wowed. It's funny, the next day I went to one of the local museums here, the Malba, where they are doing a retrospective of Antonia Berni, and it reminds you of the vast chasm between the greats and these street artist. I guess, lacking more talent, that's pretty much what you've got left. Don't get me wrong, I love Banksy and some of the others, it's just that this work doesn' t seem to come close, fairly underwhelming. Not sure this stuff quite rises to the level of a tour.

See another side of BA!. This is a fun, laid back, engaging way to get to see more of Buenos Aires than the usual tourist activities. Not only will you make it to neighborhoods and streets you wouldn't normally visit, but you'll gain an understanding of the deep street art and graffiti tradition in Buenos Aires. The owner and tour guide, Matt, literally wrote the book on BA's Street Art and he's an informative, friendly and easy going guide. It's really a perfect way to spend an afternoon. And if you're in the a rush, the lunch at the meeting spot, Cafe Lacroze, is pretty good and relatively inexpensive.

Great if you love street art. I think this is a very good tour if you are into street art. I was hoping to get more info on the culture and neighborhoods of the city, and how street art has been woven in. I didn't quite get that. It felt a bit more of an education on street artists that happen to have done paintings in the city. It also felt very long--the website advertises 2:45, but it was more like 3:45. It could have been done in 2:15, IMHO, our guide was very nice but it dragged a bit.

Awsome tour!. The tour was really good! Wenzel, the guide, didn't just showed us the diffrent street art spots, he also explaint a lot of the diffrent drawing technics. I would do the tour again if I ever come back to BA!

Great tour with lovely people. A different and exciting sight of the great city of Buenos Aires! This street art tour takes you to beautiful neighborhoods where giant murals by international artists give a surprising, fascinating touch. Matt, the organizer, and Sofia, the guide, are lovely people that care about the participants that come from all over the world and are also ready to help. A great and very enjoyable way to spend the afternoon and meet nice people in Buenos Aires!

so much fun!. I took this tour with some friends and loved it! The guide Sofia was extremely knowledgable and answered all of our questions. She also took time to recommend me street art in Valparaiso. It was is neighborhoods I didn't even knew existed so it was good to see new things! The art is amazing and always changing! I highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting or living in BA!

Had fun at BA Street Art Tours. We had a very pleasant tour of some awesome street art around town. Learned about the art's history in BA in a very small tour group so it felt intimate and comfortable. The company's owner even went above and beyond to help us find lots of other cool things to do in the city. Highly recommend this tour!

TAKE THIS TOUR. It's well worth your time and investment. The two and a half hour, guided tour introduces the city's street art scene in neighborhoods that you won't find on your own. We saw giant murals by international and local artists. Our guide, Sofia was delightful. She shared inside information about the artists and their works, the neighborhood, the medium and technique, all in a friendly, relaxed manner. I hope this organization launches into more success. Future plans include the opening of a Street Art Gallery in the lower level of the NYC Bar in Colegiales, (I suggest the refreshing IPA beer on tap).Thank you for the experience! Website buenosairesstreetart.com

Interesting and unique tour. A unique walking tour that lasted over 3 hours where we walked around parts of the city (Colegiales) that we would normally not have gotten to. Our tour guide, Matt, was very knowledgeable and passionate on the subject of street art. It would have been difficult to find these murals on our own and he explained the different artists and their work. After the tour, we asked Matt for the location of certain giant murals we had seen on their website and not covered during the tour and he emailed us very detailed instructions which was helpful. Our only regret was that we did this tour on the last weekend of our stay in Buenos Aires. Had we done this on the first weekend, we would have probably have spent some time searching out the stunning works of Martin Ron or even organized a private tour to seek them out. Must do!

Loved it!. We had a great time with Matt on the street art tour! We learned so much about a sub-culture that we hadn't really considered extensively before. The talent and dedication involved in street art is amazing and Matt has dedicated much of his time to promoting and helping the artists through his tours, blog, a published book, and soon a gallery. He was very knowledgeable, flexible on the tour, and took us to a couple local establishments along the way for ice cream during the tour and drinks afterwards. This is a wonderful, off-beat tour that took us into neighborhoods we may not have otherwise visited and informed us about a culture that we may not have otherwise learned about. In addition, my friend and I plan to take Matt's second tour offering soon - where we meet an artist and create some street our ourselves with a private lesson! What could be more fun? Definitely try this tour!

BA art tour. Such an amazing tour definitely put it on your list as one of the top things to do!! very informative went to neighborhoods I never would have gone to and Sophia was great giving us the inside scoop behind-the-scenes stories about the artists and their work
good job guys keep it up

Great walking tour!. Great walking tour with interesting inside information about the street art. They will take you to neighborhoods you normally would not go, defenitly a must see with a very nice guide!

Off the beaten path in Buenos Aires. A very different view of Buenos Aires, great to see the vibrant street culture. Wenzel was a terrific guide, with a real passion for the art works. Fascinating to gain an understanding of both their artistic and political aspects.

What a fantastic way to see the city!. The tour takes you to parts of the city you wouldn't normally just stumble upon, which is great in its own right. The street art we saw was really interesting and both Sofia (our guide) and Matt (who founded the company) described it in a way that was engaging and fun, which really reflects their knowledge and passion for the subject. They were able to convey the relevance of the murals to their time and environment, thus giving you a bit of the vibe of the city at the same time. They handled the group well, and the stop for a drink at the end was very welcome (especially after the rain showers we had at the end of the tour!) - recommended to anyone with even a vague interest in street art!
Very nice walk in interesting parts of the city exploring amazing graffitis!!!. Very nice walk, the guide was very good and strongly recommended for one one visiting burns aires. Well done guys!!

Great way to see the city!. Matt was a wonderful guide. This city tour brings out the true colors of BA. Good art info, good history info. We did this tour after our concierge said it was the best tour for graffiti and they were right. I felt connected to the street art community after learning about their struggles.

fantastic!!. the tour was really wonderful. I'm a painter and was interested in getting involved with the street art in Buenos Aires and Matt (who founded BA Street Art) introduced me to some artists working on a collaborative mural project that was being painted during the tour that I was able to then be a part of myself. he went out of his way to make himself a really great resource in terms of meeting and working with local artists. the tour was a fantastic education on the history and processes of one of the most important street art scenes in the world. i would highly recommend it to anyone (and especially to painters interested in learning about what goes into becoming a street artist).

Great Murals. I had a great experience with Matt and others on the street Art tour through some neighborhoods near Palermo. Really enjoyed seeing some of the murals and getting a lot of inside information as everyone at BA street art tours is really well informed and really well connected throughout the street art world. You will learn a lot about different artists and even may be invited to see some live painting of a mural if one is happening. It's really cool learning about the different effects some of the artists do when painting their murals and how overall many people in certain neighborhoods of Bs As have come to love street art and want the walls to be painted.

A top tour to do in BsAs and hugely informative. I recently had the opportunity to do this tour with a friend and found it to be very educational and interesting. We were hosted by the owner who had the perfect balance of knoweledge, service and his humourous anecdotes too. Thankyou for a great afternoon! Well worth it!

highlight of my stay in Buenos Aires. I'm a huge fan of street art and look for it everywhere where I travel but it was the first time I went for a street art tour. And it was an excellent choice! Buenos Aires is full of amazing street art but I would never have found the mural we've seen during the tour nor I would know about their background and the history of street art movement in BA. Since the weather was terrible the group was very small (me + 3 more people) which was actually great as we felt comfortable and could ask all the questions. The tour took us to areas of Buenos Aires I would never have visited on my own as they were fairly far from the center - another advantage of the tour as I could see also some random yet nice parts of BA. Despite the bad weather we got to see pretty many cool murals by various artists and heard the story behind each of them. Matt, our guide, also explained a lot about various technics used in street art, something I didn't know much about before. The tour lasted over 2 hours and was extremely informative, it was clearly seen that street art is a big passion of Matt (he even published a book about it) and he was willing to share his knowledge. Afterwards we all spent another 2 hours in the cafe, chatting even more about street art in BA and all over the world.If you're into street art and alternative things don't miss this trip, you'll enjoy it for sure! It's the best way to learn more about street art in Buenos Aires!

Excellent and education. Really interesting tour - thoroughly enjoyed and learned all about the street art, artists and the way artists can choose / gain permission to paint in various places in the city. Elevates it from vandalism to a genuine art form and the turnover of murals / street art makes them all the more enjoyable to see as they may not be there within a week...Our guide Sohpia was excellent also.

Cool pieces of art!. The tour is so great. You can see the best pieces of street art of Buenos Aires and walk through the beautiful city. It's the best way to know it and to meet nice people. Personally, I found out beautiful graffities that I've never seen. They are so amazing and so big. What is more, the tour guide knows a lot about art and history and he makes you feel part of this graffiti culture.Here are some of my favourite pictures!

Awesome street art tour. Previous to coming to Buenos Aires, I was not aware of how lively the street art scene is here. Matt, an English guy who is well-versed and involved in the local street art community, along with Sophia, a newer guide both did a great job of showing us around. The art was amazing, colorful, and diverse. Definitely one of the funner things we have done in our time here so far. I would highly recommend it.

Fantastic few hours spent with enthusiastic and knowledgeable guides!. We had a wonderful time on this tour, we were lucky enough to have two tour guides Matt and Sophia who were both super enthusiastic and really knew their stuff! We wandered around a part of the city I wouldn't have otherwise known about and saw some truly amazing works of art. Thanks to Matt and Sophia - it was great having a drink with you after the tour and learning more about the city from you.

A great way to experience another side of BA. My boyfriend and I loved the BA Street Art Tour led by Max, an English guy who's lived in BA for a number of years and is well entrenched in the street art scene. He took us to parts of the city you wouldn't explore on your own and that aren't listed in the guidebooks to see some of the city's most striking and beautiful murals. Even if you're not really into street art, you'll enjoy the tour, as Matt gives you a lot of background info on each of the artists and their works - it's like having a guide taking you around a museum of contemporary art.

Very informative tour with friendly guide!. I'd heard lots about this tour before I actually went on it but I must say it lived up to all those claims and more! The tour itself took me to neighbourhoods I would've never known about otherwise and covered a lot of street art and graffiti. The tour guide Matt was very friendly and clearly had a great knowledge of the city, he even marked my map with locations of more art so I was able to go on my own extended tour afterwards! Well worth the money!
BA street art tour. Amazing tour!!! I showed some of my pics to some friends that live here in BA and now they wont to do the tour.Thanks Matt enjoyed the day!!Jaz

Well worth taking the tour. I'd got to the end of a one-year stint in Buenos Aires before I finally got around to taking this tour, but it was a great way to spend one of my last few days in Argentina. Co-founder of Buenos Aires Street Art, Matt, was our guide for the afternoon and, as you'd expect, really knew his stuff. Although i'd seen a lot of street art from just walking around the city during my stay, it was really worth getting the inside track on the artists themselves - their partnerships, creative conflicts, and histories. I also saw pieces i would never have just stumbled upon as they were in neighbourhoods i generally had no reason to visit. The tour is good value, off-the-beaten-path and ideal for some non-tango/steak photo opportunities. Recommended!

Great tour in a beautiful neighborhood. I live in Buenos Aires and have seen lots of street art here, but had never ventured into these neighborhoods or seen all of the amazing murals in the northern part of the city.
