These aren't neighborhoods that other tour groups visit - they're off-the-beaten-path, up-and-coming neighborhoods with beautiful houses and quiet streets. Perfect places to paint! I learned a lot about different graffiti artists and Buenos Aires history, and was awed by huge paintings and the diversity of styles. And the guide, Wenzel, was incredibly knowledgeable and friendly. Thanks so much!

Excellent tour. We found this tour online and it was one of the best things we did all week in Buenos Aires. Our guide Wenzel was great and had great insights on not only the art but everything to do with the city. If you love art we would highly recommend taking this 2.5 hour long tour.

Art face of BA. In any city of the world there are lot of excurtions and tours to choose. One of the best things you can choose and do in Buenos Aires is a street art tour - wonderful guides, not touristic places of this magic city. It is guaranteed that you will not only learn much more about street art culture but also have your camera full of great pictures. The best choice for those who are looking for something really different!

Another Buenos Aires. It was a great look into another side of this giant city: an escape to look for poetry in the street of the monster! Wenzel who drove us after the tour is a street artist also, and is an excelent guide, explaining all the secrets behind the mirrors!Top!

Great to see BA and to learn about street-art/grafitti. The tour was great, we got to see a bit of the normal Buenos Aires outside of the most touristic routes and most of all we learned a lot about street-art. Now every time I see any kind of painting in the street I understand it in a complete different way, so my view of other cities even my own city also changed. The guide was very involved in the local art scene and knew a lot about all the context around street-art which made the tour very interesting.

Highly recommended street art tour in BA. BA street art offers excellent tour of the steet art scene in Buenos Aires. Guided by a very knowledgeable cicerone, you will discover hidden gems of murales art and you will have the chance to visit off the beaten path neighbourhoods.

BA street art tour. Thanks to BA street art team and host/artist Wenzel for a very interesting afternoon. We really enjoyed the street art and Wenzel's passion and commentary about the local street art/graffiti. P.s. watch out for the dog poo lol. Cheers Reina & Terry (Australia)
Graffiti tour. Awesome tour!!!! Definitely a highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. Our tour guide had a great knowledge of the local work and history. Highly recommended!!!!

Highly recommend. The BA Street Art tour is a great way to spend an afternoon in Buenos Aries. The tour guides are really knowledgable and passionate about the art and the artists. Something different and would highly recommend!

Great way to spend an afternoon. A friend of mine from Sydney put me onto the tour, it was a nice small group of 6 girls. We got to see a lot of very wonderful street art and Wenzel was a great host. Would recommend the tour to anyone travelling through BA. Mia from Sydney (Australia)

Awesome!. The street art is really amazing, more than i could have expected. The tour is fantastic, you get to learn a lot about the street art scene. It wouldnt be possible to have the same experience without the tour, even if you pass through the same places. Worth every penny!

A hidden gem!. I got to know about this tour through some friends who had recommended it and it didn't disappoint! Matt, our tour guide was so knowledgeable about the all the artists and streetarts. At one point the owner of one of the properties came out of his house by chance and greeted Matt which made the tour even more authentic. A must see in BA!!!

Authentic, fascinating way to explore Buenos Aires. This was by far one of the best things I did during my 10 day stay, such a great way to explore new parts of the city.The street art was stunning and unlike anything I'd seen before and our tour guide Wenzel's knowledge was second to none, explaining the difference between graffiti and street art, different styles of street artists - it added so much more than if you had just stumbled across it yourself.It's fascinating to see how the art is such an integral part of the city, and how it is embraced by the residents.Highly recommend!

Very great tour with expert knowledge of the scene!. We went on the tour spontaneously and it was great! Wenzel is nice and funny and has a lot of in depth knowledge about single murals and artists. Thanks man!

Highly recomendable Tour that gives some deep insight on the local scene and what street Art is anout. Had a really Good time on the tour and would recommend it. Guide is an artist himself and knows All about the local scene. Tour takes you to some really, really cool places.

Buenos Aires de Vanguardia. We had a great time. Walking around the streets of BA and discovering incredible pieces of art in every corner is an experience the everybody should live. I really recommend this tour, they are a good way of feeling the artistic atmosphere of the city. P.S Don't forget to bring your camera with you!

Excellent tour. We had a great afternoon walking around BA with our man Wenzel recently. His insight into the community as an artist was invaluable on the tour and he is really friendly and knowledgeable. Thoroughly recommended. Give that man a pay rise!

Fantastic tour!. Recently I had a fantastic Saterday afternoon with BA Street Art. The tour shows you some amazing streetart and in the meantime you discover more from the city BA. I would highly recommend this tour.

Best Afternoon Out in Buenos Aires So Far!. I went on the BA Street Art Tour last Saturday afternoon and had one of the most interesting and enjoyable days I’ve had in the city so far. It was fun and I felt like I got to experience something completely new.The tour combined the best aspects of visiting a modern art gallery (exposure to cool innovative artworks) with the fun of being out and about exploring the hidden parts of a city (one of my favourite things to do when visiting any new place).Learning the stories and history behind each of the pieces was fascinating and the sheer scale of some of these artworks needs to be seen to be believed. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and friendly and I met some great people on the tour.I just loved it. Highly recommended day out.

Great artistic itinerary!. I particularly had a great time going from one story to the other in each graffitti we saw along with the fact that we were getting to know different urban landscapes while we discovered new neighborhoods. As a local I loved the dynamic and locations and the aftertour beer!. I highly recommend it to any local or tourist to get to know about the history of the city and some of its main characters.Great tour!

Off The Beaten Track!. I have been living in Buenos Aires for the past 6 months and recently went on the BA Street Art tour. This is a fantastic way to experience a different side of the city and escape the crowds of the typical tourist traps. Whether you are living in the city or visiting for a weekend, I would highly recommend the tour. We were shown a range of street art from those covering 5 story buildings to hidden gems on street corners. This really is a fantastic way to see another side of the city and to experience some of the most impressive street art in the world. Our guide Matt was very knowledgeable and as a novice I learned a lot about street art per se, the artists (who came from all over the world), and the context of street art in Buenos Aires. The tour was really well organised and I was able to enjoy the street art in a relaxed and fun atmosphere. I will certainly be taking my friends along when they visit!

Seeing Buenos Aires through different eyes. While my husband was attending a conference, I decided to see a little more of BA and joined the BA Street Art Tour. Wenzel is a dynamic guide who really understands the culture of street art in BA as he is a street artist himself. He is a native German who speaks excellent English and Spanish and was able to get his message across easily to both the English and German speaking tourists. The street art itself is really interesting, of a personal and political nature and the tour covers an area of the city I would never have gone to on my own. This tour is an excellent use of 3 hours and very good value.

Do something cool.... Had the good luck to go on Ba Street Art tour this weekend. I'm a Canadian that has been living in Buenos Aires for the past 4 years. I thought I knew the city pretty well, but this tour proved otherwise! super cool, super fun and showed me a whole new BA. Highly recommend the experience, very knowledgeable guide who taught me not just about the artists, but about the city itself. Will be sending my friends who come to visit on this. Do yourselves a favour and go.

Unique, educational fun filled afternoon. The BA Art tour offers a unique experience in Buenos Aires. The tour takes you to different parts of the city that one would not normally visit which adds a different perspective. The street art that we saw were from artists all over the world. The guide describes each piece of work in a very amusing and informative manner which makes the day both entertaining and educational. Fantastic !

BA street art tour. I had a great time on Wenzel's tour. He was a great tour guide and took us to places aroun Buenos Aires that I would have never seen otherwise. I also thought it was really cool that he was a street artist himself so he really knew the ins and outs of the movement and took us to some of his favorite places. The tour went at a good pace and I saw a lot of beautiful art! I really reccomend this tour!

Great tour and awesome art. Tour went at a relaxed and easy pace. It was a great way to see other parts of the city you really wouldn't wander to in general. We definitely saw some amazing art. I have been on a similar tour with another company, and I enjoyed this much more due to the easy going nature of our guide, the pace of the tour and the amazing art that he took us to see. Highly recommended.

awesome tour. This tour was really awesome. Our guide was a street artist himself. He had worked with some of the famous national and international artist you see on the trip. There wasn't a question he couldn't answer about both street art locally and on a global scale and he was also very knowledgeable about BA more generally too. Well worth it, stop reading this and book the tour.They take paypal too if you book via the website which is very convenient.

Seeing Buenos Aires with different eyes. I had a very interesting and relaxed afternoon on Wenzel's Street Art Tour. Being a street artist himself, he knows the places to go and quite a few fun stories to tell. Despite a few hiccups with the booking process, all went very smooth. Very lenient in terms of cancellation due to rain. Thanks a lot for this highly recommended experience!

Informative, fun way to explore the city. Highly recommended!. My wife and I booked a 3 hour private tour with Matt in late March 2014 on our last full day in Buenos Aires, and we absolutely loved it! First of all, the booking process was extremely easy and I was able to reserve our tour via email in English. BA Street Art Tours were excellent to communicate with, accepted payment via paypal, and went out of their way to accommodate our schedule by picking us up after lunch at La Brigada steakhouse in San Telmo and dropping us off at our hotel in Palermo after the tour. Matt was an excellent guide, very laidback but also extremely knowledgeable about the street art scene in Buenos Aires. He actually co-authored an excellent book on BA street art, which I subsequently purchased after returning home. We also enjoyed hearing him speak fluent Spanish, but with his native English accent.Following Matt's directions, our private driver drove us to numerous neighborhoods in BA that we would never have had a chance to visit otherwise. There was a protest in the city that day, and Matt was able to avoid the closed roads and traffic so that we didn't waste our time sitting in gridlock. He knew exactly where to go to view some of the most amazing street art that we have ever seen. His enthusiasm and his obvious appreciation of the art and the artists who created it enabled him to make the scene come alive for two novices who knew very little about street art prior to the tour. He was a fountain of information about the origin of the various pieces, the significance, the public reception, and the artists backgrounds.Although some of the neighborhoods visited on the tour were a little shady, at no point did we feel unsafe, and only once did we decide to return to the car rather than continue walking down a street towards a group of men who were drinking on the corner and eyeing us somewhat suspiciously. As Matt said, we were seeing the "real Buenos Aires," and not just the areas that tourists normally visit.We took a lot of photos of the art and of ourselves in front of the art. Matt was very patient and encouraged us to take pictures, took some pictures for us with my camera, and even took some photos of us with his much more sophisticated camera (and his more advanced photography skills). He shared his photos with us in a follow-up thank you email a couple of days after the tour, which again, was a nice touch and much appreciated. During the tour, we (obviously) talked a lot about art, but also about history, politics, the various neighborhoods, bars and restaurants, etc. The time seemed to fly by, and it was interesting to get Matt's perspective on life in BA. Matt's friendly demeanor and conversational tone made it feel like a casual guided tour given by a local friend or acquaintance.We would highly recommend taking this tour as a way to see some great art, explore some of the more "off the beaten path" areas of the city, and get a different perspective of BA than the average guided tour would offer. Even after giving our driver (who was also excellent) a tip, we found the experience to be well worth the price. If you're thinking about it, just take the tour- you won't regret it!

Awesome experience!. My girlfriend and I found out about this tour on Tourslatam and could not be more pleased with the outcome of this experience. The guides really know what theyre talking about, the walk was fun, and the people who were taking the tour with us were really cool and full of energy. I strongly recommend it!

AWESOME. Great way to spend an afternoon in a non-touristy and casual way. I didn't feel like I was on a tour - it was just friends hanging out, it seemed. The guides are awesome and even show you their own work -- it was really really great and I recommend it for sure.

This awesome, non-touristy tour gives you a real (and photo-friendly) angle on BsAs. Buenos Aires is not a "tourist-attraction" city. To really get a flavor for the place, you have to hit the streets, open your eyes, and observe the city for what it is - a colorful contrast of nostalgia and transience, optimism and cynicism, rawness and a bohemian sensibility that's rooted in Latin identity but that can seem disconcertingly fashion-forward at times. Not sure you'll pick up on all that in your 7 day itinerary weaving past the Obliesco? Fear not: Matt and Wenzel's tour of BA's most striking works of street art not only takes you to cool, off-the-beaten-track corners of the city: it tells the story of the place and it's creative allure in a way that few BsAs tours really can. The guides (the aforementioned Matt and Wenzel) are smarties, enthusiastic, engaging hosts, and best of all, artists themselves, so you're guaranteed to get thoughtful, funny and KNOWLEDGEABLE explanations of how the art you see came to be: the philosophy/politics/inspiration behind it, how the work was executed, the planning involved and, often times, cool stories about how the neighborhood reacted to the piece. Some artists are local, but many too are international, and Wenzel and Matt will give you the scoop on why so many underground artists are drawn to BsAs. Pro tip: you'll spend about 2 hours walking, and though it's flat, you'll wanna bring comfy shoes. And DEFINITELY tote a camera with you, as you'll probably snap some of your trips raddest and most award-winning photos on this tour. Not to be missed.

An essential experience for anyone that wants to see a different side to the city. I enjoyed the tour so much the first time I went, last year, that I decided to go again recently and loved it even more the second time - both Matt and Wenzel, the guides, are so approachable, knowledgeable and passionate about street art and both practise it themselves and are really tapped into the street art community, and this really comes across in their tours which are fun, educational and show you a totally different side of the city. They take you to areas you wouldn't otherwise see as a tourist and since going on the tour, I have really started to look around me more in the city. It was also fascinating going on the tour again and seeing how the street art had changed, it really shows what a dynamic, vibrant and accessible artform it is. An essential experience for anyone who wants to scratch beneath the surface and see what Buenos Aires is really all about.

Fantastic tour!. Do it if you have the chance to! Much more intresting than the normal free walking tours in BA. We had a lot of fun and Wenzel is a great tour guide. You feel that he loves what he is doing!

Fantastic way to spend an afternoon in Buenos Aires. I love to photograph Street art so I thought this tour sounded like fun. And it was fun. Wenzel was a very entertaining guide. However it was more than just fun. In just a few hours Wenzel taught us a lot about the techniques and culture of Street art while showing us the good and the bad of Street art. It felt like a real insiders tour. I'm certainly looking at graffiti and Street art with different eyes. Thanks

Excellent way to see the city and some great art. Getting to know the art scene in the country or city you visit is a wonderful experience, often far more rewarding than visiting established tourist destinations. In Buenos Aires, all the best art is outside….on the streets, on the walls, the whole city exudes! Buenos Aires Street Art provided an extremely interesting, well-informed, and fascinating insight into the vibrant street art scene in this amazing city. It is also a great way to see this city's hugely diverse neighbourhoods. Three solid hours on foot covering a large number of murals of extremely high quality. I can strongly recommend this activity.

Great!. Hey! I'm not normally a tour taking person and prefer to des cover things for myself. But I really wanted to go on this tour as I thought it had a point of differnece. I was right, Matt was a great host. Making the tour feel more like you a had a mate showing you his neighbourhood than a tour guide. It was very informative, but never boring. I had spent a month in BA and actively went looking for some of the best art in BA. On this tour in was shown great deal of works I wouldn't have been able to find on my own and got to know a lot more about the development of the culture over the last 20 odd years. Great tour. Don't go home wondering if it was as good as everyone said.

Great Tour. It was wonderful being able to walk around and see street art I wouldn't have stumbled on. What I especially liked was that BA Street Art works with artists and in certain cases helped them get commissions to paint public and private property legally. Our guide Matt was very knowledgeable, and made sure to offer opportunities to stop and get a refreshment or use the restroom. I highly recommend going on a tour if you want to see and learn more about the street art scene in Buenos Aires.
Must do in BA. We got a great guide, Matt who is very knowledgeable about every graffiti, street art and more.Is a walking tour that I'll recommend to everyone. Bring your camera.

A city famous for Street Art. Street art is one of the best experiences has to offer and this tour is the best way to see it first hand. Wenzel, our guide and local artist, guided us through neighborhoods that are off the tourist map home to multitudes of murals and pieces. We learned about this fascinating sub culture and why artists from around the world come to BA to create their art.

A must in BA. BA street tours was definitely one of our highlights in Buenos Aires! If you like to get to know a city from the inside, this is the way to do it. The tour takes about 4 hours and takes you via train to several hidden neighbourhoods. The art is amazing! Getting to know more about the artists and the unwritten rules of street art made you understand more about the city itself! It did not have the touristy feeling that other tours have. Wenzel, our guide, was the best! Highly recommend doing this tour, and it is not expensive!

Very interesting, well worth your while.. This tour is an excellent way to spend an afternoon. The art is incredible, the guide is knowleadgable and the city is beautiful. Speaking as a layman, this tour gave me a new perspective with which to view Buenos Aires. Now, when I cruise the streets, I always keep an eye out for the wealth of art to be found on every block.

A definite must see when in Buenos Aires.. This was such a wonderful experience. Our guide was very informative and passionate about street art. The walking tour was great, you really get a feel for the heartbeat of the city and for this craft. Definitely worth the money and the time. If you are thinking about going, do it. You won't be disappointed.

Art on the streets!. We were visiting our 24 year old daughter in Buenos Aires and we all like looking at art & exploring cities together. So, checking out street art and graffiti was on our list of things to do in BA. There are several companies and we had originally hoped to do the one on bicycle, but it was sold out, so we went with BA Street art and were thrilled with our tour and the range of art we saw. Our tour guide, Wenzel is a practicing artist and so he was able to articulately describe the varying techniques and the lingo. The tour began and ended in two different neighborhoods, so we took trains between the two (included in the price). It was fun & different!

Not cheap but priceless. We took part in the tour coincidently but it turned out to be one of the coolest episodes of our weeklong stay in BA. Truly an amazing experience for those interested in the stories behind the many artsy masterpieces we use to walk by everyday.Furthermore it will take you to places in the city you'd otherwise never go to...

Wonderful walking tour. I love street art and graffiti, and these guys put together a great walking tour (including some shutting on a bus) around a number of neighborhoods where we saw a great variety of murals etc we otherwise would not have known about. The guides were friendly, fun and knew a ton.

A must for artist and graffiti artists!. The boys were great. Showed us around the local spots. Informed us of the backgrounds of many of the local artists and the meanings behind a lot of there work. They can can also point you in the right direction of your Into this. They are also I the know of a lot of local exhibitions! Thanks boys, really enjoyed it. Keep at it. ;)

Engaging and fun. We took the tour a few days ago, Wenzel is a great guide and guy, very fun and relaxed. He had a lot of information but it was interesting and varied to listen to. We took a slightly different route than usual due to trains and Wenzel wanting to change it up, we saw some very new pieces that were only 10 days old! The level of street art is very high - We strongly recommend going if in Buenos Aires for art fans. Tip: Bring a hat and water! It was very hot and we walked a lot, so trainers are a good idea too, unless you like flip flop blisters.
Really fun. Wenzel took me and my gf on a really cool tour. Saw some great graffiti and places that I would have never found on my own. Highly recommend!

Worth doing. We really enjoyed this tour, it was different to anything else we did in the city and it's been really memorable for us. Allow some time at the end because it finishes in a bar/restaurant - we wished we'd had time to stay for a beer but we had to rush off.

Go On This Tour!. Wenzel was a great, friendly, knowledgeable guide. We saw some really cool pieces of art, and as an artist himself, he's able to provide a better perspective. Matt also knows and works with quite a lot of the artists, which provides even more credibility and insight. The street art in BA is incredible and this is a great way to get to see it! Go!!!

Great Tour. I really enjoyed the street art tour: Wenzel is not only a very good guide but he's a street artist and shares his stories as a street artist around the world. Wenzel & Matt are really passionate about the subject and took us on the train and in part of BA that are not on the tourist map, they are not only knowledgeable on street art but also on local politics and culture that is a plus. We finished the tour in a lovely pub, good way to socialize with other travellers.Really good value for money

Expertise, Fun, Off the beaten track. I really liked the Street Art tour because
- our guide was really entertaining and knew a lot of the spraying/street art scene
- the tour was well arranged and the walking distances were short
- the price was absolutly reasonable
Highly recommended to everyone wanting to see a really interesting part of BA!

Excellent tour. This was one of the best experiences i had in Buenos Aires. The tour was awesome and we learned alot about street art. If you go to Bs. As. you must take the tour, it's a completly different and unique experience.
Thank you Matt and Wenzel for everything.

Off the beaten path, great value. This is an awesome Buenos Aires activity. You get to see parts of the city that you wouldn't otherwise go to and view amazing street art (not graffiti). Our guide, Wenzel, told us not just about the specific art pieces we saw, but also about street art in general and the street art scene in Buenos Aires. We also got to see an artist doing a new piece and relaxed in a bar after the tour. It's also a nice way to meet fellow travelers and swap stories. Excellent value for your money!!

Great Tour!. It was a very nice adventure and an interesting tour! I saw areas of the city i didn't see the whole semester abroad and the tourguide Matt knew a lot about the streetart in Buenos Aires and the streetart culture itself! I can only suggest the tour!
Not to be missed. You have a choice between a walking tour or private car tour. The car tour covers more area. Fascinating outing. There is great street art in Buenos Aires and not to be missed.

Great walking tour. Matt and his team are very knowledgable and care about street art. I loved this 2.5 hour tour.The places we went to were just amazing given that most of the street art is not in high profile areas and thus, its a bit hard to find them and also, ever evolving.I wish the tour was much longer since I enjoy street art so much. I think this should become an all day tour.

Great tour even if you usually dislike tours. If you're looking for a way to see a side of BA you just wouldn't find on your own, definitely take this tour. I'm inspired by the company Matt has started here that's completely intertwined with the street art community here. My guide was a street artist who led us through an array of neighborhoods in BA and we got to watch a visiting artist at work on a wall, plus all got drinks afterward. Fun way to get to know the city.

Fun and inspiring!!. What an excellent tour!! We had such a great time walking the streets of BA, seeing amazing street art. Our guide Matt was fantastic, sharing his great knowledge, showing us truly amazing artworks and telling the stories behind the artists and their works.We also got to meet people from all over the world in this tour. Very much recomended if you're looking for an inspiring and fun experience in the city (also super affordable and worth every penny!).

Very entertaining/informative tour, unique part of BA, highly recommend. Having lived in BA for four years and explored many of its neighborhoods, I thought there wasn't too much I was missing out on. But Matt Fox-Tucker and his tour showed me a side of Buenos Aires I had never seen--not just the rarely-visited residential area of Villa Urquiza, but the life and story behind the many street murals there and the artists who create them. I was surprised to see that this organization not only offers tours of the graffiti art and street murals, but also takes an active hand in their creation, working with the city government and the local artists to arrange the painting of abandoned buildings and walls with undesirable scribblings. BA Street Art proposed and backed the largest street mural in the city--a breathtakingly bizarre one by Martin Ron (part of which is pictured here). One of many highlights in an eye-opening new window into the city. Definitely make it a part of your BA stay.

interesting & explorative, recommend highly.. Buenos Aires is great for street art everywhere. This tour was prompt and clear in replying to emails. The enthusiasm of the guides is infectious and their knowledge is outstanding. We were glad to walk through some residential neighborhoods that we normally would not have gone to and learn not only about the artwork and the artist but also the various techniques used in the creation of the piece. Matt is really friendly and the tour ends in a nice bar with art by Martin Ron. I finished the tour with far more appreciation of street art. I highly recommend this tour for anyone interested in art in an outdoor setting.

Excellent tour. As a first-time visitor, I was surprised to see how much graffiti there was in Buenos Aires, a lot of it political, some of it artistic, much of it intriguing, but I did not have any context to understand it.The tour was great because we saw prominent artists' works, in situ, and we got knowledgeable explanations from our guides about them. They also had interesting commentary about the Argentine political situation and related political graffiti. The experience was way better than an art museum tour -- the museum is the streets themselves.I knew nothing about street art before the tour besides having a passing familiarity with Banksy. But the tour guides passed along such great background and made the subject accessible. I ended up buying their excellent book and I brought home a new appreciation of this art form in my own hometown in the USA.

JOYA! AWESOME!. Awesome! Wenzel led a truly stimulating tour. It was entertaining as well as educational. For example, learned a lot about the social and cultural aspects behind BA street art. I felt the tour was a perfect time frame and perfect amount of walking. My guide was really smart and answered all the questions really well. On top of everything else, it was super affordable. I am using the pictures I took to make a gift for my sister...this was also made possible my Matt the head of the organization who is extremely kind and generous. Overall, great energy and vibes, 100% recommendation!!!

Great tour!. If you are into street art & grafitti, you may not mis this tour. Matt is really passionated, he speaks with a lot of energy and takes you to places you'd otherwise never get. Great way to explore (a small part) of the city!

Insightful and fun!. I recently traveled to Buenos Aires with my dad and really wanted to do this tour. There is a bit of age difference between my dad and I so I was worried he wouldn't be interested in the BA Street Art Tour. However, that was absolutely not the case! The tour was so insightful and Matt is the perfect tour guide, he answered all of our questions and showed us some amazing work! It was fun to walk around a diversified part of the city and see all the different kinds of work. By the end of my trip in Buenos Aires, my dad had mastered the difference between tagging, graffiti, and street art. Thank Matt, it was a treat!

Get to know BA's creative side. Buenos Aires has a lot of incredibly talented street artists who aren't necessarily part of the traditional art circuit of galleries and museums. Their work is scattered around the city, especially in the suburbs, where mural painting is facilitated by the presence of big white walls and neighbours amenable to the addition of local colour. For most visitors to the city, however, knowing where to look and what to focus on can be a challenge – it can be intimidating to get to know street art culture if you're not a part of it. That's where this fantastic tour comes in.Matt, the tour leader, is a great speaker who is passionate about street art, well connected with local artists, and a really nice guy. His talks are full of juicy information: from the history of the artwork, to local artistic feuds, to preferred brands of aerosol. He sheds light on the nuances between 'street art' and 'graffiti', while unerringly guiding his flock (a mix of locals and tourists) around lesser-known barrios of the city like Villa Urquiza.Street art is an essential and thriving part of Buenos Aires culture, and this tour is one of the best-run, most organised ways of getting to know it. Not to be missed.

A must-see in BA. The BA street art tour provided an insightful look at the city's burgeoning street art movement. Matt was a fantastic guide who shared his insider knowledge of the artist community in BA. The tour was engaging, informative and inspiring.

Really interesting tour. I did this tour with a group of friends who had invited me along, and would recommend this to anyone, especially given the questions the number of pieces of grafiti and street art scattered across Buenos Aires are likely to raise. Matt, who ran this tour, was clearly passionate about the subject of street art, and had a fantastic inisght into the political and cultural motivations behind the art. Definitely worth looking into.

Fantastic tour. We booked onto this tour last minute as our days plans fell through. Matt got back to us really quickly and sent us all the info we needed. The tour itself was excellent, visiting some amazing huge murals in the city and matt was a great guide, giving us loads of information as we went along. To top it off when we finished the tour matt sent us some info about possible tours in London which was really kind of him. Great service and a must do it BA.

Fantastic Tour -- Great for all Ages!. For those wanting to see an authentic and raw view of Buenos Aires, we highly recommend the street art tour provided by Matt Fox-Tucker. Here, your guide Matt will move you through various barrios and show various forms of street art and graffiti. The visual imagery of street art blended with Matt’s running narrative (his English and Spanish are very good) presents a powerful and highly memorable depiction of Buenos Aires culture, politics and life on the barrio streets that you simply will not discover on your own. As a bonus, sign up for the accompanying class where you can learn to paint street art. Our family ages 71 to 8, thoroughly enjoyed learning this new art form taught by local street artist ICE. For more on the local scene, purchase the excellent book “Textura Dos: Buenos Aires Street Art” at: http://buenosairesstreetart.com/books/.

Loved it!. I booked a private tour last weekend and had an amazing time! I went with my dad who previously had no interest in street art but now is fascinated by it! This is a true testament to how interesting and engaging the tours are. Matt has even emailed us afterwards with info regarding things he mentioned during the tour.

If you love street art, do this tour!. I finished up my 7 month South American trip with this gem of a tour. The graff was amazing, and Matt provided interesting insights into the street art located in BA. I thoroughly recommend this tour! Get on it.

Matt was awesome. His passion for art and artists was clear.. I would highly recommend this tour. Be on time, and the rest is a breeze. Matt is an expert, thorough and organized. He kept a close eye on everyone, it was very safe and the right length.

Great way to spend an afternoon. Matt, the guide, is very knowledgable of what's going on with BsAs street art and he shares this knowledge during the tour very well. The tour can be attended if you know nothing about street art or if you know more - there are interesting things for everyone.i really liked Matt's way of answering questions and giving info on whatever people were interested about. He would mark murals or sights to people's maps after the tour and help everyone with their questions.This tour is run by a guy with passion for street art, not someone trying to make an easy dollar from the tourists.

Very interesting. A great way to spend an afternoon!. My partner and I really enjoyed Matt's Tour around the streets of BA. We saw some amazing street art, something we would never have seen if we didn't book the Tour. Whether you're into street art or not, this is a great cultural thing to do!
Do Something Different in BA. It was a great way to see and understand the culture of BA rather than going to another tango show or Parilla! Matt is extremely knowlegable.

Great way to spend an afternoon in BA. Matt has a lot of passion for the street art scene in Buenos Aires, and he goes the extra mile to share it. He adapts his route based on what's gone up recently, tells you a lot of interesting information about the individual artists and pieces as well as the overall scene. We loved the chance to see parts of BA we wouldn't have otherwise, and really enjoyed being exposed to a world we knew nothing about before hand.If you like street art, or are looking for something just a bit unusual to do with an afternoon, this is a great bet.
great tour!. I highly recommend this tour! The organisation was perfect. The guide really knew what he was talking about!! An expert in street art in Buenos Aires.

One of a kind tour. What a neat experience! One of the highlights of our time in BA. Matt is a published expert on street art. He articulates the themes, stories, and physical art with awesome zest. Learned a ton...highly recommend

Recommended!. I can't recommend the BA street art tour enough. Lots of detailed info about the artists, history, etc and a tour of some parts of BsAs that you might not otherwise go to on vacation. The art is breathtaking. The highlight of my trip.
Good tour. Interesting tour. The guide really knew what he was talking about and had a passion for street art. Recommended.

One of the best city tour, unique to street art lovers.. Tired or the traditional or conventional walking tours? This one is for you then. Even those who don't normally visit art museums will find this interesting.
Matt did an excellent job on the tour showing us the places where tourist wouldn't normally visit and the streets we visited were flooded with street arts.
Don't think too much. Just go.

Alternative Culture reveals itself. If you're into Street Art or even if you just see it as vandalism, this tour presents the culture in a unique way that is full of enthusiasm and passion. I highly recommend it as a way of seeing something different, which is the whole reason we travel isn't it??The guide really knew his stuff and even showed us his published book on Street Art in BA.. I highly recommend it.

Great afternoon out to really immerse yourself in Argentine culture. I went on the tour with my girlfriend and we both really enjoyed the afternoon. Very interesting to see Buenos Aires from an alternative perspective and learn about street culture. Matt really knows his stuff about street art, and seems to be friends with many of the big artists in BA. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting looking for a real BA experience!

A must-do in BA. This tour is definitely a must-do if you're in BA - it takes you into a part of the city you as a tourist wouldn't normally see and gives you a good insight into local street culture. The art is pretty impressive too! Matt's a great guide and the pace is just right. Highly recommended.

top notch and informative. Me and my wife had a great afternoon out on the BA Street art tour. I found it all very informative with Matt, the knowledgable guide, going into the backhistory of a lot of the pieces and their makers, from local argentine artists to quite a lot of foreigner artists it seems. It brought it all to life for us and we found it thoroughly enjoyable including a well deserved local ale at the final stop!

Awesome street art tour. Great tour with a very knowledgeable guide who was able to give a lot of insight to the scene. Also a great way to see parts of BA that might not otherwise be on the tourist trail.

A great day out. My husband and I took the street art walking tour with Matt and had a fantastic time. He is charming, witty and hugely well informed about the street art scene in Buenos Aires. we had the great good luck to be on the street with Matt and the other group members when a lady approached Matt and told him about a brand new piece of art work at a nearby hairdressers. We all trouped up the road to have a good luck and were welcomed in by the crew there. Matt may be adding that to the tour next time.The stories and biogs about the contributors to BA's vibrant street art scene are very interesting and Matt delivers the info in a very articulate and laid back way. Hugely enjoyable and more than worth the modest fee they charge.we are in our 60s and physically it is a very easy and comfortable few hours walking tourMairead (Maggi) Bristol

Guided Street Art Tour Buenos Aires by Matt. I had a great day in Buenos Aires by doing a street art walking tour with Matt Fox. Walked through several neighbourhoods and learned a lot about the artist way and hidden messages behind the art! The most famous street artists are included ! Really a must do when you are in BA, also nice to meet other international travellers with same interest!
Really interesting and unique tour.. If you like street art you will love this. Really friendly and knowledgeable tour guide. A must see if you are in Buenos Airs.

Excelente!. Matt is very knowledgable about the street art scene in Buenos Aires, and he is also a key-player in many of the larger projects going on around the city. He tailors each tour to the current projects going on around the city, as well as the things he finds the most important and really explains everything you need to know about BA street art. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone who is even remotely interested in street art.

Great tour and amazing guide. We enjoyed the tour very much and had the opportunity to see some amazing street art. Like everybody said, Matt was a great guide/host. He is knowledgeable and we learned a lot about BA street art scene etc. but he's also very friendly and personable. Keep up the good work Matt!

Amazing art with an awesome guide!. I highly recommend this tour. We were able to see some amazing works of art and Matt the tour guide is super knowledgeable and gives a great deal of information through out the tour. He has written a book on the street art in BA so he truly knows what he's taking about. Awesome views of the city from a different perspective!

Really interesting tour!. This was a great tour for anyone who's even vaguely interested in street art and/or graffiti. Matt, the guide, gave us a comprehensive and informative overview of the Argentinean street art scene and took us to a range of sites where we saw the different (and sometimes conflicting) styles of art in Buenos Aires.We were lucky enough to see Martin Ron, his brother and Jiant painting a mural on the day that we visited, and we had the opportunity to speak to them about their work and take photos of them in action.This was a really enjoyable tour and I learnt a lot about street art and BA sub-culture. Recommended!

Unique opportunity!. I was lucky to join this tour at a time, when a street artist was currently working on a huge mural. The tour included stories of the development of the piece that was taking form and meeting with the artist. This will of course not be possible on every tour, but I guess it is an expression of how well-connected and up-to-date Matt from BA Street Art Tours is with the street art culture, local as well international. Definitely a unique opportunity to get behind some of the multiple street art and graffiti pieces of Buenos Aires.

Eye opening tour. Matt showed us in 3,5 hour a lot of graffiti and street art in Saavedra and Villa Urquiza. He explained very passionate about the paintings and I started to see the art in it. Before I never took a good look at those paintings. This tour showed me the briljant side of many of them and I enjoyed the good company of Matt.

Well Worth the Effort!. Last Friday I took the opportunity with a group of friends, to take the Street Art Walking Tour herein Buenos Aires with the very well informed Tour Guide, Matt from the U.K. It was really very worthwhile as I had never ventured into this part of the city before and now had the chance to get a better understanding of the various pieces of Street Art and Graffiti that adorn the walls of an enormous park in Colegiales and various houses nearby. Matt was able to keep us all involvedin what turned out to be a very well organised and relaxed learning experience.

Best street art tour ever!. My girlfriend and took a private Sunday tour with Matt and it could not have been better. We were picked up on time in a nice private car, and Matt was great from the beginning. He was very friendly and knowledgeable about the BA street art scene. He even catered the tour around the artist named Blu, as he knew ahead of time that I was a fan.No only did Matt know a lot about the backgrounds of the artists on the tour, but he knew about the techniques and materials they used as well. And being an artist and muralist myself, I found it extremely interesting. Another thing that Matt did for us, was he took his camera along and got photos of me and my girlfriend in front of the murals and emailed them to us after the trip. Matt went above and beyond any tour I have taken in the past.If you are a fan of street art, and have the chance to travel to BA, I highly recommend this tour. You won't be disappointed!

Great tour!. It was really fun and interesting. Matt knows a lot about the history of street art and all the different artists. You also see parts of BA which you would never visit on your own! I definitely recomend it!!!

Great introduction to B.A.'s street art. We had wonderful tour of some of Buenos Aires' best street art with Matt last week. He really knows a lot about the history of street art, not just in B.A. but generally, and certainly knows the scene in B.A. very well. We enjoyed visiting some different neighborhoods that we probably would not have seen otherwise, and loved learning about the various styles and artists whose work we would later see throughout the city. Definitely recommend this tour.

Awesome view of BsAs from the streets. We took a weekend tour with Matt, and had a fantastic time. I had realized some great street art here before, but had no idea the variety and extent of it. Matt was super helpful not only with his street art expertise, but also with suggestions for other things to do and places to eat in the city. I typically hate tours and 'touristy' type things, but this is a can't-miss whether you're visiting for a short time or you've been here for years - it definitely opened my eyes to a whole new part of Buenos Aires.

A great afternoon!!!!. I had a great time on this tour! It was amazing to listen to Matt talk about all of the street art, he is so knowledgable about all of it. We took a train once we met in the cafe, which was also cool because we went to parts of BA I would have never visited on my own. This is a great way to spend an afternoon, whether you are traveling with others or if you are traveling on your own. This is not one to be missed!

Great tour, passionate guide in Matt. Matt,Simply, thank you. We had a great private tour with you around sights that you are obviously passionate and knowledgable about. Everything was arranged through email while we were in Uruguay and you were in the UK. We had lots of opportunities to mis connect but your arrangements were flawless. The tour is well worth doing for anyone from the novices (that was us) to the experts.I loved the other comments about mind where you walk because BA is full of canine land mines and Matt also seemed to know where they all were will explaining the street art as he went.Thanks mate!!Pete

One of my favorite parts of our trip!. We had such a great time on the tour! Matt's excitement was contagious and he did a great job of taking us through the streets at a comfortable pace so that we could see as much as possible. He had the transportation planned perfectly and was always keeping track of us to make sure we didn't wander off or step in anything unpleasant (lots of dogs in the park!). He even had umbrellas for us when it started to sprinkle, and bug spray when the mosquitos would occasionally land on any of us for a snack :) The Street Art scene in Buenos Aires is incredible, and I left anxious to learn more about the various artists ~ I even follow one of them on Facebook now! We were in Argentina attending a conference, and the tour came highly recommended from a few of the attendees. I wouldn't say I was excited to go at first, but it ended up being one of my favorite days in Buenos Aires! Matt did an awesome job!

One of the best experiences I've had in BA. I've been living in Buenos Aires for almost a year now on a university placement and I can say that the tour I went on with BA street art tours is easily one of the best things I've done during my time here. The excellent guide Matt gave us an in-depth view into the world of graffiti and street art in BA, and more specifically about the artists and how they do their work. We travelled through areas of the city that I'd never been to, and I found that it was a great way to get to know BA. Before the tour I didn't know much at all about street art in general, but since I've been inspired to write a uni essay on the graffiti and street art of Buenos Aires. The artwork is incredible, the guide is brilliant, it's a must-do!

The anti-nostalgic Buenos Aires ;). There is more than tango and football lovers in Buenos Aires! If you like getting to know other authentic and actual things that are going on in the city, then this tour is very recommendable! Matt knows the street-art scene well and will give you first-hand informations

Must-do in Buenos Aires!. Taking the street art tour was one of my highlights in Buenos Aires. Matt is a very attentive, professional and nice guy and guide, who takes you to places you yourself as a tourist will not easily find or go to. I found it really interesting to hear more about the artists, the differences in street art and also to learn more about the law. The best thing is that you can ask Matt all the questions you like and that you get to see many interesting pieces of art. I was glad I took the tour at the beginning of my stay, because afterwards I started to recognize the work of specific artists wondering around the different barrios of Buenos Aires myself. Really cool. Don't hesitate and just book the tour. I recommended it to a lot of my classmates as I was taking a Spanish course in Buenos Aires and they all liked it very much.

A must-do in BsAs!!. This tour should not be missed! I stayed in BsAs for 6 weeks and this was one of the best things I did while I was there. Matt is so knowledgeable and his passion for Street Art and BsAs is infectious! I was recommended the tour by a group of friends who live in the city, and I hope the word continues to spread on how great this tour is. A perfect way to spend a sunny afternoon in BsAs... highly recommended.
Really interesting. This was a brilliant afternoon, it was great to see some different neighbourhoods of Buenos Aires and find out about the city's thriving street art scene.
Excellent!!!. Very complete!! I loved it!! A very nice walk through three neighborhoods full of street art! Matt is so knowledgeable!! I would highly recommend!!

Fascinating look at the local Writing scene. We were visiting BA for around a week and as I have more than a passing interest in Writing, my wife and I decided to check out this tour. To say these guys are well connected is an understatement. They not only seemingly know the intricacies and politics of the local scene they positively encourage it too, working daily with Writers and home owners to find new wall space. The tour gives a great insight into the current local and global scene (many international Writers come to paint in BA). The guys' passion is Street Art, but if you're more into traditional Writing you will not be disappointed, there are some superb pieces of both types. I lost count of the amount of pics I took! A great tour for graffiti old timers like myself and newbies alike. Our group contained a cross spectrum of people. The tour guides are friendly, knowledgeable and great company. Highly recommended.

My favorite pART of Buenos Aires!. This tour rocks and Matt is the man! He loves the city and is passionate about the art. I may have the chance to travel back to Buenos next year and would take this tour again in a heartbeat... thumbs way up!

Art attack!. The Buenos Aires Street Tour is not your average touristy tour! In small, personal groups you get to go off the beaten track & into areas of the city that no tourists normally venture. Matt is extremely friendly, knowledgeable and goes over & above the call of duty to give everyone a great experience of street art in BsAs, using his in depth street-art expertise as well his natural enthusiasm. Even though I had zero knowledge of street art & graffiti I felt that I learnt a lot about the history and culture surrounding the street art- one of the coolest things is that Matt actually knows the artists themselves, and thus exactly what the artists were expressing. We saw works that were only days old due to Matt’s local knowledge, so the whole experience felt very genuine and unique. We even did our own bit of graffiti which was really fun- I have left my mark in BsAs!! I would recommend to anyone! Gracias Matt & Buenos Aires Street Art!

A must for all graffiti or street art enthusiasts. I loved this tour - it was my highlight of Buenos Aires! The art work / graffiti on display through out the city is amazing. I took over 100 photos we saw so much.Matt certainly knows his stuff and gave us plenty of information on the artists themselves.Highly recommended:-)

The cool side of Buenos Aires. Forget calle Florida, Obelisco or Recoleta cemetery. If you want to know another side of Buenos Aires, this is your tour. Streets with no tourists and full of art and histories. The variety and creativity of Buenos Aires street art are impressive. Prepare to take lots of pictures! Matt, the guide, is really kind and helpful. He really loves all about graffiti.The meeting point was in front of a cafe in Colegiales and, from there, we took a minivan to start our tour. They were about six stops. The last was in a really nice bar with good talking and beer.

Great perspective of a different side of Buenos Aires. The tour was really interesting and the tour guide was really kind and interested. He told us all the stories related to the arts and was very helpful. A must if you're looking for a different side of Buenos Aires.

An excellent way to see a different side to the city. Everywhere you go in Buenos Aires you see street art in one form or another. This tour gave us an excellent insight into the people who paint, the different styles, methods of painting and background to some of the pieces.Matt, the tour guide, was excellent. He clearly has a lot of knowledge in this area and his enthusiasm comes across as he leads you around the city. It was a fantastic way to spend the afternoon and I would highly recommend it as a "must do" while in Buenos Aires.

A look into BA's street art scene. This tour goes you insight about the diffenrt street art, graffiti, and murals alll around Buenos Aires. It is not your typical sightseeing tour, which is part of it's great value. The tour gives you background on some of th bigger street artists in Buenos Aires, information I wouldn't be able to collect on my own about sights I wouldn't have been able to find. Our tour even got to see 6 different artists in action while we were walking, a few of them being major names on the street art scene. Our tour guide was clearly an expert on the topic and a pleasure to have. 100% recommended for anyone who has even a small appreciation for street art.

An excellent way to understand BA's many graffiti'd buildings. Almost every building in BA has some form of art, graffiti, or mural painted on it (including the area around la casa rosada). This tour was all about giving you an insider's perspective on the meanings, differences in art, and legality. After going on this tour, I felt compelled to stop and not only look at the art on random buildings at every corner, but the art beneath this (as often times a graffiti artist may have their work covered up by another piece only a few weeks later). This is not your run-of-the-mill bus tour led by someone reading a memorized script...which is why I enjoyed it so much.

Infectious enthusiasm. Our guide Matt clearly loves his job - his knowledge and enthusiasm made this one of the highlights of our short stay in Buenos Aires and a great way to see parts of the city we would not otherwise have ventured to. Graffiti/Street Art is there to see in every city but this is the first time anyone has been able to get across the attitudes of the artist, the (sometimes) competition between them and the techniques they use. If you have to choose between visting a gallery or doing this tour .... do the tour. Thanks Matt.

Very cool! Not your typical tourist attraction.. I recently spent an entire week in Buenos Aires, and this tour was easily one of the coolest things I checked out. Anyone who comes to BsAs will notice that graffiti is EVERYWHERE (unfortunately most of it is "vandalismo" and looks horrible) however there is also tons of incredible "stree art" to be found.Our guide, Matt, was awesome! He showed us some amazing examples of street art and explained the techniques, influences, and messages behind the art work and the artists; many of which are world famous. I highly recommend this tour if you want to experience a unique side of BsAs that isn't on the typical tourist trail.

Prolific and Stunning. My friends and I did this tour in January. We'd all seen street art in other cities, and were familiar with some of the art in BA, but were truly stunned by the amount and variety to be seen. Our guide, Matt Fox, is a true expert on these art forms and we were treated to a real education as he explained the differences between street art, graffiti, political expression, and vandalism on a walk that took us to areas we'd never have dreamed of venturing to on our own. His enthusiasm is infectious, and he's really quite a pleasant fellow to spend an afternoon with. For the remainder of our time in the city we were constantly on the look-out for more street art. I highly recommend this tour.

Street art explained by an expert. As someone who has always wondered about this alternative art form this was a perfect primer on the difference between street art, graffiti and just plain 'vandalismo'. Matt, a transplanted British journalist, who runs these tours is an expert on this subject, has written extensively on the subject and knows many of the artists in this genre. His explanations were fascinating as were the various different barrios he took us to - ones not visited by the majority of tourists. Our trip to BA was greatly enriched and we'd highly recommend the experience. The $20.00 charge is an afternoon well spent!!

Great way to spend an afternoon!. My boyfriend and I went on this tour in early March. I've explored street art in other cities before, but we were both amazed at what we saw! Our tourguide Matt was very enthusiastic -- his passion and knowledge were evident. He makes tourists feel comfortable in a new city, while exploring areas we otherwise wouldn't have ventured to (walking and by train). I was also connected to information on my favourite artists afterwards, they really go above and beyond. I would definitely recommend this tour!!

Buenos Aires Street Art tour was a highlight of my trip. My husband and I had a great tour of the visually appealing street art of Buenos Aires. We felt priviledged to be taken through a few neighborhods with our guide Matt, who shared his expertise on the artists, techniques, subjects and the legal, cultural and political aspects of this fascinating art form. I would highly recommend this tour to any traveler to BA who wants to leave that city with a new appreciation of street art, the differences between street art and graffiti, and a chance to see a variety of neIghborhoods with new eyes.

Great Alternative Tour. I have been living in Buenos Aires for some time now and am finally seeing all the sights while I have a friend in town. This tour gave me a whole new perspective on the city overall but especially the street art scene. For any tourist, it is a great way to mix it up after days of touring and tourist activities. Matt was extremely enthusiastic and passionate about the subject and his energy was contagious. Overall, a wonderful way to spend an afternoon.

Best thing to do in Buenos Aires!. I went on this fantastic walking tour on my very first day in Buenos Aires. I was so glad I did it early on my trip! I noticed so much more about art all throughout the city; even all throughout the country! We saw lots of cool, new, street art and we even got to meet one of the artists! The guide provided us with sunscreen gave us lots of great tips on making the most of our stay in Buenos Aires. Thanks for a most enlightening tour!

Awesome!. Our afternoon with Buenos Aires Street Art Tours was by far our favorite activity during our one week in Buenos Aires. We had no previous knowledge of street art but that was no problem what so ever. Highly recommended!

Great!. I've been impressing my friends with my knowledge of local street art since I went on the tour. Bryce, who led the tour, was really passionate about the art form and very knowledgable. Plus, if you're friends with them on Facebook, they post pictures of recent street art and you can go explore yourself! Be sure to leave time in trip for this tour, you won't regret it.

The Best Way to See Buenos Aires. If you want to see BA up close and personal, this is the best company to make it so. We were met at our hotel, taken by taxi to San Telmo where we started our walking tour of this fabulous city. First was San Telmo, then Monseratt, Centro, Retiro and ending in the cemetery in Ricoletta. Along the way we we discovered more of the history of Buenos Aires; its trials, tribulations and successes. Oliver, our guide, was exceeding knowledgeable of his chosen city and was a font of knowledge. We'd highly recommend this company for a personal tour of this beautiful city.

Great street art tour- highly recommend!. Matt's enthusiasm for street art is infectious as he takes you around lesser known neighbourhoods and shares his knowledge. Great tour that I would highly recommend!

Local and international artists. It was an awesome tour through the less-touristy street of residential Buenos Aires which made it feel more 'genuine'. The guide was a very passionate expat who has been living here for ages and clearly knows the world of street art inside out, and knows the artists personally. Overall a very affordable and enjoyable way to spend an afternoon. I'd highly recommend it.

A must do in BsAs. Doing some kind of Streetart tour in Buenos Aires (one of the most important places for streetart in latinamerica and worldwide as you can find high quality streetart around the whole city) is a very recommended activity while your stay in Buenos Aires. I checked out the options and came out with BA Street Art Walking Tours. Already my first impression was really positive. They maintain a very informative website (http://www.buenosairesstreetart.com) and facebook group where you can already get a lot of information in advance. Moreover my contact over mail was answered soon, uncomplicated and with all the information I needed. So I joined the walking tour which left the oncoming day (10.01.2013). The tours are leaving at 3pm and last almost 3h. They charge 100ARS or around 20USD.The guide - Matt - speaks english and is highly knowledgable about streetart in general and specially about the streetart scene in Buenos Aires and its obvious he has first-hand knowledge about streetart art in whole Buenos Aires like not many more. He moved to Buenos Aires in 2009 and published a book about streetart in Buenos Aires (Textura dos) together with a brazilian photographer.The tour starts in the eastern part of Palermo (Colegiales Train station) from where you take the train to the Saavedra barrio. Most of the tour takes place in this barrio. Matt shows you a lot of awesome artworks by international and national artists (like Blu, Jaz, Gualicho, Malegria, Pum-Pum, Pelado) and tells you the history about every work. Moreover you get an introduction to streetart in general and about streetart in Buenos Aires (historical facts, legal situation, artists). No matter if you already have knowlege about streetart (in Buenos Aires) you will learn a lot on this tour and its more than worth the money you spend. And you can be sure your money goes to a good cause and its the least to support these two guys for all their work they have done so far and still are doing and all the artists behind that keep the streetart alive in Buenoa Aires. During the tour you can place any questions you may have and you can be sure to get a deep answer. At the end of the tour you get a sheet with a list of the most important artists and their websites/blogs/flicks accounts and some more sots in buenos aires with important artworks.I can't recommend this tour enough if you have a half day in buenos aires and it was by far the best activity in this city. Do this tour as its awesome their is such a good link between the streetart around the city and foreign tourists.Some points that could be optimized in my opinion: The tour could be made later the day (the hours before sunset) so there would be better light conditions for photographies and at some points the tour was a little bit in a hurry so it was not always possible to give the works the time they deserve.

Superb, book it - don't think twice!. We had a private tour with Matt with our two young children and we all loved it. We learned a bit, enjoyed the colours and creativity. Definitely a highlight from our trip.

Great insights!. I went on the Florida-Recoleta and the Recoleta-Palermo walk today and I loved it! The guide shares great stories and teils history in a humorous way. He speaks English perfectly, announces breaks im advance and is highly knowledgeable. It is not tyring at all. A great way to explore BUE!!

Amazing art tour. Fantastic, engaging tour delving into Buenos Aires street art scene - the tour leader Matt is enthusiastic and knowledgeable, bringing to life the stories surrounding graffiti in Buenos Aires. Enlivening, colourful and a beautiful introduction to the creative underbelly of B.A. Absolutely must-do during your time here!

The best thing I did in BA. Great experience educational but so much funThink it showed me the heart of buenos airesLearning the city,finding places I would never had seenEven came across an artist in actionAnd Matt was entertaining and knowledgeableDon't miss it

artistic view of BA. One of the greatest views of Buenos Aires! this was not only a tour but a pedagogical view of street art in the city through the great explanations given by Matt. He told us specific details about the street arts-graffittis and murals and also stories about some of the artists!. It is also good to know that he actually wrote a book about Street Art in B.A that made me feel that he really knows about the subject and he is totally committed to doing it!

Exploring Street Art with Matt. This is a great way to dive into the wealth of street art that is out there, explore new parts of the city that you may not get to otherwise, meet new people, make new friends, and to have a fantastic time while doing it! Matt's wealth of knowledge about the street art scene is quite impressive, so remember to pepper him with loads of questions! After the tour, your perspective of the city will change, and you will constantly be scanning the walls as you go around in buses, taxis, or on foot.

A great way to discover Buenos Aires off the beaten path. Before I left Buenos Aires luckily a friend of mine shot me a message if I would be up to join a Buenos Aires graffiti tour with him. I agreed and found myself on this tour the next day, discovering new neighbourhoods of B.A. I had not visited yet.The tour itself was great: the guy who runs the tours has a big knowledge about Street Art and even more intersting for newbies: he could tell the story behind those graffitis and gave a lot of information about the artist and the Street Art Scene in general. Based on a 6 month research of the scene down there these guys also wrote a book and can tell a lot of stories about B.A. as well - an excellent value for the money spent. Moreover I saw a different side of B.A. than just the typical tourist spots in San Telmo, La Boca or Palermo.

One of the best days we had in Buenos Aires. I found Matts site while browsing the internet in Buenos Aries , Three of us connected with Matt ,He gave us a great overview of the street art happening there. After the tour he introduced us to a local artist that shared his passion for painting ,and demonstrated some of his techniques . Matt and ICE where so easy going and informative it really made our trip complete in Argentina. I would recommend this experience to anyone or everyone. Its a must do !!!! Thanks Matt from Paul

An educational experience!. My husband & I had a wonderful time on the tour with Matt. Although the group was large with a lot of murals to cover, Matt was very thorough & informative in explaining the street art culture & had up to date reports of the rivalries of the artists which we found fascinating. The art is beautiful & the culture is so interesting. We would highly recommend this tour. The 3 hours flew by. Thanks for the great tour Matt!

One of the best things to do in Buenos Aires. It is well known that Buenos Aires has produced many great artists, especially in literature, music and the film industry but it is fascinating to find out that nowadays the talent of many "porteños" is producing not just very fine street art but also an exciting point of encounter and opportunities for many international artists. Moreover, I guess I am not the only one who had the idea that Argentines were rather sensitive to art and innovative forms of expression and such an idea has been gratefully confirmed by those citizens (and I believe even some local authorities) who are embracing and supporting the effort and amazing creations of street artists.In addition, the art street scene provides perfect evidence on how blurry the line is between street culture and art as most people think about it.The tour is great and one of the activities a tourist should not miss in Argentina. Finally, the tour guide is excellent and someone who can teach you many interesting things.

Waliking tour BA. The tour had a great pace, Matt paid attention to everyone in the group of about 10 people. The information was relevant and pointers and insights to the street art movement in the world and BA most instructive. Definetely a high 5 star rating. Check his tour out.

Great Private Tour. My husband and I did a private walking tour with Matt right before Christmas. We had a great time walking around some of the BA neighborhoods and Matt was very knowledgeable about the artists, the street art scene and where to go. He came prepared with sun screen and bug spray, which neither of us thought of bringing. What was really great is that Matt was flexible with his timing given that we had to change the time of our tour due to airline delays. Overall, we enjoyed the walking tour. Perhaps the only thing we would have changed is that we would have liked to see more street art/murals and less graffiti, however, this just can't be controlled all the time!We saw some amazing murals and we did love our tour. If you are not an avid street art fan, I would say do a regular, shorter group tour over the private, 3hr long tour. We loved it, but it's not for everyone!

Awesome introduction to BAs streetart!. Great tour with guides that have a passion for streetart. 3 hours in collegiales, villa urquiza and palermo. Interesting selection of murals and streetart with lots of information about each piece and the artist in general. Higly recomendable

Great alternative tour of the city. We wanted to visit areas of Buenos Aires that is more off-beat and found this tour on Tripadvisor and it was a great find. Matt, our guide, was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the BA street art scene. In our close to 3-hour walking tour, we've seen many different types of street art and heard about the subculture. It's also interesting to hear about the individual artists, the commercialization of street art, the vandalism and enforcement, and well, the aerosol vs. paint debates. We even saw some art from our hometown artists! It is a very informative tour and while I am probably no closer at being able to tell between the painting styles, I know a bit more about this somewhat controversial art form. Just remember to bring bug spray (luckily Matt had some) and sunscreen.If you are looking for something different to do in this massive city, take a look at BA Street Arts Walking Tour. Matt keeps a blog that has more information about the scene and the artists.

Excellent way to BA s streetart!. Very good way to get to know the topic of streetart and to see some non touristic areas of BA. Matt obviously loves the topic and has a good way to share his passion. Do not bring valueables unnessarily as on there are sometimes pickpockets working...

Best Open Air Museum in the World. Let Matt guide you around the world's (arguably) largest open air art gallery. Buenos Aires has become an epicentre for street art, and Matt is the guy in the know when it comes to the Buenos Aires scene. Let him show you around, and give you some insight on just why Buenos Aires has become such a hotbed. Definitely check it out!

THE best 3 hours spent looking at art!. At first I was confused as to where and why we were meeting near the train tracks. It soon became quite apparent that we were taking the train 3 stops out of town to see some of the best street art in Argentina (and perhaps Latin America). Matt, our guide is a Brit who left the BBC (he was an announcer) and gives tours on street art. He also co-wrote a wonderful book on street art (he actually wrote it while a friend took the photos). He is extremely knowledgeable and friendly. He is also concerned about our safety which made it easier to concentrate on the art. He showed us various artists and explained the difference between street art, grafitti, vadelismo (vandalism) and stencil art. He knew exactly where to go to find the newest art. Believe me, I have walked up and down Dorrego Street every day and yesterday a new piece of street art was painted! This tour is a MUST!!!5stars Matt!

Unexpectedly amazing experience in Buenos Aires. We were told by a friend who is an expert on art to do a street art tour in Buenos Aires. We thought it might be something really good since our friend gave it such a high credit. We loved it all! Not only that we saw some spectacular paintings, drawings, prints, etc. bejeweling the otherwise gray buildings at Buenos Aires, but we also saw how the locals live. Most of the good art is located out of the pretty and polished city centre so we got to know the town well.In South America it is hard to find an English speaking (very-well english speaking) guides, but Matt (originally from the UK) spoke fluently thus we got a maximum out of our tour. He was friendly and answered all our questions without hesitating. I recommend this tour to anyone who has three spare hours in BA.

Completely unique experience, must do for art appreciators. Not only was the tour a highly informative experience and a way to see real, live work off some of the bet street artists in the world, it was also a fun was to explore parts of the city that a tourist wouldn't necessarily visit otherwise. We walked around with Matt and took a couple different trains to different neighborhoods to check out various murals. Matt is an excellent guide, passionate about his work and is just a really nice guy. I would rightly recommend this tour to anyone who appreciates art and exploring different parts of the city.

Saw Jaz paint live!!. The guide (Matt) is so friendly and relaxed you feel like you've met up with a friend who knows so much about street art and he is taking you to his favourite spots. On the tour we saw some work by Blu, Cof Anamalitoland, Jaz to name just a few. Matt gives great explanations of the artists techniques used and even knows how long they have been up on the wall. Half way through the tour, after a great explanation of a Jaz piece in the park, we turn the corner and we couldnt believe our eyes...we had Jaz painting live!! Putting up a new piece while a documentary crew filmed him!!! So amazing!! (see pic) They even asked Matt for an interview which made me realise even more that he is thoroughly involved in the BA street art scene. After the tour we all had lunch together and Matt gave us a handout with more places to see and a list of all the artists you see. I was really impressed with this tour, such a chill way to spend the day, sooooo much art and really exceeded my expectations. A must do if in BA.

You MUST take this tour when you visit BA!. I had no idea about the thriving street art scene upon arriving in Buenos Aires, but it quickly became a mild obsession for me. It wasn't until my last day that I was able to take this walking tour. Matt is really great. He is very knowledgeable about the artists, their backgrounds, and the lively street art scene of the city. The tour itself is nearly 3 hours and you get to see all sorts of amazing artists' work. I'm generally not into tours (like with a minivan and a person yammering on at you for several hours) when I visit somewhere. But it's clear that Matt is in the know regarding this topic and that he's very passionate about it. And I wish that I could still be in BA ogling the city's lovely art. It's also very affordable!!!
