Art lovers cannot miss it!. We have enjoyed a beautiful time with Matt who showed us different street artists and taught us about techniques, different styles, street art history, etc.A super recommendable tour to admire great artists in Buenos Aires´streets! Loved it!

Street Art Walking Tour in Buenos Aires. Really enjoyed this tour with Matt as the guide. He certainly knew his stuff and his passion for the art work was infectious! It shows another side to Buenos Aires and it is cetainly worth doing.
Great!. Fun experience that exposes you to a great part of culture in Buenos Aires! Extraordinarily knowledgable tour guide.

Pretty interesting!. I found this tour pretty interesting and it gave a different perspective on Buenos Aires. This tour took me to areas of Buenos Aires I have never been before.Although the first area we have been to was pretty nice I found the second neighboorhood we visited much more interesting. I like when graffiti is mixed with other nice landmarks of the city!

Fantastic art and a very knowledgable guide in Matt who makes you feel very welcome on the tour.. Went on the BA street art walking tour today and had a great time. Matt explained all about the artists, the art, the law and the culture behind street art in Buenos Aires. We went to some great sights that we would never have ventured to alone. With the art constantly changing and Matt's knowledge of this I feel the trip would have something new to offer all the time. Really worth a trip and really good value for money.

A MUST for art enthusiasts wanting a different perspective on art form. I went to Buenos Aires with the intention of going on a street art walking tour. I had been to one in Berlin and was impressed with the talent that lies on and in between the bricks and concrete of the city.I searched for walking graffiti tours prior to arriving (Oct06-15) in Buenos Aires. What appealed to me about Buenos Aires Street Art Tour was the professionalism of the website and the detail of information I received when I inquired about the tour--I was sent all the necessary information that helped me quickly make my decision to attend.I booked myself and went on what turned out to be the best decision coupled with beautifully comfortable weather.I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS TOUR. The art and tour was vibrant, informative, and also felt personal. I've acquired a new found respect for true street art. Our guide, Matt, was exceptional. I am in awe of his enthusiasm and knowledge of both the artists, their history, their works of art and the city of Buenos Aires. We were taken to a part of Buenos Aires that I likely would not have ventured into partly because it was not on the tourist map. Definitely an off the beaten track/path tour. And a bonus--we got to stop for delicious empanadas.I also picked up the book Textura Dos: Buenos Aires Street Art and it sits on my coffee table proudly displayed and admired. Unlike other forms of art that are stationary (on canvas, paper, framed, or whatever surface), street art can vanish and vanish quickly leaving it a distant memory. The book manages to capture the art, the artists, neighbourhoods in Buenos Aires and more importantly, it captures the experience.One regret was not congregating with the street artists at the local graffiti festival in La Plata. Well done. Encore.

Awesome way to spend a few hours in BA. When my daughters were in Buenos Aires visiting for a week, one of the highlights of their trip was the BA Street Art tour with Matt. He is very knowledgeable about both the art and the artists, and the passion he has for Street Art was evident throughout our tour. While my girls are very interested and involved in street art, I'm not yet I enjoyed the tour just as much as they did. His enthusiasm is contagious. At the end of the tour, I was a bit turned around in terms of directions and he kindly walked about twenty minutes out of his way to make sure we got on the right bus back to our hotel. A great way to spend a leisurely afternoon!

Better than any museum in Buenos Aires!. This tour is a must if you want to get the real feel of Buenos Aires. Matt is an excellent guide and will show you all the great street art around town. He knows a lot of the artists personally so he can give you great background info on all the pieces. I highly recommend this tour to anyone interested in the street art scene!! A+

Street Art Safari. Matt is a great guide; genuinely enthusiastic he shares a great deal of knowledge about the Latin American street art culture in general and of Buenos Aires in particular. Street Art could use some ambassadors like him. As to the tour, even if you don't like the paint you will enjoy being off the beaten track.

A great street level way to view street art. Matt runs a very informative tour. He is a native English speaker with a deep insight into the current street art scene. The tour is well worth the money. You can do an alternative tour for free by zigzagging the streets on San Telmo bounded by Independcia, 9 De Julio, Humberto Primo & Defencia
Fantastic Tour. Best thing I have done in Buenos Aires. Matt is friendly, knowledgable, and a great guide. I highly recommend this tour for those with even the faintest interest in street art.

Don't miss this tour!. I really enjoyed this tour and was really impressed by Matt's knowledge and insider information. I'd recommend it to anyone with even a passing interest in street art. Wear comfy walking shoes - there's so much to see, you don't want to limp :)

Personable and excellent tour guide.. Matt was a well spoken and personable. He is someone you want to take you on a tour. The street art in BA is fantastic and his in depth explanations really made me think and appreciate the time and effort he has made to put this tour together. Too bad it had to come to an end.

Informative, fun and great company. Its great when travelling, to come across a simple and totally relaxing way of not only meeting people but also learning about the place you are visiting. The BA Street Art Walking Tour I did with Matt this week was brilliant. I not only got to meet some great people and get some exercise, but I also saw some amazing street art and parts of BA I wouldn't have otherwise seen. Matt was great and not only imparted information on the BA street art culture but also on BA generally. As a single traveller, the tour provided company and conversation. If you enjoy street art, or even just seeing different parts of a city's culture, this tour is excellent.

A fresh way to discover a city!. Street art is a great way to discover parts of cities that you would normally not visit and often murals capture not only the artist’s passion, but also very current issues. I have done a few street art tours in cities over Europe, but Matt, our expert guide, really made it unique. He is extremely passionate about the history, the artists and each mural he reveals along the way. Definitely recommended, it is a very relaxed and casual way to discover parts of Buenos Aires.

Recommended by Portenos themselves!. I'm normally not a fan of organized tours but BA street art walking tour was like catching up with an old friend who happens to know everything about street art and more (history, current events, pop culture, etc). Matt, our guide was very professional, informative, and genuine. Truly inspired by his passion to share street art with a novice like myself.

Terrific Way to Spend an Afternoon. This was our third visit to Buenos Aires. Each time we've been fascinated with the vibrant street art community that flourishes here. Matt was the perfect guide - friendly, casual and informative. He brought us to new areas we hadn't seen before and his knowledge of the latest street art gave us an insight into the culture and some historical perspective of the transitory nature of images we had seen before which are now gone. Highly recommend!

I learnt so much!. It was fantastic, packed full of information! I now feel inspired to give it ago and paint. It also shows you a whole other side to buenos aires that I never knew about, street art has a life of it's own! Our guide was very genuine and very passionate about all the art work, this showed in his endless knowledge about every piece we saw. A great thing to do on your birthday ;)

An alternative guide to the streets of Buenos Aires. I very much enjoyed the walking tour and learnt a lot about street art. Friendly and approachable, Matt was the perfect guide. I would recommend this tour to anyone who wants to get away from the crowds and see something very few people see - a large and diverse collection of alternative art.

Definite highlight!. I had heard from other people that I HAD to go on this tour and thank goodness I did! Matt knows both the city and the street art scene and took us to some amazing places. He knew all about the work and was even modest about it. The 3 hours flew by! This is something unique to Buenos Aires and definitely should not be missed.

Not to be missed. I can thoroughly recommend this tour by Matt who is a former UK journalist now living in BA. His depth of knowledge of the graffiti artists and barrios where you can find find graffiti and murials is extensive and humbling. He was very willing to share his knowledge and incredibly helpful with advice about BA in general. This tour should be on everybody's must do list. Also very good value.

Excellent way to spend an afternoon!. Matt is very knowledgable about the art, the artists, and the social fabric of the street art community. We ventured to the outer barrios of BA and saw examples of various types of street art on park and building walls. Through it all, Matt kept adding to the experience with his knowledge and was able to answer all questions put to him. The time flew by even though it keeps threatening to rain the whole time. Strongly recommended.

Very interesting and very informative tour.. Matt was absolutely amazing with his knowledge of all the local artists and taking us to see a lot of different styles of street art. I particularly liked hearing personal stories about the artists and their development and exploration of their artistic style. The tour was totally worth it!

A great tour & guide. A friend and I went on this tour on my last day in BA and it was very enjoyable. Matt was very friendly and knowledgeable on the the art and he also has a book published on the subject. I would highly recommend this tour to everyone visiting Buenos Aires.

Great way to see the real side of Buenos Aires. My husband and I live here and in an effort to always try something new with our visitors, we took this tour over this past weekend. We got to really understand both the graffiti art scene and a part of Buenos Aires that we really didn't know much about. Also, it provided a great way to show our guests other parts of the city and the real BA, not just the Plaza de Mayo or Palermo SoHo. I would recommend this tour to other people and definitely will send other guests who are interested in learning more about street art!

Incredible Tour of Living Art History. This tour was phenomenal. We explored parts of Buenos Aires that are far off the beaten tourist track. The walk is like an art museum tour that takes you around the city to see the best murals. Matt taught us about different themes, styles and trends in the street art movement and shared fascinating ideas and stories about this emerging art movement. Came away from this tour very knowledgeable on the trends. Matt's passion for the subject is contagious. Great tour - would definitely recommend it.

BA Street Art tour. The BA Street Art tour is a must for everyone who loves art in the streets. Matt is a very passionate guide who knows a lot about the local scene. A lot of the works he showed me had a very strong South American identity. BA is a city like Sao Paulo where there is still a lot of freedom to be creative in the public domain. I will take the tour again for sure.Bert (Amsterdam)

cool tour. I went on the street art tour a while back and have been meaning to write for ages. I thoroughly enjoyed the tour and the guide did a great job. Very very informative and enthusiastic. Also friendly and extremely courteous and polite. I have lived in Buenos Aires for some time now and I decided to go on the tour on impulse really as I have seen all these huge murals over the city and always wondered if there was some kind of story behind them. Turns out there is. What I didn’t expect to see was part of the city that I had never been to before. Its more of a tour of street art - it is a fascinating insight into the heritage and culture of the city with plenty of anecdotes and information which really made the city come alive. When it was finished I felt as if I knew the city much better than when I had started off. Besides that even if you’re not interested in street art it is really a cool way to spend a morning or afternoon walking around Buenos Aires with a really enthusiastic guide at the helm who really has a great love for this city. He also seems to personally know many of the artists involved which of course makes all the difference!

Great Experience!. Matt was a really knowledgeable tour guide who was very passionate about street art in Buenos Aires. The experience is definitely worthwhile. Matt brought us to neighborhoods that you would normally not venture into if you were just visiting Buenos Aires, and he showed us a variety of work by both amateur artists and seasoned street artists. His explanations and stories are detailed and very interesting! He is definitely the go-to guy for street art. Do this tour! It's a MUST.

Forget Il Caminito, see the boxing minotaurs instead. The BA Street Art tour is a must for intrepid visitors in search of an alternative introduction to the city, especially for those wishing to acquire an understanding of its art, life and politics, that goes beyond the superficial. It helped us notice and comprehend particular details throughout our stay which we might otherwise have overlooked. Matt is an amiable and knowledgeable guide. As a journalist from an artistic background he has been faithfully documenting this vibrant arts scene over several years; interviewing the artists and archiving his finds with great attention to detail. Having gained the trust and friendship of the artists, he offers a keen insight into their work. The artists themselves now contact Matt with news of their latest pieces. He is sharp-eyed for what’s best and what’s fresh. Particularly striking is the work of Jaz which is emblematic of the BA psyche and the individual at loggerheads with the system. Matt was happy to tailor the tour to suit the specific interests of our group, and even offered further assistance for research purposes to one of our group. His tour was a highlight of our visit.In organising these tours, Matt is not exploiting the work of others, but is trying to promote them, and raise their profile both within Buenos Aires and beyond. His book ‘Textura Dos’ is beautifully illustrated and makes a memorable souvenir.

Definitley need a guide for this one. Matt gives an awesome tour of street art in and around Buenos Aires in places that you wouldn't normally think of going. He gives a great description and point of view to nearly all the pieces of art that you see on the tour (which is more than plenty) and really helps you to further appreciate some of the intricate details of the artwork. The tour is easy and shows you some of the outer areas of Beunos Aires, places that you wouldn't normally visit if you were just doing the normal tourist attractions. Highly recommended for anyone!

Forget the steak and ice cream, find the real art in BA. On a recent trip to Buenos Aires, a beautiful, friendly, vibrant and diverse city, I had the great pleasure to attend one of Matt's walking tours. An exceptional deal by any standard, the BA Street Art Walking Tours will take you to parts of the city you may have overlooked and will grant you access to some of the best art in the city. Matt is a fantastic guide and though he may not be from BA, he is a great ambassador for the city. Matt's knowledge of the murals, tags, and stencils that comprise most of the city's street art seems inexhaustible and his willingness to field any question is proof of his experience with and proximity to the scene. The Tuesday that a friend and I attended the tour was a city holiday and turned out to be the perfect day to take the tour. Matt was a great guide from the start, quick to point out work from both local and international artists and glad to explain the history of individual pieces and the street art scene as a whole whenever a question arose. The work is ever changing so even if you've seen some of the work on trips through the city, it would be to your benefit to lace up your sneakers and hit the streets with Matt. He has, after all, literally written the book on the subject. Plan your next trip to Argentina around Matt's walking tour schedule, you will not be disappointed.

really cool stuff I would not have seen otherwise. Matt gives a great tour of street art in neighborhoods I would not have gone to on my own because they aren't the neighborhoods with any of the other big sites. The art and the stories of the artists behind the art are pretty fascinating. Because street art changes so much, it's sort of like revealing a historical mystery when you hear the story of something recently painted over and the new story of what's painted on top. I know that sounds uber dramatic but it was really my first deep exposure to street art and it was really fun. Matt is super friendly and I met cool people on the tour as well. Highly recommend.

Buenos Aires Street Art Tour. I hired Matt of BA Street Art for a private tour of some of Buenos Aires best street art. I am a photographer and Matt showed me lots of great street art to photograph. Matt also knows many of the artists who paint the art, their backgrounds and how their styles have evolved over the years. It was an incredible 3+ hours. If you want to see great street art and learn about the artists I would highly recommend BA Street Art for either a private or group tour. Here's the company's website: http://www.buenosairesstreetart.com/tours/

Highly Recommended!. Two of my friends went on this tour and said it was a must-see while I was in Buenos Aires which I thought was a pretty bold statement. I knew very little about street art/graffiti/vandalism, but became intrigued by some of the cooler works I had seen while walking around in Palermo Hollywood so decided to go with a few of my friends. Matt, the tour guide, led us through all kinds of different neighborhoods of Buenos Aires to get an idea of what is considered vandalism, tagging, graffiti style, and street art. It wasn't just a tour walking around Buenos Aires with a guy who knows where there is cool graffiti to look at...it was a thorough explanation of all the different elements that embody this subculture from a guy who clearly understands it. Needless to say, the art itself was very impressive and I walked away with a completely different view of the different attitudes towards the practice, the individual styles of both local and world-renowned artists, the different forms and purposes of street art in BA, the unique cultures that exist in every city as it relates to their laws, and much more. Bottom line, if you want to see some different parts of BA that you probably will not go to, want to learn something completely different about the culture here, want to look at lot of talented urban art and understand more about it, or want to come away with some cool pictures to share with others, then I would highly recommend this tour. It is well worth every peso!

Interested in street art? Then do this tour. We had a great day learning about street art in Buenos Aires – seeing some spectacular pieces along the way. This was a new experience for me and I would highly recommend. Matt is a highly knowledgeable, a great guide and takes the tour to places that are off the tourist beat.

Art vs. Vandalism? Your call... but this tour will take you to a different Buenos Aires. Let me preface that I am very torn about "street art." And even after the tour, I still am very mixed about the merits of this art form. With that said, if you have the same doubts, this really is the perfect tour for you. Matt is incredibly knowledgeable and passionate about the subject. Artists go to him first to tell him of new projects so he is constantly "in the know." Matt goes out of his way to make the tour comfortable (introducing people by first name, ensuring breaks) and takes you to places in BA you would not stumble on your own. I even spent an hour with Matt after the tour having lunch talking about his interest in Art. I learned a ton. MY only advice is that be prepared for a long tour. Matt is passionate and you will see countless examples or art. Remember, each tour is unique because the art is constantly changing. This tour is not for those who want an overview of the city of BA. But for my second visit to this great city, this was a terrific way to get of the tourist path and see the true colors of the city. Thank you Matt. Your book sits on my coffee table.

Not your everyday tour!. We went with Matt on his StreetArt tour and loved it. Matt knows everything and everyone in the scene and is the most enthousiastic guy you ever met. A nice walk off the beaten track. Highly recommended!

An Amazing and Fun Experience. Took this tour at the last minute just before our flight back to the US. Matt was an amazing guide, enthusiastic and pationate about street art. What a delightful experience and a must for anyone. After seeing some street art during our stay, it was a pleasure to learn a lot more about the street art scene. It was such an inspiring experience and a wonderfull way to end a great vacation in Argentina. Thank you Matt for making the tour so special.

A Fascinating, Educational View of Buenos Aires. Matt was a great tour guide. Very affable, knowledgable, and it's clear that he has a real passion for street art. We saw a very different side of Buenos Aires that most tourists probably wouldn't even think to see, and for 75 pesos, I'd recommend it to everybody who is living here, or just passing through.

Great introduction to Buenos Aires. I took this tour the day after ariving in Buenos Aires. Matt is very enthusiastic and has an extensive knowledge of the art and the artists behind it. He is able to show you spots thats you may not necessarily find if searching by yourself and explain the history behind the scene in which his is ingrained.If your a fan of street art or if your just looking to see a different side of Buenos Aires I would defiantly recommend it. It was a great introduction to the city.

Unique, engaging, and fun tour experience - a BA must. We thoroughly enjoyed the Graffiti Mundo tour with Matt. I have lived in BA for three years, but this tour took me to new neighborhoods and showed me a new side of the city - its incredible graffiti. Matt was amazingly knowledgable, and he was also a talented tour leader - keeping us all engaged and interested during three hours of walking and viewing. Highly recommended to both newcomers and residents of BA!

Great tour! Great guide! Great day!. Im not really one for reviews but this definately deserves a mention! I had a fantastic day walking the streets of BA; our guide Matt was enthusiastic, knowledgable and an all round genuinly friendly guide. Having written a book on street art found in the BA you would be hard pressed to find anyone more in touch with whats going on. We saw some of the best examples of street art ive seen in any city; having visited several districts. Most importantly our day was really catored around what we wanted. I have seen tours advertised in hostels but I cannot imagine a more complete experience; i work with alot of street artists in london and it was really refreshing to come half way round the world and see such passion here! If you choose any tour make sure its this one! sam

The best thing to do in BA. I did the street art tour with Matt, it was a bliss. Definitely the best thing I've done in Buenos Aires. Matt is very knowledgeable about the arts he showed us. He knows also the artists and all the insides stories. I don't have enough words to express how much I enjoyed it. So just go for it! Matt is the best!

Excellent!!!! a great opportunity to meet buenos aires. Matt knows a lot about street art scene. I found this tour really interesting! a new option to meet buenos aires and the "barrios". I recommend it!

Fantastic insight into the street art of Buenos Aires. We stumbled upon Matt's website when we were planning our trip to Argentina and knew straight away that it was one of the things we should definitely do. From the outset Matt was quick to reply to our emails and we had all of the information we needed.On the day of our tour we travelled the short distance from Palermo to the cafe he suggested we meet at (he provided plenty of travel advice so you'd have no problem getting there safely) and he was waiting for us with a warm welcome.After a brief introduction the six tourists and Matt jumped on the train at the nearby Colegiales station (he'd arranged our tickets and this was included in the price) we rode for two or three stops to the Saavedra. We were then shown amazing street art from the moment we stepped off of the train. Following Matt at a brisk pace (decent shoes are recommended) we were shown one amazing piece of artwork after another and, at each piece, Matt gave us some interesting insight into the creator of the work as well as the creative meaning behind the piece and the techniques involved. Originally a journalist from the UK he clearly does a lot of research and he really knows his stuff. As part of the popular blog he runs (http://www.buenosairesstreetart.com/) he regularly interviews the artists and has first-hand knowledge of the street-art scene that few people have access to. It was also clear to us that he had a true passion for his work and as soon as the tour had finished he was travelling to another area of the City to document a brand new piece of work he had just heard about.The tour lasted for about 2.5 hours, which was a really good length, and at the end we were given guidance about the best way to return to our respective areas of Buenos Aires.If you have an interest in art of any kind then I can't recommend this tour highly enough. It was fascinating and Matt's enthusiasm and huge knowledge of his chosen subject made the tour one of the best experiences of our month-long trip.

Congrats to Matt. Matt took us in the street of Buenos Aires for a great street art tour. He really knows his topic and was friendly and kind. I'll recommend it for any street art fan or if you want to see Buenos Aires on another angle. Be ready to walk !
Great tour, great art. Loved this tour. The street art was fascinating, Matt really knew his stuff and it was a really enjoyable day. Highly recommended.

Fascinating despite the heat. We went on a tour with matt when BA was in a heat wave but happily managed a few hours in the burning sun because he made the tour so interesting. You also get to see parts of BA you might otherwise not visit. The tour included a (free) train ride between suburbs. It's very relaxed and the group chatted between art stops. Some of the street art was amazing but all of it was interesting. Highly recommend this tour. Matt was friendly and informative. Really knows his stuff.

A great colorful experience. I discover BA Street Art Walking Tours by chance, and I must say that the decision to take the tour was really great! Matt was an excellent guide, explaining all the graffiti in a very professional way, you can guess he do love his job! I recommend everybody visiting Bs As to consider this tour as it will be really a great experience. Moreover, if you're lucky, you can have the chance to see some artist at work!The tour price was Argentina pesos 75, quite cheap for what I got.

Highly recommandable street art tour. We really enjoyed having Matt guiding us through some of the street art of Buenos Aires. The tour was wery well organized and Matt was both very knowledgable and enthusiastic. He will give you a thorough introduction of street art. We highly recommend the tour!Astrid & Hanne
Exelente!. I think it was a great tour and I couled really recomend it! I went with my mother and we got to see a lot of different styles and techniques, and we learned a lot! thanks!

GREAT!. we've decided spontaneoulsy for the tour.we had a great tour with Matt, visiting some awesome murials in Buenos Aires!if you like street art you have to make it!!!many thanks to Matt, who knows a lot of the beginning of street art in Buenos Aires and the artists.DO IT!!! and enjoy it :)best wishes Daniela

Buenos Aires Street Art Tour - highly recommendable!. Our guide Matt, who has lived in Buenos Aires for many years really knows his stuff. He is the author of a street art book and used to work for the BBC as a journalist. His Buenos Aires graffiti tour is very informative and highly recommendable.

So worth it! A great bargain and a unique way to discover the city.. This laid-back, set-your-own-pace tour of the street art of BSAS was such a good deal and taught me so much about the movement here! The guide is super knowledgeable and weaves in political history of Buenos Aires, along with current trends, personal anecdotes about the artists and descriptions of the techniques used. I learned so much and saw amazing stuff around the city that I never would have seen otherwise. I highly recommend this tour. Better than a museum.

Off the beaten path. A great time! This tour will show you a side of Buenos Aires that you won't find in the glossy photos, but is ubiquitous all the same, and shouldn't be missed! Matt is very knowledgeable about street art and personable besides, he seems more like a well-informed acquaintance than a tour guide. Be prepared to walk, but don't worry -- Matt's very good about checking in to see if you need some water or a rest or an ice cream.

If you want a truly joyful, educational, tailored experience be sure to book with Joy. Joy is delightful, knowledgeable, flexible, fun and she tailored the tour to our interests and timeline. We had two great half days with her. We loved the walking tours using public transportation in areas we were interested in. From airport pick up by Franco - with bottled water, chocolates, map and welcome note - to the tour itself, everything was perfect. What a delightful entrepreneur who will, hopefully, continue to thrive. We will definitely book with her again!!

Lots of love for Joy. On top of getting to travel with my mom, turning 30, and getting engaged, we had the trip of a lifetime thanks to Joy. All of these memories combined made us fall in love with her city, Buenos Aires. Her knowledge and storytelling kept us intrigued and she had just the right amount of energy to keep us going throughout the day. She is even a chef (on top of a number of other talents) and invited us into her home to cook a special meal, a highlight and unique touch to our trip. I could go on and on about Joy—for someone that was hesitant to use such a service (thinking we could do it all on our own) I walked away very thankful for having Joy with us in BA. Thank you, Joy!! Until we meet again, xoxo.

The Best Tour Guide EVER!!!!. I had a great experience with Joy as my tour guide in Buenos Aires. She made me feel so comfortable immediately, like a family member. We explored the city together and she was very knowledgeable of the history of the city. She provided an accurate, detailed explanation of each historical landmark. I had many opportunities to ask questions, try local foods, take pictures, and go shopping! I never felt like an "out of place American". She made me feel like I was an true Argentinian. I highly recommend her as a fabulous tour guide. She was so much more than a tour guide. She was like family! You will love her!!!! :-)

Excellent cooking workshop!. What a great experience! We made delicious empanadas and alfajores from scratch - Joy is a great teacher, very warm and friendly and knowledgeable about all things Argentina and Buenos Aires. Was also very helpful with tips and ideas for the rest of our trip. Great way to learn about Argentina while enjoying good food and wine. Highly recommended!

Can't imagine a better introduction to Buenos Aires. Joy was a wonderful guide. She met me at the apartment I had rented and after a few questions about my interests we were off. We walked and took buses around the city. Because it was a Saturday, traffic was light and the bus rides were fast. Joy is very knowledgeable about her city and is proud to show it off. At times, I think she was having a better time than I was... And I was having an amazing time. She really seems to enjoy her job and it shows. This experience was the polar opposite of a tour with a guide reciting a boring script. I was introduced to many different areas of the city and learned about their history along the way. After my day with Joy, I was confident to explore the city on my own. If you are planning a visit To Buenos Aires, I highly recommend hiring Joy to show you around.

Joy made Buenos Aires come alive for us !. My wife and I went to BA for 3-weeks and the 1st 3-days were spent with Joy (2 of the Days were 1/2 Day Tours and then on July 9th (their Independence Day) we did a separate Tour to enjoy & begin to understand their Special Day). I would really recommend that (if you have the time) 2 1/2-Days is the way to see and learn Buenos Aires . . . .and Joy is the person to do it, she knows and loves Buenos Aires and it's history!Even after the Tours, Joy offered us help and some advice to make sure that our overall experience was perfect !!!!!!!!!!!!!!All-in-all, this is the best Tour we have ever taken . . . . and we have traveled and toured the world.

If you need someone to show you around....... Joy by name and joy by nature. Lovely bubbly personality joy was very helpful when I found myself with a Credit card that wouldn't work in the regular bank machines. Once we had that problem sorted we set out on our city tour. Her knowledge, enthusiasm and advice were very much appreciated. In fact her helpful notes and tips about where to go in my free time gave me the confidence to explore on my own.

Only if you want genuine warmth & knowledge. From the time we met Joy at our hotel in Palermo we experienced genuine warmth, an unhurried tour by taxi, walking and bus along with plenty of knowledge about BA and Argentina as well as personal conversation. I wish we had the opportunity to spend more time with Joy but she is so popular we could not. As it was Joy gave us much more than the time we had booked. What a delight she is and what a perfect way to spend our first day in Buenos Aires. Thanks Joy and we highly recommend you to anybody who wants a great and personal experience. Frank & Gillian Swanberg, Auckland, New Zealand

Don't miss the Joy opportunity !!!!!!. My husband and I have traveled extensively and no tour has come close to providing so much fun, local color, insight into a country's people and history as well as assistance!!!!!! Joy immersed us in local color with a trip to watch the sortija (a wonderful weekly competition by caballeros on horseback), a BBQ with all the traditional foods, and people dancing in the street on Independence Day.She showed us the way to take the metro and bus, helped us buy our cards to use on both methods of transportation and advised us of any cautions necessary. She is a delightful young woman who has contacted us several times since the end of our full day and 2 half days of tours, just to be sure things are going well for us. I cannot recommend her tour company more highly. It was truly a Joy!!!!!!!!Sharon UptonScottsdale AZ

History and walking!!. Did a walking tour with Joy while traveling solo pre cruise. She was not only a delightful person but her knowledge of the history of Argentina added to the pleasure of the tour. We walked, rode a bus, and I definitely got my ten thousand steps in! Price was affordable.

Friendly and knowledgeable tour guide. My daughter and I took an extensive walking tour with Joy through Buenos Aires. Because our time was short, we needed to be strategic. She made sure that we got to see what we wanted to see by talking through what we had already done. Each half day, she would present an itinerary and was easily able to adapt to our needs. She is very personable and loves to teach about the history and the culture of the city. She has favorite stops for empanadas, ice cream and a very special view of the city.

Absolutely wonderful....highly recommend Joy as BA's finest local guide!. I started my South American Dream in Buenos Aires. Joy was the 1st lady to be recommended as a truly awesome local guide. She didn't disappoint. Often, city tours can become boring & disengaging after a while, this was different. From start to finish (honestly didn't want tour to end) she was wonderful. Joy is so passionate about her city. By the end of the tour, I had inherited some of that enthusiasm & love of Buenos Aires. I would highly recommend Joy's tours to all types of traveller, as she caters for your needs. You come up with the route together. Perfecto!

Absolutely Fantastic!!!. Love Joy and highly recommend her to anyone that visits Argentina. We have travelled with many personal guides. The difference between the excellent and the average is the attention to details. Joy had every detail covered from secured taxis to local eateries. Her enthusiasm and love for her country exudes whilst on her tour. We also attended her drum workshop with Diego as he instructor. Love Love Love!! Thank you Joy for sharing a bit of your country.

Can't wait to see what tomorrow brings. Just returned from a day of exploring Buenos Aires with Joy. From the moment we were met at the airport this morning and transported to our hotel where she met us, everything Joy has arranged has been perfect and hassle free. She cheerfully accompanied us to exchange money and pick up opera tickets in addition to showing us the sights of her beloved city. Franco, her driver, skillfully navigated the city and was somehow always able to drop us off and pick us up steps from where we needed to be making the day very efficient.Joy's flexibility and enthusiasm were a bonus.With the basics under our belt we are looking forward to some "off the beaten path" adventures with Joy tomorrow.Advanced communication with Joy was easy and her prices seem quite fair.It is always a special and rare treat to find a knowledgeable local to show you a city as though you were an old friend visiting. That is Joy.

What a Joy! . We went to her cooking workshop and made empanadas and alfajores. I had been in Argentina for almost 3 weeks and these were by far the best empanadas I had tasted! And I made them myself!! Joy is such a wonderful character and this is definitely the real Argentinian experience. Such good value for money and if I were here for longer would have definitely booked more with her. Thank you Joy! I will be making all things Argentinian when I get home! :)

amazing experience. We had great time in Buenos Aires with Joy.Before we arrived in BA Joy emailed us that the weather is not promising for the day that we booked the tour and suggested that we move it to the next day.Because it supposed to be raining she had a few other options for rainy day and we choose cooking workshop with her. It was amazing, we made some empanadas (the best I've ever had)and few other things. We had some wine, we ate what we have made and we chat all day long. It was great introduction to the city tour on following day as we discussed a bit more about the Argentinian history, food, customs, music. We share some mate tea and to be honest we talked about just anything.The following day we had a city tour with Joy.We've seen amazing places, we found out great facts from Argentinian history, we had some great food and all with a lot of fun.We'll recommend Joy to anyone. She is very professional and passionate about what she does.

Joy, as the name implies…. Joy and her refreshing as well as enthusiastic nature gave us a marvelous one-day walking tour around Buenos Aires. As a local, Joy was able to give us a great insight of the history and culture of the city and the people (Porteños). Taking the local buses and walking to the sights was so much fun.I highly recommend Joy as a tour guide. Thank you for the great day!

And what a Joy she is! . Had a fabulous day with Joy as she whizzed us around her wonderful city. Joy really brings her city tour to life with her energy and her enthusiasm. In her own words, she's genuinely there because she wants to be - and it shows. She had an answer for everything and wasn't scared to give us all the details on the city's past, however unsettling some stories may be. She was great at highlighting links between certain sites and tying up the city's history for us. She was happy to create a personalised tour for us, encompassing all the sites we specifically wanted to see. She was a lot of fun and just radiates - well - joy! She is an absolute pleasure and I could not recommend a day with her enough! Happy touring guys :)

Enthusiastic and nice guide!. We sent to Buenos Aires with only a few days before moving on, and one day with Joy gave us a great overview over the city and its history! Very knowledgeable and enthusiastic guide, top notch!
Such a good tour! . Joy was great showing us around buenos Aires. We saw so much and got so much info. I really felt I saw buenos Aires at its best!

City Tour. Joy customised a days walking tour for our group which covered all the highlights of Buenos Aires. She is enthusiastic and super fun. Taking us on local buses and walking to the key sites as well as some off the beaten track. Joy is extremely knowledgeable and gave us great insight to the history of Argentina from a locals point of view, all the while with a big smile in her face. She was thoroughly engaging and Informative. I could have happily listened to her and talked to her all day! Hoping to do some more tours with Joy when I am back in Buenos Aires next week. Thanks Joy for an awesome day and fantastic introduction to your home town.

Excellent tour guide! . Joy is a proud porteño which makes a very captivating tour guide.She will take you around the different areas of La Boca, San Telmo, Recoleta and more, giving you a great insight into the past and present of Buenos Aires and its way of life. A combination of walking and taking local buses to the different areas makes for a great way to see the sights .I would recommend Joy of Buenos Aires to anyone wanting to get to know the sights and the history behind it all. 5/5Thanks for a wonderful day, Joy!

A great tailor made city tour!. We were a group of 12 from Iceland. Joy arranged our pick up from the airport and an excellent city tour with in her company. At night we had a marvellous tango show. Joy is an excellent and trustful guide, a real pro! She makes tailor made tours according to the wishes and time people have. Everything went as she planned and We had an exceptional time in her company!

Such a great Buenos Aires insight!. Joy is a young girl from Buenos Aires who offers different types of Tours in Buenos Aires City. Isn't the normal free walking tour that many companies offer in BA. Her style is unique as well as the knowledge she has about the city and Argentina. I totally recommend to join a walking tour with Joy!

Walking Tour and Drum Workshop - First Class!!. I wanted to see Buenos Aires from a local's point of view and from someone knowledgeable on all that this amazing city has to offer. A friend recommended Joy and to be honest I was very impressed, beyond what I was hoping for. I considered a free tour, but the lack of 'the personal touch' of these large group tours did not appeal. This is something you get in bucket loads with Joy! From the outset you appreciate how much passion she has for her home town and her depth of knowledge is really quite impressive! Joy was very accommodating in making sure that the tour included the key areas I wanted to see, and shaped it around local events to ensure we did not miss anything going on, and I came away more knowledgeable on this great city and very happy with the way the tour was organised and delivered. Communication leading up to the tour was spot on too, Joy could not be more helpful!Following on from my tour of BA, I booked the Drum Workshop that Joy also offers. I had been somewhat inspired by the spine-tingling sounds of the drums that you often hear around the streets and suburbs of Buenos Aires (plus the percussion show 'La Bomba De Tiempo' which is stunning and sealed the deal for me...!), so thought that the workshop would be a great follow-on experience. Again, I was not disappointed! Not being musically talented in the least and lacking in the rhythm department, I initially thought that it might not quite be for me, but nothing ventured, nothing gained....Our workshop host Diego, soon put any concerns at ease as we learned about the origins of the music of Argentina and in particular the various drums that you would hear around Argentina and even Uruguay. Soon we were having a 'jam' session on the drums and Diego quickly instilled rhythm that I didn't know I had...! I had such a fun and engaging experience that I even asked for the names of the drums that I liked the most so that I can buy some on my return to the UK. My neighbours will love me..! :)All in all, I can highly recommend the guided tour and drum workshop, both arranged with Joy, and when I return to Buenos Aires later this year, I have discussed further tours with Joy, including a Tango Experience and a visit to one of the local futbol matches, to complete the whole experience. As a guide and host, you will not find better than Joy, and I felt compelled to write an honest review as she really makes you feel like a friend rather than a customer. A++++++ Clive from Scotland.

Cooking Workshop. My two Friends and I learned from Joy how to cook empanadas. I liked it very much because Joy was a very good teacher. She taught us a lot about the empanadas and also some basic hints about cooking in general. We get mate and a very tasty red wine from Argentina. I recommend this cooking workshop to everybody who likes to cook and to enjoy a nice company with a very nice and generous Argentina. :)

Best way to start your stay in BA!. I am so grateful to have stumbled upon Joy of Buenos Aires on Trip Advisor! Joy was very easy to communicate and make arrangements with prior to our stay in Buenos Aires. She arrived at our hotel punctually on our tour date, and spent some time getting to know my friend and I before coming up with a plan that kept our interests in mind. Joy is fun, energetic, and extremely passionate about her city. She is very knowledgeable about the history of Buenos Aires and Argentina, and we appreciated hearing her perspective on the current state of politics as well. She gave us many helpful tips and recommendations throughout our tour, and even helped us arrange transport to other activities we had planned. This was the perfect way to spend our first day in Buenos Aires, and get acquainted this beautiful city. I can't recommend enough!

An awesome tour with a great guide. Joy took us on a bus and showed us many different thing in San Telmo and La Boca including the safe streets. We had an amazing day from beginning to end.Just a few notes about what we saw. The 1st firehall in Argentina. The firehall has museum pieces and new equipment.All firefighters in Argentina are volunteers The Boca Jr. Stadium re: 12 player The graffiti wall about the disappeared The immigrants bridge The memorial under the bridge for the disappeared who's personal effects were found when the police station was torn downThe old tenements in La Boca which are now stores but you can see where whole families lived in boxes.Another good coffee house. Coffee comes with a glass of water and small cookies. Milk costs extra. I love the little snacks and water especially because it was very hot.We saw the Rosa ! San Martin's crypt, The British flags taken when Argentina defeated Britain.The embassy for France, BritainWe walked and rode the busesGrabbed an empanada.......and moreAs we made our way down Defense to Plaza de Mayo we first stopped and Joy explained about Mate and made us some. I liked it very much.Then we began to meet union people. There was/is a big protest today over wages and a large number of people being fired from the government. We stopped and chatted with some. Joy lead us further and we met many leaving the plaza as their part was done. The plaza was still packed with people and it was a little overwhelming. Joy says this is only a small protest and we would be fine. The only time to worry is if the police get threatening. Also don't worry about big bangs it us only fireworks.Joy is energetic, articulate, knowledgeable and very proud of her wonderful city. Thank you Joy.

Fantastic customized tour. Amazing day with Joy. We had visited parts of the city already but Joy open our eyes to so much more. Walking tour through La Boca and San Telmo. We had a fantastic day with Joy touring through La Boca and San Telmo. She is super friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. Highly recommend. Go Boca Juniors!!

Amazing Walkingtour through Buenos Aires <3. The walking tour with Joy was the best walking tour I ever joined, Joy is amazing! Drum workshop was Amazing!!! . I had been told about Joy from some friends back in Australia and was told to contact her when we visit Buenos Aires. She was SO helpful and lovely from the moment we got in touch. It was so great to have local knowledge from a friendly and relatable person. She asked us about what types of activities we would like to do whilst in Buenos Aires and looked into different options and prices for us. These included Tango Shows, Yoga Classes, Bars and Restaurants, Walking Tours, Shopping, Gardens, Museums, Markets, History, Music Shows etc. Joy made a suggestion to do a drum workshop with a local drummer and also told us about a drum show that is really popular. We did the drumming workshop on a Monday afternoon and the show was on later that night. Joy met us in the city and showed us how to use the Subway system, which we used at least once a day for the rest of our trip. (So helpful) In the workshop we got to have some tea and chat about the history and culture of what drumming means to the locals. It was so nice to see the passion of our teacher Diego. We got to learn different rhythms and techniques and use a large variety of drums. Diego made us feel so welcome in his home (where the lesson takes place) and it was an amazing experience that not many tourists would get the opportunity to do. Later on, at the drum show we could really appreciate the drummers talents and understand the work of the 'conductors'. We had such a fun day and definitely recommend the workshop to anyone travelling to Buenos Aires. Joy is very professional and a beautiful soul who made our stay in Buenos Aires so much better. ❤️

Customized and passionate tour of BA. My experience with Joy far exceeded my expectations. She was passionate, informative, and provided essential cultural and historical context wherever we went. Perfect day in Buenos Aires. My husband and I had super perfect day with Joy in Buenos Aires. It was the perfect way to discover Buenos Aires. Joy was really nice and she is very enthusiastic and flexible. We highly recommended the tour with her.

JOY, JOY, JOY, JOY. My wife and I celebrated our anniversary in Buenos Aires, on our first-ever visit to Argentina and South America. Two days of our trip were spent with Joy of Buenos Aires. Choosing two days (with a break in-between) was the best decision we made, and the 16 hours we spent with Joy, in a wide variety of situations, simply revealed to us that she is undoubtedly pursuing her passion! And there's nothing better than having a guide/friend who seems as excited about her tours (ones she's done numerous times!) as you are. It makes a big difference! And in this day and age, where websites and ads often exaggerate a person's or product's accomplishments or benefits, my feeling is that Joy gives you amazing value for your investment. And her website and Facebook page accurately reflect who she is and what she can do. Thank you, Joy!
Joy is amazing!. Terrific guide who loves to share her city. We learned so much and enjoyed her enthusiasm.Planning the tour was flawless as she maintains great contact.

Joy's enthusiasm, infectious smile and bubbly personality really inspired us. Joy was recommended by a friend and so a group of us joined her for a tour of La Boca. Perfection. Joy was born and raised in Buenos Aries so knows everything there needs to know about this beautiful city. AN EXPERIENCE OF A LIFETIME. Johanna amazed me with her level of enthusiasm, knowledge, and dedication to her job. a 'must do' while in buenos aires. me and my friend visited buenos aires and we are glad we discovered it with joy, so glad that a friend recommended her, she gave us great insight and made a fantastic introduction of buenos aires on our short time there.

Fantastic Guide!. We did a San Telmo/La Boca tour with Joy with our two kids age 7 and 10. Joy was fabulous!! She was enthusiastic and knew so much about the area. Trip of a lifetime... I can’t recommend Joy highly enough. If ever being supremely professional as well as bubbly becomes an Olympic sport, she would run away with the gold medal. She loves her job and her home city, and it shone through, countless times going above and beyond the call of duty…I mean, who else would scour the beach stalls trying to buy a pair of speedos or “zunga’s” for one of her group?  I went on a trip with Joy in 2014, travelling from her home town of Buenos Aires through to Rio as part of a small mixed tour group. Many of us are still friends to this day. Much of that was down to Joy’s enthusiasm and attention to detail. Even on her days or evenings off, she still came out with the group as we wanted her with us. She has a great dry sense of humour and her local knowledge of where to go and experience the culture was second to none. You really felt you got the benefit of escaping the usual tourist traps and really seeing the city as it really is. She had a genuine interest in your life too and tailored the programme to what you wanted…whether that was taking a tour of the Boca Juniors stadium, or watching some traditional dancing. Joy just wanted you to make the most of your trip and for you to enjoy yourself, without it being forced fun. To me that was important. A trip out kayaking, seeing Peron’s grave, visiting a distillery or having a great meal was just as key as unwinding with a drink or two at the end of the day. Although I’m sure she would have shown us every spot in town and told us every historical fact if she could, she understood that a holiday is also about a bit of R&R and so the pace of it all was just right. One last thing..Joy is a great photographer, so don’t be surprised to come away with some good snaps as well as some great memories! Can’t wait to go back some time and see my friend again.

Amazing tour of the city!!. If you're looking to learn something about Buenos Aires, Joy is the only way to go. She is super knowledgable and so passionate about the city. Joy is so much fun, energetic, knowledgable and by far the best travel guide we have both ever had. My husband had two stomach bugs that needed medical treatment and Joy would not leave us at the hospital, staying with us throughout both nights. She looked after a big group with skill and made our experiences and safety her priority at all times. Her passion for her country and sense of humor is one in a million. We were sad to say goodbye as Joy became a great friend to us.

Awesome guide! . Joy is a Joy (yep. Punny) to have around. She will take you to the coolest places only locals know, all with a great smile and infectious laugh :) VERY knowledgeable, very friendly! Thanks!

Engaging, insightful and a unique experience. A friend suggested visiting La Boca with a local guide that she had met and I am glad she did. We met Joy in the downtown plaza and her enthusiasm and knowledge about Buenos Aires was immediately evident. Although I knew some of the history from a previous tour, listening to Joy as she described historical events was the start of a great tour. Joy organised and paid for a local bus to La Boca, which is hard for tourists such as myself because a travel card is needed and my Spanish is limited. I received warnings from other people I met whilst traveling to be careful in La Boca as it was a 'dodgy place', but traveling with Joy I felt safe. She took us off the beaten path and we visited places I would not have seen if I went by myself. Listening to Joy was different, I wasn't expecting to learn so much about the city. She is from Buenos Aires and her tour was fun but professional at the same time.

What an experience!. I have lived in Buenos Aires for 40 years +. Gonzalo showed us a city that I didnt know. The hidden paths, the interesting facts of history, From the atheist Saint, San Martin, to Mafalda, the little chalet in top of a building in avenida 9 de Julio, to the 1st pharmacy in Buenos Aires.....thank you Gonzalo, I would recommend Demasiado Tours to anybody coming to Buenos Aires!

Great!. I did both the central and the recoleta tour and absolutely loved both of them! Our guide Gonzalo was really funny and had a very excellent knowledge about all the monuments we visited and Buenos Aires in general. These tours give you a detailed overview about the culture and history of Buenos Aires. I would definitely recommend them!!!

Excellent tours, a must add your agenda. If you want to learn more about Buenos Aires from a local these tours are a must do. I was travelling on my own and its an excellent way to learn about the city in a light hearted informal manner and meet new people along the way. I did 2 tours with Gonzalo on 2 separate days each approx 3 hours each around the San Telmo area and Recoleta area of the city. He is very knowledgable and informative.

The perfect start to your Buenos Aires experience!. These tours are a must!! Thanks to the fantastic, approachable guide Gonzo, I learnt things that most people I know from Buenos Aires don't even know! With small groups like this it is a much more personal experience.You feel comfortable with Gonzo immediately and he is very perceptive to your needs, tailoring the tour in very subtle ways to suit your interests whilst also providing an excellent overview of the history, politics, architecture and character of the city and how it became the city it is today. Very informative, fun, and varied. Best of all very entertaining! Gonzo knows his facts and will happily answer any questions you have and if he doesn't know the answer, be sure he will find out for you!

Fantastic free walking tours in Buenos Aires. I did 2 walking tours with Gonzalo, the historical walking tour and the tour of Recoleta. Both were fantastic. Gonzalo is entertaining and very informative and spent a lot of time with us. He really brought the city alive for me. Highly recommended if you want to learn about the sights as well as see them.

Gonzalo is the Mayor of BA. Definitely do these walks!Gonzalo beautifully weaves the city's tales of history, heroes, politics, architecture, love, despair and humour into a fantastic few hours.Highly recommended.

Lucky with a small group and down to earth guide. I went on a walking tour the day before with crowds of people and this was hands down a way better experience, I had Gonzalo, easy to understand, his walking tour was a good combination of history and those little fun quirky stops, the pope's barber and home of mafalda. Gonzalo made the tour easy to fall in love with BA, it was also great to finish off a little local eatery.Thanks and keep up the great job!

good tour - better guide!. an absolutely nice experience thanks to a great guide, Gonzalo!i atrongly recommend to attend this tour during the first days of your stay as the guide is giving you a lot of tips on where to go and what to do and how to live Buenos aires as an argentinian!i joined the tour of Recoleta, that was amazing! Gonzalo could mix history, architecture, culture and gossip, delivering a very special experience!moreover, the tour is modeled on participants, in order to meet all participants' interest and to create personal links with people, making everyone feel special.a great thank you to Gonzalo, for his professionalism and for the passion he puts in leading this tour!
a very good day in Bouenosires. piked up on time, nice and interesting day in Bouenos Ires, most of the trip was flybuy with short stops for a bit of more information .,i will recomend your company .

Walking tours. We really enjoyed the walking tours of the city. Our guide Gonzalo spoke really good English (which was great for us) and he had very good stories and interesting sites to show us. The groups were small so meant we could ask more questions etc. highly recommend!

Great walking tour!. We loved our walking tour with Demasiado Tours. Gonzalo was very informative, interesting, helpful and nice. He gave us a great tour the city, explained lots of history and showed us some very cool behind the scenes places. It was definitely one of the highlights of our trip and we would recommend this tour very highly.

素晴らしいガイド Great guide. ブエノスアイレスは3度目で、他のフリーウォーキングツアーにも参加した事がありますが、デマシアドツアーズは特におススメ出来ます。ガイドのゴンサロ君は明るく知識が豊富、どんな質問にも丁寧に答えてくれます。大勢過ぎるツアーだと移動に時間がかかり、疲れますが、丁度良い人数で説明も聴きやすいです。英語での案内ですが、わからない時は遠慮なく聞ける、そういう雰囲気のツアーだと思いました。ツアーのすぐ後に、写真をメールで送ってもらい、他の興味深いブエノスアイレスでのツアーの情報も教えてもらえ、アフターケアが素晴らしいです。(他のツアーにはありませんでした！)ゴンサロ君ありがとう！The group was small and pace easy to follow. We saw many things of interest and had any questions answered soon. After care was good as he mailed soon after the tour and recommended other items of interest. Recommended.

Great tour, very knowledgable, Gonzalo made our trip. We spent 3 days with Gonzalo, and his knowledge of the city, its history and local insights was refreshing.After spending time to understand what our interests were, he planned the time very efficiently in order to maximize our experience of Buenos Aires.We visited St, Telmo, Boca, Tigre, Ricoleta Cemetery, and he immersed us with his knowledge. We travelled by bus, train and boat which made the visiting just that much interestingHe was also there to assist in translating as most of the locals speak little English.

Great tours, great guides. We went on the two walking tours offered by Demasiado and really enjoyed them. Both Gonzálo and Ramiro were excellent guides–very funny, knowledgeable and helpful. Make sure you get the empanadas from the cafe in the market at the end of the San Telmo tour, and tip the guides generously!

Just the Tour of Buenos Aires I was looking for!. Gonza has been the perfect guide! I couldn't have dreamt of a better Tour: interesting, entertaining, full of History, spiced up with some cool anecdotes and all at once at the perfect pace! Thanks a lot for sharing your beautiful city and its past and present with us all! Best of luck!
Walking Tour. Ramiro is the man!!The tour through San Telmo was great!!A lot of experience to share!!Well done!!Cheers!!

Everything you would want to know.. If your lucky enough to have Ramiro as your guide your in good hands. As previously mentioned by another reviewer, while it's free to go on the 4 hour tour, you should tip the guy. He like us travels, and that requires money ;)Anyway, why would I not tip given his advice and knowledge. I was very lucky from a selfish point of view that it was only our family on the historic tour. He speaks good English and was a good laugh. He spoke about things without bias and when he recommends the "ice cream" or "coffee" outlets...take heed. Was the best I've had in BA. Ramiro, I wish you all the best....because without your advice I would have missed out on some wonderful times.

Ramirez rocks! Intelligent, fun, never dull, and an awesome value!. Of course it's not free, or it shouldn't be. I had Ramirez for both the Historic Buenos Aires and the Recoleta tour and tipped him about $10 each time, for which he was most grateful. That's about $3/hour, and he's worth ten times that much! He knows his history, has a balanced worldview, speaks a delightfully Spanish accented English, and is friendly and polite. What's not to like? Nothing.

Great walking tours. We went on both tours that they offer with both tour guides. We learned a lot and the guides were entertaining and informative. After the tour that covered San Telmo, the guide invited the group to stop for a lunch of Empenadas at a place in the San Telmo marketplace. They are made to order and fantadtico

Gonzalo is the best!. We had the pleasure of taking the historical tour from Gonzalo, and were blown away his knowledge and hospitality. We learned so many interesting things and followed the tour with a great discussion over the best empanadas in Buenos Aires! Then, to top it off, we were surprised with a free "guide to Buenos Aires" sent to our email by Gonzalo giving us information on everything we could ever need for our stay in the city. We have followed many of his recommendations and have enjoyed them all immensely. If we have time we will definitely be doing the recoleta tour. Two thumbs up!!

Great walking tour. . We really enjoyed our 3 hours walk with Gonzalo around the historic sites of Buenos Aires Centre and San telmo. He knows his stuff and made the tour interesting and fun. The empanadas at the end were great.

The best things in life are free. I did the historic tour and Recoleta and Retiro tour while I was in Buenos Aires. Adam was a great guide, he was approachable and most importantly he knows his stuff. I would definitely recommend the tours to other people visiting the city. Not only are they a great way to orientate yourself, you may learn a thing or two as well.

A great way to spend 3 hours. I did the historic walking tour and would highly recommend it. Adam was an excellent and knowlegeble guide and I came away knowing a lot more about the history of BA than when I started. I did the tour on my second day in BA and it really helped me to get my bearings in the city. Unlike some free tours there was no big sell or pressure to give a tip at the end of it although I think the majority of my group did (myself included) as Adam definitely deserved it. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting BA.

Great Tour; Great Guide. Adam, a BA native is extraordinarily knowledgeable, articulate and friendly. His walking tour from San Martin Park to Recoleta was an awesome way to spend 3 hours in BA. His English is exceptional honed by 2 years conducting tours in Ireland. We didn't find Adam until our third and final day in BA or we would have taken one of his tours everyday.

Adam is great. We had a very nice few hours with Adam visiting Retiro & surrounds. It was a small group so it was very easy to hear everything and engage and ask questions. Later on that week we did a city walking tour with a rival company as these guys didn't offer the city walk on that day. Would have much preferred to go with these guys as there were 30+ on the other. Adam knew his stuff, spoke English very well and discussed things " off script" like Argentine way of life now & their political & economic issues which I like to know about the countries I'm visiting. Adam is off to Australia which I'm sure he'll do very well, but it will be a loss for BA. Best of luck!!

the perfect tour with the perfect guide !. It was a very interesting tour ! Adam have humour and he has always the good anecdote! We really enjoy and i recommend this tour if you want to discover the best of Buenos Aires

Original, kind, interesting, professional... And Free!!! Thank you Adam !. Original, kind, interesting, professional... And Free!!! Thank you Adam ! A good surprise, à good day with people from around the world.
Awesome. Good work, Adam! We will definitely recommend you and your tour to anyone who is going to Buenos Aires.

Great walking tour!. We took the Buenos Aires historical tour. Our guide Mailen was very friendly. Would recommend this tour to other Buenos Aires travellers especially if they just arrived at the city.

One of the best tour guides ever. Adam was our tour guide for two day in a row while we were in Beaunos Aires. He was very informative, funny, professional, and patient. We were group of young people and he absolutely made our city tour walk fun and memorable. I would strongly recommend him

great tour and nice guide. it was a nice tour, not to long, with a nice and lovely argentin guide
you will come back the next day too see the other tour
Lea.

Strongly Recommended!. Not only Adam is a super cool tour guied, but also he is very professional. The tour was amazingly well planned and organized. Last but not least, his ability to narrate history in the most fascinating way was very impressive!

Cool and different tour. Though the guides can be a bit pushy when they try to convince you come during breakfast at your place of stay, you'll be glad you listened.This free walking tour (which is tipping based so once it's done you pay what you want) is really a beauty. It goes deeper with anecdotical knowledge of the city that goes beyond dates and architectural styles. It really guides you through the city while painting a living picture of it as a breathing entity filled with heart as data.I recommend Demasiado Tours thoroughly.

Informative and fun in spite of hot weather. Adam gives a great tour, easy to listen to, good English, and skilled at setting us up to keep moving to the next spot on the tour. I did the Ricoleta tour on one of the hottest days of Dec., but it was great. Tried to take the historic tour the next day but got rained out...will try for the tour again on Friday. Demasiado Tours is fantastic!

Enjoyable, informative city tour. First city tours (Recoleta, historic tour) I ever joined. Both tours were informative, adding just a good mix of historic impressions / information and funny stories. Adam is a gifted tour guide; I would surely recommend to join.
Great history of BA. Adam gave a great overview of the history of Argentina, significant political events and activities within the city. Great for solo travelers or big groups!
nice walk. It's real nice walk and Adam give us a good picture of BA which not shown in the guide book.The walk is a bit long, but nice.

Nice intro to Buenos Aires. Adam was a great guide to Buenos Aires. His walking tour took us to all the highlights of the city and he told us some interesting history of the city that wasn´t in our guidebook. A nice way to see the city.

Possibly the best city walking tour I've ever done. I thoroughly recommend the central Buenos Aires walking tour with Adam at Demasiado Tours. Adam was completely professional, knowledgeable, friendly, and funny. We heard just the right amounts of information about the city and country's historical background, culture, architecture and so on, with some good anecdotes thrown in there. I felt like I came away understanding the city a little better, and had a number of new places in mind to go explore. He also gave us good practical information, such as using the Metro and changing money. Across the board, just a really good time and absolutely something you should do while in Buenos Aires. Also make sure you buy a dulce de leche milkshake... out of this world :)

Brilliant way to see the city. Adam took us through the Recoleta tour. I really liked his storytelling. The person who gave him a bad review needs to stop whining. Yes, its a free tour and you are not obligated to pay anything. And he says it at the start. But it IS his job. We aren't high tipping people (we're Australian, we don't tip) but felt the fun informative tour was well worth the 100pesos we tipped. $15 bucks seemed fair for an over 3 hour tour. Thanks Adam. We will join you for your city tour as well. I must remember to bring a hat though. That heat is a killer!
Great tour. Adam was very funny and friendly. He gave us a lot of information(history, good place to go etc). The tours basically covered most of the touristic points in BA.
Gr8 Tour!. Go walking with Allan around Buenos Aires, he's a very friendly guy who is passionate about showing people around his city. Very informative and enjoyable tour, we highly recommend it!
Great walking tour!. Excellent walking tour in BA. Highly recommended. Adam gives very interesting pieces of information about Argantina's history as well.

Do it. This should be the first thing you do in Buenos Aires! It's a great way to see the city and you will learn a lot.
Make sure to do both tours, they are both completely different but equally interesting. The story of the adventures of Evita's corpse is particularly fascinating and insane.
Great free walking tour. The tour was great! Excellent information and the guide very nice and knows a lot about the city. Definitely a must do if visiting Buenos Aires.

Excellent. The Recoleta tour was excellent! Our tour guide Nacho was fantastic and had so much great info to share. The stories behind so many of the tombs at the Recoleta cemetery were the best, they took that amazing location to an even higher level. Highly recommended!

Exceeded any expectation. My son and I were visiting Buenos Aires and looked for a tour to help us get an overview of th3 city. We picked Demasiado based on a flyer in our hotel thinking - its free so we ca b always leave. We enjoyed our first tour so much (the Centro and Samm Telmo) tour that qe came back a 2nd day for the Recoleta tour. Both days our guide Adam was informative, kept the group lively and had a well paced and well organized tour. We saw a great amount of the city and he gave us a lot of useful tips without any thoughts of a kickback from places he recommended. He seemed to genuinely want us to enjoy his city.

Follow Adam! A Must do. It is not only a funny and amusing free walking tour with Adam. It also delivers insights into the history and backgrounds of the city, of famous people and the country in general. Adam's tour is a must do for travelers from abroad to gather additional information that are not written in tourist guide books. He is a gifted storyteller who makes each place an own attraction. His ability to not only show the shiny but also the shady sides of BA and its people helps to uncover the heartbeat of Argentina. This tour will pay off for everyone. Very well done, Adam!
Fun walking. Great tour, really enjoyed it, the guide was really helpful, I got to know some historical sites from a historical view, that made the trip more interesting than ever, many thanks.
Rain, hail or shine. Nacho was a great guide who spoke perfect English and was interesting to listen to. Really enjoyed the tour even in the rain. Thanks for a great day

A great intro to BA . We took the tour on a hot sunny Saturday morning. Our guide, Ignacio, was nice, funny and energetic and introduced us with the lovely city corners of BA. Highly recommended for an initial orientation of the city.
Great tour from a great porteno guide. Had a great time, guide was engaging and friendly, we felt no pressure to tip a certain amount. Would definitely recommend this tour!
fantastic tour. You must go to this tour if you visit Buenos Aires. It's really interesting and informative and Nacho was a great guide!
Awesome tour!!. Ignacio was the best guide ever. The tour was really interesting and fun. Perfect mix of historical aspects and fun facts. I loved it.

Fantastic tour, epic guide!. Adam's experience, knowledge and humour made the Buenos Aires historical tour one of the best free walking tours I've been on. When you have someone who loves their city and their job as much as Adam does it really makes for a great experience. I couldn't recommend this tour enough. Very interesting facts presented with great humour made the tour a great way to spend the morning.

Great tour. Adam was a great tour guide. The tour was extremely comprehensive - can't get more for your money with a four-hour walking tour! I'd recommend this and wish I had time to do the Recoleta tour with him as well.
very good!! Adams guide. Its our first time in Buenos Aires. Adams was very nice and showed a great knowleadge regarding angentina history. I recomend him to everybody.
great tour!. Adam is very knowledgeable and very funny. He also provided us with information about other things to do in Buenos Aires. Recommended!

A great and humourous way to know Buenos Aires. I did both the Recoleta and the Historic tour with Adam. Both of them were greatly enjoyable and after the end I felt like I knew Buenos Aires and its history for a long time.Apart from his historic knowledge, he put in his humour and knowledge about hangouts and restaurants in the city. Especially his suggestion about the "Nuestra Parrilla" sandwich place just beside the San Telmo Market was very successful. I keep returning to this place whenever I want to have something cheap and tasty!
Great tour. Excellent tour. Our guide was full of knowledge. I would definitely recommend this tour to people visiting Buenos Aires. It is a great introduction to the city and Argentina

Great tour, enthousiastic tourguide!. Great way to get to know the city. The guide (Adam) was really enthousiastic with great humor and knowledge. Not only about Buenos Aires! Also a Nice way to meet new people. The guides always have good extra information about places to go, tips about restaurants of good value etc! The tours include not only the touristplaces, But also extra's about town that you can't find in books and with other tours.

Awesome tour!. If you have the oppurtunity to do the free Demasiado tour through Buenos Aires, do it!!Adam knew so much about the town, the history and had so much love for his town. Plus he makes funny comments and tells with a lot of enthousiasm. Great start of the day with Demassiado tours in Buenas Aires. Ask everything you want, he knows it Oh, and don´t forget the choripan close to the market he´ll show you, it´s delicious :)Love and Peace!

Brilliant all round. Did the tour on Oct 10th. Was great!!! Adam had so much information to give. He made sure to spend time taking to each person to get to know you. Also he made the tour fun with his outragious claims which we're entertaining and highly amusing!! Great job, defiantly reccommended!!!

Excellent tour. I did the historic buenos aires tour with Adam today. I thoroughly enjoyed the tour it was very interesting and informative. Adam was an excellent guide, he is very knowledgeable and enthusiastic. He also speaks perfect English and is easy to understand.

Buenos Aires Historical Walking Tour. Adam, our tour guide was fantastic, full of knowledge, humourous and we left thinking what a fantastic inexpensive way to see and learn about the early history of BA.
