El Tigre Delta. We spent a very nice and relaxed day with Tomás around the Delta. The boat trip in the channels was wonderful and the picnic real good. Tomás is easy going and he made us feel very comfortable. He took good care of us and in addition we learned a lot about Argentina's history. Thanks Tommy for the great, fun day!

A Great Time On The Water. My wife and I spent a day with Tomas in the Tigre Delta just before Christmas. Great fun exploring the back country, and learning lots more about Argentina and its people! Tomas speaks perfect English and is easy to follow. He was always upbeat and very considerate. We certainly would do another tour with him (e.g.,Ricoleta Cemetery).

Do yourselves a favour & go!!. What an amazing day! We spent a day with Tomas (who is a total character) in the Tigre Delta a couple of weeks ago and it was one of the best days of the trip. The Tigre is not far from BA at all but is a totally different world. It was so lovely to get out of the city and Tomas was the best person to do it with. Tomas collected us from our apartment in a very comfortable van (stocked with chocolate, water & beer), entertained us with funny tales on the drive out and then took us on a wonderful boat cruise through the Tigre for 2hrs (& we had only paid for 1!)As we had babies with us he made special arrangements to borrow a boat with a canopy for shade, he entertained the babies giving the parents a break and he brought delicious pastries along as well. Our group LOVED it. We would highly recommend it to anyone out that way with a day to spare and it was such great value!

A man who loves his craft. To kick off our South America tour, we began in Buenos Aires. Fortunate for us we selected Tomas to give my family a tour of the city. He was engaged, informative, pleasant, knowledgeable- a person who truly loves educating tourists on the life, culture and history of BA. If you're undecided as to which guide to select, Tomas is your man.

best tour guide in Argentina. 6 of us toured Buenos Aires with Thomas. He was on time. very very knowledgable, and very funny. his English was perfect. He knew history and current events and brought it all to life for us.

An interesting and unique tour of Buenos Aires. We had a couple of days to spend in BA before our cruise left from the port and we were looking for a guide for the two of us to see the city from a local perspective. Tomas seemed to it fit the bill.We were treated to two days that included a boat tour and water picnic of the delta region that I believe is unique compared to other guides. He was also able to accommodate our many bags as he met us at the airport and we did not want to spend time checking into the ship before our tour began. Space doesn't allow me to go into all of the sights and local observations he treated us to, but suffice it to say that Tomas provides an excellent tour with very good English and a fun sense of humor that made BA one of the top stops for us in our South America cruise.Tomas is an excellent guide with a great local perspective of BA. You would not be wrong using him for your time in Buenos Aires.

A Great Day !. Thanks to Tom Huges we had a beautiful day experiencing the delta and surrounding areas of Tigre, 1 hour outside of BA. His willingness to share his extensive knowledge of the area and it's history made everything more rich for us.He personalized everything to our interests and happily adjusted schedule according to our whim.All in all, more than tour guide, a great host.Eric and Laurie

Great day, great tour & one fine guide!. Confronted with such a huge multi-layed city as BA, we used Tripadvisor reviews to find a guide to assist in approaching our week plus vacation last month. Tomas already had numerous accolades, so we took a chance for a day with Bonaventura Tours. Well, to say that day was the highlight is an understatement. It was superb! Tomas served as our key to quickly learning the cities districts & rich/complex history. It was quickly apparent that he was both a polished conversationalist and well-versed historian. His excellent recounting of BA's/Argentina's rich diverse..and often tragic history added immeasurably to our enjoyment and appreciation of what we were doing and seeing. His intuitive sensing of what we wanted to see/do was especially appreciated. While the tour was initially structured to do/see a certain itinerary, he was fully adaptable to modest revisions and tailored the outing to our interests..this is the hallmark of real gem tour guide. A somewhat 'shot in the dark' (as all tour selections are) turned out to be a bulleye and made our BA sojourn a marvelous excursion. Thanks again, mi amigo.

So much fun!. We spent a day with Tomas on a boat tour in Tigre and sharing beers with a great "history lesson" on the history of Argentina. As others have mentioned, Tomas is one of the best guides you will ever find. He's knowledgeable, upbeat, and makes the whole day fun. He had us laughing from the first minute, and it felt like we were hanging out with a long time friend. Tomas is also very proud of his country and provides excellent information about its history, politics, trivia, etc. He was easily one of the highlights of our two weeks in Argentina and we couldn't recommend him any stronger. Book with him now - you won't be disappointed!

Knowledgeable and funny. Tomas picked us up at our hotel, and he began our 9 hour tour with an education regarding Argentinian history. We visited Recoleta Cemetary, went to lunch, and then to La Boca. He was very flexible if we wanted to stay or move on at any point in our tour. He also came to our aid immediately when we called him later in the week, as we were in a crunch and needed a local who knew the area. I highly recommend him!

Best guide we've ever had!. Touristy Buenos Aires might be a good choice to do on your own during daytime if you just want some selfies in front of Evita Peron's tumb to post on FB. But if you wish to understand the history and stories behind the statues and buildings, to be able to ask questions all the time to understand the culture, if you wish to live in the shoes of porteños for a few days (people living in the Argentinean capital), you have to hire Tomas!We're a young couple from Romania celebrating our honeymoon in Brazil an Argentina. Since we wanted our last four days to be relaxing and stress-free, we had Tomas organizing everything we did in Buenos Aires: city tour, tango class, cooking class, tango show, Tigre delta. Our last day with Tomas was simply the perfect way to finish our honemoon. The Tigre Delta is the most relaxing place, the ride on the boat was bit challenging at times which only made the trip better, the picnic is great, right in front of the city, views are awesome, people are there just to enjoy life. So don't miss it!

Booked a tour - Acquired a great friend!. We booked a El Tigre Delta Tour with Tomas to spend the day on the water for our anniversary! We were not disappointed. Tomas is a bundle of positive energy, great knowledge, and laughs. This tour was definitely worth the cost as he picks you up at your residence and provides an excellent and fun tour for the whole day. Great value!! Tomas makes the area come alive with his knowledge and antidotes. As many other clients have stated, it's like you are automatically connected with an old friend while visiting Buenos Aires. We highly recommend his tours! Please see link for more! https://m.youtube.com/watch?v=Cw6VNV9vxac

Not Only a Tour Guide, But a Friend!!!. We had the absolute best time with Tomás!!! From the second he arrived, we knew it was going to be an amazing tour, and it was going to be a very fun day. He has a perfect personality to be a tour guide, and we knew that right away. As soon as we were in the car, we were laughing and having fun. This guy is very funny! It was going to be a fun day! We did the all-day Tigre tour with him, and it was over the top great! The tour started with a stop in San Isidro to get a cup of coffee and a hat for my wife, since the day was very hot and sunny. He was nice enough to think of her and make the stop to get a hat! I would suggest to stop into San Isidro, as it’s a gorgeous town on the way to Tigre. The boat portion through the delta area was ABSOLUTELY INCREDIBLE!!! He gave us some history as we went through areas of it and it amazes me how beautiful it was. We then stopped at the opening of the Tigre, where he dropped the anchor and we had sandwiches and a Quilmes (we drank the beer and he had water and Pepsi :-) When we were done we went to lunch at a spot in Tigre with a nice view of the water. From there, we went on to Peru Beach, which was a very nice spot with locals only. We had desert and coffee and he gave us a very detailed history lesson on Argentina and Buenos Aires. From there, we went to an amazing photo location for a nice photo of BA from a distance. On the way back to the hotel, he continued to talk about himself and Argentina. That night, my wife and I were very happy, and we credit that to Tomás!!! Reflecting on the day, it was a long day of no stop laughter, history, panoramic views and some of the best photos of our trip, incredible boat ride and making a new friend. Definitely one of the highlights of our 3 week trip!! This was our 5th trip to Argentina and we have taken many tours from many different tour guides. Tomás is the only tour guide we will ever use, or recommend in the future! I also want to add that his tour has a great price point as well. Gracias Tomás!!! Eress el major!

Fantastico!. We had an amazing day with Tomas. He went out of his way to make it the best day possible for us.Tomas is fun, has a great sense of humour and has a lot of history knowledge.A recommended day out!Thanks Tomas. :)

Bonaventura Trips Lives Up to Its Name! Great adventure!. I've been to many cities and have taken many tours and I can honestly say that out of all the tour guides I have met on the planet, he is my favorite. He is so full of knowledge and by the end of the day you wonder "where did all the time go" and "can we do this again tomorrow"? Tomas arranged my tour of the Delta Tigre as part of a cooking class I was taking with Tierra Negra Gourmet (read my review...you have to take a cooking class with them while you are in Buenos Aires). I learned so much about the delta and its history from Tomas. He has first hand knowledge of the area as his family has owned homes there for generations. I knew I was in good hands. His respect for his culture and his fellow portenos gives you a deeper appreciation for all the sites and sounds you hear during the tours. He is full of local knowledge and information and is always willing to tell you what he knows to help you navigate your surroundings better. I was laughing all day long and felt like I was getting a private tour of an amazing city from my best friend. He speaks fluent English so if you come with no language skills, you will not have a problem. I recommend if you have never been to the city, you hook up with Tomas as one of the first things you do. He will give you a great foundation for an amazing trip. Tomas will be my number one recommendation to anyone who visits Buenos Aires.

A Great Day With Tomas in Buenos Aires. My husband and I rang Tomas the night we arrived in BA and to our delight he was free to take us on a tour the next day. Tomas was very friendly and made us feel welcome as we explored most of the highlights. He is passionate about his city and explained the history and culture of Argentina over a cup of coffee and chocolate cake. He took us to places we would never have found ourselves and gave us the confidence to retrace some of the highlights under our own steam the next day. We thoroughly recommend his services - you will not be disappointed.

Fun-filled day in Buenos Aires. Let me start with this, if you are still thinking about this tour, I think you should stop thinking about it and just BOOK IT!!! You will not regret it.My husband and I had one day, private, city tour with Tomas! He was able to create a customize tour for us depending on our interests. He was able to show us the highlights of BA without the feeling of being rushed at all. He is very knowledgeable, flexible with the schedule, and very energetic. You won't get bored with this guy! Plus, he was able to take us around great coffee shops and restaurants around town all in one day- knowing that my husband and I are foodies and are eager to try local favorites. So the two things you need when in BA are comfortable pair of walking shoes and Tomas. And you are in for a wonderful time in BA.

Best Winter Tour Ever. My boyfriend and I were both extraordinarily satisfied with Tomas Hughe's tour. We wished we had scheduled more days with him. There are at least ten reasons why you should go on Tomas' tour.First, the tour was an excellent value for the level of service provided. Tomas' toured just the two of us around Buenos Aires based on our interests and answered all of our questions. He also adjusted the tour on a dime based on our input.Second, Tomas was very prompt when he picked us up. Yet, he extended the tour based on our interests. Basically, his timing is impeccable. He takes traffic and weather into consideration when making decisions, as well as the need to stop for food. He is definitely flexible and adaptable.Third, Tomas is both intelligent and uniquely aware of local, national and world politics. He provides context for historical and architectural tours if you are interested in learning about such things. Both of us were very interested. Tomas even took time to draw us a diagram examining the unique political history of Buenos Aires. All of this was entertaining and fun at the same time.Fourth, Tomas will ensure that you are safe on your tour. He is an excellent driver and will make you aware of any issues that you need to take into consideration.Fifth, Tomas is a very personable and interesting family man. He will answer any question openly and honestly while also sharing his personal perspective. He knows the ins and outs of everything about the city. Ask away, your questions will be answered.Sixth, Tomas is an excellent photographer. He will ensure that you look great in all of the photos that he helps you take.Seventh, Tomas knows food if you are into eating, he knows where to go. While you are there, he can describe the unique characteristics of the people living in the neighborhood that you are visiting.Eighth, Tomas is a generous tour guide. He got candy for us:)Ninth, Tomas was born and bread in Buenos Aires. He even attended law school at a university in the city.Tenth and last, you will have a great time!

Amazing, unique and highly informative!. I toured with expert tour guide Tomas on 3 separate days with completely different, wonderful experiences. It was like touring with a really smart and funny older brother who loves his country. Each day was tailored to my interests. From breakfasts to a picnic lunch on his boat on the Delta (Tigre), I fully enjoyed the culture of Buenos Aires in a unique way. Tomas is an experienced professional, conscientious, intelligent, and has a strong knowledge of B.A. history. The first day, we toured Recoleta Cemetary and its beautiful Cathedral, Plaza de Mayo, and the regal Metropolitan Cathedral. The day began at La Biela, a lovely cafe with a strong, early 20th century Argentinian vibe. Over croissant and cafe, Tomas gave a Cliff's Note version of Argentinian history which informed every sight we visited from then on. The 2nd day, we toured Peru Beach (spectacular views of the BA skyline) and La Boca where we had lunch in a quaint little Italian restaurant, and I bought some artwork. The boat tour of the Delta and Tigre area was the third day, and that was amazing. What an insight into the area where so many Portenos relax and leave the city behind. Charming homes all along the calm and relaxing riverways, and a picnic lunch with another incredible view of the BA skyline. I recommend Tomas' Bonaventura Trips to everyone! I can't imagine a trip to Buenos Aires without time spent with Tomas.

Do you like food? Book with Tomas in Bonaventura Trips!. We had spent two days with Tomas in his lovely city of Buenos Aires! We started with a trip on the Tigre River! I wasn't sure what to expect but parts of it were like a little cruise thru the Amazon. I am glad we did this as it was a true of the beaten path attraction that shouldn't be missed. Tomas has a small motor boat that allows exploration of the little streams that branch off the Tigre river, one gets a good view of how people live in this area. We had a few coffee stops through the day and had a little picnic on the boat. Tomas quickly figured out I have a sweet tooth and was anxious to let me try all sorts of candy, pastries the country has to offer. We had a delicious steak lunch at a local restaurant that had a lovely garden as well.Day two we started at a lovely landmark Cafe Tortola with some coffee and pastries. Tomas certainly knows his history but unlike other guides, if you are uninterested in what he has to say, he will quickly change the subject. It is a tour truly centered on your interests. He took us thru many neighborhoods including La Boca, San Telmo and Recoletta. The fun part was stopping for a taste of local empanadas and grilled cheese (provoletta)! Later in our trip we had some of these things in other places but they weren't as good as the places Tomas took us thru. Next time we come to Buenos Aires we will definitely count on a Food tour with Tomas! He is great company and a palate for tasty Argentinian treats!

Like Touring Buenos Aires with a Friend. If you are looking for a tour where the guide points out every building as you drive through the tourist area, book a tour with someone else. If you want a relaxed tour fine tuned for your interests, book with Bonaventura Trips and Tomas.Tomas is not formal. From the moment you meet him, you feel like you are with a friend. We spent 2 days with him exploring the Delta region and downtown area. Each day began over coffee where we discussed the plan for the day. On the first day, we explored Tigre and the Delta region. Tigre is a beautiful little town that feels like the Spanish coast. After some café con leche and treats, we went on his private boat through the rivers and streams of the delta. If you want to relax or if you want to experience the non-touristy areas, this is the perfect tour. Do not do it if seeing every tourist site is on your agenda. We spent several hours driving through the waterways or anchored in the Rio San Antonio overlooking downtown Buenos Aires while drinking beer and eating snacks. Highly recommended day if you want to get off the beaten path.The second day again began with coffee in the Café Tortoni, a regal coffee house from the golden era of Argentina. While now clearly serving more tourists than locals, a visit is worthwhile in order to appreciate what life was like here in the early 20th century. After visiting all of the typical tourist spots (the Pink House, the Cathedral, etc), Tomas took us to La Boca. The tour typically visits La Bombonera, the stadium of La Boca Junior football team. The stadium and museum are critical for any visit to Buenos Aires if one is a sports fan, and I enjoyed the visit. My wife, however, was bored at the stadium, and you should let Tomas know if you are not a sports or football fan. After the stadium, we stopped for lunch in a local café. From the appearance, I was convinced that I would be ill the rest of the trip, but the food was fantastic. I highly recommend the empanadas and grilled cheese. They were the best that we had during our trip to Argentina. La Boca is fantastic, and use the time there to shop if you do not like sports. We then went to La Recoletta ceremony where the passion of Tomas for Argentinian history was apparent.Tomas is a great guide. My family and I have traveled throughout the world, and we have not experienced a guide with so much enthusiasm before. He loves Argentina, and he wants you to love his country.

Look No Further!!. Tómas is an amazing guide and person. We took the Buenos Aires City Tour and were thoroughly impressed. We started our day with a little café and then headed to the neighborhood of Boca. We walked and talked about the area, history, landmarks, and visited Boca Juniors Stadium. He and I bought some Argentinian Futbol gear for the World Cup Final game the next day. Aside from the great tour, he gave great restaurant recommendations (also a great recommendation of where to watch the World Cup Final). After Boca, we went to other great parts of the City, including Recoleta Cemetery, which is amazing!! What makes this tour really great is that it's just like having a friend take you around the city. He gives a great history lesson throughout the tour, which all comes together in the Cemetery when you get to see the tombs of all the different people he mentioned. After enjoying our city tour so much, we were going to do the Delta tour a couple days later, but we just didn't have the time. Thanks again Tomas, we'll be calling you for our next trip!! Ciaó Mate!!

Adventures with Tomas. If you are visiting Buenos Aires I definitely recommend you take a trip with Bonaventura. Tomas picked us up from our hotel promptly and drove of us out to Tigre. We went out on a private speed boat and toured the deltas for a few hours. We stopped at a wide part of the delta with views over Buenos Aires where Tomas gave us some beer and snacks.After that we returned to Tigre and went for some lunch. Finally we drove down to a nice bar where Tomas entertained us with a history lesson on Argentina which was great.Tomas is friendly, entertaining and a great tour guide. We spent pretty much the full day with Tomas and he is such a likeable guy that you feel like you are on a tour with one of your friends. Highly recommended so make sure you get in touch with Tomas and arrange a trip with him.
Delta tigers. Great day on the Delta with Tomas our guide. From the boat trip to our personalised history of Argentina was a great day out.

Amazing Delta Tour!. I live in Buenos Aires and even though I had been to Tigre before, I'd never experienced such an incredible day. Tomás is a really outgoing, adventurous guy, full of energy and surprises. He does an amazing personalized tour in really small groups... He actually uses his own car and boat! All this makes a unique and special experience out of a regular day at the delta. We spent all morning exploring the delta talking about life, music and, of course, the story behind what we were seeing at such a huge natural area. We even got to see Buenos Aires from the river! Later on we got to a really nice quiet part of the delta where he surprised us with some snacks and drinks. We had our own little picnic on the boat! After a while eating and talking we decided to go back. Tomás showed us the Navy Museum which, by the way, is awesome, and around the river-side streets that are simply beautiful.All in all, one of the best tours I've ever taken!

3 days with Tomas. We were to be in Buenos Aires for 6 days. Being quite possibly the only time in our lives when we might be in Argentina, we booked Tomas for 3 days of private touring. We based using Tomas primarily on the great comments on Tripadvisor and his pre-trip correspondence offering options, taking the time to understand what we were wanting out of a tour and his assistance in planning out the days before our arrival. After meeting Tomas we spent a day touring the city, a day in the "province" of San Antonio del Arco and finally a day on the Tigre Delta. We had a great time every day and would not have changed anything. As many people have said, it was like having a knowledge friend showing you the sights. I won't repeat all of the details well covered in the numerous other reviews. It was a great combination of tourist must see sights and local not so tourist sights. He also took the time to offer recommendations and directions for wandering Buenos Aires on our own during our "off" days. I would give him 6 stars.We now hope to visit Argentina again and would certainly use Tomas again for some new adventures.

Great Delta Tour. Our tour with Tomas was fantastic, We started the day by exploring the river-side community of Tigre before making our way up river in Tomas's boat, taking a break to spend some time floating on the delta with a veiw of the BA skyline. On the way back, we stopped for lunch at a great local restaurant and spent some time at a riverside beach learning about Argentinian history. Tomas is very knowledgeable and a lot of fun. Highly recommended.

Knowledgeable and flexible tour guide. Treat yourselves to a tour with Tomas!!! You won't be disappointed! We could only do a half day tour and Tomas gratiously accepted. He began with treating us to espressos on a quaint setting in Recoleta while he explained Argentina's history...he made it understandable and interesting...then we went to the cemetery where Evita was buried...not sure how long we stayed but Tomas had stories for a lot of the important and not so important people buried there . Onto other areas in Buenos Aires even extending our time limit by an hour and a half!!! Wish we had booked a full day tour or had time to do his new "twilight tour"!!!
Visiting Buenos Aires. We found Tomas to be an excellent guide in Buenos Aires. He was good company, knowledgeable and extremely punctual. We would highly recommend him.

Tour with a Tigre local, Tommy!. Excellent tour! Tommy picked us up at the hotel in his car at 10am. About an hour drive to Tigre, which allows him to speak a little bit about the BsAs. Hopped on Tommy's boat and he gave a true locals guide through delta, which is beautiful. Tommy was entertaining and informative all through out the day. We were in BA for 7 nights and decided to this tour in the middle in order to get a break from the city...Tommy came through with what we were looking.Don't get trapped on the big tourist boats, go with Bonaventura Private Tour

Tour with a Local. Spending a week in Buenos Aires, we wanted to get a feel for the city our first day so signed up for a full day tour with Tomas. He did an excellent job of showing us his city and give us insights as only a local can. He did a great job of making it interesting for our teenage son. This is a great way to see Buenos Aires. He takes his cue from your interest and level of comfort. I highly recommend a tour with Tomas.

It is like having a knowledgeable friend with a boat!. For our trip to Buenos Aires, we wanted to do something outside of the city. After some investigation, we decided a trip to the Tigre Delta was just the ticket and started searching for a guide to take us there. We pretty quickly ruled out the larger group tours. Being packed on a bus just to be packed onto a boat has about zero appeal to us, so we started looking at guides who did private tours. After reading through the review, Tomás seemed to fit the profile. A quick email, and he had confirmed us for a day trip, picking us up and dropping us off at our hotel in Palermo Soho. We could not have been happier with our choice. Tomás feels more like a friend of a friend rather than a tour guide. He is very laid back, friendly and has a great sense of humor. His English is excellent and his insights into local culture are excellent. He doesn't sound like someone who has given the same tour 100 times. Rather, the experience with him feels like he is taking his friends in his boat to show off the area.He took us through some of the smaller areas of the Delta, not just focusing on the big sites and the rowing clubs. We had a chance to see the grocery boats out delivering to the locals. For lunch, he took us to Villa Julia for an excellent, and very reasonably-priced lunch. We sat out in the lawn under a canopy and enjoyed chatting about the history of the country, something Tomás has a passion for.After the Tigre, we went to Peru Beach to sit out and watch the sunset while having a beer. Overall a fantastic day with a wonderful guide. I would highly recommend Tomás to anyone looking for a fun day around BA. Well worth the very modest fee.

Excellent El Tigre Tour. Exploring El Tigre region with Bonaventura trips was a very good experience.The trip (27 April 2014) was well organised and more like a day out with friends rather than an "organised" tour. Tomas is friendly, flexible and knowledgeable.We visited the art museum and had lunch on the river on the boat together with a quick "history" rundown along the route from our apartment to El Tigre.This trip appealed to me because it included pick-up from and return to my apartment in Balvanera and suited to "small groups".I look forward to doing another trip with Bonaventura trips next time in Buenos Aires.
Great day on Tigre. This was a wonderful way to explore Tigre. Tomas offers a knowledgeable, entertaining and personalised trip and the whole day was one of our highlights of the trip to Argentina.

Tomas is the man. Me & my girlfriend spent a great day in the town of El Tigre & adventuring through the canals of the "El Tigre Delta". Tomas is very "buena onda" would recommend him as a tour guide and all out hangout buddy any day. Will take him out for a beer when im back in Buenos Aires. A++++

Perfect way to see Buenos Aires. I could not think of a better way to see and experience Buenos Aires than a tour with Tomas.First off, Tomas was punctual and really catered the tour for what my husband and I wanted to see. He was personable..and really just fun to be around! What sets this tour different than the rest is a number of things. First, the tour is individualized to what your needs are and what you want to see. Secondly, you get personal attention and every question answered. I didn't feel like I was just another tourist but hanging out with a local, someone who answered all our questions and who really let us in on the cultural aspects of being an Argentinean.We did two tour day with Tomas. The first day we explored BA. We went to the "Pink House" where crazily we got to get in to the President's office and actually see the desk she worked at! We also got to explore the famous cemetery of Recoleta. Tomas was great telling us the important history and stories of each site...he is so knowledgeable! He knew every answer to our questions...and really focuses on the history and culture of the events. At the end of the tour, Tomas was so sweet he actually stayed around our hotel while we got ready and dropped us off at a dinner spot he recommended (which we thought was likely the best steak we've ever had). We were so grateful Tomas took time out of his day to do this.Our second tour was of the Delta...which was a special way to see the outskirts of BA. Tomas took us around in his boat, and we got to have a very enjoyable lunch in one of the restaurants on the delta. Such pretty sights...He actually even showed us his own home on the delta..it was wonderful to interact with his family and truly feel like a local.Basically Tomas went above and beyond for us and really made our stay in BA. We recommend him whole heartedly...if your looking for a personable, fun, local friend with incredible knowledge of history and culture then Tomas is the guide for you! Thanks Tomas!

Delta Tour w/ Tomas Hughes. We enjoyed a wonderful day on a delta tour with Tomas on Monday, April 14, 2014. The weather was beautiful and Tomas was the consummate guide - relaxed, flexible, entertaining & informative! If you have an opportunity, do not hesitate to book a tour with Tomas and you will have a day with "No Worries"!

The perfect guide. If you are in Buenos Aires alone or with friends and want to know the city by the side of a guide is not programmed with stories memorized, he, Tomas is the right person. I spent a beautiful day and fun, to hear the story of the city told by the heart one very Argentinian man.Professional, prepared, friendly, smiling and dancer will transport you to another era.Buena onda Tomàs :)

Wonderful, fun day.. We did an all day tour of the city and surrounding towns. Tomas is fun, interesting & knowledgeable. Picked us up right on time & since he was already booked, recommended another driver to take us to the airport. We miss him. &. Buenos Aires . Can't wait to return. & do more tours with him . Ellen & Al from Cuenca, Ecuador

City tour with Tomas. Our group of 6 took a private city of Buenos Aires with Tomas. It was very easy to communicate with him via email, his replies always prompt. He met us in front of our apartment on time, had a very nice van for transportation, and was a fountain of information about Buenos Aires and the neighborhoods. He was engaging and funny, always making sure we were satisfied. Among the highlights of his tour was the Soccer Stadium, La Boca, and Recoleta Cemetary. And he bought us little treats that he wanted us to sample. We highly recommend Tomas as a tour guide, and his price is very reasonable for a full day's tour including the transportation. You will not be disappointed.

Excellent Tigre Delta visit. Booked Tomas for 4 of us to go on a private tour of the Tigre Delta. It was easy to communicate by email. We were picked up punctually and driven to the Tigre region with a few detiours in Buenos Aires to see some points of interest. We visited an art museum, where Tomas provided his expertise about th elocal art. Then for the highlight we proceeded onto his motor boat. We went onto one of the major rivers in the delta first and had lunch, which Tomas provided in the middle of th river. Then off to smaller canals surrounded by forest - canals that are so narrow and shallow that bigger boats would not be able to navigate them. This was the hightlight of the visit. We all enjoyed and would heartily recommend Tomas as a guide.

Enjoyable - Fun - Seamless. Tomas picked us up right on time and gave us an amazing experience. He was fun, knowledgeable, entertaining and we highly recommend cruising down the the Tigre Delta.He popped out a nice lunch on the calm waters and overall, I would HIGHLY recommend anyone visiting Buenos Aires!

Tour of El Tigre. Tomas picked us up promptly at our hotel and drove us to the Delta Region. There my husband and I with Tomas and captain of the boat cruised Tigre Delta (with great tunes I might add) and it was so relaxing, beautiful and historically interesting. We lunched at a lovely old home turned into a restaurant right across from the river with good food and vino! We then toured the Naval Museum of which Tomas was very knowledgeable as he is of Buenos Aries, the city, neighborhoods, the people and historical significant content. We thoroughly enjoyed our day with Tomas, who is the consummate guide coupled with a wonderful personality.

Full Day City Tour with Boat Ride on Tigres. Our group of 10 from an Oceania cruise that ended in Buenos Aires contacted Tomas through Cruisecritic.com and booked his personalized tour a couple of months ahead of time. He was easy to communicate with, answering all of our questions through emails. His tour price was very reasonable compared to the tours offered on board the ship. He spent over 8 hours with us and got us back to the ship on time. He was sensitive to our needs. He took us to a nice restaurant for lunch and paid for his own meal. We all sampled various pizzas which were delicious, and the cost was less than $10 USD pp. We had time to shop and could choose whether we wanted to be guided through La Boca or wander around on our own. We had time to take lots of photos. Thoroughly enjoyed the day. A great introduction to the city.

A Day in Buenos Aires. My husband and I spent a day with Tomás while he showed us around Boca and Recoleta. We had a great time and learned a lot about the culture and history. Tomás even gave us advice on other activities we could do while in Buenos Aires!It's a long day for the tour, but since it's a private tour, Tomás goes at your pace. You can stop for a coffee or ice cream break as many times as you want!

Trip El Tigre. We just had a wonderfull day. Tomas is a very good host. He told a lot about the history and neighbourhood. We really enjoyed the boattrip in Tigre. It was a perfect ending of our holiday. Really value for your money.

Trip to the Tigre Delta. As many other reviews described, this trip was true to their descriptions. You are picked up at your hotel, driven to the Delta region. We opted for the Naval Museum tour and Tomas was able to give us much historical information in a way that one was able to follow the "story". We were then taken to the boat lunch area (bathroom available) and were driven on the boat to where we had a view of the city of BA while we ate lunch (included!). It was a gorgeous day to be on the river and we found it quite relaxing to drive around the many varied canals and see what the region offered. The day ended with a coffee at another viewpoint. Very flexible - let him know what you want and he will be sure to provide it.

Perfect way to see a city.... First time I have ever hired a private guide for a city tour, in fact I rarely take tours preferring to do things on my own when I travel. Signing up for 2 days of touring with Tomas was my best decision in Buenos Aires. My perfect way to see a city is traveling somewhere new, meeting a friend who lives there and having them show you their city. Having a tour with Tomas is like that. My highest endorsement to Tomas because if I am able to return to Buenos Aires I would definitely book again. Thank you Tomas for helping me understand the area and culture of Argentina.

Best Guide Ever. Tomas met us at our hotel with a big smile that continued throughout the four days that he served as our guide. The first day we toured the Tigre River Delta on his boat and lunched at a rowing club. The tour provided us with first-hand knowledge of how the people on the river live using only boat transportation as there are no roads. We passed supermarket boats and were told that boats were used as school buses for local children. From the boat we had a view of Buenos Aires as we looked southward. We ate lunch at a rowing club in Tigre before returning to the city and I had divine cannelloni. It was a lovely boat, and Tomas is an excellent driver. I highly recommend this tour if you would like to see the countryside outside the city. The next three days Tomas took us to see all of the sights of the city as well as entertaining my husband at a cafe while I did some shopping. His English is excellent, and he is very knowledgeable about the city and about Argentina history. His tour of Recolleta Cemetery is especially enlightening.  Tomas showed us Carminito Street and guided us to a cafe known to locals. He also took us to Don Julio Restaurant for a real Argentina steak (the best meal we had in Argentina).  I had done a great deal of research before our trip, and I shared my list of things we wanted to see and do with Tomas. He was very enthusiastic about showing us all the sights that we requested, and he made each day both educational and fun.  He took us to the Belle Artes Museum and knew much about the art there. I requested a visit to a Milonga, and he was eager to show it to us. We had attended a River Plate "futbol" game, but we wanted to see Bombanera Stadium and Museum where Boca Juniors play. He knew all about the exhibits in the museum, and he really made the experience a powerful one. We have had many guides on other trips, but Tomas became more than just a guide for us. He became more like a son or friend. We will definitely stay in touch with him. He gets my highest recommendation. Also, Tomas's fee is very reasonable compared to the guides we have had other places. If you can afford to book him for your entire stay in Buenos Aires, do so. You won't be disappointed , and you will have a great experience.

Tomas Hughes...making Buenos Aires come alive. Recently we had the pleasure to be guided by Tomas Huges. We were four people, one of whom had difficulty walking. Tomas made the city come alive and each of us experienced both a sense of history as well as being personally a part of the city. Tomas has the knowledge; more importantly, the ability to convey it. Guides are always difficult, they represent the unknown. It is rare when one proves himself (or herself) superlative...Tomas did just that. We recomend Tomas to anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

City Tour of Buenos Aries. Thomas met us at our hotel and then proceeded to show us the sights at the same time covering some of the history of BA. The tour included a visit to LA BOCA, the famous football stadium and home of Boca Juniors.We also visited the new port district of Puerto Madero built on the site of the old Port. Next was San Telmo district .This is twinned with the hidden ancient and colonial ares of Buenos Aries. Plaza De Mayo founded in 1580 was next. This is an important landmark. (Evita used to speak to the people from here ). Our tour also included a visit to LA RECOLETA , the little Paris of South America and one of the most important districts. Here we visited the unique and famous cemetery.This is where Evita is buried As you can see this was a very thorough tour.Tomas ensured we achieved our objectives and his friendly pleasing attitude made it a very enjoyable. This was a memorable and fun tour experience. I would highly recommend Thomas

A wonderful day in Tigre and the delta. Having booked an excursion with Tomas online we were a little concerned when he hadn't arrived at our hotel at the appointed time. However he was only ten minutes late having, unbeknown to us, sent an email with apologies. We were soon on our way in his car and as the weather looked a bit doubtful he asked if we would prefer to go for the river tour on a larger, covered boat. Fortunately we decide against this and went to a boatyard to pick up his father's motor boat. The weather changed for the better and we thoroughly enjoyed going along some of the narrow creeks which would not have been possible in a larger boat. The scenery was amazing with lovely views of the houses and gardens along the river banks. After an hour or so we anchored in the middle of the channel and enjoyed a welcome glass of beer before returning to Tigre for lunch. this we had in a very nice restaurant beside the river and afterwards had a tour of the Naval Museum which was nearby. Here Tomas was able to show his extensive knowledge of the items on display and all to soon it was time to return to the city. The whole experience lasted for over seven hoursd and we consider it excellent value for money.

Fantastic tour guide!. Tomas showed us an amazing time in Buenos Aires today. He was amazingly flexible and enjoyable and knowledgable on everything Buenos Aires. He makes everything about the city interesting and easy and fun!

Great day with a fun guide. Spent a great day in and around Tigre, near Buenos Aires. Our guide, Tomás, was right on time at pickup and amazing for every step thereafter. He is a funny guy, who achieved a great balance between informative tour guide and fun-to-know local. The boat ride around Tigre is relaxing and beautiful. It really feels like a world away from the hustle and bustle of Buenos Aires. A visit to the navy museum proved to be very interesting, thanks to Tomás. We got a peek into Argentinean history and a few anecdotal stories along the way.The day concluded with a great lunch. Overall, I highly endorse this company!

visit to Tigre delta. Tomas is an excellent guide - very well informed with an obvious love for what he does. I did the Tigre tour on my own, so it was just the 2 of us but the time just flew by as Tomas is so friendly and chatty. I would definitely recommend this trip if you want something a bit different from the larger tour boats.

BEST TOUR OF BUENOS AIRES HANDS DOWN!. You know that feeling you get when you’re traveling to a different country and you want to make the most of your trip by seeing everything the city has to offer, but then you get completely overwhelmed because it seems like there’s too much to do? Well after taking Tomas’ full day city tour on our first of four days in BA—that feeling was gone.Tomas is the absolute nicest guy and the tour offered the perfect balance of history, sight seeing, neighborhood hoping, and picture taking. Tomas gladly customized different parts of the tour based on our interests, provided recommendations on other things for us to do while in town, and helped translate everything along the way (which is good b/c my wife and I don’t speak any Spanish!).The tour is incredibly convenient and a lot of fun—mostly because Tomas is such a great guy! He picked us up in his car from our hotel in the morning, happily drove us all around town, and after a fun filled day of exploring he dropped us back off at our hotel.For a personal tour—Tomas’ fee is INCREDIBLY reasonable and I would highly recommend that anyone visiting BA drop Tomas an email in advance of arriving to schedule a tour with him on one of your first days there.

Wonderful day spent with a new friend. Tomas picked is up atour apt & off we went for a great day of adventure, food, conversation & sightseeing. We went to San Isidro, San Telmo. Recolleta, all of Palermo & even to pick up our money transfer. He is a joy to be with & very knowledgable. Recommend him highly. Have such a better feel for the city now.

buenos aires with family of four. We enjoyed spending our time in Buenos Aires with Thomas. He is very accommodating and truly cares about his clients. His prices are reasonable in comparison to the other tour guides. Surprisingly we found BA to be very expensive. If you are on a budget or have a large family (private tour prices in BA are based on the number of people not per family like in Europe) do not hesitate to contact Thomas. Our favourite tour was of Recoleta cemetery where Thomas has shown a vast knowledge of the BA history. The delta of Tigre was nice and relaxing. The Gaucho experience was OK. There was not much to do but if you are looking for a relaxing day on the farm with really good food you will definitely enjoy this get away. Host family at the estancia is very nice and hospitable. They went above and beyond to make us feel at home.

布市5星级导游 - Our 5 star tour guide in Buenos Aires. I was browsing through TripAdvisor the day before arriving in Buenos Aires. We have a group of 6 people and had not planned anything except for We are Tango which we very much look forward to. So I tried my lucky to contact Tomas by email after seeing such raving reviews from other reviewers. Tomas replied my email first thing the next morning with a suggestion of what he proposes to do with us. I saw the email just when we landed in BA. I jumped to the opportunity and we agreed to meet at our apartment 2 hours after we checked in. Since we have granny of 85 yo traveling with us walking tour is out of the question. Tomas arranged a minvan and there we go. He is such a jolly and enthusiastic guide. We had a great trip seeing a number of famous tourist spots in the city (football club, a local tourist spot where most houses are built on old ship wrecks, then St Martin's Church where Pope Francis used to be celebrating mass, the pink government house, and of course the Rocoleta Cemetery where Evita Peron was buried). It was supposed to be a rest day for Tomas but he agreed to spend the afternoon with us and made an excellent first impression of this important world city to us. Tomas is an excellent amateur singer and he sang us a song before we end our fun, entertaining and memorable city tour. We can't thank him enough.

Tomas, most impressive guide. It was such an amazing tour with Tomas, our two teenagers 16 and 19 also found him interesting, very informative, accommodating, kind and understanding. He is very attentive to all our needs. It is also great tour because he has his coach, and we brought along our 85 years old grandmother as well. Everybody was impressed and likes Tomas. We will bring home many happy memories of Buenos Aires.

Boca tour with Tomas. I had an amazing time with Tomas..He was an incredible host and tour guide.Super friendly and an amazing person to be around.I totally recommend him with no second thought.Not only is he a great tour guide,but I managed to make a new friend whilst in Buenos Aires..Guys looks nowhere else and book with Tomas..
Super cool. Tomas is the best !!!! The tour is really nice too !!! If you want to spend a cool day on the delta del tigre, that's the best option for sure !!

Tigre River. We were told that we should not miss the Delta Tigre river. Our hotel recommended a tour with Tomas. What a fantastic day! Tomas picked us up at our hotel and drove us to the marina where his boat was docked. On the ride there, Tomas gave us information about everything that we passed. His English is quite good. We got on his boat and drove out to where you could see the skyline of Buenos Aires. We dropped anchor there and had a really nice picnic on the boat. Sandwiches, beer, and soft drinks. It was perfect! After our picnic, Tomas drove us all over the delta showing us private homes, etc. We got great photos and actually became friends with Tomas! We asked him what we should do the next day. He recommended La Boca. We went the next day and LOVED IT. Tomas made our BA trip the best!!!

Fun, expert, entertaining tour. My husband and another couple went on the Delta Tigre tour with Tomas. It was obvious from the very beginning that Tomas was an expert on the history of the Delta and Buenos Aires. We went on a boat ride and he provided a delightful lunch while we anchored on the river. Tomas truly made our day-long trip with him very special and I highly recommend him.

Paraná Delta and Tigre Tour. We went on the Delta Tour with Tomás. It was really amazing. Great views of the Delta and everything that goes on there. But it's not only the awesome boat ride which made the day very special, mainly it was Tomás. He is really relaxed and knows a lot about the history of the delta and Buenos Aires. We laughed a lot and he even helped us to our first Mate experience in Buenos Aires. Thanks for a great day!

City Tour and Excursion. My wife and I were taken by Tomas, owner of Bonaventura Private Tours, on an extensive full day driving tour around Buenos Aires. In this very large city we were able to see all the key neighborhoods. Tomas is friendly, knowledgable, and speaks very good English. Also, he is very flexible; if you express special interest in a particular site (the Football Stadium, for instance) he will take you there. Sincé he has been a student of history he had much to tell about the origins and development of modern day Argentina. Especially impressive was our visit to the Recolete Cemeterio where his recitation of history interwoven with the visible evidence--literally shrines-- of many of the former leaders of the country, combined to make a fascinating visit. On a second full day tour we asked Tomas to drive us to Tigre and again we weren´t disappointed. He knew the town (and canals) intimately as his family has a "country" home there.It is a "must see" destination: beautiful and unique. All in all we can recommend Bonaventura Private Tours without reservation. In the person of Tomas we know you´re going to enjoy the attributes of a knowledgeable and personable private guide as you experience the wonders of Buenos Aires and Tigre.

A great tour with a super friendly tour guide!!. I went on a tour with them just the other week and I had a great time. The tour guide Tommy was super friendly and also knew a lot of the history that has made this city what it is today. I highly recommend their tours for anyone that is looking to get to know the city's culture and history all while having fun and sharing a few laughs with a local.

Highlight of out trip to Buenos Aires. The tour with Tomas was one of the most memorable parts of our trip to Argentina it was a great way to see Tigre and the River delta (which is a must do in my opinion). The trip lasted for about 5 hours and included a stop in the Naval Museum, a boat cruise up river and a stop near the river mouth for lunch. Tomas was a great guide, spoke English well, had extensive knowledge of local history and good sense of humor. I would definitely recommend this tour for all visitors to Buenos Aires.

My go-to guide when friends and family are in town. I met Tommy through a friend of mine, and he is the greatest when I have friends in town. I live and work in BA, so it's quite frequent that when friends and family come through, I have to work during the day. I pass them off to Tommy, who's a 100% reliably and trusty guide. He's also very affordable, especially compared to other private tour company, and speaks near perfect English. Friends and family come back from the tours raving about Tommy's knowledge and friendliness every time. Additionally, he will pick up and drop off the person wherever you ask, making the whole thing care free for me.

Graffitmundo. Fantastic tour – informative but relaxed, lots of great art and insight into the art. Our host Benjamin was great, put everyone at ease, answer questions, and was extremely knowledgeable. Highly recommended!
Great history of the city. Really enjoyed my North city tour. It is amazing how much history you can learn from street art. Walked about half, then rode in a bus about half.

History, Culture and Art.....while enjoying beatiful BA!!. The Experience - While in BA do not let the 'walking' tour detour you from attending, you will miss out on a great opportunity. The guide knew the history of the pieces and provided invaluable meaningful information bring the art even more into an unexpected cerebral place. If you wish to spend a little time getting to better understand the Argentine people from a unique perspective, do not miss this tour. What to bring - If it is sunny bring a hat, rainy an umbrella and in both water. In any case there are numerous places to purchase water if forgotten. Comfortable shoes in both cases. Most importantly bring a curious mind and camera to capture the visual aspects of the tour.

Fun time with the art in the streets of BA. I had a very nice afternoon seeing the paintings on the walls on BA. Some of them were really stunning, and Anna's explanations,knowledgeable and energized, placed them in right context. She drew are attention to many interesting points and told the story behind these art creations.Fun time was had by all.

See the city from another perspective. I did the tour today and had a wonderful time. It is a nice way to explore the city. I really liked the interesting stories behind the artworks and also learned a bit about the history of Buenos Aires.

Great tour!. We did this tour on our first day in Buenos Aries. The street art is stunning!Benjamin, our guide, explained a lot about the art, the history of street art in BA and how it reflects the history and culture of Argentina. Our 2 teenage sons enjoyed it too!Highly recommended.

A must do tours. The tours run by Graffitimundo are all worth doing if you are into street art and also history. Ben, Miriam and Ana made the tours so good due to doing what they believe in. I learnt a lot about different things ranging from yellow fever to the mothers of the disappeared. It was great to finish off 2 of the tours at Post Street Bar which is an amazing place.
Oh My Goodness. I've never had such an appreciation for the art of a city. The history was truly captivating, and I gained a completely new love for everything Buenos Aires has been through

Great way to experience something unique. The tour operators Ana and (a gentlemen, sorry I forgot your name) were super passionate about what they were talking about which made the tour that much better. It was great that we got to take a bus to other sites so we truly we're touring around Buenos Aires. It was an awesome experience, I was much more impressed than I thought I would be!

Fantastic tour!. . Ana was an enthusiastic and very knowledgable guide and explained both the social and political messages that street art contains. Not only did we get to see some amazing art but recived a passionate account of the history of Argentina. It was a fantastic tour

Historical activism expressed through art!. Was impressed by the political and social explanations as well as the historical progression of the street art...street art is NOT just art but a voice of the people and expression of the times. Unfortunately this tour (South Tour) was taken on our last day. I wish we had taken it right away as it explains so much of the culture you experience when just walking the streets in Buenos Aires. We would have also opted to do the north tour too and visit some of the gallery spaces. A mini bus took us into neighborhoods I would never have dared to go but would have missed so much.Our tour tour guides Ben and Ana were a wealth of insight; through them we were able to embrace the real BuenosAires that tourists don't see.

Loved it!. I love graffiti tours as they're a great way to get a feel of a city at a different level to the normal tourist routes. This tour didn't disappoint and combined street art with a very interesting cultural and political history of Buenos Aires and Argentina. The guide was great - friendly, funny and knowledgable. I'd recommend this to anyone. Watch out for the dog poo and the graffiti cat :-)P.S. I did the north city tour
Graffitimundo north tour . Went on the north tour with Benjamin. He was incredibly knowledgeable, passionate and a pleasure to have him as our tour guide.

A Must Do if you want to understand What Has Gone On Politically in this Country. Loved all the back ground knowledge that came with this tour ... really fascinating insight into what has gone on here. And the different styles of street art. Miriam was an excellent guide and we certainly had our money's worth ... Highly recommended. There is a lot of street art in Palermo whcih, because we were on foot, was not possible to view ... so make sure you keep your eyes peeled whilst you are here!

One of a kind walking tour. Buenos Aires is full of stunning street art. Why not learn about it? This is a great tour that combines a bit of history, a lot of stunning art, and a beautiful stroll around the city. I live in NYC and this walking tour blew me away.

Great Way to See Buenos Aires. I thoroughly enjoyed this leisurely tour. I'd been in BA for several days already and had actually started to feel annoyed by all the graffiti I'd seen on so many beautiful old buildings. The tour changed my perception completely. I won't explain it here because that would spoil the discoveries that the tour revealed. My appreciation for the street art, artists, and the city as a whole has grown exponentially. The tour is easy walking and private bus riding. Our tour guide - i've forgotten her name - was delightful.

Highly Recommended. Two friends and I took Graffiti Mundo's North City tour based on a recommendation of a fellow traveler we met in Rio de Janeiro, and we did not regret our decision. The tour was $30 USD per person and you can reserve a spot and pay on their website. The tour includes some walking, and some transport by private small bus. The tour is three hours, but we would not recommend making plans directly afterward, as you end the tour at a bar owned by local artists, which is a great place to browse art pieces for purchase and/or get a drink in a cool bar covered with art. Weird tip, but watch where you step in some of the areas where the tour goes. The area has a good amount of dog feces on its sidewalks.The tour guides at Graffiti Mundo are all passionate about the street art in Buenos Aires and the information shared helps visitors to better understand the social, economic and political history of the city. It's also a great way to meet fellow travelers. We would recommend this tour to anyone who has an interest in street art or learning about Buenos Aires from a different perspective. Additionally, if you enjoyed the tour and happen to travel to São Paulo, we would highly recommend the free tour of Vila Madalena, which also highlights amazing street art. We loved this tour as well, and it's completely free!

Unique . We went on the afternoon tour of San Telmo and La Boca. Our guide told us from the outset that the tour covers parts of town that you would not be able to see as a tourist wandering alone. It was actually really nice to see this part of town as part of a guided tour. We felt quite safe as not only did our guide Ana seem to know the locals and seem on good terms with everyone, there was also another guide who would 'shepherd' us. This actually ended up being a good rainy day tour in the end as we were driven in a minibus for most of it. Ana was very knowledgeable about the area, the art, the city etc which was great. There's also a follow up email with the street artists covered and other interesting parts of town to visit.

Excellent tour with Benjamin!. Lots of beautiful art and plenty of interesting background info. The "North Side" Tour I took with Benjamin was fantastic and reasonably priced. Added plus: they drive you to locations to save time, which was very handy and appreciated. Highly recommend!

South City Tour. My wife and I took the South City Tour on our first full day in Buenos Aires, and we are so glad we did. Ana was an excellent tour guide, and provided in-depth historical background on Argentina and the roots of street art in Buenos Aires. Her storytelling was wonderful, and you could really tell she cared about the subject, including a very specific piece of street art that was my favorite. The tour itself was well organized logistically, and the content gave us a really good context for seeing the rest of the city provided (including some great recommendations for bars, milongas, and restaurants). I would highly recommend this tour, especially when Ana is leading it.

Fabulous, informative tour. Our guide Ana was so enthusiastic, sharing so many interesting facts about the street art and its context. Also a great way to see different areas of the city that wouldn't normally be visited by a tourist.

Unmissable!. This has been the highlight of my first week in BA!If you like street art (or art in general), you won't regret this tour. Ana gives a great explanation of the story behind the murals and graffiti. We even got to greet live one of the figures painted on a mural! It's also a great opportunity to explore an area (the depths of Barracas) that is not a popular tourist destination

Just awesome!!!. Really great experience!! The guide was awesome, she knew lots of stories about the artists and the paintings. And it`s a nice opportinuty to visit an area of the city that's outside the turistic spots.

Art as beauty and activism in the streets!. A highlight of our 1 week visit , just as important and enjoyable as the MALBA and the teatro Colon. Anna was a terrific guide, giving the right balanc of sociopolitical history, her own porteña history, and individualized to our group. many insights into the artisits and neighborhods. fantistico, disfrutenlo y apoyen este grupo!

Book this tour, excellent guides.. I really enjoyed this graffiti art tour of BA. The tour guide was great, she gave such a good history of Graffiti art and how it fits into BAs recent political & social history. It was a great way to explore the neighbourhood of Palermo.
Enjoyed. Interesting tour on a lovely BA late-Autumn afternoon! Good tour guide and knowledge of area. Would recommend.

Art and history in one!. The tour was great - there is a story behind every piece of graffiti, and it is amazing how talented all of the graffiti artists are. Graffiti is also an important part of Argentinian culture, so this tour is important to understand it. I also learned a significant amount about Argentinian history through hearing about the graffiti. It's a unique way to experience art and history!

Excellent tours - highly recommended . I have done both the north and south city tours and they were both excellent. The tour guides were very knowledgeable not only about street art but about the historical context and background to the street art. I would definitely recommend these tours for anyone with even a passing interest in street art as you get to see great parts of the city (especially areas of La Boca and Barracas where you wouldn't go on your own as a tourist).

The History of Argentina Told Through Street Art. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour! Would recommend visiting history museums in Buenos Aires before taking the tour - that way you'll have lots of background knowledge about the significance of the art. Loved the combination of art and history - makes it seem like all of BA is just a huge museum telling the history of Argentina through the eyes of people on the street.

Graffitimundo is a unique and wonderful way to experience BA culture. Street art in Buenas Aires ranges from a father's expression of love for his daughter through tagging (Cata, Te Amo, Papa) to a wall painted by well-known artists like Nerf. We were guided through the neighborhoods by Miriam and Benjamin in a relaxed pace so that we could really absorb the environment. Even though it was a rainy day, we were able see amazing works of art by both walking around and hopping on and off of a microbus. I strongly recommend you add this to your visit to BA, even if you're only there a few days!

OMG Bloody Fantastic . Absolutely loved this tour. One of the highlights of my trip. Included were the visits to the only two street art galleries - Galeria Union and Hollywood in Cambodia. The latter was the last stop and what a high! Highly likely to revisit before leaving B.A.

Art and history in one tour!. I loved this experience. The south city tour takes you to parts of BA you might not see otherwise. You learn about Argentine history, social justice movements and art. Ana is an awesome guide- energetic, extremely knowledgeable and passionate. Definitely worth the time and money spent.

I expected something else.. You have to have some interest in art to fully enjoy this tour. My expectation was to learn about political history of Buenos Aries from the murals . Many of wall paintings in BA have a political meaning. Our tour guide talked very little about the aspects what I was awaiting for . So the tour was somewhat a failure for me, because the stuff she talked was not very interesting. Also they claim to be a non-profit organization but they gladly price the tour for 350 pesos per person . I paid 700 for two ... and I think it was not worth it.

Beautiful overview of the Graffiti scene infused with history and culture. Check it out.. Very happy I got to see this. The tour was a bit pricey, but worth it. Our guide was fantastic, and we got to experience a good overview of what Buenos Aires Graffiti is all about. Very unique styles here, and for an art lover and someone who appreciates the history and culture of new places - this is worthwhile of your time. Also got to see a gallery and the Post St. Bar - all in all a great day!

A MUST DO in Argentina!. Travelling solo in Argentina and I came across this tour on Trip Advisor. I chose the North City Tour. It exceeded my expectations!! We had a funny knowledgable tour leader who had a fantastic personality and was very relatable! She was very helpful and could answer any questions we may have had. There were people from many countries and of all ages! Do yourself a favour, book this tour, and enjoy learning about the history of Argentinan street art in an interactive and fun tour!

Interesting and informative tour!. We went on the graffiti tour in San Telmo and La Boca. The tour was part walking tour and part bus tour, which meant that we got to explore quite a bit of territory without being too tired (or cold). We saw some amazing art and learned a lot about Argentinean culture/history and the different ways in which graffiti/murals are used (government propaganda, reclaiming public space, making a statement, etc.). My husband and I came straight from the airport after a red eye to make the tour, and we thoroughly enjoyed it despite being completely exhausted. If we had more time in Buenos Aires, we would definitely have gone on the tour in Palermo. I recommend this tour!

MUST DO - Incredible amount of history & Art. We did a 15 person tour with our crazy impressive, very knowledgable tour guide, Sorcha! She knew not only about the art but the Artists themselves and it felt like we got the true stories as if they were there with us the whole time.This tour is great for history and art buffs alike.

Jaw-dropping art and excellent context to the city's culture. I was recommended by many different people to take the Graffitimundo tour while preparing for my trip to Buenos Aires. I am very glad that I took the time to go. I took the South City tour while introduced me to several barrios that I don't think I would have visited otherwise (Barracas for example). Our guide was a local portena who studied journalism in college. She provided so much history and context to the beautiful art we were seeing. I think not only was the tour a great use of time but it also informed several other parts of my sightseeing around BA.

An interesting view of Argentina. I have lived in Buenos Aires and travel there regularly but this tour tour gave me another dimension to my understanding of Argentina, its people, its politics and of Buenos Aires. I always look at street art and graffiti when I travel, but this opened up my eyes to the art form of street art, as opposed to graffiti. Anna, our guide, placed the tour in a great historical context. Our children enjoyed it too. There wasn't too much walking between places, some of it is done on a bus. We did the Southern Tour, and next time we go back we will do the Northern Tour around Palermo. I had never been to Barracas, one of the neighbourhoods in the tour and it was very interesting to see another side to touristy Buenos Aires. We had trouble booking online, but when I called the group they were very friendly/helpful and our guide Anna, was warm and enthusiastic. Maybe get to the tour meeting point early at La Boca and visit the new art museum beforehand (but check opening days) which is just where the group meets.

Eye-Opening Cultural Experience. We took the North City Walking Tour, which is partially walking and partially by mini bus (with stopping points). Our tour guide was very knowledgable and we learned a lot about the history and culture of the Argentine people from this tour. We had pre-conceptions of the people of BA and were pleasantly surprised to find that we truly knew nothing about this beautiful culture and its people. There is a cultural and artistic richness to this city beyond our imagination and we have come back to our homeland and told everyone who will listen all about it! In fact, I was SO excited to learn that our local city is hosting international street artists for a mural project around the city through the months of April and May. I cannot wait to get out and support the local artists as they beautify walls in various locations around town. This tour was a highlight of our trip, and we got to meet some interesting people too!

super cool. super cool tour, get to learn some history through the eyes of the artists. just the perfect duration and it was also cool to visit the art galleries and have the opportunity to buy some art.

Definitely recommend!. We did the South tour and were a bit nervous beforehand about heading to La Boca, but we didn't need to be. The tour was excellent and our guide, Anna, was really knowledgeable. We learnt so much and saw a side to Buenos Aires we would never have had an opportunity to see otherwise. I would definitely recommend doing this tour.

LOVED THIS!. I left with a strong appreciation for the art, I wish I had enough time to do their classes, our guide was passionate, the tour built on the recent history of BA and gave me a stronger understanding of the people of BA. Highly recommend to all!

For art lovers, & those interested in contemporary history of Argentina. Great way to understand the art world, politics, & socio-economic contemporary situation in Argentina! Ana was a good guide, explaining many aspects of the street art in different areas of Buenos Aires, including Palermo. We walked and took a bus, so it could be possible for more senior visitors/ children to take this tour to see the colorful murals in Buenos Aires.

Amazing tour!. Graffitimundo is an amazing tour. Our guide Ana was very knowledgable. I expected to get a tour of the city and see the street art but she also gave the history of the economics and politics of the area that led to the street art. Overall one of the best tours I've been on.

Great way to start a vacation in BA. We participated in the walking tour of Colegiales and Palermo about 4 hours after our flight from the U.S. landed in Buenos Aires, and the tour was the perfect way to get acquainted with the city! There is a significant amount of graffiti and street art in BA, which can be intimidating for folks from a typical U.S. suburb, but taking the tour with GraffitiMundo quickly alleviated any fears we had concerning the graffiti in BA. Our tour guide, Anna, provided a comprehensive overview of the artistic techniques and social history surrounding the graffiti. Without taking this tour, we would have been skeptical of the graffiti in BA, whereas after the tour we appreciated the artistic qualities and social messages embedded within the graffiti throughout the city. The art gallery/bar at the end of the tour was also an amazing place to process all of the information we gathered on the tour over a cold beer.

Spectacular . Awesome tour, Anna our guide was fantastic! I didn't realise there was so much more to street art than meets the eye! If I was here longer I will do some of there other tours! Thanks Anna, it was so informative and fun xo

The best tour of BA. Having lived in Buenos Aires for the past year, I can vouch that Graffitimundo's two tours of the city will give you a better glimpse into the minds of "portenos" than any other. With one group of friends, I joined Miriam for the tour of Palermo which was fantastic, and more recently I took a different set of friends to Ana's tour of La Boca. I can not recommend these two tours enough. Not only do you get to see some of the worlds premier street art, but you also learn a large amount about the artists as well as the history of Buenos Aires. Don't miss these two great opportunities!

Find out what the people of Buenos Aires really think of their city!. Took the tour of the south city today with my ten year old daughter and we had a fantastic time. The guide Ana was extremely knowledgable, passionate and eloquent. She took us expertly from the roots of modern day street art in La Boca, through the murals inspired by political and social unrest during the 70's and 80's in Barracas, right up to the current day in San Telmo. We learnt so much about the rich and challenging history of this amazing city. I would recommend this tour as a great alternative view for anyone interested in art, history or politics.

Fantastic!. This tour is a must for visitors to Buenos Aires. The guides really know their subject and the tour is informative giving a great summary of the history of street art in Buenos Aires, the contemporary scene, artists etc. Includes visits to galleries. Run by a non-profit so all proceeds go back into the organisations wider activities to support street art in Buenos Aires. Highly recommended.

Best Tour in Buenos Aires. I saved this tour toward end of my trip while staying in Palermo. This tour is for the people who want truly understand Argentinian culture and history through artwork. Our guide (Myriamme) was very knowledgeable and passionate about her work. Its combined with walking and mini bus so its not too phydically challenging. But please bring warm jacket as its getting bit nippy this time of the year here in Buenos Aires.한국분들 혹시 Buenos Aires에 오시면 꼭 이 tour를 권장해드리고 싶습니다. 다만 Tour가 영어로 진행이 됩니다. 아티스트중에 한국계인 NERF 도 있습니다. 즐거운 여행이 되시길...

Great tour of Buenos Aires Graffiti. Miriam was a great tour guide. It was very interesting to hear all that she had to say, not only about the artists but about the history of street art in Buenos Aires. I highly recommend it!

Great tour!. A different kind of city tour! It's very interesting, they also tell you about the historical background of the city and how street art is connected. Street art is a part of the history of Buenos Aires so this tour is definitely worth it and you walk through the city with different eyes afterwards.

Off the beaten track. Whenever we visit different cities around the world, we usually call in on the major art galleries and museums. This was our first time on a tour of graffiti and street art. It was a real eye opener. Our guides and driver took us, partly on foot and partly in an air conditioned mini bus, to parts of Buenos Aires that we would never have discovered on our own. The paintings were beautiful and often magnificent. The stories behind them were fascinating, and gave us a whole new insight into the political and social history of this amazing city. Our tour guide Anna was wonderful - incredibly knowledgable, passionate about the art, and able to put it all across with warmth and personality. A thoroughly enjoyable and educational tour which I would recommend most highly.

Amazing Tour. This tour was the best tour we went on in South America and that is all thanks to our Tour Guide Anna who is sooooo knowledgeable, passionate and friendly. It was such an interesting tour and so different from any other tour I've done before. Well worth it!

Graffitimundo tour. What a fantastic experience, probably my favorite in a week in Buenos Aires! Miriam, our guide, was very well-informed and interesting, explaining about the political and social relevance of the street art, pointing out the particularities of different artists' techniques, and giving us a detailed description of how street art works in Buenos Aires. The 3-hour tour was a combination of walking and riding in a mini-bus to several different galleries, where we could use the bathroom and fill our water bottles. I highly recommend this tour for anyone who wants to learn an enormous amount about the relatively recent history of Argentina in a short time, while enjoying the back story of many examples of fantastic street art. It's so worth it!

Great way to understand Argentinian street art. Miriam was a great guide - very knowledgeable and passionate about the street art. And, wow, what art! It is amazing to look at and even better when you understand the story. Don't bother going to the fine arts museum, take this tour and see better art!

A unique and important way to learn about BA history and art. Ana, the guide, was very knowledgeable and shared a wide array of information from the history of street art in BA to the history of Argentina and its reflection in the murals as well as a conversation about the different styles of mural and street art in BA.
