I learned a lot about the history of BA, the development of street art in BA, and the different Argentinean (and Chilean and other) muralists who have contributed to the BA street art movement. I think the tours are a must-do! Note: When I heard the tour was three hours, I assumed we were walking for three hours, but they have a bus to help take you from point to point and they have breaks to get water and use the restroom.

Well worth the reasonable fee!. An enjoyable three hour tour, part walking, part minibus, viewing the art on the walls of BA. Our guide gave interesting information about the public art, but could have included more biography and details about the artists themselves. Since graffitimundo is in a number of cities, a comparison of the work in BA to the type of street art seen elsewhere would have been an interesting added touch.Definitely recommend for insight into artistic expression in a beautiful city.

Fun and informative tour. Very well run and interesting tour. The art was fantastic and our guide was knowledgeable about the art and the artists. It's the perfect amount of time with a mix of walking and mini-bus. The tour doesn't cover a great distance but the mini-bus was helpful in getting the group from site to site quickly and efficiently. I would definitely recommend this tour if you're interested in art and the culture of BA.
Excellent . We learned so much from our guide about public art, politics and culture. Extremely worthwhile. And the air conditioned bus was a nice bonus on a hot afternoon. Book ahead!

Fascinating, informative, a MUST DO. There are several graffiti tours in BA now but I belive this is the original. I did the North BA tour and found the whole thing fascinating and really informative. Our guide was a lady (so sorry can't rember her name!) who really seemed to know her stuff.She gave us a brief history of how Graffitimundo started (by two girls ) then took us on a tour (some of it in an air-con minibus, well needed as it was a scorcher that day!) of some of the most poignant, best, influential ans political graffiti around the suburban areas. It covered everything from top artists graffiti who'd been commissioned to the scribblings of licals and what they might mean. She also explained how differently graffiti is viewed here, ie. not a crime that has to be done wearing a hoodie in the dead of night, its accepted as an art form and a way to communicate/express or to just want to inject some colour and fun into lives during darker times. It really was enlightening, I learnt much and now notice graffiti everywhere in the city. Do it!

A must do in Buenos Aires. This is an excellent way to see parts of the city that you would not normally go to. We learnt so much about the history of the city, and the art was amazing. The stories behind each piece were fascinating. Ana was a brilliant guide, engaging, knowledgeable, and with excellent English. She was passionate about what she was showing us and it really showed.

South City Tour with Graffitimundo. Went on a great street art/graffiti tour through La Boca and Barracas with our terrific guide, Ana. Enjoyed touring through some parts of BA we hadn't spent a lot of time in. Ana gave us lots of information on the art, the artists, the background of the pieces, and in some cases what inspired the artists in making the pieces. Highly recommend this tour if you have any interest in street art. We'll definitely do the North City Tour on our next visit.

Don't Miss! Amazing tour of street art by Anna. I've been on many tours of architecture and street art in my life. This one was extremely educational and entertaining. Anna was an excellent guide. Not only did we see some amazing art and graffitti, we learned much about the history of Buenos Aires, the importance of LaBocca, Quinquela Martin and much much more. First class coach ride for alot of it but you can get out to take pics. Don't miss this tour!

Great way to learn about Graffiti and see the city. . Having read other reviews on this tour my wife and I decided to give it a go. We were pleasantly surprised. We learnt heaps about street art, saw some very cool paintings and Graffiti and spent a pleasant 3 hours in a new part of BA. Anna our guide was great, answered our questions and enthusiastically explained what we were seeing in the tour. Using a mini van meant we got to see allot more than just walking and the brief trip through the Flea market was an added bonus.

Take this tour!. If you're into street art, definitely take this tour. Miriam was a great guide. She brings the tags, graffiti, "bombs" & murals to life. There's a story behind the art & she tells it well. Did the northern tour this time...looking forward to the southern tour when I return to Buenos Aires in a week.

A must do!. I did the the "north" tour with Anna and I would definitely recommend this to anyone! Anna is an incredible (the best!) tour guide and I learned so much. The tour is really scaled for people with all levels of knowledge in both street art and Argentinian history. I highly recommend this for anyone looking to have a more nuanced understanding of how art/culture/politics are intertwined here in Argentina.

great walk, views and info. We did the south & north walks - both quite different bUT very interesting & informative - not just about the graffiti art but also about its historical & social context. Also learned a lot about Arg history.

excellent trip around some of the lesser seen parts of buenos aires. Had a great time learning about and seeing some of the street art in Buenos Aires. A mix of walking and bus trip to see a selection of the best street art. Good - the guide, the art, getting to different areas of BABad - couldn't get out of the bus at a few of the pieces, a bit rushed at times

Best tour ever. This was the best organized tour I've ever taken part in, anywhere in the world. Anna was an incredible tour guide.I had no idea how deep the history of street art went in BA, and this tour filled in all the background context to help understand what you're seeing as you walk around the city. It felt like we were getting the inside scoop rather than a superficial look.One of my favorite parts was a stop at a seemingly uninteresting wall covered in graffiti tags and stencil art. Anna explained some of the stories behind what was going on on the wall, and all of a sudden I started seeing things in graffiti that I had never noticed before.

Grafifiti tour.... much much more than street art. The graffiti tour in Palermo was terrific. I will walk down the streets of Buenos Aires with new eyes. Mariana's warm, smart talk guided us through the history of street art -- the social, historical and political -- through the stories of artists and communities. Fun and engaging. I'm already planning to go again. Many thanks. One of the best things to do to get to know Buenos Aires.

Graffiti Mundo Tour. One of our very best experiences in Argentina! Go on this tour to learn how the culture, politics, and history of Argentina come to life as street art. It was also really fun, and I felt a truly authentic experience. Our guide Anna was friendly, made us all feel comfortable and was able to teach us about street art and the history of Buenos Aires in a truly meaningful way. She was amazing! Totally worth the money, go and enjoy your day away from the tourist trail!

Graffiti tour in palermo. Was very good. Didn't know anything about graffiti or street art before we did this tour. Was very interesting and great to go to an area we might haven't considered visiting. Our guide Myriamme was really nice.

Expecting a Grafitti tour but much more.. Anna and her helpers were terrific. I expected a " graffiti" tour but this is much more. I was expecting more of what I had seen in Boca but this went way beyond. Beautiful street art. Murals and areas I never would have seen on my own. I learned much about the culture and political background of these murals which truly enriched my enjoyment.I highly recommend this.

Fantastic and interesting journey around Buenos Aires!. The graffiti tour is an important way to understand the city, history, and culture. We did the north tour, which was fantastic and we explored some areas that we may not have ventured. The city's street art is a unique experience and one that should not be missed during a visit to BA. Being a non-profit, it's really important to support such efforts and it was great to have an opportunity to purchase some art and understand graffiti mundo's mission and activities to support the art and artists.

Great tour! Interesting and fun!. A couple of friends and I took this tour the other day just to try something different. We are so glad we did! Great guide, (Myriamme) and a fun group. Tour was fast paced enough to keep it interesting, but not rushed. Very informative and a great way to explore a different neighborhood. I highly recommended it to anyone!

Understanding more about the pulse of the city. I was extremely happy with the tour..! 10/10. Money well spent towards a great cause, non profit group that supports street art.The host was well spoken and great understand of the background of the political street culture. I feel now a have deeper heart connect to this beautiful city. Thanks and keep great work. ✨

History and politics through street art. My boyfriend and I are usually not very keen on guided tours but since I like street art a lot and wanted to get to know the context of the street art pieces that one can encounter at every corner of Buenos Aires we booked the south tour. Our guide Ana did a fantastic job and served as facts around the street art pieces in La Boca and Barracas that she took us too as well as personal stories on the recent and current political developments. The places we went to are marked as unsafe for tourists by the lonely planet which made it even more interesting and exciting to be able to see them. Ana is a very open and easy-going person. She encouraged us to ask any question even if they tangiated her personal life and didn't hesitate to elaborate on the Mystics of Porteños. So, if you want to learn bout street art, history, politics and the way of life in Buenos Aires, this is the perfect way. If we had been in Buenos Aires on a Sunday we certainly had booked the bicycle tour though.

Interesting and knowledgable tour guide. This tour gave us a much better understanding of the recent history of BA and we got some great snaps of the street art. Ana was fantastic - you need to do this tour.

Great Historical Tour. My wife and I went on this tour three weeks ago before going to Ushuaia. I should have written this then. It was a fantastic tour. We had a young lady named 'Circa' (spell/pronounce??) and Henrick. Circa took us all over the north western area. We saw a lot and learned a great deal. She provided us with so much insight to the graffiti scene and how it developed. On other tours we went on, we saw things that she brought to our attention about the artists who generate this form. Riding the bikes was fun and exhilarating. The tour showed a different side to BA that we might not have seen or experienced.

South city tour: super cool. My boyfriend and I went on te south city street art tour. It was very cool and interesting. We don't usually like group tours but this one is cool since street art brings together open minded and relaxed people from all over the world. The walking part is nice and safe with a mini bus driver and a security guy who's there just in case. Although honestly we didnt feel like we needed his presence at any time! The tour guide (Anna?) was fun and spike just enough without getting boring. We saw some really cool art work that we would have never seen without the tour. I definitly recommand and most likely do the north city tour when I have time.

My first graffiti tour - Buenos Aires is a great city for street art. The Graffitimundo street art tour was my very first...and I was so delighted and inspired by what I saw that I now seek out interesting graffiti tours in every city that I visit.Buenos Aires is a great city for creative, colorful and beautiful street art. And along the way, Graffitimundo not only presents the works themselves, but also the story and history behind street art in Argentina. Highly recommended.

A different perspective of Buenos Aires!. I did the North City tour last weekend and really enjoyed it. You see some beautiful artwork and the guide was really knowledgable about the artists and the stories behind their work. I will be trying to fit in the North City or Bike tour on my next visit.

Highly recommended tour!. My husband and I did the North Tour at the end of December and had a fantastic time - it was the highlight of our whole trip to Buenos Aires! Anna was our guide and she was so friendly and knowledgeable - she provided us with a good summary of the important milestones in the Argentinian / Buenos Aires history, which helped us to understand a lot of the street art that we saw. We would both highly recommend doing this tour - we had such a great time!

Very interesting and enjoyable. Went on the North tour, looking forward to going on the South tour. Tour well thought out, with easy walking, mixed with being shuttled around by bus. Enjoyed visiting the two galleries. Guides passionate about graffiti, and were able to explain how graffiti fit into the the context of contemporary art, and why the BsAs graffiti scene was so unique. Would have liked to see more graffiti by women. Definitely recommend! A great organization, and a very lovely and unique way to get to know the city a little!

One of the best things you'll do in Buenos Aires. I enjoyed our tour with Graffitimundo yesterday so much. It was one of the most interesting and informative things we've done here in Buenos Aires, not just for the gorgeous street art we saw in La Boca and San Telmo but for the political context, personal stories and fantastic personality of our guide Ana. The small size of the group (about 10 people I think) made it intimate and wholly engaging. Highly recommended.

Great fun!. I did the north of the city tour and with a little bit more time, I would have definitely booked the south tour too. The tour is a lot of fun, very well organized, with really friendly guides and you get to learn a lot about the different graffitis and the artists' intention behind the murals. The only negative I can say, is that our guide was lacking a little bit of enthusiasm in the beginning, but luckily it became much better during the tour. Overall I recommend it highly!

Fabulous Tour. Fab tour visiting some slightly off the beaten track areas. Anna our guide was excellent and very knowledgeable. The stories behind the street art and graffiti are interesting and being reminded about the recent history of Argentina was good.Definitely one of the best things that I have done that in my second visit to Buenas Ari s

Really interesting tour!!!. That was a really nice tour through the most characteristic road of buenos aires...we saw a lot of graffiti made by most famous street artists and their history...Ana, our guide, was great! I suggest this tour to all people that have some time to spend in this beautiful city.

One of the best parts of our trip. My wife and I came to Buenos Aires for our honeymoon and went on both the North and South tours. Anna was our guide on both tours and did a wonderful job of rapidly immersing us in the street art culture of Argentina and what it means/meant to the Argentinian people. What a wonderful experience and I would recommend it to anyone (that's capable of walking a few miles on city streets). Thank you Anna!!!!!!!!!

If you do one tour in BA, make it this one!. Our guide Anna was the most passionate and insightful guide I've ever met. Not only did we experience the art, we also learnt about the history behind each piece, the individual artist's background and what driving forces were happening in the city and country when each piece was being created. We were fortunate enough to also speak to an artist who was creating a new mural. 10/10.

Wonderful experience!. My wife and I took both the North and South tours with the smart, single, and beautiful Anna. While the tours overlap on the basics, the "artwork" and the locations are varied enough to warrant taking both, if you have the time. But the tours are not just about graffiti and street art. We learned so much about the real culture and politics of Buenos Aires and about the people of the city and Argentina.

Alternative way to see a different side of Buenos Aires. I've been wanting to do this tour for 2 years and so glad I finally did it. Although I was aware of the neighborhoods the brought us to (South tour in La Boca and Barracas), I had never explored them so thoroughly and I learnt lots from our amazing tour guide Ana. It's really interesting to see how street art is a reaction to what is happening at a social level in Argentina and there was lots of historical and political information given along the tour. Highly recommended.
Excellent. This was so interesting! I learned so much from this tour! Definitely recommended. Be sure to come early though cause my tour was crowded.

Thank you for making me a street art expert. I can't say enough good things about this tour. It was a highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. The guide's articulate narrative wove in the many threads that make BA and its physical appearance what it is - the political, social and economic meaning and thrust behind its ubiquitous street art. The bus was comfortable and we felt safe everyplace we went, even though we were notified to be aware of our surroundings. It felt like a history lesson and an art lecture with the many incredible images explained for the layperson. Very much worth the three hours.

Great way to see different neighborhoods. I have lived in BA for a few years, and doing this tour showed me parts of the city that I have never been to, and taught me so much! Our tour guide, Ana, was wonderful- very passionate, informed and professional. She made sure to give an un-biased historical view of BA and incorporated that history very well into the tour. The art we saw was awesome, and I highly recommend the tour!

A very interesting tour of a less known aspect of Buenos Aires. This tour came recommended by some friends of ours and has been one of the most interesting part of our 2 days in Buenos Aires.There are two tours "North" and "South" (the most popular). Make a reservation in advance, especially if you want to take the South tour.We took the North one but have not been disappointed. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable and passionate about the graffiti history and cultural movement in the city and the 3 hours of tour have been very engaging.The art is fascinating and while very variable in quality it conveys a very authentic feeling about the passions of the people in Buenos Aires during difficult years of their recent history.Most definitely worth the price. An experience I most definitely recommend.

Don't miss this tour!!. Our tour guide, Anna, was wonderful. You could really tell she has a passion for the street art and for educating people about it's place and impact on Buenos Aires. If you are coming to BA, don't miss this tour. It's not about just looking at street art, it's about learning about this vibrant city, it's history and struggles, and why the art is important culturally. Of course, the art art is amazing too. We took the North City Tour and when we come back, we plan on taking the other tours as well. Anna, can we request you as our guide? :-) Many thanks.

South City Graffiti Tour - Highly Recommended!. This is an excellent tour for seeing street art in the southern part of Buenos Aires, mostly in the working class/industrial neighborhoods of La Boca and Barracas. Both of these neighborhoods are generally considered unsafe to walk around as a lone tourist. This tour presents the opportunity to see amazing work you wouldn't ordinarily see, to see the depths of these neighborhoods, to learn about the history of street art in these areas, as well as the history of street art in Argentina as it relates to the politics of the country. I found it highly informative and interesting in so many ways. Highly recommended.

Interesting view of the city!. We took the north city tour in Buenos Aires. We visited parts of the city we would not have seen otherwise. The street art was fascinating, and our guide did a great job giving the historical, political and cultural background behind the art. We both rode a bus and walked through neighborhoods, so we were able to see a lot.

Buenos Airtes Graffiti Tour. My husband and I are both graphic designers and we really enjoyed the North City Tour. It was a very insightful trip into the life of Buenos Aires locals through art. We wish we had time to go on the other tours but they were all booked! Definitely recommend it for anyone that loves art

And you thought Graffiti was visual clutter...Street Art was the Foundation for Graffiti!. I have traveled to more than 60 countries in the world and seen many unusual things. The Graffiti Mundo South City tour thru the La Boca and Barracas neighborhoods was a fascinating look at history, street art and graffiti. Anna was a superb guide who not only provided historical and current events insights, but blended history with art. Street art in Buenos Aires has also become a form of political expressions. Business owners and neighbors have embraced street art as a visual way to connect the neighborhoods. It was exciting to see another side of Buenos Aires that is not readily available to the tourist. Go, I highly recommend this tour!
Great alternative city tour (recommended by a local). A piece of Buenos Aires and Argentina history told by graffitis. Also, good to learn about our culture and idiosyncrasy.

Unique Tour That You Should Not Miss!. I particularly like taking tours when I am in a foreign city that our a bit unique to that city. This tour exploring the street art of Buenos Aires fits that description and was a real treat. There are not that many cities in the world that allow (or at least tolerate) street art and to learn about the history and culture of street art in Buenos Aires was fascinating (particularly its use by the average citizen as a form of political expression and protest). Anne was our tour guide and was an eloquent speaker and her passion and knowledge made this for an exceptional experience. It last for 3 hours and the first 30 minutes or so is filled with a lot of facts and background information that may seem like too much at first but as the tour continues you realize that all that background information made the tour that much more meaningful and enjoyable. I was surprised by how much street art we got to see (a bus is provided to take you around to different locations). This was the last tour I took in Buenos Aires before heading to the airport and I was so glad that I did not miss it. Everything about the tour is so well tone and thought out. Four star to Anne for making it such an enjoyable event.

Interesting tour allows access and better understanding of La Boca. This tour is nice balance between sitting in an AC minibus and walking along a block or two to see some incredible murals, and other street art with an interesting commentary from the knowledgeable and passionate guide, Ana, explaining a bit of history to understand the murals, artists and the development and usage of street art. The South tour (only on Monday) is highly recommended as a way to see areas no tourist would frequent on their own. The maximum of 17 people allows access to the guide. I wish they would have a system of shared tips for the driver and bodyguard (perhaps a jar at the front of the bus as we disembark) because it was a bit awkward to give 3 separate tips.
Great tour. Me and my family did a tour with Ana. It was great! We learned so much....she was very knowledgable and we enjoyed it throughly. Highly recommend. We did the north city tour.

Great perspective & history of BA. Went on the tour my first day in BA and loved learning about the history and culture of the city through the lens of street art and graffiti. BA can be a bit overwhelming to experience as a tourist, because you don't know where to begin, but this is a great starting point! I like the morning north city tour with Ana, and then you can use the afternoon to explore Palermo.

graffitimundo - cheers. The graffitimundo tour was excellent. It was a very different perspective non Street Art but also on the cultural and social changes in BA. graffitimundo and bikes BA do a great job hosting this tour. Tio and Marina were great. It was great to have Biking BA escort the tour.

Interesting perspective of the city. We totally enjoyed our street art tour. I've always been attracted to the artistic expression of the street artists in cities i've visited around the world - and this tour allowed me to understand what and how the artists are trying to say with their work. The political and social history of BA is very much seen in the work that we visited. The tour gave us a special insight into the city and the country. Very highly recommended.

Fantastic street art tour. Ana is a wonderful guide -- warm and funny and very knowledgeable. She explained the artworks in the context of argentina's political and economic history. The tour took us to neighborhoods we never would have seen otherwise!

Excellent way to see beautiful street art. I did the South tour in BA with a couple of friends and we thought it was fantastic! Anna was a very enthusiastic, passionate and knowledgeable guide. I would highly recommend this tour as it's a great way to see the hidden gems of BA. The art is spectacular!

Art on teh street. Wonderful little tour and we got to meet and talk to a local street artist while working on an elaborate piece. Part walking and part being shuttled around in a mini-bus. I would have much preferred more walking and a little bit of local community history and not only street art.
Great!. Super informative and intrestings stories about graffitis in Buenos Aires. Ten points for the guide Erica who made the tour fun and good !

fantastic. Extremely dynamic tour leader. Her enthusiasm makes you want to learn all you can about street art. Got to see parts of ba (cultural and physical)we would have missed. The bus allows to cover a wider area. Highly recommended.

South City Grafitti Art Tour with Anna. First of all, what an amazing tour guide. Anna knew it all and explained clearly everything about the artists. The tour is professional and well organized. And I learned so much about the history behind the movement. Take this tour!!!!! And Anna, you are wonderful!

Excellent street art tour. I'd definitely recommend doing this tour if you have a spare afternoon and an interest in street art. Although the tour started a little slowly with a lot of information and introductions at the start, we saw some impressive pieces and Anna provided lots of interesting context in terms of the artists and the themes of the work. A professional but relaxed and enjoyable tour!
So worth the time. Understand the history and stories behind this amazing street art. The tour takes about 3 hours, is well organized and builds to some amazing art and photo ops.

Off the Beaten Path - The Best $25 I Spent in BA. I did the south tour because I was told that we would see things that are typically unsafe for tourists to see alone, and also some pieces that are very difficult to get to. This tour delivered. Ana did a great job explaining the art, but more interestingly she gave a person history about her life in BA. I highly recommend this.

Excellent and brilliantly run tours, great perspective of the city. We went on both the north city bike tour and the south city tour. Both were excellent. Bike tour around Palermo and The north with BA biking tours was great, really informative and we saw some amazing murals. Our Irish guide (whose name I've totally forgotten - sorry) was fab as was Henric who guided our bikes safely around the streets. Our walking tour today from La Boca was also great, Ana was a fantastic guide and we saw a very different part of the city with again beautiful and fascinating street art. Highly recommend both tours!

Awesome Street Art & History!. The tour was well organized and a great mix of history and art sightings. Learned a lot and really enjoyed the context that was provided behind the artists and culturally. There was a good mix of walking and being in the bus in order to maximum time and worthwhile street art. The stop at the gallery was a great way to see lots of artists and purchase the art. The final stop at the co-op art owned bar was a great stop too.

cool street art tour. great tour by a fabulous lady called Ana, who really gave a sense of the emergence of street art in BA and Argentina. as a journalist, she really painted the scene of the political and social issues of recent years and made the images on the wall come alive. she handled a difficult customer brilliantly and had a really dynamic style, incorporating her personality into the tour brilliantly. our only critique was that the gallery tours were a little rushed and disorganised (we wanted to buy some images, but the last gallery was manned/didn't have prices etc) so that could be improved.

Ana rocks & so does this tour. I'll make this quick - all the other reviewers were spot on, this is a great tour! I did the north side one with Ana who was an absolute joy to tag along with. There were more people than I expected (about 16) but it didn't feel at all crowded - everyone had plenty of chances to view art, take pics and hear Ana speak. So much history and info was covered and the spots chosen were all interesting & unique. It was pouring rain the day I went but it didn't matter - we had a great time anyways. Loved both galleries and found a few new favourite artists too. If you do this, be generous with your tips as it's extremely good value and proceeds support graffitimundo which is not for profit. A+++!!!

Art and social history. Obviously if you are interested in street art then this is a tour for you. Even if you are not, it's a fascinating social history tour too, so really should not be missed. It's mainly a walking tour so water, sunscreen and comfortable shoes are a must, although there is a van that drives between some of the locations (we did the north city tour). Our guide Ana was super enthusiastic and knowledgeable about the art and the artists as well as the social and political relevance of different forms of graffiti/street art in the public space. Very interesting and enjoyable. Ends in a cool bar, too!

North City Tour - great experience with Ana. It was great 3 hour tour of the streets and neighbourhoods of BA through the eyes of the street artists and graffitist's of the city. Anna, our excellent host for the 3 hours took time to explain the politicial and socio economic context against which street art in this part of the world has flourished. Her English is fantastic, she picks out her favourite pieces from a number of spots across the city and we also visited a couple of galleries famed for their role in the scene. The tour was taken by foot and a mini-bus.A must point in BA tour.

Excellent Tour With Ana. Today we went on the graffiti tour of La Boca with Ana. I don't have much to add that hasn't already been said. Generally I find that if 99 out of 100 people say that something is excellent, then it must be true. I've found this to be true with respect to reviews via Trip Advisor. We are traveling with our 6 month old daughter and we had some concern whether or not the tour would be able to us as we would need to occupy a spot on the bus for her car seat. Ana made us feel more than totally welcome. All that being said, the tour involved getting on and off the bus. Every time we re-boarded the bus, we would have to strap in our daughter. At one point, she fell asleep in her seat. When that happened we weren't about to wake her up when the bus stopped and everyone de-boarded. As a result, my wife had to miss a segment as she stayed with our daughter on the bus. I mention this for those that are traveling with an infant, so that they can keep this aspect in mind.Also, I thought I should mention that we took a taxi from Palermo Soho to the meeting point in La Boca. The taxi ride took almost a half hour and cost 150 pesos, so keep that in mind when budgeting one's time and money.

Passionate History of the BA Public Art Movement. A fantastic 3 hour tour of the streets and neighbourhoods of Buenos Aires through the eyes of the street artists and graffitist's of the city.Anna our excellent host for the 3 hours took time to explain the politicial and socio economic context against which street art in this part of the world has flourished. IT's always useful to get this sort of context from a local and as a journalist and street art aficionado Anna made her point very well.Her English is fantastic, she picks out her favourite pieces from a number of spots across the city and you attend a couple of galleries famed for their role in the scene. Theres even a chance to purchase some art by the artists you've been seeing which lots of the tour did.I would recommend this to anyone.

Interesting tour. I took the north city tour just a couple of hours after I arrived in BA. It was an interesting way to be introduced to the city. Ana was my guide. She was very informative and passionate about the history of street art in BA. The tour wasn't your typical see the main tourist highlights tour, but rather a way to get into some of the neighborhoods while seeing some really amazing art that you probably would not have otherwise seen.I found that I paid more attention to the street art I came across during the rest of my visit.This was worth the time and money spent.

Lots of information -- not a lot of pictures. I would not describe this as a bad tour but I guess it depends why you go on tours like this in the first place. My objective was to get lots of pictures. I would say the tour rendered about 10 unique photos. We spent a lot of time talking about Graffitimundo, the artists they work with, and the history of graffiti in Buenos Aires. We also spent a decent amount of time on the mini-bus getting from one place to another. And when we got to each place, there was usually only one street art piece to photograph. I don't think it was the best use of 3 hours. I got more photos walking around on my own.

Best way to see and understand Buenos Aires. What a tour! I've been on a lot of walking tours and this by far is the most interesting, fun and exciting. You understand the historical, political, and social aspects of Buenos Aires through street art ....along with a few tear jerker stories. Street art and graffiti is completely different in B.A than the U.SIt's beautifully led, and after you get to meet a street artist and see a gallery. Not to be missed.

Amazing tour - a must do!. We did the Graffitmundo tour in Palermo and would really recommend it. The tour was so interesting and very current. It included a trip to two galleries where you can purchase art and was overall a great experience. It gave us a greater understanding of Buenos Aires culture and history. Our guide, Anna, was excellent- enthusiastic, passionate and knowledgeable. A must do in BsAs!!

Novice turned expert in street art!. I went on the North City Graffitimundo tour with an Australian friend. We both share a fond appreciation for art and this was the best way to introduce ourselves to a different form we're unfamiliar with. The guide, Ana, was so knowledgeable, comical and relaxed despite some of the wanderers in the group. Most of the stops along the North City tour are on the sidewalks of Colegiales and Palermo so stay alert to traffic. Tons of information about local artists that have transformed the traditional concept of street art and graffiti, learned about the different styles used and how this is a way for everyone to have access to art not just for those who can afford it. My favorite was visiting Hollywood in Cambodia (Palermo) which was a super montage of art all over the walls and terrace. This is a safe haven for active graffiti/street artists to share their work with the public in a trendy bar. Over all it was a great experience well worth the price!

Amazing afternoon. I really wasn't sure what to expect but if you want to hear about the real people's voices through the expression of street art and it is definitely ART! Then do yourself a favour and book this tour in. Ana our guide was absolutely brilliant. Ana was very knowledgeable and went in depth about the stories behind the street art and explaining the types of techniques used. A great way to support local art and expression. Loved it! Thank you Ana!!!

Graffiti & Art. The city of Buenos Aires is full of art , in every sort of form and location. As in all cities, graffiti can be an eyesore, but here they have changed it to an art form which is pretty great ! I recommend it. And even if you don't go on a tour, keep an eye out for the graffiti as you do your sightseeing ..

See Buenos Aires from another perspective. Ana was a knowledgeable and enthusiastic promoter of street art. She explained the context of the work on public display, and persuaded anyone who needed to be convinced that it isn't just vandalism. Having just a week to explore Buenos Aires, I was eager to see as many different aspects of the city as we could and the North City tour was a very interesting angle on things I would have walked by without any understanding otherwise. Thank you, Ana!

An unusual way to see BA. This tour mixes walking and an air conditioned bus to show you aspects of life in BA that you simply do not get on your own. I now understand the evolution of street art, it's links to societal changes in Argentina and how best to view it. Definitely worth the three hours it takes. Anna is a great tour guide.
Simply amazing. It was really amazing and the guide Ana was special! It hai been a beautiful and sunny day and I've been visiting things that I could never visti on my own.I loved it, really

Two Great Tours with Ana and Graffitimundo. Signed up for the Palermo (North City) tour on a recommendation from a friend and spent a sunny afternoon walking around Palermo with a group of about 12 led by Ana who is knowledgeable, informative, and passionate about the street art scene in BA. I enjoyed it so much, I booked the South City Tour (through La Boca and San Telmo) which was even better (graffitimundo offers a 20% discount on a second tour, so definitely do more than one if you have the time!).

Insightful for understanding contemporary Bs As. I live and work in Buenos Aires and took this tour because it had always looked appealing and because I was considering organizing it for a university student group I work with. I learned things about the city and got great ideas for how to connect this with students. Ana was very approachable and interested in interacting with the audience which made for a welcoming environment that spurred conversation. She was very eloquent although I would have preferred more concise explanations and walking between points rather than boarding the van for short drives; perhaps that was because of the light rain, which didn´t impede the tour.

Amazing street art. A really interesting tour about the history of graffiti and street art and an opportunity to see some amazing art in Palermo. Very knowledgable and enthusiastic tour guide. Highly recommended!
Eye-opening experience. A great experience. Highly recommend that you take this tour at the start of your trip to better enjoy the wonderful street art in BA.

Incredible Best Street Art Tour!. This was hands down the best tour I've ever been on. Our guide Ana was so knowledgable and eloquent, it made it everything we saw so culturally relevant. I really felt like I understood the artists and their motivations behind their pieces afterward. It also really highlighted the culture of using public spaces for personal messages that is intrinsic to Buenos Aires. You get to visit two street art galleries that are very good and very different from one another as well. Cannot recommend this tour and Ana enough!

Great guide and info. I really enjoyed this tour! It was fascinating to hear about the political history behind the graffiti movement and the stories about the pieces. Our guide, Ana, was excellent. She was very friendly and informative, I would have loved to have talked to her for another hour or so after! Thanks Graffitimundo team, was awesome to do such a unique activity!

Great tour @ Palermo. I took the Sunday biking graffiti tour and it was just great!Not only the crew is nice but its a very cool way to get to know bsas, Even if you're an experienced visitor to the city. Highly recommended.

Highlight of our trip. I was leading a group of 25 business school students on an orientation trip to BA, and Graffitimundo was recommended by a friend. I could not have been happier with the tour. Graffitimundo was incredibly accommodating, adapting the tour to our needs and adjusting the tour time multiple times. Ana was an incredible tour guide. She was passionate about street art and very knowledgable about its role in public expression. I highly recommend the tour for groups of all types.

Cool experience in Buenos Aires. The South City Tour was awesome. I saw areas of the city that I wouldn't otherwise experience and I learned so much about the history, politics, and street art culture of Buenos Aires. Ana was a great guide; she is clearly very knowledgeable and passionate about street art. It is definitely worth it to spend an afternoon with graffitimundo!

Best part of my trip to BA!. Absolutely loved this tour! Learning the history behind the art and having a chance to see different parts of the city, all while taking in AMAZING art. Cannot recommend this experience enough!

Awesome day!. We really enjoyed our tour with Ana. It was awesome to have a local perspective of the street art- we learned so much about the history of the city. Also a great way to access locations we would not have ventured to on our own.

South barrios tour was the highlight of my trip to BA. Ana gave us 3 packed hours of insights into the politics, history and people that make street art. The photo opportunities are stellar but the tour was so interesting in itself I could have just listened to the explanations. It's well worth the $25 cost and shows you bits of the city you might not otherwise have stumbled across. Highlight of my month long trip in the city and so great to be briefly swept up in the passion that the members of graffitimundo have for street art.

Super fun. This is more then graffiti as I would think of it in the US. It is street art. A fascinating tour about artists and politics and Buenos Aires starting in La Boca. Next I am going to the one in the Northern part of the city. Besides Anna is hot young and smart… Oh and single too!

Unique insight into the street art scene in Buenos Aires. I really enjoyed that tour! (in Palermo) Our guide knew a lot about the Graffiti and Street Art and the information were not superficial but of high quality! It became clear that this organization is actually really committed to their work, Thank you!
North tour. Very informative with a very knowledgeable guide, Anna. Gives quite an interesting perspective on the political and cultural origins of the urban art.

Incredibly knowledgeable guide, unique and wonderful tour. We took the north city tour on a beautiful spring day in Buenos Aires and it was our favorite thing we did in the city. Our guide shared a wealth of political and art historical information, but in such a laid-back, conversational way and with such intimate knowledge of each artist, that it felt easy to retain. We visited gorgeous pieces that we would never otherwise have found on our own, in a well curated order that gave us a rich understanding of the city's graffiti and street art scenes. I would recommend doing the tour early in your trip to get a sense of several barrios in one afternoon, and to give you a new lens through which to view the writing on the city walls.
A must if you visit BA. An excellent tour and outstanding graffiti, this was the highlight of our trip to BA. Avoid the structured Tango and related tours that are just tourist traps, this is x real!

Highly recommend the South City tour!!!. I took both the North and South city tours this past week and was impressed by both of them - they're informative, fun, beautiful, and a great way to see bits of BA. I thought the South city tour was more gritty and exciting - and my tour guide, Anna (Ana?), was very sweet, fun, and smart!

Amazing tour. I would recommend this tour for anyone interested in seeing a different aspect of the city. Street art in Buenos Aires is everywhere, but out fantastic guide gave us an amazing insight into the history behind graffiti in Buenos Aires, showed us works by different artists around the city and explained and the themes they are expressing and their influences. With the two guides helping us negotiate the Buenos Aires streets I always felt very safe. I also got to try mate tea for the first time and they explained the rituals behind this argentinan practice. Fastastic tour!

Fun and informative tour. I am from Argentina, but I live somewhere else, and during my last visit to Buenos Aires I decided to do some exploring. I thought that the tours offered by this company sounded interesting and fun, and decided to give it a try. I took the three hour North City Tour, and was happy to found that I was right. Sorcha, our guide, was great, and the art we saw during the tour was lovely. The tour was in English.Next time I visit Buenos Aires I plan to tackle the other tours offered by this company. Highly recommended experience!

Fun, informative, in-depth exploration of street art and graffiti in BsAs. Two friends and I did the biking/graffiti tour on a August weekend. We had two guides- a biking guy (works with Biking Buenos Aires) and a graffiti guide (works with GraffitiMundo). It was fun and easy to bike around-- the bike guy stays with the bikes and has tools in case anyone has bike issues, we often used bike lanes, and Sunday was a pretty quiet day on the streets. They're basically cruiser bikes, nothing fancy but easy to use. The tour itself was definitely in-depth. Our guide (Circa) very much knew her stuff. She explained the historical context and political significance of graffiti in Buenos Aires, named and detailed the viewpoints and motifs of various street artists, brought us to places where they work, and was very open to questions and suggestions. The art is incredible and neighborhoods were cool. Definitely recommended for a Sunday afternoon exploration in the city!

Interesting and informative. I took the South tour and really enjoyed it. Ana, our guide, is very knowledgable and passionate about street art in Buenos Aires, which shows and makes the tour better. She shared a lot of history about the city and the street art movement. I definitely recommend this tour.Tips: The Paro Museum where you meet is closed on Mondays, the day of the South tour, so do not arrive early expecting to spend time there. The majority of the tour is spent on a bus, with stops at which you can get out to see the art up close and take pictures. FYI - there is no eating on the bus.

Brilliantly structured street art tour. We loved our tour! We are a couple of educators studying street art here in Argentina, and I was amazed at how well constructed the tours were. We did the north and south city tours (both with Ana, who is an incredible guide!), and each one was a very rich and insightful experience, filled with history and engaging discussion of aesthetics, culture, and social themes. We highly recommend this tour, and especially Ana!

Vivid artwork with insightful background context. Anna was a fantastic guide who took us to many vivid and colourful artworks in the north city tour. She also provided background context to the importance of street art in Argentina and buenos aires. Perhaps a little long winded at the start, but overall a great tour.

Great way to learn about Buenos Aires and its tradition of public art. We loved our Graffitimundo tour! Our guide, Sofia, was knowledgeale and personable and brought the art to life. We learned alot about the intersection of art, politics and public protests during our tour. Our young teenage children enjoyed it as much as we did. The art is truly amazing--and the tour allowed us to understand its context. I recommend the tour highly!!

Best Tour of BsAs. This tour was very special and colorful. I was visiting my friend who lives here and we chose to do the biking tour on Sunday. So much information and great art to see. If you are in Buenos Aires I highly recommend doing this.

Colourful and rich in culture.. The tour was so much more than i could have hoped for. Ana, gave a real insight into the historical and political background for the street art movement in BA. Not only did we get to see some amazing pieces of works in areas that we would never encounter as tourists to the area, but, we learned about the messages that the artist was conveying. I will certainly be appreciating the 'colours on the walls' on a deeper level for the remainder of our trip.
Rock Galerie. Just like Galeria do Rock in São Paulo, smaller, less crowdie, with some tattoo studios inside at underground level.

Insight into the art, the artists and the historical and contemporary context of the movement. This tour, led by Ana, provided us with excellent insight into the genesis and evolution of the street art of Buenos Aires and how it reflects the sometimes turbulent history of freedom of expression and artistic and community comment on the times. We were challenged to really look into the art and work to understand it before Ana peeled away the many layers to the different works and contextualised them to their location and the communities in those locations. While I don't think it rules out anyone interested in street art, I really valued having a guide who was able to discuss the techniques and the cultural context of the works we viewed. We saw many pieces in hidden away locations - sometimes only through the windows of our comfortable bus just to be on the safe side. The stories of how these works grew out of communities rather than being imposed on them was fascinating. I highly recommend this tour, Ana as a guide and the driver and our fixer. Thanks for a great day in San Telmo, La Boca and surrounds. A memorable day well worth the cost.

Excellent street art. Very informative tour led by Ana. She highlighted the origins of street art as well as the political ties street art has to the city. I would also like to mention that this tour was not a walking tour, we were driven around and at times not able to get out due to the location.

An other view on Buenos Aires. It was really nice to get to know what's behind all of this street art ! The explanations were clear and it wasn't just informations, our guide, Ana, was more like telling a story about the artists who gave life to the streets. I really enjoyed it !

Fantastic tour and explanation of Street Art and Graffiti in Buenos Aires. This tour was really great and our guide Ana made it special. It puts the street art scene into context so that a tourist can understand why this art form took off in Buenos Aires and what the crucial dates and political history were.

Wonderful way to see more of Buenos Aires. I wasn't sure what to expect, but I really enjoyed this street art walking tour. I liked hearing the background information that Anna shared with us and I found the history of graffiti in Buenos Aires very interesting. I also found that walking around Buenos Aires in the days after the tour I was more attuned to and had a much greater appreciation for the different types of street art that I saw. The tour was also quite affordable and ended in Palermo, where it was easy to find something to eat before heading back to my hotel.

Better than the Museums!. The tour is longish and it winds through different neighborhoods. The stops focus exclusively on the street art. It would be nice if a bit more were said about the neighborhoods, but the guide is very knowledgable about the art and the artists, so you don't lack for information. Bicycling in BA is not as bad as it sounds if you go on a Sunday. Still, not for the faint of heart.A big bonus is the stop at the pub with the street art. It would be better if the stop included time to have a pint or some coffee, while others browse the gallery. Our stop was rather rushed.Compared to other attractions, the price is rather steep. But you get two guides -- one who talks art the other who minds the bicycles.

Great alternative to typical tourism. If I were to recommend one non-standard activity in all of BsAs, this is it. Anna walked us through the history of street art in BsAS and some of the big names to follow. We went through many areas of the city even locals have never seen, which was tremendous.There were several locals on the tour deciding whether they would recommend this for their clients, so they got some special attention in español, but I did not mind. Anna's English is very good and she did a great job keeping everyone taken care of. They do not include transportation to and from the tours back to your hotel, but for the price it still seems like a good deal. I spent 70 pesos to get to the meeting point and 50 to get back at the end. So add roughly 10 USD depending on where you are staying.

Provides the perfect context for the rest of your BA experience. My tour was led by Sorcha who was both informative and passionate about street art. If you can get her as your tour guide you are in for a great tour. This is a tour I would not have considered if booking from home. But once you arrive in BA you cannot help but notice that the street art is everywhere and it is incredible. You cannot help but wonder the who, what and whys of this phenomenon. Sorcha provided all of this and more with true passion for the topic. Now I walk around BA and know who painted what and why - far more useful than heading to a museum to see paintings you'll most likely never see again.

Excellent Tour. I have visited Buenos Aries once before and was always intrigued by the graffiti street art. I am so happy we decided to do this tour this time. It was one of my highlights of my trip! Ana- our tour guide was excellent and very knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend doing this tour!

Different view on Buenos Aires. I have already been in the city for over three month but the tour showed me a completely different and new side. Ana -our guide- did a great job and gave us tons of information about the historical development of streetart and the connection to political events and also about different ways to spray or draw a piece. We even took a little bus to see different areas and come to art galleries. I had no idea what to expect of the tour before but I really enjoyed it and can truly recommend it.

Streetart from a different point of view. I did the 3 hour tour with our lovely tourguide Anna. She explained everything very well and she also knows a lot of details. With this tour you see some parts of Buenos Aires, that you usually as a tourist don´t. First you get a introduction into the history of graffitti and the streetart in Buenos Aires and then Anna shows you a lot of different kind of arts from several, also well known, artists. As well, which I didn´t expect, a minibus is waiting for the group at different stops and is bringing you to some other places. Which was also nice, that Anna ask us several times, if we need to use the bathroom or want something to eat and drink. She really took care of us, which I really appreciated. The tour ends at a bar, including an art gallery of one of the artists, who you can meet and talk to.I highly recommend the graffitti tour with graffittimundo, and especially with our lovely tourguide Anna!

Awesome. Such an interesting and fun tour. Our guide, Sofia, clearly loves her job. She was such fun and the stories she told about each piece was just incredible, explaining the cultural, historical or political reasons behund it.Would highly recommend this tour.

So interesting and fun. The tour was so much more then I expected. It was really informative not only on the Graffiti history but how it connects with Argentinian history, we learned a lot, and our guide Sofia was really prepared to answer all of our questions. I'm looking forward to do it again in my next trip!

wonderful!. Graffitimundo gives an interesting and dynamic tour of the BA street art scene, explaining the cultural and historical context of the street art movement in the city as well as the different styles & artists that are found in BA. We loved our fun tour guide, Ana! Thanks for such an "off the beaten path" vision of BA!

Most interesting tour I've ever taken. The tour guide was incredibly engaging, and was great at placing different pieces in social, political and economic context in an interesting way. She also shared mate with us.
Amazing tour. The tour took us to places we would never have visited otherwise. Anna was extremely knowledgeable and enthusiastic, and we learned huge amounts. Definitely recommended.

Great insight into Buenos Aires street art. Our guide Ana was very knowledgeable and enthusiastic. She took us through the history of street art since Argentina's exit from the dictatorship, through the present days. We really envoyed the tour and learned a lot. Highly recommended.

Very interesting tour, amazing art. Thank you to Ana, our wonderful guide. She did a great job explaining the history & politics behind the amazing street art in Buenos Aires. We learnt about the different types of street art and graffiti which exists, as well as exploring areas away from the typical tourist route. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone with an interest in art, politics, history or those who want to experience something a bit different.

Great introduction to Buenos Aires. We did this tour a few hours after arriving in BA, and it was a great way of getting to see the city from a different perspective. Ana was a very knowledgeable guide and shared many interesting stories about the sites we visited. We did the North tour, and I would love to do the South tour if we visit again!

This tour rocks!. The graffiti tour of la Boca and Barracas is fantastic. Believe me, we are not talking about run of the mill graffiti here. Cecilia, the tour guide is great.. she knows her subject, is personable and really loves what she is showing you. I would definitely recommend this to anyone interested in contemporary art, art of the street, graffiti or simply in trying to get an impression of Argentine culture. Bring the camera.

Interesting tour with social-political background based in beautiful graffiti!. If you have the patience for some mild lecture-style touring of captivating graffiti pieces, I got some really interesting insights into the last decade of social and political history in Argentina from this tour. The minibus was bearable, and a necessity to get around to as many significant parts as possible. My only regret is that I had to miss the stop at the end at a graffiti artist bar in order to catch my plane. If I ever make it back again I am definitely planning on taking the tour over just to finish! Note: there was one main bathroom & snacks/drinks stop in the middle.

Perfect Sunday. I was lucky to spend some 2 hours and a half discovering urban street art thanks to friendly and energetic Ana. An excellent guide who shared her passion for this way of democratizing art available to all in the streets of Beautiful Buenos Aires. I discovered a perspective I didn't have, I loved it, I recommend the tour to all. Graffitimundo offers an excellent new lens with which to get acquainted with Argentina.

Hidden Buenos Aires. I joined the South City Tour to learn more about Buenos Aires and graffiti in general. I have spent a wonderful afternoon in some of the most particular corners of the city. Thanks to Ana (our guide) I have learned a lot about street art in Buenos Aires with an interesting insight on Buenos Aires history. I am so happy about the tour that I think I will take even the North City Tour in the next days. Again, thanks to Ana and her team for having led us in this amazing adventure!

Must Do Tour!. This tour was utterly amazing! The graffiti in Buenos Aires is extremely interesting and done by some amazing artist. Our tour guide Ana did an amazing job explaining the techniques used to make each piece and the significance behind each piece (socially/historically/politically). This tour is amazing whether you're traveling with your significant other (there were several couples on my tour) or if you're traveling by yourself (several others and myself were solo travelers). Once again, this is a must do tour if you're in Buenos Aires!
I different way to see the city!. The guide was excellent and has explained all the history context. 3hours of pure street art. I did the walking tour.

Different view of Buenos Aires. Incredible Tour. With this tour, you will see Buenos Aires from a new level and it's so interesting to see all the beautiful graffitis and the story behind. Well organised Tour and a very passionate tourguide (the girl - don't remember her name anymore).
Def. worth the price!

Much more than just street art. We went hoping to see some cool street art, we ended up with an education on the history of street art around the world and in BA. It was fascinating and it was explained in a way that allowed us to better appreciate what we were seeing. Ana clearly has a passion for this art form and is an interesting guide.

Awesome. Went on the North City tour with Ana, who was extremely knowledgeable and passionate. She put street art and graffiti in BA into social, political and historical contexts in a super entertaining way. All the art we saw was amazing, and it was really cool to hear about the artists and mediums - we even got to pop into an artist's studio at the end. The rooftop of the bar in Palermo was choice too :) Thanks heaps graffitimundo and Ana - keep doing what you're doing :)

Great tour, great guide, incredible city. I did the South city tour yesterday with Ana and it was incredible. She is so knowledgeable and passionate and really helped get even more out of all of the amazing pieces we saw. Wish I had more time in BA to be able to do the North tour, but glad I was finally able to make it to this one!

Greatfitti!. . The south and the north tours were an interesting way to put the social, political, historical aspects of Bs.As. into an artistic context. It's also a great way to familiarise yourself with some of Bs.As barrios and to see parts of La Boca, away from Camineto in safety.The tour guides for both were polite, informative and interesting, It was especially fun getting a detailed explanation of the ins and outs of telos and being shown a few from the outside by our drive, during the north tour.The information about the artists on the website is good, but perhaps after each tour a few lines about the artists and the works visited during that tour would be good to receive via email.There is so much information to absorb that some written follow up notes would be extremely handy.Highly recommended. Make sure you take your camera.

Amazing Grafitti Mundo Tour. I did the south city tour today with 'Ana' who was amazing.... We started in La Boco and saw some cool stuff locally then went in a bus (i was not expected that) to see some really cool stuff in some areas that are basically not safe to go so you would never get their on your own! Massive pieces of art and Grafitti everywhere. Ana provided some really great commentary and explanation as to the background of the pieces which again on your own you would not get. Do this tour if you come to BA to see some different areas other than the standard tourist stuff especially if you like art! $25 UsD well spent!

Best and most interesting tour in BA. Graffitimundo was by far my favourite thing that I did over 8 days in Buenos Aires. I did the North city tour with my sister and it was amazing! Before the tour we both felt that 3 hours of street art may be a bit too much, but by the end of the tour we wanted it to go on for at least another 2 hours. Not only were the street murals and different types of street art we saw amazing, but we learned so many interesting things about the medium which just wouldn't be apparent if you were walking around on your own looking at the art. We saw some really beautiful murals and passed by many more that we just didn't have time to stop at. The tour is $25 and more than worth the money. Around 1 hour is spent walking and the rest of the time you are in an air-conditioned bus. I would recommend for everyone visiting the city whether you are into street art or not.

Art + cycling = happiness. Have you ever been on a tour which was simultaneously entertaining, educational, engaging, and enlightening? This tour is like that. And did I mention, FUN?Took the graffitimundo bike tour. Melissa was our guide. Lucky to have her. Incredibly knowledgeable, articulate, and charming.You can get a bit of a workout and learn some stuff – all at the same time. US $45 for 4 hours.

Unique perspective on BA, a must-do. If your in Buenos Aires and you want to do something different, go with Graffitimundo. We started our 3 month travel in BA, where the North Tour was the undoubted highlight of our trip. After 3 months we returned to do the South Tour and it didn't disappoint once more. Our guide in both tours was Ana, a journalist from BA who is obviously knee deep into the BA streetart movement. Her enthousiasm and knowledge of (the origin of) BA street art is downright awesome. The origin and meaning of street art in Argentina is explained really well, giving you the appropriate context for the amazing murals that you will see in the tour.In short Graffitimundo is one of the coolest things to do in BA. And if you have to choose to spend your money on (for instance) Teatro Colon or Graffitimundo, I would easily choose the latter.Btw: If you really have to choose between the North and the South tour: I would go for the North tour as you see more different murals of different artists than in the South Tour, which is more about (very) large murals. But if you've got the time: do them both!

Absoultely ace!. I'm an avid street art fan, and have a huge connection to the soul and the medium, but that's not saying you need to be to enjoy this tour. Its really for anyone.I had the pleasure of meeting Ana for the North City tour, and she was superb. Bar being all of the good things; nice, caring, upbeat and great company and a guide, she did the most important thing. She connected the soul of the artists, the medium and their hearts. Its why I love the medium and is so rare to here another speak with the clarity and depth, and to hear the history was amazing. I would highly recommend Graffitimundo and this and their tours for anyone! I can't wait to see your documentary also, and think what you are doing is amazing! x

Feedback. Thoroughly enjoyed the tour today. If you're interested in learning about the authentic street culture in BA beyond the superficialities then do this tour. There are other tours focussing on the historical side of BA and will do these on our next trip.
Rosie358

Best tour in BA. By far, this was the best tour in BA! Do it on your first day in BA and you will gain an amazing insight to all of the street art, it's significance in both political and social context, as well as the artistic value. Sophia did our tour and she was very knowledgeable and passionate about street art's role in BA history. It was amazing! Plus, the tour was only $25, lasted 3 hours, and a bus was used to get around for a bit of it. Well worth the value! Before the tour, I was commenting on the amount of graffiti in the city and what a shame it was to deface buildings, but now I know that it is an acceptable and innovative art movement. Very cool!

Really interesting insights. I did the north city tour with Ana, who was great. She told a good story, knew a lot about the history of street art in BA and was obviously very passionate about the topic. I've done street art tours in Valparaiso and Bogota and this was just as good - some history, some information about specific artists, and about street art techniques. Definitely worth the time if you're at all interested in street art.Also, really great service. I missed my originally booked tour due to a protest, and the rescheduled me free of charge. Thanks guys!

Best Part of Our Time in the City!. We did the Graffiti Tour in Palermo with Ana and her enthusiasm and knowledge of the public art scene in BA was tremendous. Stories about the artists and political context brought the city to life.
Fascinating. Really enjoyed the tour, taught a lot in terms of the history of the art form in BA. Sophia was awesome as guide.

Fantastic perspective of an amazing city. We did the South City tour and really enjoyed getting a local's perspective on the history of neighborhoods we wouldn't otherwise have seen. It was fascinating to see how the public space has been used in a variety of ways for expression, communication, and as a tool for persuasion. Anna was an excellent guide, and I'd highly recommend this to anyone visiting BA.
Great afternoon activity. Did this on our first afternoon in the BA and it was a great way to get to see some neighborhoods and understand a little more about the city and culture.

BA North Grafitti tour. Sophia, thanks for an interesting and informative tour of some of the street art in Palermo district of Buenos Aires. We travel a great deal and alwatys try to set aside some time to appreciate the street art wherever we go, and thanks to your insight, we now appreciate that the Buenos Aires art community has evolved in some unique ways. Jaz´s use of asphaltic materials & brush to create watercolor-style art was amaziing as was NERF´s ability to free-hand the most complex lettering. The artist ¨Other¨ signature ¨eye-less symbolism¨ in the Mother Earth piece was stunning. There is so much life lying just beneath the surface, but it takes someone with a passion for it to bring awareness to the rest of us. Thanks for opening the door to the mysteries of the BA street-art community for us!

Putting Buenos Aires Graffiti into Perspective. On our recent visit to Buenos Aires we initially were initially put off by the graffiti that seemed to deface some of the stunning buildings in Palermo, where we were staying. I asked our helpful Buenos Aires concierge, Mariela, about it. She explained that the history of graffiti and street art in Buenos Aires has political roots, is very interesting, and suggested that we take the Graffitimundo tour to better understand it... I have no background in graffiti and street art, but started to pay attention. When in B.A. you wil see really stunning, vivid modern art on many walls and buildings. The Graffitimundo tour really put it all into perspective for me.Our guide, I believe her name is Ana, was fantastic. And for only $25 this tour is an amazing deal, as you spend 3 hours touring popular areas of town and learning about graffiti, street art and propoganda street art. Ana was enthusiastic, thoughtful, committed, and well versed in international grafitti and street art. Being over 60, i was clueless who Banksy was, the famous British graffiti artist, until this tour. Now I'm very interested and found myself walking the barrios of B.A. looking for interesting street art to capture and photograph. There are really some spectacular street art scenes around the city, many of which have a political message to tell. Some are just whimsical and fun.We opted to focus on the street art rather than spend a lot of time inside art museums. Like hip hop, it seems that street art is now becoming more mainstream. At least many artists are putting their energy into vivid art on the streets, so everyone can enjoy it. We learned that it is not unusual for a graffiti artist to be inspired and go to art school and then go back to the streets as a more polished artist. And the art on the streets belongs to the people. That is the bottom line in Argentina and why it is so popular. The way it was explained in this tour is that although graffiti is "illegal" in Buenos Aires, it is "tolerated". Street artists actually sign their art, and leave contact info because it is so accepted and appreciated by the locals. A graffiti artist will not paint over street art. So many building owners actually contact a favorite street artist and invite them to use their creative talents to paint a scene on their building, over the grafitti. After this tour I found the graffiti and street art to be more enjoyable and acceptable. We North Americans often apply our "standards" when visiting other countries. Sometimes they just don't fit. This was a real lesson for me about how our cultural differences can creep in when we don't even realize it.

Don't miss this!. Graffitimundo's tour of neighborhoods near Palermo was fabulous, informative, and fascinating. They provide a great dose of context and history, as well as understanding for what you're seeing as you walk the streets of today's Buenos Aires.

Fantastic experience!. Our guide Ana was amazing and the entire experience is a must see. Buenos Aires is an incredible city with great attractions, but you rarely get to see some of its hidden sides. The Graffitimundo tours do just that - simply awesome!
North city tour. The tour fantastic, learning about how graffiti started in Argentina and it growth. Such talent is so wide here. Sofia our guide was excellent thank you so very much

Great Tour From An Organization Dedicated to the Artists. This is a great way to see some of Buenos Aires' legendary street art. The guides at graffitimundo are not simply tour guides. They are professional people (ours was an architect) and they really love the work and the artists that they share with you. If you love street art and want to see some great areas off the beaten track in BA, you must book with graffitimundo!

Graffitimundo rocks!!!. It was a great walk through Palermo with a great guide!!! Very worth to see!!! All those colours and Differenz styles... Afterwards you walk totaly differently through the Great City of Buenos Aires. Thank you very much Graffitimundo.

Highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires!. We absolutely loved our North City tour! This is such a cool way to get to know parts of the city you might not otherwise see, and experience some of the most beautiful, impressive, and colorful street art you will find anywhere in the world. Our guide Sofia was super lovely, fun and informative - not only did she impart her knowledge on the specific artists and street art scene in BA, but she was able to connect it to the history, politics, and greater cultural landscape of the city. We ended feeling we learned so much more about BA than we expected. I am a huge street art fan having spent years in NYC, but I feel this tour would be enjoyed by someone totally new to street art just as well. Thank you Graffitimundo, and Sofia! We can't wait to take the South City tour next trip!

Highlight of my stay. So, I had lived in Buenos Aires for about 4 months..but sadly enough during those 4 months I saw very little of the city because I was either working or broke. It never set well with me..so this past February (2015) I decided to return for a month to get to know the city a little better. Well I booked the Sunday graffiti bike tour and boy did I love it. I'm really into street art, I think it captures a lot of the culture a city has to offer, but this tour goes above and beyond. Our guide Sorcha was so knowledgable about the history of street art in BAires....and about the artists that contribute to that culture as well as their styles. It was so fascinating and as a bonus we got to get to the city and the barrios on bici which I LOVED!!! It's seriously a must do tour!!! The bici tour is only offered on Sundays so book in advance if possible but if not i'm sure the tour by foot is just as great. I didn't get to meet any of the other guides but Sorcha was phenomenal and our bike tech guy Sean was also brilliant!! He gave quite the 'know all' on mate culture !! So much so i'm drinking a mate right now thanks to his lesson on how to prepare it. =) Thanks Sean!!! And Thank you Sorcha!! You guys and the tour rock!!!

Great informative, fun, alternative way to understand Buenos Aires. The North tour was great seeing a great variety of street art while also understanding the history of street art and also Buenos Aires itself. Definitely recommend this tour especially if you're new to the city.

Extremely informative and Colorful Tour. We took the South tour yesterday with Ana who was absolutely wonderful. Her knowledge and passion for the street art movement was electrifying, coupled with her ability to articulate the cultural, historical and political significance that inspires the artists was truly exceptional. You come away with an appreciation for the artists themselves, as well as a flavor for the complex and unique struggles that make Argentina so beautiful.
Fantastic new side of BA. exciting tour, enjoyable + knowledgeable+passionate guide and cool insides of BA! easy to book online. First tour like this I have ever done and known of.

Must-do: Buenos Aires like you've never seen it. I found this tour the last day I was in BA and am so happy I did. I have been to the city too many times to count, but this is one of the best experiences ive had. Ana is a really great guide and is able to give lots of information without making it feel like she is reading a list of facts; the pieces are breathtaking and it is so interesting to learn the background behind art you may pass every day. Really great organization that supports local artists so the money is well worth it, and they do a great job of avoiding typical tourist gimmicks. If you can, DO THIS TOUR! 100% recommend (I was on the south tour)

Unbelievable. Me and my boyfriend have just done the South BA tour and it was amazing!! Our guide (Anna) showed us other side of Buenos Aires and she did it with passion and energy! We saw some incredible pices of art that were beyond our imagination! The tour has made our day:)

Art in public spaces. The graffiti Mundo tour is easy to book and the tour guide Ana was one of the best guides I've met. Very knowledgeable and clearly passionate about the history, politics and practicalities of art in public places. The $25 (USD) was excellent value for money which benefits the artists and helps to spread the culture and messages of street art in buenos aires.The tour lasted approx 3 hours and the majority of the time we were on foot, walking short distances through the northern district.
