Ana gave a brief history of the origins of street art from political propaganda, teenage tagging and stencilling to the current wave of graphic designers and illustrators making their mark on the walls of Latin america. We stopped in front of several impressive pieces and were given contextual information about the artists and their intentions. The variety of street art was broad and varied and included several works by female artists and international collaborations. The styles and techniques were interesting and at times breathtaking, making for some memorable photo opportunities and leaving you with a desire to find out more about the artists and explore this unique art form.The tour ended at a bar and gallery in Palermo which hosts work from the artists seen on the tour and there is an opportunity to purchase some highly original work. We were told that there is a film currently being made about this movement, and the cost of the tour contributes to this and other publications surrounding graffitimundo. I look forward to seeing how this scene develops and am grateful to have been able to contribute to it in some small way.

A must. This unusual tour explains how Argentinians made political statement through arts. Graffitis are in every story but when you learn the story behind it it give new meaning to the scene depicted.More details about our trip can be found at http://bishopworld.wordpress.com

A must-do; inspiring. The graffitimundo tour was one of the highlights of our trip to BsAs. I loved learning about the stories, politics and personalities behind the graffiti in the city. It's a good way to see some parts of the city that you may not otherwise see on a shortish trip (as our trip was). Bring walking shoes and something to drink (though Graffitimundo staff provide water). Our guide, Cecilia, was very knowledgable, sweet and enthusiastic. Beyond the tour, it's good to support the mission of graffitimundo--giving exposure to street artists from BsAs whose work might not otherwise be widely seen, and to show how street art can beautify a city.

Brilliant. A bit of a delay in writing this review!We did the 'South City Tour' on the 9/Feb/15.Ana was our guide.A brilliant tour from start to finish with an excellent guide and very comfortable transport (when needed).My wife is fascinated by graffiti and I'm a fan of stencil art, so it was a very enjoyable tour.But I would highly recommend it to all people.It's also a great way to tour some of the city.Excellent staff, especially (again) our guide Ana, who was very informative, patient, polite and enthusiastic.A big clap on the back to GRAFFITIMUNDO who are progressing with a great concept!!

Excellent insight to some amazing artists!. We went as a four and really enjoyed it. The tour was good value as we saw a lot and it went on for a few hours. Our guide Sofía had pretty much unlimited knowledge, not just on the art but a lot of history on BA too.We even got to meet one of the artists at the end.Would definitely recommend as an alternative tour in BA:)

Awesome. Totally unexpected. My husband booked the tour and I was blown away.Ana was our guide, and she is smart and very knowledgeable. We took the South tour, and there were areas you couldn't even step out of the van, but were able to see some fine pieces of work.You walk some, drive some. Easy walking, but bring walking shoes. One bathroom stop at the very beginning. You end the tour at a small gallery where the company is housed with some pieces available for purchase.Very much recommended!!!

Amazing tour!. This tour surprised me. I was expecting an interesting tour, but it was more than that. I learned so much about the city and its history. The artwork was beautiful and the tour guide was fun and very knowledgable about all of the art. I highly recommend it.

Best tour of Buenos Aires. Wow, what a fantastic tour. I signed up for the northern tour of Polermo during the beginning of my trip which was a fantastic idea. It helped give me a good historical and artful context of such a bright city. It changed how I saw BsAs and through the week I was even starting to recognize artists from the tour. The tour guide Ana is such a great story teller that it helped me fall in love with the city. In fact the tour was so good, I signed up for Ana's other tour of the murals. Go on the south tour if you want to see the grittier parts of the city. Excellent. I would recommend this to all of my friends.

South tour was nice, Ana made it a must see.. Ana love's what she does and it is clearly obvious. It isn't just that she shows you the art, she also teaches you why it is there. The history behind the art, has it's drama and intrigue. If there is a request, don't be shy, Ana was more than reasonable and accommodating. Loved the tour, company and energy. Wish I had time to see more.

Do not miss it ! South Tour. This gem of a tour, led by Ana, is not to be missed ! The 3-hour tour was comfortable in the physical travel and so moving and informative in learning the stories from Ana's passionate telling. The tour combines art, history and politics. Ana is so attentive and welcoming. We loved it !

Brilliant. Went on a tour of South BA art through La Boca incredible pieces by Blue & Jaz our guide (sorry I don't remember her name) was excellent a journalist very well informed friendly and enhanced the experience.I highly recommend this tour it's a good way to get into the heart of la Boca and the artistry is more than worth seeing including the world's largest murial.Was also tipped to go and see David Squeiro's work at the Museo del Bicentenalrio for lovers of thus style do not miss this Muchas grasias Graffitimundo xx

This is what a tour should be like. The tour guide Ana captured us with her immense knowledge about the cultural and political background of the street art she showed us. These covered tags, stencils and marvellous pieces of professional street artists. graffitimundo is run by people who are into street art and that want to promote their culture. At no time was I under the impression that they run the tour for the money, because you felt that the spoke from their heart to share their insight.In short, the tour was perfect - I highly recommend it.

Brilliant tour. We arrived in Buenos Aires on a Saturday morning at the end of January and did the graffitimundo north tour that afternoon which was 3 hours of walking in the sunshine and viewing amazing graffiti and street art. At the same time our fabulous guide Anna educated us in history, culture and politics too! Highly recommend to anyone whether you are interested in street art to start with or not, fabulous to see different areas and learn some culture/history at the same time. Ended in a cool gallery/bar so you can't go wrong!
Something different. Really enjoyed this for something different to do, was interesting and Anna was a good knowledgable guide.

Great way to see different parts of the city. We enjoyed our walking tour with graffitimundo and highly recommend their service. It is a good value for the price. We felt like maybe the tour was just a bit longer than it needed to be (maybe that was just because we were tired for our long flight to Argentina) and that the gallery at the end was pretty picked over by the time we arrived. If we could give half-stars, we'd give it a 4.5.

See the real Buenos Aires. I arrived in Buenos Aires yesterday and today I went on the 3 and a half hour street art bike tour. I thought I knew what to expect as I live in Shoreditch in London which is dominated by street art, however the tour was much more than that. We discovered so much about Argentinian culture, politics and history. Our guides were incredible knowledgable and enthusiastic. I came away with a better understanding of the area, a revitalised appreciation of street art and a big smile. I cannot recommend this tour highly enough - do it!!!

Extraordinary way to experience the art and history of B.A.. This tour was recommended to me by a friend and I am now recommending it to you. This is such a unique and intimate way to explore the vibrant city of Buenos Aires. A city overflowing with creative energy, that is also inseparable from it's tumultuous past. The tour reflects on the voice of street art and graffiti and is equal parts visually stimulating and historically informative. The guide Ana was passionate, enthusiastic, and incredibly knowledgable. Hands down, this tour is amazing. If you are an art or history lover, do yourself a favor and go!

Jan 2015 North City Tour. Absolutely fantastic tour and definitely worth doing when in BA. The tour guide clearly knew the history, the artists themselves, and was able to point out amazing things about the art work that you may not have known otherwise. Do not miss this during your trip to BA - will give you a new perspective on the city.

Fun way to spend the afternoon in BA!!!. This tour is run in conjunction with Biking BA (awesome group of people). The guides were great, bikes comfortable, and the street art amazing!!! Loved the info and follow-up email on the artists' work that we saw and discussed while on the street. Bring water if you don't want BA city water - but other than that magnificent!! Not for kids - and able bodied adults that are able to handle the heat and humidity. Biking is flat and easy. Biking BA employees take very good care of us!!Thank You Biking BA and Graffitmundo!!!!!
Brilliant Tour. Fantastic tour showing another side to Buenos Aires. The street art is amazing. Thanks Anna for the great service!

AWESOME! Not to be missed!!!. Fellow travelers told us not to miss this tour and were they right! We saw and learned so much off the beaten track information about the art scene in beautiful Buenos Aires. The charming, passionate and informed Ana met us in La Boca (all very clearly communicated by email) we got on and off their lovely bus and ended in San Telmo in Graffitimundo' new gallery. The three hour tour flew by and our eyes and hearts were full. Thank you Ana and Melissa for making this a highlight of our time in BA

Fantastic bike tour!. I had a blast on this Sunday afternoon bike tour around BA and learned so much about street art. Our guides were so knowledgeable, thoughtful, and enthusiastic. HIGHLY recommend!!!

Great tour for street-art admirers. We took the North tour in December. It was a great experience and our guide Ana was cheerful and gave great amounts of information. It was very interesting hearing about the origins of graffiti and street-art in Buenos Aires. I'm really glad I took the tour, because we walked by so many pieces that I wouldn't really have noticed or understood otherwise. One regret would be the use of the minibus. It was very welcome on the day we took the tour, as it was raining heavily from time to time, but the distances would have easily been done walking.

Great afternoon on the North Tour. A trip highlight.. We did the North City Tour in November and it was a definite highlight of our three day trip to Buenos Aires. You meet on a street corner with the guide and other visitors and then walk around a well planned route to see some excellent street art that is not only visually stunning but also explains the social history of street art and freedom of expression in the country. For the time investment of a few afternoon hours it was so worth it and we're glad we did it on our first day there as it helped to show us around an area, and we could pick the guide's brains as to what to do during our time there too. You get ferried around in a minibus from some places (which has A/C too!) and both the driver and guide were really friendly and passionate about their topic.Really happy we found out about it and would definitely recommend it, even if you are (yet!) to be convinced about street art!

A must do for anyone visiting BA. Our guide on Saturday, Anna, was clearly passionate about the graffiti/street art scene in Buenos Aires. She is so knowledgeable about the art and artists and shares this knowledge with her group with such excitement. The tour was a wonderful way to explore the city and see neighborhoods we would otherwise miss. Learning about the artists and their messages and also the recent history of Argentina made for a fun and very informative afternoon. I recommend this tour to anyone.

A must do in Buenos Aires. This was by far the best tour we did in Buenos Aires. Our guide was insightful, knowledgeable, and friendly. The tour allowed us the opportunity to see parts of he city we never would have visited and gain an appreciation for how much BA respects and values graffiti artists. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone.

Superb perspective!. I have done two Graffitimundo walking tours in BA and each gave a special perspective on street art. Graffiti and street art was not on my radar until I came to Buenos Aires (and Rio). The Graffitimundo guides were superb and helped me to gain a completely different view on graffiti. Clearly, BA seems to be a great place for this and the more you know about the backround of graffiti the more you see and appreciate it. If you want to get to know a city from a different angle then this is your tour!

Great orientation to the city!. Having walked by murals upon murals in Buenos Aires without paying them much mind, taking the Graffitimundo tour was like holding up a magic glass to reveal stories hidden in plain sight. Really, the tour helped me and my traveling partners gain a deeper insight into recent Argentinian history, and contemporary Porteño culture. It is a tour I highly recommend for newcomers to the city!

Interesting and important side of BA. A tour very worth more than the $25 they charge for it! BA has an exciting street art scene and it is well worth taking a closer. While doing the street art tour you also get to see a number of BA neighborhoods. The tour guide spoke fantastic English and had great excitement for the art work, which made the tour more enjoyable.
Great great tour!! Must do!!. This tour was awesome! Ana was great, the information was excellent and it was a great way to get historical background about Buenos while enjoying some art. Loved it!

Our favorite part of our BA visit. As many other reviewers mentioned before me, this is a unique, informative, well-run, extremely interesting way to learn about the culture of BA. Ana was fantastic-smart, funny, articulate. Really made us think about the motivations of the Argentinian street-artists and the traditions surrounding this way of life. We loved everything about it and I feel comfortable saying that even if you had just one day in BA, you could not go wrong spending it on a graffitimundo tour.

Informative, fun, interesting tour. I just went on the north side graffiti tour. It was very fun and interesting- I did not understand the street art scene, but after this tour I now have an appreciation and respect for the art. It is also very fascinating to hear about the techniques used. Ana, our tour guide, was very passionated and informative- it was raining during our tour and she was still able to keep our attention and make sure we had a good experience despite the rain- a must while in Buenos Aires!

Different, offbeat and informative tour. See a different side of Buenos Aires. Having spent over a week here, I noticed the graffiti and murals on the walls, but didn't consider why they were there. This information and fun tour explains it.The guides are knowledgeable and interesting, the tour (three hours) is just the right length and it is rather inexpensive. I highly recommend it!

Great insight into the city. Nothing new that hasn't been said below, but this tour was fantastic. The attention to detail, insight into the culture and history of street art and information shared about the artists was fantastic. I wouldn't consider myself too knowledgeable in street art, but the tour was fantastic. Ana, our tour guide, was excellent - very personable, knowledgeable and provided insight into Argentinian history. I'll definitely recommend this to anyone I know traveling down to BA.

Great way to see the city. Our 3 hour "south city" tour combined walking and mini-bus and took us through parts of the city we would have never seen on our own. The street art and the history behind it was fascinating. I would definitely recommend the tour to first-timers to BA as well as those like us who have been many times. My only constructive criticisms would be to (a) not have the guide stand and talk right in front of the art, making it difficult to take good photos and (b) minimizing "drive by" views of murals which means half the bus can't see it well or take any pictures - very frustrating!

A fantastic view into street art. One of the most interesting things one could do in Buenos Aires to really understand what makes the city tick. The 3 hour tour was a combination of walking and van tour, and explained the differences amongst graffiti, tagging and street art. Buenos Aires is one of the centers of street art. The history and politics of this art was so well explained, and in looking at the street art, you also learned a lot about the history of the city. The murals are extraordinary, as is the explanations that are provided

Unique experience in BA!. What a great family activity in Buenos Aires! We really enjoyed our graffiti tour experience and our introduction to the BA art scene. Cecila was both knowledgable and passionate and infused enthusiasm throughout the tour. Highly recommend for a unique experience while in BA!

new way to discover BA. one of my favorite activities to do in BA! our guide ana was fantastic and passionate about the topic and had a lovely way of getting us all fascinated. very well organised, perfect amount of time to get a good impression. you also not only learn about how graffiti and streetart evolved in argentina, but also about the historical, political and social background. absolutely recommended!!!

Wonderful Way to See BsAs through Art. My husband and I signed up for the Graffitimundo Tour after reading about it in our Lonely Planet tour book. It far exceeded our expectations, even though we weren't able to stop at the artist workshop at the end of our tour since it was Christmas Eve Day. The tour guide was EXCELLENT (honestly, it"s rare to find such a well-spoken guide), and the street art was impressive and telling of the city's political, economic, and social past and present. Highly recommend!

Street Art Deciphered. If you would like to understand the political and artistic context of the ubiquitous graffiti and street art in Buenos Aires, this is for you Engaging and informative, the English-speaking guides take you through the turmoil of recent history as well as the techniques and backgrounds of the individual artists. Get off the beaten track and take this tour!

Informative and fun. After living here for almost a year, I joined a graffiti tour in Colegiales and Palermo. Sophia did a great job introducing us to the street art scene of BsAs. And now I surely have a new perspective when passing by those familiar neighborhoods of Palermo.

Really interesting and informative. I´m not so much into the street art scene but went along with my GF who takes an interest in the subject and found the tour to be extremely interesting, well organised and excellently delivered. Our guide Sorcha was extremely knowledgeable on the subject and personally knew the artists, it was easy to tell that she is passionate about the company and the art that they promote. She had a great sense of humor (as Irish people do!) and answered any queries the group had. I won't spoil the tour by telling you everything but we saw some really beautiful pieces and discovered the meanings and feelings behind them. The company sounds like an excellently run company who work with the artists and contribute to their livelihood. They are in the midst of a book and documentary production about the scene in Buenos Aires which accentuates the feeling that they are truly passionate about the tours they provide! Maybe a little expensive but I suppose Buenos Aires tends to be a little bit pricier than its more easterly neighbors.

Street Art Tours South and North in Buenos Aires. My friends and I took both the South and North street art tours this week in Buenos Aires. A superb way to see the city, feel its contemporary political-cultural history. Very knowledgeable guides - both re the artists and the evolution of the city's culture especially since the 1990s.

Thumbs Up. I booked the tour having read about it in Lonely Planet, and also on a friend's travel blog. I've always been interested in street art, but this was the first time I booked a tour. Our guide was super informative, and I really valued learning the cultural and historical context of the works that we saw and the street art movement in Buenos Aires generally. If I was here for longer, I would try and book one of the other tours too. Having the air conditioned mini bus was great too! A really enjoyable start to our afternoon in Palermo.

Do this!. History lessons, private art studio tours, getting to know the neighborhoods in the heart of a city now known for incredible artists working in cooperation. That is what Graffitimundo is. If you care at all about art; do this!

Street art tour rocks!. When our 21-year-old son, who is studying in BA for a semester, mentioned this tour, I was dubious. But it turned out to be one of the highlights of our family's eight-day visit to this lovely city. Sophia, our guide, was friendly, enthusiastic and extremely informative. The art and the stories behind it were fascinating. The three hours goes by fast (mostly walking but there's a mini-bus to take the group around to different spots, too). I just wish we could have brought some of the art work back home with us. We were prepared to buy--the tour ends at a gallery--but there was no easy way to pack canvases and our visit was at the tail end of an exhibit so there weren't many prints (which can be rolled up and easier to pack) left. Graffitimundo should find a partner gallery in NYC or another big US city--the street art is amazing!

Great tour, crazy low price for what you see. Took the North Tour and was impressed by how much I saw and learned for such a small tour fee. Saw parts of the city I would never have seen without this tour in a safe way. Super interesting tour and highly recommend it.

Great value for money. Great tour to take during the afternoon and I was really surprised that we used a mini bus in some parts as the tour is only about £16! Great value for money. I would recommend this as its a great way of seeing the culture of the city from a grass roots perspective.

South BA graffiti tour - time well spent!. We feel so fortunate to have discovered this tour through Canadian friends who live part time in Buenos Aires! It was an intimate, enjoyable and enlightening tour. Cecilia was a delightful guide. She was knowledgeable, passionate and energetic. It's as much a tour of street art as it is a commentary on the psyche of the Argentine street artist in various political climates. Time well spent!

Pretty cool!. They will show you places that probably you would never find by yourself!
And they provide good and complete information as well.

Fun and interesting!. If you want to learn more about the street art and graffiti in Buenos Aires, go on this tour!! If you want to be guided by a lovely funy guide, ask for Ana! Fun and interesting!!

Secret masterpieces revealed by a passionate Irish architect.. Circa was great, we did the south tour with 12 others. Our mini bus was air conditioned and we were gallantly handed off the bus at each stop by our porteno driver. Come with good questions they're up for it.

looking for the heart of BA. very interesting engaged guide.History, art, culture all collide in this fascinating tour. well worth 3 hours of your time with soneone who knows the genre, the city and the artists.

A true insight. This tour was fabulous, so much interesting infromation was given about the artists and the history and development of Street Art in Buenos Aires.Over previous trips I have loved seeing the Street Art as I made my way around the city but this tour gave so much information and now I can't wait to return to do the next tour.

A really original tour. This was one of two tours I made around BA last month and I thought it was brilliant! Some of the works of art are really amazing and we also had to change to meet one of the artists in his studio. For something really offbeat I thoroughly recommend this tour.

Understanding BA's street art. This was an interesting way to discover the back streets of Buenos Aires and to better understand why street art is so prominent there. The guide was very well informed and accommodating. Recommended!

South Tour. I've just done this tour and I can only recommend. You get interesting informations about graffiti art und beside you see parts of Bue you wouldn't go on your own. If you are involved in the scene then it would be better to join an artist and have a look what he and his colleagues are doing. But for a "normal" person this tour is a way to get deeper in the feeling of Bue.

Street art in Buenos Aires - there is more than meets the eyes. This tour is a must if you're visiting Buenos Aires. Not only do you get taken around town to see the street arts, you're also privided with a wonderful storu of how this art was born into Argentina and how it relates to the Argentine history over the past few decades. Thank you Sorcha, our guide, for showing us a great time!

Great voice for local art. Took an afternoon north city tour and it was a perfect afternoon seeing the local art scene with a great guide. The stories behind the art was a great accent to the already unique art. The tour itself was inspiring and educational as to what the locals have overcome and how they have handled diversity through art. The final stop at the artist inspired bar was a great perk too..make sure to spend a bit of time getting to the know the gallery and people running it. Great time and a well spent afternoon. Treat yourself to some local art, you'll be glad you did.
Great, unique city tour. i went on a bike tour with Biking Buenos Aires and GraffitiMundo...so interesting and informative about Buenos Aires and its street art. Highly recommend.

Full of interest and passion.... The tour takes you on a journey not just across the city (on foot and by mini-bus), but also across the history and uses of graffiti and its links to social and personal context. It was particularly interesting understanding how graffiti has evolved into street art - both technically and socially - and continues to evolve. The tour was lead by an exceptionally lovely and single (she asked us to put that in our reviews!) journalist who both has a huge amount of knowledge and is also a great communicator.The tour works at many levels - you can either just go along for the pretty pictures, or you can turn up and do a 3 hour "art history of graffiti course".Given the ephemeral nature of the work, it would stand multiple visits.Really well organised and highly recommended.

Would definitely recommend - great afternoon. Loved this tour. Lovely guide who was extremely knowledgable and happy to help people out with directions and recommendations. The route was great, included lots of hidden-away places you'd never find on your own. Covered a good range of the city and the minibus was a plus too! Definitely worth the money.

Well organized and interesting. I really enjoy seeing street art around the world and find these kind of tours to be a great way to get a taste of parts of the city where normal people live (instead of just seeing the touristy areas) and hear a little about the political history of the country. The guide was great and the coordination with the mini bus was well done so we didn't waste time walking between the main areas of art.

Graffiti Heaven!. I highly recommend this tour whether you already enjoy graffiti or don't know anything about it. Our tour guide, Kirsty, was a wealth of knowledge and excited about sharing the city and art with us. We learned about the history, the neighborhoods, the various artists, meanings behind their work, and different types of graffiti. And, if you like to view this type of art and take photos, you will be in heaven!The tour is kept to a small group and is primarily conducted on foot within a Palermo neighborhood. The tour is accompanied by a van which transports you to various points within the tour. It concludes in a bar showcasing art with artists on site. It is roughly three hours unless you want to linger longer in the bar.It was one of my favorite afternoons in the city and I will definitely explore this tour again on another visit. Price and experience cannot be beat!

A fantastic way to see the city and spend the afternoon. I've been in Buenos Aires for 2 weeks and the city is great and all but this guided walk was the highlight. The guide was very knowledgeable about not only street art (how things were made, how the community works, etc) but also the history of Buenos Aires, how street art in the city came about. Granted that I was too busy taking photos, the introduction was insightful and the guide was very friendly (she's from Ireland) and clearly knows what she's talking about. I would highly recommend this.

Great afternoon with Graffitimundo. I would highly recommend this tour as a different way to see a non-tourist side of Buenos Aires. It was a great afternoon seeing the street art of the northern part of the city. Our lovely Irish guide was knowledgeable and friendly and helped really explain a lot more about Argentinian culture that just the street art. It is a fun and informative afternoon and would definitely recommend it as an activity to do during your stay in Buenos Aires.

Brilliant!. This tour was fantastic. Not only did I learn a lot about the street art culture of Buenos Aires but also about the city itself. Was much more in depth and insightful as other tours I did during my stay.

Fun and interesting! Wish we had gone earlier in our BA trip.. We went on the South Buenos Aires tour, and it was really wonderful. Our guide was friendly and knowledgeable. Some of the areas to which she took us, there's no way we would have found that on our own. And she was great about explaining some of the social and political history that put a lot of this art in context.We went on this tour near the end of our stay in BA, but if you can, I'd recommend booking for earlier. She put the city in to context for us, and gave us a ton of useful information that we would have taken advantage of if we'd have had a few more days. They say this on their website, but it's really true. I'm absolutely glad we went, I just wish we'd gone earlier. And remember not to drink too much coffee or mate before the tour; it's a walking / minibus tour, your bathroom opportunities are limited!

great experience!. cecilia, thue guide, was really nice. she was into helping e showing us everything. nice trip to take pictures and meet other tourists. if you are done or looking for new experiences, graffiti mundo is a great option. unfortenelly the little book they gave us at the end is kind od out of date.

Not to be missed!. This past weekend I went on the North City tour and our wonderful guide, Ana, led us through Colegiales and parts of Palermo that I might not have seen otherwise. She was incredibly knowledgable, charismatic, and open to questions. I loved that the tour explained the social, political, and historical context of Buenos Aires's street art. This tour is a must for any art and/or culture lovers traveling to Buenos Aires.

Very interesting. A great tour to take you to the parts of Buenos Aires you might not necessarily see. Lots of interesting street art, lots of interesting artists and some very informative guide.Well done.

A MUST DO. If you have any interest in art, street art, graffiti or history this is a great tour for you. Our guide provide a great amount of information about the artists, their techniques and how the pieces reflexed the peoples history. She was lovely, friendly and energetic making a great tour. We were even lucky enough to go and meet 3 of the artists in their workshop. Ensure you don't go home disappointed, go and do it

Not just a street art tour. ... but a great way of connecting with the history of Buenos Aires. We saw great art and learnt about the role that street art has played in politics, culture and kids just being kids.

An Unforgettable Experience. This was one of the most interesting, informative, and enjoyable experiences we had in Buenos Aires. The tour, led by an personable and articulate guide, introduced us to a side of Buenos Aires culture that one does not read about in the tour books. We were not only able to see great street art and Argentinian graffiti, but the guide explained the many nuances and meanings of the work. We also walked through neighborhoods that the ordinary traveler would miss. This is a must-see experience.
Got to be done!!! . Fatastic! Amazing! Got to be done! The beat thing we did while in the city - and worth every penny! Lovely tour guide, very interesting!

A Highlight of Our Trip to BA. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our tour of street art in Buenos Aires. Our tour guide was extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the local art scene. She took us to a few neighborhoods we would have never gotten to on our own. Meeting one of the artists at his studio was a real bonus.

A different perspective... Awesome!. Throughout travelling in South America, my partner and I had viewed some pretty amazing ,street art. We had also seen quite a lot of it too! We loved exploring the street art in Buenos Aires and tried a workshop with Graffitimundo instead of a walking tour. We worked with the artist Federico, formally known as 'run don't walk', and our workshop was awesome. It lasted four hours, and despite arriving a little late he worked with us for our complete allocated time. Within this workshop, you are given a real understanding of graffiti art, create your own stencil and then experiment with it! We loved our workshop, and definitely plan to continue our graffiti skills. Would highly recommend it to others!
Great insight into BAs street art. Really enjoyable 3 hour guided tour providing history and insights into the street art and the artists. Left wanting to see more!

Fascinating and Insightful.. The tour we went on was obviously conducted by someone with a passion for the street art of Buenos Aires. This non-profit organisation does a great tour; we got to visit the workshop of one of the artists whose work we saw in the streets, and terminate the tour in a chic bar full of art. Even if you're only in Buenos Aires for a short period of time, I would highly recommend taking the time out for one of these tours.

Best thing we did in Buenos Aires!. We booked our tour based on a recommendation from a friend. It was the highlight of our week in BA. After 3 hours, I was craving more. Anna was an incredible guide- very knowledgeable and personable. Thank you!

Graffiti Tour BA. After recommendation from our hostel myself and a friend decided to take the Graffiti Tour. The alternative tour gave a different view of the city and was well worth the time and different to conventional tours. The guide was excellent she was informative and explained the history and types of graffiti from Argentina and referenced graffiti from other parts of the world too. The walk lasted for roughly 3 hours with a gallery at the end. It's a perfect opportunity to take photographs and experience the neighbourhoods. Very good value for money.

Disappointing. This tour was to be honest disappointing. I had high expectations though after coming from an amazing 5 star valparasio street art tour the previous week. The tour combined bus and walking transport. I thought that the guide really dragged out the explanations and it was quite tedious at several points. She spent a lengthy amount of time at one piece giving us very long explanations about political history (normally I would find this riveting) but I was bored silly. At the end of the tour she bought us to a graffiti bar and introduced us to a graffiti artist who literally said 'hi' then left! She gave no explanation other than pointing to a few of his pieces, like she did not explain why he became a graffiti artist, how long he had been doing it for - nothing. Even if the artist couldn't speak English you would think she might let us ask a few questions or maybe he could say a quick introduction. I was just really disappointed. I do acknowledge the other great reviews that are here.

Amazing afternoon of street art and history. After 5 months living in Buenos Aires, we booked the graffitimundo tour that had been recommended to us back when we first arrived. We loved this tour! And our two teens enjoyed it too. Our tour guide Ana was so knowledgeable, and she provided valuable context and history to the many images and pieces we have seen throughout the city. We gained a renewed understanding of this form of public expression, signature styles, content, etc. Also enjoyed learning about the relatively young nature of Argentine street art/graffiti compared to other world-wide movements. We had a lovely afternoon with sun shining, and ending at a gallery to see and purchase "extensions" of street art was the icing on the cake. A must for any visitor to BsAs!
A fun way to learn about street art. Graffitiimundo is a fun way to spend a few hours, learning about the art and artists who produce some amazing street murals.

Graffiti-Art Tour. We had a wonderful day doing the graffiti tour in Buenos Aires. The guide was so knowledgeable and the background stories were so interesting on the various artists and their work that I could have spent another day with her looking at more graffiti. Really the time flew by and it didn't seem nearly long enough for everything there was to see. I highly recommend including this on your "must see" list of BA.

Amazing Way to see another side of the city. I loved this tour! Experiencing the history and the culture of the city through this amazing art is great way to break the stodgy city tour mold. Both the street art and the guides were amazing, and it opened my eyes to all of the amazing art in other cities as well!If you are in BA for any period of time I would definitely recommend this experience!

Great tour . I went along with my girlfriend not expecting much although I was blown away by the beautiful street surroundings of the streetart world, Anna was a great tour guide and really entertained the tour like we were her close friends .

Do this tour. Right now. This tour was one of the highlights of my trip to BA. You meet a guide in part of the city and get a walking/driving tour of some of the area's street art. The scene in BA is rich and diverse. The company started up because two travellers wanted to learn more about street art there. It's fascinating to hear the stories about the art, and see it for so much more than what graffiti is in America. Please please please, do this tour.

You won't walk the streets the same way after this tour. We took this tour with Ana, who was outstanding. She managed to teach us all about what graffiti is, where it came from, who uses it every day (hint: for their political aims), and how to think about this media as art.Until I took this tour, my idea of seeing art was to visit as many museums and galleries as possible. This is what I do when I travel; luckily I have a wonderful girlfriend who does the same. Now that I understand that graffiti artists live in a world that has nothing to do with vandalizing buildings, walls, etc. I realize that every street is a museum. Having grown up in the Big Apple, this literally blows my mind!On this tour you will learn the difference between mere tagging, bombing, stenciling and street art. And you will see things you've seen every day, but with a brand new perspective.I should also mention that Ana speaks exceptional English, and has a solid grasp of the terminology artists and fans like us use. That, in itself, is a treat.As you can tell, I can't recommend this tour enough. Go on it, and enjoy the beautiful world of street art that Buenos Aires has to offer.(And don't skip the museums, like MALBA, MACBA, Bellas Artes, Fortabat, etc. either.)
Must do. Our tour guide was amazing and gave a great into to Argentina's history and current social/political climate and it was cool to hear background stories on different walls.

Good way to get to know Bs. As. from another perspective. If you are into street art or want to get a first idea of it this tour is a must! The guides are very nice and can tell you a lot about the the street art community in Buenos Aires and its history.

Highly recommended - be a TRAVELER and not a TOURIST. I have lived in Buenos Aires for 2+ years, and I've always made an effort to live like a local. Of course when I have visitors from the states, they want to see more than just my local spots and my everyday life. So when my mom and her boyfriend told me they were coming to visit, I remembered having heard about Graffitimundo, and thought the tour might be a fun, different experience for them. I skimmed the TripAdvisor reviews and decided we should go for it. What a GREAT decision. I can honestly say that of all the tours I've done in Buenos Aires, this is the one I'd most highly recommend. Ana, our guide, started with an informative overview of the history and origins of graffiti/street art in Buenos Aires, layering in some perspective about the socioeconomic/political history (in perfect English), and proceeded to lead us on an adventure through parts of BA that most tourists never see. The street art itself was interesting, thought- and conversation-provoking, and some of it quite beautiful. In the aftermath of the tour, I walk the streets and look out the bus window with an entirely new perspective. This is a tour that turned "my" city into a museum. Truly excellent.

Great insightful tour. I loved this tour as it gives you really interesting background info on the country as well. The Argentine guide's explanations were passionate and it shows that the guides love what they do. Just one little thing: please make sure to begin the tour on time!

Graffiti Mundo - great tour!. This was a great , offbeat tour of Buenos Aires. We learned a lot about the history of the city and the stories behind the street art. Even got to go to the artist's studio and meet one of them. We would highly recommend this tour!

Enjoyable. A good guide and an enjoyable, slightly offbeat, tour. I went on the basic tour, taking about three hours and currently costing the equivalent of 25 USD. Not an overly unreasonable price.An important part of the tour is the guide explaining details about the artists and contexts for the murals that are part of the tour, but these explanations are not essential. You *could* get your own bike and do your own tour, if you manage to figure out which murals to visit.

Informative and interesting. Great way to see parts of the city you might not otherwise see. Lots of interesting art on the tour, and a bit of history of the country as well. The guide was very knowledgable about the artists, as I believe the tour focused mainly on those the company is affiliated with. Passed by some other great art but didn't stop at them likely due to the previous point. However, its a nice way to see that there are lots of other interesting walls to continue exploring. Nice and comfortable tour.

Really interesting. We found this tour very interestingWe had a lovely young Irish architect as our guideLots of good insights into the history if graffiti in BA - and well conducted combining walking and busOnly suggestion - probably could be shorter ! We found 3 hours a bit too long

Alternative view of BA. Enlightening tour of varied artworks gave me a good understanding of street art in BA, and took me to some areas I'm sure I wouldn't have found as a visitor to the city. The guide (Sorcha) was very knowledgable and passionate about the art, the city, and the NFP venture.

A new viewpoint of a familiar city. Having lived in Buenos Aires for over 20 years, I didn't expect to see much new, but the excellent guide Sorcha unfolded the city's urban art to us. She had a deep understanding of social, historical and artistic context and it was a great tour - would highly recommend it to both locals and tourists. In Spanish for free on alternate Sundays.

A fantastic way to get to know BA. This was an absolutely amazing tour. I would recommend doing it on your first day in the city to give you a sense of the history and stories behind the graffiti you see all throughout the city.

Makes You Walk Around The City Differently. This tour is great. I'd learned about a lot of the history of Argentina, but I had no idea that a lot of the street art and stencils that I walked past every day were so politically motivated. This was a great way too to visit and walk around Colegiales, Chacarita and Villa Crespo... less touristy barrios with a lot of charm that not many tourists get to see. Walking around now, I see the graffiti, street art and stencils a lot differently now than I did before.

Graffitimundo - another way of seeing BA. The tour of Graffitimundo was asome! Not only did you get to see parts of Buenos Aires which you normally wouldn't visit as a tourist but also I was overwhelmed of the talent of the different artists which are active in the city. The guide itself was really good and did here story with a lot of humor. You get to know the history of graffiti in BA and a lot of information about the different artists. I can recommend this to everybody who visits BA and want's to see the city in a different perspective.

Outstanding Experience. We spent an afternoon with Kristen from Graffitimundo photographing street art in Buenos Aires. She is very knowledgeable about the artists and knows just where to find the best work, which is generally in locations you would never find yourself. We had a great experience and would highly recommend this service.

like blending broccoli into cheese sauce.... ...which I mean in a good way! I work in a preschool in the US, and one of our tricks to get kids to eat healthy things is to blend them into other foods to trick them into eating them -- like broccoli into sauce for macaroni and cheese, for example. I hope the analogy's not too weird, but this tour was a bit like that! Let me explain -- I'm a doctoral student who has been traveling to Argentina periodically for about 5 years now for fieldwork. I have a reputation for being a total bore/nerd whenever Argentina comes up in conversation with my family and friends back home, rattling off historical and political facts that most people probably don't care about. My mom recently came to visit me in Buenos Aires, and she learned SO MUCH from this tour! All the political, social, historical stuff that I'd probably force upon her was made much more accessible in our guide's explanation of the street art we saw on our tour (broccoli in the sauce...). Super interesting presentation of the social history of the city! My mom and I both learned a lot, and came away from the tour with a new appreciation for street art. We were even able to recognize artists' work when we came across it later on in the city.Awesome tour, regardless of your interest in/knowledge of Argentine history, politics, art, etc. This is a great way to learn about the city without the cliche anecdotes and cheesy jokes you'd usually come across in a guided tour. Highly recommend this to anyone who has the slightest bit of curiosity about it!

Great Insights into BA History. This walking tour was one of the best things I did while in BA. I'm not a big tour person, but this one made me very grateful for giving it a chance. It's a small group and my tour guide spoke fluent English. It was overcast during our tour, so she brought along a small bus in case it started to rain. We learned why graffiti is such an important piece of their culture. In the states, it's usually considered vandalism, but in BA, it's a work of art and freedom of expression. I was amazed at the stories behind each piece. I think everyone should do this tour if they have the time.

Something different and fun to do. Three of us went on a private 3 hour tour with Ana going to different barrios and seeing the wonderful variety of street murals, learning about the artists and what they wanted to say or not say. This was a great way to see less touristy parts of city. The street art was colorful and fanciful and always provoked discussion among us. A different and rewarding experience. Glad we did it.

Eyes for you. Heart and soul of the artists shines through their wall art. The history of the pieces was brought to life by Cecilia.The eyes of the father haunt you long after you leave, the story of how they came to be tear at your heart. Thank you for inspiring me with Argentine street master graffiti art.

A real jewel of a tour!!. We had an eye-opening, exciting 3 hour guided tour with Cecilia last week while we were in BA!! She gave us insights that we never would have gotten as average American tourists (although we had another terrific "regular" guide for other areas in BA). After our tour with Cecilia, who did exactly what some of the other reviewers have reported, we began to see BA through much richer, more exciting lenses!! What a gift!! This is WELL-Worth your time. In addition, Cecilia sent us a list of "things we like", including their favorite galleries, shops, restaurants, cafes and other tours!! This is a "gold mine" for travelers to BA!!!

Enriching & entertaining. Great way to check out Buenos Aires - its culture, politics, history - from another angle. Stopped in to visit an artist in his studio, walked, and took a bus for a quick ride between neighborhoods. Ended at a really cool bar (check out the graffiti on the top terrace) which would be fun to hit at night.

Best ever!. This was by far my highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires! Cecelia was an amazing tour guide and the art we saw was awesome. During the tour we even got to go into one of the artist's studios and ask questions, this was a bonus! Definitely do this tour, you won't regret it.

Interesting & fun way to experience BsAs street art scene!. We recently travelled to Buenos Aires to introduce South America to our teenaged children. The Graffitimundo tour of street art was an amazing way to learn about the history of Argentina and its impact on popular culture. We all were really impressed by the artists' work and the way it comes to life on the streets of Buenos Aires. If you are looking for a unique experience, this is a wonderful surprise!

Fab & fun insight into BA's streetart scene. Definitely the best way to see the most fabulous pieces of street art in Buenos Aires and discover the stories behind them. Our guide Ana was very enthusiastic and knowledgable, we enjoying learning about Argentinas history too. A great tour to keep you entertained for the afternoon with the opportunity to make some new friends too.

Incredible Art - Great Fun. I read about Graffitimundo in the Insider's Guide to BsAs on the flight into AR and it sounded interesting. Once we were on the ground and connected I checked out the reviews here and decided it was a "must-do" for me and my girlfriend. What a cool tour! I think that we stayed in Palermo but hit a number of the sub-neighborhoods. The art is just incredible... Our tour guide, Melissa, was absolutely perfect. Not only is she super-knowledgeable about the street art and artists, she is genuinely enthusiastic about it. I highly recommend the tour! Be sure to bring water with you and wear comfortable shoes. This is such a different and fun activity!If you are coming to the tour from a different part of the city, plan to spend some time walking around the gallery after the tour ends.

Highlight of our visit to BA. With only 2½ days in Buenos Aires I was reluctant to use 3 hours for a tour. And, foolishly, I thought we could research the art, hail a cab and discover what we liked on our own. After doing a little of that on Sunday morning in Barracas, we were hooked and wanted to see and understand more about these walls of art. We called Graffitimundo Sunday night and by 9:30 the next morning Cecilia and a driver were there to give us a tour before we caught our plane back to Vancouver. Her enthusiasm, intelligence and inside knowledge of the evolution-after-the revolution of this art form and its creators made the tour the highlight of our trip. I recommend visiting Graffitimundo’s website in advance and plan to return to it frequently to keep up with the endeavours of this bright young company. Lucky Argentinians: tours are free for you on Sundays.

A truely unique Buenos Aires experience...unforgettable!. I had never taken a graffiti tour before signing up for Graffitimundo so I didn't know what to expect. But this tour has changed the way I look at graffiti/street art and the way I think about artists interacting with a city. I learned for example that a "tag" next to a work of art is like a "Like" on facebook, it means another artist approves. But a tag over the center of a mural is a dislike. I also love learning the history of street art in Argentina and Buenos Aires and how the culture is much more open there. At the end, at the gallery of local stencil artists, I bought a great piece for my wall at home and a great gift for friends in B.A. Bravo Graffitimundo!

A great way to share the City's graffiti art with a group of friends. We did a private tour for a group of 12 friends, which was by mini-bus. Everything ran like clockwork - Cynthia could not have been more friendly, helpful and knowledgable. We just loved the tour. It was very interesting to learn all about how the culture formed and how it has evolved. The artwork itself is inspiring and in some cases mind-blowing. It's a great way to see parts of the city that you would never think of going to and really brings to life the urban street-scape. It's one of the highlights of my group's trip to Buenos Aires - you must do it!

A great way to spend an afternoon in BA.. Ever since I saw Banksy's documentary "Exit Through the Gift Shop" I've been fascinated by graffiti and street art. BA has a vast amount of interesting and colourful art on walls around the city. In order to have a better understanding of how and why it's there I highly recommend the graffitimundo tour. Our fabulous guide Ana was informative and very personable. She taught us a lot about the socio-political history of this art form as well as telling us about the local artists. The tour ends at a great bar called the Post which has a terrific gallery where you can buy pieces, many from artists who's work you see on the tour. If you only do one tour in BA, make it this one!

Unique and enjoyable tour in Buenos Aires. A very interesting tour of a different aspect of the city. If you like art, or you want to learn about political expression in Buenos Aires, or you want to know more about graffiti and street art in general, then this is the tour for you. In the space of 3 hours, our guide educated us about the nuances of what we saw. Before the tour I can say I knew very little about this topic - I left feeling much more informed. The tour gives visitors a chance to see different neighborhoods they might otherwise not explore. The art is amazing - varied, with different styles and techniques. Our guide was friendly, enthusiastic and highly informative. I highly recommend this tour.

Tremendously Interesting. An eye-opening tour of street art with observations regarding transition of style. If you like wandering cityscapes and have had enough of the routine museum programs, try this tour!!

Enjoyable way to get acquainted/explore Buenos Aires. This graffiti tour is a really great way to see another side of the city. For people fresh off the plane, so to speak, it can double as a way to get your bearings with some of Buenos Aires' neighborhoods. For veterans of the city, it's a way to see neighborhoods you might not have explored. The art itself is fascinating and varied. Our guide, Sorcha, was amazing. She gave us the inside scoop on the origin of a lot of the art, including some history and controversy (which are plentiful in Buenos Aires). I personally thought the bus component was unnecessary; I'd have been fine walking the whole thing or eliminating some neighborhoods if we had to...

Fantastic Street Art Experience. If you are headed to Buenos Aires, you must make a tour of their street art a priority. It's like nothing else you will experience. And using a knowledgable tour company is the best way to see it all. They provided context and history, making the experience far more enjoyable.

Amazing Tour. Graffitimundo offers several tours and me and my boyfriend decided to do the biketour. I enjoyed it very much and it was really nice going by bike and seeing all the places you otherwise would never have seen! Highly recommendable!

BRILLIANT! :-). This was a fabulous tour! I knew a little about street Art already, although our guide (Ana) was so knowledgeable that I learnt a lot more! Amazing work & great to hear the stories & history behind the pieces!! What an incredible project!... Go Grafittimundo go!!!

Must-do. Very nice tour around Palerma and some other neighbourhoods where you wouldnt come as a tourist.The guides know a lot about the art and the artists.I definitely recommend this tour! Was a nice way to learn more about the city.

Great way to check out cool city graffiti. Informative tour guides, great locations and mind blowing graffiti! They have a bus so you aren't walking the whole time. You end up at a bar that has graffiti all over the walls and you can buy art work from the actual graffiti artists you learned about -super cool
Amazing Tour. I really enjoyed this tour, learned a lot about graffiti and his history in BsAs, if you like street art must do this!!
Great way to see BA. With this tour you dont only see good street art you will also see Buenos Aires from a different view. Defenitely worth the money!

Really great. Graffitimundo is a great way to spend an afternoon checking out a side of BA you never would have seen. The tour guides are extremely knowledgeable, and this ended up not being a trip only about street art, but also about the history and culture of Argentina. I found it to be a little pricey, but well worth while. Considering BA is famous for its street art this really is a must-do.

A new way to see it!. I admit, I thought it was vandalism or something like that. Then I took this tour, beatifully guided, and it changed completely my perspective about murales. It is art! And seying it with Graffiti Mundo is also a great way to walk the city in a "non-conventional" way. I would not include it in the "visit buenos aires in 1 day" program (unless there is a specific interest) but is mandatory in "visit buenos aires in 5 days" program. Enjoy!!
Great way to BA. Great way to see a different part of Buenos Aires. Learned a lot. We had a great tour guide, really enjoyed the afternoon.

A great experience!. This 3 hour walking tour is an unusual experience and exposes you to another aspect of the Buenos Aires art scene. Our guide, Anna, was enthusiastic and knowledgible, and conducted a well-paced tour. She took us through the dappled streets of Palermo, showing us graffiti and explaining the significance of the work in reference to the evolution of styles and the motivation of the artists. We stopped at a Japanese restaurant for a comfort break and to view the works of an artist who did the exteriors and interiors. The tour concluded at a cafe and gallery where all the pieces of graffiti on display were for sale at very afforabe prices,I suggest this tour for people who want to get an insight into the contemporary scene and appreciate the cultural diversity of the city. Unusual and fun!

Fun and interesting. A little too long.. This was a really interesting look at the country's and the city's political history in street art. There was a description and differentiation among graffiti, tagging, and street art in the beginning, and I think that the idea of tagging was a bit glorified and romanticized by the tour guide, who was very young. Most in the group, myself included, felt that tagging is detrimental and inconsiderate, which seemed to cause a little bit of tension, but nothing that couldn't be overcome. The tour was interesting, although perhaps a bit longer than it needed to be. It ended in an artists' gallery/bar, but it was a very low pressure environment where you didn't feel forced to buy anything if you didn't want to. Overall, I'm glad we did the tour.
Super interesting!!!. No need for long descriptions- this tour is awesome.Places you wouldn't have seen otherwise. The guide was very informative and passionate, we enjoyed our tour a lot!

Great tour to begin your Buenos Aires experience. Very interesting tour with great guides. Not only do you learn the history of graffiti and street art in Buenos Aires, you also get a quick tour of several popular neighborhoods. It was nice to become acquainted with Palermo and Colegiales at the very beginning of our trip.

A different but great way to explore BA. We spent an afternoon with graffiti undo exploring street art in Buenos Aires by foot and mini bus. My friend is not particularly into arts but went with me as a favor. She absolutely loved the tour! The art is impressive, the stories behind each piece even more so. Our guide was super enthusiastic and really brought the stories to life. It is a great way to see the city and get a different perspective on Buenos Aires as well as Argentinian history and culture. By the end, we were able to identify the styles of different artists which is really fun if you continue to explore the city on your own afterwards. A must tour for street art lovers but also a great way to see the city for everybody else. At the end, we also received a list of recommendations by the local graffiti undo team on what to do and see in Buenos Aires which is a great reference to have for those who just arrived in BA.

Enjoyable & informative. Really enjoyed this tour, with a mix of history about the artists, discussion of techniques etc. Our guide (Cecilia, I think) was clearly really interested in the art herself which helped. We missed out on visiting the artists' studio which was a real shame, but we still enjoyed the afternoon.
Excellent tour . Really enjoyed the tour. Fee was very inexpensive. Book ahead as it is small groups. Met 3 of the artists in their studio- really interesting and fun.

Great tour; informative and different. We took the hidden walls tour. Very cheap at around $30 per person. Our guide, Cecilia, speaks excellent English and is very knowledgable. The tour starts at the Fondacion PROA modern art museum in La Boca. Leave some time to explore the streets around the museum on your own. On the tour you learn about the history of La Boca and its brightly colored buildings, a home of poor immigrants who worked in the docks and shipyards. We first walked to some street art near the museum, and Ceci explained the history of street art and wall painting and the different techniques. It is definitely not just ugly tagging with spray cans, although you see a lot of that also. Wall painting is a political and cultural condition, and may walls are painted with the consent of the owners of the buildings. We then got into a van and looked at street art and colorful exteriors in other parts of the city. Lasts about 3 hours. You will see parts of the city you will otherwise miss and learn a lot about street art and artists.
Graffitimundo tour. A very good tour and very very good guide!!!3 hour in the street at watch graphites and street arts!!
Fantastic experience. It was a great experience, very inexpensive and they explain the background of street art. It is highly recommended and it's different than regular tour.

Fantastic Tour. The tour of graffiti and street art was one of the best tours I have taken anywhere. Anna did a fabulous job of weaving the art, politics, history and nuances of the community to provide a great tour. She was very well versed, informed and provided insights that brought the art alive. Argentina is such a colorful place and the graffiti and street art has become a large part of the culture here. Definitely not to be missed!
Engaging both historically and socially. I just finished the tour and Anna was very informed and engaged. The tour will be on my list of recommendations. Brilliant job.

Learn why street art sets Buenos Aires apart. We had a fascinating tour with Ana that taught us the historical, sociopolitical, and artistic contexts for Buenos Aires' incredible street art scene. Ana was interesting, engaging, and well-informed. It was a great way to explore neighborhoods a little off the beaten path and take a closer look at the art all around the city. We also got to meet one of the artists at his studio! I highly recommend this unique tour.

Such a great tour. For anyone interested in street art and its link with the history of Buenos Aires.... Cecilia, our guide, knew all kind of stories. She is funny, easygoing, passionate about the art and the artists, which makes things even more interesting. A full 3 hours tour that gives you a lot for your money.

Street Art Crawl. Excellent, educational tour gave us insight into the history and present of the Buenos Aires street art scene. Featuring extremely talented artists and ending at a cool artist-studio bar! Happy to support the scenexeb

Street art in Buenos Aires. Had time to take a tour of street art with Graffitimundo in Buenos Aires. Very interesting and informative. Guide gave us background story of graffiti in Buenos Aires as she walked around city in Palermo area. She translated and explained political slogans. Tour lasts about 3 hours. She promoted an appreciation of this living art form.

What is the difference between graffiti and street art?. This does not feel like a commercial tour, but rather a gathering of people interested in art and artistic expression. Anna was our guide. She is an Argentinian journalist passionate about public expression and exhibition of art. The tour takes about 3 hours and includes walking as well as a mini-bus for getting around more quickly. The tour is very educational as it gives political and social context to the art and graffiti that you'll see everywhere in Buenos Aires (except for Recoleta). A great way to spend an afternoon.

Beautiful Art, Great People!. I went on the Hidden Walls tours a couple weeks back and had an amazing time. Cecilia, our tour guide, was very knowledgeable on the subject of graffiti art in the city; You could see the passion she has for the subject. She's also just a lovely person to talk to over a beer when the tour is over. I liked this particular tour because it showed areas of the city you wouldn't normally see!!! Highly Recommended.

Enjoyed it so much!. I had a friend visiting from the US and I arranged a private graffiti tour with Ana. She was so knowledgable and enthusiastic, we could have spent the entire day with her. We have a greater appreciation and understanding for the street art in Buenos Aires. She even arranged for us to visit one of the artists studios and peek inside a closed door restaurant. Thank you Ana! This was a fantastic way to spend a morning in BA!

One of the best things we did in BA. So glad that we decided to take this trip, and that we took it very early on in our visit. Doing much more than bringing to life the gorgeous murals you'll see on almost every Buenos Aires street, it's an absolutely crucial insight into contemporary Argentine socio-political history. Ana, our guide, established a very clear context for the city and its history - why the right to take the streets back is important for its citizens. We found it essential to properly understanding the city.

A Fantastic Way to Spend an Afternoon in Buenos Aires.. I went on the 'Hidden Walls' tour on Saturday with Cecilia as our guide. It was a really interesting way to see parts of the city you would never usually go to, learn a bit about the history of graffiti in the city and see current art work on the walls. Cecilia was very knowledgeable and provided us with lots of interesting information. It was exciting as we hopped in and out of the van in old industrial areas. We started out in La Boca and ended up in a cool, art-filled bar in Palermo Soho. It was definitely worth doing and I'd definitely recommend it to anyone coming here who is interested in art.

The highlight of my trip. A friend recommended this tour and I am so glad he did! I did the "Hidden Walls" tour. I had a hard time choosing between the tour options, but ultimately went with this one since I wanted to see more areas of the city. I was not disappointed. We visited a number of neighborhoods I definitely would not have seen on my own. Our guide, Cecilia, was very friendly, accessible, warm and engaged. In fact, at the end of the tour our group shared drinks and snacks together at the art gallery/pub where the tour ends.I am sure the other tours are just as good, so you won't be disappointed in whichever you choose. I think the Hidden Walls is perhaps more time on the bus, as you cover a big area of the city, and the other one might be more walking, though I am not sure of that. In any case, I learned a lot about art, Buenos Aires history and neighborhoods, and met interesting people!I first contacted the group via email and they were very helpful and responsive in helping me prepare for the trip. I paid on-line beforehand and got a 10% discount.

Great way to get to know Palermo and learn more about the city. A wonderful tour and a great way to explore the city. I was pleased to find out that a few of the stops on my own personal itinerary were part of the tour (post bar and the brilliant hollywood in cambodia gallery). Our tour guide, Melissa, was amazing as well. Her knowledge and passion for the street art scene in Buenos Aires was overflowing and infectious, it was such a pleasure meeting her and having her as our guide. The tour itself was just the right amount of time and a perfect way to spend a nice sunday afternoon, the mate break was also a nice touch. I certainly highly recommend this tour and will likely be taking it again myself with visiting friends!

Awesome!. This tour was absolutely incredible! It was so cool to learn more about the cultural context behind the graffiti, and our guides were excellent! My friends and I went on this tour today after having lived here for over 3 months, but we saw many parts of the city I haven't seen yet, which was great. I highly recommend it!

Graffiti Galore. Our guide Melissa was a fountain of knowledge. Her passion about the street art and artists was infectious and her knowledge of art in general was also evident.The Graffitimundo tour is a must for any one remotely interested in art. The quality of work shown and the behind the scenes info on the murals, stencils, artists etc was very informative. One of the best things we have done in BA.

A must when visiting Buenos Aires. I cannot rate this tour highly enough. It was absolutely brilliant. Well organised and executed and finishing at a gallery set up by the street artist's work we were looking at where you are able to purchase pieces if you wish. But what really made the tour was our tour guide Melissa. It was obvious and pleasing to see that she is so incredibly passionate and enthusiastic about her work and that really made the tour stand out. We even got to meet one of the local artists in his studio and then others at the gallery. Keep up the the fantastic work guys!!!
Graffitimundo. This was a very informative tour. The street art was amazing. Anna was our guide and we learnt a lot. Well worth it. We were lucky enough to meet one of the street artist's too!

really brilliant! I can't recommend this enough!. I had done a lot of walking around/photographing already on my own so I nearly didn't bother with the tour but then I saw they had an 'off the beaten track' version on a Saturday and I'm SO glad I went on it because I learnt lots, saw bits of the city I just wouldn't have got to otherwise and I was also lucky enough to get to meet a local artist and go inside her home/gallery which was completely decorated by all her street artist friends! This is something I just wouldn't have seen if I hadn't gone on the tour!

You NEED to go on this tour.. I arrived in Buenos Aires 3 weeks ago, but this tour really introduced me to a parts of the city (barrios, history) that I never would have seen! The tour guide was dynamic, funny, warm and a great storyteller. She told us all about the history of street art, its trajectory and significance in Buenos Aires, and the stories/meanings behind all of the pieces we saw. Our tour was on a really chilly day, but with the walking and the short stints on the bus between neighborhoods, the three hours flew by. We were lucky enough to visit a studio in Palermo where several street artists work, and the tour ended at Post St. Bar, where we grabbed a drink and enjoyed even more art (indoors) in the funky gallery/bar. The tour was one of the highlights of my time in BA so far. If you like art in general, you'll really like this tour. I'd seen Exit Through the Gift Shop before the tour, so I was really excited. It exceeded my expectations. I learned so much and the group was fun, too! I'm a college student on exchange here, but there were people of all ages on the tour. Definitely do it!

Fantastic tour with a unique view of the city. This is such a great tour that not only gives you an insight into the art world of Buenos Aires, but also delves into recent political and financial history of the city. It is such a unique aspect of BA and the tour includes many insights into both the art and the artists that you would otherwise have no way of ever knowing. Highly recommended day out - something a bit different from the run of the mill tourist circuit.

A New Look at BA. One of the best tours I have been on. Melissa was pleasantly refreshing as a guide. You get to see some of the neighborhoods a tourist would never get to and this is worth it in itself. A must do!
best art tour. Best street art tour in BA! They were so accommodating when we had to change our dates around. This tour will leave you very in the know, it is a great operation.

Interesting take on the history of Argentina through street art. If you're a fan of street art, or art in general, I definitely recommend this tour. It was really interesting for me to learn how street art has come to be in Argentina, especially seeing how different the movement is here in comparison with my home country. I also really enjoyed how the tour touched on some of the history of the country and how that affected or was reflected in the street art scene. Definitely worth checking out!

Graffititastic. I decided to do the 'Hidden Walls' tour. It was a great decision. This really did show you some of the hidden parts of Buenos Aires. The street art is spectacular and our guide (Kirsty) provided us with in-depth knowledge of the social history of Argentina - as this often explained why the street art had been created in the first place. She was also clearly passionate about the subject matter and the artists. The tour is well organised and well worth the money, which goes to help the artists themselves.

BA street art and social history. This is a good quality tour that takes you through several suburbs of BA reviewing street art, getting an opportunity to see more of the city, and learning more about the social history of Argentina. It is good value and very interesting. Melissa, our guide, was good, but does talk a bit! We also visited several artist studios and met the artists. Quite a bit of walking, and a bus provided to get to far away suburbs.
great staff!. one of a kind experience from fun knowledgable staff, i did both walking hidden walls tour and bike tour and had a good time. different insight to Buenos Aires art culture

One of the more interesting/unique things to do in Buenos Aires. I arranged this tour as I love street art; my husband didn't expect that he would enjoy it as much as he did. We did the ‘Hidden Walls’ tour on foot and minibus. The minibus was good as it obviously enabled us to cover a lot of ground compared to walking. There was plenty of knowledge/information about the artists but no real information about the techniques (compared to ‘Valpo Street Art Tours’ where graffiti styles and the techniques to achieve them were explained). The tour finished at Post Street Bar which itself is an awesome venue worthy of a visit to check out all the stencil/graffiti work on the walls. Definitely one of the more interesting and unique things you can do in Buenos Aires.

Completely exceeded expectations. I arranged this tour after reading about it in the NYT (my nephew, with whom i was traveling) is an art major and loves street art, but I didn't expect that I would enjoy (and learn) so much myself! Our tour guide was Melissa, and she did an amazing job of speaking about the work we saw. The tour itself lasted about three hours, and we even got to visit the studio of one of the artists whose work we saw. The day ended at a really cool bar where the walls were entirely covered in stencil art, and we had the opportunity to purchase some pieces by the artists we'd seen...which we did. It really was one of the coolest things we did in BA.

Seeing Buenos Aires in a different way. What a fun way to see the city! This is like the art history class you always wanted to take--or at least I did. Our guide did more than show us art, she put it all into context, giving us the history of Argentina blended with the history of street art in Buenos Aires. We took the group tour, which is a walking and mini-bus tour of parts of the city you might not otherwise venture into. I loved hearing about each artist, their style, how they started painting, etc. A great way to spend 3 hours of your visit here, and a great way to experience the vibrancy of this city. Tip: email graffitimundo directly to snag a spot on a tour. You will get a confirmation plus a link for payment. If you pay in advance--and you can use Paypal!--you get a discount and don't have to worry about payment at your tour. Group tours are currently only held three days each week, so plan in advance.

Best tour E V E R !. You canNOT visit Buenos Aires without doing this tour. It's phenomenal. The guide greets you and is SO personable! You feel so welcomed to ask any questions. You explore neighborhoods you'd never find yourself in on your own. You get to see a side of life in BA that you might not normally see. Plus, it's like a free 3-hour art history class. The guide is SO knowledgeable about the art, the artists, the interpretation of each piece of work. Halfway through, you get a mini-bus to zip you around to different areas. And you visit an artist's workshop. And a street-art bar with gallery and local street artist. It's just unbelievably great!!! DO IT!
