Fascinating glimpse into BA street art!. We loved the Graffitimundo tour through several Buenos Aires neighborhoods where we saw public/urban/street art that we would not otherwise have seen. Our tour guide, Melissa, was wonderful. She is clearly knowledgeable and passionate about her subject, and her lively explanations put the street art---so new to us---into context, helping us understand and ultimately appreciate it so much more than we ever could have before.In addition to learning a lot about urban art in BA, the trip was great fun! Highly recommended!!

Best tour in BA!. If you have time check out this tour. It is worth every penny, you get to check out artwork throughout Palermo and get an insight into pockets that you probably would have missed otherwise. Our guide Melissa was amazing- so friendly, knowledgeable and fun! Ten out of ten tour!
street art on steroids. We are still raving about this tour a month after our visit to Argentina. If you like art, do it as a walking or bicycle tour.

Best tour of BA!. We did the graffiti bike tour, which is linked with Biking BA.It was such a good day! Our guide was Melissa, who was amazing. She knew so much about the art, as well as about the artists themselves. Nathan also came with us. He was really good to talk to, looked after our bikes, and made us some mate to try. Both Melissa and Nathan were so nice, and I loved the laid back vibe if the tour. The cycling was easy, with heaps of stops, and plenty of time for photos and questions.Great way to see more of BA too. Thanks for an amazing day!

Best part of our trip to BA!. We booked a private tour with graffitimundo and had an amazing time. Cecilia was the consummate hostess, and taught us not only about the street art and artists, but about the political history of the art in BA society. She was so well-versed in the art and the artists, and clearly has a great love for her job and the relationships that have developed because of it. She was generous with her time and we never felt we were asking too many questions or touching on anything too sensitive or out of her realm of interest. Her enthusiasm was absolutely infectious. We ended our tour at the graffitimundo gallery and bought an awesome piece of art, which will forever remind us of our trip to this gorgeous and vibrant city. We also loved hanging out at the bar in the evenings, which has a great rooftop deck with walls filled with examples of the art we saw on our tour. I highly recommend spending your time and money with graffitimundo--it was completely wonderful in every way.

Grreat experience. The tour guide was very passionate and informative and allowed plenty of time to take pictures. It was well run and organised giving a great insight into the urban art/ graffitti scene in Buenos Aires, a great way to spend the afternoon and at a good price.

Highly recommend!. This fascinating, informal and relaxed tour opens up the world of the street art of Buenos Aires, while exploring different barrios and learning about the city and its history. Kirsty, our fantastic guide was more than willing to answer questions and discuss any topics that arose. Great afternoon activity to discover this fabulous city through a different viewpoint.

Very interesting and informative. I got a very good insight into Buenos Aires' culture from this tour. Hearing the origins of some of the street art, we also learned about the history of the country. It was really cool for me to know what the "Nestornauta" was when I saw him on flags later in the week! Of course, a lot of the art is also just cool or fun.I actually did not stay for the whole tour because I had caught some kind of bug and just had no energy, but I was surprised at how much more I knew after only one hour!

Great art experience. We were pleasantly surprised by the amazing art we got to see on the Graffitimundo tour. The minivan took us around several BA neighborhoods and we got to see many hidden gems as well as get a greater understanding of the city's street art scene and history, Our tour guide was very upbeat and knowledgeable, and eager to answer our questions. Great way to spend an afternoon!

Art galore. This was an excellent tour. Led by Melinda,a personable and knowledgeable guide. She gave us a really good insight to the Street Art scene in Buenos Aires and her background stories were very entertaining. As a Visual Arts teacher (from Australia) I found this invaluable. Not only was the art interesting but the insight into the areas of BA where it is found were helpful also. The little book they give at the end had some great bars and restaurants as well as little galleries. I loved the Bar/Gallery where the tour ended Hollywood in Cambodia and I purchased some great works there at a good price.Overall this is an excellent insight into the Street Art scene in particular and Buenos Aires in general. Being a combination of walking and mini-bus rides made it easy to really enjoy the 3 hours. Great value for money. Do it!!

good art, bad empanadas. my review is in-line with most of the others here. a very good tour that exceeded my expectations. it was great learning to view the city from a different perspective and it was more educational than i anticipated. naive of me to think street art here did not have it's own history and evolution.our guide's name was christy (kristy? i think...) and she was great. our tour was on a rainy day but she maintained enthusiasm and kept us going when we could have easily been lackadaisical from being cold and wet.a few of us bought empanadas from a local shop. the empanadas were not good. but this is not graffitimundo's fault.

colourful and interesting. The tour started at 3pm and lasted more or less 3 hours, also in a minivan who "carried" you to other barrios. It was really interesting and educational. Cecilia, our guide, was very friendly and motivated and you could ask her everything. I didn't know much about street art, but now I look closer at paintings on the wall :).I wish them success with their upcoming movies, books, and more!

Really fun and dare I say, educational?. Besides seeing the coolest street art in town, we learned the history of graffiti in Buenos Aires and about the artists themselves. This tour was a highlight of our visit and we were stoked to be able to purchase a piece by Stencil Land to take home. Cecilia was our guide and she was informative, fun, and very charismatic.

Great VIP tour!. My friend & I were only in BA for a few days when they didn't have their group tour available so we took a private tour with Cecilia. Her insight was great & we really felt like we got to experience BA in a unique way. She was very insightful on the street art scene in BA from its origins to the present. Highlights were meeting one of the artists as well as visiting an artist's studio. Great way to explore BA!

A highlight of any stay in Buenos Aires. A great way to see parts of BA you wouldn't normally see as a tourist - and of course some absolutely incredible art work. There is a large variety of graffiti and street art on the tour, and I found all of it seriously impressive. The tour was very well structured; our guide was extremely friendly and she explained the history of the art work in the city and it's connections to the political backdrop in a way which was very engaging ( just the right amount of info). Absolutely fab to meet in of the artists at work in his studio and head to the Post bar afterwards for a look around the gallery. I will be back on day for certain to buy some work when I am not limited to backpack space!Well worth the price, especially given it is a non - profit tour.

One of the best short tours in Argentina. Thoroughly enjoyed this half day tour through Buenos Aires. We did the Hidden Walls tour on 24 March. Found the artwork fantastic and the guide to be very detailed in the explanation of the artists and the areas we were visiting. This was excellent value and I would recommend to anyone visiting BA.

A Different Perspective on BA. I took the 3 hour walking tour with Cecilia a couple of days ago and I loved it.Before I took the tour I thought all wall art in BA was vandalism but after having taken the tour I learned that so much of what is on the walls in the different neighborhoods was wanted by the owners of the houses/businesses and that some was commissioned as well. I loved learning about each of the artists influences and different styles. Cecilia was so knowledgable and respectful of the artist and delivered 110% in a fun, enthusiastic way.Naomi

Great tour!. My wife and I were recommended this tour by friends of ours and they were bang on! We did the Hidden Walls tour. The tour took us through some different neighborhoods in BA and showed us some very cool street art. The guide was amazing: very knowledgeable and passionate about the street art! Highlight was the San Lorenzo (I hope that is right) alley with its amazing tilework. A great way to see some different parts of the city. Unique and Cool! Highly recommend

A MUST in Buenos Aires!. Grafiti Mundo is an absolute must and was my favorite thing in Buenos Aires. It's very unique and led by local street artists. It's not a tour and at the end you get to meet some of the artists in their studio. It was very interesting learning about the differences between grafiti, street art and tagging and you get to see a ton of great grafiti and street art! Buenos Aires is a hot spot for this. If you're looking for a unique and authentic experience, this is a great way to learn more about the Argentine culture.

Amazing tour of BA street art. We took a 4 hour bike tour of the street art of Buenos Aires with an expert from graffitimundo. The tour stopped in front of murals by the best known street artists of BA. The guide was fun, informative and passionate about BA and the street artists and their work. It was a blast.

Awesome tour and team!. The Graffiti Mundo tour was recommended by a friend of mine who is originally from Buenos Aires (an old friend had started it, he said). Well, I was with my parents and didn't know what to expect, but we had a blast!! We learned so much about street art in BA and even had a chance to peek into the studio of a local legend, who was busy at work. While we might have seen a few of these murals while walking around town, we wouldn't have learned so much or enjoyed the art nearly as much as after having taken this tour. Muchas gracias!

Great, different view of Buenos Aires' recent history. The other reviews have covered nearly everything, so just a few comments:I took the group tour on Easter weekend, so the city was nice and quiet, but the artists weren’t in their studios. We did get to see one studio shared by several artists, leaf through some books about street art in Buenos Aires, see some sketches and paintings, and visit with the resident cats.Perhaps because it was a holiday weekend, the tour wasn’t full although I emailed only the day before. I was able to pay online using PayPal, which gave me a discount of several dollars and allowed me to keep my pesos to use for other expenses.Ana was a fantastic, knowledgeable guide. After the tour I stayed to buy a print and met another guide, an Aussie whose name I can’t recall, and she was just as affable. On the tour I also met a very friendly Argentine freelance writer who gave me Buenos Aires travel tips, and we traded email and blog addresses.The tour is appropriate for everyone from street art experts to those who know nothing about Argentina beyond Madonna in “Evita.” I’ve been studying (and teaching) Argentine history and culture for more than 2 years, and I consider myself well-versed in contemporary politics and civil society movements there, but I learned a number of things on this tour that I’d never heard before (about the “football mafia” and about recently deceased former president Néstor Kirchner, for example). Ana was also good at addressing larger, more philosophical questions about street art vs. tagging, public art on private property, and the like.The Graffitimundo group is currently filming a documentary, “White Walls Say Nothing,” about the city’s street art scene and its history. I’m looking forward to seeing it when it’s completed, and the next time I’m in the city, I’ll take Graffitimundo’s Hidden Walls tour.

Great way to get to know Buenos Aires. The Graffiti Mundo is a great way to get to know the city behind the more touristic (but nice) sights. We were taken by minibus through the city and our guide Cecilia was very insightful and the tour wa packed with nice stories. Her English was excellent. The only drawback was that the tour was full the day I would have preferred, so book in advance. The highlight was visiting two of the street art-artist's own studios. There's also a possibility to buy some art at the end of the tour. Also, one last thing, you get a really good booklet with tips on other nice places in BA.

Highlight of the trip!. Graffitimundo tour was DEFINITELY one the highlights of the 2 weeks in Argentina. Our guide "Ana" was excellent. Very knowledgeable, engaging and fun! A more interesting perspective and off the beaten path look at Buenos Aires and the driving forces behind this artistic expression. I look forward to the documentary!

Graffitmundo. Definitely a great addition to our destinations on the trip. Everyone who visits Buenos Aires sees the major highlights, but this was a way of seeing the city in a different and exciting way. Our tour guide was lovely and very knowledgeable, and it was a lot of fun for our daughters as well, who are 20 and 14. So glad that their business card was at our hotel, Fierro. Certainly a very worthwhile and alternative way to spend a late afternoon seeing some art and great neighborhoods. People on our tour were literally from all over the world.

Great, interesting tour. In my recent visit to Buenos Aires, I joined the Graffiti Tour and it was a blast!Not only our guide Melissa was so enjoyable, but also very prepared with a lot ofbackground stories about the areas and the artists.Oh did I mention that the tour was more than 3 hours and VERY extensive?We visited, by minibus some areas that I would not venture by myself and saw some great art!I enjoyed taking lots of photos of the graffiti and met some other interesting, art-oriented people.Loved it! Highly suggested.

An whole new side of Buenos Aires. Our lovely guide - who also spoke great English - took us to places and streets in Buenos Aires I never would have seen otherwise, and that's not because we were heading into 'sketchy' districts - just because theses places are off the tourist trail! And what a shame... Some of this graffiti is stunning. A real cut above the Banksys and everyone else working back in Europe (or at least I thought so!). Great to see such incredible artwork, and to have stories and information from someone who not only knew the area, but also the artists themselves and their histories. This is more than just graffiti - it's street art, and some of the sheer aesthetics are stunning. The political history behind this work is also fascinating, and something you'd struggle to learn from a guidebook or history of Buenos Aires. The day was fun, informative and a great time - highly recommended!

A Must Do!. I had read the great reviews (including its inclusion in the NY Times' 36 Hours series), but wasn't rushing to take the tour because street art didn't seem that interesting to me -- a mistake. While you will definitely see some great art by any definition, you will also get a much better understanding of the culture and political history/baggage of Buenos Aires, which is the reason that graffiti is so prevalent (and has a totally different context and connotation than in the US). While the street artists might be members of the "alternative BA", the graffiti is about all of the city and even the country. My only regret is that we did this on the last day of our trip when it would have been far better to have had the perspective earlier. Our whole family (me, my husband and kids ages 16, 18 and 20) all loved the tour (younger kids would also like it). It really is a "must do".

Wow, what an eye opener. You see a lot of street art/graffiti in BA. This little non profit opens your eyes to the scene, artists, lifestyle and more. You meet some of the artists and go to their artists run bar. We bought a piece that will sit nicely on our living room wall.

Great way to see a different aspect of BA. We love street art, and the tour was very informative and Ana gave a great historical background to the relatively young scene in BA.
It's a great way to see the alternative BA.

Best tour in Buenos Aires. I took my parents and boyfriend on this tour and everybody loved it. My dad was a little hesitant at first because he wasn't sure he was interested in seeing graffiti. Since the tour he has been pointing out different street artist all around town. I highly recommend this tour and Mimi was a fantastic guide. Very knowledgable and easy to understand.

Fascinating. Two friends and I signed up for the afternoon group tour that involved walking and a shuttle bus. I really enjoyed learning about the history of legal street art and looking up close at beautiful graffiti around the city. Following the tour, I purchased a neat illustration at the Post Bar gallery from an artist named Malatesta.My only gripe is that registering for the tour was a slight pain. Rather than having an online form listing dates, times, and locations, you have to email Graffiti Mundo to figure out tour availability and the meeting point. I wasn't connected much to my email during the trip but had to keep an eye on it to confirm the tour details.I think these tours would be even more popular if the sign-up process was easier. (This, of course, is coming from someone who works on website design and user experience for a living!)

Great Tour. I went on this tour as part of my journalism class and I thought it was great! The tour guide seemed really passionate about the art and was able to answer everyones questions. We saw a bunch of cool stuff and got a lot of information! We even got to visit the studio of some of the artists.

Awesome!. Did a biking tour that was so much fun! One of the highlights of our stay in Buenos Aires. Tour guide was super knowledgeable and felt super comfortable on bikes with the 'bikingbuenosaires' guys. Highly recommend!!! :)

Favourite Tour in BA!. This graffiti tour covers a lot of work with combined walking and bus transportation. Cecilia was such a fun and engaging guide. Lots of great photos of a wide array of artwork. Picked up an original piece at the gallery, too! Highly recommend this tour!

A very good tour. Great walking tour especially if you love street art. We spent quite some time hearing about the artists, and getting to know their work. Then we were picked up by a van for the next location and ended in a pub/art space. Very well run, super reasonable price, and great fun. I learned a lot and got great pictures. Thanks

Eye opening eye candy. What a great way to spend our first afternoon in BA! (Even in the heat.) Melissa was a great guide. So enthusiastic and informative. The things we learned from her made the rest of our stay in BA so much better. And the ART is Amazing, really mind-boggling.

Best thing I did in BsAs. I spent 3 weeks in BsAs over winter break with my law school. To say we had a wonderful time is a major understatement. However, without question, this tour was the highlight of my trip. It is wonderfully run, super informative, and really in step with the artist community. Totally worth it. Also, the studio at POST Bar is glorious. Go. Go now!

It's a Street Art Museum, not Graffiti!!!. My wife and I signed up for the "graffiti" tour because we had an extra morning in Buenos Aires and were looking for something different. Graffiti where we come from (NYC) has a negative connotation to it and is not necessarily considered an art form. We were more than pleasantly surprised when Cecilia took us on a tour of some of the best art we saw while in Buenos Aires, at least comparable to those works in the Malba museum. I recommend this tour to anyone interested in art and getting a glimpse of tomorrow's leading Argentinian artists.

Not all the best Buenos Aires art is in museums.. Our experience with Ana viewing the amazing street art placed around town by a group of passionate and talented artists shows the possibility of a new, youthful vibrancy to an old city. They interpret all things political, social and personal using both aerosol and stencil applications. Not to be missed.

FANTASTIC!. First I have to say what really helped this tour was my tour guide Melissa. It makes such a difference when a person has such passion and knowledge in talking about the artists, and the urban art culture scene. Especially with the explanation of Jazzy, and his thought process behind his work. It was incredible. The pictures are vivid and meaningful, and the artists are very thoughtful behind each piece they display in Buenos Aires. What really made the tour come together was visiting Jazzys studio. It is one thing to see an artists work, it is another to be in their space. Anyone who is in to the art scene of any kind young and old can appreciate the messages and power behind the work. It is worth getting some more Buenos Aires culture while you are visiting!

So much more than graffiti. This tour gives you history of the culture and the art. The progression of graffiti to street art is amazing. I recommend this to anyone who has eyes and enjoys art. The degree of talent that is displayed is rediculous. The guide was friendly and knowledgeable.

Unbelievable show of awesome art work and it's background in buenos aires.. This was quite frankly the best thing I did in BA! our tour guide (Melissa) was so friendly and knowledgable and took us around so many beautiful pieces of graffiti! learnt so much about an artists side of BA in an afternoon and I would recommend it to anyone with an interest! ThanksBaz

Fun and interesting. We took a tour with Graffitimundo a couple of weeks ago. I was impressed by how informative it was - it gave a lot of information about the historical and political context in which graffiti in Buenos Aires started, how its evolution was different from in other parts of the world, and how artists themselves evolve as well. We also visited a couple of galleries, which wasn't as enjoyable. The bar they drop you off at at the end was pretty cool - I wish there was art to take home for cheaper!

Highlight of BA trip so far. I read about the bike/graffit tour on line and signed up. So far, it's been the highlight of the trip. Graffitimundo and Biking Buenos Aires are two separate organizations, and the Sunday bike tour of street art is their collaboration. It. Was. So. Cool. The GM guide, Patricia I think was her name, was really knowledgeable about all the art we saw and presented in an enthusiastic, quirky, funny, energetic way, and the guys from BBA made sure the biking side ran smoothly. It was fun, informative, off the beaten track and you felt like you were getting a real inside perspective. It was jam-packed but oddly, at the same time, very chill. Highly, highly recommend. Make sure you're signing up for the bike tour, since again, the two are separate entities.

A must do while in buenos aires. This tour was recommended to us and it was the highlight of our time in BA. The art is unbelievable and you get to go around to parts of BA that you would probably not see otherwise. Ana is an excellent guide with passion and knowledge for this type of art. We were able to meet one of the artists who was out touching up,one of his big murals. It was a great way to spend 4 hours with three teenagers! They loved it as much as we did!

Graffitimundo provides a fantastic look at an underground movement.. The tour takes you through a series of wall murals and paintings that despite being publically viewable are often unnoticed. Tour leaders such as Ana, provide a great passion for the art which is noticable in the effort and ebulance of the tour. The wall murals and street art tell a story of a growing undercurrent of Buenos Aires society. Worth a visit! And it ends, like all good tours, at a pub.

Very cool way to see outer BA. Amazing street art in many different styles, knowledgable friendly guides, cool stories. A great way to spend 4 hours in BA and see the back streets of Palermo and beyond. Recommend!

Great way to understand BA. This tour is an excellent way to understand the prolific graffiti which covers BA. The tour was well organised, the guide knowledgeable about the art and the artists, and the urban art impressive. Attending this tour is a great way to support local artists and to gain an insight into BA.

Make time for this!!. I did the Sunday afternoon bike tour of graffiti in Palermo and Villa Crespo, and I am so glad I made time for this tour!! The meeting point was easy to find a sight to see in itself - the botanical gardens. The bikes were in great condition and our biking guide was able to make adjustments to the bikes to make them comfortable. He also provided helmets and full bottles of cold water - so helpful on a hot day!! We rode at a leisurely pace and the graffitimundo guide had really interesting stories about the artists and art. We met a few of the artists and also got to enjoy a cold mate drink and some local Argentine snacks. At the end we stopped at a really cool bar and art space displaying and selling artwork done by the local street artists. I would have never known anything about or found almost any of the spots we visited on this tour - it was a window into Buenos Aires that was well worth the cost of the tour!

Best Buenos Aires experience.. This was one the best things I did in Argentina. The guide was fantastic-very enthusiastic and very knowledgeable. We got a bit of a history lesson on the genesis of street art in Buenos Aires, how it has developed and what has influenced successive generations of artists. We visited several incredible sites. I was blown away by the scale of the paintings and the concentration of serious talent in Buenos Aires. This tour got me excited about art in a way that I haven't been in ages.

Instagrammer's Paradise. Later in the trip, I spent $1 more for a whiskey than I did for this tour ($25) so in terms of value, Graffitimundo was by far the best investment of my vacation. On this three-hour walking/driving tour, you'll learn the backstory of artists, movements and the Argentine appreciation of expressionism. Our guide Jonny was enthusiastic and knowledgeable, mixing in humor and information seamlessly.This tour is an Instagrammer's paradise, so in addition to learning you'll also rack up tons of likes, which, if we're being honest, is the real measure of a good vacation, right?

Highly recommended if you like street art or history. My favorite site-seeing activity while I was there. They are entirely plugged in to the culture and obviously care deeply about it. There's a long history of street art that you wouldn't expect (stenciling in the 30s..who knew?) and some amazing mural work.

Great way to learn about Argentina. One of the highlights of our trip to Argentina. We did a private tour with a driver and guide who took us around Buenos Aires. (It can also be done in groups) The guide was very knowledgeable and spoke English. We learned a lot about the different artists, history and culture behind the art. We finished off our trip getting to meet one of the artists whose art we had seen. Lot’s of fun.The tour lasts 2-3 hours and ends in a bar where you can get food and drinks and also buy some street art.

Open your eyes to the painted walls of BA!. This tour was fantastic. My parents and I went on a sweltering hot day, and Melissa was wonderfully informative. Graffitimundo helped open my eyes to the art all over Buenos Aires. I appreciate it more, have come to recognize certain artists, and see more beauty than ever all over the painted walls. I would highly recommend this tour, you learn, you get a sense of a few neighborhoods in the city, and experience Buenos Aires from artists' perspectives.

Fabulous tour of Bs As graffiti artists. Wonderful tour of some of the city's major graffiti art works. If you're not familiar with the graffiti scene in Bs As, this will really open your eyes. This is NOT TAGGING! It is way, way more. I combined mine with Biking Buenos Aires, which I heartily recommend as you can cover a lot more territory and works; plus, it's exercise! Kirsty, our guide was great: enthusiastic, super-knowledgeable, engaging, and helpful. Corey (from Biking Buenos Aires) complemented by keep traffic at bay and making sure all was safe. Wrapping up at an artists' gallery (Hollywood in Cambodia), behind and above a pub, was a great way to end the tour. I bought a wonderful print for a very modest approx. $70US. (Side plug: Biking BsAs' other tours are also very good.)

Don't hesitate...take the tour. My son had been wittering on about street art in London, so when I arrived in Buenos Aires and seeing so much around, I decided that I wanted to learn more about this whole subject, so I signed up. Never regretted a moment, my eyes were opened to a whole new world and I am now a convert!The tour guide was excellent, good English, excellent information and included the origins of street art, the different types of application, and with the mini bus the tour is able to cover a great deal of different places, as well as providing a sit down rest. The visit to one of the artist's studios, with books, gave yet more insight as to how they work, and the final stop at a bar owned and run by an artist was a fitting end. Upstairs on a balcony overlooking the street, the walls are covered with more street art and the paintings for sale are there for buyers who are interested. one needs a drink to contemplate all that one has seen, heard and learnt. Such an unusual tour, I highly recommend it to anyone. Let's hope their work continues to flourish and the organisation opens in other cities around the world. Good luck for the future, and thank you.

Super guide and murals. Great tour with Argentinian sun. Help to discover history, politics through art. I appreciate the great guide we had. There is no 5 stars because I would have enjoy to see more in 3 hours. Hugo

A real pleasure and definite highlight of the trip. A lot of knowledge about graffiti art- we even got to go into one of the artists' studios!Guided with an airconditioned van also an unexpected plus!A three hour tour walk and private bus tour.excellent value

Don't Miss This Tour. Buenos Aires is called “Design City,” and not all the design is in the shops and studios. Street Art abounds in BA, and Graffitimundo is dedicated to sharing this art with any interested resident or visitor. We took the tour on a recommendation of two friends and are eternally grateful to them for the heads up. If you live in or travel through Buenos Aires don’t miss this tour. It is another example of the vibrant art scene in this lively city. You travel to several neighborhoods in a minibus, learning about the history of street art and its artists. The guides are knowledgeable and enthused. The art ranges from elaborated tags to exquisite works. There is whimsy, anger, humor, and most works are thoughtful and intellectually provocative. It is on this tour that the heart of BA beats in all its manifestations. If I could recommend only one tour in BA, it would be Graffitimundo.

Fantastic experience. This tour is a "do not miss" experience. I and two friends from Philadelphia Had been in BA for several days, loving it all, and after this tour we had a much richer sense of the city and it's people. There is great beauty as well as whimsy and rebellion in the art. Our guide was fun and filled in a picture of the artists as well as her knowledge of the art itself. Loved it!

Excellent street art tour. I was recommended this by a friend and was so glad I went. The guide was really informative and there is no way anybody would be able to find such wonderful pieces of art on their own.

Loved this excellent street art tour!. We had been in Buenos Aires for two weeks before signing up for the tour, and just had to know more about the street art scene in the city so we signed up for this tour. It couldn't have been better! We went to lesser known parts of the city to check out loads of great pieces, learned tons about the urban art scene here, from different artists to types of materials they use. At first we wondered why we would need an air-conditioned van, but it is because the tour is three hours and covers a lot of ground in the Palermo/Colegiales areas! What I loved most about the tour was that it is entirely about street art - it's not a city tour with some street art knowledge thrown in. You don't have to know anything about urban art, but this tour is focused entirely on it - but you still come away knowing more about Buenos Aires, Argentine culture, etc. Our guide was so knowledgeable and passionate about the work, and even though there were 15+ on the tour, she took time to talk to each of us and answer all our questions as we walked along and even after the tour she helped everyone out with even more general BsAs questions. If you choose one tour in Buenos Aires, make it Graffitimundo!

Loved the Graffiti Mundo Tour. We just returned from our 8-day stay in Buenos Aires and went on the Graffiti Mundo Tour. It was wonderful! Very informative and the tour was in English so it was easy for us to understand and follow along. We left with a better understanding of the graffiti and street art movement in Argentina and how it differs from the United States. During our tour we were able to meet JAZ, a renowned Argentine street artist and he welcome us into his studio. That was definitely a major bonus!!! Our tour guide was amazing and easy to engage. We really feel like this tour was one of the best that we experienced while on our vacation. We would encourage anyone considering - DO NOT HESITATE - and make sure to bring your camera and comfortable walking shoes. Ciao!

Original and interesting tour. I am Argentine, specifically from Buenos Aires, and registered for the tour in English and loved it!So different from all the tours I've seen in my city!! And I love to see Buenos Aires with the eyes of a tourist, so I know what I'm talking about.Melissa was very clear and friendly and took us to three different neighborhoods that seem to be graffiti hubs of BA.Nice interesting explanations which opened my eyes to what I seemed to see every day, but had not paid too much attention to. Now I see walls and graffiti in Buenso Aires with a different eye.Part of the tour is done with a van through attractive "barrios" like Palermo Hollywood and Villa Crespo. And we ended up in a coffee shop fully dedicated to graffiti works, that are on sale. The place itself is all covered with graffiti.I really loved everything in the tour.

A truly BA experience. Loved being taken to areas would probably never have visited and getting a real insight into graffiti in BA, our guide was delightful and very knowledgeable, it was a truly stimulating experience and not to be missed.

Very unique tour! Loved it!. Not sure why, but have always loved graffiti (not scribble tagging) and street art. Have never really been interested in the political side, or the meaning behind it all, just like the artwork. So was a bit unsure about the whole tour. Eventually decided to take it because i figured it would probably cover the best stuff, and that I may not find all of that on my own.Was very glad I did take the tour, however. As even though I'm still not overly interested in the politics of it all, I did find it very interesting. Found the history of it all particularly interesting, and the fact that there was an organised 'Meeting of the Styles'.Tour may not be for everyone. But I enjoyed it, and I think most people would. Definitely helps to have a well organised and passionate group running it.

Fun and Interesting!. Recently did the 3 hour Graffitimundo walking tour. It was a fabulous experience and ranks as one of my favorite things that I did while in BA. The tour guide Melissa was so passionate and knowledgeable about all of the street art that we saw. Not only was the art beautiful to see, but the tour also provides a cultural and political context for the art. I would recommend this tour to anyone who has even a cursory interest in street art. It is also possible to purchase art from Graffitimundo to support the local artists.

A great survey of the vibrant street art scene. This tour was a lot of fun. We traveled to different neighborhoods by comfortable minibus, where we would walk a bit surveying various pieces before hopping back on for the next stop. I enjoyed learning more about the history of street art in Latin America and its emergence and evolution in BsAs, as well as getting backstories on some of the artists, their methods and motivations. I was impressed and inspired by the openness and collaborative spirit surrounding the scene. The works themselves were typically vibrant, sometimes provocative and often playful. The tour concluded at an art gallery where original works by some of the artists were available for purchase. The graffitimundo team is passionate about its subject matter, which greatly enhanced my enjoyment of the experience. They're very involved in the local scene, and are making a documentary about it, which we got a sneak peek of. Tips: Bring cash if you want to buy art. Most importantly, allow ample time to get to the starting point - if you're traveling by taxi, anything under an hour is going to be a problem. I missed the first part of the tour, so I speak from experience! I took the subte home without any problem, so if I had it to do over, I wouldn't bother fighting traffic in a taxi.

Very interesting and unique experience. My partner and I read about this and weren't sure as, although we love it, you see street art everywhere so why pay for a tour? However we had a great time and found it very interesting as the guide, Melissa, was very knowledgeable about both the history of the movement(s) in BA and also the individual artists involved. We saw some great pieces that we would never of seen ourselves and now have a new appreciation for them and the wider context. This tour gave us an insight into a art scene I never thought we would know further than what you see. Very accessible tour which I would recommend to anyone interested in art even if urban art isn't usually your thing. Logistic wise, we always safe and it was well organised. Great value for money. Thanks!

Not worth it all! Maybe do a half tour to check it off list. Why am I only negative review..?. I don't think this tour is worth it at all. Maybe if you haven't grown up/lived ever in an urban center this tour would be worth it. I do not think the quality of graffiti is very high; indeed, you will find this is the case as graffiti in Buenos Aires is not illegal. Additionally, many of the "artists" are very young (e.g., the artist who likes to draw lines first and then figure out what they are after he has finished). There are a few good artists, but the overall art is not very politically motivated or charged. Its really just teenagers spraying graffiti on walls. You will find higher quality graffiti (in my opinion) in Soho NY (which I think says something) - let alone Berlin or Detroit.The guide we had was very nice and enthusiastic. However, my friends at time rolled our eyes wondering whether they were a bit over eager. We ended the tour early. The tour is safe however and one we took was largely walking oriented. Ask yourself -- why am I the only negative review? Why is this the fourth time I am posting my review before someone complains and tripadvisor deletes it?

Great tour off the beaten track!. I had a great afternoon and learned a lot about the hidden streets and walls we saw in addition to some very interesting discussions about politics! This is a Must Do for all urban art/wall art lovers and also a very good alternative for those who are keen to see Buenos Aires from a non-touristy point of view.

See the real Buenos Aires and bring street art to life. We really enjoyed this tour, had been in BA for 2 weeks but hadnt noticed all the street art until this! Kirsty was knowledgable and enthusiastic and they even provide a mini-van so its not too much walking. A must do for any visitor or even local. I really have much more appreciation for this type of art, way better than any gallery!

Very informative and fun!. We took a private bus (we were a group of 12) for the tour and it was excellent. My friends who recommended the tour with graffitimundo did the biking version, but we were just too large of a group. The staff and tour guide were very accommodating. We LOVED the tour itself and the chance to hear the back stories of the artists and their works. The following day we ran the Buenos Aires marathon and were able to spot different artists along the route based on the info we learned in our tour the previous day. Highly recommend this group! They also seem to be very involved and in touch with the movement and the artists themselves. A MUST DO.

Really cool. This tour takes you to see places you probably wouldn't have seen otherwise - all while learning about the Argentine society. Everyone who wants to see something cool of Buenos Aires and don't mind learning interesting stuff on the way should do this tour. Felt very welcomed be the tour guide who immedietely felt like a friend.

Currently rated #18, should be top #5 things to see in B Aires. This tour was recommended to me by a friend, and it is the absolute best money I have spent on any sightseeing tour in B Aires. The local arts scene - in this case “graffiti” - is truly unique. The 3 hour tour was beautifully curated by incredibly passionate and fun people. When you think of the concept of ‘graffiti’ – you think of ugly, eyesore type aerosol-ed images of some punk putting his/her name up on a wall. This is NOT what the street art scene is like in B Aires. Sure, there are such images, but these are in the minority. You are given a brief history of the evolution of the graffiti / street art scene in B Aires, which adds to your over appreciation of this amazing city. Here, artists ASK for permission to paint, draw, stencil etc onto walls. While it is not officially legal, it is not officially illegal either. The art works use a combination of paint, tar-paint, aerosols, tiles and other mediums, making for a truly mind blowing tour. Only minor downside is 3 hours is a little long. I reckon 2.5 hours would be better. Toured with a friend, early Sept 2012

Great experience !. We took the tour after reading about it in the time out of Buenos Aires . Our guide was really interesting and passionate about the art , and it was great.We enjoyed the tour very much !Was worth it!! Recommended :)

Delightful and Inspiring. We thoroughly enjoyed the several hours spent on this tour. If you are just looking for something fun and offbeat, this is a great tour. You should also go on this tour if you are looking for some visual inspiration, a little bit of a debate about what constitutes "art," visually interesting spots to take photographs, and some insight into the history and politics of Argentina, as these relate to the work of the artists featured by the tour. We even got to stop by a studio and greet two of the artists whose works we were admiring, which was really fun. I would highly recommend this tour to anyone making a trip to Buenos Aires. A few tips: If you are taking a taxi, expect a lot of time stuck in traffic and give yourself a lot of time to get here. The Subte might be a faster option. Second, if you are running late, there is a bakery a half block north of the meeting location where you can load up on empanadas before dashing off with the group. Third, make sure to have cash on hand. The day ends at a funky bar that has a small gallery with prints by some of the stencil artists, and original paintings by some of the other artists whose work is featured on the tour. Overall, this is a great experience.

Different perspective of BA... worth seeing!. This is a different, yet very interesting tour by some of the most hipster neighbourhoods of Buenos Aires. It takes about 2 hours and is mostly done on foot, but whenver there is a longer strech, there is a bus picking you up and dropping you off at another point. You get the chance to see the work of very talented street artists (Jaz was my personal favorite) and you will be told about the different techniques they use. You will also visit one of their studios and end the visit in the "urban art center", in which you can see a terrace full of paintings, an exhibition and purchase something if you like.The guide was a foreign girl living in BA for some years now, can't remember her name at the moment. She was very nice and knowledgeable about the topic. We had a great time in this trip!

Seeing B.A. in a New Way. The Graffitimundo tour was one of the highlights of our recent visit to B.A. We are two parents and two teens and all of us learned so much from Cecilia about the art and politics of this fascinating city. We even got to meet Jaz at his studio! For the rest of our visit we were able to recognize on the city's walls the work of our favorite artists. Definitely take this tour!

Great experience - brought our kids. We found out about this tour in a NY times article and glad we did. We are staying in Recoleta and really enjoyed getting a tour of this area of the city and learning about 3 - 4 artists who have a great number of works near Palermo Viejo. The guide was wonderfully enthusiastic and gave great cultural insights. At the end you end up in a great bar completely decorated with graffiti we could not have found on our own from Recoleta.

Makes Wandering Buenos Aires Even More Interesting. We signed up on a whim for the graffitmundo tour on a rainy day in August. Thankfully there was a cancellation and were able to grab up last-minute slots. I had noticed the large amount of street art during our first day or so in Buenos Aires, but taking this tour made every other walk afterwards a treasure hunt to look for artists we recognized from the tour and noting the intricacies of some of the art work. Our guide, Kirsty, was great especially considering that we really did have terrible weather at the start of the tour. On account of the weather we stopped by an emerging art studio as well as one of the workspaces of one of the city's most important artists. While appreciated, we didn't accomplish much at either of these visits. I felt that this tour went too long (three hours). My attention span was waning and we started to run short on time for other planned activities. Overall, though, I can't imagine learning more in a tour of a city and I loved learning about the artists and the history of street art in Buenos Aires. I definitely recommend graffitimundo!

Best View of Buenos Aires. We found graffitimundo on Trip Advisor because my finacee is a big street art fan. We arranged for the tour to be on our first day in the city. The art was cool and our guide was great. She really told us a lot about the city, the art, and Argentina in general. We really enjoyed the tour and hanging out at the bar for a bit after but the most enjoyable thing was walking around the city over the next 4 days and being able to identify the artists' work on the street. After leaving Argentina, we both agreed this was the most worthwhile/enjoyable thing we did while in Argentina. We did a private tour and totally recommend doing it this way, but I'm sour the group tour is great too. I recommend this for a different side of Buenos Aires and a really enjoyable day.

A tour of Buenos Aires that must not be missed!. Earlier this month while visiting out daughter who was doing summer school in Buenos Aires, she had one of her classmates go on a “graffiti tour” of the city. I thought this sounded really unique, some of the best new artists these days are finding urban graffiti as a way of expressing their abilities. Banksy who resides in London, and has his work popping up internationally, is probably the best known graffiti artist currently. What is unique about this form of street art is that it almost always has some type of theme. Trying to figure out the meaning is half the challenge.Given that little bit of knowledge, we were intrigued to see what a graffiti tour would entail and were certainly not disappointed. We were met at our apartment by Cecilia, a Buenos Aires native, who spent the afternoon taking us around some of the “sketchier” places of the night, during the day to see some amazing art work. I was lucky because the day was warm and partly cloudy, perfect for walking, exploring and capturing some images of artwork that is truly Argentinian. Some very political, others more romantic, comedic or simply insightful. Along the way, Cecilia explained the stories behind the images and the history of most of the urban artists who she knows personally. Graffitimundo is a nonprofit collaboration between the artists, a gallery and the tour company – a superb way to introduce people to the artists, their work and culture.

BA from a new perspective.. A great street art city tour with a truly enthusiastic guide. Amazing pieces. Buenos Aires is full of beautiful paintings and on this tour you will get more background info about it. (Don't book it through Tangol!)

What a first day in Buenos Aires. I couldn't have asked for a more different first day in Buenos Aires. Graffitimundo gave me a perspective of the city that I couldn't ever imagine. Their amazing work in both supporting local artists and keeping up-to-date with the latest murals around Bs As is phenomenal. I'm here for another six months and I will never look at graffiti and street art the same way. I highly recommend the tour for anyone. It's a great way to learn about the local art scene.

A different sightseeing in BA. We went on the group tour, and enjoyed it very much. The guide was charming and insightful, and shared interesting information about the street art scene in Buenos Aires. We saw some amazing pieces on the walls around town. It's also a good way to see different parts of the city. We highly reccomend this tour! Kristian & Maria

great unusual tour in special areas. We really enjoyed the hidden walls tour! The guide took us to places you would never find as a tourist. Very nice and interesting stories about the artists. The tour ends in the Graffiti cafe in Palermo where we met some of the artists and could even buy some works. We would recommend this to any traveller interested in street art.

Diverting but not essential. We did the Hidden Walls tour - it certainly had points of interest but did not give a great overview of the development of street art in BA and was a bit stop-start. I would not particularly recommend this tour unless you're really at a loose end (and I speak as someone with an interest in street art) but I note their positive reviews and it may be worth checking out one of their other tours.

Best tour of BA. I went on both the group tour and the hidden walls tour- both were fantastic! I had different guides who both knew so much about the movement, the works and the artists. There was no overlap in the tours so I would recommend doing both if you're really interested in the subject. The guides are happy to answer any questions and share their wealth of knowledge.

Shouldn't be missed.. In my opinion, the graffitimundo tour is an integral part of any trip to Buenos Aires. Even if you're only in town for a few days, it should be worked into your itinerary. Our guide was friendly and very knowledgeable. The tour provides access to and information on street art that you simply wouldn't come across otherwise. It's also a great opportunity to take some stunning pictures. A very memorable experience. Highly recommended.

Best tour I have ever been on. The concept behind the tour is very unique and lends itself to an incredibly interesting and fun tour. We saw a side of Palermo we wouldn't have visited on our own, while learning about the world of graffiti in Buenos Aires. I'm not a fan of graffiti, or so I thought before taking this tour. But after seeing the street art and learning the stories and political meanings I actually wish there were more cities with street art of this quality. Thanks for such an awesome experience!

Great and interesting Guide and Tour. I was on a Hidden Wall Tour and the reason for it was a information from a friend and also the few great Graffitis i have seen before in BaAs. The Tour didn´t include the Graffitis i was looking for but manny different other great Graffitis! Also the Guide was very nice and had a lot of informations; also things about the city and history.So in my case i would say its a absolutely must do in BaAs. The Price is totaly ok for the things you get and much more worth than manny other tours in BaAs.Manny Greetings and a good time in BaAs

A Must-Do When You Arrive in Buenos Aires. I wish we were able to do the tour on the first day that we arrived in BA because it provided us with great insight into the culture and history of Argentina, great tips for restaurants and what to do around the City, and at the same time was a tour around the City. The company is great, providing tours Wed-Sun at 3pm OR (like us) you can book a private tour at a very reasonable price for anytime that you're free. I recommend to everyone who might be traveling to Arg.

Interesting perspective on a beautiful city. We immensely enjoyed our time on the graffiti tour of Buenos Aires. The group size was not too big, which allowed time for questions and to get to know others. Ample time for photos and the guide was very knowledgable. They also give you an insider's guide to BA at the end of the tour, which is filled with restaurant, bar, and nightlife suggestions. A must do for any tourist or local!

great afternoon - great tour. This was a great tour. Getting an understanding of the history and stories of the street art was really interesting. The tour itself was well paced and involved both walking and a few stops on the minibus. The end of the tour is both a pub/bar and the shared studio. Highly recommend for a great afternoon.

Great alternative art tour. Johnny, one of the owners, took our family of 5 including 3 children on a fun filled afternoon tour of the local graffiti seen. He was very animated in his historical perspective of graffiti and it's appeal in BA. We learned a lot and saw some very impressive art in the process. He even brought us to meet 3 well known local graffiti artists. Would highly recommend this tour to anyone who is remotely interested in street art.

graffitimundo bike tour ...an awesome perspective of Buenos Aires!. Jonny and Brett were both personable and knowledgable, a pleasure to ride with and listen to what they had to say about the graffiti art scene in buenos aires. This is an excellent Sunday afternoon bike tour, just the right amount of time and distance covered. I am really glad I went on this tour. Highly recommended.

Best activity in BA. I hate doing touristy stuff when I visit a city because I want to see the city in its residents' eyes and that's exactly what Cecilia offered us with a fantastic tour about street art and the history attached to it. It was one of my favorite moment in my short week visiting BA and I highly recommend it to anyone.

A Tour for People Who Don't Go on Tours! Fantastic!. I learned so much about street art, and Buenos Aires history on this tour, which was given by an engaging, thoughtful, and intelligent guide. Amazing art, terrific commentary, and such fun! Don't hesitate to go, even if you have the slightest interest in street art, and if you are somebody like myself who never goes on tours. Thank you Grafftimundo for your contribution to the BA art scene. Leaving, breathing art in a vibrant city, this tour is the real deal!!

The Graffitimundo tour of the street art of Buenos Aires is awesome. The excellent Graffitimundo guide takes a small group on a tour of the amazing street art of Buenos Aires. This is an opportunity to learn about the street art, meet some of the street artists in their studios, and see the unique neighborhoods of Buenos Aires. Our guide was very knowledgeable, energetic, and interesting. Wear comfortable shoes and take water.
Fantastic. Graffiti tour was the top of our visit in Buenos Aires. What a great job you are doing.

Awesome Graffiti!. There is graffiti everywhere in Buenos Aires. Graffitimundo does an excellent job in explaining how this form of street art started in the city and what cultural significance it has. The tour is about 3 hours and our group leader, Ceclia was fantastic. She was articulate and smart, and open to answering any questions we had. They provide an AC van that take you around if the distance you have to travel to see the next set of artwork is a bit far. It was unexpected (I thought we'd be walking for 3 hours) and a happy surprise on a hot BA afternoon. We had a chance to visit the studio where some of the artists work and even meet a few of them. I've been recommending this tour to others here and all have come back from it very pleased. Highly recommended!Should you want to read more/see photos, http://dreamgolive.wordpress.com/2012/02/05/scary-graffiti-or-awesome-graffiti/

Great afternoon. Found this graffiti tour on Tripadvisor. Nice relaxed walking and air conditioned van around Palermo. The street art is amazing. You can wander without a guide, but you won't know the stories behind the art.

Fascinating, beautiful, and intimate introduction to a truly vibrant and original world of art. Cecilia is a part of this community, her insight into the political and cultural context as well as thorough understanding of the techniques, styles, and medium of graffiti and street art are authentic. She articulated the story of this young, prolific, relevant and vibrant scene with enthusiasm. We met in barrio Collegiales and walked bait as she gave us background - the tour was in English - and took an air conditioned mini bus for several sections of the otherwise walking tour. We visited several locations with huge, colorful paintings, stencils, aerosol art, drawings, and tiled mosaics. We stopped at a gallery/cafe for refreshments, an art studio (the artist said it was too hot inside but came out to greet us and chat about his current installation) and if finished at a very cool Art Bar called Post Street Bar - it is covered from top to bottom on three levels with a cacophony of styles and color. There were several artists there and a few rooms of shows to view and purchase. Also refreshing ice cold beer. My wife is 30, I am 36, we are from Oakland California and are a part of a vibrant art scene there, so e authenticity was refreshing. It was a great way to understand e politics of Argentina as well as entertaining for the myriad narratives that are woven through this very personal and relevant world of graffiti!

Really interesting!. We really were not too knowledgeable about graffiti art, but after this tour, suddenly everywhere we look we find something interesting to see!We thought this was a great tour with a terrific guide; she was knowledgeable and very enthusiastic. The day of our tour was extremely hot and humid, but we never lost interest. We visited an artist's studio and gallery; and fortunately we had a mini bus that was able to transport us from place to place. Very worthwhile tour...and a bit different!

Excellent introduction to BA street art. The street art of BA is quite different from the stencils, posters and rolling of Melbourne. Not ones to rush, the artists take their time and paint during the day with the permission of the building owners - who often seek out the artists instead of the other way round. Spray paint is imported making it too expensive to use exclusively and so many of the works are in fact murals. This in itself separates BA from other street art cities around the world.The tour is both walking and by mini-bus around the areas of Colegiales, Palermo and Villa Crespo. In addition to the street art, it's a great way to see some different parts of the city.For me, the tour runs a tad too long. That said, you will be well equipped to identify the work of quite a few of the most prolific local artists. I was pleased to see some pieces by Brazilian artists whose work I would see around Sao Paulo. There's quite a healthy and collaborative scene across the continent.Do yourself a favour and do the tour.

Great tour, interesting stories behind the art. I had seen plenty of graffiti art before but didn't really understand it. This tour was very well organized and gave great explanations of the structure to BA street art. Highly recommend.

Graffitimundo street art tour - best thing we did in BA. Totally worth the USD 25 a head. You get three hours with a fantastically knowledgeable guide (Cecilia), hearing the stories of BA street art and seeing some of the best examples. The group is small - there were about 12 of us on our tour - so you can ask lots of questions. We visited one of the artists' studios and met a couple of the guys; ended up in Post Bar (Hollywood & Cambodia) for a drink and a look at their latest exhibition. The tour is a mix of walking and short trips by minibus, and you get to see some parts of the city that you might not otherwise visit. All in all, a great afternoon.

Makes you fall in love with the city :). The grafittimundo tour is very well-organised and professionel - and at the same time authentic in the sense that it's run by local people who know the artists personally. It's a great introduction to the argentinian street art in general and the story behind the different pieces and artists. Also a fun way to learn a bit about the history and politics of Argentina - all packed into 3 colourful hours served by an enthusiastic guide. I can recommend it to anyone - also those who don't like grafitti :) Oh, and they give you a booklet with all the names and information after the tour, just perfect! ;)

A great way to know the city. This is a really cool and unique way to look at the city from a new and unconventional perspective. You get to visit neighborhoods you wouldn't normally go to as, for the most part, the artwork you will see is located in residential and industrial areas of the city that have no 'traditional' sightseeing. So not only you get to learn about a quite interesting emerging art scene in BA, you get to see a lot of local people and businesses that you won't find walking down Florida and visiting malls.If you're lucky you'll even get to meet some of the artists and get a firsthand experience of artsy and underground BA. Plus, all the people working there (and the people in the tour!) will make it an awesome afternoon.

More fine art than graffiti. We have been walking these neighborhoods for weeks and missed many fine pieces of street art. It was wonderful to have a guide to show us the best pieces. We enjoyed this more than many museums and it could all be different in a few months. This is a whole new prespective on art.

A great tour--from someone who hates tours. Some friends and I toured with Cecilia from Graffitimundo on a warm sunny January afternoon, and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The tour was an once informal and extremely informative. Cecelia never seemed scripted and never referred to notes, her knowledge was impressive and her enthusiasm infectious. I was especially impressed by Cecelia's knowledge and savvy regarding the political context. It helps, but is by no means essential, to have some previous knowledge of the art and politics of graffiti, but a curious and open mind will suffice. The bar and gallery visit was a great finish, and the very opposite of the "exit through the gift shop" experience you might fear.

Funky & Fabulous. Really interesting, back- street tour. Great for photographers. Charming and enthusiastic guide, Kirsty. Agree with other reviewer re length of time - should be at least half an hour shorter. However would still recommend highly.

You'll be happy you did a Graffitimundo tour!. The Graffitimundo tour was definitely a highlight of my trip to Buenos Aires. Coming from another city (San Francisco) with a great street art tradition, it was super cool to see how and where artists in Buenos Aires express themselves. Much of the artwork is really magnífico and our guide, Cecilia, was knowledgeable, friendly and totally fun. This is the best 25 bucks you'll spend while you're in Argentina.

unique and very authentic visit of arty Buenos Aires. Best combination of professional, cool and authentic guides (both Marina, in 2009, and Cecilia, in 2011 (yes, I went twice!!)) with awesome and up-to-date local knowledge of the street art scene. I can highly recommend this tour!

Graffitimundo is great!. One of the best things we did in Buenos Aires - our guide, Cecilia, was super nice and we really felt we got an insight into contemporary issues and politics as well as a great tour of the fantastic graffiti. We also really appreciated being shown a couple of nice cafe bars and being given the 'Things we like' list - it was like having a hip friend give us an in into the cool side of the city. Very highly recommended, thanks Graffitimundo guys....
Fun, Offbeat and Great Info. A Sunday only treat that ought not be missed. Good history, good art, and great guides.

Great way to see the city. I went on the graffitimundo tour a few days ago. It was a great change of pace from the typical "touristy" things. Great way to learn more about the BA culture. Definitely recommend it!

Highlight of our BA trip - bike tour and stencil workshop. We went on the bike tour and had a blast! The tour guide, Johnnie, was extremely knowledgeable and passionate about the subject. It's worth taking one of the tours to learn the history of graffiti in BA. We later took the stencil workshop and learned more than I expected. The class exceeded my expectations, and we got to paint our stencils on the wall. It was so fun!

A very interesting insight into a part of town tourists would not normally visit.... The street art was absolutely fabulous - the artists are very talented and you should not be put off going by the fact that most of Buenos Aires is covered in the sort of meaningless teenage graffiti scrawl that really should be washed off the walls...The information about the artists and their processes is really interesting and as a result we will be commissioning a piece of stencil art by one of the artists :-)Loved it!

Nice way to see a different aspect of the city. Tour was interesting, got to go to a bunch of different parts of BA. Tour guide was very nice and knowledgable about all of the artists. My only complaint was that the tour dragged on a little. Probably could have ended about an hour earlier. Overall interesting tour with lots of good photo opportunities and friendly staff.

Not a capitalist bone in their bodies. For less than $23 U.S., you will ponder not just the street art and the corresponding themes, but you'll seriously reevaluate your own value system. The stories behind these artists, their methods and their motivations, told in a highly entertaining afternoon by knowledgable members of the in-crowd, will inspire you to follow your own passion for the sake of creating without messy expectations.The tour includes some really amazing work, and makes you, for a few fleeting hours, remember the feeling of needing to get your ya-yas out, whatever your craft. I walked away a lot more knowledgeable about street art, a little shameful over my own flabby creativity, and in possession of a couple of prints that will serve as inspiration in the future.

Great way to see the city through a different lens!!!. This tour was the first thing we did when we got to Buenos Aires and we were immediately impressed. The tour took us all over and really gave us a fresh perspective on graffiti art while giving us our bearing around the city. The art was so amazing and the tour guides were very knowledgable about the graffiti artists and the culture surrounding it...i learned so much in a few hours and took some amazing pictures (a few of which are hanging on my living room wall). Do this tour and you will never look at graffiti the same again!

Great Alternative Tour in BA, Informative and Fun Guide. I went on this tour with a group of Argentine and American friends, and we all learned a lot and enjoyed the day. It was a great way to see Buenos Aires in a different light, and the guide, Melissa, was really informative and had a lot of buena onda ;) We loved hearing about the local artists, their methods and meaning behind their artwork, and walking around on a beautiful day. The ending in the bar in Palermo was fantastic, and we even met some of the artists :) I would definitely recommend this tour to anyone who likes art, and wants to hear things about Buenos Aires that you won't find out on any average tour.

Fun, Interesting, Personalized Tour. Our small group of 3 met Liz for a 1/2 day walking tour of Buenos Aires on a cool, rainy spring morning. We were a bit unsure of what we were getting into, but it didn't take long to figure out that we'd struck gold with Liz. She had prepared a route and itinerary that was geared specifically to our personal interests. She was a wealth of knowledge about the city, Argentine history and culture. She was also really helpful in arranging some other activities and providing recommendations for places to see and do on our own. She was fantastic!!

Fantastic Resource in Buenos Aires. I was looking for someone to help me create a trip for a big group of friends to Buenos Aires. After doing a bit of research on the web I came across trip advisor and looked through all the fantastic reviews about Liz. Then I found her website and contacted her. Within a very short time I had a nice welcoming note and offer to assist me in anyway she could. Liz quickly laid out a fantastic plan for me and my friends to see Buenos Aires and offered her assistance every step of the way. I can highly recommend Liz. She is truly top notch! If you're looking to discover the real Argentina I would definitely contact her!Matthew Brumley Seattle USA

Great One Day Introduction To BA!. I figured if I was going to Argentina for a few days on business that I might as well treat myself to get to know the city a bit. A colleague and I used Liz and her company to do that and it was fantastic - they were on time, friendly, and gave us a great tour of the city in 5 hours. Obviously we didn't see everything in such a short time, but it was a fantastic use of our time. Highly recommend her.

We experience the local culture of Argentina and Buenos Aires by Liz Andrea. Our dear new friends. Our group of hunting in Buenos Aires was more than happy to hire the service of Buenos Aires Tour Guide by Liz Andrea. Her experience, empathy and knowledge was more than a simple guide. She is a wikipedia! and she added more anecdotes as she was born in Buenos Aires and has experience in the city and guiding. We were around South America and she can give recommendations all around as she is well known in South America by other guides. We recommend you to hire her and her team. We recommend her to build a new website to allow visitors understand that she is the best guide in Buenos Aires. We really appreciate her company! Gracias.

The Perfect Full-Day Tour Of Buenos Aires!. We foolishly only allowed three days of our total travel in Buenos Aires, and after a 30-plus hour flight from Hong Kong, it took us a day just to recover. However, on the second day, Liz (Andrea) picked us up at our hotel (on time) at 10 am and ushered us into a comfortable sedan with a very knowledgeable and polite driver (sorry, can't remember his name now). Definitely our visit to Buenos Aires and our time spent with Liz, was the highlight of our stay. We not only thoroughly enjoyed our time with Andrea, having fun and learning as much as we could in our short stay. We loved especially La Boca, the cemetery and the cathedral. But most of all, we loved the way she took us in and treated us as friends and tried to educate us to the culture, the art, the history and the beauty of this fabulous city. Thanks so much, we will never forget it!

Best Tour Guide in South America for Small Groups. Liz Andrea was fantastic. She organised our group tour of 7 with a lot of passion and a highly professional skills. I checked different guides and seems to be that she is the best tour guide in Buenos Aires and more. She is a tango dancer! We really had fun in the middle of a conference meeting having a real customized tour with an expert guide with many anecdotes and local experiences. Highly recommended. We did the typical things but she also read our minds and made some changes that let enjoy us the history, economy, politics and local culture. She also arranged us a tango dinner show for a promo price. Great choice!

Liz Andrea is a real Tour Leader- Great Guide!. Our group of 7 were visiting South America for a business meeting. Liz Private Tours Local Guide in Buenos Aires was recommended by a cruiseship passenger that did a tour with her a year ago and is our fellow. We sent her a mail and she personally answered wich means that she was not a robot or a machine. She is a real person! We told her about our schedule and she proposed an itinerary to do an evening sightseeing tour after our meetings. She was very pleasent and highly educated. I will bring my family to South America and contact her again. We were travelling to Chile and Uruguay and she help as a lot for all the contacts. Great Tour Leader Guide!
Outstanding. Liz was very detailed in every way. Only her knowledge exceeded her personality. Great experience and highly recommend.
Liz was a fantastic guide!. We went to several restaurants and sites, and we had a great time with Liz! She had a wonderful personality, and she was very fun to travel with!
Buenos Aires Tour. Liz is a fantastic guide! She was full of the history of Buenos Aires, as well as fun shopping. I would highly recommend using her service for any travelers.

Sight seeing and shopping in Buenos Aires with Liz. Our family had a great time with Liz! We only had 2 days with Liz in Buenos Aires and she showed us excellent parts of the city while telling us the history of Argentina and the city. My girls really liked her help in finding places to shop and the leather coats they purchased!

A day in Buenos Aires. We had a whole day with Liz after we finished our cruise and before our evening flights back to the US. One of our group had arranged this before hand and it was a great way to spend the day. We were met at the terminal and our luggage and us were all transported in a comfortable van. There were seven of us of varying ages and Liz gave us a very good tour of the city in the time available. We had lunch in a cafe where we could see the Tango being performed, learned more about Evita and learned about the culture of the place.We were taken to the airport at the end of the day, not having to worry about our luggage while we were sightseeing. A excellent and very affordable trip with a good driver and a knowledgeable guide.

Tailor Made Tour in Buenos Aires. Liz was fantastic. She perfectly tailored a day tour for my husband, son and me. We saw all of the highlights and visited places we wouldn't have gone on our own. We get private guides a lot and Liz is one of the best. She know all of the local culture, history and clearly loves her city. I was concerned about not booking through an agency, but have no fear. We required a car, rather than walking tour, and our driver was great (but the car was small, even for our family of three). I would recommend Liz to all of my friends.

Liz's private tour of the Buenos Aires area. The tour was a whole day tour of the greater Buenos Aires area for a group of 12 retirees. The group was primarily retired firemen and their wives. Prior to starting the tour that morning Liz briefly met with our group to get a sense of the persons involved so she could customize the tour in a way she felt would provide the most enjoyable experience possible. In our case, she was able to include a visit to a fire station so that the retired firemen could meet some of the local ones, look around the fire station and check out their firefighting equipment. In addition, because of the group's hobby was rebuilding vintage cars she pointed out some places that those that were interested could visit on their own that included memorabilia of former race drivers. That is the kind of personalized service that Liz provides that I had not experienced with tour guides in other locales.

Fun Day Tour of BsAs. Liz set up a tour that covered all the highlights for us. We visited Recoleta Cemetery, Plaza Mayo (Casa Rosada, Catedral Metropolitana, Museo Cabolido) And then through Puerto Madero to San Telmo and Boca. We had a delightful time.. Liz explained the history and significance of these places in an overall context. For our day's visit there were protests to be held later in the evening. We asked her to frame the relationship of these current affairs into the legacy of the people, of these buildings, and institutions. She offered many views and we learned more about the culture and context of the present. We appreciated her more for having done this.Finally she arranged a tango viewing for us. Wonderful! Thanks Liz

Interpreting Buenos Aires for gringos. I had visited Buenos Aires before and didn't really need tourist sightseeing but wanted some insight into how Portenos live and a sense of the local culture. Liz provided that and more. After spending a day with her I came away with a strong feeling for what Buenos Aires is about, warts and all, as well as how it got to be the way it is. If you want an interpreter who can more than point out the sights, I highly recommend Liz.

Weekend in Buenos Aires was a 1001 night story by recommendations of Liz. I was first time in BA and falled in love with this town. Samples of architecture are superb, food and drinks, music, Tango and especially the Argentinian people are very nice. Just fly to BA and leave yourself into the lifestream of BA. Unfortunately you have to contact to Liz, and she will arrange a dream for you in BA including daily tours and of course a memorable Tango night.

Day Tour of Buenos Aires (February). I really should have put this review on before - I was in Buenos Aires by myself and was looking for a guide for the day in February. Liz was engaged so she organised for another guide, Pedro, to take me around. It was a very flexible, friendly and informative tour. It took in all the main sites including an incredible view over the Recoleta. Pedro was very good company and was prepared to answer any questions about history, politics and culture of Argentina / Buenos Aires. It was very good value and I would thoroughly recommend it. I hope to go back to BA one day.
