Great visit to Recoleta Cemetery. Extremely accommodating, knowledgable and gave us a detailed history of the different eras of Argentina. Very engaging and we would give her more than 5 stars if possible.

A great guide for a great city!. Liz guided our diverse, energetic, well-traveled group around Buenos Aires, and made the city come alive. She was knowledgeable, articulate, energetic, and fun. She is proud of her city, and it showed. We would use her again, and recommend her unequivocally.

Lone female business traveller - Liz was the perfect guide!. Travelling alone from the UK to BA for work was very daunting. I found Liz/Andrea through TripAdvisor and I am glad I did. We had a 4 hour tour with a private car and we saw loads. She is very knowledgeable about the history and architecture of this wonderful city - it was fascinating. She also organized for me to see a tango show in the evening that included a meal and the dancing was just outstanding. All in all - highly recommended!

Buenos Aires Ambassador and great Guide !. "Liz", is a walking encyclopedia who shares her knowledge in a fun learning experience .I really enjoyed my two (2) days of city touring. We truly saw all the major attractions . In addition we spent enough time at each attraction to get all levels of detail , that you could absorb. I highly recommend "Liz" !Liz even made sure to visit Recoleta Cemetery on the birthday of Eva, to see the lovely bouquets of flowers at her gravesite !

Wonderful tour for our group. I brought a group of 20 people to Buenos Aires earlier this year and Liz was our tour guide for the city. She did a wonderful job of organizing the excursion, hiring a vehicle big enough for all of us to enjoy a private and then transporting us to our ship to begin a cruise. She had tremendous knowledge and enthusiasm for her city and the history it affords. I highly recommend her if you're planning some time in Buenos Aires.
Nice city tour. Fun tour with Liz,took us through some interesting areas of the city along with a nice lunch that featured some tango dancers.
Amazing Tour Guide!. Liz's comprehensive knowledge of Buenos Aires from history, architecture, politics and shopping is impressive. It was an immersion experience. Highly recommended!

She brings Argentina to life!. I've had the pleasure of traveling to many places and been on many guided tours, but Liz is by far the best tour guide I have ever had a tour from. I remember that I found her online and all the reviews were right and more! Liz cares about your experience in her hometown and has enough sense and experience to know the kind of tour she's dealing with and to adapt accordingly. When I went I was sharing the group with different age groups and she made it dynamic enough to keep us entertained but paused enough to really let the older people enjoy. Whatever you need, Liz was funny, charismatic and completely knowledgeable and I would highly recommend everyone to take this tour as it will make your Buenos Aires experience exponentially better!! Thank you Liz!

Fantastic tour guide!. I booked a tour with Liz after reading the rave reviews in Trip Advisor. I was not disappointed! We had dozens of emails going back and forth between us; I'm a bit of a micro-manager :-). She was great! She answered my emails right away, and was very accommodating. She's extremely knowledgable, and clearly loves her city. I learned a lot and had a fabulous time. Thank you, Liz!!

Wonderful tour guide!. We booked a full day tour of BA after reading the wonderful reviews for Liz. She met and exceeded all our expectations! Was very sensitive to what we wanted to do and kept just the right pace. We saw lots of sights and also visited some nice shops and ate a a great local restaurant in La Boca. She was able to tell us lots of the history of BA as well as the politics (which we love to understand in the places we go). I highly recommend Liz!

Buenos Aires Tour. Great experience with a well versed guide. Liz led 7 of us on what felt like a personalized tour . . . because it was. Not the "standard" tour but one with a history of the political, economic, and social factors that influenced the city. Her congeniality and attention to detail made this a great experience. She was able to modify her usual tour to fit our schedules.

Outstanding All-Day Tour of Buenos Aires with Liz. My wife and I spent 2 days in Buenos Aires prior to a cruise on the Celebrity Infinity. While planning the trip, I was looking for a small group tour of as much of the city as we could see in one day (without rushing!). I found many excellent reviews of Liz on Tripadvisor, and contacted her by email. She was very prompt in answering, and I booked the tour.Liz was able to add 3 more people to the tour, which was the limit she set, and that reduced the price for us. We were picked up promptly at our hotel, and asked what interested us. She did the same with the other people she picked up. That way she was able to customize the tour based on what we were interested in seeing.Liz has wonderful knowledge of the history of Argentina and Buenos Aires, and also a great understanding of the economy and the problems facing the country.While walking in La Boca, we stopped for lunch and ate outside at a restaurant that featured tango dancers and entertainment. My wife and had had empanadas, which were delicious.We had one person on the tour who wanted to dominate the conversation and at times was more interested in talking about himself than listening to Liz. Liz did an excellent job handling the situation so that we were able to get the most out of the tour and her narration.I highly recommend Liz for one or more days of touring in Buenos Aires and the surrounding area.

Great tour of BA. Liz took us on a walking-taxi tour of Buenos Aires. She asked us several questions to determine what types of places we would enjoy the most. My husband and I have very different tastes, so she took us to places each of us would enjoy. Wherever we went, Liz provided us with extensive historical insights that allowed us to understand the significance of what we were experiencing. Liz is very personable, eager to please her clients, and a delight to have as a tour guide. Highly recommend her.

Tried to organize a tour but was really discouraged. Wrote Liz to ask for informations about a possible tour for my family but received rather unfriendly e-mails asking why I don't guide them myself, as I lived in BA, saying I couldn't expect immediate answers (which I didn't expect at all), between other things, and concluding that the TOUR WOULD NOT TAKE PLACE (in capital letters). Just didn't understand the style in answer to my mails that were on my opinion friendly and not pressuring.

Highlites of Buenos Aires. We had 2 wonderful days with Liz.We did a tour of the city one day and a tour of Tigre Delta the second.Both days were wonderful and her knowledge of the history of both wasexcellent.The Tigre Delta was fabulous and the stories of her teenage years spent  there made the day even more special.

Large group tours arrange by Liz.. Liz works very professional and with great insight. She has several suggestions which suits our groups interests and budget. In advance, she informed us very well about weather, local currency, different options and more. For our group, she arrange CityBike-tour, Tigre Delta tour and local Tango tour. She is efficient and likeable and we give her our best recommendations. We were a Danish group of 16 persons.

Tigre Delta and Buenos Aires. Thanks for the great day trip to Tigre Delta (and a little bit of Buenos Aires on the way to and from). Liz is an excellent tour guide. She provided lots of commentary and history throughout the entire trip and customizes the tour to her audience. Definitely will book her again next time I'm BA.

Liz simply #ROCKS!!. We did a full day tour of Buenos Aires with Liz and it was an amazing experience. Thanks to bureaucratic disembarkation snafus, our cruise ship was running behind schedule by nearly 2 hours but Liz was very patient and waited for our party to arrive. Liz is extremely knowledgeable about Buenos Aires..Our tour discussions ranged on a variety of topics from art to politics to culture and lots more... she really knows her stuff! :-) I could go on about the tour itself but i will share a personal incident which was the most memorable for me. During the trip, my son was still recovering from a very congested chest (cough/cold) . We had run out of cough medicine purchased prior to the trip. Even though we were way behind schedule, Liz helped me track down a local pharmacy to get the right medicine for my son. I highly recommend Liz's tour if you want a professional guide with the personal touch!
Coming back from Antartica. Hi Lise, I wish I could had spend more time touring with you I learn a lot about Buenos Aires. Thank you so muchFrance

Buenos Aires in a day. We did a full day "Introduction to Buenos Aires" tour with Andrea (aka Liz) and found her to be organised, friendly, articulate and passionate about her city. She combined the 2 of us (Aussies) with 4 other people (Americans) and we had a wonderful day. We saw all the "must do" sights and some of the lesser known ones. And we had the benefit of Andrea's explanations and commentary which made the whole day educational and interesting as well as enjoyable. Highly recommended.

Doesn't get any better than Liz!. We don't often do private tours as we are somewhat skeptical of general reviews. HOWEVER, I must say that liz was great with her pre tour communications, right on time for our departure through the city and extremely knowledgeable about Buenos Aires and it surrounding area. We had a great time, understood her commentary completely and was charming and precise.

Wonderful tour around a beautiful city!. When we first arrived to Buenos Aires we didn't really knew what to expect. We were very surprised by the detailed knowledge and love for the city that Liz showed us. She talked about history, economics, pop culture and many different fields about argentinian life that we had no idea about!But more than her great knowledge, Liz is so much fun to be around. We were referred to her by some friends and she did not disappoint at all! If you want a full day of excitement and a true glance at Buenos Aires, Liz should be your choice.

Fabulous day in Buenos Aires. We docked at our cruise terminal and Liz met us, exactly as planned, to begin our wonderful tour of Buenos Aires. She was great fun, very informative and a talented tango dancer! She took us to all the major sights in a comfortable mini bus and plied us with the local biscuits. Her English was very good and she made our trip very entertaining. We enjoyed the day so much, we booked another tour with her for later in the week to the Tigre river. Her knowledge of her city and its history is extensive and I would highly recommend Liz. Excellent!

Tour during 12 hour layover in Buenos Aires. I was picked up at AEP airport and dropped off 12 hours later at EZE airport to continue my trip. Pickup and drop off were efficient and on time. My guide, Pedro, was very knowledgeable and gave a very good explanation of the history, architecture, important buildings and culture of Buenos Aires as we walked for about 3-4 hours through the city. Afterward Pedro suggested an excellent restaurant (Happenings) for dinner.

Tangoshow and dinner in BA. We (2 Belgian couples) had only one free night in Buenos Aires before starting a cruise and wanted a typical Argentinian evening !Liz did a great job in doing the reservation for us for a tangoshow and dinner. Although there was a little problem with the company that had to pick us up, everything was OK thanks to the professional service of Liz who had given us all necessary information in case of problems.We had a wonderful evening in BA.So do not hesitate to hire Liz ! She is very efficient and professional !

Best way to see buenos aires. My husband and I spent the day with Liz getting to know all the high points of this amazing city. Liz is passionate about her city and was able to bring us the rich and significant history that we would have lost on our own. She also gave us suggestions for the rest of our stay. The day was worth every penny!

2 days tour of Boenos Aires with Liz and Pedro. My husband and I were traveling to Buenos Aires in December 2015. We took 2 days tour. The first day Pedro took us on all day tour of Buenos Aires and 4 hours the second day. His English was perfect American english . Liz was was completely booked but she went out of her way to organize the tour for us. We were fortunate to have a tour with Pedro. He told us a lot about Argentina history we went to San Telmo, the old part of town, with its cobbled stone streets and antiques shops. Downtown area, with Plaza de Mayo, Colon Theatre,Presidential Palace,and Metropolitan Cathedral. Recoleta with its amazing cemetery. Puerto Madero, the recycled former port docks are now the most modern part of the city. Palermo, the green lung of Buenos Aires and its Rose Garden.Pedro is friendly, very informed and goes out of his way to help about suggestions, recommendations. His background is helpful to get a historic and cultural sense of the city. We ran into Liz while on tour with Pedro. when she met us it was like we were long time friends. She was very warm and friendly.We would definrtely recommend Liz's tours. They are the best.Our trip to BA would have been incomplete without the tour. Thank you Liz and PedroInna and George

A real pro with a passion for all things Buenos Aires. Liz is a real pro. She knows Buenos Aires like the back of her hand and loves to tell its story. I corresponded by email with Liz for 6 months prior to our visit. Never did an email go unanswered. She let us know about every opportunity including adding some folks to our group of 4 (with our prior approval) to reduce costs. We had a great time with her touring the city one day and the Tigre Delta another. She also arranged for us to visit a truly spectacular dinner and tango show. You’ll gain insights about Argentina’s politics, economy and culture from Liz that you will never get on an organized bus tour. She and her driver were always on time and kept things moving beautifully. Contact her at Liz2arg@yahoo.com

Exploring Buenos Aires. Prior to going on a cruise of Antarctica we had a couple of days in Buonos Aiures and we wanted to ensure we saw what we could to get the flavour of this beautiful Paris of South America. Using trip advisor I arranged a private tour with taxis for the 3 of us- Liz was very helpful prior to arrival and arranged a very classy tango theatre evening for us with pick up and wine tasting and a pleasant dinner the entertainment was excellent. Back to the tour with Liz ; it was informative and as much as we could hope to covering a day - we covered La Bocca the cemetery and Recolleta and San Elmo. We were given things to do in fee time on return from the cruise and many recommendations to ensure a safe passage- recommended.

Excellent guide Highly recommend.. We booked Liz by email online prior to our visit over several emails and she met us at our hotel. Liz is extremely knowledgeable and goes out of her way to provide a tour that is tailored to the interests of her guests. We went as a party of 3 and Liz tailored the full day tour to our interests. BA is an amazing fascinating city with quite a lot more history than is often known and I would highly recommend spending a day with Liz learning about the history and character of the people and buildings around you. There is far too much to see in one day so Liz kindly drew all over a map of the city for us to point out other interesting places/areas to visit while we were there. An extremely nice and knowledgeable helpful guide.

An informative overview of Buenos aires.. We booked a tour with Liz prior to leaving New Zealand. Communications were great and she responded to emails very promptly. Liz was able to customise the tour to suit our needs. She provided a good overview of the history of Argentina. While we only had a short time in Buenos Aires we felt we got a good overview of the city visiting many different districts. The vehicle Liz arranged was comfortable.Liz speaks fluent English and is easy to understand. She is obviously passionate about her city. We had a most enjoyable day. We have no hesitation in recommending Liz as guide in Buenos Aires. Thanks Liz

Private Tour. . Excellent Tour Guide Spoke great English with a witty sense of humor. We had a group of 8 and was well accommodated. Make sure to try to get off early if your on a cruise ship the port was difficult to get off the boat being a container port. We saw everything we wanted to see except for the Tortoni cafe due to a protest in the area.

Excellent Private Tour of Buenos Aires. We were on a cruise and booked Liz for a private tour from 10-5 in Buenos Aires. We travelled as a family of 8 (grandparents, grandkids 8 & 5, parents, and aunt & uncle). We visited the Recoleta Cemetery, La Boca, Puerto Madera, and San Telmo. We had lunch at a small restaurant Liz recommended and we enjoyed the tango dancing. We experienced a good amount of Buenos Aires in only one day with Liz's expert sight-seeing guidance. We highly recommend Liz!

Valuable, entertaining resource!. My family of 11 (grandparents, parents, grand/kids ages 15 to 23) spent a day with Liz in Buenos Aires. We were impressed with and appreciative of her detailed historical references as she took us to Recoleta Cemetery, La Boca, Puerto Madera, and San Telmo. I wish we had been able to book her for additional tours (her tours of the monuments in the city and of the Tigre River sound great), but with our disparate interests and the Christmas holiday, we had to settle with only one day of Liz's expert sight-seeing guidance. We had lunch in La Boca at a small restaurant Liz recommended and were especially thrilled when Liz was invited to participate in the tango dancing being performed. Even without the right shoes, and dancing with an unfamiliar partner, Liz's skill and charm were exquisite! My husband and I intend to return to B.A., and we will again secure Liz's services for additional insightful excursions in the city. Thank you, Liz, for a wonderful, fun, and educational day!

Great Experience in Buenos Aires. Liz was a great tour guide. We were able to see many parts of the city including: Recoleta, San Telmo, La Boca, and the center of the city. Buenos Aires is very big and has many sites to see. Liz arranged a private driver for myself and my husband, as well as for another traveler. We had a semi-private tour, and Liz was able to give a sample of all the different areas of BA. I would suggest that if you really want to spend a lot of time in one area to organize this with Liz because what she can provide from 10 - 5 is really only a taste, but for first timers this is perfect. I feel like we covered a lot of ground and had a good idea of what BA had to offer. This would be good to plan in the beginning of your trip, so that you can return to areas that you find more interesting than others. Liz was informative and has knowledge of the city and its history. Thank you Liz for a nice experience.

Wonderful in-depth tours with Liz!. I found Liz here on TripAdvisor and emailed her requesting a tour for one person. She got back to me very quickly and answered all of my questions. Liz also worked with me, my time in Argentina and my budget as I was only one person. One day she even found more people to attend a tour with me to lower the cost! She organized a wonderful half-day tour of Argentina, a full day tour of Tigre and a Tango class. I also found Liz to be a very interesting, warm and heartfelt person (we spent a lot of 1-on-1 time together!). I definitely recommend Liz for personal tours, she really cares about her clients and takes time to organize tours that suit the group.

Great half day tour. I booked two half day tours with Liz for my husband and mother-in-law who were visiting for a few days. Liz did a great job introducing this fascinating city to them and they enjoyed the tours very much. I arranged everything with her by email and she responded very quickly. Highly recommended.

Fantastic in-depth and personalized tour of the history and culture of Buenos Aires. Three of us hired Liz for a few hours in the afternoon to give us a tour of Buenos Aires during our short stay over in between flights home. She was very communicative at the start and gave us a nice overview of the places she planned to visit during our 4-hour afternoon tour. She then asked us what our interests were to adjust the plans as necessary. Because there were few of us, we did the tour via cab, which also was a unique way to experience the city, and we got out and walked around most of the areas she was highlighting. Liz has a true passion for sharing her love of the history and culture of Buenos Aires, Argentina, and the stories behind the historical sites we visited. I would definitely recommend her!

Liz is a wonderful guide!. I contacted Liz via email only one day prior to our tour. She was very flexible and was able to accommodate us right away. We did a 4 hour drive/walk tour of the parts of Buenos Aires that we had not seen yet. Liz was able to change our itinerary as we were driving based on how we were feeling and what we had already seen. She was very professional, very knowlegeable, very well informed and, above, really friendly. We had a great time and we recommend her to any visitor coming to Buenos Aires. My only regret is that I did not plan earlier so we would have had all day.

Fantastic tour!. We only had a few hours to explore BA and Liz exceeded expectations, especially given our time frame! She met us at our hotel, gave us a quick overview of the city and its history over a map she spread out before us, then we hopped in a cab to our first of several destinations. She filled us in on the history and cultural significance of each district we visited. We were able to walk around quite a bit, take photos, and really appreciate the city thanks to Liz. She also arranged a tango show with dinner for us by reserving our tickets and transportation. She's a great guide and I highly recommend her. We would love to return to BA and enjoy her knowledge, competence, and company spread out over a few days.

A very special tour guide!. Liz is educated and passionate about her work and her country. We saw the sights in Buenos Aires in one day, but we also learned a great deal about the history of the country and the present day situation and politics. Her English is very good. We were only in BA one day, but had we stayed longer, we would have booked Liz for the many other tours that she offers. She was the best!

Great intro to BA!. My husband was traveling on business and I engaged Andrea/Liz for a private shopping tour of the local designer boutiques. Liz was very knowledgeable and professional and in addition to finding some great bargains on designer goods and leather I learned a lot about the history of the city and it's neighborhoods. Be sure to take lots of American dollars to exchange them in BA for the best rate!
Very interesting tour. Liz is a very interesting educated person, we really enjoyed out time together and got a lot of information about history, modern life, architecture, places to visit.

Perfect Introduction to Buenos Aires. I spent a great day with Liz-Andrea on Sunday October 25. This was a special day for Argentinians, the Election Day and a rugby match of Argentina vs Australia at Rugby World Cup. And I greatly appreciate Andrea spent a large amount of the day with me. It was like being with a very knowledgeable friend. We visited several parts of the city including Plaza de Mayo, La Boca, Recoleta, and Palermo and finished the tour at the street market in San Telmo. Andrea is an excellent guide, and visiting all these places without her would not be the same. Behind her impressive knowledge of history, are life stories of Argentinian people in different periods of time, the stories of revolution and dictatorship, the stories of rich and poor, and very poor, which really touch you…. While watching rugby during lunch, Andrea told me that national sport is still football; however Argentina is not performing so well recent years. I also learned about food, and about tango and what it means for Argentinian people. Andrea booked for me the nice little place where I next day enjoyed Tango show and learned basic steps of the dance (was really fun). She also advised me things to do next day such as guided tour of Teatro Colon, that really is impressive and I could only wish to see performance there. Overall, day spent with Andrea was fantastic, and I would highly recommend her, she really personalize the tour and I could not imagine somebody would not enjoy it.

Great overview of Buenos Aires. Thanks to Andrea, we had a great lesson on the history of Buenos Aires. She was very conscientious in making sure she was giving us what we wanted on the tour. We loved the history of how the different barrios in Buenos Aires were formed and why and the special interesting facts related to each area. The Recoleta Cemetery was very interesting especially the food left for the cats. We loved all the history of Evita Peron and the Peronistas and the Malvinas war. We felt like we were able to get a good taste of Buenos Aires in 1 day and will definitely want to return to see it in more detail. The Tango show was also a lot of fun!Thanks Andrea and hope to be back someday. Connie and Ray

Get the inside track!. Liz was very warm and friendly and knowledgable. I learned a lot of interesting things about BA and Argentina's history and lore and about the neighborhoods in the city and what each one has to offer. On our shopping tour, she took me to the best places for local designers and leather goods outlets so my CHristmas shopping is halfway done! Highly recommend spending some time with Liz early in your trip to BA so you get a handle on the city for your visit.

Nice tour guide.. She is kind, caring, knowledgeable, and professional. She really knows the City history, makes it interesting and engaging. Her command of the English language is excellent. The tour was well organized and the perfect length. Thank you Liz, We hope to see you again. Leslie and Robert

Very informative . My husband and I arrived in Argentina with basically no clue on the history. Andrea explained the history of Argentina and Buenos Aires first. We then set out on a tour of the city. The tour of the city was very interesting. She also arranged a tango lesson and dinner, which was great! She is very knowledgeable and does a wonderful job of explaining things. Due to the volatile Argentine economy, we needed to pay by American dollars. If you book with her make sure that you take that much cash with you. Highly recommend!

Two mini tours with Liz in Buenos Aires. Liz was VERY accommodating for us- at our initial meeting, we sat down over an expresso and discussed what we would like to see during our stay in BA. She made her suggestions based on the type of travelers we are and suggested where we could go on our own and how to use the best of our time. She also recommended a tour to Tigre which was not on my radar, but I'm definitely glad we went!

A Wonderful Buenos Aires Tour . My family and I spent two-and-a-half days touring Buenos Aires with Liz and it was a highlight of our trip. We spent a day and a half in the city and a day in Tigre. She also helped us arrange a day trip to Colonia, Uruguay. Liz tailored the tour to our interests. She is knowledgeable about her city's history and culture and brings it all to life. She is also friendly and fun to spend time with. We saw many of the major sights and learned a lot about Argentina. Liz also recommended things for us to see and do when we were not touring with her. She recommended great spots for lunch and we really enjoyed talking with her over lunch. We had such a good time that she's talking about doing a semester abroad in Buenos Aires!Our touring with Liz was a highlight of our trip. My wife and I are talking about returning to Argentina and we would definitely hire Liz for more tours. I would recommend Liz to my friends and family without reservation.

Fascinating tour with an excellent guide. Touring Buenos Aires with Liz has been an extremely enjoyable experience. Her intimate knowledge of the city's history, architecture, attractions and of its unique character were very clearly reflected in the tour she has designed for us. Although our schedule allowed only a half a day tour, she managed to create an impression of a very thorough visit. She has also provided us with very useful in-depth tips for additional visits which were very useful when we returned to Buenos Aires for a brief stay at the and of over Argentinian trip.

very talented guide. we spent couple of hours with Liz in Buenos Aires. it was great. she is very knowledgeable and her explanations are very interesting. unfortunately she was busy with other guests in the same days we were visiting- it was defiantly our lose.Liz gave us a very clear overview on many aspects of the city ,explained in a very vivid and special way the places we visited and gave us very good advises for the next days.

Put yourself in the Hands of Liz Andrea for the Best Private Tour of Buenos Aires. My wife and I spent two wonderful days with Liz Andrea being introduced to and exploring Buenos Aires at our own pace during our recent 5 day stay. A very professional and knowledgeable private tour guide who speaks English very well, she introduced us to so much of the historic, geographic, socio economic, political and architectural aspects of this great Argentinian capital city. Liz Andrea is bright, humorous and fun to be with and takes each visitor into account as she plans her tour days. She is well connected and familiar with all parts of the city as well as the nearby areas of Tigre and Colonia. We chose to focus on the city itself. We visited the Recoleta, Retiro, Centro, and Bocca areas with Liz Andrea. My wife wished to have a leather jacket made while in Buenos Aires and Liz Andrea was of great assistance in the accomplishment of the mission. She also arranged a fabulous dinner and Tango show night for us. Liz Andrea also suggested locations for more in depth visits during the rest of our stay in the city including the Colon Theatre. Walking the streets of a great city is the only way to get to truly get the feel of it. When you do not speak the language and feel you are out of your depth, it is great to have an excellent private tour guide. We were fortunate to have found that person in Liz Andrea while visiting Buenos Aires. We highly recommend her to you when you visit.Barry 123013, Canada

A wonderful way to see Buenos Aires. We had a short but fantastic experience touring Buenos Aires and the Tigre area with Liz. She made every effort to help us get the most out of our time in the area and experience some of the Argentine culture. Her knowledge and passion for Argentine history and politics is impressive--we learned a lot. We hope to return to B A for a longer stay --maybe next year--and will definitely contact Liz.

Excellent Experience with Liz. Liz was an excellent tour guide showing us many different parts of Buenos Aires. Her knowledge of Argentinan history is extensive. Her recommendations of where to dine and areas to explore (both in and outside of the city) were great. She even invited us to join her at a milonga where she dances the tango! She expertly handles all issues that arise and makes sure your experience is everything it should be. Our visit was wonderful!

Excellent Tour of Buenos Aires. We contacted Liz on very short notice, she made every effort to accommodate us, and meet us the next morning at our hotel. Her passion and love of Buenos Aires was evident. We enjoyed our tour, and learned so much about Argentina and Buenos Aires in such a short time. We had a great time!!! Liz was an amazing tour guide, our only regret is that we did not have more time during our stay to go out with her again.

Geat tour guide, passionate historian, genuine love for country, excellent english!. The perfect private tour of Buenos Aires!. My wife and I arranged for a 6-7 hour tour with Liz, it was amazing. Liz is so knowledgeable and easy to work with. Excellent English speaking guide with passion for history. Liz met us at our hotel and spent time going through much of the history of the city/country before we headed off for a very busy, very interesting tour of the city and surrounding area. Excellent private tour guide. We arrived in Buenos Aires a couple of days before departing on a cruise and had met up with our son and his friend who are spending a few months travelling around South America. We wanted the make the best of our time in BA so asked Liz to show us as much of the city as she could in a day. Excellent Personal Private Guided Tour. My wife and I have traveled with private guides in Egypt, Southern Africa, East Africa, Myanmar, and Australia. In each case the guide enriched our experience considerably. Therefore, we contacted Liz to set up a half-day private guided tour. Liz was booked, so she referred us to her colleague, Pedro Werberg.Pedro led us on a half-day tour our first day in BA. He proposed an itinerary that included several “must-see” attractions, then adapted it to suit our preferences and pace. The tour was a very nice mix of walking, taking taxis, and stopping for coffee at Café Tortoni. In addition to describing the sights we were seeing, Pedro educated us about Argentine culture, history, economy and politics.We also enjoyed getting to know Pedro. He was very friendly, quite articulate, and a good listener. He was quite candid about politics in Argentina, which we appreciated.At a cost of US$130 plus tip for two people, the tour was a bargain.We will remember our day with Pedro very fondly.

Knowledgeable Guide / Customizable Tour - Highly Recommended. My husband and I recently spent a long weekend in Buenos Aires to celebrate my 40th birthday. Since neither one of us speaks Spanish well, and because there is so much to see in BA, I decided to book a private tour for us and our friends who came with us. I felt like the tour would help orient us to the city, and give us some ideas for things we’d like to do or go see on our own.We’ve done lots of tours in large groups before (particularly on cruises), but I never find those very satisfying. You are rushing from place to place, and things are usually geared towards the lowest-common denominator (someone who has absolutely no knowledge of the country they’re visiting, and who isn’t very mobile). The private tours we’ve done have been good, because the tour guide can usually modify her or his timing and itinerary and customize it. The tour with Liz definitely met that expectation.My husband and I booked the tour for the Friday morning that we landed in BA. Our flight got in at about 6am, and we originally scheduled the tour to start at 10am. I got nervous about possible delays through customs or from the airport, though, and Liz said she was able to adjust to 10:30 with no problem. I shouldn’t have worried - we were able to get to our hotel in the Palermo district with plenty of time to spare. Our friends had arrived the day before, so we were all ready to go by the time Liz showed up.When scheduling the tour, Liz had said that we would be too big a group to rent a car - we could take taxis or else hire a driver and van. We opted for the driver and van; the up charge wasn’t bad at all. When the “van” showed up, though, we were really surprised. It was actually a mini-bus. It was a little comical for the 5 of us to pile in and out of it throughout the day, but Liz said that it was cheaper to do it that way than to rent a mini-van. The driver was good and the van was comfortable.We started at Recoleta Cemetery, and learned some of the history of the place from Liz. I have been to famous cemeteries in Paris, New Orleans, and other cities - this one definitely belongs near the top of the list for great world cemeteries. She told us interesting stories about some of the notable mausoleums and monuments, and of course showed us where Evita is buried. Afterwards, we walked through the Recoleta district, checking out old mansions that have been converted to hotels and embassies. It really felt like we could have been in a European Capital.From Recoleta, we drove through the new Puerto Madero district, and through el Centro. She pointed out Florida Street as the best place to change US Dollars, and then we made a stop in the La Boca neighborhood. This was definitely a rougher neighborhood than Recoleta, but still beautiful. We walked around admiring the ad-hoc architecture, and Liz took us to a place that changed some of our money (not at as good of a rate as we eventually got on Florida ST, but better than the official rate). We ate at a little courtyard restaurant that was off-the-beaten path from all the tango restaurants in La Boca. The food was good, though, and we definitely felt like we were in another country.After lunch, we went to El Centro and walked around there for a while. We saw the outside of the Pink House, and ended the tour in the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Cathedral (where Pope Francis served as arch bishop before moving to Rome). As we were wrapping up, Liz arranged for the friends we were traveling with to see a tango show later that night. My husband and I were wiped out after the day of travel and touring, so we opted out of that. The tour was great - I feel like we were lucky to have found someone as passionate and knowledgeable about her country as Liz. I also appreciated her “go with the flow” approach, as she tailored the tour to the things we wanted to see and were most interested in. I highly recommend a personal tour with Liz if you happen to be traveling to Buenos Aires for some sight-seeing.

Great tour and worth every dime!. We had a great time with Miguel doing the tour of the islands just north of Buenos Aires. He spoke great english and the islands were amazing to see. Miguel took us on his boat to see the islands and we even made a stop by his personal ranch. I highly recommend this tour and company. This was probably my favorite "excursion" from our trip to BA. Very personal and enjoyable tour!

If you like to know and see more of Buenos Aires book a tour with Liz !. Our friends on the cruise had "found" Liz as a highly recommanded guide and after looking and seeing all the great reviews on TA we decided to join them for the day . And we were very pleased at the end of the day that we did. Emails prior to our arrival were answered fast and in detail . We met Liz at the historic Restaurant "La Biela "near the huge cemetery in the Recolecta area where Liz told us about the history and politics of Argentina which facts were important to know going around the different neighbourhoods of BA . Starting at the cemetery where Evita Perron is burried and many other historical figures and moving on to the very nice historical "Palaces" and buildings now occupied by foreign embassies and major hotels . As a big contrast to this area we moved on in a couple of cabs to the colourful La Boca area where , and it pays to have a good connection like Liz , we got great seats at a "tango" Restaurant where we enjoyed some nice local food and enjoyed the dancers including Liz . After lunch we walked some more through this fun part of the city before we went to the major downtown square to go into the Pink Palace where Evita had given her famous speech . We all had a great day and felt richer by all these wonderful experiences and the great tour that Liz had given us . For that we can really recommend booking with Liz . She also helped us make up our mind of which Tango Show we should book , Gala Tango ! And she was right on that also , it was the best show we could have wished to see.! Thanks Liz for a great day !

An excellent guide choice for your tour of BA!. We "found" Liz by researching reviews here on TA and, as expected, the reviews were right! Liz is a native-born Argentinean and immensely knowledgeable about her home country. Our 6-hr tour of the city began with a short (45-min) overview of the history of Argentina and it's "ups-and-downs"...including a good introduction to the current social/political issues of today. Based on our preferences we had arranged prior to our arrival, Liz showed us both historical and cultural sites around the central part of the city (the major cemetery, churches, museums, important buildings and other landmarks) before traveling out to the La Boca area for a sidewalk lunch at a "tango" restaurant and viewing the "artsy" side streets of this neighborhood. Other neighborhoods were visited before ending our tour back in city center. Liz does not have personal transportation (car, van, etc.), but relies on public transportation for movement about the city. Although initially seen as a negative, using local taxis/buses allows for a better expenditure of your time (Liz isn't hampered with trying to drive/park/etc.). And, in reality, it's another opportunity to experience the BA lifestyle.If you're looking for a custom tour of BA, you will be more than satisfied with Liz for your needs. Be sure to book well in advance in order to communicate exactly your expectations about what to do, where to go and what to see. You won't be disappointed. (Photo is my wife on left, Liz on right...with the hat.)

LIZ Buenos Aires Private Tour Guide. We had a great tour through LIZ -- very interesting information about the city, its history, politics and current things. Excellent and informative. spent two half day tours with Liz in her beautiful Buenos Aires. Liz is highly professional and most knowledgeable about her city. Time with Liz is amazing. I spent one day with Liz in early January. There was one other couple that joined us making it easy to get around via taxi. love for her country. Great to hear someone tell with so much love for her country, Liz drags you through BA. She lets customers set the pace and make it as crazy as you want, or not, it's just what you want

Best of the best. Liz is a very excellent guide : she knows everything about her town and her country. One of best walking tours we've had. Where ever we travel in the world, we always try and hook up with a local walking tour. None better. My wife and I visited Buenos Aires in early December. Liz suggested Gala Tango which was memorable-doubt there's any better. Two tours with Liz. I booked two city tours with Liz and used her concierge services to book a tango show and Argentina Polo Day. Liz is incredibly knowledgable about the history of Argentina. Wonderfull day with private tour guide Liz. We had a wonderfull day in Buenos Aires with our tour guide Liz.Altough the rain was falling our tour guide Liz keep on shining the whole day. LIZ IS B.A.!. LIZ is an well educated tourguide. She is very people serviced, and polite.We made a private-two days trip with her. Just the best. I was spending 2 days in Buenos Aires for a short vacation but wanted to make the most of my time there. Best Tour Guide... Ever!. My girlfriend and I spent the first day of our three day visit to Buenos Aires with Liz. She is a fantastic guide! Enjoyable tour and guide. Spent a day with Liz hitting most of the hot spots in Bs.As. We started off with a history lesson and added in some politics then hit the road. Wonderful Tours during 3 Half Days with Liz!. I went to Buenos Aires for working and I hired Liz to show me around during my free time. She organized all very well. Liz scores a 10, again!. Liz knows the town; she knows the history and she knows the politics. She is a fountain of knowledge about Buenos Aires. We did a day tour with her and had an excellent time. Tour with Liz. We (four people) visited Buenos Aires for the first time. We spent with Liz two half-days. Liz told us about the history, culture, and traditions of this beautiful city. Lot of info and a nice woman to share the city with.. Liz will tell you a good resume about her country and details about the city from a local point of view. Great job Liz!. Liz is a local lady originally from Buenos Aires. She feels proud of it and will tell you all her knowledge that make the tour more interesting instead of visiting by yourself. She is professional with a good command of english.

She knows the culture and the history and puts it all in perspective.. Four of us spent a day with Liz. She met us at our hotel in Recoleta and we spent about an hour learning about the history and politics of Argentina from the Spanish conquest forward. She is facile in explaining the complex and tempestuous history of the culture and politics of this nation which are difficult to sort out for the visitor--even those interested in geopolitics. She was senstive to what we wanted to see and was very careful not to divulge her own politcal leanings until she understood our perspectives. Her family has been in Argentine for at least three generations, so she has experienced first hand or through her parents or grandparents' memories much of the last 75 years of tumult in this country. They came as hard-working immigrants (like almost all Argentines). She is a good teacher and gave us erudite explanations of all we saw, in an historical/political context, from the Recoleta cemetary, to the metropolitan cathedral, to the protestor in front of the "red house". It was a pleasure to hear her interpretation of ancient events as well as more recent gossip about Papa Francis and President Cristina Fernandez Krishner. An juicy and possibly true stories about the corpse of Eva Peron. We went to lunch in La Boca at a not very good restaurant, and enjoyed this part of the city the least. (Might want to skip this colorful, but touristy part of BA.) Liz is expensive, but we felt she provided good value. We were quoted a price of 100.00 a head and paid that even though we went from two to four clients. She is an Afficianado of the Tango and participates herself frequently, She referred us to Gala Tango with tango lession, dinner and excellent show. We enjoyed it--frist rate muscians and dancers. Know what you want to see and she will be better able to tailor your day's outing. We started at 10AM and finshed at 5PM.SInce in my opinion tourism at its best introduces us not just to sights but also to culture and different ways of perceiving and living the human experience, I think Liz is excellent and I can recommend her easily and gladly. I would use her again if I returned to this interesting, complicated culture of Tango and the Disapeared; of and Francis and Cristina.

Good guide and cute lady. Liz arrived on time at our hotel. She was very professional and really know what is she doing. In a while she understand your interests and become flexible to them. great 2 days. Great guide in Buenos Aires. We got Liz's name from some family friends who had toured with her before, and they were right to recommend her. We toured with Liz for two days, and she was great! Great Buenos Aires tour guide. Our group of 4 spent 3 days touring Buenos Aires with Liz in early February. Great guide for Buenos Aires. Energetic, personable, knowledgeable. We hired Liz as our guide for 2-1/2 days in Buenos Aires based on Trip Advisor reviews and Liz’s website. We were not disappointed. As other reviewers have said, her knowledge of history, politics, and culture of Argentina is encyclopedic and provided an excellent framework for our short visit. She knows the “ins and outs” for getting around town. There were four people in our group, and Liz was flexible enough to handle some changes in her original plans in order to accommodate us. She also had to make some revisions based on the unusually cold weather (by local standards) that we had during our stay in BA – we can confirm that Liz knows the best places to get hot chocolate! We were lucky because the big agriculture show was underway, and that was especially interesting – of course we would never have known about it on our own. I think that when you leave a place and the guide has made you want to come back, the guide has done a good job. Liz made sure we would all have good memories of Buenos Aires and a desire to return there to see and learn more. The only thing I would suggest is that if there are going to be 4 or more people in your party, think about working with Liz ahead of time to arrange a driver with a car big enough for everyone. We split up into two cabs, which worked pretty well, but it would have been more fun if we’d all been together. I just didn’t think of that while I was making BA arrangements.
