She made my trip so fun and we optimized my time a lot!. Hi there. I have to tell that Liz is such a nice lady. She is very professional but more , she is a good human being wich I value more. We spent 2 days and 2 nights doing city tour, enjoying the city as a tourist and as a local as we stopped at some bars and lunch places. We also went to tango wich I love but as I don´t dance we visited 3 places in one long night so I have seen the local life. I also went to a Tango Show and now I can tell that I have been at the same place as Madonna and Liza Minelli went. Liz knows all the gossips around jajaja so she makes the tours very fun.

Private Tour with LIz Flores. My husband & I , along with another couple spent our first day in Buenos Aires with Liz. She met us at our hotel, promptly, and we sat down for an hour and she gave us an overview of the history and politics of Argentina. We then proceeded in taxis to various places that were of interest to our group.She spoke excellent English, was very knowledgeable, and was very pleasant. In fact, we wanted to hire her for the following day, but she was booked.I would highly recommend hiring Liz.

Liz enriched our experience!. Having visited Rio and Petropolis with a guide, we decided that a guide in Buenos Aires was a must-do as well. My husband chose well when he chose Liz. He explained what aspects of our visit would interest us most and she tailored our visit accordingly. She guided us toward authentic experiences so that we avoided the popular tourist traps. We sat together and and got a social/economic/historic orientation before embarking on any barrio of the city. Excellent choice if you speak English as she speaks it well.

Simply the Best. As I was traveling solo to Argentina and BA for the first time, I wanted to make sure I was as educated as possible to all this amazing city has to offer. I could not have done better than hiring Liz as a private guide.She is intelligent, informed and passionate about her city but most importantly open to making your tour what you want it to be. I had done some homework about Buenos Aires prior to my visit and so had honed in on what interested me and Liz could not have been more accommodating or enthusiastic about my choices.I cannot recommend her highly enough. She's worth every penny.

Liz Provides A Wonderful Way to See Buenos Aires!. My husband and I arranged for a day tour of BA with Liz and we were amazed with her wealth of information. We do not speak Spanish. Liz personalized our tour to our interests and was extremely easy to communicate with. We would recommend her services to anyone who is interested in finding out more about this fascinating city,and learning about its resilient people. In addition, we were privy to some great shopping, tango shows, and beautiful city neighborhood explorations. Here is her link:http://www.lizflor2.blogspot.com/

Liz is lovely! It is your friend to show the local life and history. Good choice. First visitor and in South America far from my country and with a different language. I decided to contact Liz after searching google. She has good comments and I trust. I can confirm she is a local nice lady with education that is passionate to show you her city and roots. We enjoyed the touristic and history part and also conversations where I learned a lot about local life. If you want to do sth by yourself and not in a group of tourists with fixed schedules this will be a good choice.She has a blogspot with all her info is http://www.lizflor2.blogspot.comGive a look and make your decision

Liz Flores private guide. My wife and I visited Buenos Aires in December 2012 for 10 days following a long cruise from Europe. In order to optimise our time in that fabulous city we decided to hire a private guide for a few days. We had done an internet search prior to our arrival and had arranges to hire Liz.What a serendipitous choice it turned out to be. Liz is a friendly lady who is extremely knowledgeable about both her country and its capital city. She is passionate (in a good way) about its culture and its history but also great fun to be with.She met us at our hotel and went through a brief history of both Argentina and Buenos Aires to give a reference point for the various sites we could visit and taking into account her recommendations we agreed an outline of our tours over a couple of days.The actual tours were highly informative, very interesting and most importantly for us fun. Liz is a lovely lady with a wide range of interests and therefore excellent company as well as a great guide and is highly recommended to anyone who like us is looking for a bespoke tour in Buenos Aires.

It works for me! A perfect day!. I met Liz by a contact in US that hired her a year ago. She is a lovely lady , very well travelled and with high level of education that unfortunately her country is not given a chance to get an establish job as she wishes.Since 2004 she started to study local history and made a wonderful research of the city so now she is very famous in taking visitors around the city with all her information and with her skills in administration so believe me, she really optimize the time in one day to do all! Highly recommended. http://www.lizflor2.blogpsot.com

Liz was a great lady to enjoy Buenos Aires with. Hi. I belong to a group of paintors from Portland Museum. We used to hire Liz each time one of us decide to travel to Buenos Aires. All of us have an excellent concept of her. She is a very local lady who is passionate about her city and local life. Has a high level of education and like to organize all in order to optimize your time.Very puntual and professional

Make the most of your time with Liz.. We were on a limited schedule to see BA. I booked a day with Liz and I couldn't have made a better choice. Liz knows BA and designed the day with our interests in mind. Did we see everything in BA. Of course not. But we saw a lot and Liz left us with her recommendations for finishing the trip. The best part was Liz's tour of Recoleta. We heard stories about the people buried there that were thrilling and scary and fascinating. Brava, Liz!

Lovely Lady spending Lovely Tour with.. Liz is a local lady with a high level of education .She started as a tour guide many years ago. She is an expert but more than this she knows all details in town. Is so nice to be with her and walk aroun the city to dicover and enjoy Buenos Aires. Really a good option. A little expensive, yes, but I really spent lovely times.

Excellent Way to See BA. We read about Liz on Tripadvisor and a travel blog in the New York Times. We decided we would like a full introduction to the city right at the beginning of our stay so we could get the lay of the land for the rest of our trip. Liz was great. She met us at our hotel in Recoleta and we sat down with her for a good hour first while, in almost perfect English, she gave us a very informative historical overview of Buenos Aires as well as its current political climate. We then spent the rest of the day walking and cabbing around town, stopping for lunch in La Boca and coffee at Cafe Tortoni. Liz seems quite well educated and quite well-informed and is a tango dancer to boot so she can connect you with all types of Tango shows. Her website is: www.lizflor2.blogspot.com and we would highly recommend her.

Good Experience with a Local Guide!. Want to share that I found Liz Tour Guide at Trip Advisor after reading some comments. I wrote to her and we organized the best way to meet and spend time visiting places in Buenos Aires and local life. We did all and I found a new friend. She is very cute and flexible, good guide! Want her to improve her business!

Perfect idea! Get a tailored tour was the best choice for us. We travelled to Buenos Aires for first time without speaking spanish. We love to walk around and don´t get crowded tours with fixed schedules. We love to feel free. So we found Liz at this site and we hire her for 2 days and 2 eve nights. In 2 days we learn a lot about Argentina and its people and of course TANGO ! She prepared a plan for us according to our interests. We stopped for a coffee and lunch. We visited all the Evita History and all the Tango Life. We enjoy Buenos Aires a lot! Tks Liz! You can visit her at www.lizflor2.blogspot.com to see this or other options and her profile. Good choice for us!

Buenos Aires Liz Local Tour was a wonderful experience!!!!. Hi . Wanna tell you that for first time I decided to hire a local guide instead of an agency. I found this very unique as I was like with a friend who knows the city very well and with all the explanations on line besides sharing coffees and activities like locals do. I ´m so happy!!!!!!!!!! Tks Liz!!!! Do it! www.lizflor2.blogspot.com

Authentic Guide!. Liz Flores is a very experienced guide for Buenos Aires.  She was delightful and helpful at all times and we particularly enjoyed our time at the Milonga with her, especially when we were privileged to see her dance.Highly recommendedLisa Abrahmsohn

Great Idea to hire a Local Guide!!!! I felt like a local!!!. It was expensive if you compare with the group tours but It was so nice to have a local who explained all details , made me integrate with the local life (specific in tango world) and prepared a custom made tour adapted to my interests, weather, day, time, etc...Great Idea to recommend!!!!! www.lizflor2.blogspot.com

A wonderful visit to BA led by Marcelo. Firstly we have to apologise to Marcelo for the lateness in posting this review. We don't have any excuses apart from being busy. My partner and I spent three wonderful days with Marcelo in June and July. Prior to arriving in BA we gave Marcelo a rough idea in what we were interested in visiting - no to churches, yes to architecture, gardens, cafes.BA's weather wasn't kind to us on our first day but Marcelo planned around it as we taxied and wandered the wonderful neighbourhoods of BA. His encyclopaedic knowledge of the city that he loves, and Argentina in general, is amazing!! On the second day the weather cleared and we took full advantage by crisscrossing the city by taxi and public bus. We especially loved our visits to the historic cafes of BA. Our third day was on our return to BA after a trip to Peru that included walking the Inca Trail. To be honest we were exhausted and Marcelo tailored the day so that it was at a much more leisurely pace. We wanted to take Marcelo to lunch and asked for a recommendation of a 'locals' restaurant and Juana M. was perfect. A beautiful venue serving beautiful food staffed by excellent waiter staff. We can't recommend Marcelo enough. He showed us a BA we would never have seen on our own. Wonderful architecture, beautiful neighbourhoods, excellent cafes, frank and honest discussion about politics, economics and culture. We had never used a private guide before but after our amazing experience with Marcelo we can only hope our guides in the future are even half as good.

Amazing city tour in Buenos Aires. The private customized tour with Mr. Marcelo was the best city tour I ever have in my travel life as he tailor his tours according to customers interests. So, before we heads-up to our planned tour, he sat with us in the hotel lobby for 15 minutes to discuss and understand our points of interest and the areas that we had in our wish list so he can plan the day accordingly. The city tour was a combination of free walk, taxi and bus rides mainly to have blend feeling of Buenos Aires local transportation and get close to the hustle and bustle of the city. It was very successful and enjoyable full day tour with very professional guided tour. At the end of the trip, the guide provided us with an organized folder full of useful handy information about best restaurants, shopping and attractions in city so we can refer to it during our remaining days in the city.

Highlight of my trip to BsAs!. I have been fortunate to travel extensively, but my day tour with Marcelo was truly unforgettable, by far the best I've had anywhere. His command of the history and sights of Buenos Aires was masterful. But equally important, he is a wonderfully delightful person who made the tour a thorough joy. I cannot recommend more highly.

Marcelo is great!. We spend four great days in Buenos Aires with Marcelo as our tour guide and can’t be happier. Marcelo is not only an experienced tour guide, professional, enthusiastic, and knowledgeable, he is also a warm, easy going, friendly person we enjoyed spending time with. Marcelo speaks excellent English. Our communication was always efficient. We met at the hotel lobby always on time, and reviewed our itinerary every day before leaving the hotel. Marcelo always listened to our suggestions, and made sure to design the itinerary the way we could see the best of the city. He provided a folder with great suggestions on sightseeing, the restaurants, and the museums, and taught us basic Spanish words. We discussed Argentina history, architecture and politics, and we learned many interesting facts about the sites we visited. In the end of our daily tours we reviewed the sites we’ve seen, and it was truly amazing how much we managed to see during these trips. Another great quality we would like to comment on, it’s his flexibility. We were able to make last minute changes to our tours due the weather, and we also were able to personalize our tours according to our interests, and it worked out great! We absolutely recommend Marcelo tours while visiting Buenos Aires. Thank you very much for sharing your city with us!

Fantastic tour guide!!. We went on a tour of the historical sites in Buenos Aires with Marcelo. He explained the history of the area so clearly and made it so very interesting. We were able to choose our own itinerary and he gave some great suggestions. After the tour he showed us on a map where we had been and marked a number of places on the we could visit on our own. He also provided us with a list of great restaurants and other useful information. He was quick to respond by email and later in our week when we had questions, he answered them for us. We would highly recommend Marcelo to anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

Excellent tour guide. I was lucky enough to spend a day with Marcelo recently and had a fantastic time.We spoke briefly via e-mail before I arrived in BA and arranged to meet in my hotel lobby.Marcelo came with several suggestions on an itinerary for our time together and I chose one which included walking through most areas of the city.Marcelo spoke excellent English and was full of interesting facts about the sites we visited. There was never an awkward silence as we discussed politics, life in Argentina, history the list was endless.We had lunch in an excellent restaurant suggested by Marcelo where he provided me with lots of info on this to do and places to go during the rest of my stay.When I visit BA again I will absolutely be booking Marcelo again.Thank you for helping me make some excellent memories of BA.

Jam packed two days with Marcelo!!. I only had two days to spend in this beautiful city, so it left little time for discovering the savory dishes offered here, or even the upscale shopping it is know for. Marcelo planned out two days of discovering many of the local neighborhoods, walking to enjoy the sights and sounds each area had to offer. My goal of discovering the joy of the Tango was satisfied with Marcelo's recommendations for evening performances that were outstanding. He arranged for my transportation to and from the airport that came off without a hitch. Marcelo is an intelligent, knowledgeable, and personable man with great pride in his home town and loves to show it off. Thank you Marcelo for sharing two wonderful whirlwind days in BA!!!

Gracias Marcello, a great day in BA. We were lucky enough to spend the day with Marcello, being shown around his town.He helped us with our Spanish, discussed the local politics and history, and all while we walked and talked around BA.We came away with a better understanding of the city and its culture.Marcello also recommended some spots for us to visit later.A basement restaurant with really fresh salad vegetables was one of our favourites.The bookshop situated in a disused theatre was a must see.FInally, a delightful cafe on Ave de Mayo, for a wow moment.I haven't named these places because that is Marcello's business.No, this isn't an ad, we are just showing respect for Marcello's time and effort.Thanks again, Marcello

Fabulous day tour with Marcelo !!. We had just arrived into BA from Canada the night before and had an early tour booked with Marcelo the next morning . Marcelo met us in lobby (as we were blurry eyes after 50 hours messed up travel ). He made us feel very comfortable his English is excellent and he was extremely accomadating regarding the type of tour we wanted . We ended up sound a walking tour covering most of the city and his historical knowledge was impressive .He gave us great local insight and excellent suggestions for food ,shopping and general hints Highly recommend Marcelo and we will certainly use his services again

Marcelo is THE Best, Again!!. I was so happy that Marcelo was available last week when we visited Buenos Aires. I had told my friend how wonderful Marcelo was from my time with him 18 months ago. We started our first evening at the wonderful restaurant Oviedo to enjoy ourselves before our two full days of sightseeing with him. This trip I opted for a car and driver so we could make the most of our time. My friend fell in love with Marcelo from the start and was so impressed with his broad knowledge of Buenos Aires and Argentina. There was never a time we asked him a question from the arts to politics to the economy that he didn't have an answer. Amazing!! This was a very quick trip filled with great food and shopping! If we were looking for something in particular, Marcelo knew where to find it. I had been reading some books on 20th Century Argentina and had many questions about specifics and he gave me excellent answers to my questions. He laughed and at one point said he was very surprised I knew about that particular event. We had only one night free and asked about a local steakhouse that wasn't filled with tourists, he suggested one that was outstanding, The food was bountiful and delicious and not far from Recoleta. I cannot say enough great things about Marcelo. He is very funny also and can be a teaser as he did to me when were in the San Telmo antique area and told the driver to go slowly but not stop. He remembered my love of antiques and knew we would be on one street all afternoon. If you want the best, you have found the best!!

The best tour guide ever!. Marcelo is the greatest guide I've met in whole South America. He is organized, knowledgeable, caring and has a great, great sense of humor! Besides being a real professional, he is a very-very nice person as well. I've enjoyed every minute of the BA city tour which has been totally tailor-made based on my wishes and interests. He has plenty of opportunities to offer regarding the city tour and he speaks a beautiful English. He is a Porteño, (meaning that he was born in Buenos Aires) and knows every little details of that wonderful city. It was a real pleasure to have him as my tour guide in Buenos Aires! Thank you, Marcelo!

Marcellos was very helpful. Our family was planning a trip to BA in May and based on reviews, I contacted Marcello as a potentials tour guide. Unfortunately, he was going to be away when we planned our trip so he was not available to book our group. In our email correspondence, he did answer several of my questions about transport from the airport to our hotel. He offered to book a remis for us and then followed to send me the reservation number. We had a large group of people and true to his word, when we arrived at the airport, the remis company, TiendaLeon, had two vehicles ready to pick us up. If I get back to BA, I will definitely book Marcello as our tour guide.

Marcelo is THE guy to show you around Buenos Aires.. We booked Marcelo for a full day tour on 16th April 2016 and a half day on the 18th.Marcelo speaks perfect english, is friendly, amusing and very informative. If you're thinking of using a guide then Marcelo is your man. If you think you don't need a guide then think again....you will miss so much if you don't.Alan & Martin

Buenos Aires would not have been the same without him!. Marcelo was the perfect guide for our vacation. He was accommodating, knowledgeable, and really gave us a complete experience. There were four of us, two younger (30s/40s) and two elderly ladies in wheelchairs. He ensured there was a diversity of activities and really did a remarkable job of ensuring everyone had a great time. By the end of our two days together we truly felt that we had a truly got to know Buenos Aires. Marcelo was warm, engaging and would certainly be part of any return visit to Buenos Aires.

Perfect 2 Days. We booked Marcelo for two day private tour. He was fantastic. From early communication to a detailed walking tour of the city - everything was excellent. I had been to BA before but had my mother and my husband with me for a vacation. Marcelo helped us prioritize the main sites, had detailed knowledge of the locations and introduced us to some great little places for food and chocolate. My mother still tells all of her friends about Marcelo and his great tour. I would highly recommend him.

Tour of the Tigre. I enjoyed a day tour with Marcelo in the Tigre region. It was a good way of getting out of the city and experiencing the more rural Argentina. The train ride itself was quiet an adventure. The tour includes a ferry ride on the river and a walk along the river for a lunch break. Marcelo is very knowledgeable and shared a lot of his own personal experiences with me. I had didn't get a chance to explore Buenos Aires with Marcelo, but feel he would be as good in the city as well.

Fantastic esperience. My wife and I toured BA with Marcelo earlier this month. He had an incredible knowledge of the country and a great passion to share. I would highly recommend for anyone considering a or site tour. Very easy to work with and prompt to respond during scheduling phase. We met other private tour guides who were not nearly as responsive as Marcelo.

Great day in Buenpos Aires. We spent two and a half days with marcello in March and had a great time. He was informative and pleasant and we felt very safe with him. Buenos Aires is not an easy city to navigate and haviong Marcello show us the way was really good.

Best guide ever !. We had a fantastic day with Marcelo his knowledge of Buenos Aires is fantastic and he personalized the day for us. The restaurant for lunch we loved so much we went back again on our own !!! Marcelo organised a Tango show for us in the evening along with a fantastic restaurant that night. Marcelo gave us lots of information to take home with us as well which was a lovely surprise.Thank you for such a wonderful experience Marcelo !

Marcelo! Magnificent!!. Never having been to Buenos Aires or even South America, my husband and I felt unsure of wandering around a city of which we had very little knowledge. Marcelo change that for us. We spent a full day with him, half of it walking and the other half with Marcelo plus a driver to neighborhoods we'd never have seen on our own. We had a history lesson and adventure that we'll always remember. He was so comfortable to be with, knowledgeable and nice. I wish we would have booked another day. Plus, he took us to the best ice shop before we went back to the hotel. Great Ending to a Great Day.

Worth it!. Marcelo is very knowledgable about everything in BA! Whatever is your interest he will find a way to fulfil it. He knows history and architecture and makes seeing a new city a pure joy. I was with him for a full day and enjoyed every minute, I would highly recommend.

Great friend and advisor for a new visitor to Buenos Aires. We had a 1/2 day orientation to BA with Marcelo as this was our first visit to Argentina. Having Marcelo as our guide gave us a much better, more personalised and friendly orientation than using the hop-on, hop-off bus or wandering on our own. We opted for a half day tour after a long flight but he is happy to do a full day or longer and show you what BA has to offer. He also gave us fabulous information on dining options, sights, milonga and tango venues, bars, and markets. He took us to La Boca, San Telmo and Centro showing us just what we asked and along the way sharing history, politics, way of life, Spanish language lessons and more. A truly wonderful beginning to our first day in BA. Thank you so much Marcelo. Wendy and David, Australia
Best guide ever!. Marcelo is knowledgeable, fun and a pleasure to be with. No need to look anywhere else for a guide!!

Excellent guide -walking encyclopedia of Buenos Aires an Argentina. Marcelo was recommended to us thru a friend who was here several months ago. The BEST recommendation we ever received. He took us to El Tigre Delta for the day and explained the history of the Delta , had lunch at a wonderful place right on the delta. Saw part of BA with him before and after our day trip. His knowledge and passion for his city , the history and all the neighborhoods were unbelievable. Will hire him again on our next trip.He was fun, easygoing and has a great sense of humor. His English is perfect and he was delightful to be with for the whole day. Wish we were staying longer would have definitely taken more tours and trips with him. Even though he didn't go to the Tango show with us he arranged everything a week before we even got here. Made us feel like we had a friend in BA even before our arrival!! Thank you for everything!!!

Learning is fun in BA!. Thank you Marcelo for sharing your extensive knowledge of your beautiful city! What a delightful way to spend the day ~ a day of learning in Buenos Aires! Marcelo was the perfect guide for us, he listened to what we wanted to see and designed the day with us in mind!

Like walking around Buenos Aires with one of your best friends. My wife and I find that nothing beats walking different neighborhoods to discover the soul and atmosphere of a city.We found Marcelo not only to be very knowledgeable and flexible, but more importantly real fun to hang out with. It was like walking around Buenos Aires with a good friend. He is proud of and passionate about his city, and it shows. Our questions ended up becoming fun conversations and discussions, not only about the sights around us, but about history, politics and life in Buenos Aires in general. He also provided a wide range of more "local" suggestions for restaurants, shopping, things to do etc... In the nicest way possible, he will also try to steer you away from falling in certain tourist traps if you are so tempted. E.g. certain restaurants are known to give significant kickbacks to hotel concierges for references which you end up paying for. Together with Helena of Clandestino Music Travel, Marcelo gave us a real great taste of the city, that we want to go back and experience more of the city with him.

The most awesome day. Marcelo is the best guide I have ever had in a city. He is like a walking encyclopedia of knowledge, but what makes him truly the best is that he knows when to tell the information to make it seem like a story that is being told. He delighted us at lunch by giving us an impromptu Buenos Aires Spanish language lesson. I wish he had been my teacher when I learned Spanish. (I would have done much better!). Marcelo is kind, easy going, patient, humorous, and an all around great person. If you don't use Marcelo in BA, you are doing yourself a disservice. He is truly the best of the best.

Best Tour guide ever!!. Marcelo met us as we got off the ship - the information on how to find him was perfect. We spent the entire day with him and we saw so much of the city. He made the history come alive as well as the spirit of the city. He took us to his favorite cafe and we enjoyed a great lunch in a very local place. He even included a Spanish lesson. Because of some walking problems we have, he arranged for a car and driver. Car was clean and comfortable and driver was great. I would HIGHLY recommend him as your tour guide in Buenos Aires. If we are ever fortunate enough to get back there, I would think of having no one else as our guide.

The Guide You Want in Buenos Aires. Marcello is a terrific guide who took me around BA for one afternoon and one morning. Besides really knowing his city, he is affable and patient. Marcello is happy to give suggestions based on your interests but also wants to go with the flow of what you prefer. I strongly recommend hiring him shortly after arrival. He provided a packet of extremely useful but not overwhelming information and also gave me personalized suggestions on sights and restaurants that were consistently right on the mark. For example, he directed me to a old-style Argentine pizza place (El Cuartito) that was not only delicious but clearly a favorite of many--there was a line of locals waiting before it opened for lunch. His tours were very enjoyable. I was happy to walk for the most part but you should be prepared to cover any taxis (utterly cheap in BA) or entrance fees as they are not included in his fees. I should also add that he was helpful before the trip in booking a remis from the airport. A class act and a guide with ten years experience that I am happy to recommend very highly.

Best tour guide. We just came back from spending two days with Marcelo and we can honestly say he was one of the best tour guides we have ever had.When we first met he sat down with us to ask us if we had any requests then he told us about some of the sites we would wee in the next few days. He is promp with his emails and was always on time to meet us for our tours.This man is a wealth of information and he explains everything very logically but interesting and never boring.He came prepares with a folder of suggestions for restaurants,bars and various activities to do on our free time.We throughly enjoyed our two days being with him and we highly recommend using his wonderful talents and wealth of information if you visit Buenos Aires.Thanks Marcelo for an amazing two daysPam and Sam HandelsmanToronto

The best!. Marcelo is a truly gifted and uniquely capable tour guide- with him, you get more than just the sites and the dates, but you also get the context and history and the "why" of how things happened the way they did...He took a group of 4 of us for two days in Buenos Aires and we were totally captivated by his depth of knowledge of the history, explained in very articulate and clear English. He also arranged for us to go to a Tango show and it was great - not only did he provide a recommendation but he took care of the reservations and got us great seats!. I have arranged for many private tour guides in numerous countries, and he is the best.

Outstanding Tour. Marcelo took four of us on a guided tour for the day and it was an outstanding day. His breadth and depth of knowledge of the city was excellent as is his English. Marcelo is very personable and a pleasure to spend time with.We all felt if we never got back to this lovely city Marcelo had explained it so well we had a good grasp of its history and that of Argentina.We would highly recommend Marcelo's services.

Excellent Privet guide - Marcelo Alejandro. We booked Marcelo for 1 day. We had a great privet tour in BA . Marcelo is very knowledgeable, friendly and respond immediately to every request. we learnt a lot about Argentina and BA city and have a very enjoyable time.He speaks very good English. Thank you very much Marcelo and hope to see you again in the future.I would highly recommend Marcel for anyone visiting BA.

Fantastic private guide!. This young man is incredibly well informed and interesting! One of those rare guides who can judge whether he has given you enough information or not. Marcelo was able to pace our tour so my husband, who had limited walking capability, was able to walk for most of the day with occasional taxi rides and periods of sitting - so well organized! The city is fascinating, but our favourite memory is the pizza we had for lunch - the best anywhere! What a surprise!

exceptional BA tour guide. Using TripAdvisor as my guide, my friend and I found Marcelo who arranged for a full and complete day in BA touring all of the important sites that we could fit in with only one full day available to us. If I could rate him a 6 out of a 5, I would do it. While there are many great tour guides in the City of Buenos Aires (I have used a few before to introduce new travelers to this amazing South American city), Marcelo stands out as exceptional given his passion for the City and the depth of knowledge the young man us on so many facets of Argentine history. Culture, politics, religion and every inside fact known to man, Marcelo was a wealth of information and just made the day so much more enjoyable.He is a one man operation (I think) so when he books out, he books out.Highly recommended by me!

OUr tour guide for three days--WONDERFUL. He gave us personalized care and custom touring. We hit all the highlights. He had terrific info on local shops, restaurants and specialties to order.We would love to come back and have Marcelo help us with a longer stay.He is very prompt with emails and sharing information. He is kind to all of us and also to strangers on the street. He gave us so much information about BA. He accomodated a couples tour within a bigger group of older travellers, about to go on a cruise.We had a nice blend of walking and use of a van to cover lots of ground.THank you Marcelo.

One of the best guides we have ever had. our group of 6 had the pleasure of Marcelo's expertise and company for three days.He replied our emails promptly and answered many questions before our arrival to BA.He was helpful and patient with all. Ma is 82 and in a wheelchair.He knew so much about his city, and put a lot of information together to give us perspective. He could tell us about local cafes, restaurants and ice cream places.WITHOUT hesitancy, I would recommend Marcello as your guide. We would be back in a hearbeat.

We'll miss you. From the first time we contacted Marcelo, six months before our trip, we knew we had made the right decision. Email contact with him was fantastic. Once arriving in his city he met us on time, every time, for the four days he was with us. Before we left on our first tour he sat down with us and laid out our four days, which we could have altered if we wanted to, but we never did because his plans were just perfect! Our first couple days we walked, which gave us a great opportunity to get to know each other and to get a real feel for the neighborhoods. On the remaining days we realized we were a bit old and tired, and very simply switched over to taxis, very inexpensive taxis, and finished our tour that way. Marcelo himself was more than we could have hoped for... so knowledgeable, so fun, and had the three of us in good moods all day long. He also arranged all of our travel to the port and the airport even after our tour was sadly over. Thanks to Marcelo we will always remember Buenos Aires as a wonderful city and will miss it, but just as importantly we will remember him and miss him.

Wonderful day with Marcello. We spent a full day with Marcello prior to our cruise. Our group included four adults, two seniors with some mobility issues. We couldn't have been happier with the experience. Marcello was very good with pre-trip communications. We worked out details for a vehicle rental in advance and everything was very clearly communicated. He even answered several questions we had about transportation from the airport to our hotel and questions we had about currency. He was very helpful on the tour when one of us needed language help at a pharmacy. The tour included some local spots that we would not have found on our own. The pizza and empanadas at lunch were amazing and we had a stop at a local bar that was also fun. We found Marcello very flexible and he accommodated our requests to modify the basic tour because we were already planning to see certain things on another day. Highly recommended!

A+ 5 Stars. A+ Book him quickly before someone else gets him. Professional, knowledgeable, extremely personable, safe and honest. An example may be the best recommendation: There are thousands of taxis in BA. On my last taxi ride with Marcello, the driver must have been listening and understanding, although he was quiet. Upon exiting the taxi, the cab driver stopped us and said, “You are so lucky to have someone so good to show you around.”

Amazing tour guide. Marcelo was our tour guide for two half days in Buenos Aires and a full day to Tigre. He is very knowledgeable and geared the tour according to our needs. He also gave us some wonderful guidance for things to do when he wasn't with us. I highly recommend him if you need a guide in Argentina.

Marcello does a very good job. I would have given Marcello five stars but it was not clear to us that this is a walking tour. Being in our 60's we were not prepared for this. We had to hire a limo at additional expense to get us around the city which is quite large. This needs to be addressed up front and I would suspect that many of his clients fall into this category. That aside he does a wonderful job of bringing Buenos Aires alive and is full of history and vignettes about it. His performance was a worthy addition to the tour of this city which is a wonderful place to visit.

Marcelo is a wonderful and knowledgeable guide. My daughter and I engaged Marcelo to show us Buenos Aires in a day. We asked him to start early, teach us about the city, and 'walk our legs off'. Mission accomplished. Marcelo met us at our hotel exactly on time and proceeded over the course of the next 7 1/2 hrs to show us his city. He has an encyclopedic knowledge of BA history, architecture and politics; he guided us to a wonderful hole in the wall restaurant for lunch; and left us exhausted and confident that we knew BA far better than we could have ever learned on our own.

Excellent Guide for Buenos Aires. My husband and I engaged charming Marcello for a half day tour of BA in December, 2015, focusing on the Recoletta and Plaza de Mayo. We were very satisfied with the time we spent with Marcello and only wish we had had a full day tour. Marcello is knowledgeable about Argentinian history, politics and architecture, our main interests. He was clever and funny when giving us "the inside scoop" on events of all kinds. Marcello freely shares with his clients useful information about BA that enables you to explore the city more productively on your own. We highly recommend Marcello, but book his time early; he is busy, as you would expect an excellent guide to be.

A great guy to spend some time with. We had the pleasure of spending a morning with Marcelo this January. We found him personable, knowledgeable and a great guy to spend some time with. He gives his tours in an educational style that keeps you engaged and asking questions. We highly recommend spending some time with him.

Marcelo the man in the know!!. We had a wonderful afternoon with Marcelo, wandering round Recoleta, touring the cemetery and learning about the architecture & history of Buenos Aires and beyond. Marcelo has a wealth of knowledge about BA and there isn't anything he doesn't know, whether it be history, politics or pop culture! We learnt a great deal from him and it was such a pleasure to have him as our guide, he makes you feel relaxed and comfortable enough so you can really ask anything. On top of his amazing guided tour, he offers you all extra tips to enjoy the City, away from the main tourist traps which we would never have known about had it not been for Marcelo and his takeaway pack is amazing!! If we ever visit BA again we will definitely be booking a guided tour with Marcelo again!

If you want to know Buenos Aires, hire Marcelo!. My wife and I were on an extended vacation which began in Cape Town and wound up with us disembarking the Oceania Marina in Buenos Aires on 22 December 2015. I had been planning this trip for a long time and had the good fortune of selecting Marcelo to be our guide while we were in Buenos Aires. He was one of several guides I contacted in planning the trip but his communication was outstanding and his commitment to fulfilling our requirements was obvious. He not only conducted our tours but he also booked our transportation from the port to our apartment in Palermo and from our apartment to EZE airport for our return flight to the U.S. which is tomorrow. He did not ask for extra compensation for these services and he in fact reconfirmed the transportation the day before it was scheduled. This was not small task because we took 4 day trips to Mendoza and to Iguazu Falls requiring transportation to the local airport for both trips.When we travel, we try to not just see a city or an area but to understand it. Marcelo is the guy that can do that for you in Buenos Aires. He earned his 4 year college degree in tourism but more than that he knows and understands Buenos Aires past and present. If you tour with Marcelo it won't be a drive around "on the left you can see a (fill in the blank}" kind of tour. it will be a feet on the street walk around through neighborhoods and historic sites with a full explanation about how and why those neighborhood came to be and the significance past and present of historic sites. If you listen, you will know Buenos Aires when you are through.We had the luxury of touring with Marcelo for two full days and two half days. In that time we visited (I will likely forget some fascinating place and for that i apologize) Recoleta and the world famous Recoleta Cemetery, Retiro, Palermo, San Telmo, La Boca, Puerto Madero, and Tigre. We came away understanding the significance and differences in those areas. We came away better understanding how Buenos Aires evolved and what it is today. Because of the distance involved to reach some of these locations we had the opportunity to take taxis, a train, a bus, and a sight seeing boat. What a thrill.Since so much walking was involved on some of these days, Marcelo was always checking to make sure we were okay, if we needed to stop for a coffee, drink, or snack, and to make sure we didn't over extend ourselves. He always explained the distances we had to go and gave us the opportunity to take a taxi if we preferred. We usually didn't. There is so much more to see when you walk the neighborhoods. We felt connected to the city that way. We have rarely had a tour guide that was so aware of our needs as individuals. I have gotten a little sappy but that is because we thoroughly enjoyed our time with Marcelo and appreciate what we learned from him. For that, we have Marcelo to thank. Muchas gracias Marcelo! Muchas gracias!

Don't leave Buenos Aires without seeing Marcelo. I contacted Marcelo after I booked my cruise.From the very beginning he was a great communicator,caring and fun. When we met,he had planned my one day perfectly with a car and driver.We saw the best of his lovely city and secret places too!I could not even conceive of going to BA without him. Just book him and you will remember the experience forever!Jane H in Florida

you will not be disappointed, this tour is a must. Myself and my partner did a full day tour with Marcelo. We had a few ideas of things we wanted to see and was doing the tour as a way of getting our bearings and to learn more about the city. Marcelo meet us at our hotel and sat down with us and asked what we wanted to do and then made suggestions, we planned our trip and off we went at a comfortable pace. We were blown away with Marcelo's knowledge and we throughly enjoyed the way he described things and asked us questions it wasn't him just standing there reeling off information.We covered so much ground in one day we walked, caught taxi's and a bus.Marcelo also took us to some amazing places to eat which we would never had known aboutOver lunch he gave us a Spanish lesson and gave us a folder with information on it and plotted on the map where we had been.He also made suggestions on what we could do on our remaining days in the city but also advice on the other cities we are visiting.I can not recommend this trip enough you will learn and see so much more of Buenos Aires. Marcelos passion will make your experience memorable Enjoy the tour

Perfect introduction to Buenos Aires with great professionalism and fun . We hired Marcelo after surfing around the Net for a personal guide tour in Buenos Aires. After reading all his great remarks here at TA you might wonder if someone like Marcelo exists. And yes, he does and very much so. Prompt replies beforehand when making our booking as well as adjustments to our interests. We had a full day of excursion in the city with occasional transfers by taxi to different areas of the town. As mentioned in other reviews he has a university degree in Tourism, knows and can pedagogically communicate Argentinian history and historic events in fluent English. On top of that, we were informed about current political and social developments and we had several interesting discussions on those topics too. And to add another thing, we had great fun also - something which is important if you are supposed to spend a whole day together. To summarise - a Marcelo full day tour is a perfect introduction to Buenos Aires! And if you don't take it, you won't get his personal and "secret" key addresses for genuine and great restaurants (we know since we tried them)! Thanks Marcelo!

Buenos Aires Walking Tour. We enjoyed a wonderful half day tour with Marcelo. This is the first time I’ve ever hired a tour guide and based on the experience we had, I will make a point of doing this again in any foreign city we visit in the future. Marcelo’s knowledge of history, his perfect English and sense of humor brought the city to life and we left grateful for the experience and all that we learned.

Perfect for short stay. Marcelo was the perfect guide for our limited stay in B A. Not only did we cover more than expected for a single day, he provided excellent suggestions for the us to explore the city, next day on our own. He truely tailors the tour to your personal tastes. His history lessons are interesting without being tedious. My husband and I had a great time with him.Marcelo was also exceptionally helpful with us at day's end as we were trying to shop for what proved to be a difficult to find item. Any othe guide would have left us on our own. Marcel went from store to store as if it were the most important activity of that day. Can't say enough good things about him.

Our 16-day trip to Argentina included three days in Buenos Aires, during which Marcelo guided us through the city.. Marcelo provided our group of 5 Americans not only with an excellent historical perspective on the city, but also a fact-filled background and interesting information on the several urban neighborhoods he walked us through. When it was too rainy and cold to continue one of our daytime tours, he rearranged his schedule so that we could make up the time on the following day, when the sun was shining. He joined us two times for dinner, both of which he arranged for at popular restaurants, one in a renovated warehouse (with an art gallery motif) in the Retiro District, the other in Puerto Madero, along the waterfront in the city's largest redevelopment project. He also led us to several local cafes, where he introduced us to different types of coffee and local favorite treats. His knowledge of the city is amazing, he is very friendly, and speaks excellent English --- I highly recommend him for your next trip to Buenos Aires!
Bill Carlton . Marcelo is an excellent guide. He is extremely knowledge and made our visit interesting and fun. I would highly recommend Marcelo.
Buenos Aires guide. Marcello was a great guide, I learned so much about Buenos Aires, this was a trip if a lifetime for me and Marcello was excellent in every way

Highlights of Buenos Aires in a day!. What an amazing day I spent with Marcelo! He really is an absolute fountain of knowledge about his home city and speaks immaculate English. I so enjoyed visiting key landmarks in the city with Marcelo because he has a unique ability to bring history to life. We had so much fun and walked our feet off exploring the main streets and so many little corners of Buenos Aires that I would never have found on my own. It was my first visit and after one full day with Marcelo, I came away feeling like I really knew the place and the people. I should also mention that Marcelo was in touch with me for some weeks in advance of my visit with a multitude of tips on everything from theatre to shopping. After our tour, he gave me a comprehensive list of places to eat, shop and so much more. You will not find a better guide in BA so look no further. Just hire Marcelo and I guarantee he is all you could wish for. Hot tip - wear comfortable shoes!

Best City Guide I've Had. We were a group of 4 people visiting Buenos Aires for the first time and decided to hire Marcelo for a full day tour based on the Trip Advisor recommendations. He exceeded our expectations. He has both a great breadth and depth of knowledge so you can essentially spend as much, or little, on a particular aspect of the city as suits your interest. Couple that with a great sense of humor, and you have the perfect guide. Hire him!

Marcelo is EXCEPTIONAL.. Do not look any further. Marcelo is exactly what you need. We were visiting Buenos Aires/Argentina for our first time. We had some ideas of what we would like to do and see, but decided to hire a guide to help out. We were blown away by Marcelo. His depth of knowledge and history is outstanding. Not only that, but he continued to support us via text and email for our entire trip with hints, restaurant tips, etc. Marcelo is incredible...hire him now.

Don't miss this tour. Marcelo showed us places we would never have thought of. He gives you the inside information that you would not find elsewhere. My husband and i were hanging on every word. So fun and easy to be with. By far my favorite tour and tour guide.

Thank you, Marcelo!. My husband and I had the pleasure of spending a day and a half with Marcello in October. We never would have explored as much of BA without him. Marcello made us feel safe and taken care of at all times. We are still sharing our knowledge of Buenos Aries and Argentina with our friends and family- all thanks to Marcello and his wealth of information. We have an understanding of the country that we never could have without him.Meeting Marcelo is like meeting an old friend- he is personable and fun to spend time with. My husband was quite the skeptic when I told him that I had hired a guide via the internet, but was quickly won over. Trip Advisor has never steered me wrong and Marcello was no exception! Thank you for making our trip to Buenos Aires one we will never forget! We hope our paths cross again.

Excellent tour of BA - 5 star guide!!!. Marcelo has a university degree in tourism so for him guiding is not just a hobby and that's reflected in his professionalism and high degree of knowledge not only about BA and Argentina but also its place in South America and all the historical, political, economic and social factors that make this part of the world unique. In our full day walking tour of Buenos Aires we covered all the important sights and stopped at a local parilla for an amazing lunch. Marcelo also provided an extensive printed list of of restaurants, bars, sites etc for us to take away and use for the rest of our stay. I can't recommend Marcelo highly enough if you are looking for a walking tour of BA and an understanding of what makes this city and its people tick.

Fantastic tour guide - highly recommended!. My friend and I recently did a full day walking tour of Buenos Aires with Marcelo and thoroughly enjoyed it. We covered a bunch of interesting and important sights and learned a lot at each stop. We also learned a lot about the history of Argentina and BA and he always had good answers to our many questions. A lunch stop at a local parilla was another highlight. At the end of the tour, he provided us with a printed list of suggestions of restaurants, bars, etc. Marcelo was even available to help after our tour finished; ATM machines in the area we were staying were all out of cash on a Sunday and he was able to point us to a relatively unknown machine that still had cash available. I would highly recommend spending a day with Marcelo to get the most out of your stay in BA

Excellent tour guide - 5 stars!!!. Marcelo, has been an awesome tour guide. He's smart, friendly, helpful and accommodating. I would highly recommend him to any visitors.  -Traveler from San Francisco, CA

Fantastic tour guide – a fabulous walking tour of Buenos Aires!. We were staying in Buenos Aires for 5+ weeks so we hired Marcelo for two separate days so we could explore the city on foot with two different sets of friends that flew in to visit us. Our dealings with Marcelo beforehand were extremely professional and he was a wealth of information! He emailed suggestions for restaurants, nightlife, sights, etc. Marcelo is very animated and has a great personality. His knowledge of the city and different interests was impressive! He customizes his tours based on your wishes.

Wonderful tours!. We spent 2 great days with Marcelo. He was a wealth of information. We covered a lot of ground and he had great suggestions of things for us to do on our own. He tailored it to our needs and desires, even dealing with inclement weather. I highly recommend booking with Marcelo. We definitely will again.

Great tour of Buenos Aires. We engaged Marcelo for a full day and then a half day walking tour around Buenos Aires. He was fantastic! Marcelo told us about the history of the city and the various sites, but it was not dry or boring at all. His English is excellent, and we truly enjoyed our time with him. Walking the city on our own would not have been the same and we would have missed out on the richness of Buenos Aires. We highly recommend him.

Great Introduction to Buenos Aires. We engaged Marcelo for a walking day tour around Buenos Aires for four people. I can only confirm the other reviews for Marcelo. If the guide is good, we have found tours like this to be invaluable. You can find out a lot about the history of a place and why it is like it is. You can also find out points of interest, places to eat and places for entertainment. If you are really lucky these tours can help you get a feel for the real city, just not the tourist’s view. Marcelo did all of these things for us even pointing us in the right direction for some authentic tango. If you are going to Buenos Aires then I strongly recommend a private tour and if you are going to do I private tour you won’t go wrong with Marcelo.

A professional and knowledgeable private tour guide in Buenos Aires. If you visit Buenos Aires and wish to have a historical informative, all round knowledgeable and country, city and people specific information, all provided in a private, courteous and professional atmosphere, do not look further. We would highly recommend to engage Marcello A. Mansilla to be trusted as your tour guide. 4 days with 4 friends in Buenos Aires, with Marcello.. Our four days in Buenos Aires was spent with one of the most wonderful guides that we have ever experienced. In a country that none or us really knew, he with his knowledge of history and passion for this country, and his great personality, painted a superb picture in our minds of the people and their trials and tribulations over the centuries, their magnificent successes and failures, to go along with the actual visuals that we saw.In four days with Marcello, I had more fun, and learned more about Argentina and it's people, than I would have taking an advanced college course in the same subject. That has everything to do with the presentation.I will see him again when I return.Micheal Pistole

Amazing 4 day tour/historic descriptive of Buenos Aires. I just returned from Buenos Aires and couldn't have asked for a better experience. This was in lieu of the historic expertise, attention to detail and magnetic personality that Marcello implemented into our tour. He was so personable and flexible in regard to changing the agenda where applicable. I would highly recommend Marcello for any future Buenos Aires tour needs.

Wonderful Tour Guide: Informative and Enlightening!. We spent a memorable day in Buenos Aires with Marcelo and would recommend him without reservation. We toured with him for an entire day and saw a great deal of the city on foot and with brief cab rides. His English is excellent and his knowledge of the city, it's history, the political and financial climate is very wide-ranging. Marcelo improved our understanding of the city and the country, not just locations and isolated facts about the things we saw, but the feelings, attitudes, and concerns of the people who live there. He is a native Porteno with a university degree in Tourism. He came to our hotel, met with us, and established a personalized tour based on our input. My wife and I spoke of the things we learned from him for the rest of our trip! Highly recommended!!

Buenos Aires vacation. Marcelo was a great tour guy; was very knowledgeable and very informative whenever I had a question he knew the answer, he was very patient and very kind! Great restaurant recommendation, I went to everywhere he recommend it was supurb! I had two - half day tours with him and he was amazing.
Father/Son trip. Marcelo is very knowledgable. He was great with my son. In fact, we hired him for two half days. I would recommend him for a half day or full day tour.

Phenomenal English-language guide to Buenos Aires. Marcelo was recommended by a friend who had previously visited Buenos Aires. His English is excellent and we plan to recommend him to anyone that we know who is visiting Buenos Aires. Our full-day tour with Marcelo was easily the best day of our trip.

A most informative and comfortable way to explore Buenos Aires.. Marcelo came highly recommended by a friend of mine who had toured Buenos Aires with Marcelo a few years ago. Best way to see Buenos Aires!!. My friends and I booked an 8 hr day with Marcelo to tour the area where we were staying. Don't see Buenos Aries without him!!
Cant go wrong with Marcelo !. 100% pleased with the day we spent touring with Marcelo. He was sensitive to everyone's interests and needs, and was completely pleasant to be around.

Tour of Buenos Aires. This was our first visit to Buenos Aires. We learned more about this amazing city and it's history than any of the tour books could teach us. Informative, entertaining and one of the best guides I have ever had!. we spent the whole day with Marcelo on our first trip to Buenos Aires, he was on time, extremely knowledgable about the history of Buenos Aires as well as sat down with us for the first 10 minutes to make sure that he was going to take us to the places that we wanted to see and also asked us all 4 of us what we expected ,etc. he took us to see Evita's grave at Recoleta, Plaza di Mayo, Florida street, Casa Rosa, parks, lunch at the most famous cafe in Buenos Aires, all while giving us amazing history with very funny anecdotes and stories.. i would definitely suggest taking him for a day he was way worth the money and was one of the most reasonable guides i found in Buenos Aires. An Excellent Guide & All Around Great Guy. We traveled to Argentina to see our daughter, who was finishing her Junior year in Buenos Aires. Buenos Aries Guide June29-July2 2015. Marcelo was our very excellent guide for our visit to BA this summer. My trip to Argentina. Marcelo was a great help to us. First; we went over a map to look at the places we might want to see on our visit.Then he went over different modes of transportation and general routes. Set benchmark for private guide services. With Marcelo, you feel you slowly become part of the locals. Cannot recommend more to take the tour with Marcelo if you are visiting BA the first time.

Highly informative accommodating guide. Our time in BA was cut short due to a transportation strike and Marcela was the first to notify us of the situation which was very helpful. The ABSOLUTE BEST Guide out of the three we used on our trip to BA!. the ultimative Buenos Aires experience - thanks to the guidance of Macello Mansilla. I have been in contact with Marcello through email shortly prior to arrival at BsAs. Absolutely Amazing Guide!. We scheduled a full day tour with Marcelo two days in advance. He was incredibly responsive and informative over email. Made my trip!. My trip down to Buenos Aires was arranged only a few months before my trip as i found a deal on air miles. Despite hanging out with a great guy, he's very professional and very knowledgeable about the sites and history. I learned ton of interesting things that I would never have learned about on say a bus tour;5.Marcelo would tell me some of the sites i might want to visit on my free days; 6. I had multiple questions that i emailed him about, even after my tours and he always promptly replied with great advise. He even answered questions before my trip and recommend an agency that games tourists to futbol games;7. He made me feel safe. I needed to change money and knew about the Blue Dollar rate. I asked him and he took me to a safe place that the locals use to exchange money at good rates. I can't say enough about my positive experience and would recommend him to anyone.

Excellent!! No one better!. I hire guides whenever I travel abroad, and Marcelo is simply excellent! His understanding of BA is first rate and I am learning so much.His prices are very reasonable -- he should charge more!! He's that good. And I have never worried that he may be getting kick backs from any hotels, stores or restaurants. Hire him!!!

Fantastic Three Day Tour!. When planning our vacation to Buenos Aires, I wanted to see as much as possible in the three days we had. I found Marcelo on trip advisor and booked him for our three day visit, six months before we came to Argentina. Marcelo is a wonderful guide, our three day itinerary was very busy. Marcelo speaks perfect English, is very enthusiastic and professional. Marcelo has extensive historical knowledge about his city. He taught us a lot about the different kinds of architecture in Buenos Aires and the historical development of the city. He took us to some of his favorite local restaurants and we had some wonderful beef from Argentina. Marcelo is an exceptional guide! I recommend him 100%. You will not regret it! Thank you Marcelo for introducing us to Buenos Aires!

Awesome guide!. I can’t say enough good things about Marcelo. What a wonderful introduction to the city of Buenos Aires. He was entirely flexible, knew the answer to every question on every topic and was easily able to tailor the adventure to me and my 16 year old son. We had an awesome day. He was worth every dollar and if you have any doubts about what you are getting for your money, it is way more that the day in the city. Leading up the trip Marcelo answered questions over email, made arrangements for our transportation from the airport, made suggestions for other things to do on our own and was even answering texts to help us during our days in Buenos Aires. You won’t do any better than with Marcelo.

Marcelo is great!!!!. Marcelo was our guide for 3 days. Great guy, very educated, informative and energetic , very good English. He loves Buenos Aires and knows a lot about It. We ( group of 6) were extremely happy that we chose his as our tour guide. Very recommend him!!!!

The Best!. I wish I knew about Marcelo when I first visited Buenos Aires. For my second visit, March 19th, I was referred to Marcelo by friends who had spent a month in BA last year. He arrived at our hotel right on time and we were off on the most excellent, walking tour. I already knew his written English was impeccable so I was not surprised to hear his absolutely perfect, spoken English. His enthusiasm and love for his city was evident immediately and his knowledge of its history was inspiring. Our tour included parts of Retiro and Recoleta and it was full of facts and insight delivered with an obvious joy and passion. In Marcelo's capable hands the history of Buenos Aires came alive.I usually don't hire a guide when I travel but I recommend, unequivocally, hiring Marcelo for all the reasons, stated above, and also because the city is vast and full of wonders and you'll need help deciding what to see. I have 2 regrets, the first is not hiring Marcelo for a full day instead of the 4 hours that we chose and second, after returning from hiking in Patagonia we waited too long in contacting Marcelo for a second tour, not surprising, he was already booked. Book as soon as you have finalized plans to visit and believe me after touring with Marcelo you will run to Trip Advisor to add your own "Excellent" rating.

Private tour for 6 with Marcelo !. You certainly won't be disappointed with a very knowledgeable & enthusiastic Marcelo to show you the highlights of Buenos Aires! He speaks English & gives you the historical perspective of Buenos Aires & of Argentina. We walked to most of the highlights, including the cemetery where Eva Peron is buried. You can choose to go by taxi, bus, etc. & he will accommodate . He also booked a private taxi upon our arrival at the airport that took us directly to our hotel which was very inexpensive & saved us considerable time. If you want to avoid the large group tours, slow moving & expensive then contact Marcelo, we feel like we have know him for a long time & would certainly use him again ! Thanks again Marcelo, & our offer still stands to come & visit us in Texas !Clay & Judi Quaife

best of the lot. well I do not have any basis for the caption because we only used his services. A polite, educated young man with fluent English. He met us at our hotel and asked us our interests and how we wanted to do them - foot, taxi or? We chose taxi/foot. He had a number of routes & destinations for us. All were just what was ordered. There were adequate breaks for banos and drink. In one day we saw much more with Marcelo that if we had used our guidebook. I wholeheartedly recommend him. His fee is fair and reasonable matter of fact very good value

Great Guide!. A group of 8 of us had contacted Marcelo over a year ago about a tour but we could not decide whether we wanted a tour guide or not. Arriving in BA, we decided we did want a guide so we contacted Marcelo and he was able to give us a half day tour of the Recoleta Cemetary and a bunch of interesting old homes. He was very interesting and knowledgeable in the way he presented the information ad we gained a lot of knowledge about the history of BA and the political situation through the years. He also provided a list of restaurants that were authentic local places, but not as expensive as the normal tourist places. We tried a number of the restaurants he recommended and they were all great. Marcelo speaks very good English. He seems genuinely interested in making sure that you get what you want from the tour. He gave us great recommendations for other things that we could do and see during our time in BA.

The perfect guide. Marcelo was an excellent guide for 2 days, well organized (he showed us on a city map where we went, for example), his explanations were perfect: historical but not boring and his English is excellent. Besides, he helped us, gave us useful addresses and info on Buenos Aires. He is like a friend now for us. Don’t hesitate to make your tour with him !

Much more than I expected!. Marcelo is a wonderful wealth of knowledge and a charming personality. He met us at our hotel and helped us customize our tour for the day and off we went. We started at the Recoleta cemetery where we zigzagged through a maze of mausoleums until finally coming upon the ultimate mausoleum of 'Evita'. From there we jetted around the city until finally coming upon the famous balcony where Evita gave her speech. In-between we were treated to a myriad of small wonders about the city. Marcelo was full of facts I didn't even know I wanted to know. I can say that I practically know more about Argentina than I do about my own Country. He painted such a beautiful picture of Buenos Aires it made me want to move there. He does small groups too, there were only 2 of us and he is very reasonably priced. I can't say enough good things about Marcelo.Thanks for making my trip so much better!

The Ideal Way to Experience Buenos Air. My travel companion and I thoroughly enjoyed our time with Marcelo. Buenos Aires is an amazing city, and it really requires a tour guide like Marcelo who reflects the charm, excitement, and passion of the city. Marcelo tailors the tour to the travelers he's showing around town, which really made the experience personable and still very professional. I highly recommend Marcelo and plan to reach out to him when I'm back in the beautiful city of Buenos Aires.

Marcelo Mansilla: Buenos Aires Best Guide!. We just spent tow days touring Buenos Aires with Marcelo Mansilla and without a doubt, he was the best guide we've ever had... anywhere in the world. He's multi-lingual, has a deep love of country, but also a willingness to reveal its weaknesses. Thus, we were provided an in depth understanding of Argentine history while seeing the sights which link today with the past. Time with Marcelo was nothing short of inspirational. In fact, I can't imagine every going back to visit Buenos Aires without having Marcelo at my side -- and his guide fees are the lowest I found. So, to get the best for the most economical of prices made for both a great deal and a wonderful experience.  I just can't say enough about how great Marcelo's tours (and we took 2 with him while in Bueno Aires!) were. Definitely the highlight of our trip to South America!

Marcelo Mansilla, professional, informative, unfailingly pleasant. Read the other reviews about our new friend Marcelo and you will hear how well he responds to his clients. Marcelo treasures his beautiful and complicated city, and after a day of touring with him, you feel that you are not alone in this huge city. Marcelo personalized our first day in Buenos Aires to help us to understand all of the political, historical, architectural and cultural highlights, and at the same time allowing us to understand the daily life of the porteno. His pace was perfect, and matched ours step by step. We so enjoyed our time with him that we booked a second outing to Tigre and the Delta. At all times Marcelo is the consumate professional, always looking at several sides of the many stories that effect life in Argentina. I wish I had more stars to rate with! Gracias Marcelo!

Marcelo was a truly amazing guide!. I spent the whole day with Marcelo yesterday & had the best of times. His knowledge of the city has to be unrivalled. He was extremely personable & great fun to be with & very considerate. I have a slight disability & he made a point of planning the day around my capabilities. Please, take my advice & use his services, you WILL NOT be disappointed. Marcelo, thank you!

Amazing Tour Guide. My husband and I visited Buenos Aires in December 2014 with our 3 children. Prior to the visit, Marcelo immediately responded to all my requests for information and inquired about our interests in preparation for our tour. He also set up transportation for us to visit the Lujan Zoo on a subsequent day. Marcelo provided us with a wealth of information about BA and we had such an incredible time with him while he showed us the various and diverse areas of BA. We feel very fortunate that we had him as our tour guide and would highly recommend him.

Marcelo Mansilla personal tour guide Buenos Aires. Spent two weeks in Argentina including a week in Patagonia at Perito Moreno and Chalten. Then on to Iguazu Falls and BA. Finally got to meet Marcello. And what a pleasure it was. He is such a great guide. I found him to be very personable, informative, and flexible. He moved the date when the original one had a 90% chance of rain. I told him I liked architecture and history and wow did he deliver! He took it from there and gave me the most amazing walking tour downtown you could ask for.He gave me the history of BA and Argentina (and much of SA) and covered any and all aspects of each pertinent topic. And answered questions quickly, clearly, and concisely. He went above and beyond for me including calling a remis... actually he called two companies when the first ones price seemed high, and indeed got my cost reduced by 30%. Then offered to discuss the cost of the trip with the driver to ensure there were no problems with "add ons" such as toll fees (I speak very little Spanish). I can't recommend him highly enough. He provides you with an extensive map of the city and a complete list with several restaurants, bars, discos, tango clubs, museums and shops that he recommends in BA. I was in BA 11-19-14.

Exceptional Guide!. Not much more to say than what has already been said by others - Marcelo is an exceptional tour guide and a great ambassador for Buenos Aries! First day in BA was with Marcelo and he provided all the info one could need for a great adventure in a city we knew nothing about. After a great tour, he reviewed our itinerary and made a number of suggestions and restaurant recommendations - most of which we followed and were very happy with. I highly recommend Marcelo for English speaking, first timers in BA.

Great Guide!. My husband and I (30's from NYC) were debating between Marcelo and another top rated private tour guide, and ultimately chose Marcelo: His responsiveness was super quick, thorough, and clear. Even after our tour was over, Marcelo continued to be available to answer various questions we had throughout our stay in Argentina. What a great choice we made choosing Marcelo! We spent the entire day from 10am - 5pm with Marcelo and saw the entire city. He helped us exchange money in the morning and subsequently took us to all the main attractions. He knew of the best cafes to stop in for lunch, and the places where (nice) restrooms were easily available - very important when you're out for the entire day! There was never a dull moment in conversation... I only wish we had more time together. Overall, do not hesitate to book with Marcelo... the tour was absolutely worth every single penny!

The BEST way to see and learn about Buenos Aires!!. We found Marcelo through TripAdvisor and decided to book a day tour with him....best investment ever. Buenos Aires is a very difficult city to navigate if you don't speak Spanish and Marcelo's excellent English, his knowledge and love of Buenos Aires, and flexibility make it so worth the time and money. He tailors the tour to exactly what you want to see--culture, history, shopping, restaurants whatever. He is fun, easy to get a long with and someone you just would want to hang out with...Highly recommend. We learned more about Buenos Aires than our friend who is a native!

Marcelo is the Best Way to Start Your Trip!!!. All of the positive reviews are 100% true!! Marcelo speaks excellent English and is very approachable and works hard to tailor a tour to your individual preferences.My girlfriend and I spent our first day in Buenos Aires with Marcelo. This turned out to be one of the smartest things we could have did. Not only did he teach us a ton about the history, architecture and other details of the city and people of Buenos Aires. But he got us very acclimated to the various areas of the city which helped us throughout the remainder of our trip. He also gave me some helpful hints on exchanging money and provided us with a nice map and numerous recommendations on places to eat and drink. We were fortunate enough to try a lot of them and nothing disappointed us.Not only do I feel like we found an excellent tour guide to share with any of our friends fortunate enough to visit his great city but we have a new friend in Buenos Aires that we look forward to visiting again with in the future. Thanks for a great full day tour!!!!!!

A unique young man. It is all true, all the details and accolades given below by past reviewers. Please do believe he is a treasure-engaging, fun, knowledgeable, trustworthy, humorous, friendly, organized, meticulous etc. His dedication to providing excellent service is unrivaled. Marcelo has an open, inquisitive mind so he is constantly learning and evolving which trickles down to his tours. As he said to me " I like to travel in time". Our story: My husband and I have never hired a private guide before, preferring to do it all on our own after our research, but felt the need for help for our first South America trip. Since TA has never let us down I contacted Marcelo. I came up with a plan for the 2 full days we spent with him; he perfected it. I could feel how dedicated he was through the many emails we generated. We loved our experience with him, not expecting to be as comfortable touring with him as we were. My husband ( CPA) was particularly impressed with the depth of his economic knowledge, saying that Marcelo knew some minutiae he didn't think his colleagues did. Before leaving him on the 2nd day he said to feel free to contact him with any questions or issues. Now returned home and thinking of our time in Buenos Aires we have more thoughts and questions, so Marcelo's tutelage continues long distance as we took him up on his offer. He is a teacher, a friend, and a ( well behaved) little brother all in one!

Incredibly amazing. My husband and I spent a day with Marcelo and learned a lot about Buenos Aires. Marcelo showed us the highlights of the city and made it very interesting. He was very organized, provided a lot of information and insight.Very knowledgeable, dynamic and professional, Though we had a cold and rainy day, Marcelo made the most of the day. His passion and love for his city was contagious.Excellent tour guide. We also now found a new friend in BA.

You Would Be Lucky To Have Marcelo!. I was in Buenos Aires with my boyfriend about a month ago and spent a day and a half with Marcelo. He is not only charming and friendly, but very organized and knowledgeable. He emailed back and forth with me before the trip (always responding promptly) and dutifully answered my many questions. He had some really helpful advice regarding exchanging dollars to pesos at a favorable exchange rate. He showed up on time at our hotel on the appointed day and took the time to ask us about our interests and what we'd like to do before we got started. We had a great tour of the San Telmo market on a Sunday and also some of the more central tourist locations near the Obelisk and in Microcentro. The next day he gave us a tour of the Recoleta cemetery, which was one of the highlights - there is no need to struggle to find Evita's mausoleum, Marcelo knows exactly where it is.
