He speaks excellent English and is very open to answering questions about Argentina's current state as well as its history - he really brought a valuable new dimension to our time in BA, and we thoroughly enjoyed his company. I highly recommend him.

Great experience, wonderful introduction,. On our first day in Buenos Aries, we met with Marcelo. He is a well mannered young man, who speaks English fluently and has a great sense of humor. He gave us a detailed overview over the city, sights to visit, where to eat and what to do. Not only did he explain but he handed us a folder as a reference guide. On our walk through Recoleta cemetery and the city, he shared great insights of a native. We could talk politics, history, customs etc. We can absolutely recommend him, especially if it is your first time in this city.

Very accommodating and organized. I was referred to Marcelo by a friend and I am glad I took the recommendation. The weather was cold, rainy and windy but we continued as planned. Marcelo called to confirm the morning of and was flexible with the schedule in order to keep us out of the weather. We visited Recoleta area ended in San Telmo at the market (Sunday) and saw the sights in between. Marcelo also gave excellent recommendations on restaurants and shows and answered questions days after the tour while we were still in town. It was a great way to see the city.

Excellent!!!!. I can't say enough wonderful things about our tour with Marcelo. We took a half day tour with him on our first day in Buenos Aires. He gave us a fantastic tour of the Recoleta cemetery and helped us with all of the very practical needs that we needed for the rest of the trip (e.g. How to use the subte, local customs, how to exchange money, getting a SIM card for our phone). He was full of invaluable information especially since we are not fluent in Spanish. He gave us a folder with many recommendations for restaurants and cafés in every neighborhood, local attractions (with hours and prices), and a map which he marked important sights and roads that we used the whole week! On our tour of the cemetery, he was a wealth of historic information. It would not have been the same experience without him. When we were sight seeing on our own the next days, we really missed him! Marcelo is so friendly, helpful, knowledgeable -- I highly recommend his tours!!! So worth it!!!

Great historical and cultural tour guide. We were in Buenos Aires and spent half a day with Marcelo on July 19, 2014. We wanted a historical tour of Plaza de Mayo and the Recoleta Cemetary. He met us at our hotel and then we took the subway there. He told us all the history, special back stories, talked about the Argentinian government and economy, and all sorts of things. This was definitely one the best things we did while in the city. Marcelo was really fun and very nice. At the end of our tour he gave us a folder with restaurants, a map, and shopping recommendations. It was awesome! Plus his English is really really good.

Incredible 3 days- loved our time with Marcelo!. After exhaustive searching and reading of tripadvisor reviews, we decided upon Marcelo for our first trip to Argentina and to Buenos Aires. He was everything and more the reviews discuss below. He is not just a "guide" but a passionate, intellectual, engaging, and super-friendly person to customize your BA experience. Marcelo is able to discuss politics, history, culture, traditions, modern-day customs, and economics. He gives you an intimate glimpse into Argentina's past and present. We loved his style that was not just didactic but also inclusive and responsive; he had us thinking and interacting with what we were seeing/experiencing. (He is also fluent in English-a big plus!)Marcelo had fantastic suggestions for touring, shopping, entertainment, and dining during our days with him and on our own. This customization helped to maximize every moment we had in BA. He is ultra-responsive on email and is the best person to have with you in a busy and fascinating city like BA. If you are trying to decide if you need a guide-yes, you should ... and it's definitely Marcelo!

Excellent Guide. Marcello provided an excellent tour of the city that truly made the rest of our trip even more enjoyable. Prior to arriving, Marcello provided prompt replies to any questions we had along with a few recommendations he had. His tour is unique in that he builds the itinerary when he meets you that morning and based on things that specifically interest you. The tour itself was excellent as he provided a very thorough history to the city that clearly means a lot to him. We booked a full day tour with him and at no point did it ever feel like things were dragging along. Marcello stood out from other tour guides because it felt more like spending the day with a friend as opposed to paying someone to recite history to us. He is everything a tour guide should be: prompt, approachable, and knowledgeable about a city he loves.

Absolutely the best way to see Buenos Aires. Marcelo is, in a word, phenomenal.From the very first, Marcelo proved himself to be consummately professional yet also warm and engaging. I sent him an email a few weeks before traveling to Buenos Aires and his reply was prompt and informative describing his philosophy and approach to guiding visitors through his city. Specifically, he met up with my partner and me at our hotel in the morning and, rather than having a set plan of what to show us, he talked with us to determine what our particular interests were and how best to tailor our day to emphasize them. As a result, Marcelo was able to strike just the right balance of showing and explaining historical sites and the events surrounding them, highlighting the culture and cuisine of "real" porteños, and making us feel as though we were sharing all of this with a new friend. Indeed, Marcelo is armed with an encyclopedic knowledge of the city's history and culture from end to end and therefore is completely versatile in his ability to tailor the day to exactly what, when, and where his guests want to see and do.Marcelo offers both half-day and full-day tours; we opted for the latter and were very glad that we did. No maps or tour books (or, for that matter, large-group tour guides) ever could have allowed for the personalized, interesting, and most importantly, fun experience of Buenos Aires that Marcelo afforded us. For instance, it would be fairly useless for us as newcomers to wander through Recoleta Cemetery or the Plaza de Mayo without Marcelo's spot-on explanations of the history and iconography of these important and complex sites. Not only did he stick to a script, though; it seemed that whether it was some random mausoleum I pointed out in the cemetery or a heraldic element of the Argentine coat of arms, he knew the ful story behind it. Needless to say, his English is perfect but nevertheless was, thankfully, very patient with my attempts at practicing Spanish! Marcelo's passion for his hometown is infectious; through spending the day with him, my partner and I were able to get into just the right mindset to best enjoy the city. In order that we could continue to get the most out of our visit even after parting ways, he provides his guests with an annotated guide of his own writing to the city's best eateries, attractions, etc. that proved very useful to us throughout the rest of our stay. In sum, I cannot recommend Marcelo enough, but certainly can warn that you would be missing out tremendously not to get the chance to see Buenos Aires through his eyes.

Marcelo exceeded all expectations!. A few weeks ago I had the opportunity to work in Buenos Aires for the first time. I added a few extra days onto the trip for sight seeing in BA. I contact Marcelo based on feedback in Trip Advisor to learn more about his services. He responded immediately and provided a detailed agenda (at my request). You never know when you do these things online what will happen or what you will get, but Marcelo exceeded all expectations.He was so knowledgeable about his country, the city, the people, culture and history and was eager to share. We spent 3 days touring the city and eating in the BEST resturants. His English is excellent which made learning from him very easy. I would highly recommend him any time you are in BA!

Terrific Walking Tour - The Best. Marcello is equal parts historian, linguist and color commentator. His English is perfect, and his knowledge of the history of Argentina and Buenos Aires is professorial. He's engaging and fun, and my 1/2 day walking tour has been one of the highlights of my trip to Buenos Aires.I recommend Marcello without a single reservation.

Simply Amazing!. To be honest, I don't know where to start! Everyone seems to have said what I want to say about Marcelo! ...enthusiastic and very informative when it comes to what he does. ...warm yet very professional. When I first contacted him, all I wanted was photos of what I see, but right from the beginning he told me that there's more things to be appreciated by which he and history comes in. He made history fun and interesting. God must have led me to choose him as our guide. More power to you Marcelo! Keep up the great passion!

Best Tour in Buenos Aires!. Marcelo is amazing. We were referred to him by friends who had used him on several occasions. He was prompt in his response and gave us a great tour of the city. Marcelo really finds out what you want to get out of the tour and the city and customizes it to your needs. He is a wealth of knowledge and sweet as can be. In fact we referred him to a number of other people we were traveling with and he did three more tours for our group later that week and they all loved him.in a large city like BA, you need someone like Marcelo to show you the logistics and give the historical significance of all the sights. I can't imagine going through the Recoleta Cemetary without him! Thanks Marcelo!

Knowledgeable, charming and super reliable and professioal. My family and I had an amazing experience having Marcelo show us around Buenos Aires What sets him apart from others is his amazing responsiveness to all questions and requests before and after the tour. He helped us plan our trip, aside from his own tour, booked restaurants and tango show for us and answered our questions after the tour. Can't recommend him highly enough, we loved both our 2 hour walking tour and a 6 hr car excursion. We saw and did so much while learning a lot about this beautiful city. Do not hesitate to use him (and this is based on many years of travel and tour guides' experience).

The Best. I cannot say enough about Marcelo. He's very prompt, very professional, very personable and probably most of all, an excellent communicator. We were most interested in learning about the people of Argentina as opposed to the sights. The two days we spent with Marcelo delivered much more than we had hoped for and, allowed us to make a new friend in Buenos Aires to boot. If you have any doubts about hiring Marcelo, forget them. You will realize that you have probably had the most rewarding time in BA you could have and all because of Marcelo.

Marcelo is Awesome!!. Marcelo was great and very accommodating to my parents who were with me on the trip. I love the fact that he tailor makes the tours from your requests. The fact that he picks you up from your hotel is also amazing. He just gave us some much general information that we would have never thought of that made our trip. If you want a fun guide that will show you the way pick him.

Perfect!. We had a superb day with Marcelo in Buenos Aries. His knowledge and love of his city was outstanding. We saw all the iconic sights during our day with him whilst learning much about the history and politics of the city. His English is excellent, even understanding our northern humour. He advised us what to do in our own time in the city, suggested restaurants and bars and gave advice on how to stay safe. We cannot recommend him highly enough.

Made our trip!. On our recent trip to Buenos Aries, we hired Marcelo for the day. We found him to be very knowledgeable about all aspects of the city and Argentina, we all enjoyed his company and patience. We walked all over the city and can honestly say he is a first class guide and should we travel again to the city, I hope that we could hire him again. Can highly recommend him.

Marcelo is the best in Buenos Aires, Argentina. We have traveled to many countries and have had many very good tour guides. Marcelo has a degree in Tourism meaning he could work for any large tour company of even own his own travel agency. But, Marcelo has decided to carry on his love as a tour guide in the city he loves so much. He speaks English without an accent and speaks it well. His knowledge of Buenos Aires is outstanding and he has an ability to pass on that knowledge to his clients. We highly recommend Marcelo.

BA Tour Guide?....Look no further!. My partner and I recently spent five days in Buenos Aires and, to help orient us to the city and its history, we decided to spend our first day with a guide. With Trip Advisor's assistance, we discovered Marcelo. A great find! With Marcelo's assistance, we came to know BA's culture and history. Not only did he share with us interesting and noteworthy facts about the city and its past, he helped us develop a much greater appreciation for the politics and diverse cultures and how they have come together to create today's Argentina. Given that he was born and raised in Buenos Aires, Marcelo has an amazing understanding of the US government and our culture. This made for some interest discussion as we walked the streets of the city. His English is also excellent, so conversation was easy and plentiful.As validation of how much we enjoyed and appreciated our time with Marcelo, I should point out that it rained much of the time that we were doing our tour. We truly managed to overlook the nasty weather and simply enjoyed the setting and our conversation.Our time with Marcelo was the perfect way to start our five day visit in BA. Not only did he orient us to the city, helping us to plot an agenda for our remaining time, but he also gave us good advice on how to be a "good and safe" tourist in the city. Thank you, thank you!

You Should Definately Take a Tour with Marcelo!. We took a four-hour tour with Marcello on the day we arrive in Buenos Aires. I would have liked a longer tour - but we were fully booked with a tango show at night, etc. It was such a wonderful way to be introduced to the city. (It is a large city.) We were traveling with our two teenage boys and it was our first time in South America so, although we have travelled extensively, we were a bit intimidated. Marcello met us at our hotel (on time) and we sat down for a few minutes and talked about what we wanted to accomplish. He then suggested an itinerary to help us get the lay of the land. He pointed out things we should do on our own (i.e. Teatro Colon, the Alteneo.) He provided interesting history - i.e. why the Islas Malvinas war memorial is facing "Big Ben" and why that war was even started. He took us through a highlight tour of the Recoleta cemetary and explained how Portenos families wait for years/generations to get a plot. He also pointed out popular bars and gave us a list of restaurants/ etc. and tips on changing money safely. Can't recommend him enough. Totally worth the money.

Excellent private tour. We spent a full day with Marcelo and it was a most enjoyable and informative experience with a local entrepreneur and guide. He shared very interesting historical facts and actively discussed the politics and culture of this diverse country and city. We walked the entire day except for a short cab ride and found our time with him to be an excellent way to learn about the city. Seeing all the monuments is one thing but hearing the perspective behind them from a native citizen was what we liked most. From the Plaza de Mayo, the cathedral, the pink palace, Plaza de San Martin, the Falklands war memorial, an amazing bookstore and lunch at a local place which we never would have found ourselves, Marcelo put a personal touch on everything. He is a good value for what he charges and we highly recommend him. Btw, we found him helpful in providing pre-arrival information on airport transfers, taxis, pesos needed, etc.

Not just the What, but the Why. Marcelo is one of those gems you want to show off for all to see but keep for yourself because you know he is that good. But for Marcelo's benefit, I know I have to share. He was easy to contact and work with via email and flexible in putting together a half day tour of Buenos Aires. He hit the points that I was interested in and gave me pointers on what I could do on my own. There is more to BA I want to see and do, and when I go back I surely will schedule way in advance to ensure I have his time booked. The difference between a good and excellent tour guide is that they can engage you in a way that you retain what they have to say. Marcelo does that. For me it is the "What" and the "Why". I learned the what about what I was seeing, but also the why... the history, the politics, the economics.I was in BA for a week for work and the information I learned from Marcelo on Sunday gave me an educated leg up to discuss the city, current politics and more with my locally based team. Thank you Marcelo for being an outstanding tour guide!

You won't find better. This is a long review because Marcelo unreservedly deserves the accolades...We had decided to hire a personal guide like before in other cities and Marcelo's name came up with great recommendations. So as to maximise our time we had, we asked Marcelo for a half day afternoon guide tour as well as the following day, and we are so glad we did. Nothing was too much of an issue for Marcelo, so much so that he wanted to collect us from our B&B that afternoon and arrived right on time. He asked could we sit with him before we do anything so he could get a feel for what we were after and wanted to see. This was 30 minutes well spent, as from this sit down, he drafted a plan for that afternoon and the following day. Off we went and no sooner out the door, our lessons to get comfortable with BA began, i.e. how to catch a taxi, where to stand, what gesture to use, and which type of taxi, and how to pay. We needed to change money and Marcelo helped us with that as well.From there we began walking and he began talking, and we learnt so much in just those few hours. I won’t go into where we went or what we did, as that’s for you to find out and draft your plan yourself. When he left us that afternoon (6pm is afternoon in BA) in the heart of town, he pointed to a couple cafes where we could go for our afternoon snack, where to catch our taxi back home, and said he would see us the next morning. He also suggested a great meeting spot since we were now confident to catch a taxi. So we left Marcelo, grabbed a coffee, looked at our photos from that afternoon, and discussed between us what we had just done and learnt about Argentina the city, the people and the history of it all.Next day we arrived in the centre of the city and met Marcelo who took us to a famous café for coffee and more learning. We spent time over coffee with a map that Marcelo provided and said it was ours to keep, and he explained where we had been yesterday, and what he had planned for today, and at the same time marked up places for us to visit by ourselves over the next couple of days.Off we went exploring, and the stories from Marcelo continued, and the pieces were all coming together; we felt like we were in our own modern day screenplay and the story was coming to alive as we visited buildings, statues, gardens, parks, and suburbs of BA. We took lunch where the real people of BA have lunch…not some fancy tourist style restaurant, but an exciting vibrant café. That afternoon we rode the public bus and learnt how to do so for future travelling. We also learnt how to take the subway, all the time keeping familiarised to our map. Often Marcelo would test us and ask where do we think we are now! It’s what I call learning as you go. We walked past iconic tourist attractions, where he would say you can visit these yourselves and when was the best time to avoid crowds etc.So when it came to the end of our tour that afternoon, Marcelo’s story he had been sharing with us from 1pm the previous day had all come together. We now understood why BA is the way it is today. We had been taken on a journey of discovery from way back in the 1800s, through the wars, the revolutions, and into modern day BA. I could go on about it, but I will leave that for you all to discover yourselves.So re Marcelo, this was now our 4th private guide for South America and clearly the best yet. Don’t get me wrong, the others were good, but Marcelo’s unique way of showcasing BA and all it has to offer was so different to what we had before. Not only did we learn about Argentina, but we now were confident to tackle the remainder ourselves using public transport, and how to spot the good from the bad.He also provided a comprehensive list and details of all sorts of things we could do whilst in BA - he was the only guide we've had that has provided this type of thing!If I could sum up Marcelo, it was like having your own personal concierge who knows the place only too well, where to shop, where to eat, where to get the best exchange rates, and when to go, and at what time to get the best value. But his service didn’t stop with us when we left him that afternoon as he offered via email if we needed some assistance for the remaining time we were there. We took him up on that and can proudly say that he found us what we were looking for.I'm sure you can gather from my review that we loved Marcelo, and we wish him all great things in the future because he deserves it. He's simply the best!

Outstanding by every measure. What do you really want from a tour guide in a strange city? Knowledge of all the historical spots; someone to help you cut through all the mass tourist scene to get to places really worth seeing? Perhaps you want someone to give you an insiders interpretation of culture, economic and political factors or maybe you just want pleasant company while you see the sights.You can have all of this and so much more with Marcelo. I have yet to encounter his equal anywhere else. If there was an award for international tour guide of the year he would be a top contender for it, no question.Marcelo is a prompt, efficient, very intelligent and cultured young man who knows his city backwards and wants to help you explore and understand it. You can trust him 110% and his advice is always right on the money. Oh and his English is excellent.I could go on but then I would only be repeating all of the other positive reviews already here.I will however close with this - every time I go to BA I always contact Marcelo and a visit to this city would not be the same without him.It's as simple as this: going to BA and really want to understand the place, then call Marcelo. You will be glad you did and your visit will be all the more memorable for his contribution.

A MUST for Buenos Aires first timers. Marcelo is THE BEST. We spent a few days on our own in BA prior to our full day tour with Marcelo. Once we started talking to him did everything come in perspective -- his background, stories, and history put the whole visit in perspective. We truly wouldn't have appreciated Buenos Aires nearly as much if it weren't for our time spent with Marcelo. He really felt like a friend. Very casual and comfortable tour pretty much tailored to our interests. He's flexible and can handle any question you ask. I couldn't recommend his tour enough. He's WONDERFUL! Thanks, Marcelo!

He should be ranked the best tour guide in trip advisor. He was so friendly ,concern about what we had to do . He took us to milongas we enjoyed it so much . He was the best tour guide we could have in all cities we travelled . Thanks to him we enjoyed so much in buenos aires

Marcelo is great. We hired Marcelo for a full day tour in Dec '13. As he had prior commitments, we had to split the day into two half days and we were soooo glad we did it. It's a walking tour with some cab rides but we were extremely exhausted after every half day as we covered a lot and the temperature was 100F, Although you can see Buenos Aires on your own, I recommend a private guide. It is more enjoyable and if you have two people, the price isn't so much different than doing a tour. Marcelo covered the main attractions and told us very interesting facts about the history and culture of Argentinians. At the end of the tour, he gave us a binder of great recommendations for restaurants and clubs. We tried 3-4 and the recommendations were spot on! Marcelo also told us how to/where to exchange currency at the unofficial blue rate, which made our USD get us 50% more... Overall, highly recommended and worth every penny. He was fun too :)) We had a great day

Fabulous tour guide!!. We have just returned from eight fabulous days in Buenos Aires! We spent two wonderful days with Marcelo touring all over Buenos Aires. We learned so much about Buenos Aires and Argentina during our time with him. It was really so informative to have such a well read and versed guide giving us the "real" inside of Argentina by a porteno. I do not remember any question we asked that he did not have an answer. During our days with him he gave us many choices for our lunches and was truly fun being with him. Marcelo is very well organized and supplied us with a folder containing maps, tourist information, and restaurant selections/reviews in all quarters of the city and also broken down as to types of food. I will recommend Marcelo to any friends going to Buenos Aires. It is money well spent especially when you have a limited amount of time.

Fantastic Private Tour Guide !!!. We spent two days in Buenos Aires with Marcelo and we really had a great time. First of all, when we first contacted Marcelo via email asking about the tour options he always answered right away and gave us a lot of options so we could tailor the tours to our interest. He was always very responsive and informative during the booking process. At our request, he also gave us recommendations of some hotels and things to do during the days he could not be with us since he was already booked.The first day we met in BA, he arrived at the hotel on time and before leaving for the tour we sat down for a few minutes to discuss about the itinerary and to get to know better about our interests. He also gave us a lot of additional information about restaurants, attractions, and etc for the days we would be by ourselves.Marcelo was very easy going, knowledgeable and kept things interesting by giving enough information without making it boring. He is also very flexible in terms of transportation - if you like to walk like we do he will walk with you all day long, but if you prefer taxis, bus, subway, etc, he will also do whatever he can to accommodate.If we ever go back to BA, I will certainly get in touch with Marcelo again. The money was very well spent, specially when compared to other companies/guides I also quoted.

Money WELL spent. Marcelo is the BEST! He should be ranked first on trip advisor. He took time out of his Christmas Eve day to tour my husband and I all over Recoleta, Retiro, Centro & Barrio Norte. He gives lots of interesting information about Argentinian history and we loved every minute of it. If you are thinking about a BA tour guide (or even if you think you don't need one, you do) and Marcelo is your guy!!!

Absolutely Detailed, Fun and Wonderful Experience!. My husband and I went to Argentina and Antarctica for our honeymoon, and spent a very short time (2 days) in Buenos Aires. Given our limited time, we wanted to see and learn as much about the city as possible, and this was completely achievable via our time with Marcelo. Even prior to arriving in BA, Marcelo was responsive in his e-mails. He gave plenty of suggestions, answered our hundreds of questions, and really tried to get to know our needs and desires as tourists in his city. He was perfectly candid and honest (which I really liked) in letting us know which neighbourhoods he would help us to understand better historically/culturally-wise, and areas we would be fine exploring on our own (i.e. Puerto Madero, San Telmo), and his fees were completely fair. In one day, he took us to Recoleta, Downtown, La Boca/Caminito, rounding off with the beautiful neighbouhood of Retiro. Among the highlights, we visited the absolutely stunning Recoleta cemetary, the quaint and colourful houses of La Boca, and pretty much all of the city's major historical and political monuments. He showed us that BA really is beautiful city to walk around in, and in one instance of the day, he showed us how to ride the bus like a 'porteno'. Marcelo was extremely knowledgeable in presenting the chronological evolution of BA and how multi-culturally influenced the city really is. We could see from his enthuasiasm how passionate he is about this city. I also loved that he would ask us frequently what we think something represents to keep us engaged (and it was a hot day too!), and constantly tried to help us learn useful spanish words (or different intonations). He was so calm, friendly and unassuming that it was like reuniting with a really good friend. He also took us to a really great restaurant downtown (La Junta) for lunch that wasn't a tourist spot at all. There, we realized that empanadas and pizza really go hand in hand (peas in pod) given BA's italian and spanish influences. Finally, he gave us a bunch of material with restaurant, bar, and milonga recommendations that we could refer to after our time with him. We ended up leveraging two recommendations (Sarkis - restaurant, and Salon Canning - Milonga) and both were absolutely wonderful! BA is a beautiful place, but is only done right with the help and guidance of Marcelo! We would definitely recommend him to all of our friends and family to go with him if they visit Argentina!

See Buenos Aires through the eyes of a local. If you want a fully customized BA tour by a native, call Marcello. He's knowledgeable about the districts, and also the history of the city, and he cares! We found him easy to work with and easy to be with. His English language skills are excellent. From the embassy areas, to the parks, to the Soho of BA, and even to the shopping areas - not Mike's idea ;) , Marcello shared his city with us. He also recommended a few excellent restaurants - from a local Grill restaurant, to a high end dinner venue and a great location for drinks and appetizers. Ask for the tour you are dreaming about and he will make it happen. I would definitely recommend Marcello.

Starting our trip off right. My husband and I just got back from a 3 week trip in Argentina where I did all the planning (no travel agent), reading, and research. We started our trip off with 1.5 days in Buenos Aires, down to Patagonia, then ended it with 4 full days back in Buenos Aires. I had no idea how to do certain things in the city and frankly, just wanted a local to help me out and show us around.Heard great things about Marcelo, and they weren't wrong! I really wanted to know about where to change money, how to get around the city, and some highlights and history. 4 hours is just not enough time, but we packed in everything I wanted and more. Marcelo met us at our hotel, then we began walking. It was great learning more about the Argentines and people of the city, and swapping knowledge about our 2 countries. At the end of the tour, Marcelo gave my husband and me a folder full of information - places to eat, shop, etc, that we used extensively on our 4 day stay in the city. Excellent recommendations!As for Marcelo himself, he's an enterprising business owner who obviously enjoys what he's doing. He was helpful, humorous, and easy to talk to. It was a nice easy tour, never feeling rushed, and when we wanted a snack, he showed us the best place for ice cream. It was a great thing for me to hand the reins off for a few hours to someone so friendly and capable. If you're going to spend any amount of time in BA, it's a must to hire Marcelo!

How to REALLY see Buenos Aires!. If you want a cookie cutter boring old bus tour of another great city, a tour by Marcelo is NOT for you. If you want to see the real Buenos Aires through the eyes of local, with a passion for his hometown, then don't waste your time or money with any other tours. Marcelo will meet you for a wonderful walking tour that highlights all the things Buenos Aires has to offer. Our group of 3 learned more about the architecture, history, politics and food of this wonderful city than we could have ever discovered through any purchased travel guide or preplanned tour. Even TripAdvisor did provide as much interesting and amazing information. The passion Marcelo provided when describing everything from the founders of Argentina to the opera house was infectious and made me want to spend even more time in this city. The additional information he provided when our tour was over was used extensively and I feel it helped us organize our trip to the fullest. Marcelo directed us to some of the best meals of our trip. If you are lucky enough to have a meal with him, just follow his lead and order what he does. When I get back to BA someday, I will certainly plan to spend some additional time with Marcelo. I know there is so much more to learn.

Marcelo is the best!. We spent an entire day with Marcelo and could not have been more pleased! It was like we had know him for a long time, he's such a personable, knowledgable, friendly person. You can tell he loves his job and his city, with such energy (but not over the top-just the perfect amount). I would recommend him to anyone who is visiting BA! Thanks Marcelo!

The best way to see and learn about Buenos Aires. Every aspect of our encounter with Marcello was all we could have hoped for, and more. He came recommended to us by another friend who had used his tour guide services a while back. He responded very quickly to our initial contact, and provided invaluable information as we prepared for the trip. He invited us to ask any questions we might have in advance, and again he was very prompt in responding. There is no reason to repeat all the favorable comments that other reviews have outlined in detail. We first met up with him the afternoon of our arrival, and after learning about our individual interests and giving us a brief overview of what he had planned for our first half-day together, off we went. Fortunately, what he had planned for that half-day ran out as our energy did, and we finalized plans to meet up again the next morning for a full day of touring other parts of the city. By the time we were done, between what he showed us, talked about, and advised us about in the written materials he provided, we had absolutely everything we needed to make our trip a great success. Throughout our time with him, he was careful to adjust the pace to make sure we didn't dally, but didn't overextend either. He was very strategic in his use of our time, making sure that we got the maximum benefit from our time with him; even when we needed to stop for lunch or coffee, he used that time to pack in more information that would help us later. Although there were four of us traveling together, he kept us together and was careful to make sure that he spent time talking to each of us. When we parted at the end of the second day, it felt far more like saying farewell to a friend rather than only the end of a tour. Our day-and-a-half was a functional amount of time and, thanks to his advice, we were able to fully enjoy the remainder of our week in Buenos Aires. That said, there were many moments when we wished we still had him along with us--not so much because we felt we needed him, but just because he is who he is. Our bottom line recommendation: hire this delightful, knowledgeable, and talented young man for as much of your stay as you can afford--you won't regret it!

Marcello Mansilla Tour Guide. We returned from Buenos Aires today. We had a womderful guide experience. For a day anda half Marcello Mancillo made the history of Buenos Aires come alive for us. His communication skills made for perfect outings. He was always punctual and explained everything so vividly. Marcello's English is perfect and it gave us the opportunity to ask lots of questions.

Fun and educational tour guide Marcelo. Marcelo was an awesome tour guide for our trip. As tourists, we had no idea about the geographical location of the city, Marcelo took us on a walking tour of the city as well the town of Tigre. His knowledge is exceptioanlly rich about the history and the important events of Argentina. He made these "lessons' very interesting and fun. He speaks excellent English and is a very personable man. He took the time to explain and show us every location so that we understood what Argentina was all about. Marcelo took us to many authentic cafes while touring this beautiful city. Furthermore, he took the time to get to know us personally and made our trip very memorable. We highly recommend him as "the" tour guide for Buenos Aires. Ranjan, Monalisa, and Romita Sur

Brilliant Tour of Buenos Aires with Marcelo. Based upon the excellent reviews about Marcelo here on TripAdvisor, my husband and I decided to hire him for an entire day of touring beautiful Buenos Aires last week. We were not disappointed. He is a very personable young man with an extraordinary command of English, among other languages. He is also very passionate about his work. We learned so much in one day about BA's customs, politics, history, architecture, cuisine, and shopping. Marcelo is simply the best and reasonably priced compared to others in BA.He is truly a gifted young man. We will never forget our time with him.John and TeresaArroyo Grande, California

Marcello is first class. We hired Marcello for two days during our stay in Buenos Aires on September 12 and 13. I have travelled extensively and used private guides in numerous locations. I would rate Marcello among the very best. His knowledge is exceptionally rich in history and anecdotes. We were also impressed, in response to our questions, with his command of economic and political issues, both current and historical. His English is superb and he has a wonderful sense of humor. He was easy to reach via email and responds promptly. Two enthusiastic thumbs up.

Awesome guide. My buddy and I used Marcelo in June of this year. He was always punctual and was very knowledgable. He is very passionate about his city and it shows. Don't waste your time looking for other guides.

We had a terrific 3 days with Marcelo Manilla. We booked 3 days with Marcelo based on the great reviews we read in Trip Advisor. Traveling abroad, we are always suspect. But Marcelo's reviews were so consistently good that I felt comfortable booking with him. From our first email exchange, working out the details, I knew that we made a good choice. My wife was born in Buenos Aires but this was my first trip. She wanted to be sure that we really experienced all that Buenos Aires had to offer.We really enjoyed our time with Marcelo. His English is outstanding and he is well educated in the history, politics and economics of not only Argentina, but South America in general and the world. He was able to explain Argentina's history in the context of world events both, politically and economically. He was punctual, pleasant, easy going and very nice to be with.Marcelo was full of recommendations on what to do in our free time as well as where to be careful, etc. We toured at our pace and really had an excellent time touring with him. We would highly recommend his services.

Marcelo is the best!. We usually explore whatever city we're visiting with just a guidebook and map in hand. For our May 2013 trip to Buenos Aires, however, we thought we'd try something different and decided to hire a private tour guide for a few days. After much research, we chose Marcelo based on his incredible TripAdvisor reviews. We also figured that if we're going to try the private-tour-guide option, we might as well do it big. So several months in advance of our trip, we booked Marcelo for four and a half days out of our nine days in Buenos Aires.After receiving the first email from Marcelo, we knew we had found a gem. Every communication from him was helpful, cheerful, and professional. Even though our trip was still months in the future, Marcelo enthusiastically and promptly answered every email we sent him containing various questions about travel to Argentina. By the time our trip had arrived, we were already thinking of Marcelo as our new Argentine buddy, based on our many friendly email exchanges.On our first scheduled day, Marcelo arrived at our rental apartment in Recoleta promptly on time. As we began our first day with him, we soon understood that all of his glowing reviews on TripAdvisor were 100% accurate. Marcelo doesn't just lead you along some route he's predetermined and then regurgitate a bunch of memorized talking points along the way; instead, he helps you figure out where/how you want to explore the city that day and then he joins you in that exploration as an enthusiastic participant, deftly guiding you generally, but otherwise letting you set the pace and tone of the journey. All subsequent days were the same: Marcelo was right on time, in good spirits, and led us on a fantastic tour of the city. Marcelo's knowledge of Buenos Aires and Argentina is extensive, personal, and intellectual. He doesn't just tell you a bunch of facts and figures about what you're seeing. Instead, he wants you to understand what you're seeing within the cultural, political, and historical context of the city, region, country, and continent. Marcelo tells the story of what you're seeing in a concise, yet deeper and richer way than any guidebook or corporate tour ever could. Marcelo is passionate about his city and country, and it's infectious. Marcelo is also one of those rare people that, five minutes after you've met him for the first time, you feel like you've known him for years and that you're hanging out with your best friend. To conclude, we can only echo what all of the previous TA reviewers have said about Marcelo: he's knowledgeable, helpful, prompt, professional, interesting, trustworthy, and charming. Marcelo is not just the best personal tour guide in Buenos Aires; he's also an exceptional human being. Our only regrets are: 1.) we didn't hire him for a few more days and, 2.) we couldn't bring him home with us!

All of Buenos Aires in one day. We selected Marcelo as guide based on the reviews on Tripadvisor. And was not disappointed. He showed up as agreed, and had planned a tour that gave us the highlights of Buenos Aires in 8 hours of walking, including an update on history and culture. He knows and loves his city. Highly recommended.

Great BA Guide!. Marcelo was GREAT! Three women from Texas exploring Buenos Aires with Marcelo! He was extremely friendly and knowledgable and was a great guide for us. We especially appreciated his enthusiam for his city and his love of showing it off. He took us to some great expected sites, along with other off the beaten path places that were great! Thanks to our day with Marcelo, our trip to BA was perfect!

A Great Guide for a Great City. Just came back from a Buenos Aires - Iguazu - Rio de Janeiro trip and used the services of Marcelo. He made a great city even better. We worked out two days of tours and had a great time exploring his city. Marcelo also offered suggestions for the time we spent on our own. Forget any negatives about BA. It was a safe friendly city and Marcelo showed us many areas of the city with wonderful personal insight!

Marcelo Mansilla - Excellent Tour Guide. I contacted Marcelo to be our guide in Buenos Aires for one day for our group of 20 people. He was one of the best tour guides that I have met! He was very patient in answering our questions, he is very knowledgeable, very enthusiastic, and it is like touring Buenos Aires with a close friend! Do not look for any other tour guide in Buenos Aires - you can't go wrong with Marcelo!

Marcelo, simply the best. I am in Argentina with my husband for a couple of weeks. He working whilst I needed to entertain myself. I came across Marcelo on here and booked him for the day. What a fab day it was. He met me at my hotel and we walked around the city, stopping for breaks and for him to give me information about the history of Buenos Aires and Argentina. I did not need to go into museums but wanted the sights and get to know the heart and soul of the city and that is exactly what we did, finishing off with ice cream at the end of the day. Marcelo is a personable, very knowledgable young man and I shall never forget Buenos Aires because of his imput. He loves his work and it shows.

Mi amigo, Marcelo. Marcelo Mansilla (pronounced" Mansisha," as I learned) is, simply put, a first class person and tour guide. My wife and I and a friend toured with him for two days in early March, 2013. Our time in BA was short, but the memories will endure. Marcelo always made us feel that we were the most important part of his day. He was generous in sharing his opinions about his city and country, and he obviously loves both. He took us to lunch at a place that offered the best beef I've eaten in my 71 years. We saw many of the city's main attractions, and Marcelo tied into his tour many anecdotes and historical insights that brought BA to life. My only complaint about him is that, despite his denials, he underestimates what he is worth. Book him quickly. Do not let him escape!

Wonderful, Customized Tour of Buenos Aires. Four of us (adults over 50) hired Marcelo for a 9 hour walking tour of downtown Buenos Aires in February 2013. We met with Marcelo, at our hotel ahead of the tour, where we explained our interests and objectives for the day. He then detailed where he planned to take us and provided a verbal itinerary... we agreed and set off on foot.The tour Marcelo provided was fantastic! He showed us spots in BA we would never have found on our own and provided fascinating insights into each hi-lite. His knowledge of Argentinian history, politics and society are next to none. His commentary, english and tour pace were excellent! At the end of his tour day he provided great tips on other sightseeing and activity we could do on our own while in BA. We followed his advice and had an amazing 2 days afterwards... thanks Marcelo!We are avid world travelers from Canada and by far this tour ranks among the best we have ever taken anywhere in the world. I was sorry the tour had to end and we could not have continued traveling with Marcelo. Marcelo is a master at his job and we highly recommend him for your touring needs in BA.

Marcelo is the Best!. Marcelo Mansilla is the best!” March 8, 2013 NEW Just returned from a week's visit to Buenos Aires spending two days touring with Marcelo. It is a walking-taxis-bus tour covering the city. Marcelo provides private tours based on your choices and his recommendations of what to see in the time-frame and pace you set. He was most accommodating with every aspect from planning to providing wonderful suggestions for dining and entertainment. In addition to his in-depth knowledge of the city and history, he has a most enjoyable personality and a wonderful sense-of-humor. It was like touring with your best friend taking care of everything! The tour was informative, relaxed, interactive and just a wonderful time spent in BA. I can't wait to return soon! I highly recommend Marcelo!

Excellent. Designs tour to your wishes. Our group spent a day walking Buenos Aires with Marcelo and it was the most informative interesting tour we have ever had. He designed the tour to our interests. He helps to understand the history and personality of the city, country and its citizens. He also assists with other attractions, restaurants, tango shows and shopping recommendations. Marcelo made our vacation memorable.

Great city tour guide. From Europe we contacted Marcelo by email and arranged a whole day to guide us. It was a day we would never forget. He showed us his city with stories... history... funny things... everything. We would recommend Marcelo to everyone...

All of the reviews are correct!. If you've read the glowing reviews for Marcelo Mansilla, just believe they are absolutely accurate! My husband and I spent 3 days in Bs As and our only regret is that we had booked Marcelo for only one of them. Unfortunately for us, Marcelo was busy and we could not add any additional tour days once we arrived. Don't hesitate to contact Marcelo and book at least one full day, more if you have the time. Ditto, ditto, ditto to all the wonderful, positive comments about Marcelo and about the service he provides. He is the real deal!!

Fabulous & Perfect Guide!. I spent 3 days with Marcelo as my guide in BA this December. He was prompt, patient, kind, knowledgable, and mature. He is simply a very likable person. I think that people from all countries, and all ages, will get along with Marcelo well. If he is available, you should not hesitate to hire him immediately. Spending time with him in BA was the best decision. Not only did I truly enjoy his company, but I learned so much about Buenos Aires and Argentina.He takes pride in providing his guide services and enjoys telling the fascinating history and background of each area. I was so happy to have him there to teach me, rather than me trying to read it all from a travel book, or be on group tour. He makes the day fun and interesting and will pace his guide services to whatever you prefer. I told him that I wanted to see it all...and we walked, took taxis, and the subway, and after three long and wonderful days, we accomplished all that I wanted to see! He never tires and is always charming and in a good mood- no matter the heat, the length of day, or any of my requests. As he has traveled a lot, he understands other cultures and he speaks perfect English. Every moment I spent with him was an absolute delight. I truly consider him a friend.

Thank you Marcelo!. We had a fantastic vacation in Buenos Aires thanks to Marcelo. We were able to explore the city with a more personal perspective because Marcelo explained the history and cultural aspects in a way that we couldnt access in books alone. Thanks Marcelo for your insights! We had a terrific time and highly recommend Marcelo to any English speaking tourists!Virginia, Malcolm and Joe from California

Wonderful Three Day Tour of Buenos Aires. About four years ago my husband and I hired Marcello (Mancillo) as a tour guide after being recommended by some Trip Advisor writers. He was so great and we had time to cover the many different barrios of Buenos Aires via walking, bus, etc. We ate at some locally distinctive places and had dinner at his recommendations. It was fun, informative, and fit perfectly to our schedule. I don't like to get up early especially after a long flight--no problem! I wish I had written this before when we were with him, but it has been at least five years ago. Ah, better late than never.--

An Educator and Guide. Wow, Marcelo is everything you could want in a guide. He is personable, knowledgeable and flexible. He really knows his stuff and can explain to you history, politics, financial issues as well as show you the sights. He spent the whole day with us and we could have spent a week with him. He has lots of insider info and leaves you with handouts re restaurants and what to see and what to miss. You can't go wrong with hiring him as your guide!!

Wonderful tour guide!. If I had a Marcelo Mansilla for all of my foreign travels, my other trips would have been much improved. Traveling with Marcelo was like spending time with a good friend. He truly cared about us, which made this a much more pleasant experience than we have ever had (or expected) with your typical tour guide.Marcelo was recommended to me by my travel agent, who raved about his tours at an affordable price (quality and affordability are very important to me). He thought my family and I would have a more enjoyable experience in Buenos Aires with Marcelo’s assistance, and was he ever right.From his first email to our good-bye after 2 days together, I found Marcelo to be professional, personable and extremely customer-focused, with a great sense of humor. He doesn’t have a canned tour. Fluent in English, Marcelo customized each of our days to accommodate two 40+ adults and a 78-year old senior citizen (three people who don’t speak the language, brought a variety of interests, personalities and never-ending questions). He was totally flexible and unflappable. Marcelo is quite knowledgeable of Argentinean history, and current events both in Buenos Aires and the US. Well-traveled himself, he has interesting and well-thought out perspectives of culture, politics and people in general. I wish we had more time with Marcelo, but after 2 days, we had a firm grounding on Buenos Aires, and knew exactly what we wanted to do in our remaining few days. He set us up for success!I see another trip to Buenos Aires in our future. With Marcelo’s wonderful assistance, I look forward to exploring locations outside of the city. I know that he’ll always make the adventures interesting, fun and memorable.Sharon Lewis

Perfect Guide; More like a new friend showing you around his town.. I have used many guides around the world, and Marcelo is certainly one of the best. Some guides just go through the motions, having done the same tour a thousand times. Not Marcelo. Within a short time of meeting Marcelo, we felt like we had a friend showing us around town. We spent two days with Marcelo. We learned far more about Argentina and the city, politics, culture, economics, you name it, than just the various sites we went to. And of course, we got a great tour of the city too. Even a few unusual finds that others I have spoken to have never seen. I highly recommend spending two days. We were able to do things at a leisurely pace, take some breaks and spend time at cafes and other places with Marcelo and, as I said, felt like we were with a friend enjoying the city. Marcelo was also very very helpful even before we arrived in Buenos Aries, giving us information and tips. And when we finished up with him he gave us a package with a map and various recommendations for places to eat and other things to do. Also, I felt his fee was very reasonable, in comparison to what i have spent in other cities around the world for a private guide (no transportation. you walk or take taxi's with him)

He is the best!. We took a day tour with Marcello based upon the stellar reviews we read about him and they are all true. We saw Buenos Aires through his eyes, experience and wisdom and are grateful for the experience. He is charming and entertaining. We toured with him by taxi, train and bus which is the best way to learn about a city and its residents. Before the trip he emailed information based upon our interests and even during the trip we received further information. His suggested restaurants are excellent. Our trip to this beautiful city was definitely enhanced by walking with Marcelo and we plan to do it again.

Above expectations and reasonably priced!. Must do!! We took a 4 hour private tour with Marcelo that was excellent. Additionally, Marcelo gave us suggestions before and after the tour. He has emailed us linked to events we were interested in, recommended excellent restaurants and night clubs. Restaurants Juana M and Parillo Pena are both excellent.He has a great insight into the history and culture of Buenos Aires.Our visit was definately better because we were in touch with Marcelo.

Outstanding Tour Guide. We have five days in Barcelona. We really enjoyed our time with Marcello. He taught us so much about the history of BA and Argentina, and showed us the political and cultural significance of the buildings and sculptures we had been "walking past" for the past few days.I highly recommend Marcelo. He is entertaining, pleasant and considerate. He customized a walking tour for us based on our interests. His suggestions for restaurants, clubs and shopping were spot on! Three cheers for Marcello. I only wish we had found him on the first day, vs the fourth day of our stay.

Outstanding...Hire this guy for sure.... We hired Marcelo on Saturday (2 couples) and were so happy with the the tour that we hired him again 2 days later to continue in more depth in other parts of the city. He knows everything. He's like a great professor you had in college who not only teaches you a lot, but is personally engaging and entertaining in the way he presents the information. You couldn't find a better guide. He also was available to answer our questions by the text the rest of the time we were in the city. He found restaurants for us, made reservations, found out when things opened and closed, and sent us texts to help us find our way and make the most of the week. Highly recommend.

Great tour with Marcelo!. I highly recommend the Buenos Aires tour with Marcelo. My colleague and I had a business meeting in Rosario then a full-day layover in Buenos Aires on the way home. Our meeting timing left little time to explore and we wanted to get a feel for Argentina (to the extent possible in one day) before we left. I found Marcelo’s services via TripAdvisor, and contacted him by e-mail to set up our tour. He responded promptly; his initial message was very helpful, and he adjusted the tour schedule to fit the time that we had available (about 5.5 hours). Marcelo was very accommodating with respect to our needs (washrooms, food, drink etc.) as he toured us to the important historical, political and social sites within Buenos Aires, as well as (at our request) shops where we could find some souvenirs of our trip. He blended the site visits with an engaging commentary on the social, political and economic fabric of the country. Marcelo is well-spoken and informative, with a clear passion for Argentina, Buenos Aires and Portenos – of which he is one. I would not hesitate to use his services again or recommend him to friends and colleagues. Simply great!

He's simply the best!. We were three older travelers, one with a broken foot using crutches. Marcelo modified his tour itinerary to meet our needs, and, we had a wonderful day. All three of us have traveled extensively so are pretty much churches, cathedrals, museums, and botanical gardened-"out". We wanted to visit places and do things that would give us more the "feel" of what make Buenos Aires unique. Marcelo came through in a big way. We watched a tango matinee at a local milonga full of character watching portenos dance. We had the best pizza and empanadas in the history of the world at a local hangout that has been in business for decades. We visited a street fair in San Telmo and stopped in a little coffee shop, a favorite of Marcelo's ( and, again decades old). In other words, no matter what kind of day you're after Marcelo listens closely and delivers. One of the best tour guides we have ever had.

Wonderful!. I can't recommend anything else we did while in BA higher than hiring Marcelo! My sister and I were traveling alone and wanted someone to show us the city the first day, and he completely exceeded our expectation. He took us around the sites we wanted to see, shared so much history about the country, city and culture, and provided a list of restaurants, activities, and other helpful tips. The rest of the trip we followed his advice for restaurants, etc, and it was awesome. Visiting Recoleta with him was so much fun and he was so knowledgeable. We didn't want to part with him. Thank you Marcelo!

An amazing tour guide. This review is grossly overdue. My friends and I, four in total, went to BA in October. We didn't know much about the city and wanted to have a guide take us around. I found Marcelo On trip advisor. Our entire group was extremely impressed with him. He was so accommodating and knew so much about the city. We couldn't have asked to a better guide. I would encourage anyone who wants a great experience in getting to know BA to use Marcelo.

Don't miss this tour!. My husband and I just finished up 1 1/2 days with Marcelo. What a great time! We learned about Argentina's history, saw incredible sights, got tasty recommendations for restaurants and had a lovely time with Marcelo. At the end of our time with him, we considered him a good friend. Let him show you Buenos Aires and you won't be disappointed.

Great Guide, Great person to Introduce Buenos Aires.... We overheard Marcelo in the Recoleta Cemetery, explaining a monument to a couple of fellow Americans. He was so well-informed; his English so good ; his personality so appealing and enthusiastic that we barged in and asked if we could have his contact information. The other couple were also very happy with him. We did make contact, and spent the next two afternoons with Marcelo. He was terrific - took us all over BA, showing us places that we would not have thought of without him. He is warm , very bright and extremely well-informed. I look forward to more excursions with Marcelo.

This is the guide to choose if you want to experience BA in the most pos itive Wayne. Finally we choose Marcello after a lot of browsing through different reviews from different sightseeing tips - and we feel so happy we choose Marcello.He makes your day a memorable one. He is very perceptive, listen and give you answers to all kind of questions. He is also very pedagocigal.Wien planning the trip, he gives you all kind of advise and answers very quickly. You get high expectations from his support - and HE lives up to all of them. He is really a nice guy who likes his job to show his town and its history. If we had the time we should choose Marcello for more days. And he speaks English fluently and you feel confident in his company.

Topnotch Guide, A True BsAs Ambassador, & A New Friend. Booked Marcelo based on his stellar TA reviews for 1 full day and 2 half days in Feb 2012. Could not have been more pleased with the experience. Every email I sent (and there were a lot) was very promptly replied to. He was always pleasant, enthusiastic, and a great source of useful information. A true Porteno, Marcelo knows his city inside & out. We saw the major highlights of BsAs mostly by foot, also utilizing buses, subways, & taxis. What sets him apart from other guides I've had before is that he is extremely engaging. He is a master at storytelling, and knows his history. And he does all this in a very fun, entertaining way! He gave us a comprehensive list of restaurants, bars, clubs for us to explore in our free time. He deliberately kept us away from the "tourist traps" and we felt that he really strived to show us the real BsAs. The pace was good, tailored to our interests, and there was never a dull moment. We feel very lucky to have met Marcelo, as we consider him a new friend. Gracias Marcelo, you're the bomb!

If you're heading to BA you need a day with Marcelo. We had a 4 day stay in BA with my husband. We wanted to do a tour but was not interested in a cheesy bus tour. I found Marcelo through trip advisor and I must say he made our stay in BA. Booking with him was easy- he responded quickly and answered all my questions. On our first day he came to our hotel in the morning sat down with us and found out what our interests were and what we wanted to see. We then did a mix of walking and taxis during our 8 hours with him. He took us to see some of the main sites and gave interesting information. It was great to also be able to talk to him about the current economic, political and social context in Argentina from the perspective of a young Porteno. He helped us booking tickets for a tango show and took us to a terrific place for lunch. At the end of the day he gave us a comprehensive folder with lots of helpful information that we used to tailor the rest of our stay. His prices are very reasonable and the service he provides is excellent. Really can't recommend him highly enough.

Marcelo is a great guide. Our ship was late in docking but Marcelo patiently waited hours for us. He was very knowledgable about BA history and politcal issues. We thought we knew exactly what we wanted to see but he had some great ideas and our visit was better than we hoped.

Marcelo was awesome! I only wish I had contacted him earlier so we could spend more time together.. We hired him for a half day tour (because he wasn't available for a full day). Marcelo created an itinerary specifically for us and the things we were interested in. He arrived at our hotel on time and was very personable. He has an impressive knowledge of Argentine history and is also well travelled, which gives him a great perspective. His english is awesome and conversation flowed easily. Highly recommended.

You will be happy with Marcelo!. Marcelo is a very organized and passionate private guide for Buenos Aires. He answered many of our questions prior to coming and sent us very helpful written information. He designed the tour around what we wanted to see. We would highly recommend him and look forward to going back to Argentina.

Marcelo - Professional & Passionate!. Like many other reviewers my Wife and I avoid city centre guides like the plague mainly because of a particularly poor experience when we last visited Buenos Aires some seven years ago.As we were keen not to make the same mistake again we did our research and were determined to do our own thing and just chill out & get to know the City without doing the usual touristy things.However, when we read the rave reviews that Marcelo had been receiving on Tripadvisor we thought that if we were to explain what we wanted to do in the limited time we had available it might be worth making an enquiry.We were immediately impressed not only by Marcelo's professionally presented web site but also with his impressive English fluency together with his understanding of our objectives, which he demonstrated in our initial email exchanges.The end result was that we spent a full day with Marcelo and his genuine passion and enthusiasm for his City enhanced our visit far more than it would have done, left to our own devices. He allowed us time to do what we wanted to see, in our case the wonderful Museo Fortabat, but he gently suggested (correctly) that we would be far better off spending some time with him in Retiro instead of La Boca.Marcelo has also compiled his own recommended list of restaurants, clubs & attractions which he gave us in order for us to do our exploring on our own.On our last night in BA we visited an iconic Milonga, La Confiteria Ideal, (at the top of his list) & spent over 3 hours mesmerized by the Tango dancers, both amateur and expert, and inspired by the sensual and arousing live music. We were still humming "Por Una Cabeza" into the wee small hours!Marcelo - muchas gracias y bien hecho

Best Tour Guide in Buenos Aires. We booked a tour with Marcelo for our group of four. He tailored the tour to our interests and let us have input every step of the way to ensure the best experience. He knows all the history of the town, but makes it fun along the way. We booked the full day private tour and it was well-worth it. He also gives you a great resource of his recommended restaurants, bars and sights around town that was spot on and a wonderful help for the rest of our week in B.A.

An awesome tour guide who works on your schedule. We found Marcelo through Tripadvisor and were extremely happy with the services he provided us. We met Marcelo for a half of day tour on the day we arrived in BA and we also hired him for a full-day tour later on in our trip.This was the first time I have ever hired a tour guide for a city. My usual MO is to read a tourist book, go visit a few sites and roam a city trying new foods, looking at shops, etc. Given I have never been to South America, and Marcelo's reasonable rates, I figured I would give him a try - and was very pleased with the experience.On our first day, Marcelo met us at our hotel and we saw several of the main sites in downtown Buenos Aires. We visited a milonga, saw some historical buildings and Marcelo explained a lot about Argentine history so we would understand the various architecture and monuments in BA. At the end of our first day, Marcelo spent some time with us to plan our schedules for the rest of our trip. He also helped us with reservations and gave us several restaurant recommendations.On our second day with Marcelo, we visited a number of the touristy sites including La Boca, Puerto Madero and the Recoleta cemetery. Marcelo walked us through each site, told us the history and let us browse stores and eat at our leisure. We were very happy with Marcelo's services and highly recommend him for any visitor to BA.

Call Marcelo!!. Just to get it on record - I don't use tour guides for cities. I'm a firm believer of research through books, internet, friends. Having said that, there are times you don't have time for research and there are things no amount of research can tell you. And that's what I love about Marcelo (he's also endearing, but that's not the point). Marcelo gives you trivia about Argentines, packages his information like a story, literally walks you through them, and ends the tour with a bang. He knows drama and he employs it. Even if you've been good about your reading, I'd recommend you take a walk through Buenos Aires with him. He clearly loves his city and his job, and the day we spent with him really opened my eyes to the uniqueness of BA. Oh, if only we had met him on our first day!!

Excellent way to get to know Buenos Aires. We arrived in Buenos Aires and realised that we had underestimated the scale of the city, so decided to try to find a guide to get under the skin of the city. I found Marcelo on Tripadvisor, sent him an e-mail and the next day we met him at our hotel at 10am.The first thing we did was discuss what we wanted to do for the day - I made some suggestions that included us going to Recoleta alone, but he advised against this. Following his advice, we strated the tour which would see us walking around the city. I had initially booked a half day tour, but it soon became apparent that in order to see everything we wanted, a full day was in order - plus by that stage we know just how good Marcelo was as a guide. There was so much more than just visiting the different sights, there was so much knowledge about the city and the history of the country to accompany this which made for a really interesting day, but still fun at the same time as Marcelo has a lovely warm manner about him.This is a fantastic way to see Buenos Aires, I am so glad that I chose Marcelo and would not hesitate to recommend.

Marcello is amazing - highly recommended. We hired Marcello to guide our family of 2 parents and 3 daughters ( ages 20, 18 and 15) for a 3 day tour of Buenos Aires. Marcello's English is excellent, He is intelligent, organized, flexible, accommodating and also a very nice person! His knowledge of the history and culture of Buenos Aires is amazing and enhanced our trip. He also observed our family and modified the itinerary, with our consent, based upon what he thought we would enjoy most, and he was right. We highly recommend hiring him as your tour guide on your trip to Buenos Aires.

I can't imagine a better guide.. I did two half-days with Marcelo, and another day with the information he provided me for exploring on my own. His pride in his country and city is obvious and has motivated him to learn and to make sure you understand the complex history that has created Buenos Aires. He is also charming and was willing to conduct the tour in measured and carefully enunciated Spanish so that I could practice my comprehension. I will continue to recommend Marcelo to anyone I know that is visiting BA, but reserve early -- he is popular for a good reason.

Fantasic Experience. I have never used a private tour guide before, but I am so glad I did! Marcelo was absolutely fantastic, weaving in history with the current culture. In terms of history, he doesn't bog you down with tons of dates and facts, but instead gives you the most important pieces of information so that you remember it and share it later with other friends. He answered our questions honestly. The half day flew by and by the end we felt we had a friend. All four of us afterwards talked about how happy we were to do this, and how pleased we were with Marcelo.If you are visiting BA, book a tour with Marcelo - you will not be disappointed!!

Amazing Guide and Storyteller!. A much delayed, but much deserved glowing review for Marcelo Mansilla.... We had the pleasure of meeting and touring with Marcelo on September 3rd, 2011 for a private half-day tour. We are so very glad that we did. We’ve taken many tours in our travels, (including a few in Buenos Aires) - I think Marcelo was by far the best storyteller of the lot. He has a college degree in tourism and it shows. Marcello offers a great mix of anecdote, statistic, and historical fact-- setting a rich background and the context for each of his tales and each of the landmarks he points out. His stories were riveting, whether about the Mothers (and Grandmothers) of May Plaza or about the tragic Falklands War. Throughout our time I was truly impressed at his eye for interesting detail. In just a half day we covered a great deal of the city center by foot – and Marcelo was always quick to point out locations that we might enjoy returning to on our own. (We particularly loved his recommendation of the Confiteria Ideal.) At the end of our tour Marcelo sat with us for some time with the city map – pointing out areas and streets of interest. He then provided a whole printed folder containing wealth of activities, directions and restaurant recommendations. He was like a tour guide and travel concierge all in one! We want to thank Marcelo for such a perfect BA afternoon.

Great tourguide, we learned so much!. Highly recommend. Marcelo is an excellent guide, and has tons of knowledge about Buenos Aires and also about Argentinian history. His style is a bit different from other guides, he does not rush so you can see 100 attractions in a day. He prefers to take a little more time, and give you the background, the history, the flavor and the culture. He will completely tailor your tour based on your preference. But my friends and I decided to let him choose, which worked out great. We did a 4 hour tour; and liked it enough to have a second day with another 4 hour tour. Each 4 hour tour was $80 USD for our small group. Mainly we did a lot of walking, but also took a couple of taxis. Marcelo also makes sure you are "set" for your entire stay, he gladly shares tons of ideas for places to go, his favorite restaurants, tango shows, or whatever you'd like to see. Thanks Marcelo!

Marcelo, a guide for all seasons.. Have you ever had the good fortune to meet someone who can guide you at a challenging time? On our first full day in Buenos Aires, Marcello met us right on schedule at our hotel and proceeded over the next 8 hours to not only bring Buenos Aires alive but to help us plan the remainder of our visit to his beautiful city. He shared his city's history, its challenges, architecture, cuisine, ice cream and more and his insight, educational and personable efforts were beyond compare. A wonderful young man with wonderful skills. Thank you Marcelo!!!

Going on a tour with Marcelo is like visiting Buenos Aires with a well-informed friend.. Marcelo made BA come alive. In addition to showing us the sights he explained history, economics, local current events, and what everyday life is like. He took the time to put the sights into context, explaining why they were important. His English is excellent and he was happy to answer our questions. Marcelo was very generous with his time; he gave us suggestions about tango shows in response to a pre-arrival email and suggestions for sights to see the day after our tour.

Couldn't ask for a better tour guide - truly excellent!!. Marcello was an excellent tour guide and I am very thankful to him for everything he did for us. We contacted him after seeing his glowing reviews on here and he surpassed our expectations.I emailed him and replied very quickly with all of his information and what he could do for us. Before we got to BA we had already organised a tango show to see after reading the options for shows that Marcello told me about. (we decided to go to a hour long show at the cafe tortoni which was very fun and good value for money). He then helped us pay for it when we got there as he cleverly fit it in to our tour. He, of course, charged us nothing for this.He met us at our hotel and discussed with us what we wanted to do and then we set off! We wanted to know about the history about BA and some good spots to visit the next day we were there. He showed us a lot in 4 hours and the highlight was seeing the cemetery which he was very knowlodgeable about and told us very interesting stories about the different graves. Over lunch he gave us a map and a list of places/restaurants/safety information that we might need and told us need. And because me and mum had mentioned wine and food several times (!) we discussed the best restraunts to go to in more detail. It was great that he helped us plan the next day as we wouldn't of known what to do - and he wasn't pushy at all and didn't insist that we saw anything in particular.We paid him $80 USD for four hours but he was happy to stay for an hour longer free of charge but we paid him for it anyway as he was excellent and well worth the money.I have already suggested him to a few friends and the same recommendation goes to you!And lastly....THANK YOU MARCELLO!!! :D xxI just wanted to email you and say thank you so so so so much for all of your help whilst we were in BA and for helping us organise everything before while we were still in the UK. You were so fast at replying! I have given your details to three of the cabin crew which will be coming back in the next year or so. Your knowlodge of your city and history of it was excellent and I am very glad to have learnt about it (May 21st, 1810!!).We had an excellent time at the tango you organised for us and the next day was great as the itenery your helped us make took us to the best places which we throughly enjoyed! The market was great and I bought a cow skin rug for my living room! It was 600 pesos but in engald it would cost at least £200 (1800 or so pesos!!) so I was very very happy! We also found some good wine in the super market and so I am delighted with my souvenires! But most importantly are the memories...and my favourite part was the cematary with you tour and the facinating stories you told us, so thank you Marcello.

Passionate and personable guide. We booked a guided tour of buenos aires with Marcelo for one and a half days. From the moment I sent the first email, Marcelo always replied promptly with helpful advice.
