What could be better for anyone who arrives in Buenos Aires for the first time than to be introduced to the basics of the city by someone who also arrived as a stranger and then made the city his home.Jonathon's tour introduces you to the fundamentals of getting around the city - taking a bus, taking the subway - both intimidating activities for the uninitiated.He also whets your appetite for the history, both political and cultural, of the city. He is a natural and engaging storyteller whose wit and "outsider on the inside" take on the city is clearly influenced by his own love of Buenos Aires.Here's the short version of this review - take Jonathon's tour on Day One of your visit, and when you set out on Day Two you'll have the focus and the street smarts that would have taken you a week to acquire otherwise.

Excellent Buenos Aires City Tour. Excellent city tour of Buenos Aires. Jonathan is an enthusiastic tour guide, bringing life to the city of Buenos Aires. The tour was rather informal, which was very nice, and Jonathan adds his own interesting details and anecdotes as you walk through the history filled streets. He is a very knowledgeable tour guide and manages to provide a very detailed history of Buenos Aires while keeping the tone light and fun for the group. He also makes the effort to orient everyone with the different modes of transportation around the city to make the rest of everyones trip to BA more accessible and easily navigable. Overall, a very interesting tour that provides you with a great basis for your trip to Buenos Aires, a thorough history of the city and leaves you with the feeling of an afternoon well spent. Highly recommended.

Great intro to BA. What a great way to spend your time in Buenos Aires! Jonathan is well-informed and a natural teacher. Our small group had a wonderful time getting a great taste of this amazing city. I gained the confidence to explore on my own for the next two days.

Good introduction to BA. We toured with Jonathon the day after we arrived in BA. It was our first visit to Buenos Aires and it was an absolute wonderful introduction to the city. We were introduced to different modes of transportation and quite a bit of history. Jonathon is quite an enthusiastic guide and so well informed. I highly recommend this free tour though tips are expected.

Not to be missed!. This is an absolute MUST! Jonathan had organised a tour that introduced you to all forms of transport around Buenos Aries. It was interesting and informative and at a pace that was just right. Jonathan conducted the tour with wit, humour and panache! This was not our first visit to Buenos Aries but we went to places that we had not known about. Highly recommended

Hot Xmas Eve walking tour in Buenos Aires. Yes it was 43 degrees on the day of free walk - Jonathan kept it informative and entertaining too - what a trooper he is as well as the walk participants. This tour was particularly useful as Jonathan provided the pertinent info about individual travel plans and intro to the city from a unique perspective. A great discovery to take back home ranging from history en brief, life of famous figures from movies, street art tours, underground dinners and more. This is a city I am looking forward to return.
Great free tour. This was a great way to experience som of the attractions of BA! It was fun, interesting and knowledgable guiding. You should do this tour if you come to BA.

An absolute must!. My friends and I took Jonathan's walking tour shortly after arriving in Buenos Aires. What a wonderful surprise! Knowledgeable, witty and organized, Jonathan is a fabulous storyteller, mixing facts, anecdotes, and urban legends. We all highly recommend Jonathan.

Started my BA visit off right!. I can't say enough about BA Local Tours -- I arrived alone before my friends, speaking no spanish, and wondering how to occupy my first day - the answer? Jonathan and his tour. I hired him for a couple of hours for a private tour of Recoleta Cemetery, then joined him on his free tour. It was the perfect way to get oriented in a new city. Best of all - he takes public tranist, and explained the crazy BA bus system! We hired him again the following day to take us to La Boca and San Telmo. He was a great resource even after the tour, email us restaurant suggestions. Our only regret was we werent able to join him for Pub Quiz. Next time!

One of best travelling experiences... Ever!. My boyfriend and I were lucky enough to go on the free daily tour and also booked with Jonathan to go to Boca aftrwards. I cannot rate this experience highly enough. My only problem was that we did not do this sooner into our stay!He was a wealth of knowledge but not one second was boring, stuffy or dull - the whole tour showed not only how much Jonathan obviously loves this incredible city - despite it's sometimes-madness! - but also how interesting and quirky Buenos Aires itself is.We had a great time riding on the buses with the locals, learning the minutiae of what makes the city so unique, and talking about Porteno life, politics and culture. Definitely the best way to experience a city is to hang out with a local, albeit an adopted one, so your sightseeing isn't aimless. There is too much to do and learn in Buenos Aires to go into it with no clue, and the Congreso means so much more when you also get to hear the story of the over the top windmill cafe next to it. He was also extremely patient with my irritating shutterbug habit. If you do only one thing in Buenos Aires on your visit here, make sure this is it. Thanks again so much Jonathan!!!

Great intro to BA. Jonathan's tour was great - it was really good to incorporate public transport as we got to see some diverse areas of Buenos Aires. Deciphering the bus schedules was worth it alone :) he is clearly quite interested and passionate about various aspects and the tour kept moving at a good pace. We have done another free walking tour in BA but the group size was huge and we spent a lot of time at each stop, meaning we didn't cover much ground. We preferred this tour over the other one. The sun/heat gets strong during the day so bring some water, hat, sunscreen and sunglasses.

amazing tour. This tour is very carefully designed and Jonathan's story telling skills are amazing. We chose to do it on our first day in BA and it was the best time we had there. Recommend this tour without any reservation. Thanks Jonathan!

Great tour. This tour was perfect for me because I had only one day in BA. It's fun and informative. Jonathan s smart and witty which made it all even better. And now I know how to get a bus ticket and how to hold on to my backpack :D Recommend it to everyone, those with tight schedules and those who just got to BA because this tour is a perfect start as Jonathan has a lot of suggestions on where to go and what to see.

Perfect introduction to BA!. I can just repeat what other people say - Jonathan´s tour is a perfect introduction to Buenos Aires and how to get around the city.We were there at the beginning of November and Jonathan managed to do the tour with his broken arm! We hope you are well again, Jonathan, and we did use some more buses after having learned how to use the bus plan!

Highly recommended!. I've done both free tours that offered in the city and I can strongly recommend to join Jonathan tour. He is intelligent and knowledgeable guide and all idea of his tour is very informative and different from other. It was a rainy day and only 3 people were there to join the tour and Jonathan was more than pleased to do it in spite of bad weather. He also shares with you great suggestions about the city and places to visit, that are not usual and worth seeing! Don't miss it!

Great walking tour!. I am happy to enthusiastically recommend Jonathan's walking tour - a great introduction to Buenos Aires. He is very knowledgeable about the city and country and had lots of wonderful stories to add colour to the history, politics and culture. Definitely take this tour - you will be glad you did!!! We enjoyed his tour so much, that we asked him take us through Recoleta after the tour ended, for which we happily paid him.

Can't think of a better introduction to Buenos Aires. Having read previous reviews of Jonathan's tour we decided it would be a good idea to pop along and take the tour on our first day. So glad we did. Aside from being very fortunate that the wife and I were the only 2 people taking the tour on the day we got an excellent introduction to the city. Jonathan clearly loves living in Buenos Aires and that came across as he showed us round. It's the first walking tour we've done that gets you involved on public transport which was a nice change as it means you get to see a lot more of the city than you would on a normal walking tour. We kept seeing number 29 buses in the days following!Thanks for also arranging the trip to see a Boca Juniors match, we'd have had no chance sorting that out on our own.

A great welcome to Buenos Aires. We are a group of 8 friends who travelled to Buenos Aires to celebrate a 'milestone' birthday. We saw Jonathan's reviews on TA and decided to book him for a 1/2 day tour. We covered the Recoleta, the Plaza de Mayo and La Boca. In fact, had it not been for Jonathan, I would have skipped La Boca altogether. I'm glad the 1st timers in the group had the opportunity to see it.While we covered the main sights, I am also pleased to say that we all learned a great deal from Jonathan (despite this being my 3rd time in the city). Our group really felt like they saw not only the most important bits, but that they also gained perspective from someone who lives here and who understands what makes the place tick. We also enjoyed jonathan's wit and sense of humour. I will also say that the man has infinite patience - allowing us to stop for our many photos and bank machines attempts.I really appreciate the fact that we used public transport as it helped everyone see aspects of the city that we may not have otherwise seen.We have done walking / city tours before and I can definitely say that we would wholeheartedly recommend Jonathan.Thanks from Toronto.

Do this tour first!. We read about Jonathan's tour prior to arriving in Buenos Aires and made a note to include it in our plans. We are so glad we did! Jonathan was extremely informative, entertaining, and helpful. The history of the area came alive with his amusing anecdotes. We find subways pretty easy to negotiate but buses are more difficult....until Jonathan helps you figure out how to decipher the information. We are now ready to enjoy all the areas we are interested in exploring. Thank you, Jonathan for sending us such a complete list of recommendations! We can't wait to get started!Karin and Bill

Awesome Tour Guide and Tour of Buenos Aires. We are so glad that we did the free tour with Jonathan and saw a completely different perspective of Buenos Aires. We learned about the history of Tango, rode on the wood train (which is so cool) and met lovely people from the U.S. and abroad on this tour (Shout out to Marianne and Andrew). Needless to say, we had a great time!! Jonathan is super nice and he knows so much about the history of Buenos Aires. It was good to learn and to visit so many of the historic sites. He was kind enough to consider that we would need a food and bathroom break and we still had time to see everything of interest. He was even patient enough to wait on those of us who slowed the group down while we were taking photos. I would recommend doing this tour if it is your first time in Buenos Aires for sure! Oh, and how can I forget that Jonathan was also kind enough to explain the bus and subway system (by the 5th day we had already figured it out on our own). We wished that we had taken this tour earlier in our trip, however it was still great!

Much More Than A Walking Tour. Sign up for Jonathan's tour now! It was fun, full of facts that make BA even more interesting, and so much more than just walking from one place to another. You learn how to best navigate the city, take a bus and subway, and meet other cool travelers. Jonathan gives important historical context, vital pop culture gems, recommendations, and he clearly loves talking about BA/Argentina's greatness and oddities. Taking the tour at the start of your visit will be helpful, but I loved it even on my last day in BA. Thanks again, Jonathan!
A walk with jonathan. A deep knowledge of Buenos Aires and Argentina's history combined with a british humour,this is the Jonathan's experience. Good fun and good memory. Enjoy! Eric from Paris

Great introduction to Buenos Aires. Walking tours are often enjoyable and this one was no exception. The reason I enjoyed Jonathan's tour more than most was because he gave a good introduction to the public transportation system, which can definitely be intimidating in a city like Buenos Aires. Also, his tour was more detailed than most of the other tours we tried, meaning that you didn't just "brush" over everything. I would recommend this tour to first time visitors as a great way to start your travels.

Great Tour, Fun Day, Useful Info!. Had a great time on the walking tour! Jonathan really knows his stuff and shared a great mix of practical information, like how to operate the public transportation system and how to stay safe, and a really good mix of history, geography, architecture and cultural information about Buenos Aires. The pace was great, the walking was leisurely and our group had a nice time. I learned a lot !

Wonderful Intro to Buenos Aires. Jonathan Evans is a wonderful tour guide who has great knowledge coupled with a sense of humor which made our four hour toura not to be missed experience. I advise everyone to start with this tour because you will use public transportation, which is a mustin this large city, and Jonathan teaches you the basics. It is obvious that he loves the history of BA and passes it on very well. My husband and I were very glad to have started our adventure in BA with this tour! Highly recommended.

Great orientation!. I highly recommend connecting with Jonathan within your first day or two in the city. His tour is invaluable for figuring out how to get around and how to prioritize your time. He's so well-versed on local culture, politics and city life and entirely willing to share his experience. I also loved that he showed us the best parts of the city that my guidebook didn't highlight, it was really terrific. Thanks Jonathan!

Great introduction to BA. We took this tour on our second day in BA and found it a great way to get an overview of the city. As part of the tour Johnathan not only tells you about the transport system but he also demonstrates! We took the subte and the metro - this was so benefical as he taught us how to pay/ ask for our ticket etc. We able to use this transport when required throughout the rest of our trip (which we would definitely not have been comfortable doing prior to his tutorial!). Johnathan brought us to several of the major sights as well as lesser known neighbourhoods - I particularly loved the area around the Tango Singer Carlos Gardels house as the wall art was so colourful and it was great to visit such authentic areas. (See photos uploaded which I took on tour)Johnathan was friendly and interesting throughout the tour. His stories were entertaining and really informative.We expressed interest in attending a sold out Las Pumas vs All Blacks that was taking a place a couple of days later - Johnathan very kindly offered to arrange to source tickets for us and he followed up on this offer promptly the next day. He also emailed us a list of his recommendations i.e restaurants/coffee shops etc. Thank you Johnathan for your help and advice!The payment for this tour is via a tip at the end - which is much deserved for the time dedicated to the tours on a daily basis.

The perfect tour guide. We spent a few hours with Jonathan, and it was the best tour we could have asked for. He took us to these amazing sights, big and small, and it seems like he knows everything! He had all these little stories an insights you would not expect from your average tour guide, and gave us a different prespective on the city. Highly recommended!

an excellent tour. We only had 36 hours in the city and arranging a private tour with Jonathan within a couple of hours of our flight touching down might have seemed a bit keen but it really was worth it. He gave us four hours and we did not waste a second of it. His knowledge and obvious affection for Buenos Aires was infectious and he explained the transport system to us so efficiently that the next day we were dashing about using the Subte as if we had been there for years! His restaurant suggestion was ideal and we really cannot recommend him more highly.

Awesome tour! Highly recommend it!. The tour with Jonathan was absolutely great! He is very knowledgable about the city, its history, current affairs as well as the Argentine culture. I highly recommend the tour to anyone. When I went on the tour I was the only one (lucky me!) so I got an awesome private tour through the city. Not only was Jonathan very informative, he was also very nice and even emailed me city recommendations as well as other tours I should check out. Jonathan's tours are free but he does accept tips, so tip your awesome tour guide well! If you would like to read a little more about my tour with Jonathan, please feel free to check out our travel blog with lots of pictures from the tour: http://ddfitzgerald.weebly.com/3/post/2012/10/buenos-aires-local-tours-with-jonathan.html

Worth your while. Certainly worth your while if you have just arrived in the city. Jonathan will help you understand the bus system and take you to a few places which you may not usually see. As I had seen some of the attractions already, and was the only one on the day's tour, he quickly adapted the schedule to make it more interesting for me.

Thank you Johnathan!. My wife and I combined the "free daily tour" with a short "private" tour in one day (we were the only two on the daily tour - lucky us).We had been in BA for four days prior to his tour and we both remarked that we should have contacted Johnathan sooner. Recommendation : Land, take one day to settle in, contact Johnathan. It was that informative; in addition to learning amazing facts about BA and Argentina we learned how to traverse the city by bus, subway and foot.In summary, Johnathan is knowledgable, whitty, and personable and you simply must allow him to share his newly adopted city with you.P.S. you will cover quite a bit of ground so dress accordingly.

Great introduction to the city. We took this tour the morning we arrived in Buenos Aires and are delighted that we did - it provides an excellent introduction to the city by showing you how the somewhat confusing transport systems work and giving you a good overview of some of the key areas. Also having someone as knowledgeable as Jonathan to ask questions of is great if you are planning to spend some time on the city, and he kindly offers to send round a list of his recommendations to those who want them. Overall highly recommended, and I'd say that the sooner you do it after arriving the more you will appreciate it.

Make this tour the first thing you do in Buenos Aires.. I'm not going to echo the statements of many other reviewers as to how great and informative this tour was (which it was) but I do want to repeat the advice that you should really do this on Day One of your stay in Buenos Aires. It will give you a good feel for the city, teach you about busses and the Subte, and give you some ideas as to where to explore in greater detail. Thanks Jonathan!

incredible tour of the city- cannot be better!. I am a very experienced solo traveler- have been to over 100 countries, taken lots and lots of tours of different cities and locations. This was definitely one of the best if not THE best. Jonathan is incredible. British guy, living in BA for more than 4-5 years. Smart as hell. Has all the qualities for a perfect guide. First- knowledge. Since I am very much interested in the history of spain-europe-indiginous people-Argentina, during the tour I asked him tens and tens of questions. His fund of knowledge is amazing. There was not one thing he didn't know and couldn't elaborate on in a very detailed way.But that's not the only thing that makes him a good guide. Jonathan has a sharp and special kind of sense of humor. He also is a master in telling fascinating stories. this combo is a great one: prepare to laugh and enjoy numerous anecdotes and stories about the city.Also- this is not going to be a tour only of the "pink house", "Eva Peron cemetary" etc. He will take you to hidden gems in the city- that no other tour will take you too.And By the way- I was in BA for a wedding of a good friend. My boss took the tour too, a day prior, and he absolutely loved it! I really think that a visit in BA is not going to be the same without Jonathans tour. You will learn so much about Argenina- and in such an amusing, fun and interesting way!!By the way- this is what Jonathan does. He does not charge money but bascially living on tips- so if you like it, be generous with him.HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!Yair

We lucked out with this tour. I took the tour with Jonathan on a Saturday and it was a really unique, great experience. Unique because Jonathan is both a local, with a deep knowledge and experience of Buenos Aires, and a foreigner who is able to talk about the Argentinian culture and customs from an outsider point of view that makes sense to other foreigners. We did a Tango tour (Abasto) and visited Plaza de Mayo and other places in a tour that took about 4 hours. The group was small (5 people) and there was an intellectually stimulating, fun and friendly atmosphere all around. We asked Jonathan a lot of questions about Argentinian history and culture, and he was not only willing but also very interested to take the conversation to whatever direction we wanted, providing thoughtful, knowledgable comments. It is a pleasure to interact with such an educated and fun person as Jonathan and a great luck to have him as a tour guide!

So much better than the other "free" tours. Given we had been on 2 other "free" walking tours, we are delighted to report that this is so much better. Check the website buenosaireslocaltours.com just in case, but in principle go to the steps within Plaza Italia. Easy via subte green line D. At 11am Jonathan will be waiting for you. Jonathan takes a very practical approach - by the end of his tour you will know how to get round the city by understanding addresses/distances on a map, the bus system and the metro/subte. This learning is included as part of a very interesting walk that included Carlos Gardel, Abasto, a colectivo public bus, the A line wooden metro car, Congresso, Casa de Rosado and a lot more including the most superb explanation of Palacio Barolo - Jonathan knows his stuff. All this is delivered with an obvious passion for the subject, tinged with humour and a hint of sadness as demonstrated when he accurately described the Windmill Building next to Congress as being a snapshot of recent Argentinian history. Rich, opulent, political, poor, neglected, waiting for the next chapter. A very good analogy. The walk was well paced and even though the duration was four hours there was never a moment when we were bored. In addition to the walk, you can also tap Jonathans local knowledge which is extensive. We asked for some additional information which was not to hand on the day but was delivered by email within 24 hours. This is billed as a "free tour" but we defy you to walk away giving nothing. We willingly gave our tip - reckon it was excellent value

Brilliant introduction to Buenos Aires. This tour is an ideal introduction to BA on your first or second day in the city.Jonathan waits on the stairs inside Plaza Italia at 11am. He will advise via his website if the tour is not running at the time (eg if he is on holidays) - www.buenosaireslocaltours.com.Jonathan gives a great overview of the city before taking you on public transport to see some key sites and areas. He finds out what you are interested in so to advise on further things that you can see in the city. His knowledge of Buenos Aires and it's history is amazing and he communicates well.Jonathan keeps you entertained for around 4 hours before setting you free in the city centre.

Perfect Introduction to Buenos Aires. Jonathan is an amazing guide and I would strongly recommend taking his tour of Buenos Aires as an introduction to the city. Jonathan shows you parts of the city that you may otherwise miss out on (such as Once) and has an immense knowledge of Buenos Aires. He will also familiarize you with the Buenos Aires public transportation options. My wife and I enjoyed the free tour so much that we arranged a subsequent custom tour with Jonathan.

Great way to get to know BA. When I took Jonathan's free walking tour, I had already done two the day before. I was wanting to see the Palermo section of the city, and when his tour said the meeting point was in Palermo, near Plaza Italia I said "sign me up". When my friend and I got there and Jonathan said he was going to take us back towards the direction we came from, I wanted to leave since it seemed like it was just going to be a redo of everything else I had already seen. However, I decided to give him a chance since the group was very small and it would have been noticeable if we had bailed. He gave a great explanation of the bus system, which is very confusing - they publish a book to find your way around - and he gave clear directions on what to do when you get on the buses. The first stop we made was in the Abasto area, where we saw lots of tango related businesses and landmarks. With this stop alone I was happy that we had not left the group back at Plaza Italia. I would never have known about this area of the city if it werent for Jonathan's tour. For a non-Argentinian he had a great amount of knowledge of the buildings and city, even to the point that he told us new information about buildings we had already seen. We did not finish the whole tour with him because we had to be somewhere before the tour was over, but Jonathan was very helpful in giving us directions back to where we needed to be. He was super pleasant and interesting to talk to when we riding the buses. Even though we missed the end of the tour with him, we will definitely take his advice and ride the A line to see the wooden train cars.

Brilliant Introduction to BA!. This morning my wife and I did the tour offered by Jonathan. It was a fantastic tour that highlighted much of BA´s and Argentina´s history. Some of the sites that were especially enjoyable included a short trip on the one of the oldest subway cars in the world, a building that was intended to be a mausoleum for Dante Alighieri and Gardel´s house is Abasta.

BEST walking tour I've been on - a "must-do!". I came to BA for business and landed myself a long weekend. Unfortunately I only did Jonathan's tour towards the end of my free days to explore; it would have been much better to do the first day I had free time. We did Palermo, Abasto, Congreso & Plaza de Mayo.From the moment "go" Jonathan was extremely helpful with responding to my e-mail inquiries; on time at the meeting point and for the next 3hr30 minutes the time was filled with walking, bussing, taking the metro and lots of interesting facts and stories/legends about the places we visited. Defenitely very informative; from teaching you how to use the public transport to the stories & information shared. At no time did I feel like he was rushing to just get this over with.I have done quite a few walking tours in different cities, but none as informative, fun and interesting as Jonathans. I would highly recommend this walking tour - whether you are here for a day, a week, a month or a year! Thanks for a great morning Jonathan and sharing your passion and love for BA with me :-)

Wonderful introduction to Buenos Aires. I really enjoyed this walking tour with Jonathan. He started off by explaining how the bus system worked and then took me on a most interesting walk, slightly off the beaten track, as well as some of the popular sights too (we went to Recoleta on my particular walk). Jonathan was very knowledgeable and I loved the way this walking tour took me to some quirky sights and used local transportation too. I would thoroughly recommend this tour especially if you have just arrived in BA and would like an overview of the city and lessons in how to use the local transportation.

Must-do!. A great tour, especially early in your visit, since it helps you get comfortable using the bus and subway, which are a great (and cheap!) way to get around the city. Entertaining and informative, taking you get to a couple of neighborhoods you might otherwise overlook. Recommended!

More than just a sightseeing tour. If you're the kind of person who wants to sit on a yellow double-decker bus and observe a city from a comfortable distance, then this tour isn't for you. But if you want to truly explore the city with a knowledgeable and personable guide, then you must go on Jonathan's tour. In just a few hours we learned about the architecture of Buenos Aires, tango history, street art, political movements, and so much more. A highlight of the tour was learning about the crazy inspiration behind the design of Palacio Barolo, which to the untrained eye appears to be just another office building. Jonathan also teaches you how to use the buses and subways in BA, which is a skill my wife and I put to good use during the rest of our week-long vacation. Jonathan also sent an email after the tour full of recommendations based on things we said we'd be interested in doing. Overall, this was a great tour that we highly recommend.

One of the first things you must do in BA. If you are going to Buenos Aires, Jonathan's tour is a must do. You see a good selection of neighborhoods and learn a lot about BA's history. We did this tour on our last day in BA and were really glad we did even though we'd already spent over a week there. One of the best things about his tour is the explanation on how the bus system works, hugely handy and the reason why I'd recommend doing his tour as one of the first things you do in BA. It's free, but shouldn't be. Giving a decent tip is still heaps cheaper than yellow tourist bus, and the tour is soooo much better

great start to a visit in BA!. Jonathan´s tour was very helpful for my second day in Buenos Aires. It was an excellent way to get comfortable in the city by taking public transport and discovering the important landmarks with Jonathan´s good company. Jonathan is friendly and very helpful. His emails before and after the tour were full of information. The spots we visited were a perfect way to orient myself in the city, and to get to know some of the culture, history and interesting parts of BA.I would highly reccomend this tour!

Worth the 'Donation". We are not 'tour people' but based on the many reviews on TripAdvisor decided to try Jonathan's tour and really enjoyed it. While you don't actually go into places, you walk by and get some rich history and you then can decide to go back on your own. If you are intimidated by the Subte or Bus system, Jonathan walks you through it and you go together. It truly was an enjoyable day and there were only three of us on the tour the day we went so we got lots of attention and were able to ask a lot of questions which Jonathan easily answered. Jonathan had clearly thought out our route to help us get the layout of the city, understand using the Subte and busses, and adding a bathroom/food break inside a beautiful mall at just the right time. I would encourage you to take this tour in your first day or two in Buenos Aires....it will really help get your bearings in the city.

Awesome tour for first time and repeat visitors to BA!. In my third time visiting BA, I chose Jonathan's tour because it included several areas that I missed on previous trips. It was a fantastic tour and I learned a lot. Jonathan is very engaging and funny and made the tour an interactive experience by showing us how to navigate the bus and Subte. Since we were constantly on the go, this also made for the perfect activity to do after coming off a long, overnight flight from the US. If you're looking for a unique experience of BA, then Jonathan's tour is for you!

Delightful Tips and Stories to enliven your experience of BA. Jonathan may be a Brit but you feel like you're getting an insider's view of Buenos Aires ... with wit and style and of course, perfect English. Though I had already spent some time in the city, his tour sure enlivened my experience of this big, noisy, confusing city. He has ta knack for making the stories, and miscellaneous facts interesting, even memorable. Definitely take this tour. The info on navigating with the masses on bus (colectivo) and subway(subte) are definitely worthwhile if you want to get more local.

Two thumbs up!. You are taken to the filete houses. You see the cool Gardel images. You ride the bus and the antique wooden subte. You walk by Palacio Barolo, Casa Rosada, Plaza de Mayo, Plaza del Congreso. All the while learning new things and being entertained by Jonathan. Great way to spend an afternoon in BA! Tip well, it's well-deserved :)

Taught me a lot - and I've lived in BA for two years!. I've lived in Buenos Aires for almost two years, and did Jonathan's tour last month with my parents, who'd come over to visit (there were no teenagers, but Trip Advisor's categories didn't give me much to work with...). I already knew most of the places we went to, and of course was already au fait with the bus and subte system, but all the same I found it a fascinating tour and learned a lot of interesting things about Buenos Aires. Abasto's a great area to discover and Jonathan's knowledge of his subject is top notch. I've done a few guided tours in my time in BA, and this has been the best of the lot.

Highly Recommended- Walking Tour. Jonathan provides an excellent introduction, on his "free" walks (4hrs+) to getting around BA and its history. Walking, buses and subte, interjected with humour and anecdotes makes this a must for any newcomer to BA. Great way to get your bearings (and pick up "do's and don'ts") and very well worth doing. Bear in mind that Jonathan relies on his tips to make a living and as someone else commented he does like his "steaks and malbec"!

A great experience from a local's perspective!. I was fortunate enough to stumble across Jonathan's TripAdvisor listing on a recent trip to Buenos Aires, and for four lost Americans it was the perfect way to both acclimate to the city and see some of the best sites in Buenos Aires.Logistics: We met Jonathan at the statue at the Plaza Italia at 11 AM and proceeded on a four hour tour through some of the most interesting parts of BA. Seeing the home of Carlos Gartel (the founder of Tango and apparently quite the debonair dude), taking the buses and antique subway, and passing by the Casa Rosada (the presidential palace where Evita made her famous speeches) were just a few of the great experiences we got to sample.Jonathan doesn't charge but makes a living on the tips, so we took care of him and couldn't have asked for a more informed or interesting afternoon. I would highly recommend it!

Excellent introduction to Buenos Aires!. We are staying in Buenos Aires for a month and have really been enjoying it so far. It has been a relaxing break from the cold we left in British Columbia. We took Jonathan's tour several days after our arrival and learned a lot about using the bus and subway systems in Buenos Aires, as well as the history associated with the many sites we saw along the way. He is full of facts and stories about the city and its fascinating history. Afterward he provided us with helpful answers to questions we had via email about other places we hope to visit while here in Argentina. The tour was well worth taking!

A lot of fun and the perfect first thing to do in Buenos Aires. We had a great time doing the local tour with Jonathan, learned to navigate the city by bus (something we never would have figured out on our own, even as seasoned travellers) hear about the history of the city, current events and fun trivia. The tour also helped set us up for future adventures during our stay.Apart from the tour, Jonathan has hooked us up with detailed info for excursions out of town, and arranged for us to go to two futbol games. One with his sports writer friend and another to a big game that many agencies were not offering tickets to. Score!We really appreciate the contribution Jonathan made to making our trip fantastic!

Make your tour with Jonathan a priority when you arrive in Buenos Aries. We heard about Jonathan's tours towards the end of our stay in Argentina, via the best posible source - a word of mouth recommendation.Out tour took place on an overcast day (good for strolling round, B A can get HOT) and Jonathan's passion for the city he had made his own is evident. He has a real talent for imparting knowledge and what seems to be an endless supply of anecdotes...all interesting and relevant, even the ones about the buses and subte. He saves what I thought to be the best until almost the end, it's diabolical...that should whet your appetite!The tour is free, but be realistic with your tip at the end...whilst he enjoys running these tours you are getting four hours of his experience and guidance and - as he states in his website - he does like steaks and malbec!

Great tour of Buenos Aires!. Jonathan is an excellent guide, he knows an impressive amount of facts on Buenos Aires and would score well in a test on the Argentinian history! His tour is very informative and useful as he explains how to take public transport, gives you advice on what is worth visiting, and can answer any questions you may have on Buenos Aires and Argentina (politics, history, geography, culture) - a must-do!

Make it the first thing you do!. The other reviews say it all but it really is great. Jonathan is very knowledgable about the city and knew all the details. Not being a local and having been a tourist himself, allows him to share information that other guides do not. We did this tour plus another walking tour and Johnathan does take you to places that others don't go. Jonathan also very kindly answered some email queries I had after the tour which was very helpful. We also tried two of his restaurant suggestions and both were great.

Great way to get to know the city. Jonathan is very informative with the right amount of culture and history to keep it interesting without overwhelming factoids. He pointed out the more interesting features at La Recoleta cemetery and told stories to accompany these features. I did a solo tour because I had limited time and wanted to see all the highlights of the city. I was suffering from some leftover effects of 3 days of tourist stomach so was a little slow and weak and Jonathan was extremely accommodating of my slow poke ways. I highly recommend his tour.

This is the tour to do. (and I've done 4 so far...). This is money well spent. it's free of course... but you should tip this guy. He's awesome. Wha the saves you in taxis alone is worth $50 USD. We started at Plaza Italia. He showed us how to use the confusing bus map (yes.. there is one!) and also where to get it. ... how to use the subway (Subte) and also a lot of the things that will trip you up and illustrate just what a gringo you happen to be. He's down to earth and has been there before (not speaking Spanish and trying to get around.) I did the tour on a Tuesday... and then showed a friend how to travel around BsAs on a Wednesday (because I became an expert after that. ;-) Jonathan took us to parts of the city that the other guides don't show you. Okay... but after all that... I'm ready to move here! ;-)

Entertaining and informative! A Great start to my trip.. This is a great way to start your trip to and I strongly recommend that it's the first thing you should do when you're new to Buenos Aires and want to get your bearings. Jonathan gives lots of helpful tips on how to make your way around the city on your own using the public transport which is invaluable information if you're planning on staying for a few weeks and really want to explore. He took us to some of the key sights like Abasto - to see the amazing buildings and learn about Carol Gardel, then to the La Plaza de Congreso and the 1930s wooden subway train is like something out of Back to the Future! He speaks several languages (although English was the most useful for me!) and has a remarkable memory for details, dates, facts and figures which brings the buildings and stories to life. All in all an excellent tour. Next time I'm in BA I'll probably do one of his custom tours.
Charming and informative. Jonathan gives a lot of information without overwhelming with facts. Seems very reliable, says I don't know instead of making up stories. Don't miss this tour.

Charming, informative and knows how to be entertaining. We spent a lovely afternoon walking and exploring the sights of BA with 3 other couples from USA and elsewhere. Jonathon guided us onto the buses, subway and walkways of this beautiful city. I would highly recommend him to first timers to BA.

You cannot afford to miss this tour. I got lucky - Jonathan didn't. i was the only one who showed up for my tour. I was pleasantly greeted by a delightful young Brit who has lived here long enough to know the ropes and how to get around, but not so long that he has lost the ability to bring excitement to each turn of the corner and each new monument you spy. If all you learned was how to ride the buses and the subway, that alone would justify the time you spend seeing BA on, this tour. but there is more.....lots more, and its all interesting. Show up for this tour. it's worth it.  Bob - - - Minneapolis, Minnesota

Great Tour.... I wish I would have done this tour a long time ago. Not only was this tour informative, it provided me with the ability to navigate the bus and subway systems. If you want to venture out on your own without taxis, this is the perfect tour for you.

Explore BA in a fun and informative way. This tour was a wonderful highlight of my visit to BA. Jonathan introduced us to areas beyond the guide book and shared first-hand knowledge of his experience in this vibrant city. As someone who loves big cities and public transportation, this tour helped raise my comfort level and encouraged me to explore even more on my own. The tour is officially free, but I was so appreciative of the experience and tipped on the high end. For me, it was more valuable and memorable than the standard city bus tour.

Enjoyable Tour wif Satisfaction. I know about this tours from a friend of mine in Buenos Aires, and also visiting this tripadvisor website. From here, I know Jonathan, the owner of this tour and I've been contacting him about my trip in Buenos Aires. I strongly recommend those who will be coming to BsAs to go for this local tour as from here, you learn a lot, Jonathan is the type of person that will explain in details what you should do and what you should not do to have a better understanding on BsAs. All the information you need in order for you to go to the city alone in the future, so that you won't get lost! So, go for this tour on the 1st day of your arrival!

Ideal Way to See BA. I found this tour on Trip Advisor and had a great time. Jonathan is very knowledgable about BA and really cares about showing his clients a great time. He is very personable, and you feel like you have known him for a very long time. By using the bus and subway, you get a real taste of what city life is like. Take this tour early on, and you'll feel like you have a great sense of the city. If I had been there for a longer period, I would have booked Jonathan for a personal tour of other areas of the city we didn't see. I would highly recommend him, especially if you end up in the basement of the National Bank during a rainstorm. Quite funny! What completed the tour was how nice the other members of the group were, a Belgian woman and an Israeli couple. Fun day.

Great Tour. we really enjoyed this well thought out and informative tour. the guide is brilliant and we learned lots. Do this tour early in your stay and save big money on taxis....we now use buses and the subte like the locals... thanks.

Tour to start your Buenos Ayres exploration. I and my husband took this tour on the first day it was available for us - Monday, November 14. We met with Jonathan at Plaza Italia at 11 am, and our little (4.5-5hours) journey started. The tour was very informative and fun at the same time. Jonathan took us to few neighborhoods by bus (so we learned along the way about tricky bus service in Buenos Aires...) and Subte (Buenos Aires metro) telling us about well known and not so much known historical facts, local legends, etc.. He managed to answer almost all questions our little group was bombarding him with.. We highly recommend this tour to ANYONE who does not mind walking and taking public transportation.

An excellent tour worth recommending to friends visiting Buenos Aires. We joined the tour on Nov 24. Although Jonathan is British rather than Argentinian, he obviously has a passion for Argentina and its capital city. He is knowlegeable on historical sites and the ride on buses and subway (a wooden train built in the 1930's) was fun. Learning how to get about by public transport proved to be extremely useful for us as we explored Buenos Aires on our own in the next few days. Eventually we even managed to get to the Tigre Delta area by train (a one-hour ride from Retiro) and returned for just 2.5 pesos per person!We thoroughly enjoyed the tour of Abasto area where we get to know more about Carlos Gardel, the Tango King. The route has a good mix of cultural and historical sites. We had done another free city tour (by another company) the evening before and it's good that the two trips basically had very few overlapping sites. For us from Hong Kong who do not speak Spanish, Jonathan's English is easy to understand, and through his introduction, we get a feel of how expats see Argentina.Great job, Jonathan, and thanks!Mym and KM Leungfrom Hong Kong

Dont pay for over-priced, commercialised, tours - try this tour instead. Arrived in BA on 6th November on 6th Nov and took the tour on 8th. Met Jonathan in Plaza Italia and was part of a 5 man group. Covered so much in the 4.5 hours but it all flew so quickly. Jonathan manages to show you a blend of the obvious places (Pink House) with the less obvious (Home of Carlos Gardel). He has bags of energy and delivers his facts with genuine interest. My girlfriend is a Portenio and she managed to learn more from Jonathan (About her home city) than she had learned in years of living there!!! He also has time for anyone wanting to ask additional questions - even if unrelated to the tour. Jonathan, sorry I didnt get to to the quiz night but maybe next time!! All the best and thanks ever so much for an excellent insight to BA.

Nice intro to the lovely city. After reading the reviews here I took the tour. The reviews have never disappointed me. Jonathan is a great person who gives you a tour of the city with great enthusiasm and energy. It's a great way to start your visit in Buenos Aires.

This tour is truely different. I usually steer clear of tours but this one is truly different. I had visited Bs As. before and had been back visiting for about 2 months when I took this tour and most of the info on this tour I had not heard before. Jonathan is very knowledgeable and gives information that is interesting and that you would most likely not get on other tours. Plus he is very personable and fun. His information on how to use the bus and actually riding a bus has proved invaluable to me. I have friends coming from the US shortly and will definitely take them on this tour.

Creme de la Creme. Even if you are not a "Tour" person like me...Do this one.. I came to Jonathan through an app on my iPad (not a review) and had no idea there were so many accolades already written about him. I just perused these here before me and they are all absolutely true. Meet him Day 1 if at all possible! He’s full of incredibly useful information but more importantly I think he understands the heart and soul of this city, those historical Argentines who created it along with its current inhabitants. His tour is unique, fascinating and positively entertaining. Not your typical excursion, for sure.You can feel his commitment to “we” who he guides and can tell he is truly happy doing what he does. To me that’s really important as it adds an extra quality to the experience. Don’t miss it.

DO THIS FIRST! A great way to start a trip to BA.. We took Jonathan's tour on advice from a couple who had been to BA before us. They said make it the first thing you do and now we're saying the same thing.Jonathan gave an incredibly interesting, well planned and executed tips only tour, where we took the bus and subway to really get to grips with the city at the beginnign of our trip.A history of the city and it's crazy politics and characters, with interesting and knowledgeable anecdotes, a great sense of humour and a real passion for the city was delivered as we worked our way across BA, with an invaluable lesson in the art of using the amazingly cheap buses and subway system.All the key bits are in here - if you don't visit somewhere on the tour, Jonathan will tell you all about it and without doubt help you plan a fantastic itinerary for your time in BA.We pretty much only followed his recommendations that interested us - we saw an incredible game of football at Boca Juniors (he knows where to get the difficult to come by tickets from), a trip to Recolleta cemetary, various markets, Tigre and the Japanese Gardens.One of the highlights of our time in BA, many thanks Jonathan. 100% recommended.

Do Not Miss This Opportunity!. I had a great tour with Jonathan in October 2011. He's smart, thoughtful, and knows his stuff. I learned so much information and he was great at fielding my questions. Do NOT miss this opportunity to learn Buenos Aires - and the bus system - with this eloquent and fun guide!

Excellent & Very Knowledgeable. We found this tour listed in Tripadvisor & based on the reviews decided to book Jonathan for a 4 hour private tour. We had limited days in BA & wanted to maximize our time. So we booked for the first day we arrived at BA & met Jonathan at our hotel lobby to start the tour.Johnathan was prompt & right on time to start.He had a plan for our tour that he discussed with us & we were happy with what he suggested.We did att the major tourist attractions in town, Recoleta & La Boca, we caught local buses & trains which was lovely to do as I think it give you a more authentic experience of any city you visit.Johnathan was really knowledgeable about BA history & life in BA in general- it gave us a really good understanding of BA, the histor, the people & culture.Johnathan was also very generous with his time- we booked for 4 hours but he spent 4hrs 30 min with us. My husband is a keen photographer & Johnathan was able to adjust the tour pace to suit us- which if we had been on a group tour this would not have been possible.We had a great time, & learned alot about the history & people.A very worthwhile investment of our time & money.If you are considering a tour in BA- I strongly recommend you contact Johnathan.

Everyone will learn something new and fascinating...a refreshing change from the normally dry "historical" approach!. Jonathan not only offers a great tour, full of of fascinating insights about Porteño history and life, but is able to adapt it to the needs of his guests. The meeting point at Plaza Italia is convenient and easy to find. Although it's my 3rd visit to BsAs, Abasto was a new barrio to explore and a refreshing change from the standard Recoleta/Centro route..I learned a lot today and made some great contacts for other activities! Jonathan, thanks for the good company and all the information!

Very Useful and Informative Tour. My spouse and I recently took Jonathon's tour. As it is the off season, we ended up having a private tour. As previous reviewers have mentioned, Jonathon's explanation of how to navigate the BA bus system and subte (subway) are great, as it helped make us more confident to use public transit rather than to continue to use taxis. Jonathon took us to a few great neighborhoods in BA and had a lot to say about the history of each area. His explanation about the history of Argentinian government (including Evita) is really interesting. He is also able to provide current information and public opinion commentary that you won't find in any travel guide books.We would highly recommend Jonathon's tour at any point, but particularly on your first day in BA.

Great Tour - Perfect Overview. For everybody coming to BsAs this is perfect to start the trip. In just 3 hours (the City Tour) you get a really nice overview with a really competent guide. Thanks a lot.

What a great day!!. We really enjoyed our tour today! We had been in the city for over a week and wish we had gone sooner...the how-to on riding the bus was a perfect bonus to a lively and interesting tour of BA. A perfect blend of walking and resting...details that you might not learn from a more formal tour...Jonathon has perfect English (because he is from England after all) and a great command of Spanish...he's been here long enough to know all of the ins ands outs...A must do while you are here!

A BA must do!! Great tour- feel like a local and get to know the city!!!. Jonathan was a brilliant guide. You can feel he loves the city and really makes sure you see it like a local - using the buses (not as easy to do unaided) and subte. He was brilliant at little tips on where to buy certain goods and helped with queries unconnected with the tour. If visiting do this tour Day 1 if you can and it will make your BA experience for the rest of your stay 100% better.

Excellent tour - passionate guide!. Jonathon really loves Buenos Aires and his passion shines through in his tour. We got to take the bus and subway like a local and see all the sights at a relaxed pace.Highly recommended especially if you've just arrived in BA!

Great Tour with a Knowledgeable Guide. I found Jonathan's tour on Tripadvisor before our trip and the only thing I wish I'd done differently is to follow other's advice and take this tour on day 1. Jonathan starts the tour by explaining the map, bus routes, subway, how to use these and what to say to buy tickets. If you are planning to explore the city on your own without being lost this information is vital.On the day of our tour, we were the only two people to show up so Jonathan ended up giving us a private tour which we thoroughly enjoyed. Not only it was extremely informative, but also fun and entertaining, took us to many places around town we wouldn't have otherwise visited, allowed us plenty of time to take pictures and have a coffee, answered every question we could come up with and even had a healthy doze of British humor. This is one excursion you don't want to miss. To be honest the word "free" first attracted my attention to this tour. I figured if the guide is willing to work for tips, he will make an extra effort to earn them, as opposed to pre-paid excursions. I felt that no matter how much money I paid at the end of our accidentally-private tour, Jonathan's effort was still greater, and this review is just an extra token of our appreciation for the tour and the view of Buenos Aires it gave us. Thanks.

A great introduction to Buenos Aires. Both my husband and I had been to Buenos Aires before and didn't think we needed a tour. However, when we heard rave reviews from several friends about Jonathan's tours, we figured a little refresher might help us enjoy our weekend. We were right.Jonathan is very knowledgeable in an interesting, "insider info" kind of way rather than just sticking to dry facts. The route the tour takes gives a good general overview of some of the main neighborhoods and sites in the city, and if you're planning to stay a while and use the bus system, he gives a great explanation of how to do just that. If you're new to Buenos Aires or just haven't been for a while, check out this tour on Day 1 to get the most out of your trip.

Excellent paid tour with Jonathan - I'm sure you'll enjoy the free tour. We booked Jonathan for one of his paid tours because the timing for the free tour didn't work with our plans.We were very satisfied. We got to see the key highlights of the city, got to see how the buses and subway operated, and also enjoyed Jonathan's expert commentary. He could share a knowledgeable expat's insights into Argentine culture, history and politics. (Ask him for his two-word phrase to describe Argentina and Buenos Aires.)

Great way to see the real city.. My fiancé and I enjoyed the tour a lot. We walked, took colectivos (public bus) and subte (subway) and learned a lot about Buenos Aires and Argentine culture and habits. Jonathan is a very nice guy and knows a lot (wow!! Lots of ´a lot´!! hehe) about his new home. He does a pretty good job and the group recognizes it, in the end, tipping. We gave him 100 pesos, for two people.If you´re affraid of trying local public transport in a foreign place, don´t miss this chance to learn how to move around Buenos Aires.

One of the best tours in Buenos Aires. Jonathan's tour was absolutely brilliant - full of passion, wit and history told in an engaging way. One of the hardest things to do as a new tourist in a city is to figure out the transport system - Jonathan de-mystified the local bus system so that we were able to use it frequently thereafter - meaning you are living the way the locals do and saving some pennies by not using taxis all the time. He takes you to a number of the famous and not-so-famous parts of BA - always with great stories and knowledge to impart. I would encourage anyone to do this tour, particularly early in your trip, as you will be much the wiser after it!

A really great day. My daughter and I took this tour our first day in BA and it was great. Jonathan had so much information and was such a pleasure to spend to the day with. We got a great sense of the city, learned a lot about the history of BA, and had fun.

Do this your first day in Buenos Aires. An absolutely fantastic introduction to the city and the country. You'll use mass transit (bus/subway), learn how it works so you can navigate/travel the city, visit slightly off the beaten path tourist destinations and best of all you'll spend time with a fellow who clearly loves his adopted city. And, frankly, in some ways, I think an expat can provide more nuanced information/explanation of a place than a local tour company. I know that sounds a little off but really...an expat can relate much better to a tourist's common questions/concerns/misunderstandings than a local because he probably struggled with the same issues. I did two free tours while in the city and the level of information/insight that I received from Jonathan far exceeded that from the other tour. He is a friendly, smart, and interesting fellow who's a fantastic travel resource. This was an all-around great experience.

Great introduction to BA. We would definitely recommend a tour of the city with Jonathan. Our tour took place a couple of days after arriving in BA - We suggest doing this on your first day! He appears to be very passionate about a city which is not his home town. He has a practical hands on approach and a tremendous sense of humor. Thanks Jonathan. Pierre and Dean

No better way to spend 3.5 hours in BA!. As a couple other reviewers have said, this tour should be top of your list on your first day in town. Excellent orientation to transit. Tremendous depth of historical information and tons of fun anecdotes. Jonathan immediately puts you at ease and makes everything about the tour interesting. Leaves you wanting more!

I learned so much on Jonathan's tour. While I was in Buenos Aires I went on 3 different tours. I must say I learned the most about BA history, architecture, politics, art, the people...everything on Jonathan's tour. He is very knowledgeable, interesting and easy going. I learned how to take the bus and the subte which was very helpful. He also takes you to area in BA that are over looked by the major tour groups. I highly recommend this tour.

Better Than Any BA Guidebook Or Bus Tour!. I feel like I discovered the real Buenos Aires! This walking tour has the best guide I've ever encountered, Jonathan Evans. He answered every question (appropriately he's also the host of the Monday night Pub Quiz at Le Cigale -it's in English, btw and it rocks!) and he even deciphered the transit systems (we rode the bus and train like locals!)With his insight, I had so much more reverence for the Mothers of the Disappeared as they marched around the Plaza de Mayo. And how else would I have known the real story behind Madonna being filmed on the balcony of the Casa Rosada for EVITA?If you're going, try to take this tour during the start of your stay so you can make the most of it -we relied on his recommendations (museums, restaurants, shopping) for the rest of our trip! Amazingly, this tour is free, Jonathan does it for tips, but how could you NOT tip after getting so much inside information? Gracias, Jonathan! Abrazo grande!

Do this the first day!. I went on Day 4 of my trip but wish I had gone Day 1. Jonathan deciphers the very complicated bus system and gives a great general overview of the city. We went back to Plaza de Mayo and I learned so much about what I had seen the previous days but had no clue to their significance.It's a good introduction to the city and a must-do for anyone in Buenos Aires.

The best way to see Buenos Aires - as the natives experience it every day. Jonathan's tour was incredibly enjoyable because it went off the beaten path usually covered by generic "touristy" tours, and covered interesting nooks and crannies that reveal the city's true soul and essence. The "back story" about Buenos Aires that I learned from him really helped me to understand the place in a way that conventional tours just can't. I also really enjoyed learning how to use public transport (bus, subway), very practical for the rest of the trip but also a lot of fun, not sure I would've ventured into that territory on my own. Highly recommended!

Great Tour! Very knowledgeable!. We had a great time with Jonathan today. I highly recommend his free walking tour. His easy going manner and vast knowledge made the tour interesting for all of us. I've been on so many awful tours in my life and Jonathan receives top marks. Do not hesitate to take his tour and experience "la verdad" Buenos Aires.

great intro to getting around BA. We took other free walking tours and a bike tour in addition to this tour and I'd recommend all of them, but on this tour we learned how to use the buses which made all the difference in our stay in Buenos Aires. Jonathan, our guide, explained how to use the GuiaT (the bus riders' bible) to get from any spot in the city to another, as well as how and where to get the buses. We also used the subway which is easy, inexpensive (about .25 a ride), and fast. Jonathan took us to El Abasto (see the only kosher McDonalds outside of Israel), and to the Carlos Gardel house and museum which weren't on any of the other tours. The tour lasted about 3 hours including time for a quick lunch. The tour is free but I think most of us tipped Jonathan about 50 pesos.

Great Guide & Walking Tour...Highly Recommended. Jonathan was fantastic. I brought a group of 12 people and he kept everyone's attention. He knew all the highlights & in and outs of the city and. Jonathan gave us great tips on places to eat and shopping, as well. The cost is free, but you are encouraged to tip. Try to do this the first part of your trip and you will have a great idea of what else you want to do in Buenos Aires.

Definitely do this if you are in BA for more than a couple of days. Jonathan is a great guide, with an excellent knowledge of the city and its history. He is relaxed and friendly and provided a really easy introduction to BA. We would definitely recommend taking his walking tour soon after arriving in BA, as he shows you practical things like how to take the local buses (confusing) and subte (easy). He also takes you through more 'local' type neighbourhoods that you may well not visit otherwise. The tour ends in Plaza de Mayo, so you can head off and explore further after it ends. Jonathan can give all sorts of practical advice regarding where to go, places to eat etc. A very worthwhile day, far better than stumbling around with a guide book if you're newly arrived. Tip at the end whatever you wish.

If you like to see where the locals go, this walking tour is for you. I don't like big city "group" tours and I don't like to sit on a bus. I found this "free" walking tour through google. I'm never sure if something for "free" is going to be good but I can highly recommend this tour. Jonathan is a wealth of knowledge for an outsider. The tour started in Plaza Italia in the Palermo section of Buenos Aires. The tour includes everything Jonathan advertises, taking the buses (colectivos), the subte (the subway) and lots of walking in the "non" traditional sections of Buenos Aires. This is a big city so don't think you are going to see everything in a few days. It was lots of fun and I learned a lot from Jonathan.

Excellent "free" walking tour of Buenos Aires.... My wife and I booked a "free" walking tour after Googling the site at www.buenosaireslocaltours.com The tours run daily (except Sunday) at 11am from Plaza Italia in Palermo. We had an truly excellent day. Our guide, Jonathan, is a British ex-pat with a deep knowledge of the city and its history. He relies on voluntary donations at the end of his 3-3 1/2 hour tour and there is no hard sell. He's a truly nice guy and loves what he's doing. For the record, we gave him 100 pesos each (US$25/person) as that is what we had been charged the previous day by another tour company. It was worth every penny and then some.Jonathan differentiates himself in two ways: first, he takes you to interesting places ignored by the guide books and bigger companies and, second, he includes two trips on the collectivos (local buses) and one trip on the Subte (subway). That introduction to, and explanation of, the B.A. transit system is, by itself, worth the tour. Just show up; you won't be disappointed.

Wonderful day. Go, you wont regret!. Check Jonathan`s web site, gather your peso coins and go! Bring a bottle of water and your sunglasses, you'll love it! Great way to have a taste of Buenos Aires. The mix bus-walk-subte is great with one perfectly timed break! Jonathan went beyond all expectations and even did the tour in the group`s native language french, instead of the usual english. Don't think twice and go!

Very nice tour. We booked a private tour with Jonathan.The day before we had some contact about our special interests, so he could provide a customized tour. He brought his impressive collection of coins, so we were able to take the public buses.He came to pick us up in the apartment, we went to Boca, Ricoletta and ended the tour in Palermo. It was entertaining and informative, maybe he should tell a little bit more about history.After the tour he provided us with information about other attractions in the city, which was nice.Thanks Jonathan

Great Tour. This tour was a good overview of Buenos Aires. A good combination of walking and riding the bus to get to see a lot of the city. Since the tour guide is a native English speaker, it is easy to undestand him. He knows a lot about the city and its history. It was also great to learn how to use the bus guide (which is more complex than you might expect). We throughly enjoyed the tour.
Wonderful. Jonathan was very knowledgable about the area and was very nice! Thank you very much for all! Even the bus ride WAS fun!

Excellent walking/bus tour - a brilliant start to our holiday!. We visited in December 2010 and had a great time on the tour. Jonathan really looked after us and is a top notch guide. Really made a difference being shown round by someone who lives here - his training on how to use the bus system was excellent and helped us find our way around like locals for the rest of the trip! Really enjoyed the visit to Abasto - amazing. Would completely recommend this tour. Five stars.

Excellent. Better than paid ones. . We did the morning and afternoon tours and they were both great. Ivan and Javier are fantastic guides, with information not only of the city, but also of Argentinian history. Highly Recommended!!

Fab. We did the morning walking tour the day we arrived in Buenos Aires in Recoleta and learnt so much about the city and felt like we understood the history and the architecture. Our guide answered all our questions and was really enthusiastic. Our hostel had a walking tour for 200 pesos but this was much much better (we took the hostel one too) and our guide made clear he worked only for his tips but that there was no pressure in how much to give. We liked it so much we also did the afternoon city centre tour. Again, our guide Martin was great, explained his view on all the economics and current political problems of Argentina which clicked a lot with our experiences here so far and was happy to answer any questions.Use this company!

Recoleta and Congresso tours. The tours were amazing! Both our tour guides, Vicky and Jemina, were very knowledgeable and easy to talk to! They Gave a great history of their city, you could feel their passion and love for their city! I would definitely recommend this tour. It's also great to go on the tour at the beginning of your stay so you can have a better understanding of the great city.

Informative and friendly - highly recommended . Our tour guide Jimena was extremely friendly and very knowledgeable about the city. Starting at the Congress Plaza and ending at the Obelisk, the tour is a good length, beginning at about 11am and finishing around 2pm. It was a great way to see the sights and the guide really brought the city and the country's chequered history to life throughout. Highly recommend as an economical way to spend a half day here.

Great Free walking tour. This concept started in Europe about a decade ago and has been a highlight of most of our vacations since. The Buenos Aires free walking tour is no exception. We took the tour starting from Teatro Colon on a beautiful afternoon, hot despite it being the middle of winter there. The group splits up into two with two guides, one spanish and one english. The english group was very large with over 25 people but the guides speak with microphones so it is easy to follow. Highly recommended for your visit to BA.

Best free walking tour of BA. We stayed in BA for over a week and tried 3 free walking tours and we found this was the best one. We did the afternoon tour, it was a large group and it was raining but it was well organised and informative. It gave a good overview of BA combining the history and architecture. The highlight was finishing at the Plaza de Mayo with changing of the guards. Highly recommend.

Best way to see the city!. The free walking tours was one of the highlights of Buenos Aires for me. As I was in B.A for a week I was lucky enough to have the time to do both the morning and afternoon tours with a very passionate local guide (her name began with H but my Spanish is non existent so can't remember sorry) but she was excellent, having lived in Argentina her whole life her knowledge was great. Both tours complement each other and showcase different parts of the city, so if you have time to do both it is well worth it. Just look out for the green shirts and although this tour is free, be sure to bring cash to tip as they will really enhance your time and experience of the city!

A must!. We thoroughly enjoyed the walking tour with our guide Franco - he was very knowledgable about the places he took us to see ending in Recoleta where we were free to explore the cemetery. He entertained us throughout with his songs on his guitar. Really recommend!

Well-worth it!. My daughters and I chose the morning tour, meeting at the Plaza del Congreso at the appointed time and joined the tour as it was beginning. The tour guide was energetic and spoke both English and Spanish well, addressing the numerous cultures represented in the tour group. We learned a lot about Argentina's history and it "connected the dots" for the rest of our stay. Well done!!
Best way to see the city. We did the morning tour which was fantastic. The guide was enthusiastic and I learned a lot about the city...and its free!

Great way of seeing the city. This is a great way of seeing the city and taking in the sights. I have been in Bueno Aires on Buisness a few times and each visit I always try and take one of these tours.

Free walking tour. The walking tour was the highlight of our time in Buenos Aires - the guide spoke good English, had lots of interesting information & stories to tell us, took us to a range of local places of interest, responded to questions well & looked after us....his enthusiasm was infectious and we had FUN!
English friendly. The best way to see and learn about the history, culture and architecture of Buenos Aires. The guides are young, passionate and informative.

Great, informative walks. We did both the morning walking tour with Franco and the afternoon one with Juan Cruz. Both of these guides were outstanding. They were passionate about the city, informative about the history and fun to tour with. Franco even brought his guitar and entertained us with some cute songs. I would highly recommend these walks and the guides.

Solid walk around the city with good information. Knowledgeable guide.. 2.5 hours of walking and learning about the city. Good for pictures and getting a history lesson of the city. Passionate and knowledgeable guide makes it enjoyable. Great for tourists.

Great way to get to know this amazing city!. We've been to both tours. Morning tour was with Martin and afternoon one with Juan Cruz (not in the same day). Both guides are amazing, know a lot about the city, and know how to tell the stories in both funny and informative way. Each tour lasts approx. 3hours, with a 15min coffee break. We are very happy with the level of information we got, and feel like we really know the city know, so would recommend it to everyone!

Great introduction to a city. We have the taken "Free Walking Tour" in Europe as well as in Rio and now here in Buenos Aires. It is a great way to get off on a fast start to get some good historical as well as current information. We took the tour yesterday which marked the 40th anniversary of the start of a seven year dictatorship and the city was full of peaceful demonstrations. It was very interesting and the explanations of Gaston our guide were very helpful. We took both the morning and the late afternoon tour and both were equally enjoyable. Another great feature is the meeting of all the other participants in the group.Highly recommendable.

Great, good and friendly tour. The tour was really good and informative. You get in 2 hours a lot of great and interesting informations about the big city buenos aires. Vicky speaks good and clear english and she is really funny! Defiantly recommended!!! Thanks

OK.. Took the free walking tour as I have taken it in few other countries. We were a small group of 6. our guide was medical student and it was his 1st tour. So he was nervous and was not a pro. but considering it was his 1st and it was a tip based tour, should say, we had fun. Think he would pick up and become better as he does more tours. Overall covered few of the main places. Was a good 4.5 hrs walk.

Excellent way to get your bearings.. Would always recommend this as an introduction to the city as it gives background information and saves you carting a guide book around. Its amazing how quickly you can find your way around after this.

Very informative . This 3 hours walking tour through BA is good and super informative. I would recommend during it the beginning of your stay to get a better understanding of BA and Argentina. The tour is more about the history of the country and city than the actually sights you walk by. For sure worth joining, especially because it is free!

Stace was brilliant.. Humorous, informative 2.5 hr tour. Stace managed to bring the city alive. You must do it. Compared with the hop on hop off bus tour which was very mediocre- this was great.
Thanks Stace, loved it.

Good Overview And Lots Of Tips. Chris , our guide had a great knowledge of the sites and history and put events in context. He also provided some great tips on restaurants, things to do in the city, where to find different types of tango at reasonable prices. (How to avoid some tourist traps.)I would recommend to use him the first thing you do in the city.

A must do in BA!. We did both the 1030 and 1500 tours and found both a fantastic way to see the city of BA and learn a lot about the city's last and present. The tours are taken at a good pace to get around a lot of stops in a few hours but you never feel rushed and the guides always wait for people to gather before starting their informative speeches. Martin and Mariano were incredibly knowledgeable, always happy to answer questions and lively speakers. These tours are a must for anyone new to BA!

Great way to see city if you are willing to walk a lot.. I would recommend a hop-on hop-off bus or guided city tour first then walk to through the attractions you like best. There is much to see so chose how much walking you are willing to do.

Walking tour . Fantastic. Seriously. Our guide Chris hails from Boston and I was initially sceptical he would have the knowledge to keep me informed and entertained regarding all things Buenos Aires but he didn't disappoint. His familiarity with the buildings, places of interest and history was exceptional. And he has such a lovely manner and personality. We were certainly lucky in that there was only the two of us AND we got to experience the passion of BA by way of a particularly large protest rally that seemed more celebration than demonstration. This is the first walking tour I have ever been on and I would highly recommend it to visitors to this fine city. Chris pointed us in the direction of a great little eatery with the best empanadas as we parted company. Well worth the tip we gave Chris.

Great way to see and learn a lot about Buenos Aires. We took two different walking tours while in Buenos Aires, and both were very informative and enjoyable. You learn a lot about a city this way and see parts of the city you might no otherwise. They aren't too strenuous or crowded, and they made sure to include a stop for a drink or rest rooms. The guides were good and spoke loud enough for everyone to hear, and their English was very good. We'd highly recommend these tours to anyone.
