Well worth the time. Chris was very thorough with information on all sites visited during the tour. History of places, events and people past and present enlightening and informative. Would recommend tour to all.
To be recommended. We had a three hour long walking tour in BA. Our guide John was really knowledgable with a nice sense of humor. We enjoyed it a lot.

All the reviews are true!. We read reviews from other people and agree with them all. I texted them the night before and got a quick response to join them the next AM by the Obelisco, which is easy to find. Our guide was from the US but had a wide and varied knowledge of BA and filled the 2 hour walk with lots of interesting info of people, places and history.

Good introduction to Buenos Aires!. Sixteen of us from a cruise ship dad a tour with our guide Chris. Chris has been in Buenos Aires for six months, a transplant from Boston where he worked in public relations for the state of Massachusetts.The tour was quite informative and we covered a good part of the central city including the Obelisk, the opera house, the main synagogue, the supreme court, the capitol, the electronics district, jewelry district, luggage district, several churches, landmark cafés, Calle Florida, and ending at the square at the end of Avenue Cinco de mayo. We found the pace a bit challenging towards the end as distances between stops grew. We felt like we were holding back some of the others. Also, crossing Av 4th of July the walking sign was misread and a taxi was very mad at us. For future improvement try to determine the pace the group can maintain.

Great way to see a bit of Buenos Aires. Our guide, Chris, gave us a great tour and also provided a great recommendation for lunch. Unfortunately, I cannot remember the name of the restaurant.Lots of walking and it was a good introduction to the city.
Loved Buenos Aires. I had the free walking tour with Jeanette, she is very nice, kind and lovelyVery interesting way to discover Buenos AiresI recommend this tour !!!

It is really worth the tip you give in the end. I discovered this kind of free guided tours in Europe and by chance I came across this in Buenos Aires. I did both tours in the morning and in the afternoon. The guides are really well prepared, even though sometimes they tell too much about specific topics and it is really easy to lose the overall sense of the story. However, these tours are really recommendable!

Thanks for being open on Jan. 2!. We've come to count on free walking tours in cities and this was a good one in spite of the fact that it was VERY crowded--probably over 50 of us. I think it was due to the fact that it was the day after new years and a Saturday and the other free tour in town was not operating that day. In any case, it was a good tour of city highlights, ending at the cemetery. Our guide was great and handled the crowd well.

Interesting but a bit crowded. The guide was informative and tried his best to engage the participants with words and music. But with over 50 participants it was a bit of a challenge . Apparently the organisers are aware of the issue but have not addressed it yet .
best ever. It is one of the best tour we have ever had. Guide was excellent. He explained everything very well. We learned a lot about the history and Eva Peron. Thank you, thank you, thank you.

Perfect start to the city. We attended the free walking tour mid-January - the group was large, probably 30+ people but the guide wore a microphone so everyone could hear. It was HOT but he did his best to keep spirits up and find shade while he spoke. Great way to understand the background of the city and monuments. The tours are technically free but patrons are encouraged to tip - this is how the guides earn a living and I was more than happy to tip for the 3.5 hours of work he put in. Highly recommend!

The guide opose to show a spot. The guide was more a politic teatcher than a guide. At the end said that Evita was irrelevant and visiting her grave was boring, oposing himself to show where was the place(what clearly was not since it's was one of most visited spots).
Great tour. Our guide Chris was excellent and provided loads of information. We got to see a large area of downtown and covered a lot of ground in 2 1/2 hours. Recommended.

Brilliant walking tour . Our guide Franco was great. We did the afternoon tour which covers congreso then avenida de mayo up to the Plaza de Mayo. Very informative & the perfect length of time for a tour

Brilliant way to see the city. This was the first walking tour I did and it was really engaging. Our tour guide was helpful and knowledgable of the area. I learnt alot about the history of Buenos Aires. I recommend this tour to anyone who wants to see the city.
Brilliant and I could hear him. We love free walking tours. And B A was great . Informative, just the right pace and we could hear him because he had a small microphone.

As Expected. We´ve done free walking tours in other cities around the globe which have been better executed. Our guide for the morning tour spoke English well, was cordial and occasionally funny and gave plenty of description. In the end, I didn´t learn much more than I could have reading about the city and the host didn´t have me rolling over laughing like in some other cities. It was just average. The stop for medialunas was a bit too long.If you want to stay in your comfort zone and be introduced to the city, or if you haven´t done much international travel, this is a good way to dip your toes in the pool.

Great way to orient yourself to the city. I did both of the free walking tours while in BA for a week. Both tours were really informative and a great way to see the city and meet other travelers. The tours operate rain or shine, so bring an umbrella (we got caught in the rain during the Recoleta tour!), water, and sunscreen.

Great Deal. We took the English speaking morning tour, easily found in the plaza next to the teatro colon. Our tour lasted approx 4 hours with a brief stop in the middle for a snack. The group was large, but our guide used a microphone so he was easy to hear. We leaned much about BA history and visited sections we wouldn't find on our own. It ended at the Recoleta cemetery. We planned to continue with the afternoon tour, but too tired. Don't try to take both tours in the same day.

BA free walking tour. We had Chris a young man from Boston. An excellent performance by any standard.Very enjoyable and informative. There were 5 experienced travellers in our party, and overall about 15 people.We were asked to decide our own contribution at the end, no pressure.
Informative and thorough . Great way to get to know BA and notice things you wouldn't on your own. We had Chris and he led a great tour. glad We did it.

Great tour!. I really enjoyed going on the afternoon political tour with our guide Martin. He was very knowledgeable and particularly liked getting his point of view on the different spots we went to. I wanted to go to the morning tour due to my experience on this tour however I couldn't manage to get there because of the rain which I was really disappointed.

Great way to learn about Buenos Aires and Argentinian History. We took the morning tour (San Nicolas/Recoleta) with Dolores (Lolly) and afternoon tour (Congreso Nacional/Plaza Del Mayo) with Martin. We learned so much about Buenos Aires and Argentinian history from our knowledgeable and entertaining guides. The concept is the tour is free; you pay at the end what you thought it was worth. We (a couple) paid 300 pesos for each which we thought was reasonable given the size of the crowd on the tours we took. The best thing about the tours is the contextual commentary - you learn about the character of the portenos (Buenos Aires citizens) and Argentina as a whole.

Great intro to Buenos Aires. This tour was great to get our bearings whilst being introduced to the sights and sounds of this architecturally diverse city. Chris was out tour guide who was excellent, we'll be looking to organise a paid tour from these guys in the coming days.

Can't beat the concept-worth a try. We took both tours. The after noon tour with Martin was a tour through the history and sociology of Buenos Aires. Martin was so steeped in knowledge about the history and politics it was almost like a university lecture. I liked the fact that he kept on time and finished early. Our second tour Recoleta was good but not as the first. Our guide was friendly and knowledgeable but it was also hot with a large group and slo moving. We finished 30 minutes late and with hungry boys that was difficult. What I like about these tours (this is my third one all over the world) is they are not really free but you are not paying for a bad experience. If you don't like the tour or the guide you leave and pay nothing. If you have a great experience you pay more. I think this is a great movement for budget travelers and my wife was always bugging me to stop listening to other tour guides-so this is perfect. That said we did hire a private tour guide in istanbul and have one tomorrow and believe those are also worth the money because they take you to places that most tourists wont visit.

Very informative. We went on both the morning tour of Recoleta and the afternoon tour in the city centre. Both tours were very interesting and definitely worth going to. Our morning tour was with Franco, who played some lovely traditional songs on his guitar at a few stops. This tour included some really pretty areas and beautiful buildings. The afternoon tour was with Martin, who is extremely knowledgable and told us all about the politics and history of the city/country. We found it really interesting. Would recommend both!

Great walking tour w/ martin!. Have to say one of the best walking tours ive done. Martin wasserman did a great job. Highly recommended. Great tour from the teatre colon to recoleta where we were told about evita's death and the tour her body had after death. :-)

Great overview of the City. We enjoyed the 3 hour tour. The guide was very nice and had great stories along the way. It was very informative and I loved the "little known facts" that I would not have gotten on a bigger tour. The location of meeting folks was great. We had 3 couples and another couple joined us along the way. The guide pointed out very interesting facts at each location. She was a bit FAST walker.We did tip her at the end and didn't feel high pressure.Thank you.

It is really free tour and great guide. l took this free walking tour and l booked from my hostel which name is hostel America deal sur hostel,tour starting 11.15 am and meeting point is pick you up from hostel and it's really great tour l will highly recommend everybody..don't Waite go book your free walking tour ,it's best tour
Very informative. We did a Sunday morning walk with Loli. We were quite a large group but she kept us all moving along and her commentary was interesting and entertaining. Her English was very good.

Great Way to get around BA. The tour was a great way to get around the city and get your bearings. Our tour guide was great and informative, and even played some songs on his guitar along the way! The city is noisy and he was a bit hard to hear at times. It is a lot of walking so wear comfortable shoes! I recommend going early in the trip so you can go back to any neighborhoods you want to spend more time in. Definitely worth the time.

Fantastic tours!. We went to both the morning and the afternoon tour. Both were equally good. For our morning tour we had Martin and for the afternoon tour our guide was Dolores/Lori/The girl who speaks too much. Both were excellent, can't recommend these tours enough.

Explore Buenos Aires with Martin!. We generally try to participate free walking tours in big cities which help us to explore city and its history, we definetily recomend this as well.. Thanks a lot Martin for excellent explanations and being prepared for the rain with many raincoats on this sunny day.

Un Buen Paseo!. This was an awesome tour! I did both sessions and it was a great way to learn about the city. Fernando did a great job and I think I now know more about the city than most Portenos! I found the content of the tour starting at the National Congress more interesting as it focused more on history and politics but they complimented each other well.

Great tour. This waking your with Victoria was fantastic. Did the morning I've starting near the national congress and walked av. de mayo, to pink house and up to the obelisk via Florida street Thanks a lot. Highly recommended. Lindsay

A Must Do in Buenos Aires. We stayed for about a month in Argentina and was wowed all the way and this walking tour put lots of thins into perpespective and helped to shape the next few days visits. Vicky, the tour guide, was hilarious and very informative. She is a local, born and raised in BA. The tour started at Constituion House and finished at the Rosa de Casa. A perfect route to learn about the history and the struggles of the people. Vicky also pointed out some must sees that the guide books don't refer to and best times of the day or week to see or do things. There was also a toilet and coffee stop enroute. All in all an excellent 2 hours spent that I would happily do again and again.

Great tour. Very informative.. . Did both morning and afternoon tours on separate days. Tour guide Martin was brilliant with better English than myself. Very smart man and gave a huge amount of information. Would advise going at start of your trip as you will get lots of good tips. Sorry it took so long for me to post review. Thanks..

Lots of walking but totally worth it. We went on the 3pm tour and Delores was our guide. She was awesome. Funny and so informative. Learned a lot about the city and history. I later went on a paid tour through my company and it was not nearly as informative. Highly recommend it and if you are lucky enough to get Delores (Lori), it will be a great tour.

BA free walking tour. Awesome! The guide was super informative & didn't dwell on anything for too long, so everything stayed pretty interesting the entire time (speaking from someone who doesnt usually like tours also), but it was deff worth it, especially if you know nothing about BA - it is a great way to get a general overview of the history and the current state of Argentina!
Good intro. I went on the Orange walking tour. Great way to learn about BA. Our guide was pretty good. It went for close to 4 hrs in the end and was perhaps a bit too long but worthwhile.
3pm Avenida de Mayo tour. Absolutely amazing tour with Martin, also learned a lot about the history, politics and economy of Argentina! Highly recommended!

My Tour Of La Recoleta Cemetery. I had a wonderful 2 hour walking tour of La Recoleta Cemetery on a rainy, cloudy day, but that atmosphere added to the ambiance. It is an amazing cemetery, not like any other I've ever seen. My tour guide, Soledad, was bilingual, speaking excellent English. She brought to life many interesting stories of the people and the grave sites that I would not have known if I had walked it alone. She also gave a lot of the history of Buenos Aires as we walked the cemetery. The creativity of grave sites was amazing. I think this was the best way to get the most out of a visit to La Recoleta Cemetery.

Great tours, highly recommend. We did the 3pm walking tour with lolly ( who was amazing!) And it was fantastic. Very informative and you got to see and learn so much. Lolly was really fun and told some truly terrible jokes ☺ and she really new what she was talking about. We loved this tour so much that we joined the 10.30am tour the next day. And even tho it was raining lolly (again) made it so fun. Highly recommended
Good way to learn about hidden histories. This is a great activity to show you things you would not otherwise notice or know about. Just be ready to be on your feet for 3 hours!

great way to learn about the city. the 3pm freewalking tour was excellent. even though it was raining the tour went ahead and our guide made it as enjoyable as possible given the conditions. his local knowledge was so interesting plus hearing his perspective on all that Buenos Aires has been through was an extra bonus. You absolutly must do this tour to get the most out of being here.
Puppet Show. A great street artist in Buenos Aires - an individual with creativity and talent. His show is worth definitely the stop.

Well worth a visit... Fernando is an excellent guide. Full of personality. Enjoy three hours with him – I`m sad that I only did two and my tour group had to leave to catch the tacky street market in San Telmo!

A great start to Bienos Aries!. Loved the morning tour! Meet up at 10:15 next to the "Teatro Colon" look for the guys in bright orange jackets! Then your set to explore the city on foot! Martin leads u through the great surrounding areas in Roceleta ending up at the famous Recoleta cemetery!Highly recommend this tour especially on your first or second day here in Buenos Aries.They take a break at a nice coffe shop where you can grab a bite to eat too if you missed breakfast! A good pace and very informative. Walking tours aren't just about the sites you learn so much more, a bit of politics, history, how things generally work, do & dont's, what's polite here in this culture etc.......We did the afternoon tour as well the next day, which was good, though it is noisy with traffic and the guide doesn't pick the best places to stop & talk as the traffic is buzzing by loudly. The talks are a bit long when your trying to hear, better if she had a microphone & cut down on the info a bit. But definitely worth while.

Informative and interesting tours. We had Martin for the morning tour- who was excellent! And Fernando for the evening tour - who was also good. The tour lasted three hours and was full of interesting history, as well current social, political and economic commentary which shed an interesting light on Argentinian society from a local's point of view. Would definitely recommend

Amazing tours. I did both tours, the morning and afternoon one. Absolutely recommendable in order to get a feeling of the city. Tour guides are very helpful and nice and able to give you some inside information about the city. Martin, the morning tour guy, was great in combining very useful information about the city and Argentinian history with tips on where to go and what to do in a very funny and amusing way. It is advisable to ask them as many questions about pretty much everything: Bars, Clubs, Restaurants, Tango even travel. Those guys really know everything! Congrats!
Morning walking tour. Our tour guide was Martin. He did a great job. Very friendly and explained everything very well. Very informational and a great sense of humor.
Well worthwhile. Did the morning tour with Dolores (Lolly) and the afternoon tour (different days) with Fernando. Both excellent. Definitely worth doing both.

Great way to see the city. Did both of these tours - they do one in the afternoon and one in the morning concentrating on different parts of the city. The afternoon one lasted about 3 hours and the morning one about 4 or so hours with a stop for coffee. Very very knowledgeable guides - Martin and Fernando, spoke perfect English and loved their city so very passionate and know lots of details. It's tip based so you leave what you feel ok with but its worth a decent tip, you probably pay a lot more for the mass produced city bus tour. Also gets you out and about and a bit of exercise to walk off the holiday excess food!
Excellent tour. Very informative and the guides are happy to offer extra information to make the stay in BA easier, especially the blue rate. We took both tours, we especially liked the cemetery.
The Best! . I took both tours and loved each of them. Martin & Fernando were very impressive with their knowledge and their love for the city was infectious!

The best value for your money in Buenos Aires!!. The first one was from Teatro Colon to Recoleta Cemetary and the second from Congress to the Presidential palace (Casa Rosada). Both lasted about 3 hours and were led by very knowledgable guides. Both guides spoke good English and had an intimate knowledge of the history and customs of their city. We learned a lot - they were very educational and interesting. Both mentioned that they worked for tips only, but did not talk about it much or make a big deal out of it. They received their tips at the end and made good money because they did a good job not because we felt pressured. A very good way to get to know the city!! Way better than those silly busses.

Extremely informative. Great way to see the city. We did both the morning and afternoon walking tours and luckily had Martin both times. The tours are a great way to see the city, picking out all the highlights that this interesting place has to offer. Martin gives a great insight (in excellent English!) in to the historic/economic/political aspects of the city and country. Would recommend these tours to anyone
You get an insight into what makes BA and Argentina tick. Only had time for the morning tour. Lori? our guide was open and knowledgeable. Really good stuff and appreciated. Thank you.
Awesome tours. The walking tours are such a great way to get to know the city and a bit about the culture, people and history.Our guide Martin was amazing. So passionate and honest. Well worth doing!
Interesting. Really nice walking tour. A lot of information in both tours (morning and afternoon). U gonna visit a lot of places and receive a lot of information in the 3 - 4 hours of the tour.

Funny and engaging walking tour. I went on both the 10:30 and 3pm walking tour. Two different guides (Fernando and Mariano) but both were hilarious, helpful and good story-tellers. On both walks, you take a break at the half-way point (for coffee and a bathroom). We were able to cover a lot of the city during these walks, and it gave a lot of ideas of where to explore further afterwards.Please remember that these wonderful guides work for tips! I was so sad to see some people walk away without remembering to tip the guide. When I return to Buenos Aires next, I will do these tours again, without question!

Fernando was great Tour Guide !. We took the 10:30 AM tour - loved it so much we came back two days later for the 3PM walk. There was some overlap but lots of new sites and information on our secon d tour. Great way to learn about Argentina and Buenos Aires. Fernando made the tour both fun and informative. Thanks.

Great initiative! . My girlfriend and I took the magnificent 3pm walking tour hosted by Fernando. I could feel he was very enthusiastic about it as a host and really enjoyed sharing his stories with us. I was very happy to learn this much about Buenos Aires, and although it took us almost 3,5h(!), it was a great experience. Thank you Fernando, you're awesome!

Fernando, you rock!!!. Fernando our fearsome guide (and lawyer) was informative, interactive, full of fascinating facts, funny stories and made the 2.5 hour morning tour very interesting. He conducted the tour in excellent English. It was the perfect way to get an overview of the city and decide if you wanted to spend more time at any one particular place and as such should be done at the beginning of your stay.We learnt about the history of a relatively young Buenos Aires and Argentina. The influences of the French, Italian, Spanish, Swiss and British. He talked about the juxtaposition of the architectural styles, the acoustically sound Teatro Colon, Plaza Libertade and the Jewish quarter. He referenced politicians including the strange site of a monument to General Lavalee erected outside the palace of his most famous conquest, General Doreggo. Our tour also included some of the bigger tourist attractions in Buenos Aires like The Obelisk, Monument to General San Martin, Cabildo, Falkland/Malvinas Memorial and the British Clock Tower. We saw the fascinating "singing forest", the impressive Kavanagh building (and learnt of its sad history in obscuring the Metropolitan Cathedral) and the San Martin Palace. We learnt about figures on Argentinian notes, coming out of bankruptcy, the history of slaves, those that disappeared and the tragic story of AMIA prosecutor Alberto Nisman.We finished at Recoletta Cemetery where we learnt about Lola Mora, Eva Peron and Nobel Prize winner in Chemistry - laureate Luis Federico Leloir, amongst others. WOW - all in 2.5 hours!!. well done, Fernando, you rock...Although advertised as "free", a donation is the very least one could do...!Highly recommended...

Free walking tour. My wife and I went on the morning walking tour hosted by Martin. The tour was excellent, with details provided by a knowledge guide that went beyond the boring fluff you read in a pamphlet. Martin presented information which gave insight into the history and people of the city. We're going to do the afternoon tour this week.

Great tour. We took this tour towards the end of our time in Buenos Aires and it is a great way to find out about a lot of the history of Buenos Aires and Argentina. We wish we had have taken it at the start of our time. Our tour guide was Fernando who was very informative and really interactive. The tour takes you to some of the biggest tourist attractions in the center of Buenos Aires. I'd recommend this tour as it gives you a great insight into Buenos Aires and it can be difficult to get around B.A. due to the size of it!

Excellent way to kickstart your Buenos Aires trip. My wife and I went for the 3pm tour yesterday and we were absolutely blown away by Martin's level of detail in his knowledge of Argentina's history and culture from colonial times to modern politics - all in very fluent English. In this 3-hour tour, Martin also shared very essential travel tips on money changing, safety tips on minimizing thefts, dangerous areas and places to go for tango classes/shows. An excellent way to kickstart your Buenos Aires trip with this tour, especially if it is your first time in the city.

Great walking tour. just came back from the morning walking tour Tribunales - La Recoleta with Javier and have nothing but praise for the tour. Javier was engaging, friendly and very knowledgeable. I have been coming to Buenos Aires for over 40 years and I learned so much this morning, I couldn't believe it. Although it was 3 hours, it went by quickly. Not only was Javier a super guide, but my fellow tourists were also very interesting. I can't think of a better way to learn about the life and history of Buenos Aires. Don't miss this wonderful tour.

Well worth your time(and money for a tip). 3 hours of fascinating and informative information. The time passed so quickly as it was so interesting. Martin was exceptional with a personal and well informed view of the history and politics of his city. He communicated in perfect English and barely stopped to draw breath at each location, such was his passion for his subject. It was noticeable that some people dropped out before the end, presumably to avoid giving tips. A mean gesture when these people only earn through tips and put a lot into the tour. Highly recommended.

No better way to discover a city other than walking. Awesome !! Funny guide and interesting facts and so enjoyable in such a beautiful city !!And most amazing fact is that these guides are volunteering with such a positive and fresh spirit i totally recommand it !!

Just awesome!!. I did the free walking tour at 3 pm with Martín and it was the best free walking tour I ever did! Martín new a lot about the history and politics of Argentina but the best part was him sharing his own personal experiences during several different economical and political conditions of life in Argentina. I enjoyed the tour so much, Martín made it really special and personal, I would recommend everybody to participate in this tour, it's worth it! I wasn't going to do the morning tour but now I definitely will! High quality !

Never in my life a 5* review and now 2 in 2 days. Simon (assuming I got the name correct) was better than brilliant.A large group he held me spellbound as he gave so much insight into life with Argentinian politics, bankruptcy, "the disappeared" and Nisman.Along the way he introduced us to Rodin's thinker, Dante, Lola Mora and the 100 peso note.Better than excellent.

A great free walking tour of Buenos Aries. We were looking at tours while we were in BA and stumbled across this tour on line. It sounded too good to be true but we turned up at the meeting point in the centre of BA at the allotted time and found Victoria waiting for us and the rest of that morning's group soon turned up too. Vicky was brilliant. She was enthusiastic and knowledgeable about her city and a lovely person too. We had a great time. Whilst this tour is free, please show your appreciation to Vicky or whoever else is your guide by generously tipping them as we did, it really was worth the money.Sadly just after the tour finished my husband was mugged and his watch was forcibly removed from his arm by two men who got away on two motorbikes that were waiting for them so when in BA be very careful and watchful and hide or leave all your valuables somewhere safe.Fortunately my husband sustained no injuries other than a few scratches and the loss of an expensive watch which he forgot to take off before leaving our cruise ship.

Learn about Argentinian cultural history. An outstanding introduction to the history and cultural mix that creates Argentina. Our guide Martin has a wealth of information and insight into his native country and uses the architectural landmarks to explain core political and cultural issues in the Country. Three hour tour but so interesting I was sorry to come to the end.

Very efficient way to learn about Buenos Aires. We did the morning city tour. Our tour guide Victoria was very knowledgeable and interesting. I learned a lot about BA's history and architecture. A great way to learn about BA in a short amount of time. The whole tour took about 2.5 hours and Victoria was happy to answer tons of questions and give us tips about our stay. Thank you Victoria!

Maru is the most passionate walking tour guide ever.. We spent 4h30 walking around with Maru (initially it was 3h), and she gave us so many details, anecdotes, stories, answers, all with a passion of someone who obviously loves the city. Fantastic learning and discovery experience.

Informative and fun. First experience with the concept and I think it is great. Since the tourguides work for a tip they really make an effort. I was more satisfied then with a lot of tours where you pay dearly and get a pig of a guide. Both tours where with Delores (Lolly) a knowledgeable nice girl who knows and talks a lot. She really makes an effort and has an open personality. As an heritage and history student I had quite some additional questions regarding the cities cultural heritage and was happy with the amount she knew. No better way to get introduced to the city.
Great free walking tour. A great intro to the city. Our guide Andrew was awesome and had plenty to share about the city. A great way to explore if you are new to the city or have limited time there

Fantastic and very interesting tour. Great and very worth tour. I could understand more about Buenos Aires and her history. Both tours, morning and evening are fantastic to walk, even for more than 3 hours. Special mention to Paula, you're great!! (I hope you enjoyed your birthday!!) Muchas gracias!! Helena ;)

Great tour to start off your visit. Great tour with a fantastic guide. We did the morning tour which takes you around the city and ends in Recoletta. Overall, we had an awesome time and my only feedback is that I wish the group was a bit smaller, but the guide did a great job managing the group and making sure everyone could hear and participate. 5 stars for sure, and you should try to do this earlier in your trip to learn more about the city before you explore on your own.

Great tour. I did both the morning and afternoon tour on 2 different days. A great way to get to know the City and its history. Martino was knowledgable, enthusiastic and funny. Would definitely recommend!
Excellent in every way. Very informative, interesting and the information was presented by enthusiastic staff who really gave the best to their job and were obviously enjoying giving the tours,

Excellent - very informative & entertaining. Did the morning tour and thoroughly enjoyed it. It was informative and very funny at the same time. The pace of the walk was about right too. It is definitely worth taking the walk. Great way to get some history and a feel for the city.

Brilliant tour. We did the afternoon walking tour yesterday. Our guide martin was excellent. Extremely knowledgeable and gave us a very good feel for the history of the city. Also have a great tip for a restaurant. It was very hot but he kept us in the shade as much as possible. Would definitely recommend.
Very informative. Great walking tours. Nice pace. Not too slow but definitely not rushed. The guides have a great knowledge of their city. Great way to get to know Buenos Aires.

Free Walking tour with Lolly is supergood!. This Free Walking tour was fantastic! Guide Dolores (Lolly) was amazing! Her way to talk about Buenos Aires was so interesting and funny! I really really liked it and can strongly recomend this tour!

Best part of Buenos Aires. Everyone should begin their visit with one of these tours. Good exercise but Mariano always kept us out of the sun.....he was knowledgeable, funny, knew everything about the history of the country and could point us in the direction of empanadas and ice cream at the end of the tour. I can't say enough about what an excellent guide he was....we had a large group on a Saturday morning, but he spoke loudly and clearly and the size was not a problem. Oh, and we stopped at the half way point for bathroom and drink break.

Nice Tour. I did the morning tour of the central district. This tour is much more history based than the Recoleta area tour, so I was a little bit bored. But the guides were friendly and knowledgeable, and if you're into history, you'd probably love it.It was a good way to see a lot of sites in the city.

Excellent. It gives very good points of view about the Argentinian history, people, sociology and state of mind. The guides are very friendly and answer every question about the city - either if it's about sights or recommended places for visit.

It rained yet Lorrie still soldiered on for us. This is the second free walking tour I've done and definitely the best one. Cuzco was ok but they went hours over the allotted time so our plans were ruined. This BA one seemed very well organised and she controlled the schedule very well even after serious rain that prevented us starting for at least 30/40 mins. Lorrie impressed with her huge local knowledge many times. She could even tell me the Latin names of native trees - that definitely shouldn't be expected!Smart girl, smart tour, well worth the walk and tips. Off to do the afternoon one today!

Great way to know Buenos Aires!. We did both the morning and the afternoon tour. It's a good way to visit the city but having a good guide makes the difference. We really appreciated one of the guides, Dolores, a bit less the other one but still we enjoyed walking around the city.
Great tour. I went on both tours my first day in the city. It is a great way to learn a little about where you are visiting and helps to get an initial feel for the city. Both guides were great.

Well informed English speaking guides. This is the best way to get to know any city- walking around with a local guide! Loli was funny, open to questions and was not intimidated by the big group. I recommend both tours

Great tours (both AM and PM) with very nice and knowladgable guides.. We went 2 separate days to each of the offered tours. Very nice students with good English and good knowledge of the City, culture, history. Very attentive to include everybody and address all the questions.I highly recommend taking this tours. Yes you can have a tour book, and look and read about the buildings but everything come alive when these enthusiastic guides are bringing history, art, culture together. The tour is free but after spending 3-4 hours with each of them you cannot leave without giving them a tip. How much is up to you and your pocket. An other advantage is meeting a bunch of interesting people that are sharing the experience with you and sometime adding to make the walking even ,more enjoyable.i hope they are adding more tours for other areas of the City.

Free Walking Tour - am and pm. My girlfriend and I did the morning and afternoon tour. Both tours were great and we learnt so much more about the city than I imagined we would. Both tour guides spoke very good English and presented the tours very well. I'd definitely recommend to anyone.

A must. This is where you get real information about Buenos Aires. I went for the more cultural morning tour with tour guide Dolores, and a more political and historical in the afternoon, with the guide Martin. They are two people, who have so much passion for their city and who knows all the stories about it - as they actually been part of it. Told with a lot of humor and compassion, I could feel the essence of what the argentinian people has had to live with for decades of changing governments. I feel I have gained a much deeper knowledge about Buenos Aires, than I would ever get out of any museum and it also makes me love the city in a total different way, being close to the heart of it and those two people - so knowledgeable and engaged in the life of it! It is free - but the guide lives from the tip.

Great introduction to BA. We did both the morning and afternoon tours (our guides were Dolores and Martin respectively). Both tours were excellent in regards to the content, route and friendliness of the guides. We had a fantastic time in both.One issue. The morning tour ends in the cemetery which is quite a way from the town centre and our tour did not finish at 13:00 or 13:30 but actually went until 14:15. I felt that this was quite long time and did not leave much of the afternoon by the time you had lunch and got back to centre of town. Perhaps the tour could start at 10:00, a much better start time I feel.Having said this both guides were outstanding and I would recommend doing both tours to anyone travelling to BA!

Great intro to the city. We did the afternoon historical tour and really enjoyed it. Very very informative with a lovely guide. Gave us a thorough overview of the city and its history - we learnt a lot more context about the place.

Did old city and Recoleta - loved both. I admit - I love the model of these walks and have done them in many places around the world. This one did not disappoint. We did both of the free/tip-based tours - each interesting in their own way and fully worth the time. Loved how the guides (Martin, for the city tour, and Dolores for the Recoleta tour) were "locals" that wove their own perspectives into the information given. Learned some valuable advice on a variety of topics - along with some very interesting Argentinian history about BA. My request of your? Please tip as generously as you can. These guides clearly love their city and deserve a decent wage for their energy and time.
!. I've made two tours with these guys. It's a good way to discover the city!Good mood and interesting !

Excellent morning tour, detailed and enjoyable. The tour with BA Free Walking Tours (NOT to be confused with Buenos Aires Free Walks) was fantastic. (Meeting point at corner or Paraguay and Florida 899)Our guide Eilat was not only informative, but passionate and detailed in her descriptions of the 'downtown' area of the city. She manages to condense the history of the city into informative but interesting stories. Although we'd spent over a week in Buenos Aires and had walked the same streets before, she managed to add so much more, things we'd missed, info on the things we'd seen already and we saw the city in a whole new light.This tour runs Thu-Fri-Sat but is well worth catching, we hope to do the afternoon tour with the same guys this weekend!
Free walking tours BA. Great way to explore the city. Lolli was a great guide and her information on the city was first class. Highly recommend
Historic tour. Great tour but a tad hard to find... had to go into the restaurant. Wish we would have done this on the first or second day since we learned so many helpful bits on top of the great.

Great start to BA. My fiancé and I arrived in BA and decided to do the morning walk first thing the next morning so we could get an understanding of where things are and a bit if cultural understanding. Tour was perfect and our guide Delores was funny and entertaining! Would highly recommend!

Fantastic Walking Tour. I've been on several walking tours in other major cities, but I haven't been on one as informative as this one. Soledad really knows her history and her architecture; if you're into both, I highly recommend this experience. She also loves her city to bits; which is an added plus as you get a very personal overview of the city. Buenos Aires is a magical place, and this is the best introduction to the city.

Good Tour Greedy Guide. Have done these all over world and think it is a great concept. We dId two tours both kind of average compared to past tours in other cities. What we do not like is guides who think this is Tours for Salary. We tipped to show our satisfaction above amounts mentioned in these reviews and were given a snub and criticism on one tour for not giving a lot more (such as salary payment). Really surprised me, that never happened before and I hope never again, as there are other options for tourists. if making money is the only objective, this is the wrong job.

This is a fantastic idea. This was great.. we took a free walking tour (afternoon tour) around the city. Our guide, Onno, was fantastic and he told us loads of genuinely interesting stories about the history of Argentina, and engaged us and really gave us a feel for the history of the buildings and why certain aspect of buenos aires are the way they are. the best thing is it's entirely free and you can choose to tip the guide as much as you think his/her time was worth. Given that you have to pay like 200 pesos for the other companies, this one comes highly recommended..also for the girls, onno isn't bad on the eyes either!!

A wonderful way to hit the highlights of BA. Eilat is very knowledgeable about BA and its history. We hired her for a private tour. First she took my friends and I to the cemetery, hitting Evita's tomb and other important tombs. We walked through and around Casa Rosada. We then took a break at Café Tortoni which is must visit for the chocolate and churros. Continuing on to La Boca to see local artists and the colorful neighborhood she made sure that we left at a safe time. Finally to top things off we went to Salon Canning to see some tango. It is not a fancy place, but it is the real deal. You will definitely be asked to dance here and you best get up and do it because it is like no other experience. Along each step of the way Eilat gave us the background and history of everything that we were seeing and visiting. We went at our pace and didn't feel rushed. Hiring her is a great way to see the city.

Enjoyed it so much I did the night tour. First off I hope I am reviewing the correct company. This company uses green shirts for their guides. 11am tour leaves from the Captial. I LOVE the concept. Pay what you can afford and feel is right. I did the 11am with Vicky and was very impressed. Right amount of history and sights seen. Only 6 on the trip so that was great, although unusual. Went to the 5pm and had Maggie. She was good but a little long winded for my taste, but still a nice tour. I gave each $200 pesos ($20US /blue exchange). I seemed to be the biggest tipper which seemed like my fellow tour goers may have been a little tight. I highly recommend both. I'd start with the 11am and then wait a day. It's a fair amount of walking.

Awesome way to start your stay. Our first night in Buenos Aires we did an evening tour of Recoleta with Maggie. She was a fantastic guide, funny and knowledgeable. She didn't hesitate to explain the "unique" features of Buenos Aires from the blue market and face lifts to the two hour hotels. It gave a real flavor for the city while showing us the beautiful homes and sharing their history.Highly recommended tour.

Great way to see the main attractions and get some context about Buenos Aires!. I'd definitely recommend this tour if you don't have much time in Buenos Aires or if you prefer to spend more time on exploring the "non-touristy" parts of the city. The tour lasts about 3 hours and you see the top 10 attractions.Although our tour guide was a bit "weird" (she spoke in a very theatrical fashion), she was very knowledgeable about history, politics, economics etc. and had lots of quirky stories to share too. She also thought us Argentinian hand gestures which we ended up using later on during our trip :) NB: Although this tour is advertised as free, the guides earn money via tips. So if you go along, please have the courtesy to pay them at the end. Those who run away once the tour is finished, should be ashamed of themselves!

Wonderful Introduction to Buenos Aires. Our family visited Buenos Aires for 10 days for the first time. We wanted to make the most of our time there, and arranged for Eilat to show us around for the first few days. We had an amazing time with Eilat, and became great friends. She showed different parts of the city, founds great places to eat, and kept everyone happy all along the way - mom, dad and two girls. We fell in love with city and our guide and can't wait to go back.

Both tours - a must in BA. Buenos Aires is an amazing city. Awesome food, fantastic wine, great beer and home to some of the friendliest people on earth. Paris without the attitude!There are none more friendly, passionate and knowledgeable about this wonderful city than Eilat and Soledad! Walking encyclopedias with personality! My sister and I did the morning tour with Eilat and enjoyed it so much, we came back for the afternoon tour the next day with Soledad! Actually we meant to go back the same day but a Labour day demonstration blocked the traffic and we couldn't make it!My only regret is that it wasn't the first thing we did in BA and that's what I would recommend. Get a feel for what you like and then go back and spend more time there later. A brilliant introduction to Buenos Aries!

Fantastic Tour. It was one of the best tours I have done. My guide Soledad, was well educated, knowledgeable and able tailor the experience to the my liking as I was lucky enough to be the only one on the tour on a rainy day for both the Recoleta and Historical & Picturesque walks. Soledad, had extremely good english and a good understanding of how BA works. I would highly recommend this tour and it was well worth a tip.

Excellent Free Walking Tour - Historical 3:30 pm. I took this tour on a whim and was rewarded with a great introduction to Argitinian and Buenos Airas history through the archecture of that city. The guide (Soledad) was knoldagabe, multilingual and tailored the tour to the intrestes of the group. Her enthusiasm and knowledge of the city she lives in is startling. I would recommend this to anyone who would like to know a bit about the turbulent past of Buenos Arias. (Note that the tour is free, but take a tip for the guide).

Lovely, very informative and the right lenght!. really worth the 2 hours, easy route, very interesting and a lovely guide!! On the day we went there was only 3 guests so we paid 100 Pasos each as a tip, which by the end you feel is excellent value.
Hire Eilat!. Eilat is delightful. She provided an easy, educational and interesting introduction into Buenos Aires.

Viva!. When I made a sightseeing tour in Berlin some years ago I was amazed how our tour guide from Argentina, who was living in Germany then, showed me my home town. Reason enough to book her service on her own territory when I first came to Buenos Aires with my wife to celebrate our 40th wedding anniversary. Soledad certainly gave us the introduction we were looking for. I met again the expert in architecture, literature and savoir vivre I remembered from Berlin. (Having taught literature half a life you don’t want to get mucked around with in this respect.) My wife as well was glad to meet a charming guide who does not only know her home town but who looked beyond. Above all Soledad tells it with humor. But you better watch out. She even taught some nasty policemen a lesson who wanted to deny us access to a historic building in an exciting off-the-track-barrio. I was perfectly entertained and always felt safe in her company. Only minus for me: It was too much for my old bones. I had to quit after two thirds of the way. Of course I immediately regretted when my wife came back to the hotel and told me about the wonderful evening they spent on some hidden Tango milonga. So I dare to say if there was a Kamasutra of Sightseeing to be written, Soledad could write it - she teaches you to love her home town ;-) Thanks for the inspiration and the precious contribution to one of the most beautiful trips of our life. We hope to come back one day to this stunning city!
What a TREAT!. We liked it so much we are hiring them to do a private full-day tour for us next Sunday. Eilat was amazing.Do yourself a favor and take the walking tour.

BA even more 'querido'. It was my first time in BA and what an amazing city this is. I truly did not expect it to be so majestic, monumental and vivid in every sense of the word. Soledad is a true Argentinian who is madly in love with her city , she has travelled and lived in many places of Europe and the States which gives her a true insight into visitors needs and her way of presenting the city. We simply told her our main interests and she simply made a tour which was simply perfect. If you go to a Buenos Aires and you truly want to make it a unique experience do contact her as she will simply make it happen.

Top notch!. I had the feeling I was on some magic city tour (BA is definitely magical but there's ways to make one acquainted with it) thanks to our tour guide Soledad's extremely vivid anecdotes wrapped around each one of the spots she took us to. Soledad was amazing and was very passionate about her work, and also very attentive to my little daughter! Our feeling was that this is way beyond a standard tour experience. So....did you get it? Recommended !! ;)

A tour to remember in Buenos Aires. This was a first for me. The tour with Soledad opened so many doors that lay behind the big avenues of Buenos Aires! Her knowledge of history and architecture are passionate. We went to so many magical places and saw a real hidden BA. She clearly loves her city and her kind help gave us so many leads to ideas and places we followed up on our own. We started our day from the classic points of interest - like the opera house - and ended attending a real milonga for tango. She has so many contacts and is so generous with sharing! I highly recommend touring with her. Soledad tailored our tour especially to our interests on the first phone call. BA Free Walking Tours gave us the best tour in any of our travels over the years.

“Perfecto” way to be introduced to Buenos Aires! And, it’s free!. On our first full day in Buenos Aires last spring, my friend and I had the good sense and very good fortune to choose Eilat Jelin as our guide there. Buenos Aires Free Walking Tours is Eilat’s recent venture aimed at accommodating the demand for her tours of the city’s diverse neighborhoods. Through two-hour, introductory walking tours, at no cost, Eilat and her partners give visitors a glimpse of BA and whet one’s appetite for much more.Eilat possesses all the expected attributes of a great guide in spades, but, in addition, she is especially quick to get a sense of exactly what interests her clients most. Too, she doesn’t waste one’s time during her tours on museums, street fairs, and other interesting but time-consuming spots. Instead, Eilat points them out and recommends those that one should not miss on their own time.Specifically, Eilat showed us six BA neighborhoods in our day together, educating us about the city and Argentina along the way; took us to a fabulous, 120-year-old French pastry shop and a small but amazing, off-the-radar tapas restaurant; told us of a book store we had to see; and assisted us in several ways that made the rest of our visit to BA far better than it would have been otherwise.[Note: If our experience is representative, finding good tango on one’s own can be most difficult.]

Great Tour, Informative Guide. This is a great tour to take and very adaptable to what you actually want to see and do.
The guide was very informative and helpful in every way possible.
We had a great time in Buenos Aires and would recommend this tour to anyone else visiting the city.

Magnificent tour, wonderful guide!. The tour was excellent! I was curious about the development of the architecture, the culture… Soledad (the wonderful guide) could answer all my questions and more, she gave me an inside view of Buenos Aires, told me about the background stories, the context…Thanks to her I had a beautiful experience in Buenos Aires!Because it was such a great tour I also went on the tango one. I`m not able to dance tango, but nevertheless it was a great evening!I saw a lot of nice tango places, listened to this wonderful music and saw these nice people dance so beautifully with each other.She knows a lot about tango, because she is not only an architect, but also a tango dancer.So it was a match made in heaven! I can highly recommend her and will go on the tours with her again if I`m in BA. Thank you so much!!!

I don't know what I would have done without BACC. I recently moved to Buenos Aires from the U.S. for 8 months and had the good fortune of using BA Cultural Concierge to help me. Madi spoke to me on the phone before I left, answered all my questions and gave me invaluable information that helped me tremendously in my move. When we arrived, Nestor took us on a tour of the city and even got us set up with subway cards and Argentinian SIM cards. He was an amazing tour guide and got us to see the city for how amazing it is.BACC is a great, one-of-a-kind company that I would recommend to anyone wanting to get the best Buenos Aires experience possible!

Best in BA!. My husband and I worked with Madi to create the perfect itinerary for our 1 year anniversary/delayed honeymoon. I cannot say enough wonderful things about Madi, Nestor, and Juan. Not only did Madi have great suggestions for us, but she clearly understood what we were looking for and went above and beyond to get it for us. If Madi was ever unavailable, Juan and Nestor easily took the reigns to ensure there were absolutely no hiccups. I highly recommend using BACC for all of your itinerary needs inside and outside of BA. We went to BA, El Calafate, and Iguazu and had exactly what we wanted in each location. If you want to actually enjoy your trip and know that you are in excellent hands, run to Madi and BACC, you will not be disappointed!

Madi was so efficient and responsive. I was recommended to contact Madi Lang by a colleague; it was a great recommendation. A small group of us visited Iguazu Falls for a few days and Madi provided excellent services such as an airport/hotel transfer and a great tour of the Argentinian and Brazilian sides. Madi was always quick to respond to our enquiries and very efficient in organizing things, even at short notice. I am very happy to recommend her services to others.

Far more than I had expected. I started at zero. A three-week window had opened unexpectedly in my calendar. I wanted to book a bonus flight in Lufthansa's first class on their longest non-stop connection. Buenos Aires met all these criteria. So now I had a flight there and back - and no idea what to do in Argentina in June/July.After checking a number of German travel agencies I came across BA Cultural Concierge Tours in the web and sent them an email. They answered promptly, asking about my preferences. Next we set up a skype call and Madi and I talked for about one hour. She sent the first draft of her suggested travel-plan about three days later. We discussed and adjusted a number of details, and within another 3 days I had all my confirmations.We had set up a completely individualistic journey for someone who speaks only minimal Spanish and cannot travel in groups because he drives everyone crazy by taking his time for shooting just the right photos in just the right locations.Throughout the entire trip everything worked exactly as planned: people showed up at airports to pick me up and take me to the hotel. Tour guides were all knowledgeable, friendly and reliable. Most of them were also very helpful with photographic hints and support. Hotels were exactly as booked in location and quality. Even the flights were on time :-)I got so much more out of this trip than I had expected. Yes, great photos, stunning. But I got to know so many people too, wonderful, open-minded and interesting people. And nature and wildlife were just unbelievable. So I know I'll be back to see the South of Argentina. And I know I'll be organizing my trip through BA CC again.Just to give you an idea of the complexity of what Madi and Juan organized in a really short time, here's my itinerary:* pick up at BA international airport and transfer to the hotel* same afternoon walking tour with guide through La Boca and San Telmo* next day walking tour with a well-known architect to see Art Deco and other fancy buildings* next day walking tour with a pro photographer to LaRecoleta cemetery and other locations* next day I had to myself, walking around BA, taking pictures* night bus to Mercedes (Corrientes) and transfer to a (really) small place in the middle of the Esteros de Iberá wetlands* two days with a personal wildlife-guide, boat ride across the lagoon, birds, caiman, water-deers, capibaras, monkeys, you name it* transfer to Puerto Iguazu * one day on the Argentinian side, one day on the Brazilian side, you have to do both sides if you go!* Flight to Salta, walk around the city* day trip with guide to Cafayate, unbelievable landscape, nice lamas* day trip with guide to Purmamarca and Humahuaca, more incredible landscape, colours, skies* got drawn into a fiesta on main plaza, celebrating 200 years independence, wow, photos, fun, music* flight to Mendoza* 4WD trip with guide into the Andes, up to 3.500 meters, unfortunately the highest mountains were covered in clouds. So we went to an alternative destination. A mountain of seven colours, so unreal that people back home think I faked the photos :-)* next day a tour through three wineries with a great master-sommelier as my guide. And great wines to taste and enjoy.* flight to BA, night in BA, transfer to international airport.They booked all this, down to seat reservations in the night bus (a must-have!!!) and I think the also booked the wild Guanacos to show up just in time. And they really are available 24/7 via phone if you need their immediate support, which luckily wasn't the case for me. But it still felt good to know I had a number I could call if the need should arise.Thanks Madi and Juan, you did such a wonderful job!!!

Accommodated my very quirky needs . I travelled to Buenos Aires for a photo production and needed very unique guidance and Madi and her team delivered magic. I met many locals and saw a huge party of the city thanks to this cultural concierge. They learned my goals and delivered an itinerary that perfectly matched them. A fantastic group of people at this company!

Fabulous 2 week tour of the north. Madi organized a fabulous trip for me, including wildlife viewing at Ibera, the Igazu falls, stays at jungle lodges, a bike ride in Tilcara, and tours of the amazing valleys and gorges. All accomodations were great. She and Juan were very responsive during the tour, smoothing out the inevidable glitches that arise. I will enlist her services again when I return to visit the south.

Madi Lang -- Great Guide to BA. Wish every city had a cultural concierge like Madi Lang. She took care of every detail for our group, provided interesting background on city life in Buenos Aires and was excellent company. She set up a wonderful dinner for us in a totally unique setting on our first night. I would recommend her to anyone needing insider guidance to BA.

Two months in Argentina with 2 small children!. My husband and I planned our trip to Buenos Aires on the spur of the moment and we could not have done it without the help of BACC! As a mother of two young children and a business owner, I didn't have time to plan out our trip in such a short time. We put all of our trust in Madi and she did not disappoint!!! She catered to our specific needs as a family, helped us find the most lovely apartments in both Recoleta and Palermo Soho. She helped us plan side trips, book tickets, navigate the city and offer advice on nearly everything to do in two months time! I felt like we had our own personal tour guide at any given moment and her response time was amazing. She also saved us money by suggesting tours that are less expensive but just as good, if not better! She went above and beyond in connecting us with friends in Uruguay for our trip to Jose Ignacio. Madi is professional in every sense of the word and we could not have done it without her. Highly recommend BACC!!!! Just book her! You will spend less time looking through your book and on the internet and more time looking at the amazing city right in front of you. Enjoy! :-)

4 days solo on crutches? AMAZING. So you would think that a 4 day solo trip on crutches would be terrible, right? Well, because of the amazing staff at BACC, I had my most amazing vacation yet!I was a bit nervous since I originally planned this trip as an able bodied person, but then having to modify things for my injured foot. I googled "low mobility tours" and the BA Cultural Concierge website came up. After one short email through their automated site, Madi contacted me to get the ball rolling. She was extremely helpful in planning things out with me via email and skype. The best part is that everything was planned with my injury and (meager) budget in mind.I spent one full day touring with Madi around the La Boca area and was delighted to hear all of the history and cool stories behind each building, painting and street. I was truly impressed with her knowledge of the area and in awe her ability to truly bring to life the city we walked. I never once felt pressured to do more than I felt able (side note- it was recommended that I just use the crutches and go at my own pace since the streets were a bit too bumpy for a wheel chair) Even further, when I was unable to make change for a cab, Madi was kind enough to pay for it until I could find change! That's one of the little things that really impressed me about her and the service. By the time the day tour was over, I was confident that I knew PLENTY about the area, but also that I had made a friend. :) Here's to you Madi!After our tour, Madi continued to help me plan out an amazing schedule of activities based on my interests. I went to "The Argentine Experience" - highly recommended for the single traveler or anyone who loves food and wine. I was able to catch a Cirque Du Solei show- Kooza, and barely had time to clap because I was so amazed. I spent an afternoon wandering around Palermo and attended a world class polo match. I basically had the time of my life all thanks to Madi and the super helpful staff at BACC. To anyone looking for a one of a kind plan that will make your experience in Buenos Aires memorable, do yourself a favor and hire the BA Cultural Concierge. You won't regret it.

A month in Argentina. I discovered BA Cultural Concierge in Lonely Planet. Luck was with me that day! Working together via email, Madi and I developed an ideal itinerary. Communication was always prompt before and during our trip. Once in country their services were invaluable -from the tours they arranged, to the accommodations they suggested. Having Madi and Juan available via What's App saved our trip on several occasions. First when we were placed on a small group tour without an English guide and second when our debit cards were lost. I texted Madi and the problems were resolved quickly. This company is all about service. Anyone thinking about traveling to Argentina should contact them. You will not be disappointed!!!!

The reason I finally fell in love with Buenos Aires after 3 weeks of feeling meh about it. Maybe you are currently like I was - feeling rather lukewarm about the city. Everyone else is saying they love it and want to move here forever, but you're still not convinced. I thought I'd leave BA without really having any strong feelings or memories from it, but then I met Madi and Juan, and my perspective has changed completely. They really introduced the human side of BA...what makes it colorful and vibrant, and why everyone here is like family. I got to experience the authenticity of a community that lives and works here and be fully immersed in their passions and love for their people. If you want to REALLY get to know Buenos Aires, this is going to be your #1 best option. Thanks for helping me fall in love with Buenos Aires, guys!

Get the insider experience of BA. Madi and Juan are a dynamic team that have both a local and expat view of BA. They put together an amazing day out in Tigre for a large group I was traveling with and everyone thought it was one of the best experiences they had while in BA and we've been here for a month. I can't recommend them highly enough. You'll get the info they don't give you in guidebooks and leaving feeling like you made a new friend.

Let these guys plan your amazing BA experience!. Madi and Juan are amazing. They are super knowledgeable about the city and its history, know all the cool nooks and crannies, and are just delightful. Also, there is nothing Madi and her team can't make happen. Whatever you're looking for from your BA experience--itineraries, tours, projects, special requests--let these guys be your guides.

Best tour of Buenos Aires. We had a fantastic tour with Juan, he was great company taking us to all the best local spots and so knowledgeable about the history of Buenos Aires! Thank you for showing us around your beautiful city!

Can highly recommend!. Had an amazing experience going on a walking tour in El Boca with these guys! Beside showing us the not turisty side of the area, our guide was very knowledgable and covered everything from a political, historical view and art in a very street level. Came home feeling like i learned so much about the city and its people. Im still in BA and def thinking of taken another of there tours before leaving....!

Learn the history of a neighborhood through its unique art. BA Cultural Concierge Tours led a walking tour of La Boca neighborhood, and it was a great way to learn about the history and culture of this part of Buenos Aires.On a rainy Sunday, our guide - Juan - took a group of 5 into el Caminito for our necessary tourist photos, but also took us behind the scenes into the neighborhood's interior. As we went, Juan stopped and used the murals and graffiti as a launching point to discuss the history of immigration and the working class in La Boca. Juan took all of our group's questions, and made sure to weave our conversations into discussions of common themes throughout the tour. As a result, I left with a sense of how La Boca fits into the broader picture of Buenos Aires and Argentina. More than I expected, and highly recommended.

Wonderful Time. Madi was spectacular setting up our trip prior to our arrival and worked with us to get everything right. Additionally we had to make some changes to the itenerary while in country and she was very helpful making the corrections. I am not sure if there are any more superlatives to describe Juan. He is very passionate and knowledgeable about Buenos Aires/Argentina and it shows during his tours. We combined both private and public transportation tours and both worked great. I highly recommend BA Cultural Concierge Tours for your Buenos Aires and Argentina/Uruguay tours.

Worth it for knowledgeable and fun tour of Buenos Aires. Madi was very helpful prior to our decision to book BA Cultural Concierge Tours for a day. Cultural Concierge was recommended by Seattle friends who raved about the service. Madi told us about our options and as we are walkers who are fine with exploring on our own, we decided that a day tour would be nonetheless helpful as we had never been to South America, let alone BA, before. Prices are very reasonable and we felt it would be a good investment. And it was. Nestor Mentasti, one of CC's guides, met us promptly at our hotel (and brought pesos for us to exchange). He then took us to neighborhoods and a few sites for about 5 1/2 hours. He was terrific; full of interesting information but also a really nice person who was easy to talk to. We went to La Boca, San Telmo, and Monserrat, then headed to Recoleta to wander the cemetery where Eva Peron, among others, is buried. Along the way we stopped at shops, admired the street art, stopped into the Metropolitan Cathedral where Pope Francis had said mass as Archbishop of BA, and talked politics at the Plaza de Mayo, which is across the street from the Pink House, the executive mansion of the President. There is so much we saw it's hard to remember. it all. We did get a good sense of where we wanted to return in the remaining time we spent in BA as well. Since we were staying in the Palmero neighborhood, our tour allowed us to see areas of the city we were not near. It was wonderful having our own tour and not feeling "herded" around the city. Doing this at the start of our stay was also great for encouraging a sense of confidence that we could navigate BA ourselves. I highly recommend BA Cultural Concierge, whether you hire them to plan your entire stay, or simply do a day as we did. Nestor was exceptional, as well, if he is available.

Full day in Buenos Aires. My husband and I and another couple arrived in Buenos Aires at 830 AM from a cruise. Our flight didn't leave until 930 PM so we booked a full day in Buenos Aires with BA Cultural Concierge Tours. Nestor met us at the cruise port with a driver and large, comfortable van which accomodated all of our luggage. He was wonderful. We saw all the highlights, walked two street markets, had an empanada lunch at a local cafe and after touring all morning and afternoon, stopped for ice cream. We went to his favorite book store that had been a theatre. So beautiful and interesting. Lastly, we went to a "central park". It was a beautiful Sunday and all the locals were out enjoying the paddle boats, rose garden, playing soccer .and just enjoying the park. It was a perfect ending to a "perfect day." I highly recommend BA Cultural Concierge and especially recommend Nestor.

Fabulous Tour. Very informative and pleasant day spent with our guide, Juan. We learned sooo much about the history, culture, politics of Argentina and specifically Buenos Aires. The six hours on this private tour with 7 adults literally flew by. We opted for private transportation but the tours are available using public transportation. The tours can be tailored to your likes, needs and wishes.

Experienced, knowledgeable and fun.. Madi took us for a day tour of Buenos Aires (a group of six of us). We were so impressed with her knowledge of the city and she took us to places that we would not have known about. She made the whole experience wonderful and educational.

24 hours in Buenos Aires. Best Tours!. We only had 1 day in Buenos Aires. We set the tour up with Madi to see the city and the tango tour. Everything was amazing. All the guides are extremely knowledgable of the city and the history. We highly recommend using them. We will use them again when we return to Buenos Aires.

Madi + Juan = amazing time in Buenos Aires!!. BA Cultural Concierge made our extended family trip in BA absolutely fantastic and so memorable. We were a multi-gen group with elder grandparents and children ages 11 and 13. We started with a half-day tour with Juan, and he truly has a knack for people. Everyone adored him. He handled the grandparents with graciousness and kindness, and my children were completely charmed by his easy manner. My son (who doesn't generally like to talk with adults) liked Juan so much that he wished Juan could have joined us on other days just so he could talk more with him. And, the kicker is that my kids actually learned a lot of history, politics, and culture from Juan (and the next day from Madi) while thoroughly enjoying themselves. Juan had an impressive amount of information at his fingertips.We had a full-day tour of the Tigre Delta (boat ride + picnic) with Madi, and that was again a completely delightful experience. Madi is lovely and great with everyone. As an American living in BA, she can offer a very interesting comparative perspective, and has an encyclopedic knowledge. Even the story of her journey from landing in BA to creating this company was really absorbing to us. We also appreciated the care she took with accommodating our dietary preferences with the picnic.What I noticed is that she works with wonderful people--for the boat ride, we had a guide also named Juan who told us tons about the specific flora and history of the Delta, plus he was a thoroughly nice person. And, we also really liked our driver Dario. We felt very safe and comfortable in his care.I can't imagine who wouldn't have a fabulous time with the BA Cultural Concierge team. We asked Madi and Juan about everything from trees to political history to even cow parts, and they knew how to give us just the right amount of info without overwhelming us. The content of the tours were also well thought out: showing us not only the beautiful sites and historical venues, but also how regular folk live, which was particularly interesting.All the other details that Madi took care of made our time seamless: the restaurant reservations and all the questions she answered before we even arrived in BA. We recommend BA Cultural Concierge whole heartedly!

Are you sure she's not a local?. Madi Lang is hands down the best tour guide I've ever worked with. Not only was she incredibly accommodating to my older parents by scheduling car services to take us around town, she was extremely personable. Half the fun of seeing Buenos Aires was seeing it through her eyes. My parent's had shown an interest in learning about the Jewish heritage of BsAs and Madi coordinated tours with the most knowledgeable guides showing us old temples, landmarks and neighborhoods. I on the other hand just wanted to get to know the local food joints. We had hands down the best steak of my life at Don Julio and I'm still dreaming of my favorite middle eastern meal at Sarkis! I highly recommend Madi Lang and BA Cultural Concierge!

Inside La Boca!. When I visited Buenos Aires, Madi from BA Cultural Concierge set up a tour for me to explore La Boca a bit more off the beaten track! My guide, Juan, picked me up at my AirBnB apartment and we took the public bus to La Boca – something that also makes you feel a bit more part of the city and something I always appreciate when traveling. Juan speaks excellent English and is super knowledgable about Buenos Aires history, its people and its culture – and it basically all started in La Boca! :)I had been to La Boca once before on a biking tour a couple of years ago, and remembered the ¨Caminito¨ area to be super touristy – Juan already got off the bus with me before reaching Caminito and told me all about the history of the neighborhood and explained Caminito´s original, non-touristy significance to me. We then left the Caminito area of La Boca, where he showed me some really cool Street Art, showed me an old fire station with some antique fire engines and told me about how the sports club Boca Junior´s – known for its soccer team – is being socially active in the neighborhood.I highly recommend this tour – it made me see La Boca in a different way!

Great Art Tour!!. I had planned to spend only a few days in Buenos Aires and was eager to gain insight into Buenos Aires Art Word.The Art tour booked with BA Cultural Concierge perfectly met my needs! Not only Madi was really responsive to my enquiry and helpful, but also Natalia, during the Tour (Malba Museum, Casa Cavia, Palermo galleries), was the perfect Art Guide to spend time with. She is friendly, a full-time artist, and no doubt she knows how to adapt the Tour to your taste & artistic background. Thank you! Nathalie

Fantastic Resource for BA Travel. Trying to wrap things up for an end-of-year trip to Buenos Aires left us with very little time to actually plan the things we'd do once we got there. Luckily, BA Cultural Concierge was recommended and I got in touch with Madi. Responding to our requests and style, Madi and team planned a fantastic trip for us: from gallery walks and bike tours to dinner reservations to an overnight trip to Uruguay, they planned a fantastic itinerary for us. Better yet, they were completely responsive to several last minute requests for changes/adjustments to our schedule. They removed all worry from our trip. If you're heading to Buenos Aires, reach out to these folks ASAP!

The way to go in Buenos Aires. Madi Lang, the head of BA Cultural Concierge, was a true find. She came highly recommended by friends who had used her services previously and she didn't disappoint. She steered us through the confusing money situation, arranged two tours of the city, an evening with a tango teacher at two tango clubs (we were not required to dance), and made all the arrangements for three day trips out of the city. All her suggestions were excellent and she was always available. BA Cultural Concierge is the way t go

The Ultimate Local Fixer. To say that we hit the jackpot with Madi and BACC is an understatement. We're not fans of the typical hotel/tour bus/ concierge approach to travel and were looking for a more local, authentic and young experience. So I reached out to a bunch of people asking for recommendations on someone who we could hire as a 'fixer' or independent concierge.I also added a bunch of tough criteria:o Seriously obsessed Foodieo Great sense of design and aestheticso Connected to the local art, design + creative communityo Has a love of local adventures and authentic experienceso Deep knowledge of BA neighborhoodso Loves peopleo Bonus: knows the local tech + startup sceneFrom the first email with Madi to our goodbyes, we found everything to be truly spectacular. Some highlights:o Help picking out an awesome AirBnB in the best neighborhood in the city. Check.o Personally greeting my partner at the airport knowing that she was arriving solo. Yup.o Cash exchange services - in person at your apartment / hotel @ the best possible rates. Done.o 24/7 WhatsApp access to help with figuring out last minute plans, reservations.
