Yes!o A world-class itinerary where locals who live in BA said:"Whoa, how did you know about THAT?!". Oh yeah.o Great taste in food with excellent recommendations. Double yeah.o Minor medical issue? Madi: "We're on it!" Problem solved in 1 hour.o Locals only tour with a cultural anthropologist who loves people and history? That would be Juan, one of Madi's partners.o Best ice scream spots in the city? Madi: "Here's a list." And yeah, it was some of the best ice cream we have ever had.There was no better way to land in a new town than to be in the care of the BACC team. Please consider using them only if you like being around people who treat others well, who enjoy creating amazing experiences and who are all around solid human beings. For those of you who know me, I rarely ever write something this glowing when it comes to reviews. Actually I don't do many reviews at all. I can be a tough customer with high standards. Madi and the team far exceeded all expectations and made our trip *extraordinary*. Thank you Madi, Juan and team -- see you next time!Visited Buenos Aires October 2015

it's all in the details! thank you BACC!. my business partner and i had planned a chock-filled itinerary for a week in BA for our clients which was focused mostly on the contemporary art scene in BA. we were in search of a good local guide and someone local to help us finalize the details, etc. a true gift fell in our hands when another expat recommended madi lang and BACC. not only did they provide the best local guides, juan and architect eduardo, but they helped to arrange all of our ground transportation, personal museum guides, a boat trip in the tigre delta, a tango lesson and a day of polo in pilar. additionally, they confirmed all of our restaurant and museum reservations which was challenging for us with the distance and language barriers. we truly can't imagine having organized this trip for our clients without the assistance and hand-holding from madi and juan. they were exceptional in every way and available at any moment during our stay in BA. beyond being so detail oriented, both madi and juan were delightful to be with. their love for their city is contagious and it was impossible not to appreciate juan's passion for argentina's history, culture and people. juan, as well as eduardo, shared so much about argentina's establishment, past and present that we wouldn't have learned otherwise. our clients couldn't have been happier with our trip and we give kudos to BACC for contributing to our success. our new challenge is to figure out when we can get back with another group - or just for shopping and eating! thank you BACC, madi and juan! we will be back! kpeArts and studio traveler

BA Cultural Concierge Tours - Buenos Aires. We used a small client focused agency in Buenos Aires called BA Cultural Concierge (BACC). We were extremely pleased with the service level and attention given to our group of 10 people. Madi (Owner) was our primary contact who was extremely responsive and flexible in creating an itinerary for our 5 days in Buenos Aires. Our guide in the City and Delta was Juan who is very outgoing and informative. Great sense of humor and very attentive to the needs of the group. Our guide for experiencing a working gaucho ranch and visiting San Antonio De Areco was Guillermo who was equally as good as Juan. Of course the food in BA is excellent and Madi gave us great restaurant recommendations as well as making the reservations for us before we arrived in Argentina as these are popular places. You cannot go wrong with the attention and service that Madi and her team provides you during your visit to Buenos Aires. They provided great tips for first timers to South America. Look for their website.

Making life easier and more fun!. I've now used BA Cultural Concierge Tours multiple times. The initial tour I got through them when I first came to Buenos Aires was excellent. It gave me a great lay of the land while getting to very cool historical facts at the same time. Great price too!Madi was very professional and accommodating. When traveling there are already so many things to worry about so, working with Madi is wonderful in just alleviating the stress alone. I've used them now to book tickets to shows, weekend get aways, and a trip to Pategonia. It's the best. Just have an idea of what you want to do and they'll take care of all the work. The best part is you'll most likely get to do what you wanted for a better price. I can't recommend them enough and will continue to use them when I can.

Buenos Aires we'll be back again!. I do not usually leave guest feedback but after an AMAZING week of touring Buenos Aires, I felt compelled to say what a wonderful itinerary Madi Lang arranged for our family. Having an agenda to work from that was pre-planned made all the difference in the world. I began to work with Madi 6 weeks prior to our trip requesting help in arranging an apartment for us and an educational, fun framework of touring and relaxing. Madi helped arrange and negotiated a beautiful apartment for us in lovely Recoleta. The apartment was like a little piece of paradise after a day of touring. My daughter recently had knee surgery so Madi was able to arrange all driving tours of the city for us as well which was so wonderful! We did the city tours of BA, went on the Graffiti Mundo tour, took a boat tour of the Tigre Delta, took the ferry to Colonia, Uruguay, toured Colonia then spent a lovely day at Rio Ancho in the country where we had a baking class and finally went to Kensho for a vegan cooking class with Chef Maximo. Our days were full and our evenings were spent relaxing street-side in cafes sipping wine. It was a wonderfully clean city, filled with nice people and lovely architecture. Our guides Nester, Juan and driver Dario were absolutely the BEST! We would not be going home with such nice family memories of this great city without all of them. We would not hesitate to go back and use the services of BA Cultural Concierge!

Great time in Buenos Aires!!. Madi Lang was wonderful. We felt like friends as soon as we met her. She arranged for one of her guides, Juan, to show us around the city. Juan was excellent; he was friendly and very knowledgeable. In addition, Madi arranged for Rabbi Ernesto to give us a tour of Jewish Buenos Aires. Rabbi Ernesto was very familiar with Buenos Aires; he was knowledgeable about Jewish Buenos Aires as well as the overall history of the city. Overall we had a great time in Buenos Aires.

Madi, Madi, Madi Lang, the Magnificent!!!!. Based on TripAdvisor reviews, I knew I needed to book Madi Lang of BA Cultural Concierge fairly early on in our cruise planning for South America. The group from our ship was overjoyed with Madi's tour! We agreed on a tailored-tour of B.A. based on her recommendations which was a nice balance between viewing from the van and walking tours in selected areas. Madi is originally from Maryland, USA and has lived in B.A. for about 8 years. She is an expert in Argentinian arts, culture, history and politics. She has an obvious love for B.A. and its residents and is also a very-well organized tour guide. Under her skilfull narration, B.A. came alive for us. We ended our tour in a wine bar ("Pain et Vin") where we tasted some wonderful red, white, rose and blends along with bread made on the premises and some olive/cheese plates. Mention should also be made of the very professional driver Madi employs who always seemed to be at the right place and time to pick us up. Our tour with Madi was, for me, the best tour my wife and I took while on our South American cruise. Book early and often!!!

Excellent walking tour with Juan Palacios! Highly recommend. Juan was knowledgeable of BA, and tailored well the 7 hour walking tour for a group of 6 of us from Asia. He was enthusiastic, and made an excellent effort to take us to places and see items he knew would be of interest to us. He was entertaining, communicated well and had the pace just right. A smart and sincere tour guide all 6 of us at end of tour would not hesitate to highly recommend. Well done Juan - keep it up ! Raymond from HKPS - thanks too for recommending La Brigada. Awesome short ribs!

Amazing day with Juan. Another member of cruise critic organized this tour. We found our guide to be very good -- and he gave us commentary on the sites as well as the city and country. We made an empanada stop that we enjoyed (extra price-- but cheap) and the included wine tasting stop. We highly recommend this tour.

Very Good Travel Planner. We used BA Cultural Concierge to arrange for travel to/from the airport, tickets to Colonia, and tickets to Teatro Colon. Normally I like to arrange travel on my own but found it easier to work with Madi/Juan as my Spanish is not the best. They were very responsive and helpful and provided some useful travel advice/tips along the way.

Highly recommended. BA cultural concierge organised three great half day tours for us in Boca, San Telmo and Recoleta, with Juan. Great knowledge, great itinerary, great recommendations for lunch etc. Many thanks.

A Truly Incredible Experience. My partner and I decided to celebrate our joint birthday's with a vacation and party in Buenos Aires. We invited friends a year out with the thinking that maybe 10 folks might join if we were lucky. As the "confirmed" count climbed above 25, we knew it was time to engage a professional. I came across Madi Lang doing a simple internet search and reading reviews. From the first consultation on the phone to the flawless execution of a week of hospitality and events, to the follow-up after, Madi and her network of partners far exceeded our expectations. In the end, Madi and her team took care of over 35 people, providing bespoke arrangements and hospitality for each based on their wishes and needs, and created an inspiring and incredible party none of our guests will soon forget - all created and curated with an impeccable eye and taste level.Madi was personally invested in creating stress-free experience, and the ultimate happiness of our guests. She and her team were accountable and communicative, and passionate about sharing all that Buenos Aires has to offer. I highly recommend Madi and BA Cultural Concierge without reservation to anyone looking to make their trip to BA memorable.

wonderful guidance. My husband and I rented an apartment in BA for 3 weeks. Although we are well traveled and do a lot of research, since we were not staying at a hotel we decided to hire a concierge service. And we were really glad we did and even happier that we found Madi.She arranged all our restaurant reservations, arranged our tours, which were all incredible. She helped us decide what was worthwhile and what was not, so our time was used very wisely. Her ability to arrange anything from hard to get Boca Junior tickets to touring Milongas at night was amazing. The tour guides that she recommended from the amazing Ernesto to Juan to Graffitimundo were perfect. When there were problems such as one of the tour guides not showing up, she was on top of it immediately. Or when we were ringing the doorbell at a restaurant at 10 pm and they closed that night without any notification, she and Juan called multiple restaurants to see where we could get in.She was so much better then any hotel concierge that I have ever worked with and wish she would expand her services to many more places.We can't recommend her enough. If you are going to BA or anywhere in Argentina, do yourself a favor, save yourself a lot of headaches and hire her. Her services are worth every penny.

Great tour in Buenos Aires. We had 2 half day tours with Juan. He was friendly, informed, funny, and very knowledgeable about Buenos Aires. One of the days was in the rain and Juan scheduled our stops to accommodate the weather. He was the best tour guide we have ever had.

Great experience. Madi gave us a wonderful day in Buenos Aires. She made us feel comfortable from our first contact with her before we even got to Argentina. We arrived by cruise ship and later discussing our tour with others who had taken the standard ship tours we decided we had gotten the better deal. Our tour was varied, personal, in depth and set at a comfortable paceMadi made us want to return while fellow ship passengers on other tours felt "Been there, done that"Along the way we sampled breakfast pastries and had a light lunch. Madison checked with us as to what appealed to us and it was just right

Very Helpful!. We recently utilized the services of BA Cultural Concierge for a visit to Argentina. Madi was delightful and helpful, as was Juan. They assisted us in finding and renting an excellent short term stay apartment in BA and then assisted with our travel plans around the country. It was very reassuring to have a local expert to call on for advice and assistance in making the most of our visit.

A great day in Buenos Aires. We took a full day trip with Juan around Buenos Aires. We had a complicated schedule, which was not helped by schedule changes caused by our cruise line. Juan worked around our schedule to create a great day in the city. We started with a drive around the city highlighting a range of neighborhoods. We went to lunch for pizza and empanadas, then headed to the city center. We ended our day at a contemporary art museum. Juan worked to make sure we saw all the sites we requested despite an auto race winding through the city. Juan was knowledgeable and engaging and his enthusiasm for the city was contagious. He interacted well with both of us as well as our 12 year old daughter.

2 wonderful days with Madi!. My husband and I spent 2 days with Madi all over BA. She is a delight! Madi is knowledgeable about all things Argentinian and loves her adopted city/country. With her careful questions before the trip, she knows what you are looking for from your experience and delivers. She made reservations and recommendations for additional things to see and do. Thanks for making our trip fun!

Two fun days. Our family of 10 arrived in Buenos Aires via cruise ship on a very hot Friday morning. With three generations ranging from an 84 year old using a walker ... To a hyper 10 year old boy ... We were not an easy group to manage or entertain! Yet Madi found numerous interesting options for us over a two day period ... And Juan treated us like family once we arrived. I highly recommend having Madi & Juan be your Buenos Aires choice. They were just fabulous!

Loved our Buenos Aires trip thanks to Madi. We just returned from an 11 day cruise from RIo to Buenos Aires and ending our cruise in Buenos Aires was the best part of our trip thanks to BA Cultural Concierge and Madi Lang. We are real planners and booked with Madi nealy a year in advance and we are so glad that we did. Madi took care of everything in Buenos Aires for us and even booked us flights and a private tour in Iguazu Falls. My only regret is that we did not spend more time in Buenos Aires and touring with Madi. Everything we requested was done exactly as planned. Madi met us at the port for our first day and took us on a wonderful tour of the highlights of Buenos Aires. As an American living in Buenos Aires, it is clear that Madi loves the city. I felt like I was touring with an old friend. She showed us the highlights that we requested and got us back to the ship by 2 PM as we had requested. The next day we disembarked the ship and Madi had arranged our transportation to our hotel as well as a dinner/tango show that night. She also did all the planning for our flight to Iguazu Falls the next morning including booking our flights, arranging for transportation to the airport and booking a tour guide (also excellent) and transportation in Iguazu Falls. The service was outstanding and Madi and her tean take care of every detail including delivering printing and delivering our bordering passes on our last day. We traveled with another couple and I have to say that Madi made me look like a genius since I was the one who did the planning with her. Thanks Madi.

Really great experience - thank you, Madi!. I planned a trip to BA for a conference and wanted to make the most of my time there by working with a tour guide. I'm really glad I did! Madi is really personable and it was great to get to know Adrian and Eduardo as well. I felt so comfortable exploring the city with them. I went for the car tour option so we could cover more areas and we also walked around La Boca and San Telmo and took breaks for coffee and gelato. Later, we asked for a specialized walking tour focused on literature and architecture and Madi made it happen on pretty short notice! It was such a memorable experience because Eduardo is a famous local architect. Not only that but corresponding with Madi in advance of my trip made me feel a lot more relaxed since I had never been to Argentina before. Madi helped me develop an itinerary and think through logistics. She also helped us identify stores for specialized purchases like a hospitality gift and gifts for friends back home. She really helped make the trip a seamless experience - I can't recommend her highly enough!

Bravo Madi!. A wonderful week for 30+ of us to spend time together and individually for some of us who were first-time visitors and those who knew Bueno Aires better. From hotel reservations, to small-group tours, to tango programs, to club recommendations, no request was too trivial nor overwhelming for Madi and her crew to accomodate.

An unforgettable experience with an unbeatable guide - thanks, Madi!. I have had the pleasure to have two walking tours of Buenos Aires with Madi, each several hours long. I really enjoyed them, for a few reasons: first of all, Madi has incredible knowledge of BA, she has lots of information, experience and stories to share. Secondly, she combines this with a warm welcome and unfailing professionalism (this combo does not come all too often!). I will be able to remember BA fondly, also thanks to Madi! And finally, she is a great guide not just because she knows a lot of the city or is professional in what she does; first and foremost, she is really passionate about BA and this shows, which makes the experience even better. I'm one hell of a happy customer!

Spring in BA With Fabulous Personalized Service!. My husband and I recently spent a week in Buenos Aires and had a really terrific time. We relied on Madi Lang and BA Cultural Concierge to help us plan our trip, to make all our reservations, and to guide us through. Frankly we could not be more pleased that we did.Madi began by asking us about the types of things we wanted to do in BA and how we like to travel (my husband has ambulatory issues.) Based on her planning we were able to do everything that we wanted to do and very much more.Madi arranged for getting us easily through the airport and brought comfortably back to the apartment she arranged for us. The apartment, which we were able to look at online, turned out to be even more fabulous than we imagined. We had all the space we needed with beautiful bathrooms and a very up to date kitchen. The key, however, was the view of the very pretty plaza outside the long window wall – a beautiful cityscape that changed as the day went by. Our trip focused on art and architecture, which are our particular favorites. On various days we enjoyed formal tours of the city including a really in depth one with Juan who works with Madi. On one of the more casual days, Madi arranged a terrific half-day tour and lunch at the Museum of Latin American Art – it turned out to be one of the highlights of the trip.Among the other experiences that Madi was able to offer us included many excellent modern and traditional restaurants and shopping for Argentinean leather and even South American yarns. If you are going to Buenos Aires you cannot go wrong by relying on Madi and BA Cultural Concierge. They certainly made our trip very special.

Back again!. BA Cultural Concierge did it again! A very special person was on her second trip to BA. So of course I emailed Madi for help with another delivery of wine and flowers. Malbec of course, I mean this is Argentina! And this time she worked with a great Wine store to present a list of recommended wines in several price categories. I picked two wines and Madi was on her way. The delivery was made in the afternoon, that very special person arrived, and called me right away to say how excited she was. Another great experience. Thanks Madi!

Wheelchair tour BA - fabulous. In March this year I had 3 days exploring BA with Madi and Juan, what amazing guides they are! I am a wheelchair bound lady travelling alone in Sth America so I needed guides who understood my disability needs. I discovered Madi on Tripadvisor and all of the wonderful reviews are so well deserved.I stayed in a hotel in Recoleta which was a great central location as we could walk (or wheel!) nearly everywhere from there, particularly as BA is pretty much flat..Juan and I explored the fabulous La Boca area (we caught a wheelchair friendly bus to the district). It was a really fun and colourful area, and Juan was so knowledgeable and passionate about his city, and heaps of fun to hang out with.The next 2 days Madi and I visited Recoleta Cemetary, Casa Rosado and the central city, and the Puerto Madero area. Again it was a lot of fun hanging out with Madi - I felt like I had known her for years and I was being shown around the city by an old friend.Right from the first email contact the communication was excellent and friendly, and she puts together a tour to suit just you. And she is always just a phone call away if anything is needed.When I arrived in BA Juan and Madi were 2 strangers, but I left with 2 new friends!I highly recommend them as guides in BA, you could not find anyone better, and they make your trip really unforgettable. And they are excellent and understanding at dealing with anyone who has a disability so don't hesitate to contact them. Fabulous!!

excellent in every way. We were referred to Madi from BA Cultural Concierge and from the first moment Madi contacted me the experience was excellent. Madi made everything very easy and ensured that we were well looked after: from the driver waiting for us at the airport through to the wonderful 2 days Juan spent with us exploring the old and the new(er) Buenos Aires. My daughter and I are interested in the history and stories of places we visit, and Juan didn´t let us down. He clearly knows his city! If you are coming to Buenos Aires and only have a couple of days, I highly recommned contacting Madi and arranging a personal tour. We paid $65 USD per hour (including the driver) which I think was worth every penny. Looking at the other poor travellers jammed into tour buses who descended en mass at all the sights is not my idea of a cultural enlightening experience!

Gift Delivery - Wine and Flowers, Last Minute. I wanted to surprise a very special person with wine and flowers during her first visit to BA. A web search presented several options. BA Cultural Concierge's web site was well done, appealing, very informative and mentioned "gift and care packages" so I gave Madi a call (the US phone number made it so convenient). Based on our brief conversation I immediately knew there was no need to try any other option because Madi would see to it that my "mission" was accomplished. She enthusiastically said: "of course we can help you! We would love to."So the plan was set and we were off! But literally at the last minute, there was an unforeseen change of plans which Madi handled personally, quickly and professionally. The result was an outstanding experience for both of us! Thank you Madi!!!!

Lovely day in Buenos Aires. We arrived in Buenos Aires in the early morning, and our driver was there to take us to the hotel to meet our guide Madi.....a lovely young American who has fallen(understandably) for the charm of Buenos Aires. Knowing that we had a typical tour of the city the next day..Madi took us to many of the non-touristy areas , such Palermo, Palermo soho, Hollywood, the horse park, and the lovely park area. She strolled us down avenues and we popped into the Café Tortoni. She helped give us a flavor of the city, the people and the culture!! She pointed out where we could return to shop, and some excellent restaurants! I strongly recommend Madi and BA Cultural concierge for a customized and satisfying visit to this wonderful city!

A Marvelous 4 days in Buenos Aires. My wife and I had 4 days of tours with BA Cultural Concierge with Juan as our guide and Facundo as our driver. What an experience. We covered the entire city and the Tigre River area with detail and interest beyond belief. We could never have done so much on our own if we had 10 days. Amazing. Juan was so considerate and was always willing to accommodate our changes and needs. We learned so much about the culture and the people of Buenos Aires and we experienced the true local flavor and areas that tourists would not see on their own. The days were well planned but flexible. Juan acted as an interpreter, which is an additional benefit, as anyone who travels can attest too. It's like having family taking you around a new city you are visiting. I would highly recommend this tour group to anyone who is truly interested in getting to know Buenos Aires. We couldn't have been more pleased.

BA Cultural Concierge was great. My husband and I had one full day in BA and wanted to make the most of it. We contacted BA Cultural Concierge and were very pleased with their email responses and putting a tour together that was personal and thorough. Our tour guide Juan and their driver spent the day with us taking us around to many different parts of the city explaining the history of the neighborhoods and the architecture. We were able to walk around some of the areas to get more of a feel for them. We loved our tour around LaBoca and the surrounding neighborhood. By chance, when Juan was pointing out the architecture of a lovely home being renovated, the owner/renovator/artist came out and invited us in for a tour. It was a nice surprise and a bonus to our tour that day. We wanted some empanadas for lunch so Juan found us his favorite place and we enjoyed a quick lunch with him. He answered all our questions and showed us where we were at all times using a detailed map which was very helpful. He was very patient with me when I was taking lots of photos too. He was very proud of his city and you could tell. We felt very pleased with our day in BA with Juan and would highly recommend this company for your private tour.

BA Cultural Concierge Is The ONLY Way To “Do” Buenos Aires!. Over a year ago my wife and I, along with our friends with whom we would be traveling, decided to spend six days in Buenos Aires following a cruise that departed Valparaiso, Chile and ended in Buenos Aires on February 1st 2014. After researching private tours in Buenos Aires, we discovered BA Cultural Concierge on Trip Advisor and we are so thankful that we did. Madi Lang is the owner of the business; I was elected to contact her via her website baculturalconcierge.com. Over the intervening months, Madi worked with the four of us via email and telephone, as she developed and refined a completely unique and absolutely perfect itinerary for all six days of our visit. The services she provided included pre-arranging transfers (whenever and wherever we needed them); arranging for Juan to meet us at the ship followed by a fantastic city tour that ended with him assisting us with the check in process at our rental condo – Superb job Juan; helping us to exchange USD to Argentine pesos after we arrived, booking our roundtrip airline reservations to Iguazu (to include transfers once we arrived there); purchasing tickets for the English language tour of the Teatro Colon well ahead of the date we would visit the teatro; arranging for Nestor to drive us to Recoleta cemetery where he gave us a wonderful tour, followed by driving us to parts of the city that we would never have found on our own; arranging for a late-night visit/tour with Mariana of three Milongas (where the real Portenos go to tango); and making dinner reservations for us at two terrific restaurants in Palermo Soho that were within walking distance of the condo. Madi also insured that Nestor was available to be our driver every day. His amazing knowledge of the city and wonderful sense of humor made our time together especially enjoyable. Some of the aforementioned items required interim payments early in the proces, and the remainder, we paid directly to Madi in USD cash when we arrived in BA on 1 February. We are so happy with the services that she and her team, who for us included (besides Madi), Juan Palacios, Nestor, and her “tango fanatic” Mariana. Madi also arranged for a full day tour of the Tigre Delta and, fortunately for us, personally acted as our guide. We had so much fun together, it seemed like we had known her forever The day began with a walking tour of the picturesque town of San Isidro and a visit to the wonderful Victorian residence of Argentine writer and intellectual, Victoria O Campo where we enjoyed a fabulous lunch. After lunch we had a boat tour of the Rio de la Plata Delta, which was pre-arranged by Madi. We enjoyed exploring the various waterways of the delta, seeing homes on the numerous islands that can only be reached by boat. We had lots of laughs with Madi throughout our visit and couldn’t have been any more pleased with her services or comfortable with her personally. Madi Lang and her team insured that we were taken care of every minute we were in Buenos Aries – they were only a cell phone call away the entire time. She has the business skills, knowledge, personal network, and exceptional interpersonal skills which, in combination with her outstanding team, make BA Cultural Concierge the epitome of what a private, personal, tour operator should be. So, our recommendation is to be smart and contact her…the earlier the better! I know that you will be as pleased as we were. She is a genuine gem…and great fun too, and…as a bonus, you’ll leave with a friend in Buenos Aires.

BA Cultural Concierge service is in a class by itself. Traveling to a city with the size and complexities of Buenos Aires can be intimidating if one is not familiar with the language to say the least. Having Madi and her fine friends and employees, Jaun, Nestor, and Ernesto, organize our tours and accompany us was like having good friends in the city. Completely customized to our needs we felt like we got as much out of the city as we could in the few days we were there. Visiting in February or January is somewhat frustrating because many of the cultural activities are not happening, but still we felt we got the highlight,and some very unique experiences that we would never found on our own. We had an incredible introduction to making Empanadas by the Chef owner of El Federal, which is a superb restaurant for Argentine cuisine. We highly recommend BA Cultural Concierge. One caution however beware of imitators.

a wonderful guide in Buenos Aires. We were fortunate in having Madi be our guide for the two days we were in Buenos Aires as part of our South America/Antarctica cruise. Madi was always prompt in responding to e-mails, making suggestions for sites to see and arranging for us to see not just the major sites but also non tourist sites, stores for local and economical presents, and local good and inexpensive restaurants. Her knowledge of the city was obvious and her warmth made our two days extra special. We highly recommend Madi for your trip to Buenos Aires.

Excellent day trip from cruise ship. Very efficient, friendly and informative guide, Madi customised tour to suit our particular requirements using a comfortable vehicle and efficient driver.Highly recommended.

Personalized Experiences designed for our whole family.. Madi is an Expat from the US. Not knowing anything about BA and where to start, she designed our 4 days there with each of our grown children and our interests in mind. Tango lessons, cooking class of regional cuisine, bike tour of parks and monuments, private restaurants for New Years Eve and a thorough history of the city and it's politics. She helped make it not only a memorable experience but a highly educational one as well. I particularily recommend another US Expat she set us up with: Biking BA. I will submit a seperate review on Robin at Biking Buenos Aires. My wife and I were travelling with our two grown sons and daughter-in-law. We wanted more than just the sights, but to experience the city as much as possible in 4 days. Over all, I highly recommend Madi and her contacts: from hotel recommendations, to dinners at smaller "private" restaurants, to specialized activities. One of her guides even helped us purchase SIM cards for our cell phones and exchange money at most favorable rates.

Great intro to BA - highly recommend. Based on TripAdvisor we initially contacted BA Outings with Loli but she was booked. She recommended Madi at BA Cultural Concierge. Contact by email was very efficient and, although Madi herself was booked, she set us up with the Tango dance lesson and tango night out with Mariana and a half day tour with her associated Juan. Could not recommend both more highly as things to do as an intro to BA. Even though we had just arrived that morning and were a bit lagged, the tango lessons (for a family of five) were totally enjoyable, informative and gave us a great insight into tango. We then visited three different milongas at different skill levels to see how the locals do it. The tour with Juan the next day was also outstanding. Juan is an anthropologist and the tour (mostly of the original city locations) gave us a great overview of the origins of the city, its development into the Paris of the South and its history through to recent times. I have been on many such tours but this was by far the most relaxed AND informative. It was Sunday so we passed through the vast markets and Juan even helped broker a few deals for us. You can see that Juan enjoyed exploring the nooks and crannies of the city as much as we did and he even seemed to find a few new places to visit along the way.

Incredible BsAs Experience. Madi and her team made our 2 week visit to Buenos Aires an incredible experience! We started planning several months in advance and Madi really listened to what we wanted to do and helped us plan an unforgettable visit. Madi and driver met us with a warm welcome at the pier following a rather hectic disembarkation. She waited with us until our apartment was ready, introducing us to a terrific coffee place just half a block from our home in BsAs. Our visit included a tour with Madi for us and four of our shipmates! She and Juan helped us book restaurants and concerts and remis. All except one went without a hitch and Juan was there to help us with that little hiccup. All arrangements were made by email.

Personal Tour of BA. I had never been to BA so I arranged for BA Cultural Concierge to give me an orientation/tour of the city the day I arrived and again the following day. Juan was like having a tour by a good personal friend. Excellent English and knowledge of BA!! On the day of my arrival, he took me to exchange money, buy some food and drinks for the apartment I was renting and do a general tour of the neighborhood and central BA as well as an orientation to the Subte and taxis.The second day, he took me to some of the historical areas and surrounding neighborhoods where we toured and had a late lunch of some wonderful empanadas.The time we spent together enabled me to maneuver and enjoy BA on my own for the rest of my stay. They made my visit to BA get off on a very good start. I highly recommend them!! Thank you Madi and Juan!!

If only there were 10 stars.... Madi is the BEST! We recently visited BA, in part to see our son during his semester abroad. Madi enhanced our week in myriad ways, smoothing out the rough edges and deepening our enjoyment. With her knowledge of, and passion for, all things BA--including city tours, tango milongas, historic sites and restaurant recommendations--everything we did was enhanced by her experience and attention to detail. Our pre-trip communications led us to expect a very good week. What we experienced was memorable beyond our imaginings, thanks to Madi. Don't hesitate!

Highlight of 3 week South American Trip. We made last minute arrangements for a personal guide in Buenos Aires - and glad we did.  Juan was wonderful.He knew the city very well and was extremely flexible. He had a couple of significant points he wanted to hit - and asked us if that was OK - it was. We wanted to only use public transportation - Metro, Bus and Cab - and we did. As journeyed to the high points we would stop - change direction and then think of other things - he respond without a hitch

How to Have the Perfect Holiday. We recently traveled to Argentina with another couple to celebrate our 10th wedding anniversaries. From our first email to our final adios Madi and her team went out of their way to make our holiday a special experience, and one completely free of stress and hassle. They consistently went above & beyond to ensure our trip exceeded our expectations. Here are some examples: meeting us at the airport and giving us an overview on BA, Juan spending a day in line-up to get us the BEST seats in the house at Teatro Colon, getting us "in" at the most fabulous restaurants and clubs, booking us into top-notch lodging (every place we stayed was spectacular), putting us in touch with other tour providers who also provided amazing experiences (for Futbol & Uruguayan wine tours), city tours with a completely personalized touch (like attending to our caffeine needs at a beautiful roof-top terrace cafe), and spot-on suggestions on where to shop, eat, and dine. If you're going to the time and effort to invest in a holiday, this service is a SMALL additional investment that will ensure your experience in BA will be "perfecto." Thank you Madi, Juan & Nestor! We can't wait to visit you again!

Great experience with BACC!!. I originally contacted Loli who is highly recommended on Trip Advisor. I contacted Loli only a few days prior to our trip. Loli was booked with another client. In our good fortune, Loli recommended my wife and I work with Madi at BACC.... and fortunately again.... she had an opening.On very short notice, Madi pieced together a wonderful day in BA. She is a bilingual American who is very knowledgeable and passionate about Buenos Aires! We walked around the city learning about the history, influences, architecture, and culture of this wonderful city! All the things we wanted to achieve on our first day.Madi shared some of her favorites restaurants(we enjoyed lunch at one during the initial city tour), she arranged dinner appointments, a Tango show, and a day trip to Uruguay which was a great little escape from the big city. All the top spots and experiences we desired!We HIGHLY recommend BACC and Madi for those visiting BA who desire to have a wonderful and optimal experience.John & Karen

Helpful, flexible and friendly service. I first contacted BA concierge service after looking for travel companies to help plan part of our trip to South America. After emailing quite a few BA was the only one that was flexible and allowed us to tailor make our trip. Madi was always on hand to help with ideas and listened to us in terms of budget etc. Responses were always quick and when we actually got to all of our hotels they were beautiful and each one was special in it's own way, giving the best experience of the area we were in. The company specialise in Beunos Aires but helped us with travel arrangements and hotels round Argentina and Chile. We have just finished this leg of our trip and everything went incredibly smoothly. Would definitely recommend contacting them if you are planning a trip to this beautiful part of the world!

Absolutely Superb!. My husband, 9 year old son, and I just returned from Buenos Aires and BA Cultural Concierge absolutely made the trip. By the end of the week Madi felt like a trusted friend, not a tour guide. So much so that when we left for Iguazu Falls our son kept saying "I wish Madi was here to tell us about that." or sometimes just "I miss Madi." Her love for the city and country she has made her home are obvious, and we were able to experience Buenos Aires in a way that would never have been possible without her. The experience was so amazing that our original walking tour and day in El Tigre turned into multiple days of additional personalized tours, fun, food, history and laughter. And when we missed out flight from Iguazu and were suddenly at risk of missing our international flight home, she jumped into action letting the driver she had arranged know and making sure that we had the best chance possible of making the flight (which,thankfully, we did).Whether you are a seasoned world traveler, or this is your first trip abroad, you simply cannot do better than BA Cultural Concierge. Thank you Madi for the amazing memories, we cannot wait to see you again.

Great BA City Tour. My wife and I had one of the best personalized City tours ever. Juan was engaging, informative and funny. We enjoyed ourselves so much that our 2.5 hour tour became 5 hours, ending at a cafe over beers.. He met us at our apartment and we took a taxi to La Boca. We hit every neighborhood in BA. His English is as good as ours, and his knowledge and love of his city is honest. I highly recommend their services.You won't be disappointed.

Brilliant. My family used BA Cultural Concierge when we came to BA in April for three days. This was our first trip to Buenos Aires, so decided to leave it all up to Juan our amazing tour guide. Juan did a fantastic job taking us around giving us a history of BA and catering for our needs as we had our 4yr old boy with us. He is still asking when we will se his friend Juan again.. Juan also helped us with recommendations of were to eat, shop and organised all our pick ups and drop offs at Airports. We fell in love with BA and will be back to explore more with BA Cultural Concierge. My family would highly recommend you use BA Cultural Concierge for your next trip to Buenos Aires. Thank you so much guys.

First class. We had an absolutely first class day tour of Buenos Aires, in which we took in all of the major sights and attractions this wonderful city has to offer. Our guide, Madi, was incredibly informative and friendly and we enjoyed a superb few hours with her during which we were given an insight into the history of BA and life as a porteno. More so, she provided us with some excellent restaurant recommendations as well as hints and tips which enabled us to make the best of the few days we had in Buenos Aires. There was a misunderstanding regarding the price and this was handled very professionally and honestly, which is not always the case with ground agents.If you are after a BA tour I would look no further. Based on my experience with them, I would highly recommend.

Wonderful, wonderful Madi Lang. I researched Tripadvisor for a tour guide in Buenos Aires and am so glad I came upon Madi Lang. She is not only a fantastic guide but a true concierge for your stay in Buenos Aires. We spent 3 days in Buenos Aires before our cruise ship's departure. I emailed Madi many times prior to our arrival and she took care of everything with many excellent suggestions. She arranged for a driver to pick us up at the airport (at half the price we would have paid a taxi or our hotel) also took us to our ship on the last day and drove us for our tour with Madi. Madi gave us an excellent full day tour of the different areas of Buenos Aires. She is very pleasant and knowledgable, a real sweetheart to spend the day with. Clearly she loves Buenos Aires and wants to share that with you. This was our first time to visit Buenos Aires so we had LOTS of questions before we arrived - where to stay, what to do, where to eat, etc. Madi is very prompt to answer emails and had many thoughtful suggestions. She made dinner reservations, tango show reservations, and arranged for us to visit 3 milongas at night with a tango dancer. We left Buenos Aires with a feeling that we had experienced this wonderful city. If you are going to Buenos Aires - RUN, do not walk to your computer and enlist Madi's services for your visit ( madi.lang@gmail.com). You will not be sorry. She also has a website - www.BACulturalConcierge.com

The smartest thing we did in Buenos Aires. If your first language is English, and you are spending more than a few days in Buenos Aires, then you absolutely must make contact with Madi.Ultra professional, and a pleasure to deal with, Madi helped us organise an idyllic 5 day visit.Our first full day was spent on a private tour, concentrating on La Boca and San Telmo. This was the best introduction to Buenos Aires.Madi was always available to help with any issues that arose, and actually saved us money.I highly recommend BA cultural concierge as an essential itinerary planner for Buenos Aires.

Perfect, exactly what we asked for, and more.. We asked Madi for a non-standard tour of BA. Madi came thru with one of the most intriguing tours we’ve ever had. From our late night Tango tour, that lasted to the wee hours to our tour of BA the next day. Madi’s choices were exactly what we had asked for. For a while my husband and I felt we were on one of those food TV shows. You know the sort of one where the lead character gets to travel to far off locations. They get to see and do all those special activities. You know the sort of activities we all wish we could do when traveling to new places. Well, we did them and we enjoyed it all. I wish we could bottle Madi and have her available in all the places we travel to. Nuff said, Thank you Madi.

An unforgettable experience. I found out about this service from trip advisor but note that it's also mentioned in the Lonely Planet guide book. All arrangements were made with Madi by e mail and although we never actually met she was always prompt with replies and advice. I was interested in guided tours, the Sunday fairs and photographing major sites. All of this was adressed and more! Madi hooked me up with Juan who was absolutely brilliant. I have nothing but praise for him. He was friendly, knowledgeable and made the city come alive.....as promised. On my second outing we went to the Mataderos fair which was so interesting, followed up by the fair at San Telmo to catch the inevitable tango...... amongst other things. Both were really different and I feel Juan and I became firm friends rather than tour guide and customer. I particularly liked trying the street food on offer as well as getting close to the locals. His understanding of the city's history also made my city tour fly by. Madi also arranged for a "photography lesson/tour" with Foto Ruta. Joss was my guide/teacher for the day. Madi and Joss made sure I didn't visit the same sites twice. This made such an impression that I decided to take a smilar tour/lesson in Santiago the next week. My whole BA trip was a joy. If you can afford it, seriously give the BA Cultural Concierge a whirl. You wont be disappointed!

Made our trip in BA shine. I don't know what we would have done without Madi Lang in Buenos Aires -- she made sure our trip ran smoothly and customized the entire vacation perfectly to our needs. She is also an amazing tour guide, so incredibly knowledgeable, informative and fun, I couldn't recommend her more!

Brilliant Tour!. Madi is quick to respond, listens then creates a tour to meet your interests and time frame. We contacted her at the last minute plus had a short window for touring the city. She is informative, fun, hits the highlights and makes the most out of your tour. We have had the "boring/ talkative" tour guides before and she puts them all to shame with her knowledge and presentation. We learned so much and had an absolutely brilliant tour. I recommend her highly and then some...

Buenos Aires experience. We were finishing a cruise in BA with two friends, and Madi Lang arranged a personal tour with alocal guide and tango dancer! We saw places that would not have been on any tour, and spent the day of our late-night flight home at an estancia outside the city - beautiful, relaxing and very welcoming. The touring vehicles were first-rate, and making arrangements was easy. Madi paid attention to our wishes and needs, and added her own knowledge to make the experience great. Use BA Cultural Concierge when visiting Buenos Aires!

Very informative, professional and personal. Madi was really great, took us on a lovely walking tour of BA. She's got her finger on the pulse and if you need someone to arrange your holiday in BA these are the guys to do it.

Phenominal. Madi Lang customized our tour to match our interests after speaking with us for only a few minutes. She took us to see places we would never had known about and could not have asked to be included in our tour. She is charming and gracious which nakes her the perfect guide, My husband and I are not easy to guide as we have travelled enough to be a bit skeptical of tours. Madi never gave us the feeling that we were hearing the same words she said to each tour or seeing the same places she showed to everyone. We toured with Madi for two days and were excited to see and hear what she presented to us. I really put her to the test as I had brought heavier tops than the weather required. She took me to find some tops that were at great boutiques and were in a plus size and on sale. Combine that with the history and architecture and culture that she presented to us and you really have OUR perfect trip. She will create YOUR perfect trip with you.

Outstanding and Positively Memorable Experience. We had never been to Buenos Aires (or Argentina for that matter) and we would have been completely lost without BA Cultural Concierge. Madi and Juan were absolutely remarkable and helped us achieve a vacation that we'll always remember.Even though we took our girls (4 years old and one year old) with us, we came away from the vacation feeling like we achieved a true couples time away. Madi designed our program so that we and our girls could enjoy family time during the day, while at night we went on "couples retreat" type activities. Our daughters took to Juan like family they had known for a long time and could not wait for him to return everyday. We left Argentina knowing we had gained new friends in Madi and Juan. We also resolved that if they ever expand outside of Argentina, we would be very happy to engage them to help us if they are in the countries we are visiting.Best,Lekan & Tamera

Seeing Buenos Aires the right way!. If you will be visiting BA you MUST contact BA Cultural Exchange and seek out Mady! Fantastic! First off, she is responsive and if you are familiar with the culture you know that is not a given! Second, she is knowledgeable and passionate. Third, she is flexible, friendly and delivers information conversationally. No lectures, just sharing and she has a lot to share. Mady is by far the best guide we have had in all our travels. Highly recommend her.

BA Cultural Concierge review. Madi Lang, based in Buenos Aires, organized our entire trip to BA. We are a family with a 10 year old and my mother and Madi proved invaluable in organizing tours, transfers and accommodating the needs of a multi-generational family. Madi knows quite a bit about Argentina and the politics, economy and stories that make a tour rich in culture. Her no-problem, can-do professionalism was great. She has a wonderful person, Juan Palacios, who also helped make the trip complete. Highly recommend.

Invaluable on the ground assistance. Besides organizing a great half-day tour of BA, customized for my mother (who has mobility issues) Madi also proved how invaluable it is to have someone on the ground who can help when problems arise. I had arranged a transfer from our hotel to the cruise ship terminal in BA, and the morning of our transfer there was a major fire at the cargo portion of the port - with toxic smoke, the port in lockdown mode and lots of confusion. Madi came to our hotel, helped assess the situation and then got us to the port when she was sure things were safe. The majority of our fellow shipmates, who relied on the cruise ship company for info and transfers, had a much more frustrating experience.

a MUST do!. It's now been a year since i spent a month in BA, and when i think back to the wonderful stories, places and people i met, they all seem to sprout from the afternoon tour i took with Madi. She seriously knows her stuff, and introduced me to a mountain of knowledge and culture i wouldn't have come across otherwise. When booking, she emailed me back the next day, and asked what i wanted to see, how long i was going to be there, and what (if anything) i had heard about before, and offered numerous suggestions (in a friendly, and non pushy way) that had me even more excited in getting there. Punctual, warm and friendly, and with a great passion for the place, she oozed enthusiasm for the city and the people within it. So much so, i took 2 more tours with her over the following weeks! Taking an afternoon tour with Madi is a definite requirement for visiting BA, and i know when i'm back next i'll be wowing my friends with another one. I couldnt do the vibe and feel of the place justice, and she sure can! great for any age, and a massive eye opener to one of the greatest cities in the world!

Outstanding service. If you are going to BA you need to book Madi!! She is absolutely awesome. My husband and I visited buenos aires as part of our honeymoon while touring around South America. She was the only "concierge" service we booked so I was a little sceptical as to what her service entailed. I cannot believe now that I would have ever considered not booking her. Not only is she reasonably priced but she saved us so much time with five laid out days of itineraries (including some down time) and saved us money by recommending restaurants where locals eat. Without us knowing she requested that we have the most romantic seat in each restaurant and some restaurants even gave us a complimentary glass of prosecco when Madi told them thst we were on honeymoon! She arranged a trip to Uruguay, futbol a tango show and so much more for us. Her tour of the city was refreshing and interesting. She also dropped us in a local phone and arranged airport transfers for us. She was on the email to me constantly during our stay answering my many last minute queries. She also was quick to reply to my many emails prior to our visit. I really cannot recommend her highly enough.

Madi is awesome! Don't go to BA without her!. It was our first trip to South America and BA was definitely on our list. My wife found Madi while searching the web and we now realize how lucky a find this was for us. Madi asked all the right questions and got to know us well before the planning began. We were traveling with our two daughters (4 & 8) and we obviously needed to keep them entertained. She had a ton of great suggestions and we narrowed the trip down to some specific events that gave us just the right amount of arranged appointments and free time to roam the city. The attractions and people she set us up with were all fantastic, we loved them all and felt we made friends along the way. We left BA for Chile where we had done our own planning and this leg of the trip was no where near as cool as what we had with Madi at the lead. If only she had been our Concierge in Chile...The trip was a perfect and we truly thank Madi for her role in making it happen. Our family is a big fan of BA Cultural Concierge! This is how travel should be!

Madi from BA Cultural Concierge Rules!. I was recently in Buenos Aires for a short trip so I wanted to make sure to get in as much as possible. A few weeks before arriving in the city, I emailed back and forth with Madi from BA Cultural Concierge and she was always prompt to answer any questions in a very friendly and approachable way. I knew before meeting Madi that it was going to be a wonderful experience and I was right! Madi came to my hotel to meet me on my first day and we took a taxi together to experience the Feria de Mataderos. On the first day in a new city, it’s so nice and definitely takes a load off being with a local who knows exactly where to go. Madi was able to guide us around to all the different stalls and because she knew I was a foodie from our emails, she made sure to take us to this amazing pulperia for empanadas and locra stew made fresh right in front of you. Not very many people working in the Feria speak English so it was so helpful to have Madi, who’s Spanish is excellent and beyond impressive, to ask questions about certain products that were being sold in the stalls. To end the day, Madi busted out a thermos and mate gourd and made us mate which was an amazing touch of the local culture but also helped warm us up on a particularly chilly day. It was such a sweet thing to think of to do. Madi naturally creates a sense of comfort that makes it feel like you’re just hanging out with a friend. For my second day, we had wanted to get a historical tour/background on Buenos Aires as well as get acquainted with the public transport so that we had a good base to work off of the rest of the week, so I enlisted the amazing help of Madi again. She showed my mom and I how to use the bus and subway and what the best route to take would be for certain locations so that when left on our own for the rest of the week we’d know exactly what to do and where to go. Along with her extensive knowledge and genuine passion for Buenos Aires, Madi from BA Cultural Concierge truly knows how to provide an incredible tour. I would most definitely recommend her to anyone who wants a personalized and friendly experience!

Get ready for the best travel experience!. I was trying to plan the perfect trip for my husband's "big" birthday but between throwing a surprise party, work and other demands, it seemed impossible. I found Madi on Trip Advisor listed with other tour options. Could I have planned our own trip? Yes Would it have been fun? Yes. I would have used the Tripadvisor selections and had a good time. Would it have been as perfect? No. Madi is able to customize your experience so it fits your personality, budget and energy level. Our experience was awesome and she was just an email or phone call away to make last minute adjustments and to help us navigate through the city. We are very experienced travelers but she is an expert on the city, the sites and the surrounding areas. She sent a pre-trip check list that included a reading list, packing tips and other helpful ideas. We corresponded through e-mail and Skype before the trip and she sent a day by day itinerary that was easy to follow and very thorough. I was able to pre-pay using PayPal for most of the excursions which took away the stress of changing money and carrying cash. I recommend Madi and her crew of guides. You won't be disappointed.

Helped me get to know my new home city. I moved to BA in December with little more than my backpack and a job offer in the city. What was initially an incredibly daunting prospect (moving to an uknown city on the other side of the world), became manageable and exciting thanks to Madi. I contacted her while i was planning my move from London, and she helped me with everything from finding a flat, to helping set me up with local contacts and an introduction to the city when i arrived. She was incredibly helpful and generous with her time, throughout the move process and gave me a great intro to the city on my arrival. I'd definitely recommend getting in touch with Madi if you're heading to BA

Madi Knows Buenos Aires. Our July 7, 2012 tour started with Madi laying out a map of the city on a table and orienting us to what we would see during the day. The perspective she brings is one of a rich understanding of the history of the country and the city. She then very nicely wraps the tour into this historical context. Madi was able to answer all of our questions, make changes on the fly as our interests shifted during the tour (6 hours on our feet), and her energy level remained high throughout. I left feeling as if the day was very solid, I saw things I wanted to see, I saw things I never would have seen on my own, and that if I ever came back, I could likely navigate BA a little bit more comfortably on my own. If you're coming to BA, call Madi!

Solo in BA. I was traveling alone to BA to visit my daughter, a college student doing a semester abroad in BA (what a great choice!) I knew I would have 4 full days entirely on my own so I contacted Madi when I found her website, only a few days before I left for my trip. Madi was very responsive, even though she was on vacation herself. Everything she arranged for me was as promised. The tours, transportation and day trips were exactly as we discussed and I enjoyed each one. The traveler tips were great especially since I speak no Spanish and was traveling on my own. My daughter and I tried 3 of the restaurants Madi recommended near my hotel, all were excellent and fun. Madi customized the trip for me, based upon my interests. I cannot say enough about how she helped me get the most out of my trip. Everyone I met who knows Madi (tour guides, wine expert, etc.) have the highest respect for her efforts to show the place she has come to love to others. Hire Madi!

Would hire Madi again. We visited BA for 1 week in March 2012, with 3 children ages 12 and below. Madi really helped us organize our time to make the most of our visit. She was very helpful in recommending and coordinating excursions for us. She met us on our first day in BA to review our itinerary and give suggestions for local restaurants etc. She was very friendly. She even organized a scavenger hunt for our kids to complete during their week and arrived with a prize for the top finisher on the day we left. When we had trouble accessing our ATM accounts, she exchanged our currency into local dollars at fair market value. If we ever had any problems, she was a quick text away and was able to assist us. We have never hired a concierge service before but found her exceptionally helpful and would recommend her unreservedly.

Madi is awesome!. We just returned from a 3+ week trip around Argentina and had found Madi through a referral and twitter. We have 3 kids (6,4,1.5) so wanted some help and Madi over delivered.She helped us figure out our whole itinerary, booked all the inter-country travel, found apartments, arranged transfers with a car seat, booked a stroller for the city, shopped so when we arrived we had some basics for the kids. She knows a ton about the country and Buenos Aires so even though we didn't do any formal tours, we learned a lot.Beyond the basics, she found a friend that cooked us Asado at the apartment's BBQ on the terrace, figured out great spots for the kids - hands on science museum, baby-sat so we could go to a tango show on our last night.... I could go on and on!Great job BA Cultural Concierge! If you are traveling to Argentina, you need to contact Madi, we're fans.

Great inside knowledge.. Hiring Madi was a stroke of good luck. It was so nice to be able to plan the trip that we wanted instead of a generic tour. We able to stay at small boutique hotels and book reservations at excellent restaurants due to her local knowledge. I would definitely recommend.
Out of this world guide. Madi Lang is a most wonderful guide, full of personality, informative, caring, polite . You will feel at home in BA after a tour with her

A very valuable experience. We had one afternoon and one full day in Buenos Aires between the Iguazu falls and Ushuaia and Madi did her best to get us transfers, a tango show and a most enjoyablevisit with her as a guide .We could not expect to see and learn more that we had in such a short time in this big and vibrant city with a English and Spanish speaking,knowledgeable and most agreeable person.Also attentive to our needs and ready to make changes in order to get us the best possible deal.Warmly recommended.

Madi provided us an extraordinary vacation. This was our first trip to Buenos Aires and we were very excited. We had read all of the guidebooks and knew generally what we wanted to do, but we still had questions… And then through pure serendipity, we met somebody who referred us to Madi Lang at BA Cultural Concierge. Madi was able to assist our planning and make us feel much more confident about some of our choices. More importantly, she was able to suggest a number of alternatives that only a ‘native’ would be aware of. Once arriving in BA and meeting Madi, it was immediately obvious that she loves the country and makes an ongoing effort to learn more about the Argentine people and history to spice up her tours with interesting facts. And yet Madi is a US citizen with an office near Washington, DC. This made it much easier to send deposits and prepay certain aspects of our trip. Madi Lang was the difference between having a very good trip and having an extraordinary experience that we will remember our whole lives. Thank you Madi!

Madi rocks!. I learned about Madi from a link I found on Cruise Critic. I was planning a South American cruise on Celebrity on very short notice. SO glad to have found Madi! She took care of our ground transport arriving in BsAs and switching airports, also arranged for transfer from airport to BsAs hotel upon our return from Iguazu Falls. We did about a 6-hour tour with her and a driver. We were happy and relieved that she totally took charge. We saw some things we would not have seen without her. I would recommend her to anyone heading to Buenos Aires for any reason. She is very professional, always reachable, and a terrific resource, particularly for Americans traveling to Argentina. She knows lots of Argentine history and wove nuggets of it throughout our tour. She also knew just where to take us to find beautiful Argentine handbags in BsAs that won't set you back and arm and a leg. Just email her, you'll be so glad you did!

An open door to a wonderful city and culture. We enjoyed our tour with BA Cultural Concierge and Madi because she was completely in tune with what we wanted to see and understand about Buenos Aires. By sharing her sincere interest in the city and her personal observations as well as an incredible historical knowledge, we gained insights that we could not have obtained from any other tour. We recommend this tour who wants to see and understand the real Buenos Aires.

Madi made our trip to Buenos Aires a great success!. Thank goodness a friend recommended that we contact Madi to plan our 5 days in Buenos Aires! Madi listened to our interests, asked great questions, then helped us plan a great trip. She planned our days in ways that made good sense, worked well, and took account of distances and holiday closings. We ate in fabulous restaurants, usually the only tourists in the place. She planned an art and gallery-browsing day for me and my husband that was wonderful, right in keeping with our interests. My teen daughters and I had 2 great afternoons shopping in great neighborhoods - we kept saying "we never would have found this great place without Madi!". Although she was out of town when we were there, she was always available and her wonderful partner, Jed, took great care of us. Thought, she was delightful, responsive, a pleasure to work with. We heartily recommend Madi!!!!

Extraordinarily Helpful & Knowledgable!. B.A. Cultural Concierge was recommended to us as we prepared for a trip to Buenos Aires. We were to be in Buenos Aires for 6 days and we wanted to make sure we made the most of our time. We did quite a bit of research about the city and had a good idea as to what we wanted to do, but we were looking for advice on hotels, areas to stay, etc. We contacted Madi and, from the start, we were extremely pleased by her suggestions. She understood that we had a pretty good idea of what we wanted to do, and offered us a package that complimented our plans perfectly. We spoke with and emailed her about 5 times before arriving in Buenos Aires and, each time, she had a new suggestion or idea that fit perfectly into what we were planning. When we arrived, we did a city tour with Madi that was absolutely fantastic. We visited a number of areas by foot, taxi and subway, and she provided a fascinating historical and cultural perspective on each area that we visited. She also booked us for some neat things that we wouldn’t have even thought of, like a closed-door restaurant at a chef’s house! When a minor problem arose, she was able to dealt with and resolved quickly and effectively. Madi was able to key into exactly what we wanted to do and plan our itinerary around that. As a result, we made the most of our time in Buenos Aires and had a great time. We couldn’t have asked for more! We can’t recommend her highly enough!

An invaluable resource in Bueno Aires. My 18 year old son was in BA last week and thought he might have developed a blood clot on the flight. He had one before, so we were all very concerned. He emailed to tell me he went to a hospital and it was such a zoo, he just left. Luckily, I quickly found Madi's blog with a search and was able to identify and even send the address for a couple of excellent hospitals. My son later had tests at both and felt very confident in the care and results (negative, thank goodness). He went to both the Swiss Mediacl Center and Hospital Aleman. Both were good but he liked SMC near Palermo the best.In addition, when I thought he may have to stay at the hospital, Madi offerred to help us with his things back at the hostel, translation or just a friendly face. I cannot say enough about her kind nature and avaialbility to help even after hours. I cannot imagine a better resource in BA whether you are there, or need help long distance. Thanks, Madi. Brooks Cowles, Atlanta, GA, USA

I would have missed so much . . .. On my second trip to Buenos Aires, I contacted Madi Lang (BA Cultural Concierge) on the recommendation of a friend. I had seen the major sights on my first visit. This time, arriving after a wonderful stay in Cusco, Peru, immersed in the culture of the Andean Highlands, I was primed for a more intimate relationship with Buenos Aires. Madi provided insights you cannot get from guidebooks. Walking along, seeing the evidence of the history and culture, the fascinating stories of multi-faceted Buenos Aires came alive for me. The great thing is that I know BA Cultural Concierge will serve up more and different experiences when I visit again.

Best personalised attention available in Buenos Aires. And great value for money!. We found BA Cultural Concierge and Madi Lang in October 2010 on the Lonely Planet guide to Argentina as a highly recommended cultural concierge. We were looking for someone to help us find an apartment to stay in, because we were a bit overwhelmed by all the apartment listings (and they were filling up really quickly).To be honest, it felt a bit strange for us to think of hiring a concierge in the beginning, because my girlfriend and I are not exactly the "Concierge" type. We're seasoned explorers with plenty of experience dealing with situations that would stress out or frustrate most people. However, as we were short on time, and really felt like it would make a difference for someone on the ground in Buenos Aires to be able to look at the apartment, check on the contract / landlord, we recruited Madi to help and report back to us.From the very beginning, Madi comes across as a very professional and courteous person. She got started within 24 hours of our request, and in a little over three days had an apartment that later turned out to be absolutely fantastic (we're still living in it!). We sent her what seemed like an infinitely long shortlist, and she went to visit each one of the ones available to give us the pros and cons of each place. When I landed in Buenos Aires, she was waiting for me at the apartment to help me with the paper work and give me a small welcome talk. She also helped me peruse the rental contract (as it was in Spanish), and check for any inconsistencies before I signed it.We were so impressed with her work that we recruited her a second time to help us find a weekend getaway in San Antonio de Areco during the gaucho festival in November. She managed to find an available estancia that later turned out to be an absolutely marvelous little gem (and one that we will be writing a review for in just a bit!).While we may not have a good comparision as Madi is the first concierge we've ever sought help from, we have no doubt that she is the best option for anyone who needs help planning a visit to Argentina. Whether it to check out an apartment or organise your trip as a whole, she has devoted a lot of time to understanding Buenos Aires and Argentina and uses this knowledge to provide a top quality service. What we liked most about her was that at no point in time did we feel pressured to choose "her option". She always presented each option in equally good and poor light, and while she expressed her personal ideas on which options may be better, it was done tastefully, and with enough breathing room for us to come to our own decision.Finally, BA Cultural Concierge's services are also very good value for money. Both the apartment hunt and the estancia arrangement were organised for us at a sum that we felt was more than reasonable.We highly recommend BA Cultural Concierge and Madi Lang for any Argentina related travel assistance. A double recommendation if your Spanish is weak or non-existent!

BA Cultural Concierge - superb. I was in Buenos Aires for 4 days December, 2010. I found the service on Trip Advisor and was so happy I did. Madi Lang, the concierge is a young woman from Baltimore who move to BA 4-5 years ago and started the business. She is smart, personable, and a terrific person. She helped me figure out what I wanted to see, arranged an airport transfer with this georgeous guy (not necessary but very nice), and was overall welcoming. The first day we walked for 4 hours, San Telmo, Recoletta, took the old subway car, and had lunch. Walking back to the hotel I tripped. Blood was down my slacks. She went with me to the hotel, where I was bandaged, and took me to the German Hospital. She stayed with me the entire time and tranaslated. Nothing broken but I needed stitches. The hospital wouldn't accept my credit card without a passport and I had minimal cash. Madi went back to my hotel and retrieved my passport. After the hospital she shepherded me to a brace store and helped procure a brace for my leg. Canceallaiton of remainder of tours.Madi called that night to see if I was OK, and had another georgeous guy stop by the next day to make sure I was fine. She had given him a book and an Argentinian book of photos to give to me.The third day Madi came back to the hotel, picked me up and got a cab, taking me back to the German Hospital for a look-see at my knee. Again, she did this on her own time despite my protestations.When I returned home I received a message from her just checking.I can only hope others meet Madi Lan, truly an exceptional human being. Without her presence, my time in Buenos Aires would have been scary. I recommend her to a visitor without exception. I cannot wait to return to BA, and reconncect with her.Marcia

BA Cultural Concierge made our visit to Buenos Aires a perfect 10.. My husband and I and our two adult children decided to be adventurous and rent an apartment for the week in Palermo Soho in Buenos AIres. We had not done this before and one of the only hesitations was the lack of a hotel concierge. How fortunate we were to have stumbled upon BA Cultural Concierge and Madi Lang while doing online research for the trip. She was professional from the start and was able to get to know us via skype weeks before our arrival. Over the course of a month we fine tuned the schedule for the week. Madi was always responsive and creative. When we arrived in Buenos Aires she agreed to meet us at the apartment that afternoon. I can't tell you how wonderful it was to have a friendly English speaking American give us a quick orientation to BA on our arrival day. She took us around the next morning on a city tour with a car and driver to give us an overview and let us establish some bearings. After that day, she was always an instant message or local phone call away. She gave advice, changed reservations, advocated, translated and generally made us feel at ease. Even when there was a mini crisis with our apartment, she was a voice of calm. We all agree that Madi Lang and BA Cultural Concierge deserve high marks. If you have any reservations about renting an apartment - don't - just hire Madi.

The best guide and helper in Buenos Aires. We just returned from a 9 day trip to Buenos Aires. We hired Madi Lang from BA Cultural Concierge to help us navigate around the city and area. Madi lives in Buenos Aires after growing up in the US. She understands the US traveler and is an expert on Buenos Aires and Argentina. Madi was available to us all day, every day during our trip. Helping us decide where to go and what to do. Madi recommended restaurants and made all the reservations. She helped us pick a Tango show to go to, and secured our boat tickets for a day trip to Colonia, Uruguay. Madi also served as our guide early in our trip to help us get to know the city and where we might go back to during our stay. There was nothing that Madi did not/could not help us with. Her English is perfect (she grew up in the US) and he Spanish is even better. She had us picked up at the airport when we arrived and made sure we got back to airport at the end of our visit. She was available on the phone, via email and via text messages day and night, always responding promptly with expert help and advice. All the benefits of a five star hotel concierge desk but with the added advantage of being able to be in contact from anywhere at anytime. I would highly recommend Madi for your next trip to Buenos Aires. Your trip will be enhanced and more enjoyable.

Lets you get on with enjoying BA without the hassel. Madi was very helpful in providing us with guidance and information prior to our arrival in Buenos Aires and once there, gave us a good orientation to the city and subte. Her information helped reduce the amount of time spent trying to figure out the city or where to find things. Madi was also very helpful in lining up tickets to events and activities that met all of our interests. Further, when we decided to leave BA a day early, on a holiday monday, she helped out by taking the keys to the rental company the next day and hanging onto our deposit for us until we returned to BA a couple of weeks later. This is the first time we have used a concierge service. I wouldn't bother in most places but I was very glad that we chose to do so in BA. Madi made our time there effortless and I always felt that we had a friend in the country that we could turn to if need be.

Fantastic service!. I would recommend anyone travelling to Buenos Aires to contact Madi. She is extremely knowledgable, super fun and she treats her clients like family.
