She made us feel like the city was our home and made sure that our stay was comfortable. She goes above and beyond expectations to make sure your trip to Buenos Aires is unforgettable.

Wonderful Buenos Aires Planner, Guide, and Companion!!!. I was put in charge of arranging a pre-cruise and post-cruise Buenos Aires visit for my Dadand Uncle for January, 2010. Both of the gents are 80ish, have mobility problems, and neither speaks much Spanish. Having never been to Buenos Aires, I wanted someone familiar with the city to assist with planning. I found an ad for BA Cultural Concierge on Landingpad BA, and I went to their website. The proprietor of BA Cultural Concierge is Madi Lang, a native of Maryland, who's been living in, writing about, and sharing Buenos Aires the last several years. It was evident from Madi's website that she could provide all of the services necessary ( planning, transfers, reservations, tours, errands, accompaniment...even gift baskets! ) to make the boys' Buenos Aires visit as enjoyable, enriching, and stress-free as possible. Plus, the website has links to some of Madi's interesting and well-written articles on a variety of Buenos Aires topics. I was very intrigued after perusing the website and reading the articles, so I e-mailed a lengthy initial inquiry to Madi. The next day, I received a pleasant and very detailed reply from Madi's intern, Emily. Emily provided clear, well thought out answers to my questions, and had some good questions for me. I felt very comfortable leaving the Buenos Aires arrangements to Ba Cultural Concierge.Madi and Emily ended up arranging most of the airport and cruise pier transfers, a tango show at Cafe Tortoni, a day trip to an estancia, a walking tour of the Recoleta neighborhood where the hotel was located, a tour of the beautiful Recoleta Cemetery, a city tour in an air-conditioned van, a Sunday brunch at the Alvear Palace Hotel, a Sunday afternoon at the San Telmo street fair, and a "cafe chat" with a local economist who discussed Argentina's economy, culture, and history. The ladies also put together a beautiful gift box chock full of Argentinean treats! Best of all, per my request, one or both of the ladies was available to provide accompaniment to all of the above activities. Sadly, my Uncle had to back out of the trip the week before departure, but, luckily, I was available to be his substitute. I feel very fortunate to have been able to spend a few weeks of quality time with Dad, go on a spectacular South America/Antartica cruise, and hang out with Madi and Emily in Buenos Aires. The ladies did a fantastic job of planning and executing all of our Buenos Aires activities. Everything went off without a hitch. Madi and Emily are both knowledgable, caring, full of cheer and good humor, and Dad and I truly enjoyed our time with them.

BA Cultural Concierge. We recently returned from a 4-day visit to Buenos Aires, and thank goodness for BA Cultural Concierge! If this is your first visit to Buenos Aires, and you are an English speaking American, you will love these girls! A complete guided tour of the city with a private car and driver from the airport or the Buquebus Ferry - way to go! They will help you with all your acitvities and reservations too without a hitch. Charming, knowledgeable and efficient - what more can you want!

The best one!. Very nice free tour. I strongly recommend the one with Vicky in the morning and you also must attend The tour with Jimena in the afternoon. A must things to do if you visit Buenos Aires. The girls are the best. They share a lot of information in a very nice way, they are friendly, easy going, telling you tips and are open for any advices. THANKS Ladies for making Buenos Aires visit even more memorable.

Great tours of BA!. We took both the morning and afternoon tours with Jimena and both were excellent! She is a wonderful and engaging storyteller and we learned so much about Buenos Aires and Argentinian life, history and culture. I'm not usually a fan of walking tours, but this came highly recommended and I can see why!

Excellent tour of the iconic sites of central Buenos Aires. The morning tour gathered very near to my hotel in Congresso, and the guide Vicky was easy to find, wearing a green jacket. It was quite a large group of around 30 people, but she managed to keep everyone together, interested and amused while she walked us round the main sites of central Buenos Aires. Her tales were a good mixture of politics, sport and local custom, and I felt well introduced to city after my first morning in the place. Great way to start a visit, and highly recommended.

Great way to spend several hours. We did this tour at 11am with Victoria or as she said her friends call her Vickie. Vickie was friendly and passionate so she made the tour great, lots of interesting spots to visit and good information. The tour is free and lasted approx. two and a half hours, we gave a tip as the tour was definitely worthwhile. We had a layover in Buenos Aires so we could only do the morning tour, but the next time we visit we will definitely sign up for other tours. Lots to do and eat in Buenos Aires!!

Great tour!. Had a great time doing the tour (we did the one in the morning). Our group was small as it was a very cold and wet day, but we were still able to see everything. We did the tour with Jimena who was friendly, and spoke perfect English. She gave lots of interesting tips and info about the city. Would definitely recommend doing this tour, especially during the first stages of your trip to the city, that way if you see a point that you like and want to go back to, you know how to get there.

Best way to see and learn about the city. The best possible way to start your trip in the city. You meet friendly locals who show you around, explain with passion the history and make you leave the tour feeling immersed into the city. We did 2 free tours...missing city tour and aristocrat afternoon your. Great guides Victoria and Jimena. Thank you so much! We came back home searching and looking to learn more about argentina 's history. Highly recommended

Excellent walking tours. We went on both the Aristocratic and the city walks, both times we had Jimena (sorry if spelling is wrong) as a guide. She is just lovely and is so full of energy and fun information. We would recommend this company to anyone. Buenos Aires is a fantastic city to explore

Great way to know the city. Yesterday we took both tours - the morning tour with Jimena and the afternoon one with Victoria. They were fun tours with Jimena and Victoria pouring their knowledge on us through enthusiastic and playful show. The historical and cultural places were put in context, explained how they and Argentina came to become what they are. In the morning were in a group of 8, in the afternoon in a little bit bigger group and it was nice to talk with people from other places around the globe.All in all - highly recommended.

Best experience in BA, better than Tango show. I went on the 5PM walking tour from Plaza San Martín to Recoleta Cemetery, the tour guide Jemina (sorry if I misspell) was awesome and very energetic, she is like the Emilia Clarke of BA! I like the inside views and stories she gave, it was very interesting, not something you can read about in a guide book or even in Wikipedia. It is a MUST DO stuff in BA, and please do support them with donations so they can maintain this great tour!

Excellent way to see and learn about Argentina and BA. I took the 11.00 am city tour. Just show up and look for a green jacket. I had Jemena as a guide and she was an excellent source of knowledge about what we were seeing and also about the history and culture of Argentina and BA. An informed tour like this brings to life the buildings and areas that you walk through.

Get A Porteno's View with Buenos Aires Free Tours. Took both the 11 AM city tour and the 5 PM aristocratic tour. Victoria gave a great morning city tour from Congresso to Plaza de Mayo to Avenue 9 de Julio. Loved the insider's view and secrets of the city--like looking up at a little house on top of a high-rise, finding out about the daily protests in Plaza de Mayo and learning where the Pope had his hair cut. The architectural beauty of this "French" inspired city will leave you wanting more. Jimena was so delightful. She gave a very fun and educational tour of Retiro and Recoleta which started at the San Martin statue. Her insight into the "aristocracy" really helped make you understand the history of Buenos Aires and Argentina. Don't miss Gran Gomero which is so old and so heavy that Atlas helps to hold it up and the ultimate architectural revenge, the Kavanagh building.Make sure to tip these guides. They are amazing.

Relaxed, knowledgeable and approachable. A fun, informative and engaging walking tour around the central plazas and streets. A comfortable walking distance and time to meet new people from around the globe.

Unprofessional walking tour. Lacking in substance, with no content, nor factual information.Guide was friendly with good command of the language, however, she rushed through the "information" to such an extent that it was largely incomprehensive even to a native English speaker.Futhermore, her speech had no depth and was littered with political bias with too many adjectives and minimal facts. We left the tour at Plaza de Mayo feeling dissapointed, as we had expected to engage with a factual and well-presented history lesson of my country. They should know that tourists are not interested in political propaganda. As Argentinian myself and having taken free walking tours around the world, I feel embarassed by this one at home. I apologize.

Jimena was an excellent guide!. We took both tours available, and coincidentally had Jimena for both. She was very knowledgeable, so friendly, and really spent time talking through the history and culture of the city. We really enjoyed it!

Excellent walking tour. I took the city center tour. This is a good, well planned tour. Our guide provided lots of historical and political information along with some amusing and interesting anecdotes. Well worth the time.

Informative walking tour. The best way to get oriented to a new city is to take a free walking tour first. We took the free walking tour at 11:00am with Vicky. She speaks English well and she stops periodically in front of different sites to speak with us and provide interesting background information about Argentine history. It takes about 2 1/2 hours and the pace is relaxed, so no one in our group felt it was demanding. Keep in mind that you are only seeing a few major sites in the central BA. I followed up with a private tour of BA, in order to see the key sites located in other parts of BA, such as Recoleta cemetery. Most important advice is, avoid the hop on hop off bus tour. I would not bother with this, even if it was free.

Excellent friendly guide. Did the 11am BA free tour leaving from the Congress. Our guide Vicky was knowledgeable, friendly, spoke perfect English. Was great to hear some BA history and see some highlights. I also appreciated that she gave us a suggested amount to pay - $20usd per person. She was very helpful in recommending more sites to see and places to eat. We also booked our tango show through this company and they were great to work with

Great walking tour. I normally hate tours but decided to try this one based on a recommendation from my parents. I ended up doing both the Afternoon and Morning tours. This is the one with the green shirts. Jimena was the guide for both tours. I really liked her, she has a wonderful personality with a great spirit about her. She was very expressive in her stories and was very knowledgeable being able to answer any questions. Her english was the best of anyone I spoke to on my entire south america trip. The afternoon tour only had one other person. There was some light rain but overall not bad. Some of the sites are ones I would have never thought of visiting but everything fit together. In the morning there were 3 other people. Light rain also but very windy. By the end, every inch of my body was soaking wet and I was freezing. This tour was more historic. Both tours were great though. I think I found the afternoon tour a little more interesting with all the great stories (and better weather). My only criticism would be that the website isnt too clear. I think people mix up this tour with BA Free walks alot. Overall, I was very impressed with Jimena's enthusiasm and passion especially with the weather and so few people. I'd definitely recommend this tour to anyone, maybe in better weather..

Informative English speaking tour . Vicky was very friendly, informative and a perfect tour guide for the city of BA. She gave us plenty of opportunities to take pictures and showed us a few secrets of buenos aires. Perfect for any English speaking tourists. It was free however we gave Vicky 150 peso each at the end...well worth it :)
Great walking tour. Went on the BA free walking tour with Vicky today. She was knowledgable, engaging and fun. An excellent intro to Buenos Aires. Highly recommended

One of the best walking tours I've been to. This tour is great, Jimena is very clever and I really liked her passion and commitment to her job, she walked the tour with us even when it was raining all the time, and she never ever complained or downgraded the quality of this tour and also whe was very kind. A real must do if you are in Buenos Aires!!!. If you can do both tours you will be very pleased as you will cover pretty interesting places. Congratulations BAFreetour !!!

Don't miss out!. You will enjoy this tour! Jimena was an excellent guide and enjoyed sharing your love and knowledge about Buenos Aires. For the evening tour I was one man crowd due to a rain and she still did the tour even know she didn't have to. That's what I call "Above and beyond". She spoke better English than anyone I cam across in town and far superior than a paid guide I had at ...let's say well known place for an entertainment. I recommend doing morning and evening tours which will cover most of the BA downtown. (Hint: go there in Summer :))

Fun and informative. We loved our tour! Jimena was fun, energetic, and full of interesting stories as we walked. It was a great intro to the city. Now we know where we want to go bak and spend more time. Thanks!

Best walking tour ever. Our guide Victoria was absolutely FANTASTIC taking us around the city and talking about the history and current life in Buenos Aires. Her style is laid back yet informative and very funny. She kept us interested the entire time. Thank you for a great tour!

Great. Did the Retiro/Recoleta tour with Jiména, she was great! Spoke very good English which was very helpful to me as my Spanish isn't excellent. Brought us to many different monuments around Retiro and Recoleta and had great stories and information about them all. Would definitely recommend

Really enjoyed. Would go again.. I did a city walk with Jimena. I also did a walk with the other free walking tours company and much preferred her style and tour. She was very knowledgeable and personable. Lots of facts and interesting titbits. Helpfully answered other questions about the city and how to do things too.Would definitely recommend.

GREAT EXPERIENCE!. When my family and visitors from the USA decided to take a Private City Tour of Buenos Aires, I contacted BA Free Tour. From the very first moment, Adriana provided me with excellent and professional service, patient and friendly. She was personally the tour guide of the city tour. Adriana was in charge of making reservations for the tango show La Esquina de Carlos Gardel; coordinating various mini-van private transportations with Héctor, an excellent and professional driver. Definitely we highly recommend BA Free Tour for those who wish to visit and enjoy Buenos Aires.

Amazing Way to See BA!!. Our guide Gonzalo was just what you could wish for! He was engaging, full of knowledge and happy to answer any questions! It starts at the Plaza San Martin and ends at the cemetary about 3 hours later. What a perfect way to see the city!! Oh... It starts at 11 AM. Don't forget to tip the guide as well - it's worth it!!!

Free, but worth paying for. We stumbled into this tour which was ongoing in a city park and tagged along. What a find! The guide was engaging and the tour interesting. He told us about a family feud which resulted in the building of the quirky high-rise we passed by, constructed to purposely obscure the other family's view of the church across the park. Who ever would have known? I confess we only stayed for a bit of the tour due to time constraints, but next time I'd take the whole tour.

Seeing BA through the eyes of a local.. Victoria was the perfect guide to show us her city and to tell us things we would never have learned from a guide book. The tour ended on a busy street corner and I was disheartened to see a lot of the group just wander off without making any donation to our guide, who depends on these tips for her survival.

Great orientation. The BA Free Tour operates every day Monday to Saturday. Yes, it is free but they survive on tips. Our tour was about 3 hours long and covered a lot of the downtown core of BA. We received a lot of interesting commentary on the history, the buildings and the local customs, all delivered in a very friendly manner. This is a great way to learn about the city of Buenos Aires.

A city tour worth your time. We took both the morning and the afternoon tours - one focusing on the city's history and the other focusing on culture and neighborhood life. Expecting to like the latter more, we actually found it a bit dull. So lesson learned: no need to do both walking tours, but do enjoy one! I would suggest the historic option (the morning tour) as it provides a great summary of the history and gives you a context of Buenos Aires in present. As with most walking tours, it provides a great opportunity to get your bearings in the city and meet new people. Lovely day; would recommend for travelers regardless of a short or long stay!

City Center Tour with Victoria. We had a great 2,5 city center tour with our guide Victoria, who was very friendly and knowledgeable. Buenos Aires is an amazing city, which can be quite overwhelming due to its size, so the Free Tour principle is a great way to get an introduction. We'd recommend it to anyone!

Interesting & entertaining . Went on a tour on the 24th of March - a holiday so most of the central streets were blocked off and walking was easy. We walked with Gaston, a young man who is involved in marketing this tour. He was from BA, entertaining, knowledgable & easy going. The tour started at the Congress @11h & ended at the "colon" about 1:30 with a "bathroom break" midway near a good ice cream store.There was history, customs, politics and even "hand expressions". The group was large - about 20 people & from all over the world. A very interesting, leisurely walk ( about 10,000 steps but who's counting).
NYU Tour. Gaston provided a comprehensive tour of Buenos Aires. He was knowledgeable about Argentinian history. His humor made the tour even more enjoyable.

excellent walking tour. Did the 5 pm tour of Buenos Aires Free Tour with guide Sol. Can definitely recommend! It was a great tour, learned a lot about Argentinian culture and about the history of the area we walked through (Retiro). Sol is an excellent guide, lots of humour and although I was rather tired and started the tour thinking I may leave earlier, it was so interesting time flew by and I stayed until the end.

Best way to experience Buenos Aires. We took both of the walking tours offered by this company. One each day. Young, friendly English-speaking tour guides who work for tips. They are entertaining and knowledgeable about history, architecture, geography. We were refugees from the bus tour from hell. The bus is NOT the way to see Buenos Aires. The walking tours are perfect. It would be great if they could describe the exact starting points a bit better, but they wait around at least ten minutes to pick up stragglers. Highly recommended.
super interesting. Super interesting way to explore the city, very detailed and funny, a Must Do while in Buenos Aires.

Excellent, with an interesting local. We took this tour and as it turned out were the only 2 on the tour. We were having trouble initially working out how to arrive at the meeting place but an email to them was followed by a very quick and detailed response.The tour was at a leisurely pace and covered the history, architecture, economy and other things as well. It is suitable to anyone of average fitness. It was a fun way to find out about a very new place for us and we thoroughly enjoyed our tour. I do not remember our guides name but her English was excellent and she was able to give quite detailed information. At the end you give a tip and how much is up to you to decide. Would recommend this as a good introduction to the city and to work off the empanadas!

Definitely well-worth while!. My husband and I did both the am and pm Tours4tips tours in Buenos Aires! We were delighted with all the information, history, the stories and the overall highlights of the city. Both our guides, Jimena and Victoria were excellent - very friendly, enthusiastic and very knowledgeable! We learned a lot and would recommend these tours to anyone interested in learning about the city!
Enjoyable and informative. We did the 11am tour on our first day in BA. It was a great introduction to the city and really helped us get our bearings. Victoria was entertaining and knowledgeable.

True highlight of BA visit. My husband and I came across this by chance and are so pleased we did. Chris, our guide, was both really knowledgeable and had a great personality. When we turndup it turned out it was only the two of us that day - which meant we really got the most out of it. Although Chris had only lived in BA 9 months he was able to answer all our questions about Argentinien history, architecture, and more, I was truly impressed. So yes- I sincerely recommend this tour!!

Wonderful and knowledgeable volunteers. You can tell the people they have working for this company really enjoy what they are doing. The tour lasted approximately 2 hours and they gave a great in depth discussion about the history, stories and myths about the various locations and buildings. They answered everyone's questions and were overall incredibly enthusiastic and friendly. I went to both the morning and afternoon tours. There is, however, one thing though, I would like to point. During the afternoon tour the guide talked about the Falkland war between Argentina and Great Britain. There was a bit of information that was incorrect and would like to have this changed so that wrong historical facts are not disseminated. They claimed that it took the British 2 months to get to the islands and they fought for 10 days. In actuality it took the British close to 2 weeks to get to the islands and they fought for about 6 weeks. The guide also claimed that the people fighting for Argentina were kids that were not well equipped, but from reading about this war...the people sent from Argentina to fight this battle were the special forces and the army...so kind of, a little misinformation. I understand that many Argentinians died and it was super tragic...but being a history buff, I like the information to be accurate also...otherwise a fantastic tour and we loved every minute of it!

Great way to see the city. My hostel offered some free walking tours. I did 5 of them. They are excellent. Lasts about 2 hours and you can do the second 2 hours for a small fee which I did as well. The guys are great and very knowledgeable. You can tell they enjoy their work from the passion they display.Most of the people I met in BA I met on the free walking tours. It's a must do.
Brilliant tour guifrd. We did both of this firms tours Both guides were brilliant and inspirational We learnt an awful lot in a fun filled atmosphere Thoroughly recommend

Very informative!. I did this tour yesterday and it was great. Our tour guide Jimena, was really informative and friendly who explained everything in style! It was really enjoyable - I highly recommend it!

Very informative and can't beat the price. I did the 5pm tour at Plaza San Martin. It was a great way to meet other people visiting the city (one of the other tourists and I knew someone in common, small world!) and to get more history. Our guide was very entertaining and did a great job telling stories about the sites we walked past. It did get a little long.. I think it ran to 7:30. All depends on the speed of walkers in your group and how many questions are asked. Bring money for a tip at the end.

Good tour but room for improvement. We enjoyed our visit to Buenos Aires and our walking tour of La Recoleta. The guide (we didn't catch his name but it wasn't Martin or Fernando, who are often mentioned by others) was knowledgeable and shared interesting personal insights and experiences. Unfortunately, he tends to speak quickly and with a fairly strong accent, so some of the people in our group who don't speak English as their first language had a hard time understanding him. He was also a bit long-winded at times. We could have covered more sights if the commentary at each stop were shortened a bit. Overall, very good but room for improvement.

Great concept and great execution, highly recommended!. I really liked the concept - it starts with a group of people and a guide, the visitors are asking any questions they like and steer the conversation while the guide is trying to answer the questions and earn the tips.It's becoming popular in many cities and here they got it right. The guides are excellent. We walked around the center with Gaston and he was full of character, knowledge and energy. As someone who grew up in the city, he could give the best insight on what the locals do and why.And, yes, while it's called "Free Tour", they are hoping to earn some tips but there is no pressure whatsoever or "suggested donation amount" mentioned - you're free to give any tips or none and you don't have to show how much you give.
The friendly friendly guide!!. Totally worth it! Victoria was so full of energy. Definitely do this! If you have a spare morning, then you get to see the city and get some exercise in also!
Terrific guide. We did the morning city tour. Our guide Gaston was energetic and informative. He was able to answer any and all questions people had. A great introduction to BA.

Try to get Martin Wasserman on your free tour of BA. Martin gave us two excellent free tours. He is passionate and knowledgeable. Gives practical advice and is a kind person as well as an excellent tour guide.
Impresive. Jimena did a terrific job making a lot of history come alive as we walked around town. Terrific work and a truly clever idea.

Best way to know BsAs. We joined both tours - the morning and the afternoon one in different days. The guides in both tours are very knowledgable and explained the history in a fun and easy-to-understand way. We truly enjoyed it.
I suggest to do them in different days because you might get tired after walking 3.5 hours in the morning.

Simply a terrific way to see the city. Have just finished this tour with Victoria and it was terrific. As well we were having trouble working out how to get to meeting point so emailed them the afternoon before and had a reply almost straight away which was very easy to follow.If you can walk at a gentle pace for 2 to 3 hours then do this tour. We did the morning one which deals with history and architecture as well as other things. They also,offer another at 5 pm. Victoria was informative and had a good sense of humour. Her English is excellent and since there were only the 2 of us we were able to ask any questions we wanted. We did not even book the tour and although it had rained it still went ahead, and they will do this. After the tour we retraced part of our tour and then went to the Cathederal which is worth a visit and is only about 10 minutes from where the tour ends.The tour is free but guides get by on tips and it is up to you what you pay.Would thoroughly recommend this as a different way to see the city rather than a hop on hop off bus trip.

Fun filled walking tour. We went to both the 11am and 5pm waking tour and got Vicky as the guide for both. Lucky us. She is energetic, responsive and very informative, giving us all the fun facts of the city with good humor and interesting stories. We came off both tours with so much more insights of this lovely city. Highly recommended!

Same same but different. Buenos Aires has a lot of political history the problem is that the city is so big that walking so much is really tired. In any case it's better to go with a guide then to do it by yourself. It was a lot of people and thatb made it really difficult to hear and follow the guide.

Fun, interesting. The guides in green are knowledgable, passionate, energetic and entertaining. Gaston and Vicky really contributed to my understanding of the history and culture of BA, the information delivered in an engaging, personable, style, friend to friend. You can't do any better than having a native show you around. This was a great introduction to a fascinating city.

Great Tours!!!!. We did the 11am city tour with Vickie (3hrs), and the 5pm Ricoleta tour with Jimana (2hrs). They were both fantastic, especially the morning one! The guides made the information super interesting and fun! And just FYI- you can drink the tap water in Buenos Aires!

Definitely wouldn't have known any of this without the tour. We did the afternoon tour with Jimena to Recoleta. She was great, the tour was excellent - we stopped at places that I would've walked straight past without a guide. Her stories were interesting and engaging and were a great insight into Buenos Aires and Argentina as a whole. Definitely recommend it!

Fantastic Walking Tours!. We only had 30 hours in Buenos Aires and did the 2 walking tours in a day. We have thoroughly enjoyed both tours and learnt so much about Buenos Aires. Gaston did the morning tour and was passionate and gives a true insight into the current political opinions. Vicky did the evening tours and told us lots of gossips which allow us to see the city in a different perspectives. Highly recommended!

Excellent Guides. Gaston took us on the morning tour starting at Congreso and finishing at Casa Rosada. We enjoyed listening to the history and political information about B/A. Gaston was very engaging and gave us lots of insights into Portenos life especially how to order coffee like a local! As we enjoyed it so much, the day after we took the afternoon aristocratic area tour with Vicki. Starting at Plaza San Martin and finishing at Recoleta Cemetery. Vicki was super, full of interesting information on B/A history, life in the city and a lots of quirky stuff you won't read in the guide books. The great thing with the tour is you can tip based on your travel budget. It was also fun to meet fellow travellers from around the world. Definitely would recommend the tours.

Very informative and entertaining tour, don't miss it!. We took the two different tours on one day. Even though we spent 4 hours on each tour, the guides did a great job of making it a wonderful day. Both ladies were very passionate about BA which made a big difference relative to other tours. If you only spend a short time in BA these tours are a MUST!

Informative and fun walking tour!. I took two walking tours, covering the politics and history in the morning with Sol and Recoleta and culture in the afternoon with Vicky. The tours are an excellent introduction to Argentina, its history, and culture, focused through the lens of its capital.The guides present information with passion and humor, providing everything from historical timelines and Argentinian slang terms to safety tips and restaurant recommendations. They are a treasure trove of local expertise - take advantage and ask lots of questions!The morning tour ends at Guerrin, a cheap local place that's known for their mozzarella pizza ("mozza").

Love everything about it. From the moment we arrived, I was impressed with it all, people are nicer than expected, be ready to eat so much, you won't believe it. Stay at least 10 days, it is a beautiful city

Perfect way to learn about BA!. I convinced my boyfriend to go along with me to the 11am tour our first day in Buenos Aires. Walking tours are not his thing, but by the end of the tour, he asked if we could do the night tour of Recoleta the next day. Vicky was our guide for both tours, and she gave us a great introduction to the city and the life and history of portenos. This is not a fast-paced tour, so don't worry about keeping up with the group. Vicky was animated and willing to answer any questions from her tour (no matter how silly). Make sure to find the green shirts and attend one of these tours! It will be well worth your time (but don't forget to tip)!

Perfect introduction to BA. We did both the morning and afternoon tour on separate days. We decided upon the afternoon tour after the success of the morning tour. The tour provided a great intro to BA, helping us to know what to do/where to go (as well as what to avoid). Gaston provided a wealth of information regarding the history and modern day culture as well as useful information to know when visiting BA as a tourist.

City Tour with Gato. We had a great day with Gato, he did give us a lot of insider informations about the city BA and of course all about the history of the city and some of the country Argentinia. Glad have done the tour with Gato!

Great even on a rainy day!. Gaston our lovely guide did not give up although only the 2 of us arrived due to the weather and taught us so much about Argentina, history and politics...This 11AM is highly recommended
Great info, even better guide. We had a great tour with Gustav, who demonstrated his love (and opinions) for the city. We learnt plenty and were given a great overview of Buenos Aires.

A must!. We made the 2 tours and it was great! We learnt so much about the history of Argentina and Buenos Aires! Also the guys told us interesting stories "behind the scenes" ! The guides were excellent-they explained everything with passion which was transfered to us :)))

Excellent walking tour. We did both the 11am tour with Gaston, and the 5pm tour with Victoria (on separate days). Both tours were great. The guides were knowledgeable, friendly, interesting, personable and enthusiastic about sharing details of their city with visitors. We enjoyed both tours, and appreciated that they did not ask for tips (of course we did give them a tip because it was a great tour, !and they did a great job... But it's nice that it's up to you to decide.)

don't miss this tour. Had a great few hours walking around BA with Vickie our guide. She is a very knowledgeable portena and entertaining also. We did the 11 am walk leaving from Plaza De los dos Congresos in front of the fountain. Look for a person in a green sweatshirt. It's a leisurely pace so don't worry about keeping up. Its great to find out the history of the city and what the buildings are.Vickie is happy to give you tips on other attractions and things to do etc. Ask her to show you how to get to the pizza place called Guerrin, great place to have a late lunch after the walk. Highly recommend. This is a free tour, however we did tip. Vickie did not ask for any money, they do have advertising and a website to maintain and we felt the tour was really worth it.

Take This Tour!. This was a fantastic tour. Sol was our guide, and she was great! I did the 5:00pm tour that met at Plaza San Martin. Sol was friendly, knowledgeable and fun. I walked away from this tour really feeling like I had insider knowledge about the city. Thank you, Sol!

Best way to connect with BA. 2h30 walking down BA's historical spots with very entertaining fun and yet knowledgeable guides. Very good info about habits, cultural curiosities and always the unofficial side of the city's history - the other version is available at am website anyway. We did 2 different tours, with 2 different guides - both well worth it!

Morning: Walking Through Recoleta Tour. For nearly 4 hours, we got a tour of the Paris of South America. Martin Wasserman was an excellent tour guide and we give him 2-thumbs up! He gave us historical information with tidbits of entertaining back-story. Martin is passionate about his city and it shows! Loved, loved, loved the tour!

G8est Buenos Aires free tour! Guided by friends. This was my first free tour and it was amazing. I picked the Recoleta tour, I learned details that I would have never known elsewhere. I'm thankful for that.The tour guides were awesome, I took the afternoon tour, perfect for a relaxed walk to learn more about this wonderful city. Highly recommended

Do This. I was fortunate enough to be introduced to Sol through friends, and therefor to this tour. It was amazing, I learned a ton, and Sol was an amazing tour guide (funny, personable, knowledgeable, etc). My group even went out for a beer afterwards to top it off! One of the best free tours I've ever done.

We learned so much. We are a family of 4, 2 teenagers, my husband and myself. We all enjoyed the tour Vicky lead for us. My daughter was concerned about what she was going to see and do on the tour before we went and actually didn't really want to go. By the end of our week in BA she put the walking tour as her favorite thing we did. You would never know we walked 5 miles, but we learned all kinds of "secrets" about the downtown area of BA.

Great morning tour. Our guide was Sol, she was full of stories and all those small extra details you don't get from a guide book. Passionate about her home town she enlightened us on many of the facts behind the things we were looking at. Great tour.
Sol was amazing!,,. We did both tours and our tour guide was great. She was friendly, funny and knew her city. This is a great way to get an overview of what buenos aires is all about :)

Great stories from the horses mouth. I had an excellent tour guide named Martin. He told some great stories, answered all of our questions and gave us a great feel for the city. Its always best to get locals opinions and there is more hunting to do after this. Highly recommended.

Great feel for the city. We did both tours, and I recommend doing both tours. Even if you're running a little late (like we were), the guides are very easy to find in bright green jackets.The AM tour was led by Gaston, who was constantly smiling and was genuinely happy to be there. With a lot of tours, it's easy to find burnt out tour guides or people who are doing it just for the money but Gaston's passion was obviously his city and he loved telling us about it.He was able to answer all questions, and he offered us a few city "secrets." We learned about a lot of the BA history, mostly through stories about politics which is one or Argentinians' favorite subjects. The evening tour was led by Sol, who like Gaston, was incredibly passionate when speaking about her country. She told us elaborate stories about the rich and elite in BA, their downfall, Peron and of course Evita. We walked through gorgeous areas and got advice about wonderful places to go to eat and to brunch, etc. I cannot speak highly enough about these tours.
Exellent walking tour Great way to see BA. Fantastic walking tour to get the history of Buenos Aires from a porteno. The walking tour gives you a great base of the city and it's colorful history.

Two Great tours with two Great Guides!. I would recommend both of these tours to everyone. We had a great city tour in the morning with the fun and informative Gaston. It was SO good that my husband and I decided to do the evening tour the same day. We thoroughly enjoyed the evening tour with Sol who was funny and had lots of great insights to Buenos Aires. They were extremely helpful and full of great tips for getting around the city. They also encouraged emailing them after the tour for any inquiries about the city. They definitely go above and beyond for a free tour!

Morning tour with Fernando. Our guide fernando did an amazing job explaining history of what we were seeing through interesting and colorful stories, tour was never dull, lunch place was very good. One thing I will say is that please keep in mind since the tour is a free tour, the guides rely on the tips. We felt pretty embarrassed for the people who seemingly love the tour and only gave 10-20 pesos which is the equilvant of less than a few dollars for a fun couple of hours. That is my only negative about the experience. But the tour is great, must do!

Excellent!. These tours are a must if you are visiting Buenos Aires! We took the 5pm tour first and found it so informative and fun that we also ended up taking the 11am tour as well, which was just as excellent. The guides were both wonderful! We have taken a lot of city tours before and this was by far the best!

Fantastic Buenos Aires Tour. We did the morning tour and had to come back for the evening tour. This made for a really fantastic day. The guides are very knowledgeable and provided brilliant color commentary to make the history come to life. I have done many tours in many places but I can honestly say the enthusiasm and passion for the city we got from our guide made it my favorite city tour ever... Highly reccomend

Morning City Tour. Very enthusiastic and friendly guide (Gastong!). Extremely informative and knowledgeable. He made the tour fun and interesting, and was more than happy to answer questions about Buenos Aires.

Must do if you are in BA! Excellent. They have 2 different tours and both are great. I done it 3 times in different visits with different friends and I always get to learn something new. I also received great tips for things to do around the city. Every place Gaston and Sol have recommended were the best and more fun places to go. I also find fascinating that you can ask then pretty much about anything from politics, culture, night life and wherever else. They are fun to be around for a couple hours exploring Buenos Aires. I highly recommend it.
A great experience. The tour was excellent and it was a great way to know the secrets of the City and enjoy it's magic. We really enjoyed it.

The tips about the city are great. 2.5 hours of great insight into the city and culture. The tips Gaston gave really brought to light the life of the locals. Bring walking shoes.
We stopped for 10 minutes for refreshments so you can always buy a drink on the way.
Great way to see the city with the expensive bus approach

Must Do!. We did the morning downtown tour with Gaston and so enjoyed it we did the evening tour with Vicky on the same day. Both guides were excellent - tremendous characters with a passion for their city and what they do. The tours were made fascinating by the small stories and "not in the guidebooks" snippets of info and their honest and forthright views on the good and bad in their city & country. We also appreciated that there was no selling of places to go unless the info was requested by us.

Introduction to Madrid. What an enjoyable and informative walking tour of the highlights of Central Madrid. The information gained on this tour opened our eyes to attractions the we hadn't planned on visiting. This is the ideal introduction to the city since you learn of not only places but customs and traditions that might not be in a guidebook. our guide Mary did all for us.

Absolute MUST DO whilst in BA!. This company runs two daily tours, one in the morning which focuses on key areas of downtown BA and the afternoon tour which concentrates on architecture and aristocracy. However, don't be fooled, these tours are so much more than just the basics. The guides offer passionate and unbiased views on their city, from the good to the bad. They talked us through the history, the economy and the people of not only BA but Argentina. Also, unlike other "free" walking tours that we have taken in South America, this tour does not stop off at any local vendors where you feel obliged to buy "artisan products". If you have limited time in this amazing city then trust me, there is no better way to spend it than on a BA Free Walking Tour. You will get so much out of it! (Thanks Maggie & Sol)TOP TIP: If you are in BA for a few days then make this tour your first port of call as the tips and advice offered by the guides will help inform you on what to do and see in BA.

Private tour with Adriana. My husband and I initially wanted to do the free tours but then we had just two and a half days in Buenos Aires and decided to do a private tour so that we could see much more. And we were so happy we took that decision. I booked our private tour on their website. You have to pay only 100 USD as deposit via paypal and the rest in cash when you meet your guide. We did two tours with them. A whole day city tour (190 USD) on the first day and Tigre Delta (230 USD) on the second. The price includes transportation by local bus and train, entries, Tigre city tour by bus and the boat ride) I corresponded with Adriana who was very prompt in her replies and she was our guide too! She was simply fantastic! She knew the city inside out and was extremely knowledgeable about Argentina's history and politics and culture. She gave us so many insights into the country's past and current affairs. She was a walking talking encyclopaedia on Argentina. She took very good care of us and made sure we were always safe and cautious on the bus and while crossing the street. She gave us great tips on everything and we shared a lot of warm conversations. Our city tour lasted for more than 6 hours and we visited so many neighbourhoods and almost all the main attractions. She told us to visit the Pink House on our last free day as weekend tours are free and open to the public which was a great recommendation! We enjoyed our Tigre Delta tour with her too. She took us by train and then we did a one house bus tour of Tigre before we go on the boat. We had lunch at a restaurant called El Hornero which was great. The boat ride was great and we go to see the beautiful houses and witness their way of life on the delta. Adriana also helped us exchange USD and gave us a good rate. She also helped us save money on our airport transfer. We had booked our airport drop off through our hotel which turned out to be very expensive and she recommended taking a standard taxi instead which was wonderful as it was half the price! We are so happy we did the private walking tour with BA Free Tours. We highly recommend it!
Perfect tour. Highly recommend this tour. We did the one during the day with Gaston. It was a great way to see the sights and be taken around by a local.

Recommended for evreybody visiting the city. If you are for a short visit and just have one day, go for both the tours they offer. It is the best way to spend your time, as make friends.Maggie and Vicky were just amazing! They tell you so much about Argentina, and Portenos. If you are reading this, thanks a lot! You made my day, I have fallen in love with the city.Cheers :)

Maggie was highly entertaining. Another Australian couple told my family about this tour which leaves from plaza San Martin every afternoon at 5 pm (look for the guides in green shirts at the horse monument). So glad they did as it was fantastic. I enjoyed it so much I made sure my husband did the tour the next day as he missed it with my teenage kids and I the previous day. Came away knowing so much more about Argentina and BA and the people who live there . If we are ever back will make sure to do the morning tour too.Beautiful buildings and fascinating history. You will definitely give a generous tip at the end as Maggie is such fun and entertaining guide.

Walk your way through Buenos Aries ...free!. Great way to start your visit in Buenos Aries. If you don't mind a lot of walking (3 hrs), then this is your kind of tour. The guides will walk you through several areas of the city, explaining the history & culture, pointing out landmarks, and what each district has to offer. Our guide was knowledgeable, and gave us tips on where to eat, shopping, and what to expect to spend on "stuff." Familiarizes you with the area, so you can come back on your own. A tip at the end is all this may cost you, and you won't have a problem giving one, as you will be happy with what you learned. Hope this is helpful for your next visit.

Highly recommended!. We did both tours, the morning one with Gaston and the afternoon one with Maggie.We had a wonderful time touring BA while learning more about its history, architecture and people. The three hours fly by because you are walking and taking in some much information in a fun-filled way! I would definitely recommend the tours if you are in Buenos Aires and are looking to be immersed in its history and culture with 2 locals!

Enjoyable way to see the city. We did the 11am tour with Gaston and the 5pm tour with Vicki. Two completely different but equally interesting tours conducted by friendly and knowledgable guides. Both made a point of asking all tour participants to share their name and home country before starting the tour. Vicki also gave us a very good restaurant recommendation in the Recoleta, and Gaston helped us with deciding on football games to attend. I recommend this to anyone visiting BA

Albergue Buenos Aires. We are one of the first Hostels in Buenos Aires and so we know the most important thing is to have a clean place, with many bathrooms, large and safe lockers, good internet access and a friendly environment. Visit http://www.06centralhostel.com for more details.
Fun Free Walking Tour!. Had a great time learning about this beautiful city. Did the afternoon tour with Victoria and she is wonderful.

Well worth your time. Did the morning your with Gaston and the afternoon tour with Maggie. They were both wonderful hosts of the city, very knowledgeable about the sights and the history. This was a great way to get acquainted with Buenos Aires.

Great free walking tour!. Did both morning tour (11:30 at Parliament) with Maggie and afternoon (5pm at San Martin Park with Vicky) and they were both great! Interesting and funny guides with lots of information, which is very helpful in a huge city like Buenos Aires where it is hard to know where to start! Would highly recommend! Make sure you are getting the right tour (green shirts - awesome) rather than other free walking tours, one of which never showed up for us!
Participated in both (Recoleta and City Center).. Both tours were very insightful, so learnt a lot about Buenos Aires and the people who live/lived there.

Fun and interesting. We did both the morning (with Vicky) and the afternoon tour( with Maggy),both were interesting and fun. They incorporated historical elements with cultural particularities: such as ordering coffee without speaking. Buenos Aires is a huge city and 3 hours is a short time to cover everything in details. These tours give a good overview. More details about our trip can be found at http://bishopworld.wordpress.com

Left half way through. I'm a bit surprised by the overwhelmingly gushing reviews. We left half way through. Maybe it improved and they saved the best till last. I wasn't willing to risk another hour to find out. We went on the morning tour with Maggie / Magdalena. She was very sweet, enthusiastic and clearly very passionate about BA. Ultimately the content was lacking and the style was probably best suited to children under 12yo. Maybe we have been spoilt by excellent free walking tours in Santiago, Chile and Medellín, Colombia, but there were a number of let downs. The background history of BA seemed to be totally missed - when was it founded, why is it the capital, when and how was Argentina formed? You don't need an extensive history lesson, but you could quickly cover the above in 2-3 mins to help frame the tour. One of the rooms in the Congress was painted pink after Evita - who was she? Perron's wife, right? Well who was he and why is he any more important than any other President? Instead we had what felt like 15mins on the Porteno names for coffee - interesting, but probably something that can be covered in a couple of minutes more as a side note. Somewhat confusingly we were let into "big secrets" which ended up being things such as the widest avenue not actually being the widest avenue... rather than say, burying potical opponents under the freeway during its construction. The anecdote about the avenue also seemed to take an eternity.All very odd. Maybe the afternoon one is better. It's really sad to see some of the less positive reviews say things to the effect, "maybe BA just doesn't have that much that's interesting". I was lucky enough to have an excellent high end private tour in the past (which I obviously didn't expect to be the same) but I can assure people that BA has an incredible culture and history. Definitely would not recommend.

Insightful trip. A fantastic 2 hour walking tour which is fun and packed full of local information. We did the morning city tour with Magdalena who made the city come to life through her passion and knowledge of the city. Suits all budgets. Very highly recommended.

Great. We did two tours with Magi on one day - just because we couldn't get enough. Magi was outgoing, friendly, motivated and made the tour really personal. We did the city tour in the morning and the aristocratic tour in the afternoon. We visited nice spots, learned a lot about Argentina and its people and history. It was a great way to experience the city! A must-do if you're visiting BA! The tour is for free, donation comes easily after such perfect service.

Free walking tour of Buenos Aries. Although the tour started 15 minutes late (on time for Argentina) it was an excellent, informative tour. The guide combined history and humor which made the 3 1/2 hour tour go quickly. There is no charge for the tour but a tip is given at end of the tour (US dollars preferred)

Passion for Buenos Aires. We took both tours that are offered and had Magdalena as our guide both times (she remembered our names from the day previous!!). We considered ourselves very fortunate as she has so much passion for her city. Each tour focuses on a different aspect of the city and, if you have time, both open your eyes to a beautiful city. These tours were among the very best that we've ever taken.

Excellent tour. We took the daytime tour with Victoria and thoroughly enjoyed our experience. She spoke clearly and loud enough for the entire group to hear, all the time engaging the individuals taking tour. She was patient with questions and time for photographs and really knew her city. We highly recommend this tour. There is no charge for the tour but she certainly deserved her tips!

Loved Adriana. Had a wonderful city tour with Adriana--four hours of walking our legs off but a great intro to the city. She is extremely knowledgeable--especially in regards to the history of the city and country. She tailored her tour to our interests and we would highly recommend her for your introduction to Buenos Aires

Informative and fun!. We had Magdalena for both tours. We loved her energy and love for her city that we decided to do the morning tour with her as well. (We werent the only ones who turned up to both). The afternoon tour is great if you love architecture. You look at all the amazing palaces and how society used to live. The morning tour is better if you love history and politics. I wish i asked for a private tour or Palmero with these guys. They are highly recommended!

Great day of walking and learning in beautiful BA!. Our walking tour was one of the best free tours we've ever taken. Fernando did an incredible job with history, architecture, and humor to engage the group and teach us plenty about BA. He is clearly proud of his country's history and did a wonderful job sharing.Thanks for a fun day!

Really worthwhile. The tour is made in English and the guides are all funny and relaxed. You van learn a lot about Buenos Aires culture and history. I really liked it even though it was my second time at the city.

Great Way to Learn About Buenos Aires. Excellent way to learn more about Baires! My first day I took both the City Tour and the Aristocratic Tour my first day in Baires in early December 2014, and it helped me get comfortable and oriented, and I learned a bunch. Gaston and Magdelena were my guides and they entertained and informed. They encouraged questions and usually had answers. After these tours I decided not to take the tour buses. The tour are truly free though you have an opportunity to tip them what you can afford and you think it is worth when they say farewell at the end. I tipped between $10-$20 if that's helpful to you. Check the BA Free Tour web site for meeting places. times and itineraries. I also booked a tango show, La Esquina Carlos Gardel, through them. I thoroughly enjoyed that show and thought it worth the money given transportation, food, wine, show and what shows like that cost in other tourist cities.

Wish we would've done it sooner!!!. I wish we would've done this the first day! It was my first free tour and I wasn't expecting it to be nearly as helpful. (Usually uninteresting, unrelevant, useless information/dates). We really got to know more about the culture, the people, the landmarks, and lots of funny stories that made the city come alive to us. The information we received was as if we read a few books about Buenos Aires! I am extremely impressed with the quality, passion of the guide, and how much knowledge we gained in such a short amount of time! Definitely worth it!!!!

A must do to start your BA experience. We did the morning city tour with Victoria (over 3 hours) and the afternoon recoleta tour with Magdalena (over 2 hours). We did them both on one day... makes for tired feet by the end of the day but very worthwhile. Both tours and guides were great. We have done these tips based walking tours in many cities over South America and there is no better way to get your bearings (well perhaps paid for tours if you have lots of money to spare) :-) We learnt a lot and got our heads around what we would return to over the coming days. I would definitely recommend asking lots of questions if you want insider info on restaurants and attractions... preferably the type of questions that others in the group would be interested in too. And i know it is repeated a thousand times but wear comfy shoes and take sunscreen and water. It was 35 degrees the day we did these tours and while the guides try to find shady spots it is inevitable that you'll be standing in the sun. Highly recommended.
Very Informative!. A fun, informative and chilled tour. Our guide Magdalena was fantastic, its nice when you can have fun and have a laugh while on a guided tour! Highly recommended!

Great Tour. I did the 5pm tour of Recoleta with Vicky. Our group was pretty large, but we could always hear Vicky. She is obviously passionate about her city and sharing it with visitors. She was funny and interesting. We walked for about 2.5 hours. I was a bit disappointed that the cemetery is not really included in the tour (it closes around 5pm, so clearly it can't be), but as it was listed on the website as a stop, I thought we would actually be able to go in it during the tour.

Great Tour To Get Your Bearings. This is a good tour to see what you would like to explore in more detail. Their are many neighborhoods in Buenos Aires and it is always great to get a feel for what you would like to see in more depth.After this type of tour then you would want to book a more in depth tour.

Great way to see the city. I have taken a few free walking tours in Europe and this tour was very similar to those. It started at 11 am at the Plaza del Congreso with Gustavo as our guide. The tour was a great way to get an overview of the city and see many of the important historical sites like the Pink House, Congreso, and the Obelisco. Gustavo was full of information about Argentina's history and culture. The entire tour lasted about three hours and I would highly recommend it to get to know the city.

Average . We landed in Buenos Aires at 5 in the morning and somehow made to this tour at 11 in the Plaza Del Congreso. Our guide was Maggie. The tour was only partly interesting for us. We expected a lot more historical view of the city. We were also expecting hints at the end for travelers like public transport, food, safe & unsafe corners and things which could be looked in detail after the tour. We actually got more such stuffs from our hostel than in this tour. With this tour you can basically cover the city center. I felt the facts told to be little exaggerating.

Excellent overview. We took the 11am city tour that starts at the Plaza del Congreso. The tour took about 3 hours in total with a short break in front of the pink palace. Victoria was our guide. A group of about 20 showed up for the tour, which worked fine. We could always hear Victoria at the various stopping points.Victoria was a great guide. Very energetic, knowledgable and entertaining. It was a great way to get an overview of they key sights downtown, and some history on BA, the culture, key events, etc.I would highly recommend the tour. You choose what to tip at the end, and everyone seemed happy to give Victoria a nice tip.

Free tour is all about the guide. I like free tours. The tour was ok but what I was missing is small treats, advices on which restaurants and other places to visit. The guide Magdalena was over dramatic.. I was feeling like she was acting all the time.. I preffer natural behaviour.

Excellent!. We took the 11 am tour with Victoria and had an excellent time! She was a great tour guide and made it obvious that she loved her job and Buenos Aires and it made our time with her that much better! She is very knowledgeable about all the sights we visited and even provided a little insight into living in Argentina.

Fun Way to Discover BA's Cultural History. BA is a unique South American city, one with many bright historical highs and some shocking lows. This 5 pm tour with Vicky introduced us to it all- never getting too in depth (which was a bit of a shame, but with so much to see and learn, it makes sense), we learned the general history of the city from Argentina's liberation by San Martin, the glorious years at the start of the 20th Century, all the way to the economic crisis still affecting the city today. Recoleta is a beautiful neighborhood, and Vicky was a fun and enthusiastic guide, making it easy for everyone in our large group of 15 people to feel included and get something out of the tour.Highly recommended!!

Superb!. This is absolutely a must!
You will have the chance to know part of the city and some histories as well, from a local.
It was awesome, absolutely recommended.
Note: use comfortable footwear.
Excellent and Informative. Victoria's 5pm tour impressed me so much I did the morning tour with Gaston the next day! I would highly recommend them.

Great way to see the city. We took both tours on the same day. The guides (Gaston and Maggie) were very informative and spiced up their walks with amusing anecdotes. It gave us a very interesting insight into the history buildings and people of Buenos Aires and Argentina. They really earned their 'tips'!

Highly recommendable. we did the 11AM BA tour and it was fun, entertaining, informative and relaxed. Vicky (Victoria) was a very clear, funny, enthusiastic and knowledgable guide and I think this is a must for everyone who is interested in BA and the history/daily life/secrets etc.

Friendly and laid back. We went for the morning tour with Maggy. Lots on informations in a decontracted way. She has a good sense of humour and excellent knowledge of BA.
2 days later we went for the 5 PM Recoletta tour and surprise Maggy was doing that tour as well.
Keep up the good work

Excellent - must do in Buenos Aires!. This was our very first 'activity' in BA and it was the right decision. It gave us the context behind Argentina and we saw all the key buildings with great explanation and opportunity to ask any questions. Our guide was also great fun and made it an unforgettable experience. He even pointed us in the direction of a food market that day which was incredible - thank you!

Excellent Tour from Enthusiastic Locals - a Must. This review is long overdue. I took the Walking Tour with Maggie in July upon first arriving in Buenos Aires. She was incredibly energetic and friendly, and very thorough in her attention to detail. I did not know much about Argentinian history prior to this tour and I learned so much after three hours on the evening tour. This free attraction is a perfect introduction to Buenos Aires and Argentina and a must if you visit.

Excellent Guided Tour. Five of us, 63 to 75 years of age, arranged for a 6 hour of guided tour with BA Free Tour. We had a van, driver and a guide for this tour. We are extremely happy with the tour conducted by our guide Gaston. He took us to various parts of the city and provided interesting historical events that shaped Buenos Aires and Argentina. We highly recommend Gaston and BA Free Tour.

An absolute must for a Buenos Aires. This is the best "free" tour we have done in South America! We took the afternoon tour through the centre of Buenos Aires and were fascinated the the history of this beautiful city. The guide kept our attention thought the 3 hours and was extremely informs tube with crystal clear English. He offered his opinion on current affairs and gave us a fantastic insight into what it meant to be a Porteño. I could not recommend this tour enough!

A great way to start your trip.... My two friends and I went to the evening tour first with Maggie. We had a great time with Maggie, she is so energetic and passionate about Buenos Aires and it really comes across in the tour. I liked that she was open to any questions and very knowledgable about the city's history. We lesrned so much and had such a great time that we decided to also do the morning tour and were so happy to see that Maggie was the guide again! The morning tour was great as well. If you are interested in getting a feel for the city and being introduced to some of the culture and history, I highly recommend this tour! Thanks for such a good time Maggie!!! And oh yea... It's a free tour! They work based on tips!

walking tours. We did both the 11am tour and the evening tour. Maggie was our guide for both. She was very entertaining and very informative. She helped me to understand the culture, portenos, and even gave a few tips on how to blend in. She gave a great history lesson.The tour wasn't strenuous. it was a nice walk around the neighborhood.At the end of the tour, you can give the guide however much you think it was worth. I loved both, and paid accordingly.

Walking tour. I went on the tour in the morning with Maggie (Magdalena) and it was fantastic!! She was very entertaining, had wonderful knowledge and was very approachable. It was a great tour (despite the freezing cold day!) and I highly recommend it!

Great. I came across these walking tours via Google. I was in Buenos Aires for a limited time and thought they would be a good idea to take in. I joined both the day and evening tours and was pleasantly surpriesed by them. The tour guides were nice and informative and the group was a decent size without being too large. You won't be overwhelmed with information, but get just the right amount. The day tour feels less like a tour because you're fighting with the sidewalk crowds, but the evening tour was a bit more cohesive. Overall, well worth it.

Excellent tour of the city. We did both the morning tour with Vicky and the afternoon tour with Maggie, and they were both excellent guides. The tours were a great introduction to the Centro and Recoleta neighbourhoods of Buenos Aires, and gave us great insight into the city as well as its people. Highly recommended.

Excellent tour guide, great way to get a feel for the city. Did the morning city tour and it was fantastic. Gaston was very informative and kept things lively and interesting (despite it being a historical tour). He also has a wealth of information when it comes to getting the best coffee, steak, ice cream, etc in town so ask him lots of questions. Had the best time, and made a whole lot of friends, would definitely recommend it to anyone. Gracias Gaston! Cheers :)

Excellent!. Did both the morning and afternoon tours with Maggie and really enjoyed both of them! Maggie was a great guide, very knowledgeable and friendly! Learnt lots about the city and it's history. She also gave us very useful tips! Great tours!

Did both the am and pm free walking tours. Did both tours on different days with tour guide clementine. After the am tour we all went to park to watch Argentina play Switzerland.had a great day. This guide really loves her city.

Great tour, but I find the history of BA a tad boring - sorry!. I feel bad putting this down as 'average' because the people that run this do a great job! We did the afternoon tour and had a really lovely, funny, happy tour guide who really knew what she was doing.My only issue was for me, personally, it was too informative and it wasn't really the kind of history I'm interested in... I found myself getting bored... I guess I needed the dumbed down version!By all means, do this tour!!! Hopefully you find it more interesting than I did!

Tour by real locals. We went on both the historical centro tour and the recoletta tour with Guille in June. what a legend! this guy really knows his stuff and tells the stories of his hometown with such enthusiasm. more than that, he takes the time to recommend other random little things along the way, such as bars for later in the night, or the best alfajores. an awesome tour, free with a tip for service.. which you will want to give. 100% recommend!

Great tour buenos aires downtown area. Our tour guide was Victoria. She´s very knowledgeable about her city and its history, and shares what she knows with enthusiasm.The morning walking tour takes you through Av de Mayo from the Congress all the way down to Casa Rosada. She makes several stops along the way to fill you in on interesting historical details! The tour is delivered in English and although it´s free, you´re expected to tip the tour guide at the end. Don´t be cheap ´cuz the service is great.

A passion filled way to get to know the city!. My friend and I were lost and asked some nice looking people in a park how to get somewhere. They ended up speaking English as well and said they were waiting for a free tour. My friend and I decided why not join them! BEST DECISION EVER! It was the night tour and wow was it awesome. We discovered a lot about Buenos Aires that we never would have known if it wasn't for this tour! She was so enthusiastic and passionate about her city that it spread like a wild fire among the group. If your looking for a way to get to know Buenos Aires that is enlightening, informative, and peaks your curiosity about this beautiful place, then you must do this your. My friend and I loved it so much that we are going to do the morning one as well!!

Amazing way to start your Buenos Aires journey!. It's hard not to love the BA free tour - firstly because it's FREE and second because it's really a great way to get acquainted with the city. With two tours running every day (in two different parts of the city) - you will get a good understanding of the history, culture, and will have a lot of fun while doing it. VIcky was super informative, funny, and answered all my (many) questions professionally! I HIGHLY recommend :)www.bafreetour.com

Great way to discover the city. Buenos Aires is fantastic!. The tour guide was very knowledgeable and friendly. A friend of mine recommended this tour to me and I´m very thankful to him since it was a nice activity to do. The weather was perfect for me. I would love to move here some day!

Excellent way to learn more about Argentina and Buenos Aires. Went for both the day and the night one all in a day. The guides were really friendly, humorous, and knowledgeable. I learnt a lot about the history, economy, as well as politics of Argentina.Well worth your time. What better way to learn/get tips about Buenos Aires than from a local?

Astonishing city. the similarities between Buenos Aires and Paris are incredible. I decided to come to Buenos Aires, because a friend of mine come here before and told me that it was beautiful, and she is right. The tour is the perfect way to discover the city by foot. The guide is very knowledgeable and professional.

Great way to spend a couple of hours walking around the city!. I have read other reviews and couldn't agree more about this being a very good option to get to know a little about the city and its history. Our tour guide Vicky was very enthusiastic and made an effort to include everyone in a group of about 12. She threw in little facts that were not related to the buildings that we were looking at, which only added interest to the walk. Highly recommend you spend a nice afternoon walking around.

Disappointing. Myself and a friend have done a number of free walking tours in South America. This tour however was the most disappointing. Our guide Vicky was excellent; enthusiastic, excellent English and entertaining. The tour however was a little dull and dragged. I'm not sure whether buenos aires just doesn't have the same sites as other cities but we found it a little boring. Other tours we have been on have perhaps shown you more of the culture of the city, taking you to taste local foods and drinks which have added another dimension to the tour. We have found they have been historic tours with a splash of culture and a difference to make it that little bit more interesting and entertaining. We did enjoy this tour however, but compared to others it lacked that special something.

Great tour ! . We took the tour in buenos aires, which gave us a great insight into the city, it's history and the main monuments. The tour starts at 11am daily (except for Sunday) in plaza congress. Our guide was light hearted, happy and informative. We walked about 2km learning about the history of buenos aires, it's culture and people. Major attractions included the congress, the pink house, cathedral and much more. Well worth it to get an overview of the city attractions and your bearings. Great tour!

Great tour to get to know BA, but a little too crowded. This free tour was great! Unfortunately, we had picked a day in the Easter week and there were round about 50 people. As it's free and everyone can join, it's needless to say that we all came along ;-) It was a little bit too crowded for my taste and Gaston (the guide) had to scream to reach out to everyone.The tour itself was great though! Gaston is funny, motivated and gives great information together with little stories and advice what to do if you stay longer. He's answering all questions and those 2,5 hours are well spent! Absolutely recommendable!

This was a great tour. I've taken paid tours before and this is just as good as any of them. The guide (Gaston) was knowledgeable, pleasant and funny. The guides work for tips so it's not actually free (assuming you're the decent person type) but overall it's totally worth the money. I had a great time and got some good intel on the city.
Great way to see the city!. Great 3 hour walking tour with our informative guide - Vicky! The tour visited the main sights in the Plaza de Mayo and microcentre districts

Great morning tour . We did this tour with my fiancé one morning as we wanted a quick overview of this part of the city and it was great.Our tour guide Gaston had a lot of knowledge and could answer all our questions, he also gave us great tips of where to go etc which helped us on our other days. Unfortunately we didn't have time to do the afternoon tour but we would have liked to do it also as it was in another area of BS AS.Would definitely recommend to do this tour on one of your first days to BA to get a quick overviewI also read some of the terrible reviews this tour had and they are wrong. They do indeed talk a lot about the history and they also warned us about the troubles we could come across.

Highlight of BsAS. We took the evening tour with Gaston, and I have noting less than good things to say.. He is extremely knowledgeable, with very good english speaking skills. It was a fantastic tour; and I would recommend everyone take it on the first or second day of your visit to BsAs. It is a great way to see the city and know what places to visit after. Also, if you are traveling alone, you can meet some other fellow travelers for adventures in the city after.. I would highly recommend taking this tour.

Excellent tours. Went on both of the tours. Both were very interesting and highly recommendable. Both guides, Gaston and Maggy were very interesting. Due to the fact in the afternoon, Aristocratic tour, the group was smaller, we were able to ask lots of questions which Maggy responded very well. The tours are free but if you were happy with the tour and the guide, it is to be recommended to give them a tip after the tour. This is the tip you want to give them, depending on your own budget. So don't feel bad when you are giving less than others, the tour is meant for people from various backgrounds, travelling on various budgets. If you decide to not give anything, that is equally fine. Enjoy the tours!

More than a tour. I've been on both the morning (BA the city) tour and the evening (aristocratic BA) tour and both are well worth your time. You don't need to reserve ahead of time and you don't need to pay a dime (or peso) to go on the tour so just show up at the meeting point (on their website) on time and you're on your way. If you have the means, give the guide a tip at the end because this is how they make their livings (and wages are low for everyone compared to the price of necessities) but you are not expected to do this. Guides Gaston and Sol were both wonderful and full of information not only on Buenos Aires history, architecture, etc. but also on the culture - how Portenos drink coffee, what hand gestures mean, where and how to change money, and more.
Don't miss these tours. Went on both tours and both were exceptional. Great information, guides who were interesting and funny. A great way to learn more about the city. I highly recommend both.

made the city more interestint. Loved getting little stories about the buildings. Gaston was energetic and friendly, taught us some funny sign language and gave good recommendations for further activities. A great was to get to know the city.

Great way to get to know Buenos Aires. I did the morning city tour. Vicky was a fantastic guide who spoke loud and clear, and was very captivating. This was not just a tour about the history of the city but also the culture of the porteñoos (people from Buenos Aires). There were lots of picture opportunities. I would recommend doing this tour on your first day in BA if you are staying for several days. That way you will get a good base on what the city is like.
