Plus you can ask the tour guide any questions you have about anything. Bring good walking shoes. The tour costed nothing but we gave a well deserved tip at the end.

Thank you Maggie! Two great tours!. We had three days in spectacular Buenos Aires before leaving on a cruise and we are so happy that we took both BA Free Tours!!! Maggie was an incredible guide. She was informative, funny and gave us two comprehensive tours from a locals perspective. It was amazing listening to her insight on politics and life for a porteña. At the end of each tour, we felt more and more like locals.We highly recommend both tours, but if you have to pick one, the city tour is probably more useful as it will give you a basic overview of B.A., the history, culture and politics. The second tour, which is also great, is more detailed and naturally will skip over the stops that the other tour covers.

Fun way to get familiar with BA!. Awesome tour guides...we did both the morning and afternoon tours! Very knowledgable tour guides (Magdalena and Gastin) and both make walking the city fun! HIghly recommended.

A great morning walk!. This is wonderful. I did the 11am tour that meets at Plaza del Congreso and the group was about 25 people. Gaston, the guide was excellent, enthusiastic and informative. Though the tour is billed as “free” you are asked to tip at the end. This is no problem at something between 100 to 150 pesos would be fair. The guide answered all questions easily, made sure everyone felt included and, bottom line, did a very good job.It is a walking out and you moves fairly quickly.
Don't bother with guide books. Thank you Gastin for an insightful and very entertaining 21/2 hours in Buenos Aires. We will be back for the afternoon tour.

Do this tour. Went on the Aristocrat tour which provided a great historical insight to this area of the city. The guide really knew her stuff and enthusiastic. Go on this tour and the other one offered by the company for a detailed insight to BA

Fun way to understand more of the city. Very enthusiastic guide called Magdalena - very knowledgeable, nice walk around some of the main areas getting some information. Considering this is a free tour and tip only it is a great way to start and get some of our bearings. Also great being able to ask a local guide questions, e.g. where's the best ice cream parlour / empanadas.

BA Free Tour---great to get to know BA!. We did this on our last day and I wish would would have done it right away! We took the Aristocrat Tour which covered many areas in Retiro and Recoleta. Our tour guide Vicky was poised, knowledgeable and very eager to share the history of BA. Our walk was two hours and was well paced. We went by many home and European style buildings that I would have just passed by if I was just a regular tourist walking down the street. The last stop did scare the heck out me---the myths and supposed facts of Eva Peron were discussed. I am glad to know them but it was a damper that we left on that note. Thanks for a wonderful free walking tour. I highly recommend tipping these awesome guides!
Excellent. A wonderful way to see some of the major sites and to get interesting insights from a local along the way. Enthusiastic and genuinely helpful guides. Highly recommended!

Great Buenos Aires walking tour. Maggie (Magdalena) was our guide - she was fabulous! She was friendly, very informative, energetic, entertaining, and gave great suggestions (outside of the organized tour too). I learned so much about the history of Buenos Aires and got great pictures along the way.
Shirley. Had a terrific tour with Gaston this afternoon. He was fun, informative and helpful in answering questions even after the tour. Thanks for the directions to my post tour destination Gaston
Great tips for BA. We went with gaston for our tour. He was witty and very knowledgable. We learned a lot about BA and got a lot of tips on everyday life in Argentina. Highly recommended.

Maggie was an enthuastic guide. I highly recommend this free walking tour of the city. Maggie was an excellent guide. She provided in-depth background on the history and cultural points of the places we visited. We gave her a nice tip, since it was well deserved.

Fantastic Tour. This tour was excellent. It provided me with a general understanding of BA. The tour guide, Maggie was excellent. I highly recommend her. The only thing I would recommend is that a sign be posted on where to meet; I was searching for the sign but finally came together with the group.

Well worth doing - enthusiastic and informative. First off - of course this isn't free. It's a "pay what you feel like paying" tour.I did both the morning and afternoon tours and, personally, I was happy to tip both guides (Gaston and Magdalena) reasonable amounts. They were both very knowledgable and enthusiastic and their English was flawless.The tours are a really good orientation around key sights and a primer on the basic history of Argentina. They are interactive - with the guides happy to answer questions frankly about anything at all and are not constrained by time - so the tours lasted more than the nominated 2-2.5 hours.So nice to get out in the sunshine and do these tours; much better than sitting on some bus, listening to a recorded explanation.Five stars - and strongly recommended.

Very informative and interesting!!. We took the Aristocratic Tour in Buenos Aires, and foud it extremely interesting, informative and fun!!Our tour guide (don't remember the name) was very friendly, and told us a lot of interesting bits of history about the city.Would highly recommend it as I doubt any other tour will be so informative and interactive.

Excellent!. This tour is awesome! You get to see the city, get information from a local guide, get some exercise and the best part is its free! Of coarse we tipped the guide at the end of our 3 hour long tour. I have done these free tours in Australia and Chile as well and they never disappoint!
Very informative tour. Did both tours, they were very interesting and informative. We especially liked the morning tour with Gaston. References to history, Argentinian way of life, etc.

Something else, good walk, nice to meet other people. Free is a subjective interpretation, as at the end you are being asked to tip what it's worth to you.However the enthusiasm, tour it self and the opportunity to meet other people is great.You get to learn stuff, which you don't find in a Lonely Planet.Also, thanks to Tripadvisor, I found this tour. I used the iPhone app - great! Thanks again TA!

An angel in Buenos Aires. We arrived in Buenos Aires in the early hours of a Sunday morning. At noon we were robbed en route to San Telmo market - camera, spectacles, credit cards. We had booked a private tour with BA Free Tours - we were so despondent that we wanted to cancel and leave Buenos Aires as soon as possible. But Adriana persuaded us to take the the tour with her -s he lent us her camera, she provided us with additional photos, she walked us the length and breadth of Buenos Aires and showed us what a truly wonderful city it was - she was a font of knowledge and a wonderful guide.Thank you Adriana

So Enjoyable but you need hands!!. We went on the eleven o'clock tour our guide Maggie was informative, knowledgeable, enthusiastic and funny. She guides and engages the group throughout the tour with stories of Argentinian culture. Would recommend his tour to anyone visiting BA for the first time.

Room for improvement. We did both tours: morning and afternoon. Both offer interesting info and nicely planned walks. They seem a bit too short to give full justice to the planned route, especially the morning tour. There is a great feeling of enthusiasm the guides have, but info provided could be broader and presented in more professional order reflecting both, the history and the culture of Buenos. Despite these observations, both tours are definitely worth participating in!

Excellent. We did the morning tour. Excellent guide - informative and entertaining. We also met up with lots of other travellers and picked up lots of ideas for our next three weeks in Argentina. I would thoroughly recommend this tour.

Wonderful introduction to Buenos Aires. I learned about this tour by reading tripadvisor and was not disappointed. My husband and I went on both the 5pm and 11am tour. They're different and both very interesting. On the tours we enjoyed talking to the guides and the people from all over the world. The guides were more than enthusiastic about their city. The morning tour is historical and covers the main goverment sites. There is quite a bit of walking involved. The afternoon tour is cultural and covers aristocratic and artistic sites. We feel we got the "lay of the land" in the city. Our guides were Gaston (the founder) and Vicky.

Fantastic! A Great Way to See Buenos Aires and Learn about Argentina. I highly recommend taking the Buenos Aires Free Tour. I took both of the tours offered: 11am in the morning (City) and 5pm in the afternoon (Aristocratic). The tours are a great introduction to the Argentine people, history, culture, etc. It was easy to find the starting locations and the guides wear green shirts so you can keep track of them walking around. Speaking of the guides (Maggie and Gaston), they were young, enthusiastic, knowledgable, accommodating, friendly, forthright, and fun. You will have fun. You'll get to walk around several historical, cultural, political areas of BA and meet other tourists who are also interesting. The guides are supported by tips. You can tip whatever you think it was worth the 2.5-3 hours they spend with you. I was more than happy to give them tips at the end. They earned them!

EXCELLENT WALKING TOUR. This company, Buenos Aires Free City Tour (walking) is really super. The owner, Gaston, was our guide for the morning tour thru the downtown/capital area. Very informative plus full of lots of local history/experiences. This tour is available daily at 11 am Monday-Saturday, and they work for tips, so you can decide what the value was for you! We were happy to give him a big tip as this tour gave us a sense of "knowing the city". They also offer an evening tour at 5 pm thru the Recoleta area. We participated in this tour as well--our guide was Sol. Again, lots of information and very enjoyable learning different aspects of life in BA from Sol. Each tour is around 2.5 hrs, and a very easy walk with many stops. There are many tours available--do this one first and then decide what else you want to do.

Great Tour. We went on both tours the third day of our trip, but wish we would have done them sooner. The tour guides shared great historial and cultural information about BA and Argentina, and were very personable and energetic. A definite must-do for travelers!

Bafreetour. Took the ba free tour in Buenos Aires last weekend - the 11 am walking tour that starts in Plaza Del Congreso. This organization offers walking tours with payment being up to the individual participant, on a tip basis. Our tour guide was Sol. I recommend this tour highly. Sol displayed great knowledge of her home town, and her country's history, all shared with an energy and sense of humour that truly made the experience one I will remember for a long time. Nothing but good things to say about it.......just wish I had had enough time to do the 5pm tour as well.......Colleen from Halifax

Great tour. A brilliant introduction to BA and great value. Our guide was friendly, knowledgeable and gave lots of advice on restaurants and other places to visit whilst in the city. I would highly recommend!
Informative tour with knowledgable guide. Highly recommend this tour by volunteer guides.Its free but a donation at the end is highly regarded.Go for it if you are ever in BA

Very Worthwhile - fun, interesting and a definitely a good value. Guide-owner Gaston has a delightful, lively humorous personality and obviously loves his work. His passion for his native city, Buenos Aires, is palpable and he seems to have the personal mission of infecting others with that passion. You may begin the tour thinking, "hey it's free, what have I got to loose" but you will end feeling like you want to take Gaston to lunch and become his personal friend - and I say that after he deftly made nearly 20 people in a group feel that way in 2.5 hours! He has the confidence that at the end you will feel you got a great value and WANT to tip him well so he doesn't have to charge up front.

Really good value, for just a tip. This free tour is so worth it! The guides are local, young and fun. Plus, we actually learned a lot of stuff about the city that the guide books won't tell you. We did both the morning and afternoon tour on our first day in Buenos Aires, and it was a wonderful introduction to the city, the people and the culture. I especially enjoyed the Recoleta tour, since the area is so beautiful and you end off in the square, where you can have dinner. I would really recommend this tour to all travelers, not just budget travelers, since the value of the tour far exceeds a tip only.

Best free tour you will ever take. It was one of the best tours in our 10 weeks of travel. Gaston was funny, informative, gave us a true local perspective on everything from the history to currency exchange. We also were looking for a good Tango club and his recommendation was spectacular. Best free tour you will ever take. Great source for anything you need while visiting. He even emailed me the next day to see how we like the Tango show. Great service.

Would not recommend (to my worst enemy). I went to the 5pm tour on the Saturday.First impression of the guide was that she was being superficially overfriendly (clearly in preparation for the tips). The tour was boring and disjointed. Everything seemed anecdotal with absolutely no historical perspective on the city. At the site of the Israeli embassy bombing she spent 5 minutes talking about the reference price of the Big Mac...I didn't understand what she was trying to get at so I asked another member of the group but he hadn't understood either...Pity because I went on a walking tour in Santiago (Chile) and found it absolutely brilliant. There might some good ones in Buenos Aires but I would advise trying another organisation...
Excellent.. We had Vicky as our guide and she did a fabulous job. She was super enthusiastic and really knowledgable. We really learnt a lot about BA !

Nice!. Today we did the free city tour and it was really nice. This guy Gaston is the most enthusiastic guide I ever met. He knows almost everything about this city and shows you the real side of the stories in all tourist books. Even as I don't like guided tours, I loved this one.

Excellent way to get introduced to Buenos Aires. We took the morning tour (11am) on our first day in Buenos Aires and found it so fascinating and enjoyable that we decided to join the afternoon tour (5pm) the next day. Our 2 teenage daughters (ages 15 and 17) enjoyed it too. Both tours were informative, interesting and fun. The guides were both extremely passionate about their city, sharing a wealth of knowledge about Buenos Aires, it's people, culture, history, politics and language. We highly recommend both as the perfect way to get introduced to the city. If you had to pick only one of the tours, we'd say try to do the 11am tour, although both are great.

Excellent. I did the afternoon tour one day, then the morning tour the next. Both were run by Vicky, who was an excellent and enthusiastic hostess. I very much enjoyed them both, and have been recommending them to anyone who's travelling to BA.

Great introduction!. My husband and I joined the tour and it was a nice way to learn more about this great city. The guides are really fluent and knowledgeable. You will know more about what BA can offer in only two hours.

The best thing we did in Buenos Aires !. Com certeza foi a melhor experiência de Buenos Aires. As nossas guias eram maravilhosas, super animadas e simpáticas. Recomendo para todos !I'm sure that was the best experience we had in Buenos Aires. The guides were very friendly and lively ! I relly recommend.

A Taste of Argentina. A private tour took us around the city and its attractions. Even visited the place where Evita was buried. Visited its churches and went to a dinner show with awesome tango dancers. Also learned a few tango steps. The shops, the restaurants with its authentic food and wine were excellent. Also took a day trip to Uruguay which was also a wonderful experience.

Nice Overview of the City. We took the afternoon tour on our first day in the city and found it to be very informative. The guide was friendly and knowledgeable. Her tips and suggestions enhanced the remainder of our trip. Our only regret was that we did not have a chance to take the morning tour!

Excellent free tours. BA free tours we took both tours on our first day in Buenos Aires - both so enjoyable - guides were both locals and were so interesting & spoke perfect English. We covered a lot of area and were made to feel very comfortable walking around the city and what a city is it. Without a doubt you must take the tours - well worth whatever tip at the end you wish to give. We ourselves are in our mid 50's - we met people of all different ages and from all over the world - thank you BA free tours you have got it so right.

two fantastic city tours. I took both the morning and afternoon tours, both of which were excellent. Both guides spoke perfect English, were hugely knowledgeable about the city and the history of Argentina. Really really interesting and enjoyable. Would highly recommend to all.

Great tour, worth a hefty tip. We only had time for one tour in Buenos Aires and chose the morning tour with BA Free Tour. The meet-up location was easy to find and our guide was great. She was really enthusiastic about her city and did a great job linking the whole tour together. The walk was a long one but we covered a lot of territory and plenty of information. I really enjoyed our guide's sense of humor and positive attitude. She also did a good job of helping us know what was usual & customary as far as the tipping went at the end of the tour. Families and people of all ages were part of the tour and everyone seemed to have a good time. We even connected with another couple and ended up having lunch and exploring with them for the afternoon. I'd recommend taking the tour-- it's free so the only thing on the line is your time.

Tango Tour To Buenos Aires. the best of the best Tango experience ever! Inspiration,art, dance, shows, classes, museums, history all in one single place. Definitely the best time to go to enjoy tango is at the end of August when the city organizes the Tango Fair and the Campeonato del mundo.

So much fun. We did both tours and really enjoyed it. Both guides were locals and really easy going in there way of showing the group around. it was just great. We even got some BA secrets... So check it out! It's definataly fun with this guys.

Be careful of pickpockets associted with this tour.. The tour ends in the exact same spot at the same time 6 days a week. Pickpockets hanging out at this spot and watch you tip the guide. They pick their target, and have a clever plan to separate you and your wallet. The friendly tour guide warns you of many dangers in the city, but not this one. Why not?

Walking the sights of Buenos Aires. We did both the morning (avenida de Mayo-Congresso, Cafe Tortoni, Casa Rosada and Plaza Mayo) walk with Vicky and the evening walk (leaving Plaza San Martin for a walk through the ritzy Recoletta) with Maggie and enjoyed both equally. It was a great way to see this beautiful city. Knowledgeable locals who were proud of their "Paris of the South" they were fun, informative and helpful. You cannot hope to understand a city without the guidance of a local and both girls did a great job of providing quirky insights into BA. (Would we have seen the house built on the roof of a city building without the hints? No way. That building looks like it came from Paris...it did, brick by brick!) The walks were not strenuous, as they are done at a leisurely pace and the time flew. As a taster of Buenos Aires it is highly recommended,

Great Introduction to Buenos Aires. We did the morning tour on our second day in Buenos Aires and found the tour to be a great introduction to the city. The tour guide was friendly, fun, and knowledgeable. She was happy to answer any questions and spent time talking to each person in the tour group. I would definitely recommend this tour to others.

Great way to see the city, but that's all.. We took both tours and had a great time during each of them. The information is interesting and the tour guides are friendly and knowledgable. I would definitely recommend the tour, especially if this is your first time in BA.However, I would NOT recommend using BA Free Tour to help book a Tango Show or any other attraction. Their website guarantees arranging a discounted Tango Show complete with transportation to and from the venue. My boyfriend and I exchanged multiple emails with an associate to book our reservation, and she told us to meet at a certain time/place for our transportation. However, after waiting for FORTY minutes, nobody ever showed up. To top it off, nobody from BA Free Tour ever emailed me back regarding the mishap after I had notified them and requested alternative arrangements. Unprofessional and disappointing- especially after such a good tour. For this reason, I must give BA Free Tour only an "average" rating.

Great way to see the city and learn!. We have made it a point to take the free walking tours anytime we find them while traveling! We did the 11am City Tour and it was great! Saw the main highlights of the city and learned so much of the history! Very sad we missed out on the 5pm Recoleta/Aristocratic Tour!

Enthusiastic guide makes 2 hours walking feel like walk in the park. My wife and I joined the afternoon tour yesterday. The tour guide was early and ensured that she had eveyone comfortable before departing from San Martin square. The tour was informative and took us through oarts of town we would otherwise not have seen. It gave us quite a bit of insight in the Argentinian history and culture. It was most enjoyable and I will recommend it to anyone.

Best introduction to Buenos Aires. Great starting point for first-time visitors to BaSs. Tour guides are knowledgeable and entertaining. Both tours give you a good idea what the city has to offer. The pace is leisurely and one is encouraged to make mental notes of places to explore further in one's own time.

Do it during you first day or two!. These free tours are EXCELLENT and very well organized.The guides are fluent in English and locals (usually arts, history, human sciences students). There are two different tour, with different focus: the morning one is more focused on historical places and politics. It is very interesting to be able to understand several aspects of Argentinean history. The evening tour is more "cultural"; they talk about their life style, curiosities about buildings, architecture, famous people, points of view. It is VERY interesting. Make sure you do at least one of these tours during the first days of your trip. It will give you a very general view about what is interesting (or not!) for you to see and eventually spend more time visiting later. Also, they can provide you extra tips/suggestions about other places to visit, restaurants to try, etc. It is like having an argentinean friend for few hours. :)Th tour is free, but if you can, pay them tip. It is very appreciate and it is a nice way to keep them motivated to provide us this great "service".ps. apparently there are many cities around the world with these "free tours". Keep on eye on that!

Affordable and Insightful. We loved the morning tour with Maggy so much, we did the afternoon one with Victoria that same day! Both guides spoke excellent English and were friendly, funny and easy to approach with questions etc.The concept of going on a free tour is excellent, because the guide really tries to be as engaging and entertaining as possible to earn a good tip at the end. The total lack of obligation to tip, and the emphasis that you should only pay what you can afford, makes this a stress free experience, and one in which you can get local insight into the history and monuments of Buenos Aries. The morning tour is more political and focuses on El Centro, and the afternoon tour is more cultural and takes you around the fancy neighborhood of Recoletta. I would strongly recommend both!

Make time for this tour!. This tour is very nice. BA is a huge place so you have to focus on the most interesting points. We will be here for a couple of weeks but wanted to get a local perspective. The 11:00am tour focuses on the area from Plaza Congresso to the Presidential Palace, the "pink house". Our guide, Magdalena was very energetic and enthusiastic. She provided good information about the main sights and good perspective on "porteños" and life in BA. The guide will point out that "free" means that you can pay the guide based upon the value you perceive. What other service provider does that? Gives you the tour and then allows you to pay what you think it is worth. If you can make the time, this tour is well worth setting aside 3 hours.

Amazing!. This tour was so much fun and amazing! My friend and I attended both the morning and evening tour. Both of our guides were extremely friendly and knowledgeable about the city of Buenos Aires and Argentina in general. It was great to get a locals perspective and opinions on politics, restaurants, architecture, you name it! The afternoon our especially hit most of the sites that we wanted to see in the downtown area. Their English is excellent and the tour is an opportunity to meet other interesting travelers as well. The guides deserve a great tip but emphasize that whatever you are able to give is a welcome amount. Very welcoming, and fun!
Great introduction to the city history. This is just great, can't believe they do it for free, they deserve a generous tip at the end of the tour for sure

Reminiscent of European Tours. We did both tours on different days during our May, 2013 visit to Buenos Aires. The tour guides are extremely knowledgeable and sociable with excellent English. We learned a lot about BA from the guides.The tour is reminiscent of free tours offered all over Europe, which makes sense given those was their origin.While the tours are "free", please tip to make sure they stay that way!

Great introduction to BA. We did the morning tour on our first day in BA and it was a great way to get a taste for different areas of BA downtown. Vicky was our tour guide and she was so lovely and fun. Our group had about 12 people from all around the world. even though its a free tour, we gave Vicky $100 peso because we enjoyed it so much

11am walk. I did this walk, with Maggie as our tour guide, on 8 July. There were about 30 others on the tour which had the added complication of the truck drivers' protest march in the areas where the walk was to take place, which made the walk that much more interesting and atmospheric. Maggie was enthusiastic, attentive and knowledgeable (I assume), and she obviously enjoyed her role as a guide. At the end of the tour, she made no push for tips, and the level of her services meant that she really didn't need to, anyway.

So much fun!. We did both the 11am tour with Gaston and the 5pm tour with Sol.Both tours were absolutely awesome.Gaston and Sol were great guides - very passionate and knowledgable about their city and showing us around it!The tours are free, but there is no way that you would leave without giving the guides a tip - compared to other cities where a walking tour can cost up to $50 (USD) - this tour is a real bargain!These tours really showed us how close everything in the city is - and we were able to revisit some areas during the rest of our stay.Would definitely recommend these tours - they are fantastic value for money and really show you around the city.

Maggie is the Best!!. Just back to NJ after doing this tour few days ago. Was favorite thing i did on my trip. Great way to meet some fellow tourists too. Maggie was a champion, full of energy and great information .HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

Great way to see the main sights!. I highly recommend this activity - the guides are super friendly, it is quite a lot of walking, but you learn more than if you just wandered on your own. You give a tip at the end, which seems to range based on what you want to pay/can afford (~100 pesos arg to $20). And for great pizza and empanadas afterwards go to Guerrin in avenida corrientes - it's only two blocks from the end of the tour and is delish!!
Gaston is fantastic. Really great way to see the main attractions of this wonderful city, and Gaston is such a great enthusiastic guide that you can't help but catch his enthusiasm for this city.

Brilliant. Cannot recommend highly enough.. We arrived in BA yesterday and a walking tour is always the best way to get your feet on the ground (and knowing where they're going!) We did the 11 am tour with Victoria who did a brilliant job of introducing us to the main sights and the culture, customs and inside jokes of BA and Argentina. We did the 5 pm "Aristocratic" tour with Sol who also did a wonderful job of showing us around the part of BA our hotel was most definitely NOT in! These guys are passionate, fun, interesting and full of quirky facts.... Seriously... do you have any idea what happened to Evita Peron AFTER she died.... We certainly didn't. But we do now. You could not make this "stuff" up in your wildest dreams. Go. Enjoy. Do both tours. (PS - ask Victoria to take you to the Empanada house on Avenida Corrientes and tell her VVN on Tripadvisor said to).

Not to be missed. This is one of best tour I've ever done... It's was fun a full of history. A Great way to see Buenos Aires and learn about the city and their people.We were a small multiculticultural group, so we had the chance to ask questions to our guide Victoria and she had all the answers.And let you free to decided how much you would like to tip... They deserve it!Don't forget to bring your camera, comfy shoes and some water.

Highly recommend. After reading previous reviews we decided to join the afternoon tour having arrived in BA mid morning. Our guide Victoria was fantastic. As well as giving us great insights on locals and history of palaces and events in BA, Vicky's recommendations on where to eat, how to improve our Spanish and places to visit were excellent! Having enjoyed Vicky's tour so much, we decided to do the morning tour with Gaston. And he's as passionate and funny about life in BA as Vicky was. If you've got the time it's worth doing both tours. Neither Gaston or Vicky put any pressure on what, if any tip, you give them however we thought their passion and commitment was worth a generous tip.
Gaston is the man. Super funny and creative way to see the city and learn cool facts while you share the time with other people from arround the globe.

Definite MUST!. If you are out of that typical tour spectrum, then this is the way to do it. Great facts and energy are delivered buy this dedicates local BA lovers. Maggie was my tour guide, her energy, enthusiasm and cool facts made getting to know the city of Buenos Aires so much fun and nice to do it, also you do all in a couple hours. The tour is free and you just have to tip them. For half the price, in my perspective, you have a better experience without all the typical hassle of taking a "normal" tour around the city main spots. If you are that "our of the box" kind of person, then this is the experience you are looking for.

Good Way to See BA. Did the walking tour a couple of days ago and so glad I listened to my daughter. She had done it in February and said it was a "must do". We found it a little difficult to locate the meeting the place despite the pictures on the website, so leave a bit of extra time just in case. Victoria is a fantastic guide, very knowledgeable and smiley. She told us a lot about the history and what we were seeing on our way which is so much better than just walking round a city with a guide book. At the end she told us the way to a place where we could get good empanadas. We tipped her ARG$150 and she seemed genuinely pleased with this which was a relief because it is so hard to know what to give someone.
Victoria was great. I took the 5 pm tour and it was really great what I learnt about the Argentinan people in only 2 hours. Victoria is an excellent tour guide.

Great tour. Absolutely deserves top billing. We did the afternoon trip with Victoria. She's very passionate about her work and it comes out in her tour. Really helps you understand the people of Buenos Aires and their city. Highly recommend for folks who are mobile as there is some walking (bring water) but nothing too demanding.

Sometimes you get more than you paid for.. The Trip Advisor reviews were right on and it was well worth the tip. Gaston is as promised, knowledgeable, funny and helpful. Learned a lot and got oriented to BA.
Highly recommend & you get some good exercise to boot! It is alot of walking though, so if you are not up for that, try the bus.

Great free tour of BA. Gastron is one of the highlights of the whole tour itself. He is funny and at the same time tells you enough info of BA in a probably different way that you'd expected. It's a definitely a must tour to do while you're in BA. He has lots of inside info that might be really helpful while staying there. They have one tour in the morning and one in the afternoon. They're differently run but bith worthwhile going on.Thx again for the great tour in the morning and afternoon.

An inside view of Buenos Aires. Great experience. I did the afternoon tour and our guid, Victoria, did a great job. What I enjoyed more was not the views and the walk around Recoleta, but Victoria's views and stories about the porteños and their way of living. You can't ask more for free, but of course, I think it's woth a tip

Excellent Free City Tours at 11AM and 5PM. Gaston and Victoria are really passionate about the culture, history and people of Buenos Aires. I would recommend starting any visit to Buenos Aires with one or both of their tours and explore the city from there. They work for tips and as such are responsive to their customers.

Better than the paid city tour. We had a tour with Gaston and we found him to be very knowledgeable and passionate about his city. The tour was comprehensive and he told us things about the people of BA which the average tour guide would not talk about. You get to learn about the people and the culture apart from the history of the city. Victoria was the afternoon guide for Recoleta and the aristocratic area and was equally good. And to top it all, it is all based on voluntary tip.

Great tour - and you only pay if you enjoy!. We did three tours whilst in Buenos Aires. One cost 500 pesos, one cost 150 pesos and one cost absolutely nothing. The best? Hands down the free Buenos Aires walking tour! Do not waste your money on any tour until after you have done this one. The local guide is passionate and knowledgable and shows you some of the main spots in the central part of the city. Although the tour takes about 3 hours its not very far to walk and the pace is relaxed. His stories are not the standard fare and he is very interesting. We learnt more in this 3 hours than in the 4 days we have been here.Our only regret is we did not find the your until the last day. There is a second tour in the evening I would have loved to do but we just cannot fit it in. Finally remember this is the tour guide's job so please do tip if you enjoy it. There really was no pressure put on us for a tip which made us happier to give. Given the tour is zero risk to you I highly recommend that you try it out first and I think you will enjoy it asMuch as we did.

Adorable Place and tour. You must walk through this historical sight scenes, where is a mix of Latin america and British influence, and all the way is calm and incredible peaceful.I liked a lot!PS: stop by at "Café La Biella" nearby a Recoleta at 600 Quintana street. Very cozy atmosphere.

Great tour, knowledgeable guides, plus it's free!. We really enjoyed our morning city tour with Gaston. His English was great, and he is super knowledgeable about the city and had lots of interesting facts to tell us. Would highly recommend to anyone spending any time in Buenos Aires.

Slightly long but good value. The tour was a lot of walking and slow at points but got a good feel of the city. The guide Gaston was a local and knowledgeable about everything we asked him. Since the history is not as rich as say Europe, it was a nice relaxing tour. Highly recommended to start your trip off in BA. Bring water and a hat/sunscreen.
Very passionate Afternoon Tour. Victoria lead the afternoon tour. Her enthusiasm as she described the culture and history of the people and the city was infectious. Great walking tour.

GREAT!: Buenos Aires Free Tour. What better way to see the city than with a local who speaks English and loves what he does. Gaston shared his love of Buenos Aires with us as we walked amongst the locals and heard some of the history and understood the sights. Very easy walk, not that long, not fast, but very interesting. Highly Recommended way to see and learn about BA. Payment is tips only, so if you don't like, quietly leave the walk or just don't tip!

Well worth it!. I am skeptical of "free" anything when I travel so I was wondering what the catch would be with this. I was happy to find that there isn't one. This is the real deal. Gaston gives a great tour of the historic parts of Buenos Aires from an insider's point of view. You learn a ton of great stuff, it's funny and you can ask him anything. And it's free. No strings but tips accepted. It's totally no risk to you. If you don't like it, drop out. But you'll learn a lot and if you're like me, you'll think it's worth supporting. Wish they did stuff like this in more places.

Free Tour. The time I spent on the free walking tour was fantastic. Our guide was informative, funny and very much a local. Apart from learning things of historic nature, he was interesting about just "street" things. Something that I had not noticed was that no-one walks in the streets drinking a coffee or eating take-away food. If you see someone doing that they are "tourists" local take time to sit and share! Bring it into Australia PLEASE. Our tour guide fron Intrepid was also fantastic and I can recomment this compny to anyone. I did x2 weeks in Peru with Intrepid and x2 weeks in Chile, Argentina and Brazil. My only regret was that I listed to people at home in Sydney and did not take my mobile (take the global roaming off) and my tablet so I could easliy access internet. Instead I had to rely on hotel connections and internet cafes. I felt safe everywhere I went but .... take the advice of your tour guides and do as they say!Do it by yourself and expect problems, Spend the bit extra to take a tour. You DO NOT have to spend lots but for peace of mind, safety it is all worth it. If I could, I would go again tomorrow:-)

Great introduction to the City. I took both the morning and evening Tours and both tours were very informative and fun. Our guide Sol was very knowledgeable about the citt and gave great local tips and a guide into everyday life of Portenos.

Highlight of my visit. I had only 2 days in BsAs so I decided to go on the city tour and the aristocratic tour and it was amazing!! Definetly a highlight on my visit.The guide was very knowledgeble and it really was an introduction of this amazing place. Thank you!!
Lovely thank you!. A great insight into Buenos Aires and Argentina. Such passion in both guides. Loved the tips on travelling through Argentina also. Not too too much walking either. Just right :)

Great tour with Gaston. You cant go wrong with a free tour, when you just pay a tip at the end for what you think its worth.Three hours walking around the main sites with an international group of tourists and a young local guide who can explain the significance of various public buildings and give insights into the local history and politics is actually invaluable. Gaston did a great job.

I agree with every one who gave this tour an excellent rating.. Read all the excellent reviews and 'ditto' from me, too. We had Sol as our guide..passionate about her city, her history and politics, funny, informative, and interesting at all times. It was a wonderful experience.

So Good. Yesterday 29/3/13 we had both morning and evening tour with Sol and Vicky, both were really great, they give you tips about the city, they tell you so much information that you don't listen going in the bus tour for example. Sol and Vicky were fun were happy were all a tour guide should be, all people enjoyed this, kids, adults and old people. I recommend this tour as the first thing you do when going to Buenos Aires. A and one more thing this is not chamuceo (hope is written right) :)

Excellent walking tour BA. Hi All, the To Travel Too team had an amazing time today with guide and host Sol. Over sixty people in attendance and still Sol was able to manage the numbers. Enough time is given for walk and Sol with her native knowledge is a perfect guide. We would reccomend this tour to visitors to BA.

Interesting and informative tour, and you tip what you will!. I decided to try this tour based off of reviews from here, and wasn't disappointed. I first did the morning tour with Gaston, and liked it so much that I decided to do the evening tour the same day with Victoria. The morning tour goes more into the history and politics and the afternoon gets more into the culture. Both tour guides are excellent and know what they are talking about. They are friendly and able to provide the information in an interesting way.I only have a couple of other comments. Although Gaston says that he will wait for people to take pictures and cross streets, he seems to continue on without noticing when group members get caught up. That being said, the pace is slow enough that as long as you don't lose sight of the group, you won't get lost. Victoria was much better about waiting for everyone, and I found that more relaxing as I didn't have to worry about hurrying to catch up. Some small tidbits in each tour were the same, but it was more for a contextual basis on what each specific group was talking about, so it was warranted and didn't feel repetitive. At the end of Gaston's tour he teaches how to talk with your hands which I found interesting, and helpful. After that, I began to notice everyone doing the same signs that he showed! Victoria tells some interesting stories about families that used to live in the magnificent palaces you'll see along the tour. The afternoon tour also is a little shorter in length and you don't walk as far, so keep that in mind.Overall, both tours were excellent and well worth the time. And since you can tip what you want, you decide how much the tours were worth!
Two Aussies in B.A. 28/03/13.Vicky was our guide for 5pm tour.Many thanks Vicki.You were knowledgeable,pleasant and made the tour interesting.Lyn &Michael from Australia

Great way to discover a city. We did the morning tour with Gaston and the afternoon tour with Vicky.Both tours were different and we learnt so much about the sights, life style and the history of B A.Gaston and Vicky made the tours interesting and enjoyable. They both have so much passion for what they do. I suggest you do the both tours and don't forget to tip well,as they work hard for their there money.

Walking the feet off ourselves in BA!. Thanks Gaston for a fantastic tour today! We really enjoyed learning all about the history of Argentina and Buenos Aires and more importantly we learned how to order coffee properly! Thanks for a tour full of interesting facts, tips and fun! A great way to spend your first morning in Buenos Aires.

Fabulous tour, cant believe its free!!. Just got back from Buenos Aires and did both the morning tour with Gaston and the afternoon with Vicky, both were completely different. Gaston was brilliant so passionate about the history and politics of this great city. Both tours were very entertaining and gave us very usefull information. Would definiately recommend.

Wish I'd done this the first day. Joined the morning tour about an hour into the tour on my last day in BA. Wish I'd done this earlier. The guide gave some good tips about getting around the city, what to see (and not to see), restaurants, etc. As others have stated, he gives his views of political situation and history, which I found it valuable to hear, understanding that there may be other views. Overall great context and a really easy way to get an overview of the city.

A can't believe it's free!. This tour is fantastic (I did the morning tour). It was really hot the day we walked around, but that didn't bother us, as our guide was very informative and entertaining. The tour lasted 3 hours and was never boring or dull.I highly recommend you do this tour before anything else when visiting Buenos Aires as it's a great way to get comfortable with this wonderful city.

Ok tour but could be better. We attended both tours with Gaston and Victoria. The tour with Gaston seemed contain a large amount of his biased view of the Argentinean political system rather than substance for a city tour. Victoria was friendly but provided different answer to that of Gaston's when asked about the protesters in front of the presidential palace. Both tours talked about the thousands of people kidnapped during the military dictatorship and the tour with Victoria mentioned the Jewish memorial, however both tours failed to even mention what happened to the African slaves which at one point consisted of one third of the Buenos Aires population; a pretty significant piece of history I would think to at least deserved a mention.

Loved this tour!. We took this tour our second day in Argentina and it was the perfect way to get acquainted with the city without having to sit on a bus and pay a fortune. In fact, as the name suggests, this was free! But we gave our tour guide, Gaston, a well-deserved big tip. He was awesome and very passionate about Buenos Aires, for both the good and bad. We learned a lot about the history and current state of Buenos Aires, which is a very mixed bag. This tour gave me some great context and information that made the rest of my visit even more rich.

Best way to see Buenos aires. We took both the tours offered by BA 'free' tours and found them informative and engaging. We had both Gaston and Victoria show us around two different parts of Buenos Aires and introduce us to the streets were to come to know. The three hours passes quickly as you are regalled with stories of history, politics and just plain fun about this great city. When they started by asking us to say our name and what city we were from we thought it was a bit hokey but were quickly interested at the broad range of people we were walking with. The 'free' part of this should involve a voluntary donation of around $US20 but that is up to you. We thought it was well worth the cost. Look for a small crowd and their distinctive green shirts at the meeting points.

A must do for anyone who wants to know this beautiful city.. I did both tours, and it was the first thing I did when I got to BA. The guides, Gaston, who takes you on the walking tour, and Vicky, who guides you on the afternoon tour are both really nice. They tell you some really cool stories, which you hear from anyone else, and they also help you understand why the city is the way it is. I recommend it 100%. And also, remember to give them some good TIPS, they really deserve it.

Great tour. We did the morning tour from Congresso to Obelisco and it was very enjoyable. Our guide, Gascon, was very entertaining and approachable. It wasn't quite as good as the equivalent tour in Santiago but still well worth doing.

Great intro to Buenos Aires. This was a fantastic way to start our trip. It helped us get some sense of Argentina's history and independence along with the layout of the city. Gaston our guide was funny, knowledgeable, and had a lot of energy. Definitely worth the three hours and a great way to start off your Buenos Aires visit. I wish they would expand into doing tours of other areas in the city as well cause it's a great model and they're great people.
Worth doing. An excellent way to see Buenos Aires through a local. Very informative and what they are talking about

Great insider's view of Buenos Aires. My wife and I visited BA for the first time and choose the BA Free Tour based on Tripadvisor reviews. The tour did not disappoint. We met our guide Virginia, at the Plaza del Congreso after a short ride on the metro. As a BA native, she was fluent in English and was very knowledgeable in the city's history, landmarks we visited, and culture.The tour was a reasonable time (about 2.5 hours) and distance for most people of all ages and fitness levels, however, for very young children I'd recommend a stroller.Since the tour guides only work for tips, please be generous and consider that the fee-based tours charge anywhere from $50 - $100 per person. Even at US$30 per person, the tour is still a great deal.

Don't listen to the taxi touts. After the attempts by taxi drivers to divert us from the free BA walking tour (they wanted us to book tours with them, of course), we were glad we stuck to our guns and ambled alongside Gaston to see some highlights of BA on foot. Best bang for the buck in BA (no fee,just a tip)!

A very good tour - especially for the money. This was a very fun tour. I did both the morning and evening tours and enjoyed them both. Good tour guides and a nice pace. Note that the groups are pretty large (I'd guess 20 or so on each tour) so obviously it's more for the masses. Given it's donation only, it's well worth it.

A great into to Buenos Aires. This tour gave us a great introduction to Buenos Aires, its architecture, history and culture. Gaston was a charming and entertaining tour guide, mixing up stories, anecdotes and humour to good effect. This tour is not intended to be exhaustive so if you are looking for a highly detailed overview of Buenos Aires (a very big city) choose something else. But if you want a nice 3-hour stroll around some of the city’s main sights and some not-so-well-known places in between, this is a great option. Most participants tipped Gaston at the end (as you would expect – after all, good service should be rewarded).

You have to do this tour!. My husband and I are here in BsAs and even after a private city tour in a van, we decided to do this walking tour. Are we ever glad we did....because it was excellent!! Sol was our guide and over three hours, we saw and learned so much about the city, the country, its history, its politics, etc. She is passionate, articulate, funny and engages the group. She guided us along a very manageable if fast-paced walking tour. I was aware of the "operating on tips" basis, and agree with other reviewers: We WANTED to pay since it was that good. Don't miss it!.

Guides are great!. Both free tours, one in morn and the next day we did the later, early eve one. Great intro' into BA and lots of fun and good information that was formal and informal about the city and country.
Would highly recommend it. The Owens, Toronto, Canada

Great tour. We did the morning tour with Gaston today. It was excellent, relaxed and a lot of fun. He was very informative and funny with it. The tour lasted nearly 3 hours and you felt at the end you knew a lot more about Buenos Aires. Highly recommended.

fun, interesting, thought provoking guide to Buenos Aires and its history. having only a couple of days in Buenos Aires, I'm so glad we caught this afternoon tour! It was a fascinating and very eloquent guide to a vibrant city by one of its own. Sol was enthusiastic, friendly and warm and gave a passionate account of her city, its turbulent politics and history, and life in present day Argentina. Going early on in my visit helped me appreciate the rest of my time there more and I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone dropping by or staying! Thanks Sol!

New to BA - start here. I joined this group for a tour with Sol in the morning a week and a half ago. It took about 2.5 hours with lots of walking. Sol speaks english very well ,she is entertaining, and a local with that not only has a lot of knowledge to share about the history, culture and the people but also has handy safety tips about what to be careful about as a tourist in BA. If you have just arrived in BA I suggest this is a good place to start and of course Sol is very happy to answer any questions about the city and seems to know heaps. It is a free trip but so good that I was very happy to provide the optional tip. Long may it continue.

Entertaining and Informative. We were in Buenos Aires for 6 days - on our first day, we took a 1/2 day bus tour of the city - learned a little about the city and visited lots of souvenir shops. Then we did the free BA walking tours - morning one with Gaston and afternoon one with Sol - what a difference! No souvenir shops, but lots of great information about the country, city, culture, and everyday life in Buenos Aires! Both guides had great personalities and were enthusiastic and proud to show off their city - would recommend this tour to all visitors! Since there is a lot of walking involved, the tour groups tend to be younger (20's -30's)- we were some of the "older" members of the group - over 50 - we managed to keep up and have a great time.

Do this tour!. The tour is well-worth your time. We did the Recoleta tour with Sol. She is simply fabulous! She's incredibly friendly, very knowledgeable about the city's history and shared lots of interesting anecdotes about Argentinian culture and lore. We learned so much more than if we had just used our guide book and roamed around. The tour was longer than we expected (about 2.5 hours). We were going to duck out after the first hour, but we were enjoying ourselves so much that we couldn't leave. They entirely support themselves and this business on tips. There's no pressure to tip more than you can afford. It's a really cool service that they are offering.

Highly recommended !!. It is a fairly complete tour. Begins in the Congress, the goes on Avenida de Mayo until the Casa Rosada and then ends at El Obelisco. The route is 2.30 hours aprox.Our guide today (Gaston) makes it excellent. Explains everything perfect, is open to all sorts of questions and makes it very entertaining. I recommend this walking tour 100%

Great introduction to the city. We decided to do the City tour on our first morning. Our guide Gaston was very enthusiastic and knowledgeable and the tour lasted longer than 3 hours as he gave us so much information at each stop we made. We really enjoyed the tour and it was a great introduction to the city. The following afternoon we did the Aristocrat tour, which was also good but we felt it was a little bit rushed. Although they say Recoletta Cemetery is one of the stops, it is closed by the time you get there and the guide just briefly talked about it when we were standing in front of a nearby church.Overall, I would recommend both tours as a starting point when you first come to Buenos Aires and if you have the time, go back to each of the stops and spend more time exploring. At the end of the tours, there was no pressure to give a tip from either of the guides.I have heard that sometimes there can be a lot of people on the tours but we were lucky to have been in fairly small groups for both tours.

Perfect start to our BA stay. This is a great idea. Gaston, our guide, was very proud of his city and loved sharing it with us tourists. It is a brillant way to see Buenos Aires and we recommend doing the tour at the beginning of your stay.

A great introduction to a beautiful city. We did both tours on our first day and it was a great introduction to Buenos Aires. The guides were enthusiastic and knowledgeable and shared their their love of the city.

okay, not great. We did the morning walking tour on Dec 27, 2012. There were way too many people for one guide. We couldn't hear well and there were so many people (at least 50) that it took too long to cross intersections etc. At the beginning of the tour, he spent 20 minutes answering questions from people that were not relevant to the whole group, while we stood in the hot sun. He could have said I'll answer that while we walk. That being said, I did learn things, the guide was proud of his city. We did leave a tip, however we have had MUCH better free walking tours in Barcelona, Paris and Talinn.

Great way to see BA. We did both of the tours and it's definitely a great way to see the city. Ask the tour guides for tips beyond the tour (ex., restaurants). They gave us some very good recommendations.The tour is free but a tip is highly recommended.
Very Good Tour of BA. Gaston was a very enthusiastic guide with lots of passion for his city. Very knowledgeable and friendly guy. Definitely recommend to take BA in slow pace.

Do this your first day in BsAs. On a beautiful day in November we were guided by Sol on an excellent introduction to Buenos Aires. Not just its history and architecture, but also discussion on some current issues, descriptions of interesting places to see on our own, and practical advice on transportation, safety and currency. Quite an introduction to this beautiful and complex city.As others have mentioned, Sol is quite an amazing young woman -- knowlegable, sociable, and very dynamic. Her voice could be heard without amplification - no mean feat with two dozen tourists in tow, and traffic to compete with.Sol took the time later to offer many suggestions and directions for our upcoming 2-month tour of Argentina - from Jujuy to Patagonia. We're now back in BsAs, and i think we hit every one of the places she recommended -- and loved them all.I'm sure the other guides are good also, but if you are lucky enough to get Sol, tell her Richard and Carol sent you !

A fun afternoon. I did the afternoon "aristocratic" tour leaving from plaza San Martin. The guide, sol, was great fun and told us a lot about the local culture. I met a lot of other travelers too! A great afternoon!

Best way to start your visit to BA. I thoroughly enjoyed the engaging and informed tour Gaston provided. My daughter and I will definitely checkout the 5 pm tour as well. The relaxed,casual atmosphere and the diversity of the group provided a wonderful way to enjoy this city!

Created so many opportunities for an amazing visit to BA. Did the evening tour with Sol. She was great, as was the tour which covered not only places but a lot of the history and culture of BA, as well as introducing many great things to do afterwards. Other people on the tour were fantastic too...

Thank goodness it was free. My husband and I read the reviews and since they all raved we decided what a nice way to see Buenos Aires and went on the walking tour. The tour was scheduled for 11. We actually did not leave til after 11:25. It was hot out that day and those of us who were on time, or early, had to stand out in the sun and wait for another 25 minutes. That is not pleasant. I believe that if you say you start at 11, then please do as you say. if not, let your guests know there is always a delay. The tour lasted for 3 hours. It could and should be about a 2 hour tour. At least 1 hour was spent on self promotion. Again it was hot out and we stood in the sun listening to our guide talk about himself and not the history or sights of architecture we were seeing. We have been traveling in South America for 2 months and this was by far the weakest city tour we have been on. Juan the tour guide had quite a good sense of humor and he knew his stuff. But he always was very full of himself, thought he was terrific, and told us constantly how good he and his company was. He also dropped the [--] bomb several times. Now I myself use that word. But I saw how uncomfortable this was for many of the people in the group. There we people of many different ethnicities there. This not how a proud Porteno should conduct himself. This tour may be "free", but I would rather pay for some professionalism than stand in the hot sun listening to a stand up night club comedy act. I do hope the tour people take some notice here. This could be a fabulous experience.

If you do NOTHING else in BA, do this!. This was the highlight of our trip to Buenos Aires. We met with Sol on a freezing cold Monday evening in September for the walking tour of Recoleta. Sol was engaging and informative, it was hard to believe that such a tour could be free! Aside from the cultural information she gave us, she armed us with tons of useful practical information re: where to go and how to make the best of our time in BA. It is easy to see she is passionate about the city and enjoys sharing it with visitors. We felt like we had made a friend! The tour was so good we made sure we went to the morning tour with Gaston the following morning. This was a more historical view of BA and really put everything into context for us. I cannot recommend these tours highly enough, if nothing else its so nice to meet up with a group of people and get some local insight into the city. Also becasue the tours focus on point out the features of BA rather than visiting attractions in detail, it allows you pick and choose what you wish to visit later on in more detail. An invaluable experience at the beginning of your trip! Thanks so much again Sol! Rach & Andy
Great way to learn about BA. this is a MUST when visiting Buenos Aires! You'll learn a ton about the city, its history, culture, and some politics.

Perfect Intro to B.A.. First of all, it’s true. It’s totally FREE. Sure, the guides work for “tips,” but even their mention of tips was completely understated (making us want to tip even more, since they didn’t pressure us at all).As for the tour itself, we couldn’t have been happier. The trip begins with a brief introduction of fellow tourists and then on to the sights. The tour leader, Juan, had the perfect blend of enthusiasm, professionalism, and great humor. He provided insights about all of the stops along the way, infusing the buildings, monuments and parks with Argentine history and perspective. If you’re looking for a perfect way to get familiar with the heart of BA, this is the tour to take. As an added bonus, it turned out that everyone in our group was very diverse and interesting. Juan even joined a group of us “new friends” at the end of the tour for lunch.

BA free walking tours. This was a very informative 3 hrs. We had about 35 people in the group from all over the world.IT's a great way to get introduced to the city and get a feel for where everything is.

A must do when arriving in Buenos Aires!. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed the morning tour with Juan.He was energizing, knowledgeable, and entertaining.He clarified a great deal for us about the attitudes,culture, graffiti, dog poop, and trash on the sidewalks, among other things.We felt much more comfortable with the City after experiencing his tour.Wear plenty of sunblock, and a hat.Also, take some bottled water.

A wonderful introduction to the area. My husband and I took the evening tour led by Sol. She was wonderful ... Shepherding a group of English speaking strangers through Recoleta, within minutes she had memorized everyone's name, quite a feat. The pace of the tour could be characterized as leisurely, and as other e viewers have indicated this is a combination of history and culture with some current culture throw in. Sol was very entertaining and truly shows her love of country, we tipped in US dollars which I think was preferred,
Good tours. Adriana was very nice in giving me info. Camille was an excellent guide and very helpful. I joined both tours. Worth every moment of my time.

Just OK. Not sure exactly what to say on this one. We had Juan in the morning tour. There was a lot of talking but a lot of it was just not that interesting to us. There needed to be more color facts and maybe less history and political science lesson. We had our 11 year old with us and the amount of cussing that was used was not professional or really appropriate. I had planned to do the afternoon tour, but will pass. There were also a lot of people, around 30 in the group though we did not have any issues hearing him.

Authentic tours delivered with passion. There is no better way to learn about BA and its colourful history than with these guys. Make sure you do both tours. Non scripted and passionately delivered info as we walked through the streets to the famous, and not so well known, city landmarks and historical places.BA is such a vibrant and highly interesting city, and these tour guides share all of their personal knowledge, mixed with humour and some whacky tidbits. Both tours are a must-do when in BA.

Interesting, funny, irreverent and well worthwhile. Gaston puts together an interesting few hours through the streets of Buenos Aires. Because he is not part of a large corporate tour operator he is free to tell things as he sees them. This authenticity is rare and yet exactly what I look for when traveling.

Has to ne the starting point. An excellent way to get to know the landmarks in Buenos Aires and quite a bit around its history. Recommended for solo travelers as it is also a good way to meet others and hang out together. There are two tours, one late in the morning and one in the late afternoon and they cover two different areas of the city, so in theory both should be taken. Remember sun block and a hat!

Information with passion. Our guide was so passionate about his city he made the tour so much more than it could have been. Not the type of tour I would usually do but with a short amount of time in Beunos Aires it was the perfect way to get an understanding of the city layout and some information on the history of the city. The tour was delivered with humour and was interesting. I felt the tip system to be very fair as I was able to assess the value I received and pay accordingly. Definitely worth the time and if you have a few more days I am sure the evening tour is well worthwhile as well. Made my short trip to BA much more memorable.
Brilliant. Well worth it, gaston is fun and entertaining and manages to make a large dirty city vibrant and lively. Highly recommended.
Must-do. Make the time and do both tours. I've been to Buenos Aires several times and this was, without question, the most fun, informative tourist activity I've done.

A wonderful way to experience BA. Gaston is a wonderful guide, filled with colourful stories and willing to spend as much time as needed to answer our questions. You get a real flavour of Argentina, in general and Buenos Aires in particular. I did the 11 am tour that starts at the Plaza del Congreso.and winds down the streets to the Presidential residence and the Obelisk among others. Its fun, informative and a great way to see central BA in a short period of time.The only cost is the tip at the end which is highly worth it!
A good idea to start to know BA. Gaston was fun and informative! Recoleta tour gives you a different perspective.You also meet many other travelers.Thank you guys!

Great Buenos Aires tours. I took the morning city tour and the evening aristocratic tour. Both tours were wonderful. Gaston was our morning guide, full of energy, tons of information, and more than happy to share with everyone in our group. Camilla was the evening tour guide and she was equally great. Both are native Portenos and were eager to share stories of their city. These tours were a highlight of my time in Buenos Aires, and I would highly recommend them to anyone. And....it's free! There's no pressure to tip, but I was more than happy to at the end of each tour. Thanks, BA Free Tour!

BA Free Tours. I would highly recommend the tour to anybody who would like to understand better the Buenos Aires vibe. Sol was the perfect host. She went an extra mile to answer all possibe questions: from history and politics to how to move around the city. It is definitely must do experience

¡go for it!. In this tour locals show you around their city and... they realy realy love to be proteños and want foreigners to understand their passion. There is 2 tours a day from monday to saturday, no tours on sunday. I liked the morning tour better, but I think it depends a lot on the guide. The morning guide (sorry, am so bad with names) was very passionate and knew a lot about details. She gave many sideinfos and went with us to one of the best pizza-places in the Baires after the tour. Highly recommended, its very good to go there in the first days of your visit and you will get many usefull informations like safety, fake money, trips, how to safe money, up-to-date event infos, political information aso. The homepage has a nice blog and you can also book individual tours. The tour is free but of course you should tip the guide. Thanks a lot BAfreetours for showing me your view of BsAs!! Nos vemos!

Do it!. We loved this tour!We were in BA for 2 weeks before we decided to check out this walking tour. Why did we not do it earlier!!? Lol Gaston was our guide and he is so enthusiastic about his city. He explained the history and tales behind so many buildings, squares and most interestingly the ways of the Porteños. We were entertained for over three hours! So we decided to also do the 5pm tour through other parts of the city. I recommend this to anyone visiting BA.It's free but he lives off this and def deserves a big tip. I have no idea how his voice holds up for so long.

Awesome tours. I did both the morning and afternoon tours. Gaston was very lively, fun, and informative. These are great to do your first day or so in BA, I was able to navigate back by myself to some of the sights. Highly recommended~

local insight. I especially welcomed local point of view, more real approach, and definitely more truthful to the reality in Buenos Aires. The info was communicated in a fun way, often with sarcasm and jokes. I took both tours - morning and afternoon. Once I had it with Sol, another time with Gaston. Both were really good and entertaining. Personally I prefered the one with Sol because of the tour agenda. The afternoon tour covers less know buildings, facts. The morning to me was quite obvious as I already lived in B.A. for few months and had seen the points of interest by myself as they are the most popular attractions - Casa Rosada, Catedral, Palacio Barolo etc. I recommend taking the morning tour as soon as you arrive, the second tour as a second. And do not forget to tip, that's how they can do this for you.

Must do!!!! Graham portsmouth 21 nov 12. “Wonderful intro to Buenos Aires” I did the morning tour (with Gaston) The walk was excellent. Gaston is lively individuals with a great passion for their city and country.. He made sure that the tour was really informative and enjoyable. He provides a historical overview with some (general and entertaining) political backdrop and then spices it all up with a very charismatic firsthand perspective of how and why BA is such a unique city. I highly recommend any tourist to make the effort to attend one of their walks, you won´t be disappointed!!!If you only have a few days in Buenos Aires - make sure you find time to do at least one of the free tours offered by these guys.

Go!. Buenos Aires is too big but you can do some walking tours. The tour is delicious because the city is flat and you do not feel any difficulty. We did the aristocratic tour with Camila and had a great time. check the schedule and go!

Do It - Do It Day 1. I recently did the 11 am tour on my last day in Buenos Aires. It was excellent and I wish I had done it the first day and I wish I would have also planned to take the evening walk. I have never taken a walking tour before and it was well worth the time - loved the personal touch given by the tour guide because she was a local. The stories she told were "sticky" and memorable - much more informative and entertaining than a tour book. Highly recommend!!!

The best tour guides at BA Free Tour. We loved both the morning and evening tours. Our guide was Sol and she is amazing! Gave us a great sense of what it is like in Buenos Aires, including what do see and do while traveling there.

I liked this tour very much!. I think this was the best tour I have ever taken in Buenos Aires! I´ve been to this city several times and I took different tours every time I came here. This one was relaxing, the guide was great and knew lots of things about Buenos Aires and its curiosities and the itineraty was very well selected (I took the Aristocratic Tour)Well done guys!

Wonderful intro to Buenos Aires. I did both the morning tour (with Gaston) and the afternoon tour (with Sol). Both walks were excellent. Gaston and Sol are two lively individuals with a great passion for their city and country...both were enthusiastic, comedic and informative. I highly recommend any tourist to make the effort to attend one of their walks, you won´t be disappointed!!!

Must do in Buenos Aires. If you only have a few days or are just starting a longer trip to Buenos Aires - make sure you find time to do at least one of the free tours offered by these guys.We did the daytime tour with Sol and it was so good that we made time to do the evening tour too.We agree with all of the great feedback already posted here. Our guide, Sol, made sure that the tours were really informative and enjoyable. She provides a historical overview with some (general and entertaining) political backdrop and then spices it all up with a very charismatic firsthand perspective of how and why BA is such a unique city.Great tours.

Must do activity in BA; Best thing in BA. I went on both the morning tour (with Virginia) and afternoon tour (with Gaston) because they were so good.It's great to have locals, who speak perfect English, give you their perspectives on the history and (dare I say) politics of this city and country. Each of this tours last just over two hours. The walk is leisurely, and you get to see the important sights of the city, with great commentary.Well worth the effort! These guys are great ambassadors for Argentina and Buenos Aires (unlike the yellow Buenos Aires Hop on Hop Off Bus [trading as Buenos Aires Bus] -- which is a total rip off, to be avoided at all costs). Do the walk instead!

Fantastic walking tour. Just returned from the 11am walking tour and really enjoyed it. Vir, our tour guide was super enthusiastic and very knowledgable. She was happy to answer any question the group had and gave us a good insight into the city and the porteños in it! Starting at El Congreso the tour takes in all of Av. De Mayo with some interesting stops along the way, plaza de mayo and along to the obelisk. Tour takes roughly 2 1/2 hours so make sure you take water etc if it's a hot day!
Great tour. It was a 2 and half hours tour with Gaston. We walked through Av. de Mayo, and he told us a lot about the city and the Portenos way of life.

Excellent tour. We really enjoyed this tour around the centre of Buenos Aires, it was both fun and very educational and it took us to places which we'd probably never visited on our own. And Gaston is a great guide!
We can recommend this tour to everybody!

Great introduction to Buenos Aires. If you are interested in not only visiting the main sightseeing but also learn a bit of the "portenho" culture I strongly recommend the free tours! They have two tours and I recommend both. And you can ask for information to the guides, Virginia and Sol, who are very nice people!

Great way to tour BA. Gaston was a great guide, with a lot of knowledge on BA. I did both the aristocrat and city tour and both were equally good. I highly recommend to start your visit in BA with these tours as it gives you an understanding of the city's history, the key sights to see and the meaning behind key monuments.

Good intro to Major Sights of the City. Virginia was a very good guide. Enthusiastic and energetic, she kept everyone interested for the 2 or so hours she had us on an unseasonably hot spring day. We did the morning tour, which takes you to the Congresso, pink house, cathedral, and other major sights. Virginia was knowledgeable about BA and willing to explain the country's politics and many protests, which are a visible feature of BA. She recommended each person tip 50 pesos, which seemed a bit low to me (when converted to US dollars) and I expect many gave her more.

Really good free walking tours of Buenos Aires. We did the morning tour with Gaston (great) and the afternoon tour with Sol (nice).It's a good introduction to the city and to Argentinian people. We have learned a lot and have the feeling we understand better the city, the country and the people.Good tours, where you can ask all your questions.Good atmosphere and good fun.

A must do in Buenos Aires. I have just come back from the afternoon (cultural) free walking tour with Camilla and am still buzzing from what I learned. Despite only spending just over 2 hours walking around I really feel like I know the city and have been exposed to the history and culture. From starting at the Monument San Martin we visited several palaces, heard about the British, French and Spanish influences in the city, saw the Malvinas and Israeli embassy monuments, and visited the Avenida Alvear - BA's equivalent of New York's 5th Avenue, before finishing up in La Recoleta at the cemetery where Evita is buried. I really cannot recommend this tour highly enough - and hope I get a chance to do the morning one before I leave.

good, entertaining, despite torrential rain. Virginia our guide interspersed historical facts with local news, e.g. as a student she was on strike for better education facilities. She did this in torrential rain, and kept us entertained. I was quite disappointed when it ended. The tour is a 2 hour wander around the main sites in the area between Plaza Congresso and the pink palace. Best bits were learning about how to order coffee in BA, e.g. the difference between a lagrima (3/4 milk and a ¼ coffee) and a jallista (?) which is the other way around, and a cortado (an espresso) and the word for a cappuccino which I have now forgotten! I also liked getting the bits of recent history about the veterans from the Malvinas/Falklands war who were on hunger strike outside the presidents palace to claim their unpaid wages, and the condom over the obelisk story. Nicely done! I would have given 5* but think that some more local stories would have been good, how things were experienced by people in the city, or an overview of how all the bits fitted together would have been good - BUT I am being fussy here! Overall a great tour that i would recommend.

Great for groups!. I scheduled a group tour for 15 teenagers that were visiting Buenos Aires. They wanted a tour to check out the city, but I was a bit worried about the tour holding their interest.
