But I had no reason to be! Gaston managed to keep their attention the entire time, by modifying the tour to fit their interests, and even stopping for ice cream along the way. He was also kind enough not to be flustered by us showing up 1.5 hours late! If you have a large group, this is a great and very reasonable option (email in advance!)
Definitely worth doing. We did both the open top bus tour and these walking tours and the walking tours were 100 times better than the bus tour - and cheaper!Would highly recommend doing both tours.

A Great Snapshot of BA. We did both the 11am and 5pm tours and loved them both. The morning tour (approx 3 hours) gave a good brief history of the city, and the evening tour (approx 2.5 hous) more cultural. Both were very engaging and casual, a perfect way to see BA if you only have limited time.

A Charming Introduction To Buenos Aires. On Friday, 5 October, my wife and I had the pleasure of joining the morning tour conducted by a delightful young lady named Sol. Sol was personal, warm and charming, and spoke English clearly. Her explanations were fascinating, full of information and delivered with enthusiasm and humor. Even my Argentinian-born wife learned facts about her home-town that she didn't previously know. We found the tour with Sol completely enjoyable and readily recommend it.

Great tours, better than the bus. We took both the afternoon and morning tours and our guides provided a lot of historical and cultural background that gave us better insight into argentinians. We also did the Buenos Aires bus, which provides audio overviews of the city, which came at a price, and were way less informative than the free tours. Thanks to Vir, I have been enjoying submarinos ever since.

Intro to BA. We took the morning walking tour of BA, led by Gaston. It was a good introduction into the central area of the city. It was the right pace and mix of information and humor without too much detail to be boring. Gaston was enthusiastic and had a good recommendation for a tango show later that eveing.

Worthwhile. I took both AM and PM tours and both were pretty good. The culture one (I had it with Sol), was the better of the two so if you only have time for one, I would suggest the latter. The PM is more about the Buenos Aires you won't hardly read on travel books. The former was a hit and miss for me (having already taken a similar walking tour and done background reading about the city). I was looking forward to a bit more info about the other buildings on Avenida de Mayo. Regardless, I learned bits and pieces on this tour that I wouldn't have otherwise known, so for a couple of hours each, it was worth it.

Exceeded Expectations!. We participated in the evening walking tour. This tour of Buenos Aires exceeded our expectations. Our guide was extremely knowledgeable and entertaining. Her English was perfect and her enthusiasm for Buenos Aires was contagious. We would have loved if a walking tour at this level was available in every city in South America!Thanks Camilla for sharing the history of B.A with us and helping us understand the many passions that are a part of the life of an Argentinian.

Perfect to start your stay in BA with a tour like this!. I did the 11am tour with Gaston and the 5pm tour with Sol. Both tours were very interesting and informative in a relaxed way. The tours are quiet different. So, I can recommend everyone to attend both. Thx to Gaston and Sol who did a very good job.

OK but have been on better. Doing the 5pm tour with Sol around aristocratic Buenos Aires was excellent. She was passionate about her subject and very informative - not just about the historical stuff but also personal information that only a local would know. Hey - walking through the "plastic surgeon" part of town we got to see some pretty wild "fixed faces". Just not very happy that the tour ended at 8pm, in the dark, out by Recoleta cemetery - our only way home was by taxi. The 11am city tour with Gaston was OK but he seemed to be having a better time than the group. Everything was delivered with a funny/clever line when actually most of what we needed were the facts. It was a big group so maybe a little difficult to keep us all interested. Two days earlier we had walked the same walk with a different "free tour" which hands down was 100% better. Same walking distance but much more information delivered in a much more professional, interesting way. The tour says they are free - therefore it is not acceptable in our opinion to hear Gaston saying/laughing that 100 pesos would be an amount to give. That said - we defy you to walk away without giving anything. They say: "spread the word" - they also mean: "give us the peso"

Brilliant walk in an amazing city. I wandered towards the appointed meeting place and was amazed to see people just rocking up to a sign in the middle of the plaza del congreso, on time!! We all shook hands and introduced ourselves and were off on an amazing walk with Virginia (Vir, like beer) as our guide. All of a sudden the mysteries of the city I had felt quite alone in for the past week were opened up. I at last found out how to order the right coffee ( a jarita as opposed to a lagrima or cafe con leche), what a submarina was (something yummy to do with chocolate!), where parliament went during the revolution (the coffee shop of course!) and was totally blown away by the story of the abuellas de la plaza de mayo, who still walk every Thursday at 3pm. Thank you for sharing the stories of your amazing city Virginia!! I thoroughly recommend this walk and can't wait to return another day to find out more!!

As good as it gets. Have done a few of these "free" walking trips in various cities around the world and this one was up there with the best on both morning and afternoon walksI would suggest taking some insect repellent on the afternoon walk as the Mosquitos moved in heavily towards the end

Friendly and fun. We took both tours, the afternoon tour guided by the bubbly Camilla and the day tour under Sol, full of verve and ready to offer opinions in addition to providing facts and figures. The guides do a great job of involving the participants in the walk by remembering their names, and encouraging people to mix and chat as they walk along. This is much better than the canned tours run by the big tour companies.

Extremely Entertaining and Interesting. We did both tours (downtown/central Buenos Aires & Recoleta/Retiro), and they were indeed some of the most fun and entertaining hours we had in the city. We were lucky enough to have Gaston as our guide. He has a great sense of humor, which made the tour really fun as well as really interesting. The pace of the walks was pretty leisurely, and Gaston answered all questions. He also asked the group questions to get people talking and involved. I felt that we got a better perspective on the city's history here than in some of the museums, and that Gaston's company is a very good ambassador for the city to us English speakers. This is a free tour, so no one is obligated to pay; or you just can tip the guides what you can. However, I would value the service being provided for each 2-3 hour personally guided tour at least at 100 pesos ($20-$25 US). I would certainly have bought a ticket for such a tour for this amount, and I would have felt it was a really good value. One other benefit of the tours was being able to meet other tourists who were in town. We kept bumping into the same people during our visit, which was also fun.

Really great way to learn about BA. We did both the 11am tour with Gaston and the 5pm tour with Camilla. Then morning tour despite the rainy weather was a great intro to the city's political history. Gaston was a great guide always making sure our questions were answered and really opening our eyes to some of the darker times in BA history. At the end of the tour he was great in suggesting a good place to eat.Camilla lead our evening tour through some of BA's fancier neighbourhoods. She was very animated in her descriptions.Overall, this is definitely something we would suggest to every person visiting BA.
really nice job today, Virginia. very nice 3 hour tour day. Great amount of information shared and nice format to ask questions. Loved input about political situation in Argentina which is complex.

A must do in BsAs. I did the morning (11:00 AM) city tour and it was outstanding. Virginia (Vir) was informative, knowledgeable, entertaining and just plain fun. She did her best to bring our small tour group together by encouraging us all to get to know each other. We became a group of friends touring! I’ve been to Buenos Aires many times on business but never took the time for a real city tour. This was worth the 3 hrs. I highly recommend it! Jim R

Freaking do it!. We did the afternoon tour ( Hi Cami) and the morning a day after (Hi Virginia) and we loved both. The guides are informative, entertaining, funny all what you want for... free! I wish Id live in a city where things like this can happen. I congratulate the entire BAfreetours team and promise if I return to BA I will take it again, just for the fun of it.For non-english speakers there are options in other languages, so please dont hesitate to go to their webpage and ask.

Very Informative. We did both tours on the same day with BA free tours. Found the morning city tour to be a little slow in getting going. Our guide, Virginia, was very good about explaining the different aspects of typical BA life, showing us the major sites and giving us information about the political background that has shaped the lives of Portenos over the years. At times, she was a little animated, which is probably better than being dull, but it felt a bit over the top for my wife and I. Overall, highly recommend the tour as it is an easy way to see the city, get information that you wouldn't typically get from guidebooks, and obviously very reasonable even with the tip at the end. I would recommend doing this early in your visit as it gets you used to the parts of the city, and is a good venue for asking questions about what to do in BA. Good overview of the city and very knowledgeable tour guides.

Informative and entertaining. This was one of the first things we did upon arriving in BA. Took the 11 a.m. city tour with Vir which included the Plaza de Mayo, Casa Rosada, and Congreso among many other stops. She was a great! She was full of historic information as well as giving us much insight to the people of Argentina. She also added a lot of humor, keeping the attention of my 18 and 24 year old daughters (which is a feat in itself). I especially commend her for making our group feel comfortable---with people from all different countries, she made us all welcome and it was a pleasure to get to know them as we strolled along. Another plus was that we were encouraged to ask her any questions (unlike other tours I've taken when you feel like you shouldn't interrupt the guide). This tour gave us a good overview of the city and it was beneficial to orient ourselves. There was also a 15 minute stop where you can grab a cup of coffee or use the restrooms which I thought was convenient. We were sorry when it was over!

Fab, great way to know the main sights of the city. We took the 11am tour and we loved it, our guide, Virginia was so enthusiastic and funny,and gave us a fantastic insight to buildings, streets and other facts about Buenos Aires. Great way to spend 2hrs, we could ask any question and she would have the answers. We'd recommend it!

Reliable, interesting, and fun!. My husband and I are not big tour people, but we read such good things about BA Free Tours on Tripadvisor that we decided to try it this past week. We started with Juan for the morning tour and had a great experience. He was extremely knowledgeable as well as personable. He presented a lot of very interesting history and added information about Argentinian culture as well. His "chamuzo" kept us all involved with the tour from start to finish. I was so interested in some of the history after hearing Juan that I bought two autobiographies on the Dirty War that night. We actually ran into Juan with another tour group two days later and joined them for coffee. We had a two-hour discussion of philosophy, literature, and culture that can't be found in a tour book or on a tour bus.Because we enjoyed Juan's tour so much, we did the afternoon tour as well with Sol as our guide. Again, we had a wonderful experience as Sol really knew her stuff. She showed us the Recoleta neighborhood in great detail all while adding in more cultural information that was fascinating. We continued to "look for lions" all over town after that tour.We highly recommend the BA Free Tour! They are at the meeting places in their bright green hoodies rain or shine - and we know that for a fact since the second day we ran into Juan with the other group, it had been raining all day. The four people in that group said that they figured he wouldn't show up, but they were wrong. Reliable, interesting, and fun - what more could you ask for?

Charismatic guide, excellent experience. We had Sol as our guide on our final night stay in buenos aires. It was a fantastic tour that also had funny elements (look out for lions). Sol was charismatic, energetic and took the time to answer questions. The night tour into one of the richest areas of buenos aires was a great alternative when comparing other poorer parts of town. It highlighted the many contradictions found in Buenos Aires!!! Don't forget to have money to tip the guide - while it is not necessary you will want to provide something to show your appreciation. Highly recommended, would definitely do similar tours with same company....

Good way of getting to know Buenos Aires on foot. My and my boyfriend took both free tours: the morning one through the city center and the one in the afternoon though the Recoleta neighbourhood. It was a great way of getting to know the city, the Argentinian culture, the habits of the people. Both guides were local youngsters, which gave us the feeling we were really getting a local perspective, and were very knowledgeable about the history of Argentina and the monuments in Buenos Aires. They made their best to be very engaging, by telling jokes and making personal comments, and to make the visit as interactive as possible, by posing questions to the tourists and encouraging them to do the same. Personally I prefer low-profile guides, who state the facts and leave all the judgment up to myself, but still I enjoyed the guides and both trips!A tip on how to find the guides: they wear bright green hoodies with black letters on their back.

Great way to see the city. My friend and I just arrived to Buenos Aires, and after taking a free tour in Santiago de Chile that was an awesome experience, I wanted to try it again. We had Sol as our guide for the afternoon 5 pm tour. It lasted a little over two hours, but the time flew by since she gave us a lot of history and background to the Argentinian culture and way of life. She also was happy to answer any of our questions and give us tips on other things to do, see, taste, etc in Buenos Aires. The tour was in English, and we got a lot out of it!

11 am tour with Virginia. We had high hopes for this tour since we read great reviews online and had already done a free walking tour in Santiago. The guide, Virginia, has a good command of English and is very dramatic. For my taste a little too dramatic. The tour was 2 hours and 45 minute with a 15 minute stop at Plaza de Mayo to get something small to eat and/or go to the bathroom. The information given was mostly historical, but lacked depth. We might have seen everything on the list but the following attractions were never talked about Calle Florida, Manzana de las Luces, Cabildo, Estacion Peru and Teatro Colon. I would have also liked to hear more cultural references and received more background info on everyday life in Argentina. Like the information that Virginia provided about the Cafe Tortoni.

Good and funny tour. I heard from the BA Free Tour from other people in my hostel.I went to the first to the city tour and liked it so much that i went to the aristocratic tour aswell the next day.The tourguides are young and funny people, you learn about Buenos Aires, Argentina, but you also hear funny stories and they give personal advice if you have questions about events etc.The tour is tip-based, i loved to give tip for such good tours!

Are you kidding?. Good information is extremely valuable, and at the end of this "free tour," our tour guide Vir suggested a 50 peso ($12 US) donation. It was worth WAY MORE than that. We took the AM tour, and the only reason we didn't go on the PM tour also was that it was too cold. In retrospect, we we should have purchased some warmer shoes and gone on that tour too.

BA Free Tour- Excellent way to see the city. My brother and I recently visited Buenos Aires. I had done a lot of research prior to our trip about tours around the city and came across BA Free Tour. I was skeptical at first given that it's free but could not have been more impressed with the company and their guides. We went on Gaston's morning tour that starts at the Congress building on our first morning in BA. The tour lasted around 3 hours and he took us all around the Centro area, visiting the Congress building, Avenida de Mayo, Casa Rosada, Cafe Tortoni, Peru Station, Calle Florida and ending at the Obelisk. Gaston was a fantastic tour guide. He is a porteno who also spent some time living in the States. His passion for his city is contagious and he gave us a great historical background of the city and its culture. The tour also was a great way to get a feel for the city and its geography. Gaston is one of the owners of BA Free Tour and he gave us lots of suggestions of other things to do in the city and offered help planning. We had such a great experience that we decided to go on the 5pm Recoleta tour and had Sol as our guide. This tour explores a different area of BA and Sol was just as phenomenal as Gaston. She gave a great context for everything we saw (San Martin monument, Malvinas/Falklands Memorial, British clock tower, embassies in Recoleta) and what it means to Argentinians today. These two tours together made for a great start to our trip and gave us solid bearings on the city. I cannot recommend it any higher. These tours are so worth it!

Perfect orientation. Virginia was exuberant and enthusiastic - a true porteño. The tour is quite easily the best way to get an orientation of this widespread metropolis - it's run efficiently. The walk isn't tedious - the sights are splendid.

Educational and enjoyable. The guides working with Buenos Aires Free Tours are the friendliest and he most entustaistic guides i have ever met! Both the morning and evening tour are fantastic and informative and the guides paint Buenos Aires in such a imortant and beautiful light! From the pink house to the cemetery, all of Buenos Aires is amazing and im sure everyone who goes on that tour thinks so too.

Interesting and informative. I really enjoy seeing "famous" sites and having the locals take on politics, economics and culture of a place. Virginia was a great guide and I enjoyed her insights and her attempt to be unbiased. It was a great tour.
Enjoyable tour.. Fun tour with only 200 years of history. Good information with good sights to see in the modern city. Enjoyed the tour and company I met.

It's a must!. We took both the morning and the afternoon tours of Buenos Aires. Our tour guides, Gaston and Sol, were not merely extremely well informed and engaging, but they were original, entertaining and funny. This is an absolutely lovely experience and I would recommend it to anyone. Walking everywhere is the way to immerse yourself in the atmosphere of the city and Buenos Aires is absolutely stunning!

BA Free Tour. What a fantastic tour of a fascinating city with a short but interesting history. The tour guide, Gaston gave an energetic, funny & informative view of BA and Argentineans. This is my second visit to Buenos Aires and it would be in my top 3 recommendations of must do's whilst in BA, also check out their blog on the website for places to eat, stay & see-really great tips.

Take both the morning and afternoon tours!. A fun walking tour of the city that gives you lots of information--official and insider. One thing I greatly appreciated was that the guides took time to ask about your experience and interest in Buenos Aires and then made very good recommendations for dining and activities as well as let you know what special events were happening during your visit.

Best Overview of Buenos Aires. We had a fantastic walking tour of the architecture of Buenos Aires with a knowledgeable, enthousiastic and outspoken guide named Sol. She brought her beloved city alive for us. We did the afternoon tour (didn't have time for the morning history walk). We highly recommend it. You will see BA through the eyes of a local, and she is willing to answer all of your questions about politics, social issues and recommendations of other things to see and do.

Morning and afternoon tours - both excellent and highly recommended. Sol and Gaston each led the afternoon/morning tour respectively - both were enthusiastic and friendly guides. They covered different areas of BA and as such the associated history (e.g. the afternoon tour finished at the Recoleta cemetry at which Eva Peron was buried; whereas the morning tour covered the Plaza de Mayo where the mothers and grandmothers of those who disappeared under the military dictorship have been gathering weekly for 30 years). In addition, they would also share trivial/fun/local knowledge facts - e.g. why the city is constantly short of coins in circulation, and talk about things that the whole city is crazy about (football, politics, matte..). We finished the tours feeling much happier, feeling so much more in touch with the city.

A must-do in BA.. We thoroughly enjoyed the commentary from our witty and insightful guide, Gaston. The tour gave us a much better insight into BA's history, and social and political life. Highly recommended.
shockingly terrific!. super interesting. funny guides- we did two tours- and just really informative. for anyone who can walk.

Forget the yellow buses, go by foot!!!. I did both tours and was very pleased!I had been in BsAs for 3 months when i decided to go and finally do the tours. Their explanations were very good, very dynamic and fun.I recommend both these tours.P.s: People don't be cheap! Leave the guides tips!

A great way to get your bearings!. We have recently come home from a two week stay in BA. We arrived on a Sunday and decided that the first thing we would do on Monday would be to take the free tour. We were not all that familiar with BA and its history, so we wanted to get our bearings before exploring over the next couple of weeks. We were not disappointed. We were met promptly at 11 a.m. by Gaston, our guide. His love and enthusiasm for the city where he was born and raised was contagious. He shared the history and culture of the city on many different levels and would answer ANY question that you might have. He said that if he did not know the answer, he would look it up, but he never had to because he knows his stuff. We had such a great time that we decided to do the second tour of the Recoleta neighborhood later in the day. Again, we were not disappointed. Daniela, our guide, was just as professional and enthusasitic as Gaston and had all the answers. She was even quite the dipolmat when she thought I was asking her about her opinion of the current President - where I was really asking about the general country's feelings. Our one suggestion with this tour might be to bump up the start time a little as we finished in the dark. We would highly recommend these tours. They are indeed free- although you may(and should) tip afterwards. This is how these folks make a living! Don't be stingy Americans! Each tour is about 2 1/2 hours long and is worth every peso!

Totally recommend both tours. We took the morning tour on our first day, and did the afternoon tour a few days later. Both tours were fantastic. We loved the guides (Virginia for the AM, Camilla for the PM). They were knowledgeable and had great passion for BsAs. Totally great way to be introduced to this wonderful and unique city.

Very Enthusiastic Guides. It's free because you pay at the end what you can afford and think the tour is worth to you. We thoroughly enjoyed both the 11 a.m. and 5 p.m. tours which cover different parts of Buenos Aires. Be prepared to walk, though. Carry water and snacks, if you usually do and dress for the weather/time of year. Both young women (guides) are very enthusiastic about their home city and all that it has to offer. The end time is flexible, so don't make any specific appointments until well after the three hours from the starting time, or you'll miss out. And, don't skip out before the tour ends--these gals deserve to be tipped/paid! Yes, a few people did skip out.

Buenos Aires free walking tour - 11 am. We decided to do this tour with our 4 yo daughter on our first day in BA. Our guide, Bia, was fantastic. She seemed to be very experienced, entertaining and most of all...patient with the only child joining the tour. The toilette breaks were well received! I highly recommend families (maybe younger children in a pram) to take this tour as soon as they arrive in the city. Buenos Aires is a great place for walking, Being guided and entertained by a local is an extra bonus. BTW, the guide will ask for voluntary donations at the end of the tour. We also did half of the late afternoon tour, which was interesting,,,but at this stage my 4 yo couldn't walk anymore on her 'little legs', as she described. Check it out www.bafreetour.com

Buenos Aires free walking tour - 11am. We did the 11am tour recently and it was great. It focuses on the historic sector centre part of the city, National Congresso down Avenida de Mayo (finishing at the Oblesik). The best part is Gaston's knowledge and the insight you get to Argentina today, plus history and how Portenos live - plus he can give you tips on Tango shows etc.

Explore the major sites in 2.5 hours. The 11am tour gave me a great overview of the cities main historical sites in an entertaining way. Gaston is funny and gave a lot of great practical advice like what the different types of coffee orders are and which museums you should actually spend time at. Also, he will answer any other questions that you have about other things to see as well as provide his information for questions later.

Do both! These guys are incredible. I was in BsAs studying "la guerra sucia" (The Dirty War) in December 2010. I did both tours. I can't remember the name of the guide on the afternoon tour but Gaston was who I toured with in the morning. They take their time, and know the answers to all of your questions. They are so helpful and friendly and even let me talk about the Dirty War when questions came up about it. They love their job and work very hard for their tips. I can't imagine a more in depth and awesome tour. Every city in the world needs to establish this! Genius!

excellent and unique tor! a must do!. We found about this tour while we were in Bs As through a friend that recommended us to join Sol's and Gaston's tour. Sol gave us a great background of portenios and the city with useful insight that you cannot get in a bus tour -running-around-type. We recommend you to take this tour and walk around this loving tourist guides and enjoy their information and tour. Don't forget to tip because even though it does not have. price is not free!!! You pay what you think it costs. And considering the high costs of the not-so-unique tours in bug cities we considere that this one a worth one and we contributed to the tour.:)

great tour by Sol- definitely recommend this for anyone traveling to BA. My husband and I found out about this the last day we were in Buenos Aires-- such a shame- because we went on Sol's 5pm tour and absolutely loved it! We wish we were able to go to the 11am tour. Sol explained a lot on how portenos think and their culture and customs. I recommend this tour to anyone traveling to Buenos Aires. It is also worth taking a tour in Buenos Aires because there is so much history there and influences the way the entire city is. You basically tip Sol how much you want-- she recommends 50 pesos per person which I think is a very fair rate!

Great. We did both tours and we liked it very much. The guides are very good and funny. Even our daughter (12 years) liked it a lot. We got a lot of information about the history of the city and the buildings and about politics. So do the tour at the beginning of your stay. They also give you informations about good restaurants and bars. It is free but we gave them a good tip.

Excellent tours: Informative & fun. We did the morning (11:00) tour with Virginia, she was EXCELLENT !!!and also the afternoon (17:00) tour with SOL - she was great too.I recommend those tours with all my heart.Their site: http://www.bafreetour.comThey ask only a tip at the end.

Entertaining and Informative Tour. We took both tours (on separate dates) and they were great. We had Sol for the Aristocratic and Virginia for the City tour. The tours are very informative. Both guides gave us great insight into the Argentine people not just the buildings we visited. I would highly recommend going early on in your trip as you'll have a nice overview of the city and you can focus the rest of your time.

Very knowledgeable and entertaining guide. I did the "free" tour (it would be rude not to tip) a few days ago around the centre of Buenos Aires. This tour runs from the congress square along Avenida de Mayo to the Plaza de Mayo, then back up to the Obelisk. This seems a short route but still takes 2-2.5 hrs as there are a number of stops along the route where the guide (I had Gaston) gives a very thorough and entertaining explanation of the history and current uses of the sights. Overall an excellent tour with a good and entertaing fuide that had all thr knowledge abd was able to answer a whole number of quedtions from the group. Expect to tip only what you can afford - there is no hidden "mandatory" charge but it would be rude not to for such a great tour.A couple of notes on the meeting point, tour begin at 11am in the congress square, but it does not begin from directly outside the congress building. Instead the meeting point is along the right of the large gated monument opposite the congress building when you are facing the congress building itself. Look for a guide in a green T-Shirt.

nice and informing walking tour. Gaston took us around the city center, told a lot about the buildings, the argentinean history and some cultural aspects. All this in an ethausiastic and pleasant way. And the great thing is that you can pay whatever you think it was worth and fits your budget.thanks BA free tour team, keep up the good work!
personal, great english and insight. Do it!Gaston is great (he owns the business).He advised $100 pessos is the usual tip (bargain)

Great fun way to get a feel for Buenos Aires!. We took both the evening Recoleta and morning downtown tours and both were excellent. Gaston was charming and funny and was happy to adapt the tour to suit the audience. I came away knowing much more about the history and culture. Take the tours on your first day so that you have time to explore all of the suggestions!

We loved it and we will recommend it to anyone. anyone that wants to take a unique tour and experience of a different uenos aires. the staff is friendly, speaks reat english and give us informatm that you could not get in any of the stiff and rushy tours that are over priced. we loved loved this and hopefully they will expand and give other options to keep going back! thank you

Excellent tour! The best experience I had in Bs. As.. This are great tours, I highly recommend taking both the morning and afternoon tours. Both guides: Gaston and Sol are amazing, committed, interesting and funny. They clearly love the city, so what could be better than touring Buenos Aires with real "porteños". What is best about these tours is that you get to know both the typical touristic places and city secrets not commonly seen by tourists, all with great info, secrets and inside stuff. You will also get amazing info for everything else you need from Buenos Aires: Tango, food, shows, what to do, etc. What else can you ask for? - thanks for everything Gaston and Sol! - the Mexicans from the 27/03/2012 tour
Great Tour. Had a fantastic wander through the city with a guide who certainly knew his stuff. A great way to learn about what you're looking at and really experience the city
Recommended!. I did the morning tour today, and it was very, very good. Our guide Gaston (I hope I spelled it correctly :-)), was really entertaining, knowledgable and engaged. Bravo!

An Excellent Tour; A Real Glimpse of What it means to be a porteños. This is a tour that you should not miss. My wife and I did the 11:00AM tour on our second day in Buenos Aires and the 5:00PM tour 19 days later on our second last day in Argentina. Both guides were excellent: educational, candid and humorous. To be honest, we do not take a lot of organized tours and so do not have a lot to compare. If there were such tours in other countries that we have visited I would have included them in our itinerary. Our three week visit would have been lacking without this experience. Don't miss it and don't forget to tip .
very good tour and hope there are more. staff are friendly, excited, and very helpful. i wish to see more tours covering this great/massive city.

Thanks Gustav for an informative and fun walking tour experience!. Gustav has a wealth of personal and factual knowledge about BA. We absolutely enjoyed his stories and facts about quirky things to find, recommended places to eat all over BA. We ended up staying for both the tours and felt that the A$50 tip was highly worth it. Recomend even if it's just to hear some amazing stories!!

An essential for all visitors!. My wife and I did the city tour one day with Gaston which was excellent, he has a great sense of humour and the tour seemed like a walk amongst friends. It was the perfect introduction to a big city. There is also an afternoon tour, which covers some more of the cultural aspects of the city, including the fancy European-style palaces. We did this tour with Sol. Both tours covered the essentials and were very interesting and interactive - the best part being that we could go back and spend more time where we wanted. We also got help getting tickets to a Tango show (no dinner, just the show) which turned out to be very good. The seats we had were fantastic, and I am sure that is because Gaston booked it for us.
Best way to start your visit in Buenos Aires. It is a pleasant way to have an overview of the city and to get some tips&tricks.

Free BA walking tour. This free walking tour of Buenos Aires was amazing and well worth the 3 hours we spent.What made it so amazing was the passion and sense of humor of the young man who was not only the tour guide but the founder of this tour company!!

Very informative. This tour was great! Found out the history of Argentina which was interesting.I did the 11am tour with Virginia. She was very entertaining. you can tell she loves Buenos Aires.i would recommend this tour to all new visitors. i will be doin the 5pm tour as well.

Excellent introduction to Buenos Aires!. My girlfriend & I took the City Tour & The Aristocratic tour on the same day. Both tours were fun & informative and both guides were friendly & humorous. Their English was great too. Highly recommended! The City tour will also help you get acquainted with attractions in BA that you'll want to check out on your trip.

a must when visiting Buenos Aires. Our group of friends did both free walking tours covering different areas of Buenos Aires. Not only was the walk fascinating, but was extremely great way to get our bearings around Buenos Aires. Our guide was full of loads and loads of local knowledge and more then happy to spend time with us after the tour giving us tips on other attractions, places to eat and drink. I would highly recommend both the walking tours, one leaves downtown at 11 am the other in the afternoon at 5pm. great to get them in on your first few days of visiting if you can.

Good Overview of Central BA. Based on all the great reviews, my family of four (all adults) joined this tour the day after we flew into the city and were very pleased with it. Virginia (Beer) was our enthusiastic guide and provided our rather large group an informative walking tour of the central area. We learned quite a bit about the history of the country, city, and its people and government. We took a 45 minute break outside the President's house, and the only thing I would suggest BAFT change would be to increase the break time and allow/encourage participants to tour the President's house (if on a weekend) and/or the Cathedral before regrouping and leaving the area. Either that, or rearrange to have the tour end there so people can explore it on their own time.We tipped generously and would encourage others to do so if they enjoy the tour.

Learn the "Secrets" of Buenos Aires with BA Free Tours! You won't regret it.. Was in Buenos Aires for 7 weeks studying abroad and did both of the Free Tours with Gaston in the morning and Sol in the afternoon/evening. Honestly the time flew by and I walked away feeling like I really knew the city. Gaston and Sol were both extremely engaging tour guides but also helpful with restaurant recommendations and activities. I enjoyed it enough to come back a second time when my fiance came to visit. The Historical tour is a must do so you can see the notable sights, but I think the Aristocratic tour in the afternoon really makes you feel like an insider. It's called a free tour but you are recommended to tip when it's done, and you'll want to since they do such a great job.

A great tour....a must do!. When travelling around Buenos Aires in February I went on both the morning and evening tours and they were both great. The morning tour went through the history of Argentina and the city and the evening tour focused on the very interesting culture of both city and its people. The guides were lovely as well as being very informative and passionate about sharing their city. Overall a great way to get an understanding of a really cool place.

History with a giggle .... City tours can be so boring (guides droning out dull facts) ... but not our BA free tours. We went on both tours and had a different guide on each. Gaston & Sol were both funny and entertaining. They are working. but their only revenue is your tips; so they seem more adaptive ... making the tour interesting to the members of the group (plus I think they are naturally charming ... like Portenios are).The tours covered El Cento (downtown) and the other the Recoleta neighborhood. They showed us the usual city info plus shopping tips (but not stop and shop), local interest, history, gossip, and funny facts. Gaston also gave us his email address so we could ask questions about BA during our stay, which we did and his answers were helpful. Having a local resource, other than the tourist bureau is useful.I have to admit we probably tipped our lovely guides close to what we would have paid for a commercial tour, but two points on that; we did it because we thought it was extra good value (not because we were pressured) and the initial premise is; pay what you think the tour is worth & what you can afford, and if you can't afford much they are good with that.Enjoy BA it's a great place.

Do it on your first day in Buenos Aires. We had a fun day on this free tour. Morning tour with Gaston and with Sol in the afternoon. It was a great introduction to the city, the guides shared a lot of information, provided useful tips and travel advices.

Vir (guide) is crazy, fun, entergetic and knowledgeable. Great way to see BA, I did the City Tour with the guide Vir (pronounced like beer)She was very knowledgeable and helpful. I throughly recommend the free ba tour as a great way to see the city. Dont forget to tip. ;)

Don't miss this great walking tour. My husband, adult daughter and I, did this tour last week and loved it. Gaston was our guide and typified the generosity and spirit of a Portenos. He was knowledgeable, interesting and funny, and had the balance right between information and entertainment.Sadly we didn't have time to do the 5pm tour. Have to save that for our next visit!! This is a must do tour of Buenos Aires. Being able to just turn up at 11am and tip what your budget allows makes this a flexible option to fit with a busy travel schedule. We have a better understanding of the history, culture,language,coffee and passions of Buenos Aires, thanks to the BA free walking tour.

Excellent 3 hours. We took the 3 hour tour of buenos aires with Sol, it was an excellent way to find out about the city it's people and the way of life in Argentina today. She was very knowledgable and provide an insight into both the long term history of the city and also more recent events.A most enjoyable opportunity to see some of the key sights in the city

Do it!!. This tour was the best one I did in BA last week- not because it was free, but because it was FUN! The guide was interesting and entertaining the whole time. We learned really interesting and current information about the city and the portenos as we walked through the city at a leisurely pace. Start your trip with this tour! My only regret was not having enough time to squeeze in the evening tour as well.

Good, informative tour. We did the private (not free) tour since it was a Sunday and the free tour does not operate that day. It was just my husband and I with the guide. We saw it all and got the background on everything we saw. Spectacular 5 hours! The guide showed up right on time and ready to go. She told us about the history, past and current politics, showed us each area and gave us suggestions about where to eat.We walked (and walked and walked!), took cabs (cheap), and the subway. We can say now that we really saw Buenos Aires!

Informative and great value. This free tour operates Monday to Saturday at 11am and 5pm. The first tour takes place in and around the city centre and is concerned with the history and culture of Buenos Aires; the second takes places in what feels like a leafy suburb (actually it starts at Plaza San Martin) and is about the architecture of the early richer classes. Both were very informative and lasted around 2 hours on foot. Walking is a perfect way to explore and get to know the city, but the usual warnings about the elements apply - it was 32 degrees Celsius when I went.There are no charges for either of the tours, you are encouraged to tip the guides as a sign of appreciation - the recommended amount was 50 Pesos (about US$11 at the time of writing) but there was absolutely no pressure to pay anything if you didn't want to or could not afford to.All in all - well worth it. The guides are friendly and enthusiastic, and they really added to my appreciation of the city.
Go. The tour was very informative and the guide Gaston delivered the material in a funny and interesting way. Well worth the time. We only went on the morning tour so can not attest to the PM tour.

We loved it!. We did both the tours, and they are really complementary. I only can confirm all the comments given below. It was wonderful to get information from a local, who clearly mentioned that sometimes her story was a bit "colored", but this made the tour even more interesting.Tip: seen the high inflation in Argentina, I noticed that a tip in dollars or euros is also very appreciated!

Amazing Tour--so informative!. This was the perfect tour for me (and I did both of them). The guides are great: very engaging, knowledgable, funny, helpful. They answered all of our questions and we learned so much about the area, history, current events and more than I could have imagined. If you want to know about the fascinating history behind Buenos Aires, this is the perfect tour.Bring water and be prepared to walk for a while, as they can last around 3 hours depending on how many questions you ask.

Great two different tours with Gaston and Sol. We had Sol for our first tour on Thursday afternoon. This was our first activity in BA and we were very impressed. The walking is not too much at all. The commentaries by Sol were fantastic and she was so energetic. She was always able to answer questions. On Friday, we did the morning tour with Gaston. Fantastic. He taught us more about BA. Again, the walking was not too much. Both Sol and Gaston gave a great overview of THEIR city. I HIGHLY recommend both tours and both guides.....MUCHAS GRACIAS!!!

Great tour, depending on the guide you have. We wanted to do the morning tour, Virginia was our guide. For our taste she was a little bit too much, so we left the tour after a quarter of an hour. Maybe the screaming around and showing off works for young americans, for us it was nerve racking after some minutes.On the evening tour our guide was Juan. Very good tour with a lot of informations about the richer part of Buenos Aires.I think both tours are great if you like the style of the guide. We did not, but nevertheless recommend both tours. Because you don't pay in advance, you can leave the group after the first minutes if you are not satisfied (don't do this at the end of the tour, it would not be fair.)

A really entertaining tour. We did both the 11am tour and the 5pm tour with Gaston and they were both amazing. He is a genuinly entertaining person and the 2 and a half hours or so flew by, even in the humid heat of BA. They were both really interesting and gave a great insight into the history and culture of BA and Argentina. Gaston was really helpful when it came to what buses and subways to get home after the tour as well and you felt totally safe while doing the tour. I would thoroughly recommend doing both the tours.

Recommendable. We did both tours and absolutely loved it. The 2 guides both have great knowlegde of the city and we especially appreciated hearing about the people who leave in BA. A very professional tour. If you have the time - go for it. Both tours last about 2.5 hour and the walking distance is easy. Don't forget to tip at the end of the tour!!!! they deserve it.
A must do in BA. The two tours offered are fabulous - they're fun, interesting and you get the low down on what makes Argentinians, especially portenos, who they are. A must do in BA!

Excellent, Gaston is a great guide. This morning i went on the BAfreewalkingtour with Gaston as the guide. This was a great tour, Gaston is a very funny and informative guide and was always willing to answer any questions. The tour lasted around 2.5 hours and was just about the right length. Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for a great tour of B.A

THIS IS A MUST DO FOR ANYONE WHO CAN WALK!. I have done both the 11am and the 5pm tour with BA Free Tour, and in fact every time I have visitors come to Buenos Aires I recommend they go on the tour and if I can I will accompany them - just because the tour is THAT FUN! The guides, Sol and Gaston, are knowledgeable, relaxed, fun, never boring and "real portenos." It is so evident how much they love their job and their city. GO GO GO!

The tours you must do in BA - Excellent. We did both the morning and afternoon tour in one day to get an idea of what to do in BA. Gaston & Sol were fantastic, we all learnt so much. We had 2 kids 9 & 12 which were never bored, they always included them. They answered our questions, gave advise and helped guide us so we had a safe & enjoyable experience in BA. We also brought tickets to a Boca game to give the kids (& us) an amazing experience. We were not disappointed. Unfortunately though we had problems with the kids tickets, when I contacted Gaston he was amazing and Sol personally delivered a refund to our hotel. I highly recommend both Gaston & Sol's walking tours & the soccer game. It's nice to know you can trust someone when you are away from home in a strange country.

Excellent! Must join! Highly recommended!!. They provide 2 tours (covering different areas) per day, at 11am and 5pm, for approx. 2.5 hours each. We joined both tours on the same day. The day tour was led by Gaston who was friendly and humorous. He speaks pretty loud, so you should be able to hear him very well on the busy streets. Gaston told us interesting stories/history about different buildings and areas. We also joined the evening tour and met Sol. We were so lucky that no other people were joining us, so it was a "private" walking tour for us. Sol was super nice and sweet and helped us take many good photos. She was very familiar with the area and told us interesting stories/history too. She also recommended to us a very good restaurant (La Cabrera) for dinner. We enjoyed the tours very much! Thank you Gaston and Sol!

A perfect way to see BA!. We absolutely loved our experience with BA free tours. We had Sol as our guide and she was so entertaining and informative! In the end we walked quite a distance but we didnt even notice! Sol stopped at really interesting sites and we managed to learn so much for her. It is such a perfect way to spend the day and I would highly recommend it!
Its free but u will tip at the end because its worth every minute of the 2.5hrs!. Great way to introduce urself to the city with a local. Totally recommended!

Both tours excellent - complementary and can be done in a single day !. At my recent visit to Buenos Aires I made both walking tours in a single day - this is the way to be done as the two are really complementary. Overall, excellent indeed - in the morning with Virginia, visiting the main attractions in the central area and listening to the history of Argentina, its psychology, social structure, etc., in the afternoon with Sol going to the aristocratic part of BA. Both girls with a lot of info, different characters but so charming. Learned very much about Argentina - things you cannot find in the books. The two groups were quite big, each about 30-40 persons (mostly from US, Australia, less from Europe) - and among them there were some very interesting people as well. The second group finished with a good cup of beer in a resto close to Recoleta cemetery. Lovely, and highly recommended.
Is really worth it! Do it :). Amazing free tour! The girl who shown aroud was simply amazing and really into the culture of her city. One of the best free walking tour I had so far! :)

Do both tours!. BA is an amazing city and BA Free Tours really break it down for you!! I would suggest you do both tours as they are different (but both excellent). My wife and I loved it and cant recommend them high enough!

good way to listen to an argentinian's perspective. I went on the Retiro-Recoleta tour with Juan. He was very nice and spoke great English. The only problem I had with his tour was that his stories tended to go off-topic quite a bit. Other than that, it was a good way to see the city with an Argentinian to talk about the history and the culture of Buenos Aires. There is no fee, but tips are encouraged.

Great way to see the city. I did both the morning with Virginia and afternoon tour of the city with Sol in the same day. It was a great way to see the city and both tour guides had extensive knowledge that they shared with us and their enthusiasm for the city was infectious. It was a great way to learn more about the cultural, architectural, political and social views relating to Argentina. Both guides more than earned their tips - they made the day educational and fun at the same time. I hope this tour continues for many years to come. Well worth doing

Could it be better,well maybe if it was free...oh,it was free!. Took both AM & PM tours.Both different and quite informative.Especially liked Sol's,our 5 PM guides,cultural,political,social take on Argentine history and society.She was a treasure trove of information and gladly responded to all queries in a straightforward,honest manner which was much appreciated by this pleased attendee.We were asked to leave a tip if we so desired at the conclusion of the tour at a recommended 50 peso pp amount which was well deserved.Thanks again for 2 wonderful tours.

Great way to see the city!. We have been here for 2 weeks and all over BA. We were not sure how much more information we needed at this point but i was pleasantly surprised by this little gem..Both the AM and PM tours were excellent. We learned ALOT more about the city, culture and people of Buenos Aires (Portenas). Both Virginia (AM), who was energetic and Sol, (PM) tour guide who was a fountain of knowledge, were top notch..they also answered every question we had. I highly recommend these tours. They are "free" but tips are expected. Well worth the tip we gave them!!

Sol was fantastic!. Our free tour guide, Sol was fantastic! Funny, engaging and knowledgeable. It was like having a very smart friend to show you around the city. Since the tour is free, there was a fun mix of people on the tour. They make their living via tips, so tip well! Wish we took the 11am tour but ran out of time. Way better than the yellow bus city tour!

Great Way to Spend Several Hours. Took the Buenos Aires Free City Tour as most flights to the U.S. leave late at night. This tour was very entertaining and gave you a very personal feel for and introduction to BA. The guide was very entertaining and open to questions. Even though our group was rather large - probably 30-40 people, there was no problem hearing or keeping up. There is an afternoon tour called "Aristocratic Buenos Aires," that would have been interesting, but we did not have time to participate. The tour is free and a tip at the end is totally up to you! Very good deal!!

It's a must. What do you have to lose? It's FREE!. Perfect amount of walking. A lot of very insightful stories and history. Sol is fabulous! Had a few beers with some tour mates after the tour. Made friends! It was a great experience.

Excellent way to see the city...... We did both tours in the same day.....very knowledgeable tour guides (Gaston in the morning, Juan in the evening) and both gave us a really good feel for BA and its people, environs, etc. They were funny and educational...and didn't say just positive stuff about BA and Argentina.....very worthwhile.

BA Free Tours is a must!. I did both the morning tour and the evening tour with Virginia and Juan. Both very different tours but both amazing to actually learn the history of BA and Argentina. The tour is free and I promise you won't be disapointed! They live on the tips, so not only is it a huge saving to the backpacker but means you can give generously if you enjoy it...which I did!

Excellent. Agree with all the other positive reviews.. Virginia morning & Sol afternoon were brilliant. Set the scene for our first visit wonderful,broken Argentina. Was quoted 85$US by another outfit! Consider that 100 pesos for two is about right for the gratuity at the end. Still more expensive than the equally good London Walking Tours.

Fantastic .... Fantastic introduction to the city with very attractive animated tour guide. It turned out to be better than what I expected. Great group of fellow travelers on the tour.I highly recommend it !

BA Free Tours Are Great!. There are two 'free' BA Walking Tours. Even for those like myself who generally dislike any type of organized tour, I highly recommend taking each of these tours. One leaves at 11 AM and the other at 5 PM. Each starts and finishes at a different location and covers an entirely different section of the city. The guides are knowledgeable, enthusiastic and fun. There's an expectation that satisfied customer tip. Everyone I each of the tours I took appeared to be delighted with the experience. I was certainly very pleased!

Great!. Did both the morning city tour and next day the afternoon one. The previous reviews say it all and they will give unbiased advice for the rest of your trip. No gimmicks here. Thanks for a great tour.

Who said tours were boring?. This tour is just pure fun. Not only your young and dynamic guide shows you the architectural wonders of BA, but he tells you all kind of anecdotes and fun facts about the city and people living in it. And for those who wonder about the cost, yes it's free, but you have to tip the guide and given all "tips" he gave you, you're just happy to tip him back.

Recommended tour, not your average tourist trap. Did the tour this morning. Gaston was our guide. He is the greatest narrator in thw whole world :-) .Gaston is super enthousiastic and does a good job by showing you Buenos Aires through the eyes of a local. The tour is free and you can decide if you want to give a tip

Free - great value for money!. My girlfriend and I did the morning free tour with a group of approximately 15 people. The tour was in English, very understandable and at a very relaxed pace. The sights visited were the main attractions of central Buenos Aires; the parliament, pink house and finished at the Obilisk, as well as anything else we passed of interest along the route. The guide was friendly, helpful and very keen on getting questions and chatting with people. They work on tips only and she flat out suggested a peso amount at the end. Good value and interesting I would recommend it to anyone with a morning to spare in BA

Entertaining AND informative!. I hate walking tours - but I LOVED this one. What made all the difference, of course, is the storytelling ability of the guide. He brought humor and passion and history to the 2.5 hours and even on Day 1, while running really low on sleep, I was energized. What a great way to start a trip

Fun ans Interesting Tours!. We did both the aristocratic tour with Juan and the morning historical tour with Gaston. The guides show up on time at the designated meeting spots and are full of energy and information. They're patient with answering all questions and taking pictures. The tour guides point out interesting things you would never notice on your own, and provide helpful tips on restaurants and events.I definitely suggest doing both tours early in your trip. The guides can give you suggestions for restaurants, etc. that you will want to explore during your stay. I also suggest wearing comfortable walking shoes and carrying a water bottle; sometimes the tour can run over 3 hours. I would definitely recommend these tours to anyone visiting BA!

Great way to see Buenos Aires with a young modern "porteño". As a Argentinean (from Cordoba) I wanted to better know the capital of my country. I have done this "free tours" around the world and I wanted to try the Argentinean version of them.I was REALLY charmed by it, the content, the circuit and the ambiance of it, I loved it! Sol gives throughout the tour nice pieces of information about Argentina TODAY, how we live, where to go, etc etc

A good way to start exploring Buenos Aires. We are from Hong Kong. We joined the evening tour on Nov 23 and Sol was our guide. She was friendly, knowlegeable and spoke frankly on what Argentinians think. The route chosen was interesting and we went through neighbourhoods the buildings of which were reminiscent of those in Paris. London and Spain. In two hours we acquired some basic and essential information about Buenos Aires and Argrentina and for the rest of our stay it was much easier to explore the city on our own.Thanks for your professional job, Sol! We'd recommend the city tour to first time visitors of the city, especially those who speak English only and not Spanish, like us.KM & MYM Leung

Fantastic tour; great way to familiarize yourself with BA history and culture. The high ratings on TripAdvisor and truly well deserved. I did both the evening tour (with Juan) and the morning tour (with Sol). Both guides were full of energy, spoke excellent English and had lots of interesting information to share. They were also fun people to spend a few hours with. Both tours cover lots of territory, so you may need to explore some of these sites in more depth if you want to tour buildings like the Palaccio Barolo, the Teatro Colon or go through the Recoleta Cemetery (by the time the tour hits this area, the cemetery is closed). The guides are also able to help you out with recommendations for restaurants, bars, festivals, events and things to do in the city. For those traveling solo, this is also a great way to meet other tourists as well.

Great Place to Start. Sol was our guide on a raining Fri. night. We went on a evening walking tour through Recoleta. It was a small group I'm sure due to the weather. But our guide Sol kept the info and the jokes coming throughout the two hour walk. When she found out my husband wanted to see a rugby game she emailed us later with all the info as to where to buy tickets and help us hire a remise driver. We can't thank her and her business partner enough for all their help.

Very well worth the time. We did the morning tour in English that begins at Congresso at 11 a.m. along the northwest side maybe 100 meters down from the congress building. It's easy to find the person in the green shirt.Our guide was Virginia and she was fun and informative and quite knowledgeable about whatever she was asked.I recommend doing this tour as soon as you can in your visit, as much of the information provided will help you enjoy the rest of your stay and find your way around the city.

Easy, interesting & funny introduction to Bs As. I did both tours after having been here a fortnight & really enjoyed them. I had seen some of the sights previously having done a few other activities in Bs As so I knew a bit about the places, however the humour & insight injected by the guides brought the city to life again. I particularly enjoyed the afternoon tour as it was more about the people & also not so hot!

Amazing! You see all the sights and get the inside story!. There are 2 walking tours. One in the morning, and one at night. The day tour is more about the typical highlights that you need to see when you are in BA, and the night tour is more about the culture and lifestyle. Both were fascinating and both tour guides were awesome. So helpful and lovely. And it's FREE!!!! You just tip them. It's great.

Great tour, Great sights, Great guides!. While in Buenos Aires for a week, my husband and I took both BA free tours and found them to be very thorough, informative and lot’s of fun. Sol was our guide for the City Tour and Virginia for the Aristocratic tour and both guides really enjoy what they do and definitely shows in their love for Buenos Aires and sharing their experiences with visitors. Would highly recommend this activity while in BA and would also like to dispel the myth that the tours are not in fact Free, when they are. We never felt pressured to offer a tip at the end of the tours, but enjoyed them so much that we really felt they deserved something. Some people didn’t feel the same way and ditched the tour midway, so not for everyone, but definitely for most!! A great way to explore a new city with passionate guides and would love to see Free Tours started in more cities.

Fantastic, friendly and funny inside-guide. I only had a day or two to explore BA whilst I was doing some work there and the evening tour with sol was a highlight of my 'non work time'. Her local knowledge and recommendations, historical stories and contemporary anecdotes made the couple of hours tour fly by. Was also a great opportunity to meet other travellers. There is no hard sell at the end either, though from my point of view this tour is well worth paying for. Thank you Sol for the tour and sorry it has taken me so long to get around to reviewing it!

A must do while in Buenos Aires!. We completed both the morning and the afternoon tours and the tours were great.Both tour guides gave us the inside scoop and facts that were both interesting and worth hearing. The afternoon tout shows you a nicer part of the city,but they are both worth going too.

Do this tour -well worth while. Gaston was great - funny, informative, accommodating. Thank you. We had a wonderful time on this tour. Well worth it, after all it is FREE. (We did leave a tip). The pace was comfortable for all ages

This is my kinda tour.. After having arrived in Bs As just hours earlier I was a bit hesitant about a 2hr walking tour but am so happy to have forced myself to stay awake and join. Our guide, Sol, delivered some great info about the city and country in an engaging and funny (smart funny) manner which kept me awake and engaged and was a perfect way to spend my first evening in Argentina.Sol took the time to chat with everyone and was great about answering questions and keeping the tour interactive. Bonus points for learning pretty much everyone's name by the middle of the tour!The tour is free and based on a tips-only payment, but by the end my dilemma wasn't whether to tip or not but how much more to tip than I'd originally planned.

Perfect Intro to Buenos Aires. The perfect way to start your trip in Buenos Aires. My dad (age 59) and I (age 30) took the morning tour with Virginia a couple of days ago, and we took the afternoon tour this evening with Sol. Each tour gives you a great overview of the main (and some not so main) historical sites in BA. Afterwards you'll know where everything is if you want to go back to spend more time. The history and information the guides tell are great, and they come from a local's perspective. Sol's description of the war in the Malvinas/Falkland islands was great because it gave me a better understanding of the view from an Argentinian. Walking around, seeing the cities highlights without a guide of some kind is like looking at a nice picture book with no captions. You're only getting half of the story. Having the other half of the story told from a local's perspective really enhances the experience, and taking these tours is a must do no matter how much or little time you have in BA. Note: be sure to schedule some time to see the Recoleta Cemetary other than after the evening tour as it will be closed by the time you get there.

Awesome tour!!!. Gaston our tour guide was awesome!! I had been on vacation in BA a bunch of times since my family is Brazilian but I had never been on an official tour before. It was awesome getting info from a local who was able to explain previous events in BA and Argentina from many different perspectives. Gaston was also super funny, and I truly encourage you to tip him because he does an awesome job!

Great way to see the city!. We did the afternoon walk with Sol on our second day and the morning walk with Gaston near the end of our trip. Excellent and engaging guides, really gave you the local flavour - and learned things you don't get in the guide books. Gaston....your secrets are safe with us! Sean and Darby

Great way to see and feel this magnificent city!. ‎....managed to find ourselves in Buenos Aires for a few days, saw this featured in Trip Advisor and joined as it had good ratings. I'd highly recommend it to anyone new to Buenos Aires. I have been there before but had really very little knowledge about the place, other than the fleeting association with Parilla, lomo, vino and Tango. Of course we have all heard of Eva Peron, but there was so much else to learn of the history of the place and the politics of the past 200 or so years since independence, ably re-told by the very knowledgeable porteños and what better way than to see the splendour of the city and its famous monuments and palaces at street level, all taken in whilst walking along its grand city grid and while negotiating the weekday traffic, both vehicular and human! The porteños rely on tips (which they gamely say is optional, because they are advertised as being free), but these tours are well worth more than the price of a commercial tour and I do not believe that there would be anyone mean-spirited enough not to repay their splendid efforts!

One of the Highlights. Did both tours with Gaston during the first couple of days in the city. Both provided a great overview of past and present life in BA . Morning tour had emphasis on political history, and afternoon tour talked more about the influential families of BA's past. I appreciated getting information from a local who was consistently able to express and explain events from more than one perspective. After each tour I was inspired to learn more on my own about the events and sites covered. It was also a great way to meet fellow travelers and learn a lot from what they had been doing in the city.Gaston was informative, friendly and entertaining. No pressure to tip (although I highly recommend you give as much as you can afford because it's worth it!) and certainly the tours were not in any way an attempt to sell any other product or service. Each tour lasted between 2-3 hrs . Buenos Aires Free Tours are, as many others have indicated, a must do for any trip to BA.

Very informative and worthwhile... Back at the hotel relaxing after a tour led by Gaston. My wife and I had walked some of the areas already but Gaston brought them to life. We did the 11:00 and if time permits we would like to do the 5 as well. Great to do early in your visit to BA. Bring your camera and your questions!

Get to know Buenos Aires through the eyes of a local. We took both the morning and afternoon tours and really enjoyed them. Virginia led the morning tour through downtown. We had been walking around and exploring for a few days already, but she pointed out interesting bits we had missed. Sol led the afternoon tour we took and very passionately described the history, the politics, and the sights in Recoleta. These are not your typical guides with pre-selected sets of facts and figures. They are real Portenos, who are clearly excited to show you their city. There is absolutely no pressure to tip (in fact, I think they should sell their services more aggressively). We definitely recommend taking the tours even if you think you have seen it all. You will certainly learn something that is not in any guidebook.

Good introduction. I recommend this as a first up when you arrive. We did it the afternoon we flew in and the walk was just what we needed and gave us a pleasant introduction to the city. Our tour took us from Plaza San Martin up through the up town suburbs to the Recoleta Cemetery. Sol was great. Easy to talk to, knowledgeable with loads of tips for enjoying the city she loves and lives in.

great free tour with great guide. took the morning tour with gaston as our guide and had a really good time. The tour takes in the main sights and provides an insight into what it all is rather than just being another building. Gaston our guide was friendly and engaging. At the end he answered loads of questions for everyone about general buenos aires stuff. He even sent me a few emails with info about my questions- really helpful and above what you'd expect from a free tour guide. He was never pushy about how much to tip. He genuinly seemed to enjoy being a guide of BA.

a great taster of buenos aires. this was a brilliant tour. Loads of information and really interesting. Gaston was our guide and was really friendly and helpful. After the tour he gave us loads of information about where to eat, sport and tango. So far, all the recommendations have been really, really good! I would highly recommend this to anyone coming to ba.

Great insightful tours! Must do in BA!. I took both morning and afternoon tours and couldn't be happier. Local guides Gaston and Sol took us to various parts of the city and gave insights not found in traditional travel books. Both were funny, passionate and knowledgeable. The also gave tips on city events happening during the week. Tours were free and there was never any pressure to tip or buy anything, I've taken similar walking tours in other cities which charged $30-$40 per person. Given the quality of the tour and an enjoable time, I felt good about tipping generously. These tours are must do in BA!

Fun, informative, and priced right (free)!. We were hoping to spend a few hours wandering Buenos Aires to see the major sites and learn a bit about them on the way.The BA Free Tour could not have been better. For the price of a tip (that we were more than happy to pay), we got to see the culturally significant sites of the City Tour, filled with laughs and great, educational information (in English). It was perfect.I wish they had this service in every city!

WEAR SUNBLOCK! Do BOTH tours- preferably on your first day in the city to get aclimated. Charming guides&a great time.. Gaston and Sol are awesome tour gudes who love their city and both have that charm that seems to be charactistic of Portenos..What a great way to get acclimated w/BA. We have been in the city many times before but STILL took both tours and learned a lot more than we did walking around on our own. Do it on the first day so you can decide how to plan your visit.P.S. wear sunblock so you don't get burned.

Loved it. Great way to see Buenos Aires.. We took the evening tour and loved it. Our guide, Sol, was very entertaining providing a local's perspective. I'd recommend this tour to all of my friends. Only thing I miss is that we didn't get to take the morning tour.

Unconventional & fun tour, great guides!. This tour is so amazing and our guide, Gaston is really a fun guy showing us Buenos Aires with an interesting twist, very well informed too. They work on a tips-only basis and hence there is no charge for the tour but you are free to tip according to what your budget permits. I tried the evening Aristocratic BsAs tour first, and enjoyed so much I went for the morning tour the following day. Surely a must-do. Their blog also has some very good recommendations on restaurants, bars, tango milonga nights, etc.

Great way to get acquainted with BA.. I have done a few free tours and find them to be a great way to learn the culture, see the sights and get to know your way round. We did both B.A free tours and got some great advise on other things to do during out stay.B.A is very similar to free tours I have done in other cities but they only do free tours so will give you unbiased advise on which tours/activities to spend your money on. They also have a blog with good tips on places to eat, shop and visit and give you an email where you can ask them questions during your stay in B.A.

Fun and informational - one of our favorite activities in BA. This was one of our favorite activities in BA. Our guide had so much knowledge (and humour). We learned so much about Argentinean culture and history. Our particular guide had lived in Europe and the States so he could make good comparisons and contrasts between the cultures (to help us better understand).They offer two walking tours – a morning tour that covers history and culture and an afternoon tour that takes you through the fancy Recoleta neighborhood and the Malvinas Memorial (with an explanation of this war). Each tour is about 2 - 2.5 hours, but the time goes fast.There is not a fee for the tour, they work on tips.The tours are in English and you get to meet other English speaking tourists (and compare notes about the good/bad of BA).I highly recommend making this one of your first stops in BA so that you can use your knowledge for the rest of your stay. The guides are knowledgeable, very friendly, and energetic.

Great way to learn more about the city. I took the 5 pm Aristocratic Bs As tour with Sol last month. She was a lovely, informative, energetic guide for our 2 1/2 hour tour. I enjoyed the personal stories about some of the neighborhoods we visited. Sol gave me a better insight into the people, history and culture of Buenos Aires on my second visit to the city. The walking was not a long distance, maybe a mile or so? Very enjoyable tour!

Best tour in Buenos Aires. This tour was great fun. Gaston was a fun guy, knowlegeable & spoke excellent english.We enjoyed the morning tour so much we went back & did the evening tour . We would definitely recommend both tours. Great value.

An absolute must-do!. My wife and I did both the morning tour at 11 am with Gaston and the 5 pm tour with Sol.Both tours were simply great and we couldn't imagine a better way to explore and learn about Buenos Aires. Both Gaston and Sol not only are very knowledgable about Buenos Aires but they also know perfectly well how to bring the parks, buildings and neighbourhoods to life. They are very open to answer any questions which makes the whole tour more interactive and we really felt as if it was like walking through the city with a local friend.They bring the story with a good sense of humour but after the tours we really understood a lot more about Buenos Aires history but also Argentina's economic, social and political background.So yes, if you are in Buenos Aires and want to do a great tour, this is the one...
Great pace, very informative and great way to see the city and see the sights. Great pace, very informative and great way to see the city and see the sights

A wonderful introduction to Buenos Aires. I went on both of the tours offered and cannot recommend them highly enough. Sol led both tours I joined and she provide a great introduction to the history, culture, and politics of the city. I even enjoyed the tour I took in the rain! I hope they offer tours to additional areas Buenos Aires in the future.

Worthwhile. Jonathon runs this tour really well. I had 2 weeks in Buenos aires, mainly for Tango, so did this tour early on my trip, and found it gave me a great overview of the city, and the history of Argentina. Put me on to some great people for tango, and good restaurants.

Excellent way to see and learn about BA. We did the BA Free City Tour with guide Gaston. I highly recommend this tour. He arrived promptly at the scheduled meeting place in Plaza Del Congreso. After introductions of the small group that had gathered, we set off. Gaston was very knowledgeable and spoke great English and had a good sense of humour. He shared current and historical info. The tour took about 2 hours though he said we could take longer as he was flexible to accommodate the needs and questions of the group. The guides only make money on tips as there is no charge for the tour. There was no pressure to tip, only an explanation of what standard tours might cost and a mention that any tipping was up to the individuals depending on the experience and the ability to pay a tip. We were most happy to provide a tip as it was a very worthwhile tour. There is also a second free walking tour daily through Recoleta however we did not have time to fit this into our schedule.

A Great Way To Get A Taste of Buenos Aires. This morning I did the Buenos Aires Free City Tour, and I can highly recommend it. Our tour guide was the charming and affable Gaston, and he did a great job. He was knowledgeable, informative, and very witty. It's obvious that, as a porteño, he has a real passion for his very beautiful city, and he conveys that passion well. I could think of no better way to get a taste of BA than taking this tour.
