If I get in the next couple of days I'm going the evening Aristocratic Free Tour.

Definitely worth it!. We went on the afternoon tour and were so impressed we decided to do the morning one also. Both are totally different and give you a great insight into the city, its culture and the way the locals think!I would recomend this as one of the first things you can do in BA as it gives you an oversight of the city and will help you identify the areas you would like to dedicate more time to.
Must Do While in BA. This tour is great! Sol is a wonderful tour guide and full of knowledge on culture, history, politics, and architecture. This is definitely a don't miss experience.

We love Sol!. My daughter and I just returned today from a week in BA. One of the true highlights of our week were the two tours that we took with BA free tour. Sol was our guide for both. They were fun, highly informative and by using her suggestions we felt we had a true taste of this very interesting city!I would recommend doing these tours early in your trip. The morning tour is more interesting in terms of history and politics. The afternoon was walk through more elegant neighborhoods and ends with an awesome view of the city.Sol is warm, funny, smart, highly knowledgeable and really passionate about her home city. This is a must! Thanks again to Sol for making our trip even more special!

Highly informative tours - a definitive "must-do" in BsAs. We did the morning tour today with Gaston. Not only is he charming but so knowledgeable and pleasant. We learned so much about the city and its interesting history. We enjoyed the tour so much (after 2 1/2 hours of walking) that we decided todo the afternoon/evening tour as well. Our guide was Sol, another energetic, knowledgeable guide who showed us other parts of Buenos Aires and shared some very interesting historic perspectives. I think the mark of a good tour guide is one who will give you the little tidbits of information that you will not usually find on your own in a guide book. She and Gaston both did just that. Yes, this is ostensibly a free tour, but at the end, when the tips are decided upon, you will not hesitate to give 50 pesos per person to the guide. It was worth every centavo!!!

A must do in Buenos Aires. Gastón and Sol are the Best! I took the morning and afternoon tour and both are excellent! It’s a great way to get to know the city with the comments and insights of a Porteño. They make the whole experience enjoyable as they give you tips on even how to order your morning coffee. If you are thinking of Buenos Aires for your next trip, you should definitely try the BA free tour… you won’t regret it.

Don't Miss It!. These tours are not to be missed -- especially the morning tour. I did both the morning and afternoon tours, and Sol was my guide for each of them. She is very fluent in English and the tours were great: informative and very enjoyable (she has a good sense of humor!). Not only did we see many of the City's most famous buildings and monuments, but also gained insight into the origins of neighborhoods, their composition and political significance over the decades. Sol offered the expected historical background, but also cultural & political commentary that provided a welcome context. I tipped her 50 pesos at the end of each tour although it feels like I didn't tip her enough because a day later I'm still thinking of many of the things she told us, not to mention seeking out restaurants she suggested.

A Friendly, informative introduction to Buenos Aires.. The Free Walking Tour was one of the highlights of our stay in Buenos Aires. We chose to do the walk on our first morning in BA. Gaston was most informative and we picked up some great ideas for things to see and do while in BA for the week. Including a local football match at Boca Juniors complete with arrangements and guide (via email with Gaston). Also about where to get the best pizza and free tickets for a performance at the Opera House. Yes that sums up the wonderful and diverse experiences of Buenos Aires!We enjoyed the walk so much we met up for the 5pm afternoon walking tour. This was also fun, relaxed and informative with our guide, Sol.

Great information, introduction to Buenos Aires. Our guide Sol was gracious and accommodating on the city tour, answering a wide variety of questions with a great deal of thoughtfulness. We learned a lot about the city. Our only regret is that we didn't make this our first stop in Buenos Aires, we would have enjoyed even more during our short visit. We also wished we were able to go on the aristocratic tour, but doing more than one of these in a day would be incredibly ambitious. The tour lasts 2.5-3 hours and wear comfortable shoes. We especially appreciated the way Sol suggested fun things to do that met all budget needs, both from a dining and tourism standpoint. We highly recommend this tour.

Great introduction to the city. I did the 11am tour starting from the Congress Building through Plaza de Mayo, Pink House, and Obelsisk. Our tour guide was very informative - I love history and this definitely had a history bent. This "free" tour (of course, tips are given at the end if you liked the tour) was much better than the bike tour I paid for with another different company. This was one of my favorite things i did in Buenos Aires - to just get a feel for the city and its history. It was approx. 2.5 hours long.

A great way to get to know the city. I really enjoyed this tour. Our guide was very informative and it was great to be able to ask a local about the city. It was also nice to meet other travellers and it was a great way to spend a few hours. A must for anyone new to BA.

A great way to see the city. I'd recommend a walking tour in Buenos Aires with these guys. We learned so much about Argentina it's history and politics. Our guide gave us a fascinating insight to life in Buenos Aires. We did the morning tour and would have loved to join the afternoon tour too but we ran out time. The knowledge and enthusiasm of Gaston was brilliant. We gave a tip of 50 pesos each and was by far the best value trip we had in Buenos Aires.

Sol is an amazing guide to Argentina--history, architecture and soul". Can't say enough good things about this tour. Sol and her partners work on tips only....you should be generous since my wife and I took both the morning and afternoon tours. They were terrific......2 and a half hours long....and an instant deep dive into politics, art, history and culture which is exactly what we wanted. Highly engaging and worth every minute....and an amazing bargain. Do it....you won't be disappointed.

Amazing experience with a unique local flavor!. I was with a friend from Texas, and we did the Aristocratic Tour with one of the best local guides, Sol. She proved to be knowledgeable and insightful about the local history and culture. Above all, she was very inclusive of the whole group and made us spend an amazing time. Never imagined a walking tour could be so much fun and at the same time so interesting! Can’t miss it if you go to Buenos Aires!

A absolutely MUST for tourists in Buenos Aires. Every time we visit a new city we do a free walking tour to get familiarized with the place and be able to define what we want to see in further details. We did the tour with Gaston. He is extremely active, entertaining and very acknowledgeable. We spent a great time together and learnt a lot about this amazing city. Strongly recommended!

A must do!. To get to know Buenos Aires and know how to find your way around easily you must do the morning Free Tour. You must be prepared to walk and an average level of fitness will see you through. Our group had Teo who is very passionate about Buenos Aires. You will learn where the streets originate, how the streets run and how the blocks are numbered. You will learn about some of the more interesting buildings and there is a history lesson about the dark times. Teo was excellent, ask him anything ... getting around Buenos Aires was so simple after this tour.
A really good tour!. A very interesting and entertaining walking tour hosted by an excellent English speaking guide. Definitely recommended.

Best way to spend your time in BA (after tango and bistec). If you've got the time and you don't want to be the typical turista grande sitting on a bus listening to a guide drone through your headphones, then this is the tour for you. You walk and see the city and learn about the history, culture, politics and architecture, things that get glossed over on a bus tour.I went to BA 8 years ago and did a bus tour and thought it was decent. How little I knew then and how much more I know now. All thanks to Gaston, Sol and the amazing team at BA Free Tours, my group and I had a blast learning and walking the city. Their recommendations range from super turista to super local. All the food recommendations we got were SPOT on and so well-priced. They went above and beyond to learn the interests of my group and would point out certain spots that they knew would have particular appeal.I cannot recommend anything in BA more than BA Free Tours!

Highly recommended!. I did this tour previously 2 years ago with some friends who came to visit and loved it, so when my girlfriend came down to visit Buenos Aires we once again did this. There are two tours - the historical and 'aristocratic' one which look at the oldest part of the city where all the government houses are located and one of the most expensive neighborhoods which look mainly into the Argentine culture. Both are great, but if you only have time for one I would chose the later - because I think this one gives you a greater feel for what the Argentine culture is. Anyways, the tour is very informative and the guides very charismatic. Even as a local I still was able to learn quite a deal about my own city so I think for tourists there will be an even greater payoff. As far as bang for the buck is concerned, this is the best tour in town.

Great way to get your bearings in Buenos Aires. There was 8 of us in total on our tour. Our guide was knowledgeable and enthusiastic. There's 2 tours on offer, a city tour in the morning which meets at the Plaza del Congreso and an afternoon tour of aristocratic Beunos Aires which meets at Plaza San Martin. The meeting point board is easy to spot (as is the guide with his green top on)!My friend and I did the morning tour. It was a good introduction to BA. We covered the obelisk, Av. de Mayo, Av. 9 de Julio, Teatro Colon, Plaza to Mayo and more that I can't even remember now. It was relaxed and easy going, stopping for a 15 minute break inbetween. We spent about 3 to 3.5 hours on the tour.We went on a Friday, we bumped into our guide on the Saturday whilst he was doing the tour and there was double the amount of people on that tour, so if you can, do a weekday.

Great walking tour, really worth it!. We did the tour with Teo, a young Argentinian who speaks English perfectly. It was really interesting, he had tons of fun facts and stories about the buildings, the culture and the county in general. He knows the opening and closing hours of every important building, and the prices for visits... Thanks to him, we saw a wonderful tango show for only 50pesos, while our hostel told us the cheapest tango show costed 140pesos.I highly recommend this tour. If you do it, be sure to bring a couple of pesos to thank him. And if you're planning to go there in July or August, dont forget to bring warm clothes (and a notebook to jot down opening and closing hours of each building you'd like to visit)!

What a great experience! Don't miss it!. This will probably be some of the best 3 hours you spend in Bueanos Aires! You get to learn facts you would have not known otherwise, in a very fun way. You get to communicate with the locals and ask them all sorts of questions and they are very good with recommendations! They tell you places where you should and should not go from a local point of view and with a history background. I would recommend going on your first day, as they take you to the most touristy places and explain how to get arround the city easier. Totally worth it and great fun!

The night tour run by sol was fantastic!. We were only in ba a short time and took both the night and day tour. Both were really informative and the guides are really honest about any kick backs they get from businesses and their advice was always top notch! The day tour was a tad too long and a little too political but still excellent!

Good fun, relaxed and informative!! Perfect. The tour had a very good energy and as a family that does not like tours we really enjoied this one. Teo out guide is passionate about BA and having the insight of a Porteno added interest.Cant wait to go on tha afternoon one!!

Lots of Fun!. I started my first tour with Sol, but it was rained out. Actually, Sol continued the tour even in the middle of a downpour--very dedicated, but I bowed out early because I was getting soaked. Too bad it rained. I will definitely try to do it again. Hopefully the weather will cooperate. I did a second tour with Gaston and that the weather was better. He was lots of fun, very friendly and he did not rush us along. I would recommend Buenos Aires Free Tour to any of my friends visiting Argentina.

History and Aristocrats In One Day. Based on Trip Advisor reviews, we decided to take the Buenos Aires Free Tour starting at Congreso. Our guide was Teo and we had a great time with him. As promised, Teo pointed out the major sites, but he added the extra value of his Porteno point of view, including doses of political commentary at appropriate moments. We had a small group of six from the US, Venezuela, Germany, and Australia; and as many have found, we were all friends by the end thanks to Teo's enthusiasm and humor. Teo particularly brought the Plaza de Mayo to life with his firsthand commentary and experience related to las Madres de los Desaparecidos and their marches at the Plaza. This history tour of the Microcentro lasted about 2 1/2 hours starting at 11:00 a.m., so the end of the tour was perfect timing for a lunch break, including the invitation to join Teo after the tour.We headed off in our own direction, enjoying lunch at Los Inmortales (fantastic empanadas) a few blocks from El Obelisco and near Calle Florida. The timing and location of that break was a perfect setup to walk to the afternoon Aristocratic Tour that starts at 5:00 p.m. at Plaza San Martin.Our afternoon tour guide was Sol. She was equal in enthusiasm and humor to Teo, and as anticipated, this tour was a much different point of view. Passing through the luxury neighborhood of Recoleta, we learned much of the culture of wealth in early 20th century Argentina that brought the essence of Paris and European style and architecture to Buenos Aires. Since we toured in June (late autumn), this walk was mostly in the dusk and dark evening, but that made the sites all the more interesting.Overall, the Free Tours were well worth the time and can serve as both an introduction to the city and more in depth experience. Like many of the reviewers here, we tipped about $15.00 per person for each tour - a great value considering that the more impersonal and commercial tours start around $30 per person. These are the perfect tour to take in the first day or two in BA. So meet up with the green sweatshirts and enjoy the walk.

Highly Recommended! Don’t miss it.. Buenos Aires Free Tours offer a great introduction to the history and culture of Buenos Aires. On our second day in the city, we took the morning tour with Gaston. He was lively, funny, knowledgeable, and kept the tour interesting throughout the two hour walk.The tours are free, and you simply tip at the end. It perfectly reasonable, and we were happy to show our appreciation this way.Later in our trip, we took the evening tour of Recoleta (also with Gaston), which we enjoyed even more. If you are traveling to Buenos Aires, I would highly recommend these tours. They will enrich your Buenos Aires experience.

Don't miss these tours. We did the morning tour with Teo and the evening tour with Sol and loved them both.We saw so much that we would have missed without our guides, learnt a lot about the country and the city and had a great time doing it thanks to the guides' great sense of humour. With only two days for our visit to Buenos Aires these were time very well spent.The 11am tour is a great way to get orientated when you first arrive in the city. Both tours will show you things you will want to come back to.

Great Way to Learn From a Local. I have taken many 'free' walking tours all over the world and they usually deliver a nice 'local' view. The two offered in BA are both unique and gave me exactly what I wanted - an insiders view on the streets, neighborhoods, history and most importantly, a chance to get some questions answered. I joined the morning tour, it took about 2.5 hours and the guy (can't remember his name) reallly put his heart and soul into it. We were a mix of single travellers and a couple of couples - at the end of it he suggested a good local restaurant and some of us went there as a group. Liking the tour format so much, another traveller I met on the tour and I decided to do the evening one as a few of the others had done that one the night previously. Sol was our guide and it was completely different but equally as good. Again she worked really hard at delivering what the group was interested in. This personal delivery is why these tours work. Good job by both guides - tip them well, they are working really hard to build a company and you won't be disappointed.

Amazing introduction to Buenos Aires!! Loved it!. We went on the morning tour with Teo and the evening tour with Sol and loved both of them!! They each show different parts of Buenos Aires and I highly recommend you do both! They are casual, fun and you learn a ton! It's also great to connect with other travelers from around the world. The tours lasted about 2 hours and you should have good walking shoes. If you go in May, on the evening tour, bring a jacket b/c it gets a little chilly. They provide a great introduction to the city and also share some good street smart advice for tourists in BA. they give great recommendations for hostels, restaurants, etc. The tours are totally free and then you can tip the guide at the end if you feel they earned it and trust me they will! Just look for the guide in a green shirt/jacket and a bunch of lost tourists gathering together--you'll have a great time--it's totally worth it! I just wish they did this in every other major city in the world!

Nice experience. Recommended. We were in the morning tour that started at 11am, wanted to extend to the evening tour also but could not as my friend looked very tired in the end. It was still enjoyable and informative for us. Got to learn many facts about the history. This is the best thing about walking tours that you have enough time to know things from very close. Recommended to all.

Do both tours!. Free tours with Gaston and Sol are great. Sol on the 5pm tour gave us plenty of information and answered all our questions. She had a good sense of the history of the city and alot of enthousiasm.The next day we did the 11am tour. Gaston went out of his way to explain in great depth the history of the city. When a local joined in with her opinions he allowed her to talk then elaborated when she left. The tour lasted 3 hours rather than 2, and the time just flew. We would highly recommend Free tours as a way to get started in Buenos Aires.

Just do it. Unfortunately I only did this on my last day in the city but I'm really glad I did. I feel as though I know Buenos Aires, and the Argentinian people, really well now. Gaston is wonderful: he clearly loves what he does and even though he is doing this tour for free he goes out of his way to do a little bit extra. Don't forget to bring tipping money!
Totaly worth doing. I really enjoyed both tours. Very interesting facts and stories. Two hours well spent. I can highly recommend.

Great way to get acquainted with the city centre!. Just arrived? Feeling panicked and overwhelmed by the BA vibe? Take this tour and you'll feel the grip of anxiety loosen. Funny, informative, orientating and all at a relaxed pace. A great start to your visit — don't miss it!

Entertaining yet informative. We had four days to spend in Buenos Aires and wanted to get a feel for the city and a feel for the history of Argentina. We decided to take the Buenos Aires free City Tour and Gaston was our guide. He was knowledgable and enthusiastic in his explanation of the history, background and other relevant details of Argentina and specifically Buenos Aires. It was informative to have a local (a Porteno of Buenos Aires) give the tour from his perspective. The tour was filled with people from different parts of the world and lasted a good 3 hours making stops at the important points at the center of Buenos Aires including Av. de Mayo, Plaza de Mayo, Casa Rosada, Av. 9 de Julio etc. This tour is really worth your time for those looking for some background information about the city.

Informative,fun and worth your time. By the middle of next week spouse and I will have spent 25 weeks in Argentina/BA......spaced out over three trips in a little over 2 years. Do we know BA? YES!!! and yet for the first time this month, we took the Aristocratic tour with Sol and the AM Congresso tour with Cecilia.We were able to enjoy the insight of "portenos",pick up additional facts about the city along the way and ask any question that came to mind.What a wonderful way to spend 2 + hours(each tour).....and to thank your guide for showing you a part of their city.......please remember to tip them. They certainly don't emphasize that........but showing your appreciation is meaningful.You will have a fun time!!!!!

This is a must if you are in B.A.. We read about this through posts on TripAdvisor and were so glad we did!We did both the morning (city) and afternoon (cultural) tours with Gaston and he was awesome! It was fun to met fellow travelers from around the world and hear about B.A. from a porteno (local).Gaston was entertaining while extremely knowledgeable and no topic was off limits -- if you had a question about something, you were encouraged to ask it. He also was a great resource to ask for recommendations of things to do, tours to take and restaurants.HIGHLY recommend!

Wonderful Tour. My wife and I had a day in BA before heading down to Patagonia region. We had read the reviews of this tour on Trip Advisor and decided to try it out.It was very enjoyable and I'd recommend this tour to anyone. We did the evening tour (5pm departure, Aristocratic tour). It began approximately on time. The guide was there early, but she gave people 5-10 minutes to join the group. Our group size was decent (15-20 people) and that is probably the only negative of the tour. The sidewalks on some portions are narrow and people end up spread-out and thus with limited ability to hear the guide. Any major spot, the tour would stop and everyone would gather round to hear, but if you wanted to engage in additional conversation you needed to stay at the front of the group.I wasn't watching the time, but I think the whole thing took a little over 2 hours. thus leaving plenty of time to find a dinner location.One other positive -- since it wasn't clear to me from their website if the tours ran rain or shine, I sent an email the day before we were leaving the US. The Buenos Aires forecast included rain for the day we would be there. Very prompt response to my question -- the answer is the tours are operated rain or shine.

Fun & lovely guides, informative. We took both the 11am tour with Gaston and the 5pm tour with Sol. Both are lovely relaxed people who make the tour interesting and fun. They don't push in any way for a tip at the end, but you want to give them one by then because it has been so much fun. Highly recommended.

Relaxed, informative and enjoyable. We joined the morning tour at 11.00 a.m.with guide Gaston. It lasted just over 2 hours and was really enjoyable. Its not like a boring historian taking you round - he made it fun and informative. gaston gave us some insight into modern day Argentina as well as its history. He makes his money from tips so in a sense its not free but you can pay what you like. We would have gone on the other walk as well but did not have time which is a pity. Their website also has useful information and he is willing to be contacted to give personal advice about your stay in Buenos Aires.

Great Guide. The historical walking tour was very enjoyable at first, but then got tiring for my wife and I, especially given the heat. However, if we were younger and had more endurance, then it would have been better or if we took an earlier break. Also, there were no bathrooms during the tour...so make sure to go beforehand. I really enjoyed our tour guide, Gaston, who was very informative and funny. Plus he was not really pushing for tips like the other free tour I attended...he didn't mention once how much we should give.I feel that walking tours are more intimate (better pictures) and more hands on, but walking 2.5 hours can be tiring...so it really is up to the person. I think we were better off taking a bus tour given how tired we were to begin with.

Excellent tour and Guide. we have been to BA several times, but have never gone on a tour. We decided to do the Aristocratic Tour by Buenos Aires Free tour. Very glad we did this 2 hour tour. It was very interesting, the architecture lovely and the guide, Cecilia, informative and entertaining. I highly recommend u take their tour if you're looking for a fun way to learn about the city by Portenos, it was fascinating to hear the insights that Cecilia shared with us. This is a great way to spend two hours in a beautiful city!

Passion and History of BA. Gastón and Sol are amazing tour guides. You'll cover all the basis of Argentina just walling by the streets and probably would get a new view of Argentinians.I loved the Sol's passion about her country and its history. Next time in Buenos Aires i would have this tours again. I'm pretty sure that they're always new and different.
Good tour. Great way to get your bearings an learn more about the city

The largest review of the world as Gaston would say..... I read good comments of this tour and I did like the idea of getting to know BA at the beginning of our stay.They do 2 tours, 1 called architectual BA, 1 called historical-political BA.We did the first one with Cecilia. Her sweet and lovely manner are really entrataining, it goes from Plaza San martin, through Retiro and Recoleta.On my own I did not understand all the similarities with Paris, after a while with Cecilia no more doubts... Her father was with her for a walk and added some nice stories to the walk.As we liked the one with Cecilia (and it does not cost 200 pesos per person) we went on the following monday to the other one, with Gaston, the guy who invented the free tour (you give a tip at the end if you want). Talking about politics of your country is always not easy, but he tries to stay as neutral and laid back as possible, making it fairly entrataining... It goes from Plaza del Congreso through all the Avenida de Mayo up to the Casa Rosada...These guys put a lot of hard work in what they do without a guaranteed return, they also offer you free advice on restaurant and attractions in BA... Spend with them 2 hrs, I recon' it is really worth it!!!

Informal fun walking tour. If you want to know a bit more about Argentina, BA free tour is the activity to do. It is like walking around a neighborhood with a friend. The guides are not professional, but since they do this as their living, they know the city very well. You can ask them any questions and they will try to answer as well as they can. The tour is free, but of course, you should leave a tip for the guide. I did the morning tour, but I would have had more time, I would have done the afternoon tour as well. I would recommend this for everyone.

A great introduction to Buenos Aires. This was one of the first things I did when I arrived. Gaston was engaging and informative on the 11am city tour. I enjoyed it so much that I joined Cecelia (and Sol) on the 5pm "Aristocratic" tour the following day. Well worth it.

Perfect Start to our week in BA. Garston was a great tour leader, his commentary is factual and funny. The walk is just down one avenue (Ave De Mayo) from congress building to the 'pink house' (morning tour). we also did the night tour from Plaza San Martin to recoletta. this was also a great tour and shows a totally different area of the city. Definitely a must do in BA

Excellent - informative and fun. Following reviews on Tripadvisor we went on both walking tours on the same day!! We thoroughly enjoyed both tours . The two guides were informative and fun and it was particularly good to speak to some 'real ' Argentinians . They were both happy to answer questions and we learnt a lot more about what it is like to actually live in Argentina. i would thoroughly recommend both tours

Not sure what I can add to existing reviews: excellent in every way. Friendly, enthusiastic guides, well informed, local. As it's on foot, you clearly don't see the whole city but you do see, with local colour, a small part of the city in great depth. You sort of feel a bit sorry for the coach trips which sometimes go past, loaded with people with their audioguide headphones on: one shouldn't but one does!

A must-do. This was a fantastic way to see Buenos Aires. We were advised about the free walking tour by our hotel so decided to do this on our first day in Buenos Aires. We met at the specified point at 11am and the tour lasted approximately 2.5hrs. We learnt a lot about the history of Buenos Aires and Argentina which gave a great insight into the city which otherwise we would not have had. Since we enjoyed the morning tour so much we decided to attend the afternoon tour also which covers a different area of the city. The afternoon tour also lasts approximately 2.5hrs.Both guides were great and were very passionate about their city and also very knowledgeable. Very energetic also! As the tour is free a small tip is expected at the end of each tour however we found this to be no problem considering the information and time the guides are giving.I would advise to have plenty of sunscreen, water and even a hat. Also wear comfortable shoes. There is a lot of walking and particularly when doing both tours in one day...it is quite tiring. We were exhausted by the end as were others in the group who had attended both tours.All in all, it´s a great way to get your bearings and learn something along the way. Highly recommend!

Highly recommend. Gaston was wonderful and it was a very good overview of the area we chose. We did the 11a tour of the government center. I'm only sorry we didn't get a chance to do the 5p walking tour as well.

Aristocratic tour was great. I did the aristocratic tour with Sol last week. There was a group of about 15 of us, and she held our attention really well with her interesting bits of history and funny jokes. We didn't cover a lot of ground, physically, but I felt I learned a lot. She also was really helpful with tips about what else to do and where else to go in Buenos Aires. All in, the tour lasted about 2 hours, I think. For the price (honestly, it's free), you can't beat this tour. The guides work for tips alone, and perhaps this is why they do such a nice job! Thanks, Sol!

Great way to see the city with a Porteño.. BA Free Tour was really good which shows that price does not reflect quality. There are two tours, both in English. The tours took about 2 hours each, and you don't cover that much distance (maybe 2km.) The tours were really for free. We tipped the tour guides at the end of the tour. Neither tour guide went around the group asking for money. Everyone who wanted to tip had to approach them to say thanks.We did the 5pm tour with Sol starting at the San Martin Plaza. Sol wore a green shirt with the BA Free Tour logo on it and asked all the people that looked like tourists if we were looking for her. Be warned that there are other "tour guides" that lurk in the area to lure you to their tours set at different days or times. Sol was very informative and told great stories and answered all the questions that we had about the tour, sites, and Porteño way of life. She was very helpful in recommending good restaurants for us as well. We ended the tour at the Recoleta Cemetary. Sorry - by the time we get there, the Cemetary is already closed but Sol did recommend a few things to look for when we got a chance to go in. The 11am tour with Gaston started at the Plaza del Congresso. It was very hot that morning so he waited to make sure that everyone was able to get water, etc. before he started the tour. We recommend doing this tour on Saturday as it ends at the Casa Rosada and you can do a free tour of the government house then.
Awesome tour for a great value!. Great tour guides that give insight views and interesting content. Can't beat the price :)

Brilliant. A really good way to see BA.......wear comfortable shoes, take water, and a poncho for the rain. Alot of walking involved and the pavements are not so good in BA. Very interesting and fun. Thanks for a great tour

Funny and interesting. The free walking tours are a fun and comprehensive way to know Buenos Aires in shor time. I been to the City Tour and the Aristocratic Tour and they're both great.Don't forget your sun screen, hats and a comfortable tennis. You'll walk for about 2 hours and Buenos Aires is a very hot city.

You NEED to make both tours. A funny and pleasant way to know Buenos Aires.. My friend and I took both tours with Gaston, the completly funny and nice guide. This porteño guy is going to show you why their people are so proud of that city.He told us the history of the places we visited in a really cool way, and the places visited in the tour were very well choosen.Give them good tips. They deserve them for sure.If you visit Buenos Aires and don't go to these tours, your travel will be not complete. You NEED to do these tours.

Pretty great for free. We laughed and it was fun because they told you about the origins of words or other little things that may not be mentioned by other tours that stick to the facts. It was interesting to see people from all over (though mostly from the US), and even a few of the locals were intrigued and joined parts of the tour too. We were sad that we didn't have time to do both tours they offer. Ultimately they do ask for tips if you enjoyed the tour, but there is no real pressure. They certainly deserved a tip too. I don't know what other people give, but we gave 100 pesos for the two of us.

Two free tours you must take. There are two free walking tours in Buenos Aires. The first one starts daily Monday thru Saturday at Plaza del Congresso at 11 am and the second one starts at 5pm at Plaza San Martin. Both tours are definitely worth doing. The first one is a general tour and gives one a good overview of the Argentine history. As I already mentioned it starts out Plaza del Congresso and ends at the Obelisco. On this walk you will go down the main artery of the city toward the Plaza de Armas and then from there will take side streets to get to the Obelisco. This tour company is operated by two females who primarily operate on tips. Their knowledge on history of the county and the city is quite decent but don’t expect a PhD tour guide. Some information we received was not entirely in line with what we knew about the city and the economy. With that caveat, this tour is totally worth the time. This tour takes about 2.5 – 3hours. The second tour is called the aristocratic Buenos Aires and takes you on a walk through the neighborhood of Recoleta ending at the entrance to the Recoleta cemetery. This tour is packed with history as well. However, it is more geared toward architecture of the city and more precisely what that archetecture used to be like. On this tour you clearly see the European influence on the architecture and you will visit a few mansions that used to belong to private parties and now are owned by either large hotel chains or various embassies. This tour takes about 2 hours and again if you like architecture this is a great way to get to know the Architecture of Buenos Aires.

Great!. I highly recommend both tours! Good tour, interesting walk, easy to find, everything perfect!
Also it was nice meeting people from all over the world in the group.

It is actually FREE!. This tour is well worth to do on your first or second day in Buenos Aires so you can get an overview of the city.Gaston, the tour guide, is very energetic, funny and extremely friendly. He speaks fluent english. He'll take you around the whole downtown of the city and give you an insight of how portenos (people from Buenos Aires) live, think and enjoy life.There are two tours. One is the morning (downtown area) and an afternoon one that is more dedicated to the Recoleta area.We did the morning one. It was very sunny and hot too so if you go to BA in the summer, you must wear a hat (I didn't and burned my scalp!), sunglasses, light clothing, lots of sunscreen and comfortable shoes. The tour takes about 2.5 hours, lots of walking but it actually doesn't feel like it because Gaston was so very entertaining!He even stopped twice on a little convenience store so we were able to get bottled water.It is a free tour but he makes his money out of tips and for a tour like that you would be charged at least $US 25-30 per person somewhere else so keep that in mind when you tip him.Don't even think about taking the double decker bus tour. It is a disaster. This walking tour is 1000000 times better. You actually walk on the streets, see the locals, can take great pictures and will learn things that are not explain on a conventional tour.This tour is for all ages. Our group had people from 10 years old to probably 70.Great tour Gaston!

Highly Recommended. My wife and I took both the morning (11am) and afternoon (5pm) tours today. Loved both tours...very nice tour guides, informative, leisurely pace. Definitely a huge step above riding a bus around or reading out of our Lonely Planet all day. Our feet hurt but it was well worth it! We had Gaston and Cecilia, both were great. Gaston recommended a tango show which we will attend this evening at a 10% discount.

a great experience, friendly and educational. Informative and very friendly, Gaston is born to be a tour guide. We got a lot of information you can't get from guide books, and we will definitely be doing the afternoon tour ASAP.

Great way to get introduced to Buenos Aires. my wife and I did both walking tours... the first is the historical aspect of Argentina & Buenos Aires downtown and the second is more focused to the culture and beautiful neighborhoods of Buenos Aires. The tourguides are great people with big hearts who love showing off their city. Definitely a must do while in Buenos Aires... it would be nice if they would add a third tour showing San Talmo & La Boca.

Great to learn about the city from a porteno. My husband and I took the free tour with Gaston our first morning in Buenos Aires and were not disappointed. Gaston was very helpful and informative telling us about the history and the culture while showing us the sights of the city. It is easy to see that he is very passionate about sharing his city with others. It was an excellent way to begin our stay in Buenos Aires and I highly recommend it.

the perfect way to start your trip in buenos aires!. Both free tours were a great way to start my trip in Buenos Aires! Much better than a bus tour that barely gives you a moment to stop and enjoy where you are.And both were in English, which is always a plus for travellers! My only advice would be to take them on different days. There's a lot of walking, but it's definitely worth it!

excellent personalised tour. i was travelling with my husband, baby and parents and wanted a personalised tour. sol and gaston said they could assist, and rented an airconditined van with a baby seat for us. we had the most excellent guide, adrianna. she is passionate about ba and really showed us everything that we found interesting in 8 hrs. it is a pricey option to have your own tour, but we travelled in comfort and could ask all the quetsions we wanted. adrianna explained everything so clearly that we all left with an excellent understanding of argentina's history. really worth it all!

This walking tour is great!. Gaston is informative, funny, patient, and passionate about anything Buenos Aires. He has 2 different tours a day. Bring good walking shoes and some money for a well deserved tip! Oh, if you contact him he'll help with the best restaurants, places for tango, hotels etc. He's the guy!

First thing to do when arriving in BA - take this tour!!. Thanks Gaston for a wonderful tour of the city! We really enjoyed the insight and hidden treasures of vibrant Buenos Aires delivered with humour and passion. If we had time, we would have attended the evening/afternoon tour as well but we will save it for our next visit.This really is a "free tour" and the guides earn their wages from whatever you are able to give them (no pressure). So if you are a new arrival to BA, take this tour and get oriented to the city. Gaston was extremely helpful for getting us set up with other activities and also arranged for us to attend a wonderful Tango show the next evening. Thanks again and see you in 2011!!

Highly informative and very relaxed. As a general rule, I hate organised tours and prefer doing things on my own steam. The BA free tour however was a great way to amble around the bustling streets of the city, see the sights, and pick up some useful info. We did both tours in the one day, and both are highly recommended

A definite must!. We had two full days in Buenos Aires, and didn't want to walk through the streets of BA having to refer to a guide book. Having heard of this tour on tripadvisor, we decided to give it a go and it was definitely worth the time spent!In the 2.5 hours of the tour, we walked through the streets, laughed at jokes as our guide shared the idiosyncrasies of the portenos and the bits of Buenos Aires that you do not often find in guide books. That, to me, was one of the main reasons why I believe this tour is a must do.It's a walking tour, and very easy to complete. It seemed like the entire history of Argentina was summarised in a concise version during that 2.5 hours. My family found it very enjoyable, and I recommend it to everybody!

Definitely do it. The tour takes abut 2.5 hours and was really interestng. Our guide spoke very good english and gave lots of insider tips about Buenos Aires. So many more things on the 'to do list' now!

Don't miss it!. This tour is a great way to get introduced to BA and get a local's perspective (you can't find that in a guide book!). It is a walking tour so you get plenty of time to take everything in and take photos. The guide is very informative and speaks perfect English. It covers the main sights of central BA. I would definitely recommend doing this tour when you first arrive in BA to get your bearings and learn a bit about the city.

great walk around BSAS. I was told by some of my friends about this tour so I went as soon as I got to BsAs and I really enjoyed it. Gastone in the morning was brilliant, enthusiastic and knew a lot about buildings and history and Sol in the afternoon was super smiley even though we were walking in pouring rain and soaked to the bones. If you are the kind of person who wants to see a lot and don't want to spend half of the time reading info out of a book this is definately the tour for you. Thanks guys!!! Elisa
Best ba tour. More interesting than your typical tour with more info about the city today and what to do on a budget or not something for everyone
very good. I totally recommend this tour. You will have a nice and fast overview of the city.

Culture and Fun combined. My wife and I just came back from BsAs and were delighted with the experience. Gaston, the guide, has done a terrific job in putting together this tour that will fill you with lots of cultural and historical information in a very dinamic and fun way. IMO, there's no better way to feel a city than walking. He takes the time to answer all questions and he even helps taking some pictures so that you can actually appear on them :). The tour begins at 11am every day except Sundays, it lasts around 2.5 hrs and it's only in English, which he speaks very fluent and neat. Even if English is not your first language (we're mexicans), I strongly suggest you to take it, as you will have no trouble in understanding him. They also offer another free walking tour through the Recoleta area (Aristocratic Tour) on the afternoons, we didn't have a chance to take but I'm sure it's also worth it.At the end of the tour Gaston also helps toursits with recomendations and tips for during your stay in BsAs. He can also help you arrange tickets for Tango Shows or some other tours.Final recommendations:- Arrive with enough time so that you can locate the group, the plaza where the tour begins is medium size.- Wear sunblock and hat, never underestimate the sun of BsAs- Take the tour as early as possible during your visit, so that you can take advantage of the tips and hints during the rest of your stay.

Fun and informative. This is a great tour. Our guide, Gaston, was funny and informative. He was also willing to take as much time as needed to help people with their individual tourism questions once the main tour was over. All it cost was a tip--I've paid $25 plus tip for similar quality tours in other cities. Highly recommended.

BA Free Tour- both city tour and aristocratic tour. I've now down the BA Free city tour and I just took the aristocratic tour. Both are well worth it. They are awesome, informative and the guides are beyond great and extremely knowledgeable.Check out their website www.bafreetour.com

informative, fun & free. we took the city tour this morning and found it a great way to learn a bit about the city and also to get our bearings - if you do it, try to do it at the start of your time in BA, so you can take advantage of the tips about what is happening where & when and also what places to take the time to see while you're in BA. Our guide was funny, spoke very good english and knew alot! its definately worth it - its free after all, but its also the way the guides earn a living so leave a tip! on the practical side, bring some water and if its sunny bring a hat as there are bits where you will be standing in the sun in front of particular buidings

Totally worth doing!. We did both tours and definitely recommend them. The City tour is about 3hrs in length and leaves at 11am and the other tour is only 2hours in length and leaves at 5pm.Guides were very informative, adding their own humor and personality to make it more interesting. Totally recommend this to anyone going to Buenos, and its free! Well you tip the guides and its well worth it!

A great way to get introduced to BsAs. I've done the free tours throughout Europe so I was excited to try this one on our trip. It was a fun way to get introduced to the city, see the major sites and learn some of the city and country's fascinating history. My wife and I went on the 11am tour and had a lot of fun. It helped us decided what we wanted to see more of in the city and encouraged us to read up on Argentine history.Gaston was an entertaining guide who kept our large group entertained and laughing on a boiling hot day. He can help you figure out what to see and do after the tour is over or answer any other questions you have about the city.It's a free tour... you're guaranteed to learn something, see some sights and meet other travelers... what do you have to lose?

Imperdible para conocer Buenos Aires. I really enjoyed both free tours. It was great to see and know something about the things we saw that are important (or just an anecdote ) for the city, the country or the argentinian people. Gaston was a great and fun guide. I totally recommend those tours!.

Best introduction to beautiful Buenos Aires. We enjoyed the morning tour so much we took the afternoon one too! The guides are enthusiastic and knowledgeable. Buenos Aires is stunning and this is just such a fantastic way to see so much. Thank you Gaston and Sol!

Take this tour!. My sister and I arrived in BA this past July and were overwhelmed by how much there was to do and see. She had found this tour online, and we thought it would be a great way to start our trip. We were met by our guide, Maca (short for Macarena!) who couldn't have been nicer. She filled the tour with all kinds of funny stories and insights into Argentine life and culture. We started at the Plaza del Congreso and spent about 2 hours walking around downtown. We saw the Obelisk, the Casa Rosada, Calle Florida, Avenida 9 de Julio and the Plaza de Mayo. We enjoyed ourselves so much, we opted to take the other tour offered by the company later on in the week. We met our tour guide Sol in Plaza San Martin and off we went. This time our group was very small, just 5 of us, so we got a lot of personal attention. This tour was completely different than the first one. This one was called the "tour of Aristocratic Buenos Aires" and they were right! We saw more of the ritzy neighborhoods and tons of great the architecture, shopping and people watching. Sol was super sweet and funny, and went out of her way to give us the real story of BA. After our tour was over, she helped my sister and I plan a trip to see a Boca Juniors soccer game. The tours are free, and the guides earn only tips, so knowing this, we were very generous. The tours were so awesome, if you're in BA and speak English, I would definitely recommend them both!

Do this first!. We came to Buenos Aires on vacation from California without any set plans and read the reviews for this free tour service. This was an extremely fortunate way to begin a great holiday. Our guide, Sol, one of the founders of this service, is a lovely young woman, native to the city, who led us through Recoleta, the historic and artistocratic neighborhood of Buenos Aires, stopping to point out the examples of Belle Epoch architecture and providing snippets of history of the families. She and partner work solely for tips. In addition, their webiste recommends other tours, restaurants and music and they will assist in arranging reservations. We highly recommend this service.

Fun and easy experience. We went on the tour today of Recoleta and had a great time! The guide was funny, knowledgeable and was open to any questions and comments from those on the guide. Definitely worth the tip at the end.

Don't miss this tour!. Without a doubt, this is the best walking tour of a city I have ever done. Their model of just working for tips is a real winner. I have done several tours in the past that were just not worth it, but I really believe that they have a great idea here. 100% true that there is no fee for the tours, and no pressure to tip at the end, but it is clear this is how they make a living. Sol was a fantastic, funny, passionate and shared a lot of insight into her wonderful country. I can't wait to do the morning tour tomorrow.

Really worthwhile tour. The reviews here are spot on - keen, energetic, enthusiastic, knowledgeable guide who doesn't feel like he is giving "the same old tour".... No hard sell for a big tip but you are happy to give one anyway due to the energy level and genuine experience. Will be going back for the evening / nighttime Recoleta tour. Highly recommended.

Much better than a Sightseeing Tour by Bus.... I did the Aristocratic Tour with Sol and I must really admit that it was a great experience. She knew so much about the history of the different places and houses and it was great fun to interact with her.

Perfect to learn and have a nice time. Buenos Aires free tour is the ideal choice if you want to get a first impression about the main places to look at around the city, and also to get to know a little bit about the history from the hand of argentinians them selves. The guides are really nice people, and very keen about their city and about comunicating all the charme of Buenos Aires to tourists. I have been to Buenos Aires before, but this last time after taking the tour, I gained a better knowledge about the place.

A MUST DO. At first we did not think we would be up for a two hour walking tour starting at 5pm in the evening, but it was one of the best things we have done in BA. The 5pm tour start time is actually perfect as it gave us the whole day to explore and do other things in the city. Our tour guide Sol made the tour, what could be very dry and boring information, she made come alive with her local knowledge and flair. She is a wealth of knowledge on all things BA, from history, cultural, activities, eateries, shopping, politics... A MUST DO! Most importantly do not forget to tip your tour guide as this is a free tour and they deserve every penny for the great job they do!

We enjoyed the morning tour so much, we rocked up for the afternoon!. Gaton and Sol were both so informative in taking us around the beautiful city and understanding the mindset of the people from Buenos Aires, plus great English and superb humour. They seemed like a one stop shop giving us information on other tours and great things to do. You left the tour feeling like you had new friends in BA and someone you could ring if you got into a pickle!

I highly recomend!!!. I highly recomend, this people do this because they really love the city and love people. I've been to BA before, on a paid tour, and is not as good as this one. They're funny and inteligent people.If you can, do each one in a day (not the two in the same day), or you might get tired.

GREAT Tour - BETTER People!. Took the afternoon tour yesterday. You can read the reviews below to know its a great tour. Even more helpful was the fact that Sol, our highly informative guide, hung around w/ a group of us afterwards for over an hour, planning our evening outing (there were a bunch of singles on the tour and we went out for the evening and are going out together again today and tonight!), as well as getting us into very difficult to get reservations restos, shows, etc. Sol (in case you dont speak spanish, means "sun"), but i'd also rate her a true "gem."

Great Tour. I had some solo time to kill on my trip to Buenos Aires and this tour was great. Not only was Gaston, the guide, well informed, but he was also more than willing to answer any questions you had. I would absolutely recommend this tour to anyone visiting this city. I took the morning tour. I wish I would have learned about this group earlier in my stay so I could fit in the afternoon tour. Also, to my surprise the tour actually was completely free.
Informative Tours from Seasoned Travelers. Both tours were good but the 5PM one was particularly excellent. Sol, the guide, was enthusiastic and friendly.

The best tour in Buenos Aires!. You should not miss this tour when visiting BA. The tour guides are fantastic, and very knowledgeable about the history of the city. Don’t miss the opportunity to learn about the best places to eat and visit from them – their list of preferred restaurants is unbeatable.

Saved us time.. I loved this tour because in ~2.5 hours we got a good orientation of the city and its main attractions. We learned invaluable tips from the other travelers in the tour along with the tour guide. We would have wasted so much time trying to get to all the historical sites on our own. I generally don't like tours but this is a must especially if you're short on time. Maca was our guide and she was awesome, we learned interesting facts but definitely not boring at all. She also gave good restaurant and cultural tips.

Great tour. Don´t miss it. I love Buenos Aires and I visited it several times but I had never did a real tour, so on Sept 6ht, I joined the Aristocratic Tour. It was really great and Sol, our guide is amazing. The tour lasted around 2,5 h and ended on the rush time on a bridge over Av. del Libertador. The tour is free fo charge but the guide is so nice that you´ll be happy about tip her in the end.

Great walking tour of downtown, Recoleta. The tour was really good, and it's true -it's FREE. But you should tip your guide. Our guide was great, and really comical, she made the tour even better with her humor. She gave us good insight on the buildings, history of Buenos Aires, interesting stories not found in guide books etc. Our tour ended at the Recoleta Cemetery, which left us off for great beers at Buller Pub.
The Paris of South America. The tour was free, informative, and great exercise... I really recommend!!!

Good tour - and you can't beat FREE!. We took the city and aristocratic tours on the same day with Maca. It was great! Maca clearly has such a love for her city and her warm and bubbly personality made the tours a lot of fun. She was able to be sometimes a bit irreverent with her commentary but since the tour is free of course she is allowed to be so and it made the tour that much more interesting. Other tours we researched were $35-$40 per person. Thank you BA free tours for making a good intro to your city affordable for everyone!

Awesome. Definitely start your stay in Buenos Aires with both of these free tours. Our guide was Macarena and she was GREAT!!!! You learn so many interesting facts about the area and are able to go back at your leisure if you so desire.

Great tour!. Found out about the BA Free Tours from Tripadvisor. So glad I read about it here. We went on the morning city tour and really enjoyed ourselves. It was very informative and our guide was friendly and entertaining and open to questions. It's always great to hear a local's take on things and get the back story that you don't always get from a book. It lasted approximately 2.5 hours and only required some casual walking - nothing too fast or too far. Definitely worth our time, especially since it was free (though the guides do work off tips).

Outstanding Free Tour. If you want a quick overview of the city and its history, this is the tour for you - plus the price is right - it's Free! The website's map is easy to follow. Just show up, no reservations needed. Our guide (morning tour) spoke English very well and was easy to understand. There were roughly 17 people in our group ranging in age from 11 to college student to retiree. They came from the US, UK, Canada, Germany, and Austria, The walking was not strenuous, with many stops along the way. There is a five minute break at one point for bathroom and snacks. It lasted just about 2.5 hours. At the end, you may tip the guide or not - up to you- but this is how he makes his money. We were happy to tip as we found the tour enjoyable and educational.

Great tours - do both!. This was my third trip to BA and was finally able to hop on the tours. They were fantastic - really enjoyed the information and the tour guides were great. These are a definite "don't miss" activity when in BA.

DO IT!. Class tour! It was great and the information they give you is invaluable. I wish I had gone on the tour when I first got the BA (3 weeks ago). Between both tours its really comprhensive and informative, and of course the guides are super friendly. They give you more info than just the history and sites they also try to explain the way the Argie´s think, which for me was great. 10 outta 10

Excellent. We went on both tours with Sol and she couldn't have provided better tours. Not only were the tours great but she also helped us obtain tickets to the World Cup sendoff game for the Argentine national soccer team, gave us several great restaurant recommendations and told us where to go to a "non-touristy" tango show. We've recommended Buenos Aires Free Tour to several friends, all of which had a similarly, great experience.

Buenos Aires, sun, young girls, what more could you ask for?. This is a GREAT tour to take if you are young and want to be shown around bye people of similar age that you can relate to. I've traveled all around the world and I try and take the free tours whenever I can. I have never been disappointed. Although this isn't affiliated with any of the European free tours, this one was no different.Honestly, I hate those big tours... its probably the combination of being shown around by some old person and being surrounded by old people in your tour group. With the free tour you feel like your being shown around by your college buddy and these free tours always seem to be attended by young people as well... maybe because it involves a lot of walking and you have to be reasonable fit to complete the tour. I had the evening tour with Sol and the morning tour with Macarena... both were awesome and both are now my facebook friends.

not to be missed. There is one historical tour, which takes place in the morning, and another one though Retiro and Recoleta, at 5 pm. Both are worth going for as the guides, both from Buenos Aires, both friendly and enthusiastic, give a different view of the city, which would be hard to have on your own.

Great Introduction to BA. I found that BA wasn't a particularly 'touristy' city, which meant compared to other major world capitals it wasn't as immediatly obvious what to see or do. I found both the morning & evening tours were excellent introductions to the history of BA, the city and its people - all of which I can admit to having minimal previous knowledge. The guides were 'true locals', interesting, informative and entertaining. I would suggest anyone visiting BA for any length of time to do both (they are different) - you won't regret it.A great idea, and done brilliantly!
Worth Every Penny and More. Be sure to do the morning and evening tours. The tour guides have some great non touristy restaurants and things to do. Overall Great free tour.

Wonderful way to experience Buenos Aires. WE had a great time exploring BA with the BA Free Tour. The guides were professional, courteous and full of energy and excitement for their home city! It was also fun to meet other's from around the globe who had also come to enjoy this amazing place.

I couldn't be more pleased with their helpfulness and knowledge. My experience with Buenos Aires Free Tour was a truly delightful surprise. In the past I have tried to obtain information about questions I have had on a trip in other countries and received no answer. So, you can see how delighted I was with your company not only to answer my questions and offer more help but to do so immediately and even in excellent English. I couldn't be more pleased with their helpfulness and knowledge. If I am ever in Buenos Aires in the future, you can be sure I shall contact them for a personal tour.Phyllis FullerNorth Carulina

BA Free Tours a must do. Do not miss taking the BA free tours - both of them! If you are familiar with the free tour concept in other cities you will not be disappointed in Buenos Aires' version. Young entergetic guides show you the highlights of their city, while answering your questions on everythig from the local economy, religion, education , or whatever you wish to discuss. Each walk takes about 2 - 2 1/2 hours, and can be joined for whatever you feel is a fair tip for their time.

A must do when in Buenos Aires. My wife and I did both tours and we had a great time on both. I cant imagine anyone doing a better tour in the city. The tour provides great insight into the history of the area as well as the thoughts and sentiments of the average porteno. The tour is a great way to spend a couple of hours in the city. The guides are very knowledgeable and helpful in every respect.

Best Tour in BA. Did this tour on our last day in BA. Found it through tripadvisor like other reviewers. Did both morning and afternoon tour with Maca who was very funny and informative. After the first tour, we went to have lunch with some people from the tour at a pizza parlor Maca recommended. The pizza was very yummy and everyone spoke highly of the tour. Wished I've done in sooner. Will definitely come back and use their service again!

Perfect Intro to BA. We did the free tour starting at Congresso... we accidentally hitched onto some philosophy tour in spanish and were contemplating leaving when we noticed the green t-shirt!! Jumped ship onto that instead and it was blast. Maca was funny and insightful! The best way to get your intro to BA. I had meant to join the Recoleta one, but never got the chance. Highly recommended!

Stand back, Buenos Aires!. You'll get a bit of star quality treatment on these tours. OUr guide, Gaston, was personable and informative. Kept the group moving and answered questions honestly.
Good way to see the city

Buenos Aires from the inside. I had only planned on taking the morning tour but I liked it so much I went back for the afternoon tour as well. My guides were Maca in the morning and Sol in the afternoon - both were enthusiatic and fun, and they gave insider's tips about the city.

Superb way to know BA insights. We took both tours with Maca. She's great and told us plenty of details and insights about BA, their people and how they live. BA is an easy city to walk by, but you will never learn as much things as you will taking the tours with these guys. Our particular tour was full of young tourists so Maca treated us as if we were all long time friends. However midage tourists can also join the tour as the walking has lots of stops and you don't feel like have been walking that much.I will strongly recommend both tours for your first day in BA. After this you get trained to visit almost all BA by your own.

Tour Guide--had a wonderful experience. WE made arrangements with BA Free Tour! at info@bafreetour.com. They offer free walking tours of the city. We made arrangements for an all day tour through them including lots of walking which really allowed us to see the city but also used the city bus and finally taxi. We toured with Adriana who was extremely knowledgeable about the city and spoke excellent English so we really enjoyed the sights. We saw a lot in one day for a very reasonable price. In addition, for the next day, Adriana even helped us with the crazy taxi situation around the cruise port--more than she needed to do for us. We toured on our own the 2nd and 3rd days but had enough knowledge after touring with her to know where to go and what we were seeing.

Great introduction to BA!. We did both the morning and evening tours on our first full day and learned so much! In the morning we had Gaston and he was great - extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and engaging. He showed us around the downtown / commercial / government areas and gave a ton of background information about the culture and history of BA and Argentina. He also gave us recommendations for restaurants, attending a soccer game, etc. In the afternoon, Maca showed us around the aristocratic area, which was also interesting. The guides work off of tips, which is nice because you can give what you feel the tour is worth (or what you can afford). They really don't pressure you about it, either. We found the tours to be a good pace to allow for seeing a lot while still allowing plenty of time for taking photos and learning background. After the morning tour, we ended up going to lunch with a big group from the tour, which was a fun way to meet new people from all over the world!

Macca was a great tour guide.... Macca was a great tour guide - interesting, funny and very informative. It was great that she added her own personal thoughts on topics whilst also giving us the facts. Plus it's free, so you can give as much as you feel it is worth in tips. Our tour lasted about three hours but was at a good leisurely pace.

Great way to see BsAs. Sol and Gaston are energetic, enthusiastic and knowledgeable guides to one of the most enchanting cities in the western hemisphere. The walking tours offer a great way to learn the do's, don'ts, should's and should not's for this very vibrant, eminently walkable city. Take the tours early during your stay and use your knowledge to and get around the city for rest of your time in BsAs.Highly recommended.

Brilliant start to trip in BA and South America. HiWe joined both tours offered by this enthusiastic, knowledgable company and enjoyed every moment. A brilliant way to start your adventure in BA and to gain back ground knowledge to the sights, history as well as local tips on the best bars, places to eat and getting around. Sol and Garton were excellent guides and can,t rate this highly enough...thanks for a good start to our trip. Harriet and Rich, London.

SUPERB!!!!!!! If visiting Buenos Aires contact BA FREE TOUR!!!!!. Gaston replied to all of my emails and is always polite and extremely helpful.We arranged a private tour as we only had 1 night and 1 full day in BA before our cruise left. What a great time we had, Gaston arranged for us to go to the Carlos Gardel tango show which was amazing and then Adriana met us a showed us as much of BA as she possibly could on foot, by bus, underground and taxi. We had a ...truely FANTASTIC time in BA. We cannot wait to visit BA again. Thank you Gaston & Adriana. Best wishes Jason & Richard. England

Great Tour!!!. My husband and I enjoyed the morning tour very much--our guide was terrific and we learned so much about Buenos Aires--highly recommend to everyone!!! We are sorry we were not able to take the afternoon Recoletta tour that our hotel mates told us was just as good!!!

Best way to get to know Buenos Aires!. The guides were terrific! Historical information very interesting and current information gave us a chance to experience Buenos Aires "like a local"! Would recommend the Free Tour to anyone!

SOL...YOU ARE SO SPECIAL!. History, culture and fun...We enjoyed very much to meet you in this beautiful city!
We had the opportunity to do the Aristocratic Tour only....it was outstanding, great. We loved to learn so much. Thank youuuu.

Defenitely do it!!. My wife and I took this free tour on our first day in BA and defenitely recommend to everybody. The tour lasts about 2h30 hours and our guide was very good. A down to earth, friendly and straight forward tour. Don't forget to leave a tip.......

One of the best things you can do in Buenos Aires. I found this tour recommended on Trip Advisor and decided to try it as I am for 1 months in BA and do not know the city. The guides are great, flexible and very helpful Be prepared to leave some tip if you enjoy the tour, so it is not absolutely free, but it is definitely worth it.They do a morning one and the afternoon one and visit different places. I personally would recommend the afternoon one but it depends on what areas you are interested in seeing. Thank you Gaston and Makarena, you are great!

very authentical, informative and funny. not too long, not to short. both tours they offer are worth going to. nice young people with a lot of knowledge! got in touch by "accident" as we saw a group waiting and joined them. quickly got very interested and visited the afternoon-tour the same day (we were not disappointed!)thanks to get a little bit closer to Buenos Aires in a different way than guided through a book!
Fantastic for backpackers and everyone!. Fantastic for backpackers and everyone!

Outstanding BA Free Tour. If you are planning to visit Buenos Aires, the BA Free tour is a must. Sol, our tour guide, provided us with an outstanding Aristocratic Buenos Aires tour. She was extremely knowledgeable and friendly. She treated you like a friend who wanted to show off the city where she lived. She even took the time to find us a cab at the end of the tour and later sent us an email on information about other things to see in BA. This tour was one of the best things we did while staying in the city.

Culture & History made fun and interesting!. Absolutely a must do! A great introduction to the city . You will learn a lot and have fun too. Great for kids and adults alike . Enthusiastic guides , wealth of information and just the right length!
Very good. I did both tours and really enjoyed the information.. I would highly recommend these tours. I took both tours and found the information and tour guide very helpful and personable.

Highly recommended!. I did both of these tours during my stay in Buenos Aires: the regular tour with Gaston and the "aristocratic" tour with Sol. I learned so much about the city and both tour guides were great -- very entertaining and incredibly knowledgable. I had done my research about Buenos Aires before going, but nothing beats getting the locals' perspectives. Thanks guys!!!

Don't miss these tours!. We did both BA Free Tours! Even though we had already been in BA two weeks before taking the tours, we learned so much and they were fun! The morning tour with Gaston was all around the Microcenter and ended at the Obelisk. We had walked those streets many times before but saw things we had not seen and hearing the history and the stories was amazing. Gaston was entertaining and friendly and really knowledgeable about the historical contexts, politically, economically and socially. He was also helpful in general about things to know in BA. The afternoon tour began at San Martin statue in Retiro and Sol was our guide. She was also amazing in every way! Friendly, funny, smart, personable and filled with tips and info for the rest our trip. The tour took us also to places we thought we would have been to, but had not. Streets we never would have found on our own, even with the map. And the funny and interesting stories she told about all the aristocratic families from the 19th century. And the wars, and the politics as well. I can not recommend these tours enough. The company and the guides survive on tips so tip well, they earn every peso!! I think they should franchise all over the world! Bravo folks...keep up the good work. S&S from Boston

Well organized overview of the city core. I went on the 11am tour this morning. Our guide was Gaston. He was easy to spot in his green shirt. He took us around to see various landmarks and gave us the history behind each location we stopped at. The information he provided made the tour much more interesting than wandering around town on your own. I read a previous review that complained about waiting for other tourists and the counting of missing people. We also waited and collected late comers. I think that's expected when tourists are making their way to a destination in a city they've never been before. Also, nice that they keep the group together, so no one gets left behind or lost.My friend and I had to leave early. We didn't just take off, we told him we had to leave. He didn't force us to stay. He suggested we go one more block to see one more thing. Really glad we stayed to see something quite unusual.I recommend the tour if you've got time.

Informative and entertaining tour. My husband and I took the 11am tour of Buenos Aires. We found the tour to be both informative and entertaining. We had the pleasure of having a nice, energetic college student lead the tour.
I definitely recommend it. We spent 2 hours in a nice atmosphere, learning lots of interesting things about the city.

Best value and great fun!. We went for both tours, first the afternoon Regoletta tour with our tourguide Sol which was in a larger group, but she managed to keep us all together and informed. It's great to learn about this amazing city by a local, as the stories and explanations where much more authentic then from any guide book. The morning tour starting at Congresso was also well attended and even the rain starting half way didn't stop the group from following our guide. We strongly recommend to join the BA free tour and promoted it to friends already, best value for money as you only give a tip if you enjoyed the tour.

Tour would have been great if the guide's attitude were more mature. I decided to go on this tour without a shadow of a doubt after reading the raving reviews. We met with Macka (?) the young girl who was our tour guide for the Aristocrat tour right before the new year. She had us hanging out and waiting until everyone (who wanted to come along) showed up so we started about 10 after 5. Then as soon as we walked over to another attraction, she started counting us. She planned to do this every time we moved. A couple had already left. She went after them and had us WAIT. On a free tour that there is no commitment, she had us wait while she went after other couples. Then in Recoleta, she had the more immature attitude towards the rich and wealthy who lived there, using code words to make fun of them. I found her immature beyond words, and while my husband insisted on tipping her, I would never recommend this tour to anyone.

BA Free Tours Are Great!. I went on both the morning and the afternoon BA Free Tours while in Buenos Aires a couple of weeks ago. Now, as I look back on my trip, I realize that they were highlights of my time in BA. I would highly recommend them to anyone visiting that beautiful city.

Great introduction to the city. This was a great way to see a few of the most important sights of BA. The tour guide was great, and I learned a lot about the history of the city. I also got advice (which I trust) from the tour guide about the best places to eat pizza, parilla, and see tango. I recommend doing it on the first day of your trip in BA, and be sure to bring some money to tip the guide, as they do expect tips (and they deserve them).
Awesome!. My wife and I loved it! Great information about any and everything. We asked about Tango shows, Parillas, shopping and more and the guide stayed afterwards to answer our questions.

A Must Do!. My husband and I really enjoyed these tours. We took the morning tour with Gaston and some folks from Australia, Spain, Italy, Russia and California. We all liked it so much we decided to all have lunch together (at a fabulous pizza place Gaston recommended) and hang around to take the afternoon tour with Sol! Both guides are very knowledgeable and entertaining. I would highly recommend these tours!

The best tour in town. I have been in Latin America for the past three months and this is by far the best tour i´ve done. Sol and Gutan and the team are so friendly and helpful - they´re the local friends you wish you had in every city you travel to! No question is left unanswered from Tango shows to politics, steak houses to where on earth you find veggie fare. The tours are a great way to get involved with the best areas of the city, 2 hours of fun, informative and local knowledge. It gives you a real tatse of the city and a real insiders look ... much better than the big yellow buses! The guys walk you through the history and sites of BA and give you a real insight into the city and what it is to be a Porteño. I can´t recommend the tour highly enough. Best tour in town for sure ... don´t miss it!

Free BA tours. Excellent, smart, kind, informative and fun! Plus its freebut please offer a tip as it is well deserved. Do not pass this up...the best way to learn about BA plus they offer tips on tango, resto, cafe, etc, etc. I want to start my own when I get back home. Bravo !!!
