It's Free and Fun. It's a great tour last for just like 2 hours, it's fun and you can know the aspect of how Argentina live and the true fact of their culture, the guide are informative. It's even better than other guide tour that are not free. If you have 2 hours, why don't you go for that tour?

BA tour. We took the Buenos Aires privet tour with Adriana and privet Tango lesson with Poly.It was not free bur worth every penny. We had a great time and had a lot of fun. The Adriana is very knowledgeable and provide interesting insights into the history and character of Buenos Aires. Highly recommend the free tour as well as their add on trips

Great combination of Information, Entertainment and Exercise. My wife and I are not generally guided tour types. However, after reading some ot these reviews we decided to give it a shot and it was a great experience. We did the morning tour with Gaston. He was entertaining and gave us not only highlights of the typical tourist sights, but shared some interesting historical facts and insights into Argentinian life (as well as a few secrets that I won't divulge here). As a walking tour, it also allowed you to get a good idea of the layout of the city, which proved useful for later exploration on our own. I highly recommend this as a great introduction to BA. I think by the end of the tour you will feel that they have earned a generous tip.

Great snapshot of BA!. We really enjoyed the morning and evening walking tours. Guides were super friendly and helpful for historical information and for other attractions and things to do around the city. They even help you with booking things. Definitely recommend them! Buenos Aires is beautiful!

Well worth the effort. Hi there, we did the day tour with the cute Gaston on our trip to BA last week. Super friendly guide and enough points of interest and fantastic commentary on the way around. Lasts about 2 1/2 to 3 hours and I would highly recommend it.
Fun tour. It was a fun and informative tour however I wanted to hear more historical introduction to the city and less talking of platic surgery.

Great tour, great tour guides. We took both the morning and the evening tours and enjoyed them very much. The tour guides are very knowledgeable and provide interesting insights into the history and character of Buenos Aires. We wholeheartedly recommend both tours to everyone.

A must do tour in Buenos Aires. Planning a recent trip to Argentina, I relied on the advice of fellow traveler comments on Trip Advisor, so it is only fitting I share my experience with you.We wanted to make the most of the limited time we spent in Buenos Aires. BA Free Tours (yes, FREE) was an excellent resource for learning a lot about the city in a short time. We took the morning "city" tour, did a little shopping on Florida Street, then joined the afternoon tour, called "Aristocratic Buenos Aires." The morning tour starts at the Congress building and ends at the Obelisk, and covered everything in between. The value comes from seeing the city through the eyes of a porteno. Read the travel books for a black and white understanding; but if you want to add color to your experience, take the tour with a native who puts all of what you read into the context of living in B.A.The afternoon tour starts at Plaza San Martin and finishes at the Recoleta Cemetary. Walking through this section of town you get a strong sense of the history of Buenos Aires. And it is a beautiful part of the city. Gaston and Sol, the tour guides, were excellent. They are very knowledgeable and passionate about the city, and its rich history. As well, ,they are vey amenable to providing you additional information about the city; restaurants, tango shows, etc... Their web address is www. bafreetour.com.Enjoy
Great Informative Fun Tour. I think everything has been said already about this tour. Its fun and informative and informal. We did both tours with Gaston and Sol and enjoyed every minute of it.

Don't miss these tours!. We have done two tours , one with Gaston and one with Sol (thank you guys!!!), and I suggest to everybody to do the same. The tours are excellent, cheap (they ask only a tip! ... and it's deserved!) and introduce you in the city. For us they were a key step because at the beginning in a big city like Buenos Aires you don't know where you can start. After the tours you know a bit the city center and you have an idea on what you can do and see: then it's up to you choosing museums or getting inside some of the buildings/places they have shown you during the guided tours.

BA Free Tour - Excellent. I took the BA Free tour both of the downtown area and the Retiro and Recoleta districts with Gaston and Maka respectively, both tours were informative, well paced and kept you interested throughout the tour, even though it poor down with rain on the afternoon tour of. I would highly recommend these tours as a good starting point to getting to know Buenos Aires.

Great tour by Sol. We enjoyed the aristocratic tour so much we signed up for a trip to Mataderos with BA free tours. The excursion trip wasn't free, but is was cheap and a very good value. Highly recommend the free tour as well as their add on trips.

Excellent and fun tours. We had a very good experience with BA Free Tour.We took both tours offered by BA Free Tour - they were excellent, and our tour guides - Sol and Maka - were fun and energetic. Also we took private tour for the whole day with Adriana, she is very knowledgeable tour guide, she managed to show us almost the whole city of Buenos Aires in one day. Everything what we did with BA Free Tours were very professional, on time, fun. Before you go to Buenos Aires, get in touch with Gaston - he will give you a lot of good ideas and suggestions, we are very grateful for his help in organizing our tour.

Amazing Tour - Must Do!. We were considering some other guided tours and are very glad that we chose the Buenos Aires Free Tour. Gaston was personable, knowledgeable & a delight to spend the tour with. The group was small, only 7 people, very easy to ask questions. The tour itself was informative, learned about the history of Argentina and even though it was pouring, was a delight. For anyone considering a tour of BA, make sure to do this one. I am really excited to do their Aristocrat tour later in the week.

Really worthwhile, informative and fun!. We stayed in BA for two weeks and on our second day went along to the 5pm Aristocratic tour of Recoleta. Sol was our guide, her English was excellent and she made the tour alot of fun. The tour lasted 2 hours and although it didn't seem like we covered that much ground when we looked on the map at the end, the time flew and we took in alot of information on the sites/buildings etc that we saw. You just need to give a tip at the end of the tour as it's free but this is how they make money to keep going. I definately recommend this tour. Also, you walk past the Park Hyatt hotel at one point and Sol tells you that for 120 pesos you can go and have afternoon tea there. t's actually 105 pesos for two people as we did it the following week. This was also a really nice way to spend an afternoon having tea on the terrace - we even spotted Depeche Mode who were staying there as part of their tour.

Fun, Fantastic and Free Tour!. We found this tour when researching things to do in Buenos Aires on the Internet. There are two 2-hour tours the Buenos Aires City Tour and the Aristocratic Buenos Aires Tour. We took the Buenos Aires City Tour which met at 11am at the Plaza del Congreso (Avendia Rivadavia @ Rodriguez Pena). On the day we went it was pouring rain and cold. Despite the weather, the tour guide, Gaston, arrived on time and was very energetic. The tour was given in English and very easy to understand. We passed many key monuments and buildings and our guide was very informative. We took the tour on our first day in Buenos Aires and felt that at the end, we had a great understanding of the city and the people. We also enjoyed the "surprise building" at the end of the tour. At the end, Gaston was kind enough to give everyone on the tour his email and told us to email him if we had any questions or needed any suggestions. The only thing we regret is that we didn't have time to do both tours!

Great business model!. The reviews are accurate- excellent tour, enthusiastic and knowledgeable guide, low pressure and pay what you think it's worth in tips. The guide is a great resource for other information and certainly does not hurry any one along. I only had a brief time in the city and this was an excellent way to see the city centre- and to meet fellow travelers. These young people have a clever business model - I'm sure the guides do well on tips- but they earn them through the quality of the tour. A standard city tour will cost you $25+ and this may well be better - so keep that in mind when tipping. Oh and of the 10 or so people on my tour, at least 8 had found out about it from Tripadvisor!

simply the best tours!. I did the recoleta tour a while a go and it was well worth it. Sol, the guide was very informative and funny. We had an awesome tour and then Sol answered all of our questions and suggested several places to go that met our expectations. Since the tour was free, tipping Sol was the least I could do. I think anything from AR$50 and up would be reasonable. Thank you Sol for the wonderful tour and keep it up BA Freetours!!!!

Awesome Tour For Any Budget. I took both the morning tour and the afternoon tour and both are really great. The guides are enthusiastic, honest, entertaining and can sense what the group wants to learn about. I think both are worth doing, but if you can only do one, do the morning tour, since it covers more. On both, you'll really see a lot and learn a lot about the history of BA and even the customs of today. Since they only work on tips you pay what you want to or what you can afford. It's the best deal I've found in BA. Definitely do this if you're in BA!

Well worth the time. A great program. Our friendly guide spoke English very well and did a great job explaining the history and significance of each of the locations we visited.A walk is a great way to see the city of Buenos Aires and the path of this tour is perfect as it leads you from spot to spot.Overall a wonderful value for your time and money(since it is free) and should be included in your itinerary if this is your first visit to Buenos Aires. I would recommend throwing the tour guide 10-20 pesos as a tip since they technically work for free.

Great tour. I had a great experience on both the Centro tour in the morning and the Recoleta tour in the evening. Very nice tour guides with good information. I nice stroll and pretty entertaining. I learned alot and was happy to spend time with some great people while in BA. I highly recommend it...

Excellent tour in Buenos Aires .... Buena Onda!. Recently went on the evening tour with Sol and have to say it's been one of the most enjoyable and informative 2 + hours in Buenos Aires to date. I believe that the enthusiasm and perspective of this local "portena" makes it worthwhile, and it's absolutely free!! Only regret is that I waited nearly three years to do this. Great job Sol!

Probably the best tour in Buenos Aires. Some friends in Switzerland put me in contact with Sol which recommended me to make the tour, so I did.Even if the weather was really cold and rainy, Gaston was highly motivated. The tour was really good and instructive. I highly recommend this tour. Muchas gracias a Gaston y Sol por todo ;-)lolo from switzerland

check it out. I did each of the two tours and both Sol and Marca were fantastic tour guides. I would certainly recomend this if you are a backpacker, in for work, or just passing though B.A. They were energetic, extremely knowledgable and willing to answer any f the questions we had. I also got follow up emails on some of the places to check out after the tour was done, which was super helpful to me. B.A. is a big city so it was great to be able to see all the right sights and learn the history though an all english tour. bets of all it is free! :)

Best to do first day in the city!. We read the reviews on this Tour and we wanted to make it but we were not sure if there would be enough time as our flight was scheduled to arrive at 9:30, luckily our flight arrived a few mins early so we took the shuttle to our hotel, checked in, dropped our bags and took a taxi to the meeting place making it right on time when Maca arrived promptly at 11AM, we still waited an additional 5 mins in case more people were rushing to get there.It is good to do this tour the first day you arrive as you get oriented with the City and get to walk around town with a local. Maca's English is very good and she explained things quite well. We enjoyed taking this tour, it last about 2 1/2 hrs. just make sure you take a restroom break before you go as I was dying towards the end and I didn't want to interrupt the tour by asking where I should go to the restroom. This is a free tour however the guides work on tips and you will have a great time learning about the city, it's history and landmarks so be generous and tip your guide!

Did both BA Free Tours (City & Aristocratic) and loved both of them!. First of all, both tours are seriously FREE - no hidden fees... we just tipped both tour guides $30 USD each. But I noticed some who tipped a little less and a little more. It's really up to you what you want to give them. The best is that they don't pressure you about ANY tips at all. I think you finish the tour, and enjoy it and them so much that you want to give them a tip. My husband and I did the City Tour on a Tuesday morning with Marca last week and then we did the Aristocratic Tour on Wednesday afternoon with Sol. We thought both of the tour guides were very passionate about their city giving us great information about the major landmarks while also incorporating aspects of the culture you wouldn't otherwise get unless you knew someone from BA. Both tours were like having your friend take you around their home town. We were especially grateful to Marca for taking my husband and I, along with another tour attendee to a local Pizza place that was so delicious after our tour. We were also especially grateful to Sol who took us on the tour, despite the miserable, cold rain -- and for her to give us a virtual private tour - because nobody else showed up! Plus, she didn't even skimp out on the tour --- she gave us the full tour plus answered all our questions! Both Sol & Marca were such great tour guides!!!! Anyway - obviously I'm giving a high rating because at the end of it all - you see the best of BA plus the culture from very passionate tour guides who clearly just love what they do --- oh and it's FREE (but you really should give a tip)!

It's like Touring with a Local Friend in BA. I had read the reviews on TripAdvisor regarding this tour and decided to attend both the Morning and the Evening tour. As we can attest, I highly suggest taking the tours early on if not the first day you are in BA just so you can get a sampling flavor of what the city attractions are. My bf and I attended the evening tour on our first full day in BA and we thoroughly enjoyed it. We were lucky enough that the group was small and Sol, our tour guide was able to provide a intimate and more personal tour for us all. I love the concept that they create the tours with the idea that you have a personal local friend in BA. One of the ladies in our tour was craving ice cream and Sol took us to one of her favorite gelato shops on the way of the tour and introduced us to the local flavors. Also upon our arrival, our electrical adapter did not work and Sol helped take us to a local stop and helped us purchase what we needed. She also welcomed us to email her while we are in town if we had any other questions. During the week, I emailed Sol for Malbec and restaurant recommendations and she was prompt in her responses. She was great and I highly recommend anyone to take this walking tour. It is much more personal than an organized paid tour and the guides work on tips within your budget. They are gracious, fun and personable!http://www.buenosairesfreetour.com/en/index.html
Strongly recommended. All the tours offered are interesting. Very nice atmosphere. Detailed explanations and info. It's really worth doing if you're in B.A.

Excellent pair of tours. My wife and I had 3 bays in Buenos Aires to see the sights,
we did both the 11am and 5pm tours.
The guides were different but both excellent, helpful and knowledgeable,
do the tours, you won't regret it

BA Free Tours ROCKS!!!". This is the number one attraction for a reason. How could you go wrong with a 2 hour free tour giving you unique insights into the history of a great city, led by charming and charismatic guides?We took both the morning and the afternoon tour and they were fantastic and informative. Maca(short for Macarena) led both of our tours and she was funny, smart, and enthusiastic. She was incredibly knowledgeable and had great tips and stories. There is no better way to get an overview of the Microcentro or the Recoleta/Retiro areas. We tipped her each time and it was money incredibly well spent. Thank you Maca and BA free tours- you made our BA experience even better! Jason and Jaime.

Great way to find out about the city from a local quickly. I went on the evening walking tour of Recoleta and it was excellent. Our guide (Sol) was really friendly and had great helpful tips of other things to do in the city as well. The tour was really informative and gave you a much better insight to Buenos Aires than a guidebook. If I had of walked around this area on my own I wouldn't have noticed or appreciated half the sights I saw. Well worth it.

Wonderful Tour. We did this tour our first morning in BA, and I'm so glad we did. Gaston was a great guide and helped to get us oriented to the city. He was funny and informative, even though it was freezing cold and wet. I feel like I learned a great deal about the city, its history and landmarks. Gaston later helped to point us towards good shopping areas, as well as helped us book an amazing tango show.

Excellent introduction to the geography and history of Buenos Aires. Walking tours can help you orient yourself geographically in a new city. This tour not only gave us this, but also a valuable insight into the history and culture of Argentina, and the mindset of the local Porteños. A great way to start your exploration of Buenos Aires. The guides are great, very helpful and will follow up via email on questions you have about the city. They will customize their advice based on your interests, so don't be shy! Sol and Maca are excellent ambassadors for their city. Thank you both for sharing your enthusiasm with us.

took both the morning and the afternoon tour - it's great !. Hi there, my columbian roommate recommended BA free tours to me, and I enjoyed it very much - it's fun and interesting and the guides are very entertaining and helpful and know a lot of things of their city that they like to share with the visitor. abolutely recommended! enjoy your trip, caroline

Gotta be the best tour in town!!. Just got back from the 5PM BA Free Tour and can't wait to go again tomorrow for the (totally different) 11AM tour! Sol was funny, entertaining, knowledgeable and super informative. She not only told us about the history and stories of the neighborhood, but also gave us tips and information about other things we wanted to do in the city - things I don't think I would have found without having talked to her. The tour is free but, of course, tipping is encouraged and, believe me, you'll want to as she makes it worthwhile. A definite must-do.

Awesome free tour. I was impressed with BA Free Tour for their informative and entertaining tour. My tour guide was Sol, and she was very energetic and gladly provided advice on the best places to go in the city. Even though Argentines eat a lot of beef, Sol told me some good vegetarian restaurants to check out. The guides are knowledgeable about the history of the architecture, neighborhoods, the best clubs, milogas, and which museums to hit in the city. Best of all the tour is free, and tipping is optional.

An inside perspective on life in the "Paris of South America". This is a great tour to take if you are on a budget as it operates on a tips only basis. Our guide, Sol, is a Buenos Aires native and is both knowledgeable and passionate about the city. She shared the history behind the unmistakable European flare of the "Paris of South America" as well as various insider tips. The tour was entertaining, and Sol readily gave advice about things to see and do while in Buenos Aires. It was great to get the scoop from someone in the know.

Don't Miss it!. Make sure you do this as soon as possible after arriving. We didn't and said over and over how we should have. We went with Sol on 3 tours - one to Feria de Mataderos. It was like having a relative in the city. Genuine and fun, I would recommend these tours to all ages.

A must do on your first day in Bs As. This is the best way to get to know a fabulous city and the people that live there. There are 2 tours offered, one at 11 a.m. covering areas related to gov't and Argentinian history, and one at 5 p.m. focusing on the aristocracy. Gaston led our morning tour and he was terrific, having us all say where we were from - entertaining us with his great sense of humor - and allowing us to get a peek into the AR character, esp. what they think of their gov't (it's a joke to them!). On top of this, he offered us his email and sent me answers to several questions we had about restaurants, etc. This is free, but tips are freely taken!

Fantastic introduction to a fantastic city. We attended the morning tour and learned a lot about the city and it's history. The guide speaks great English and is passionate about his home. I felt like we had gained a new Porteno friend.

Their private tours are also brilliant!. We only had limited time in BA so was unable to make the free tour group. Instead we took a private tour on the afternoon we arrived with Gaston. He took us to a number of neighbourhoods - we saw some of the tourist attractions, but we also just walked the streets and Gaston shared the history and his passion for his city. It was a fantastic way to be introduced to BA, and we thoroughly enjoyed seeing the city from a local's point of view.

Take this tour the day you arrive!. My mother and I didn't take this tour until day 3 of our 10 day trip and we both wish we would have taken the tour the day we arrived. We did both the morning and evening tour the same day and it was definately one of the best days of our trip. It's not too much to do both in one day - eventhough my mom is not athletic she had no problem doing both tours. And the tours are so very different. If you had to pick only one, I wouldn't know which one to pick. Thankfully the tours are free, so you shouldn't have to choose only one!Sol and Gaston are awesome. They speak very very good english. They know the city well. And they genuienly want to help you make the most of your trip. We emailed them shortly after the tour for some specific things we wanted to do, and they responded to us right away. The tour is fun and very informative. We went to a cafe immediately after each tour to jot down notes about the things we wanted to go back to and explore more. Do not miss this tour if you are in town. It was so fun and very informative. I can't say enough good things about Sol and Gaston.

Buenos Aires Free Tour. Took this tour last week, and what can I say...so far it was the best thing I (we) did since we arrived!!! Our guide, Gaston was such a pleasure to deal with and not only did he provide us with alot of historical background, he shared many cultural facts/insights we would have never learned or heard of. We have been in touch with him since our tour, several times now, and he comes through every time in such an unbelievable helpful way. Friends and family will be visiting us in another couple weeks, and this is the TOUR we will have them go on as well! A true asset to the city...I am thankful to have found this tour.

A great alternative to know BA. At first, we get to the meeting point and we didn't see any signs, what made us feel a little in doubt about the tour, but at 11AM on time Gastón arrived and presented himself. It was a great walk through some of the most importants places in BA. It is a great alternative if you want a quick and non commercial tour, really great.

Real porteños lead a fun and interactive tour. Our guide (Sol) was super enthusiastic about imparting historic stories to set the scene for our stay in BA. She was also keen to have a chat about what we wanted to get out of our stay - in our case, seeing live music and visiting natural areas outside of the city. Her local knowledge has been a great help as we've found some gems that we wouldn't have found on our own... Thanks Sol!

Like having a new local friend!. We did both tours. Gaston and Sol are great - knowledgable, enthusiastic and fun. It´s amazing that although they do the tour every day they still sound fresh and enthusiastic and are totally engaging. Even more amazing is that Sol (who is so warm, genuine and gorgeous) goes out of her way AFTER the tour to email or text you with personalised tips on things you might like - based on what you said you were interested in. So some people got tips for restaurants or milongas, and we got a whole page of current tips about the local gay & lesbian scene. Yay! These tours might be free, but by the end you will be really happy to tip generously!

Buenos Aires Free Walking Tours Are A Must Do. Two free walking tours in Buenos Aires offer a comprehensive and fun way of getting to know the city in a short amount of time. Each tour is about 2 hours and covers different parts and aspects of the city's culture and history. They go rain or shine every day except Sunday. The tour was in English. The guide was so energetic and knowledgeable. I happened to have the same guide for both...her name is Sol.....she was also able to recommend restaurants and places to visit more in depth...and what not to bother visiting. Wonderful sense of humor which added to the understanding of the city and its history. The tours are 11am meeting at Plaza Del Congreso and 5pm meeting at Plaza San Martin; both places very accessible. Check out their website: www.buenosairesfreetour.com/en/tours.html. They rely solely on tips and you will want to tip them generously!

Incredible!. The tours guides are kind, generous, funny and very interesting. This trip is worthwhile and worth every second. There are so many interesting facts in every city and these guides know everything. Absolutely incredible and I would recommend my family and friends to take this tour.

Excellent tours. We took both the am and pm tours and found both to be excellent. The guides, Gastön and Sol, are both great, speak almost perfect English and have some great stories about the city that you won't find in guidebooks. After the tours we got some great tips for local places to eat from them and they more than earnt their tips. A really good way to help you get your bearings in this great city.
a must do!. we participated in both tours with sol. sol was great! she is very knowledgable and her enthusiasm is contagious! i recommend this tour to everyone.

Buenos Aires Free tour. As a first time visitor to Buenos Aires I highly recommend this amazing tour not only did i feel like i was receiving factual information but I also felt comfortable walking the streets of Argentina with someone who knew where they were going...I took both the Historical *Morning* tour and the Aristocratic *Evening* tour, both were enough to make anyone feel like a native... you almost relive history with the help of the tour guides. Both tours are long enough to keep your attention yet short enough of a walk so that you don't burn out... A MUST SEE

Excellent introduction to the city. We did the morning tour on our second day, its a great way to learn the main areas of central Buenos Aires. Gastol (our guide) was very well informed and funny, giving us a true Portenos point of view. Highly recommended...

Brilliant - must do!. We have done both morn and afternon tours, and both are excellent. Interesting, informative and lively. You are taken around by people who clearly love the city, and know a lot about it. It should be the first thing you do in BA to get yourself acquainted.

If you can only do 1 thing in BA this is it.. If you have never visited Buenos Aires before, then the BA Free Tour is the best way to receive the perfect introduction to the city. We somehow had the energy to do both the morning and afternoon tours the same day. The guides are very engaging and seem to be knowledgeable of the city. The tour manages to touch upon all aspects of the city ranging from: historical to political to social to religious. They’re also a great resource to use if you need some recommendations for things to do. The next time I go back to BA I’d probably email them beforehand just to get more suggestions. Best of all the tour is free. They only work solely on tips. We ended up giving them a good tip. At least I think so, I’m still trying to figure out the exchange rate.
wonderful way to see Buenos Aires. Our nicest experience in Buenos Aires, thanks to Gaston.we enjoyed his tour in downtown so much so we also took their Sunday special tour (not free) with Sol.

A fantastic and interesting tour. This was one of the highlights of my trip to the lovely city of Buenos Aires. The tours are very relaxed and informal and give great insight into the history and culture of the city. The tours are led by the very charming and hilarious Gaston and Sol and go for about 2hrs. Its a facinating look into the history of Argentina through the eyes of a local and will only enhance your visit to this beautiful city, a must do for any traveller in Buenos Aires. Their private tours to Mataderos Fair was also an enjoyable and interesting outing for anyone wanting to see the locals at play!

A great introduction to the key sights of the "microcentro". I would recommend this tour as the best way of seeing the major sights of downtown BA (often called the microcentro). Our guide was Sol, who was knowledgeable, friendly and communicated well in English. I also took a 1/2 day city tour run by a major operator in a bus, and enjoyed the Free Tour much more. The sights are best seen on foot, you get more time, you generally meet some interesting people on walking tours, and the guide was much better. The only advantage of the 1/2 day city tours run by larger operators is that you see the "uptown" sights as well, though BA Free Tour also operate a second walking tour (which I didn't do) for those sights.I really like the idea these tours are free - but they earn their money from tips. Although having free tours is a great way of introducing their company, Sol told me that they want everyone to be able to take these tours regardless of how much money they have, so they intend to keep them free even as they develop their travel business. BA Free Tour also offer full day tours to the Mataderos Fair most Sundays (not free !). This is one of the less touristic attractions of the city - I signed up for this and was really disappointed when it was cancelled the previous evening as other participants had cancelled.I highly recommend BA Free Tour and hope that Sol and her colleagues are successful in developing their travel business

You feel like you are on a personal tour of Buenos Aires with a friend. My husband and I did the morning tour yesterday and it was wonderful. Gaston is extremely nice and knowledgeable. We are going to do the evening tour with Sol tomorrow but I heard that it was equally awesome. We learned a lot about the city and its history. Thanks to Gaston we had the best empanadas and were able to walk around and discover more. Great way to start any trip to Buenos Aires.

Good tours, informative guides. I took both the morning and afternoon tours, and was very impressed by the level of knowledge and enthusiasm of the guides. They are very interested in explaining their city to visitors, and they are good at answering questions. They don't shy away from controversial topics, which I appreciate.

Great Free Tour. We took both the morning and afternoon tours (not on the same day), both tour guides, Gaston and Sol (brother and sister) were wonderful. They are really personable and informative, no droning on in a monotonous voice. They tell you the facts and also other interesting things. We are very happy that we went as it deepened our understanding of this wonderful city.

Free Walking Tour is a great way to start in the city. I took the morning walking tour with Gaston the day after I arrived to Buenos Aireslast week. I have to say I was very pleased and glad that he was the first to introduce me to the city. He was animated, knowledgable and charming. I would highly recommend the tour if its your first time tto the city

Great tour!. We enjoyed our two tours with Gaston very much! It was a great introduction to an amazing city! Go on, give it a try...it's free! Just remember to tip well if you enjoyed the tour! All in all, highly recommended!

Buenos Aires Walking tour. My wife and I went on the walking tour on 12 March 2009. This is a great way of seeing parts of the city with a friendly and knowledgeable guide who was happy to answer any questions. The tour lasted about 2.5 to 3 hours and included many places of interest - if you have a morning spare this is an ideal way to spend it.

walk around Buenos Aires. Saturday 3-21-09. just finished the day tour with Gaston. Had a great time and very informative. We also went on the Aristocratic tour with him last night. If you come to BA you should definately take these tours. His English is perfect and it's obvious he loves his city. Tours last about 2-2 1/2 hours and well worth the time.You learn a litle history, a little politics and alot about the city in general. It's a great way to learn your way around BA and he is very willing to give you any additional information you might want about places to go, to eat, tango shows etc.
Must do!. The BA free city tour is a must! We couldn't have paid for a better tour. It's educational and fun. Bring money for tips because they're well-earned. Bring water and good walking shoes too.

Buenos Aires Free Tours are great!!. The free walking tours of Buenos Aires given by Gaston and Sol are a terrific way to get oriented to the important parts of the city while getting a nice laid-back education about the history and quirks of BA and Argentina. I guarantee you'll have a blast (assuming you like to walk around) and will get lots of ideas about what parts of the city to revisit and spend more time in. Both of the tour guides are great young people who obviously love their city and love showing it to new friends. They'll fill you in on upcoming events to visit, and make themselves available to help you figure out the best restaurants and other places to go to. Thanks guys!

Great experience with some exercise. Both the morning tour, given by Gaston and the late afternoon one given by his sister, Sol, were pleasant and worthwhile. They have been in business (although the tours are free, they do live off of the tips) a little less than a year. It is suggested to take both tours as Gaston concentrates in the downtown area while Sol covers a small portion of a business section, a wealthy residential area with alot of European architecture and the Recoletta area. This tour does not go into the Recoletta cemetary where Eva Perone is interred. If you are planning to see her crip, there is a charge to get into the cemetary and it closes at either 5 or 6 pm. Sol's tour arrives at this location after the facility is closed so it is necessary to plan the visit either before the tour or for the next day.If you like information/history in a casual atmosphere with some light exercise, don't miss either of the tours.

2 more fans of Gaston's tour. We took Gaston's daytime tour in February 2009 & it was great. We had already walked a lot of the tour on our own, but never looked up to appreciate the beautiful architecture. Learned a lot, met some interesting fellow travelers from all around the world & appreciated Gaston's knowledge of history & love of his city. Kudos!

informal and personal angle on Buenos Aires. Great way to get familiar with BsAs; a basic introduction in an informal and personal style. I did this on my 3rd day in the city so I had seen most of the sights already and read the guidebook - so I think I would have got more out of the aristocratic tour, which will surely try out during my stay too. But definitely worth trying out - interesting and informal. A must do.

Great Tour, Better Then Paid Bus Tour. Must Do in BA!!!!!. This was a informative, fun tour. We completed the 2 tours and they will tell you a lot of useful insite about the city (which a paid tour did not tell us). The day tour was very informative of the city history and political background. The host was very funny and a absolute joy!!! The evening tour show the rich area of BA (Recoletta and Reitro) and told you about the rich family and there homes. Both yours were different and should be completed. WARNING: The day tour guide warned us about people with green vests at the 5 PM tour saying they are from Free BA tour and asking for money for the tour. This tour is completely FREE tour, they will not ask you for anything except feedback if you want to give it and of course if you enjoy it, which I know you will, you can give them a tip since this is how they make there living. You cannot miss this tour when you visit the city, well worth 2 hours.

Do this your first day.. I took the tour in early January. It was great to get the historic and architectural background of the City/Country from Gaston. No political agenda, just the facts, from all points of view, except soccer talk, he is an Argentinian !!!!. Gaston spoke perfect english, he has spent 5-6 winters working/skiing in Lake Tahoe. He'll even recommend restaraunts and other things to do. It was a very enjoyable 2 hour walking activity. Highly recommended. Do it your first morning to get a good overview to start your stay in BA.

Intro to B.A.. We really enjoyed both of the free tours guided by Gaston and his sister Sol. We don't normally participate in guided tours or activities, but we had been traveling around the world for 6 months and we were getting a little tired of figuring out stuff for ourselves. We did the evening tour January13th and the afternoon tour January 14th. We arrived in BA on the afternoon of the 13th, so the evening tour that night and the afternoon tour the next day were a good way to familiarize ourselves with the city. Both tours are very informal and more like going on a walk with your local friend as a tour guide . We enjoyed Gaston's afternoon tour most because it's sights allowed us to learn more history about the city. Sol's evening tour is more residential, so their is not as much to learn. Also the way both Sol and Gaston collected the tips was great. At the end, when you gave your tip they just placed the money in their bag with out looking, thus eliminating an awkward transaction. All together the walks were a great thing to do.Danielle & RyanSt. Louis, MO

WOW! A Must!. Wow! I mean wow! I’m naturally a skeptical person… nothing free can really be that good... But then we met Gaston, our tour guide for the day. He was knowledgeable, interesting, and insightful. He knew all about BA’s history and the main sites to see. I went on the morning tour which covered most of the main sites in BA except for Recoleta Cemetery… but don’t worry, that’s covered on their afternoon free tour at 5 PM! There is absolutely no reason to pay for a tour guide in Buenos Aires when these guys are in business. We just showed up at the meeting point (Rivadavia Ave and Rodriguez Peña street in the Plaza del Congreso at 11 AM) and off we went. This is a must if you want a good overview of the city. This tour is truly exceptional.

Best way to walk the city and see the major sites. This is a small company started by Gaston and his sister Sol. They both have excellent English and know a fair amount about the city. They survive by tips which is a great incentive for them to give you the best walking tour of your life. I had only a few days in BA and I went on two different days, there's a 5 PM tour more of the residential areas and a 11 AM tour of the major gov't buildings. Both are about two hours and don't require RSVPS. Just show up near the meeting points and look for other tourist like folks. Meeting points are detailed on their website. Definitely take the time to do this....

The first thing to do in Buenos Aires. This was the most professional and well conducted tour I have been on and it is amazing that it was free - well we left a tip of course so not quite free. In a city with so many attractions it was good to have someone tell you what was worth visiting and what wasn't and to give you some background and history of the city. It would be nice to see this being done by students in all countries. This should definitely be the first thing you do in Buenos Aires, if you are travelling alone it is also a good way to meet people.

Excellent Tour. Great way to get a lot of information about the city, and get great advice from a very friendly local tour guide, fluent in English. Get insights you wouldn't get walking around on your own, but also enjoy walking around with someone you feel like you know. Best way to start off the visit to Buenos Aires, would be well worth it even if it wasn't free.

BA Free Tour Fantastic!. I went on two tours with this group. It was unlike any other. Gaston and Sol are so knowledgeable about BA and they are so personable. Made it feel like you were hanging with friends! Gaston guided us through parts of the city and the stories of history were told with so many facts. Sol was so helpful at the Feria Matadores showing us where to shop, what to look for and explaining the Argentinian culture along the way. I highly recommend these tour guides. I will use them again on my next trip to Buenos Aires!

Great Tour!!. I went on the Aristocratic tour and thought it was amazing!! As I was the only one there I ended up having a private tour. I definitely recommend it to anyone who is interested in learning more about the city and its history!

Free City Tours in Buenos Aires, Argentina. If you are planning to visit Buenos Aires, my City, let me recomend you a great option to walk, learn and have a lot of Fun... www.buenosairesfreetours.com You will enjoy this experience for FREE!!

Must not miss in Buenos Aires. Buenos Aires is a fantastic city. Start off your vacation by taking one of the free tours offered by BA Free Tour. These guides show you the highlights of 2 important areas in BA. One starts close to the Congreso Building and the other begins in Recoleta. Just show up at the location and time listed and look for the person in the green shirt. Don't worry, they look for people too so you do find each other. The tour is free but the guides rely on their tips. Please be generous. You will learn more on these tours then you could do on your own. I can't rave enough about them.

BA Free Tours. I did the morning walking tour the first day I was in BA. It was very helpful and gave me a good overview of the layout of the city - so much so that I was ready to venture out and explore San Telmo and Puerto Madero on my own afterwards. Also, our group was small enough that we (there were only two of us) could ask questions and get recommendations for things to do and places to eat afterwards. It was a very pleasant experience and well worth the two hours plus tips!

Excellent and fun walking tours of Buenos Aires!. Just came from a most wonderful 4 day holiday in Buenos Aires. Not knowing where to start with the many places to visit and things to do in Buenos Aires, I was happy to find through Trip Advisor this website that advertised free tours of Buenos Aires (http://www.buenosairesfreetour.com). Feeling a little skeptical ("free" tours? must have a catch!), I decided to call them anyway to arrange a tour (well, it's not actually "free", they work 100% for tips). Little did I know, it turned out to be one of the best decisions I made on the trip. The Aristocratic BA walking tour my wife and I joined was two and a half hours full of fun and very interesting insights from our very friendly guide Sol, who took us around the neighborhoods of Retiro and Recoleta. It was like having one of your good friends (who happens to be a local) take you around town and give you a tour of the city that only a friend can give you (not to mention happily take photos for you!). We had such a good time that we ended up also taking the next morning's Buenos Aires free city tour, which had Sol's equally friendly brother Gaston as our guide. Gaston took us around Plaza de Mayo, Congreso and other places in Centro, and we thoroughly enjoyed his humor and attention to detail during the tour as he toured us around. Between those 2 tours and total of 5 hours with Sol and Gaston, my wife and I felt that we had covered so much of Buenos Aires' most interesting places to visit as well as learned quite a bit about the city's history, culture and people. All in all, I was extremely pleased with both tours. Very highly recommended!

1/2 Day La Boca and San Telmo walking tour. This tour was absolutely what we wanted. We were unsure whether a tour would be fun and informative in the right way or a bit annoying as some other tours can be. It was 100% the former. Don gave us a great tour full of interesting information delivered so well. He was extremely generosity with his time.

Outstanding way to get acquainted with city. My 12 year old son and I booked in for the City walking tour, starting at Recoleta cemetery, walking through Retiro along Alvear to Plaza de Mayo. We chose the extension, so our walk was meant to last 4.5 hours and went for closer to 7!Our guide was Don, a very personable North Carolinian who has lived in BA for six years. He was a very nice man, amazingly knowledgable and pleasant to spend time with. We spent more than two hours at the cemetery and we felt we came away with a pretty reasonable basic grasp of Argentinian history, told through the stories of the characters in the tombs. Another highlight was coffee and cake at Cafe Tortoni, said to be the most famous cafe in BA. This is delightful place, old and witness to many of the greats of BA life over the years and an excellent place to rest up for a little while.I can't recommend this company or Don enough. The tours are not cheap, but are well worth the price and for anyone with limited time to spend, or looking to get a good introduction at the start of a longer trip, they are good value.My son highly recommends the tour with anyone his agePack good shoes!

Excellent service even when we had to cancel.. We had scheduled Buenos Tours for our arrival day as a way to learn about the city prior to other scheduled activities of a larger group during the week. Unfortunately our flight was delayed by a day and we were unable to arrive in time to go on the tour. I emailed Buenos Tours as soon as we learned of the flight delay and they responded promptly and gave us a full refund. I would have rescheduled with them but our week was already full. They are true to there word with regard to refund policies. I would recommend booking with them without hesitation.

Wonderful walking tour. Had a wonderful day tour seeing the lovely city of BA. We were able to visit all of the top sites while still having time for a great lunch and coffee break. Would highly recommend this tour...BA is much larger and more spread out than I expected and it was very helpful to have someone assist with navigating the city by taxi or subway.

Perfect overview for the first day. We had a very reliable, punctual and great guide in Jessica and appreciated all the information she shared about Buenos Aires. Walking, taking taxis, Metro and bus is the best way to get around the city and once you figured it our it is easy. Jessica can help with all that and she'll show you how to quickly get your bearings around the city. Recoleta cemetery and La Boca was our highlight. We also booked a Milonga Tango tour through the same company and again had an excellent guide and received very good and reliable service.

Excellent!!!. Did two walking tours with Ceri, one of Recoleta and the next day of the historic centre and San Telmo, both tours about 3 hours.Excellent! He has a deep knowledge of the City and is excellent at pointing out wonderful architectural details no quirks of the city.Book, walk, relax, enjoy
Excellent. A comprehensive of BAs neighborhood, Jessica is so knowledgeable and fun. Its like having close friend showing me around.

See Buenos Aires with New Eyes. Our walking tour was the highlight of our stay in Buenos Aires. The 7 hours were perfectly paced and felt like a short, thoroughly enjoyable, educational afternoon. We thought the city was a somewhat sad, grimy and threatening place before the tour. We finished the day able to celebrate our experience in beautiful, rich, vibrant andfriendly Buenos Aires.Thank you Ceri for introducing us to this delightful & wonderful city.

Great experience with a great guide. I was with my friend Mirella and we went with our guide Richard for this great adventure. As I say, it is not a tour but a learning experience. I developed my photo skills, learned about Buenos Aires and its people, how it was developed and took some amazing pictures. We laughed a lot. Such a great time. Now, I have great memories about this beautiful city. Thanks to Mirella, Richard and this amazing tour. If you are reading this, do it. Trust me, it is amazing. That is also the coffee that we took in the beginning, in the end, and the amazing wine that we had in the end.

Such a wonderful day. I did the full day walking tour with Jessica. I felt comfortable with her immediately and as the day progressed I became increasingly impressed by her intelligence and depth of knowledge of Buenos Aires. I learnt so much, but the time passed too quickly. Jess' reflexes also saved the day when she prevented me from falling hard when I tripped on an uneven pathway - a woman of many talents. I can't recommend this tour more highly. Try and do it on your first or second day in BA if you can, as it gives a different perspective and a lovely intimacy to this beautiful city.

Highly recommended. We did a 7 hour walking tour from San Telmo to Recoleta with Jessica. We had arrived the previous day and had organised ourselves an English tour of Theatro Colon and also visited the historic ships at Puerto Madero with their Spanish signage and explanations. We ended up being slightly unsure about Buenos Aires, wishing we spoke Spanish. Jessica changed our view entirely - bringing the city instantly alive. She explained how it had developed and fitted together, showed us many interesting sights, told us many stories and got us into a packed Café Tortoni for lunch despite their being a queue.This walk is most enjoyable and highly recommended. And, we ended up energised rather than tired - as it is not a route march.

Wonderful day in Buenos Aires.. We did the 7 hour walking tour plus La Boca with Oliver. Despite it being a drizzly day and our tiredness (we were just off a 12 hour flight) we had a wonderful day. Oliver was knowledgable, entertaining and flexible. We got an incite into the history of BA, life today in BA and some suggestions of other things we could do after our tour. He tailored the tour to our interests and we got to experience both bus and subway transport and a local restaurant. He saved the best until last. The tour of the Recoleta cemetery was fantastic. Highly recommended

Great experience - definitely again!. We arrived in Buenos Aires Sunday morning from the US and had no plans yet how to spend our 3 days there.I contacted Buenos Tours by email late Sunday afternoon to check availability for a full day walking Tour of the highlights of BA for the next day. It was short notice, and I didn't really expect to get a reply that evening, but Alan, the founder, got back to me within 30 minutes, telling me that yes, they do have a guide available for the next day, and we signed up for the tour.So we met Jack, our guide, on Monday morning at our hotel and he showed us the highlights of his beloved city. Jack is a very personable guy, he is fun to be around with, and he shared with us his wealth of information about the history of BA and Argentina and also patiently answered the many questions we had.We can only highly recommend Buenos Tours. It is very easy to do business with them, and you get a native English speaking tour guide, which was important to us, as we do not speak Spanish at all. We will book a tour with them again the next time we visit BA with friends.Karin, Clearwater/FL

Did 2 tours with Jack from Bueno Tours. I did the half-day – Off The Beaten Path and the full-day I think it was Buenos Aires 101. Both were great. The tour guide Jack was from the US and so spoke perfect English. He was super knowledgeable, funny and easy to chat with. This was not my first trip to BA but it was by far the one where I saw and learned the most. It was GREAT!!! Thanks Jack. Totally recommend l.

Fantastic walking tour of Buenos Aires!. We did a 7 hr walking tour of Buenos Aires with Oliver as our tour guide. Oliver was very knowledgeable about Argentinian history and culture and presented the information in a manner that kept us interested and entertained. He took the time to make it relevant to our interests and questions. Oliver was awesome! It was a very enjoyable day and it exceeded our expectations!

Good experience. We did a half day tour of La Boca and San Telmo with Richard. Richard was very informative and provided a lot of insights into BA and of course the places we visited. He even sent us a list of places to eat when he found out we like to try different food.

Very Informative and Helpful!. We did a two day tour of both North and South Buenos Aires and could not have been happier with our experience. We would never have found so many places or information on our own. We highly recommend the tour company!

Great experience!. Ceri, our guide was wonderful! Our originally planned day to tour was very stormy and raining. Ceri was kind enough to make arrangements to postpone our tour with him till the following day when the weather was much better. He is very knowledgeable and personable. We took taxis, a bus and walked around Buenos Aires. We shopped in the markets and viewed historical buildings, cafes etc. We never felt rushed. He was interested in our enjoying the city and the experience. I would definitely tour with him again in Buenos Aires!

Exceptional Experience. First, I have to say that I think my wife and I would have enjoyed touring a vacant lot with our guide, Ceri - he was that personable, engaging, and knowledgeable. Couple that with the beautiful and vibrant Buenos Aires and you have an experience that is essentially priceless. As I mentioned several times throughout the day, we felt less like we were on a tour and more like we were spending the day with a friend. My new favorite expression (that doesn't involve profanity, anyway) is 'Buen Onda' and that sums up the day, our time with Ceri and the entire trip.

What a great company!. We did a photography/city tour today with Richard. What an absolutely fantastic time. We was so knowledgable, fun, and energetic. My friend and I had the best time. We even did a wine tasting as part of the tour, which we absolutely loved!! Also, this company is amazing. They were very communicative, giving us detailed instructions, contact info and pictures for our driver and our guide. And when our flight itinerary got messed up, they quickly and efficiently rearranged our schedule to pick us up at the hotel and not the airport. I have traveled to a lot of places around the world, and this is one of the best tour companies I've worked with!

Fantastic walking tour of Buenos Aires. My husband, 16 year old son and I were fortunate to have Jack as our guide for an 8 hour tour of Buenos Aires. Jack was simply fabulous, he knows the history of BA and Argentina well and was able to make it relevant to all of us. We fell in love with BA, largely from Jack enthusiasm. I strongly suggest this tour.

Fantastic tour of San Telmo and city centre. Our tour has been the highlight of our family's trip to BA. We have young adult kids and thoroughly enjoyed wandering through San Telmo, seeing unique locations that we would never have found on our own, and meeting people that our guide Ceri knew. We lost all track of time as we toured hidden places while stopping in cafes and wine stores on the way through the historic city centre. Thanks Ceri!

We took the Tango and the City tours. Liz and Richard, our guides for the respective tours were wonderful. We learned so much in such a short period of time. We intended on a short night with Liz for the Tango tour because we were tired from travel but the orchestra was so fantastic that we closed the place down. We thought we would have a short tour of the City and learn some history with Richard but ended up spending about an hour extra because we drank Mate and had a couple of diversions. Great tours.

The best way to see Buenos Aires. I wanted to get a good sense for the city in a short period of time (I only had half a day free on a business trip). Our guide Don was very knowledgeable and packed a lot in our short time together. We focused on Recoleta Cemetery - what a great history lesson and snapshot of life in BA over centuries. Definitely walk the city and use Buenos Tours if you do!

Best way to see the city. We walked, used a bus, a taxi and the subway to get around most of the areas in BA. Took all day, was hot and sweaty but of so interesting. I would recommend this to anybody who wants to get a feel of the place and also find out where to go on other days.

Excellent walking tour for an overview of the city. Our guide, Oliver, was knowledgeable and fun to talk with. Two of us spent a full day with Oliver seeing highlights of several different neighborhoods and learning about Argentine history, architecture, culture, and more. He asked about our interests and customized the tour to accommodate them. We had a coffee break at one of the historic cafés and the best empanadas we ate on our trip for the lunch stop. We saw and learned much more going with a guide than we would have on our own.

The MUST do tour of Buenos Aires. . My tour guide Jack was Fantastic! I learnt so much about this beautiful city & the people throughout the day. I would advise everyone to book the Full day city tour when you arrive in Buenos Aires. It gives you a great overview & perspective of the city. I saw so much and got to know my way around the city. Jack is extremely knowledgeable with a passion for BA, street art and the culture. He has lots of great tips to help you during your stay. His tour of Recoleta Cemetery was brilliant & linked it back to many of the places & people I heard about throughout the tour. He also helped me navigate the public transport system. I advise everyone to book a tour with Jack, the best way to see this city. Worth every dollar & more.

Terrific Tour of Buenos Aires. The company was excellent and very accommodating to meet our needs. Originally, we had a large group of nine people at two different hotels. They arranged transport to pick us up each day for two half day tours of the city, and refunded us some money when not everyone could participate. Richard, our tour guide, has lived on BA for some time and shared lots of interesting history and personal knowledge about the city. We got to tour everything we asked for and more. Do not miss the feria in San Mateo or Cafe Tortoni, a classic tourist cafe. He also knew the lesser known, but really awesome cafes in other areas. Recoleta cemetery was amazing and we actually discovered relatives of in-laws are buried there! Our private walking tour was fantastic and at our own pace. He made sure we saw want we wanted and always checked to make sure we had options. If this is your first trip or a return trip, I recommend this tour.

This private walking tour is a must in Buenos Aires. Yesterday we did an 8 1/2 hour walking tour with Oliver. It was absolutely fantastic and we can't believe how quickly the time flew. We covered the majority of the tour on foot however we managed a taxi ride, bus ride and subway ride. We found this company on the internet and after extensive research decided they best catered for what we wanted to see and do. This has been a highlight for us (2 couple travelling together) and we truly thank Oliver for showing us the sights. We loved eating at a local restaurant for lunch (empanadas and delicious soup) and morning tea at a gorgeous cafe. Oliver was very interesting to chat with and well and truly knew his stuff. I would highly recommend this company. Everything went smoothly and we enjoyed the day immensely - thank you for your company!

Private Photo Tour & Walking Tour. We took a private photo tour with Richard, who has lived in BA for over 10 years and is also a documentary film maker, and had a blast. In addition to knowing all the best spots for photos he also made sure we gained an appreciation for the history and the architecture of Buenos Aires. We loved our tour with him so much that we followed up and booked a full day walking/photo tour with him for the following days. He conducts his tour like an old friend showing you the best parts of a city he loves. The next time we are in Buenos Aires we will book him for a tour again along with a midday coffee. If you want a typical "tourists" view of BA, he can make that happen. If you want to go "off the beaten path," he can make that happen. If you want to combine your tour with some farm fresh meals from a local co-op and then a pizza from a local shop, he can make it happen. I have honestly never had a better tour in my life and I have taken tours in over 20 countries. My wife and I were very pleased.

Full day private walking tour. OMG! We had an awesome tour. Oliver met us at our hotel and showed us around BA. Everything was personalized and he was an awesome guide. He's been in Argentina for 10 years and knows just about every corner. It was well worth it. I fell in love with the city through our walk.

BEST private tour ever, must-do!. I have had the pleasure and privilege of traveling all over the world, and this was by far, the best private tour I have ever taken! Jessica was extremely knowledgeable on all relevant touring topics including history, culture, arts, politics, food, etc. etc. etc. Her time in country along with her educational background and experience lends much credibility to her as a guide, right off the bat. Also importantly, Jessica was adaptable to mine and my traveling partners' varying sightseeing styles. I had a traveling companion who had not taken a private tour before, and this surpassed expectations! The tour of BA infused my short trip with a richness that was unexpected and much appreciated. Cheers to Jessica's office colleagues Justine and Frank as well. They were incredibly responsive to my emails and made my choice to book so easy. The touring staff were kind enough to answer questions before, in between, and after tours. I would say that this is an added bonus as a newcomer and non-Spanish speaker. I can't say enough good things... you won't regret the decision to book this tour!

START your trip to Buenos Aires with Buenos Tours. Make this tour the FIRST thing you do in beautiful Buenos Aires. It influences the rest of your trip positively because you won't be wondering what to do or where to go. You will already KNOW.Want to see what there is to see in one day? With a guide that knows all the great sights and insights--like how NOT to get ripped off?Book these people. They are FANTASTIC. Read the other reviews for more details. All true.

Excellent, informative and fun day! . (This review is a little late... Sorry!)We booked a full day walking tour of Buenos Aires with this company after seeing the great reviews on trip advisor and a friend's personal recommendation, and had a fantastic experience with Oliver, as expected. The tour was tailored to what we wanted to see and peppered with lots of cool facts to make it very enjoyable. However I also wanted to call out the FANTASTIC support the team provided ahead of time, from their website (what to pack / wear, security considerations, etc) to the personalized emails. We wrote back and asked for some restaurant and activity recommendations, and they responded promptly (and the advice was spot on). Would definitely recommend and use again! FYI - We also used them to book the Piazzolla Tango VIP experience (... Because it was simpler, we could pay by credit card, and got transport to and from the venue covered). Would also recommend that! - note the show is not managed or operated by Buenos Tours.

Great Sunday walk in Buenos Aires. In April we visited Buenos Aires for the second time. Our first trip was in 2008 and we ran around the city with the Lonely Plant as our guide. For this trip we wanted to get a more in-depth experience and better understanding of the city. Buenos Aires Tours delivered that and more. Since Sunday was the only day we had completely free we opted for La Boca and San Telmo tour. I know Sunday morning can be pretty sleepy around most cities but Jessica met us at our hotel and was ready to go. Jessica currently lives in the San Telmo neighborhood and had a lot of great local insight about the area and what it’s like to live in Buenos Aires. I particularly enjoyed learning about Republica de La Boca and the conversation on current events over a cup of coffee at El Federal. If you are looking for a great walking tour that does more than scratch the surface than this is the group to go with. I have been around the world and taken several walking tour, this one was one of the best.

Thank you Bueno Tours - Fabulous!. This review is overdue... Bottom line - FABULOUS!!!We read about Buenos Tours on Trip Advisor and we are so happy we booked with them.When you go to Buenos Aires, do yourself a favor and book an amazing tour with Buenos Tours before you go. We booked a private tour. Ask to have a full day escorted tour of the city. Guides are fluent in Spanish and in your language. Our guide was Ceri (pronounced as Kerry) and if the other guides with Buenos Tours are half as great as he is, you are in for a great time. With Ceri we felt like we had made a new friend! We did this "cab/bus/walk around" on a cruise day in port (last day before officially getting off the ship), and it gave us a great feel for this beautiful city and we were completely comfortable to go back to many of those places on our own after the cruise. Not only will you see the different neighborhoods, but also you will get to meet fascinating people of Buenos Aires as you tour the neighborhoods: like a wonderful lady who sells wines in San Telmo, the shopkeepers in the local food gallerias, along with various people you will meet along the street. We wanted to go to Boca and that is where our day began. You'll see the Recoleta neighborhood and its tree lined streets and park where you can learn to Tango. You will see the Casa Rosada (and if lucky changing of the guards) and the incredible cathedral across the street - where the guards from Casa Rosada also stand guard, a bookstore that used to be an opera house, and then you can taste the creamy gelato flavors in one of the fabulous ice cream stores. Want another treat? Go to lunch with your guide at the Café Tortoni, a Buenos Aires fixture for over 100 years (where you can also book reservations for a Tango Show that will not rip you off.) And who knew a cemetery could be so fascinating? Recommendations for dinner? Just ask. No pressure, no hard sell - just honest answers. My husband and I went to a recommended San Telmo parilla for dinner --and experienced a steak you could cut with a spoon, done just right, along with salad and a huge slice of grilled provolone -- all for less than $US40. Ceri knew all of the best places to shop -- without pressuring you to buy anything. They just tell you where the best shops and values are for what you are interested in. My husband bought a beautiful handmade reversible leather jacket (suede on one side, smooth leather on the other) for a fraction of what we would have paid outside Argentina. Whether you are going for a long weekend or for an extended stay, Buenos Tours will give you a great exposure to the neighborhoods, the people and a list of places to see and things to do. Ceri gave us great advice on money. We would have never thought to do this - write your initials on currency to make sure you don't get ripped off in stores, restaurants, cafes, taxis, others who might claim you gave them "invalid/old currency". And how to take a taxi. He also gave us great advice on what not to carry (big purse, big backpack) when waking around by ourselves. And not to carry a camera over your neck, an iPad in your hands or anything that someone could easily grab. Thanks to Ceri - we had a fabulous first day in Buenos Aires. And his advice carried us thru...

Excellent Choice. Based on very positive reviews of this company, we decided to book a private tour. Indeed this company displayed all the way from the booking a very professional attitude prompt reply and good recommendations regarding the intermarry (Justine from the office). We were given Jessica as a guide, who made this day in Buenos Aires the most unforgettable one! This energetic guide possess such a wide range of knowledge,about Argentinean history which she presented in a very vivid and interesting way , she knew a lot about Soccer , Jewish world, food, economics culture and more , so interesting . The all-day Buenos Aires tour (Including La Boca!) is a must!

Pre Arranged Tours. We would highly recommend Buenos Tours if you are looking to get the best out of your trip to Buenos Aires. We booked 2 Tours, 1. to a Groucho Ranch for horse riding BBQ, horse skills and a beautiful small town. 2nd was a 7 hour private tour with our own guide and driver. This meant that we could go where we wanted and at our own pace. They were very professional and kept in touch by email up until pickup at our hotel.

Informative and fun tour!!. My husband and I had an amazing overall experience with BuenosTours! To start, I sent an inquiry only 36 hours before we wanted to take a tour, and they we able to accommodate us with a special time frame so that we could make our flight home. The folks who handle booking via email are incredibly responsive and helpful. They worked with us to design a tour that would meet our time requirements and allow us to see the places we had in mind. They even sent us photos of our driver and our tour guide so that we would be prepared to meet them.Our driver, Nick, was very friendly and knowledgeable about Buenos Aires...wish we could have spent more time with him! Our tour guide, Ceri, was wonderfully funny, personable, and intelligent. The entire time we spent with Ceri he had us thinking deeply about history and current social issues while also laughing hysterically with his sarcastic sense of humor. He was an absolute wealth of knowledge about the city, and particularly knowledgeable about Recoleta Cemetery. Touring the Cemetery with Ceri allowed us to experience so much more than we would have if we visited on our own. Ceri gave us a comprehensive history of the Cemetery and was able to point out unique architectural details that we certainly would have overlooked on our own. Ceri was also very cognizant of our interests while on the tour, and frequently checked in to make sure we weren't feeling overwhelmed by information. Spending the afternoon on tour with him was like exploring the city with an extremely knowledgeable good friend. I wish we were in town longer so we could have taken additional walking tours with BuenosTours!

If you do only 1 thing in Buenos Aires... Do this. I went for a walking tour of Buenos Aires in May 2015 with Ceri, one of the brilliant tour guides from BuenosTours on my first full day in Buenos Aires.This was the smartest thing that I could have done, as it gave me the information and confidence to navigate many neighbourhoods in the city by myself for the rest of my trip.Ceri not only provided an entertaining and informative tour, he customized it entirely for me to make sure I saw the places that made sense to go with someone else, and essentially street-proofed me so I had a good idea where I could go alone and what I could do in Buenos Aires, and what was "normal" for BA.We visited La Boca, the Recoleta, San Telmo, and several other areas during our day. He showed me some good places for food and coffee, and ice cream, of course.It was so much fun and a highlight of my trip. Ceri is also a really funny guy, and a pleasure to travel with.During the remainder of my trip I took Ceri's advice, and I had a fantastic time. I went many places along, visited great neighbourhoods, and took reasonable precautions based on his advice. I also had a good idea of where to spend my time, what to eat, and because of that I was able to pack a lot of great experiences into my trip.I highly recommend that anyone who is going to Buenos Aires for the first time to go on a good walking tour with a knowledgeable guide and do not be shy to ask for advice and street proofing. It will save you so much time and prepare you for a wonderful trip in a beautiful, unique city.Thank you Ceri and Justine!

Really informative and enjoyable. We had Jack as our guide and we enjoyed our city-centre tour the first day so much that we booked a second half day tour with Jack of San Telmo and La Boca for the next day. We enjoyed the second tour even more and really loved the San Telmo area. We also did the San Telmo tour starting about 4pm which was great as the heat of the day was over. We had our two children with us aged 12 and 14 and even our 14 year loved the tour! The tour is a really great place to start when you arrive in BA for the first time as it gives you an orientation and feel for the city. Jack is a history major and we really enjoyed learning about the history of Argentina and it made us want to learn more about this intriguing country. Jack also brought us on the subway and on a bus ride which was very helpful and gave us more confidence in moving about the city. These tours were definitely one of the highlights of our wonderful holiday in Argentina. The only negative was that we had to book a private tour because of the children but it turned out to be a positive!.

Awesome, must do.. Our tour guide was Jack and he was awesome. We did the tour on March 21st 2016. There were 3 of us and only had 1 day to spare during a work trip and said we wanted to see everything. I had email correspondence prior to our trip to give an indication of what we would like to see and to get advice on restaurants and shopping, all advice was spot on and we really appreciated the time Jack took even before our tour which resulted in giving the best experience we could have. We did the full day private walking tour adding La Boca and hotel drop off. Even though it was a full day, the time flew. We didn’t realise how far we had actually walked and were sad when the tour ended. We had so much fun and cannot speak highly enough of Jack who understood our personalities and what we would enjoy. If I get to go back to Buenos Aires I would do this tour again, (and request Jack!) we had so much fun.

Like being show the city by a close friend who lives there. Our tour,guide was Jessica, who moved to BA about eight years ago from New Jersey and appears to have absorbed everything there is to know about this very interesting tourist destination. Or, as we put it in an email to BuenosTours, "Jessica ruined our vacation. We had six or seven private tour guides in an assortment of South American cities following our two days with Jessica--and none of them lived up to her level of cordial, informed professionalism.

Historical walking tour of San Telmo and Monserrat. Richard was wonderful. Interesting, native English speaker, spent a lot of time with us, introduced us to many local vendors. He imparted a lot of information about the area's history and culture.

One of the Best walking tours I've ever experienced!!. Where do I start?! I booked with BuenosTours after reading the fabulous reviews on Trip Advisor. Our expectations were far exceeded. Jessica was our guide for an 8 hr walking tour. Jessica met us at our hotel in La Recoleta and from there we proceeded to visit 5 different neighborhoods in Buenos Aires, including San Telmo, San Cristobal, Barracas and Constitution. Jessica was literally a walking history book! She explained the history of of the areas we were in, including fun facts and memorable dates. She was extremely well versed in the politics, history and culture of Argentina and South America. Jessica took us to places only locals would know, and made us feel so welcome. I could go on and on! Because of her, we had an unbelievable first day in BA. She and Justine (who was so wonderful to work with via email!) even took the time to email me places to go our next two days. BuenosTours is extremely affordable and an absolute must-book if visiting BA. Justine also arranged a driver (Nick) to pick us up at the cruise terminal and take us to our hotel, as well as a transfer to the airport. I highly recommend BuenosTours as one of the best tour agencies I have ever booked with. If we return to BA, we will definitely use them again!

Recoleta Walking Tour. We were guided by Oliver through Recoleta and neighbouring areas; the tour was very informative, well organised and enjoyable and Oliver is an excellent tour guide. We can highly recommend this agency. Guy and Caitlyn Baxter, South Africa

Lovely day in Buenos Aires. Nine hours and seven miles with Ceri (the name is Welsh.) Good conversation and the highlights of the city from La Boca to Recoleta. Saw places we wanted to revisit - and we did. Pointed to a great Parilla which we would not have found on our own - La Brigada, and to the terrace at the Park Hyatt for wine at midnight, and the amazing market on Sunday in San Telmo, and of course lunch at Gran Cafe Tortoni. We spent three days in BA (after seeing Patagonia with Mountain Travel Sobek - also outstanding and amazing) and saw and learned more thanks to spending the first day with Ceri of BuenosTours.
Great tours. We really enjoyed our tours. Our guide, Don did a great job. We went at our own pace and we had a wonderful time.
Full day private walking tour. The guide, Jessica, was nice and knowledgable. Excellent way to get to see the city on our first day there.
