We were actually able to go into the Pink House, and Jessica was able to tell me information about the current government as well as the history of the military state in Argentina, the Perons, and protests that often occur in the square.We then had a perfectly timed coffee stop and I followed Jessica's recommendation of getting Chocolate y Churros. Delicious! During our coffee break, Jessica was able to fill me in on the cafe culture within Buenos Aires, some of the artistic history, and current Argentine's views on their place within the world. After a nice break, we continued our walk, hopped a bus (a great experience most tourists don't get) and headed into some of the upscale, northern parts of the city. Wow are these houses gorgeous. We stopped for lunch and once again I followed Jessica's recommendation of getting empanadas that I washed down with a delicious house Malbec (I am in Argentina after all). At this point, we ran into another one on one tour from BuenosTours which seemed to be having just as much fun as us, so we decided to join together to finish the tour at the Recolata Cemetery.This place gorgeous! Both guides had amazing stories to tell about the different people buried there, pointed out details on some of the structures I would never notice, and provided a laugh (or many) along the way as well. They were right, that this Cemetary doesn't feel like a place of death but more like a celebration of life.We ended our tour with an ice cream and a good bye near my hotel. I was sad to say goodbye to Jessica as I had such a relaxed and fun time with her and felt that I probably only had the time to crack the tip of her knowledge about this amazing city.Overall, this was an unbelievable experience from my initial inquiry with Justine until the end of the tour. Jessica was so knowledgeable and able to relate that knowledge in an accessible way, tailored the tour to my interests, and really made me feel like a part of this city, all while creating an informal enough environment that it felt just like chilling with a friend. Justine (who I believe is a lot of the organization around the business) was also extremely helpful, responsive, knowledgeable, and eager to make sure my experience was amazing. All of this with only two days notice!My one regret is that I will not get to spend more time in this amazing city. I would say to anyone, skip the group tours, skip the bus tours, and take the time to do BuenosTours - it was an excellent day! I can't say thank you enough to Jessica and Justine!
Excellent. Excellent tour. Our guide Don was very knowledgeable, affable andhelpful. We were given insights into BA that we would not haveotherwise been able to gain. Highly recommended. Thank you!

Excellent introduction to the city.. 8 hour walking tour of the city with Ceri, who showed us many of the charms (well known and hidden) of Buenos Aires. Would recommend this to tour to anyone who does not mind walking.Also a great introduction to some of the history of the city.Ceri also gave us excellent advise as to areas to explore on our own during the rest of our stay.

Wonderful way to tour Buenos Aires. After reviewing their informative and thorough website, we chose the all-day tour as we wanted to see the city "up close" not from a bus window. The tour and our guide Don were amazing - a highlight of our trip. He met us at our hotel .. it was like having a personal friend show you around his city. We loved La Boca, the history of Buenos Aires we learned, the chance to stop and photograph whenever we wanted, and the chance to ask every question we could think of. It was a close up look at a city with one who lived there and could share so much of his expertise.I needn't have worried about walking all day, as we didn't! During the day we took taxis, bus, & subway at opportune moments and there were refreshment, lunch stops as well. We also had input throughout the day on what WE would like to do/see next. This was the first full day of our trip to South America where we cruised around Cape Horn, and we both voted the Buenos Aires tour as the best part of the entire 2 weeks.

A dazzling introduction to an amazing city. My husband and I spent a wonderful, informative, and fun day with our guide Ceri in late March. His knowledge of his city went way beyond what you read in guidebooks; he was able to impart the feel of each neighborhood we visited and what gives each area its distinctive identity. A gifted storyteller, Ceri made each place we visited memorable by providing insight into the history and people who made it what it is today. His love of Buenos Aires was contagious. Though this tour came at the beginning of a three week trip that took us up the coast via Uruguay and southern Brazil to Rio, it is still the highlight of the whole trip, thanks to Ceri. Buenos Tours isn't the cheapest way to see Buenos Aires, but it sure is the best. Worth every peso!

Team Ceri!. Excellent walking tour with a very patient man who wrangled and charmed four giggling ladies through the streets of San Telmo. We even requested Ceri for a second day to see Recoleta cemetery because we had such a good time chatting and laughing with him.Ceri is so genuine in his appreciation for the city, its history and people (and dogs) that he made our first trip to Buenos Aires really memorable and special. Highly recommend booking with Buenos Tours -- you'll learn more to love about a fascinating city

Great city, great tour, great guide. We visetend Buenos Aires during our cruise of South America which lasted 10 weeks and our visit to BA was one of the highlights of our visit. All communication with the company before our visit went really well but there does seem to be a bit of a turnover in staff so there were a couple of changes to our name guide before we went. We also felt we were bombarded with too much information. Maybe that's a British thing? However that should not detract from the fact our guide, Jack, was excellent - warm, friendly and knowledgeable. He was unstinting of his time, and tweaked the tour exactly to fit in with our requests. We loved the included rip on the subway and also the fact he was so helpful in helping us find a place to change our currency. He also answered all our questions quite happily and gave us fantastic advice with our plans for the rest of the day after we left him and for our second day in BA. Great guy, great tour.

Walking Tour. Booked a walking tour with Ceri prior to leaving UK. We could only do one afternoon and when investigated on line the tour showed no availability. We mailed Benostours to request a late booking, within 30 minutes we had a reply in the affirmative, along with details and even a photo of Ceri. Payment was simple as was mailing our expectations,age, walking ability, great attention to detail is Buenostours forte'. Ceri met us at our hotel and we were taken on an extremely comprehensive, informative and enjoyable walking tour of A great deal of Buenos Aires. Thanks Ceri for the cup of coffee you treated us to at Tortinos,we never had a better one anywhere in South America. Thanks also for you restaurant recommendation for our evening meal, brilliant.and also for the extra two hours on our tour at no extra cost. If you are looking for a walking tour of Buenos Aires, look no further than Buenostours, they lead others follow, so glad we found them.

Fascinating. This was the most amazing cemetery we have walked through. We saw mausoleums throughout, many dating centuries ago. We even had a picture in front of Evita's marked grave. There was incredible history here with many markers to read and ponder. Most are in Spanish so if you are not fluent you can use your translater app on your phone to get the feel of the history. The church attached to the cemetery was beautiful and it is very worth going to the top to take in the view of the city.

Walking through La Boca and San Telmo. My husband and I with two other friends enjoyed a walking tour with Jessica through the old areas of La Boca and Sal Telmo. Although we had toured these areas two years ago, Jessica offered a new and historical perspective.. We walked through the colorful area of La Boca listening to tango music, viewing some tango dancers and learning the history of tango and especially about Carlos Gardel. We then boarded a bus for San Telmo, visiting a very old café and drinking a local beer, walking the streets and visiting the old market and plaza. Jessica was very knowledgeable about the areas. Walking is the best way to learn about this very unique part of Buenos Aires.

Buenos Aires with a fascinating guide!!!. Took the all day tour with Ceri, a man of many layers. Better than any old tour-we saw all of the sights but with a running commentary-history interspersed with philosophy. So many great stories that at times they seemed somewhat unbelievable however when we returned to the casa did an internet check and all of them were true. A great day-coffee extraordinaire, steak and FF for lunch in a workingman's diner, ice cream-all in different parts of the city. It was fantastic!! Gracias for a wonderful intro to this fine city.

A Great Taste of Buenos Aires. I was in Buenos Aires for a couple of days and wanted a quick and personal introduction to the city. I met my guide, Richard, at my hotel and we spent 3 hours or so mostly in San Telmo and it was great getting a feel for the city with someone so knowledgeable. Setting up the tour was easy using the website and email and the outfit was flexible and willing to accommodate my late arrival. I would recommend BuenosTours to anyone.

Walk, Taxi, City Bus, Private Guide.... We spent most of a day with our guide, Ceri, touring Buenos Aires and learning the history and culture. We were able to see several areas of the city on foot, Ceri took us on the bus and by taxi at times, we had a super lunch at a restaurant filled with local people, saw the tourist places and the ordinary places, big streets and back alleys. The cost was reasonable, and booking easy. Ceri also gave us some more places to visit on our own the next day, which we also enjoyed. A great city and a great tour...

Great way to explore Buenos Aires. We were in BA for a family trip over Easter and booked 3 half day walking tours with Buenos Tours based on previous good reviews. We can absolutely say that is was full value for money and a great and relaxed way to explore the city on foot. Our guide (Richard) was both very knowledgeable and friendly but also had a great way of showing things of interest for our two young boys. We were picked up at our apartment by the designated driver ahead of each tour and driven to meet the guide. It all worked very well and allowed us to see parts of the city we would otherwise never have found by ourselves. Can fully recommend Buenos Tours.
Great Walking Tour - BOOK WAY AHEAD!. A top-notch outfit with the greatest guides for a fun walking tour. Ceri kept us engaged for hours and hours. Price is very reasonable.

Touring Buenos Aires. We did several tours of Buenos Aires with BuenosTours while visiting Dec 2014. I found their website to be very useful and arranging tours via internet to be both easy and, because we told them a little about ourselves and our interests, productive. Our guide, Richard, was a native English speaker with an incredible knowledge of the history, architecture and culture of Buenos Aires. He tailored the tours to our interests.I would highly recommend them to anyone.

Buenos Aires full day City Tour (walking). After much research prior to our arrival in Buenos Aires, I selected Buenos Tours as the "go to" organization for a tour of the city. I then reviewed the biographys' of their tour guides. For a party of 4 persons, we selected Jessica for our tour in late February of 2015. In short, she exceeded our expectations on every count. She was simply delightful and so knowledgeable of the city's history and architecture. Her tour stops were so well thought out. In our 5 weeks in South America, her tour was one of our two best. P.S. If your from the USA, there is no language barrier as Jessica is an expatriate from New Jersey with graduate work in Buenos Aires universities. Thank you Jessica. Also, the support staff at their office was terrific.

The best way to enjoy your visit to Buenos Aires. We were lucky enough to come across the BuenosTours website before our planned visit to BA in December 2014. We booked two separate half day tours and enjoyed every minute of both. Our first tour with our fabulous tour guide Jessica gave us an introduction to the city, a great history lesson and an understanding of the best way to take advantage and enjoy all the things the city had to offer. Our second tour was of Recoleta cemetery and was the highlight of the trip. The tours offered were exactly as described and allowed us to get a real feel for the city while at the same time feeling very confident to explore on our own. Jessica gave us tips on travelling on the subway and many other invaluable bits of information on how to get around the city. Jessica was a wonderful guide but the tour almost felt that we were being taken around by an old friend. Thank you BuenosTours for a fabulous trip and great memories of exploring BA.

Wonderful Day Walking tour of Buenos Aires. My wife and two college aged sons were in Buenos Aires for three days, and spent one on a walking tour with Ceri (from mid morning to early evening, over lunch and cocktails at the end of the day). We were always on the go, although the walking was not taxing. We visited several different parts of the city - neighborhoods, monuments, churches, historical sites. Ceri knew a lot about Argentine history, current cultural, politics, art and more. The day was a highlight of our three week trip through S America. He was one of the two or three best guides I have ever been with - knowledgeable, engaging, provocative, fun, and totally interested in enhancing our appreciation of BA. Each of the four of us - with very different personalities and interests - think back on our day with him as absolutely terrific. That is quite an accomplishment. I could not recommend Ceri more highly.

Ceri is AMAZING!. Hands down the best walking tour of my Central & South America trip! Ceri was such a great guide to the city! You can really tell how much he loves the place. It was pouring rain on the day of our tour so he adapted it for us to stay out of the rain as much as possible. He had so such practical and interesting information to impart, I just cant recommend him highly enough! As well as the sight seeing, he brought us to a fabulous wine shop (so good we returned later in the trip to get more wine), introduced us to the gluten free doughbut shaped snacks they sell on the street of BA (delicious but can't remember what they're called chappi or something like that?), brought us for the best value steak we had in the whole trip (like ridiculously good value!) and then brought us to a milonga to watch the locals dancing the most amazing authentic tango (way better than the cabarets). Do this tour and ask for Ceri (pronounced Kerry). He is a LEGEND!

do this tour! it was SO worth it!. our tour guide was Richard…. not sure if all of Buenos tour's guides are this good -- but he was just terrific. he has a real passion for the city, and for it's history and architecture. he speaks completely fluent english and spanish, so he makes the city make sense - as well as can translate everything to you and for you. but the best part -- he will show you some little nooks and crannies that you wouldn't see on your own! he was worth every cent! we are so glad we did this on day 1 of our stay, it gave us a great overview of the whole city. SUPER!

An Excellent In-Depth Tour of San Telmo. My wife and I have traveled with private guides in Egypt, Southern Africa, East Africa, Myanmar, and Australia. In each case the guide enriched our experience considerably. Because my wife is a very serious amateur photographer, we signed up for a half day tour with BuenosTours with an emphasis on photography.BuenosTours set us up for a Sunday morning tour with Richard Shpuntoff, who is both a guide and a video maker. We exchanged several e-mails with Richard before the tour, so that he could plan an itinerary. When Richard learned that we had had a pretty comprehensive private tour two days earlier, he proposed that we explore San Telmo — where he lives and works — in depth.The tour was excellent. It gave us a much better sense of San Telmo than we would have gotten exploring the area by ourselves. Richard generously invited us to see his studio, where he produces videos, and took us to his favorite coffee shop.Richard is an expatriate American who moved to BA in 2002, when he married an Argentine. Thus, it was quite interesting to get his perspectives on Argentinean culture and politics. We enjoyed getting to know Richard, as well as seeing San Telmo.At a cost of US$130 plus tip for two people, the tour was a bargain.PS. Kudos to the BuenosTours website for alerting us to the Argentine Reciprocity Entry Fee.

A walking tour of central Buenos Aires. The day we arrived in Buenos Aires we felt overwhelmed by the intensity and hugeness of the city and quickly realized that an orientation by an expert was in order. With one day's notice - lucky us! - BuenosTours found us an excellent guide, Ceri Foster, who completely adapted his tour to meet our needs. They also arranged for a driver to pick us up because our timeline on the day of the tour was tight. Ceri has a wealth of information, which he adeptly embedded in "Buenos Aires lessons" - how to use public transportation, how to stay safe and how to find the beauty of the city inside of courtyards and buildings which we otherwise wouldn't have noticed. Our afternoon with BuenosTours really got us off on the right foot!

The Best Way to Tour Buenos Aires. We had 3 days to visit Buenos Aires prior to departing for Patagonia. Lucky for us we found Buenos Tours. We booked two full day walking tours of Buenos Aires (South half one day and North the other day). In addition we booked a tour of Colonia del Sacramento in Uruguay. The tour guides met us at our hotel each day. Jessica took us to many places in BA which we would otherwise have never visited. She was a wealth of knowledge on the history and culture of the city. She tailored the pace of the tour to our individual needs and knew exactly when breaks were in order. She was wonderful. When we expressed an interest in attending a tango show at Cafe Tortoni when we returned from Patagonia, Jessica purchased tickets for us while we were gone and they were waiting for us at our hotel upon our return to BA. She definitely went above and beyond!Oliver was our guide to Colonia. He made all the arrangements for the ferry to and from Colonia. His knowledge of Colonia's history and geographic significance was spot on. He reviewed the history of the regional drink Yerba Mate, and was our cebador (server) as we sampled the drink. Best of all he knew where the best ice cream in town could be found.We would strongly recommend Buenos Tours to anyone looking for a reliable, knowledgeable, and friendly tour of Buenos Aires and the surrounding area.Bud Oliveira

Essential! A brilliant introduction to the city. BA has a complex history. It's also huge and there's a great deal to see - especially if you like interesting architecture. We had a whole day walking tour with Ceri (driving in between highlights), and it was worth every penny. He was very knowledgeable and clearly loves his adopted city. Do it! (and take lots of US dollars).

The best part of our trip!. The walking tour of Buenos Aires was one of the highlights of our trip. We learned to love the city even more and our guide was beyond excellent!! The tour of the Recoleta was amazing and his knowledge was outstanding. I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting and definitely do the all day tour. They were also very accommodating in helping me find a cooking class that was incredible and recommended the best restaurant we went to.

The Thrill of it All. We had 3 different walking tours with Richard, Jack and Oliver, in late February. What a wonderful way to experience this exciting and varied city. My husband has a cane and the tours were paced so well for us, although nothing stopped us from seeing everything we wanted to. We loved the neighborhoods, the wall art, the new understanding of how people spend their time. And a special shout out to Richard and his Photo Tour. If you can take this with him, you will experience walking tour heaven. We even got to see where Borges worked as a librarian so many years. GM from Brooklyn

Excellent tour and delightful tour guides. I found this tour company name in my Lonely Planet book on Buenos Aires. I subsequently did some research on Trip Advisor and booked through email the half day walking tour City Center and San Telmo tour with Jack and another half day Recoleta/Retiro tour with Jessica. These two guides were excellent, both American and with loud clear voices for my partially deaf father-in-law who accompanied us on this trip. My husband enjoys discussing politics and history and both Jack and Jessica provided lively discussions. Smart people who know their stuff! The tour company provided detailed instructions on pickup times and provided a driver for our first day tour to meet Jack. The price was very reasonable for a private tour, which to me is the way to go in a big city. I can't say enough good things about this group. Just book and you will not regret it!

Fantastic from start to finish!. Buenos Tours were brilliant. Justine patiently crafted two day tours for us and tweeked timings and content to fit exactly what we wanted to do. Jessica, our guide was excellent, really easy to get along with, and so passionate about Buenos Aires, but also honest and frank with any questions we had. We loved all the little food stops along the way, she very quickly grasped that we wanted to eat as the locals would and took us to some great little spots that we probably would not have gone to on our own. We covered so much ground in two days and we felt like we spent the days with a friend showing us around their city rather than just a tour guide! We also booked tickets for the Piazolli Tango Show through Buenos Tours and it was a high quality show with excellent food. Highly recommended!

Best way to experience the richness of Buenos Aires !. I can't speak highly enough of our guide Ceri, and this tour company. We arranged a all day personal tour for 2. The day of the tour, there were downpours all day and we were offered the opportunity to reschedule or proceed-completely our choice. We went for it and our guide was a real trooper- we had a full day's adventure that will stay with us forever. Ceri (by birth Canadian-English) was an amazing raconteur and shared so many insights into life in Buenos Aires that we could never have gotten. He led us around the city much more efficiently than we could have on our own (taxi, bus, and foot) and took us to some small markets, shops, cafes and no tourist traps that we would never have found on our own. We are very independent travellers- plan everything ourselves and one of us is fluent in Spanish so we would have been fine seeing Buenos Aires on our own- BUT we would never have had such a rich experience. This will stay with us forever. I would (and do) recommend this tour to anyone who has the chance. They tailor the tour to your specific interests. If you are spending several days in Buenos Aires, I highly recommend arranging a half- or full day tour for your first day with BurnosTours- it is not to be missed and it serves as a great orientation for the rest of your stay.

Above & Beyond!. We booked two separate tours, the all day walking tour & a day trip to Uruguay. Our flight was delayed and we weren't going to be there in time to make our walking tour departure and they split it into two parts so that we could still enjoy the full tour! Everything was simply outstanding! The guides are very knowledgeable, articulate, entertaining and engaging. Highly recommend both tours!

A custom Touring Experience Nonpareil!. I cannot say enough good things about BuenosTours and its Chief, Alan. My wife and I are seasoned global travelers who only want to take private tours with our own guides and drivers. Boy, did we find the right agency! This was our very first visit to South America. We were spending three nights in Buenos Aires before going on an Oceania cruise. Ever since my first contact with Alan, he was thorough and tireless in giving me advice and direction in designing a tour just for us and on things like money exchange, transportation, safety,...He was a remarkably responsive e-mailer even under heavy workload. I felt like our tour started days before we set foot in the city. Alan arranged an excellent VIP Tango dinner-show for us on the first night. On the second day, we had an in-depth tour of the city with Ceri, a multi-talented Canadian expat who was very much into the history and architecture of the city. Even our warm and enthusiastic driver, Gilbert, could easily serve as a guide himself. The following day we had an exciting cruise on River Tigre in a private boat with Oliver who is a conscientious and delightful American expat. What sets BuenosTours apart from many other tour agencies is that their staff are flexible and proficient in communicating with foreign visitors. At the end of my tours with them, I fancied taking a couple of BuenosTours guides with me to the other ports of call!

Great Introduction to Buenos Aires and the history of Argentina. BuenosTours made our introduction to Argentina incredibly easy and entertaining. They arranged to have a driver (Chris) pick us up at the airport (me, wife, son and son's friend) and take us to our hotel in Palermo for a quick change, and then to meet Ceri, our tour guide for the day. Ceri was incredible. Friendly, knowledgeable, funny, a native English speaker: the whole package. We began by touring the Recoleta Cemetary, where Ceri used the identity of the famous dead as a backdrop for a lesson in Argentine history. After a lunch of enpanadas and beer, we continued our tour through the area, to Alvear avenue by the perfume shop Fuegia and the Park Hyatt and Vatican Embassy. We passed the Brazilian and French Embassy before crossing the 9th of July Avenue. In Retiro we walked through the Plaza San Martin, saw the Anchorena building, Kavanaugh building and the Paz palace, before taking the subway from San Martin to Av de Mayo. We had coffee at the Cafe Tortoni, visited the national cathedral, talked about the Mavinas/Falklands, saw the Pink Palace and walked down Defensa to the Franciscan church, walked by the Puerto Rico church, the Avila bookstore and the Jesuit church by the Roca statue. We then walked up the Av de mayo, crossing the 9th of July. We saw the Palacio Barolo and the Hotel Chile (art nouveau) and then to Rodin's the Thinker in the plaza de Congreso until we stopped by the congreso and the confiteria molino. By this time, it was time to return to the hotel and get ready for a tango show, all of us feeling like we had learned a ton about this new and fascinating city. I can't imagine a better introduction.

Wouldn't have done a thing differently.. We had a marvelous day with Don. His North Carolina accent didn't bother us at all and I'm quite certain he knows more Buenos Aires history than many of the residents. What a fact filled but fun time we had. I wish we could have spent even more time with him, but alas the ship was calling. Having a local along to help us with transportation and local currency was a real help. Highly recommend this company, and especially Don.

Worth every penny!. We booked the full day walking tour for our first full day in BA and I'd recommend any other first time traveler to the city do the same. Our guide, Jessica, was full of energy and knowledge and enthusiasm. She gave us a terrific overview of the history and people of BA and we saw so many things I can't begin to list them all. Needless to say by the end of the tour we felt we'd seen many aspects of the city and felt much more comfortable heading out and about on our own for the remainder of our stay. We were also given a number of recommendations for places to see, eat, etc and none of them disappointed!Jessica pointed out so many neat things and taught us a lot about the city but it always felt relaxed, like we were with a friend. I know I peppered her with a million questions and her depth of knowledge was superb. We felt this tour was worth every penny.

Private walking tour. My husband and I had a 5 hr private walking tour with Don, it was really great. Don was very accommodating and informative. His knowledge of the area is extensive and he gave us a very good overview of BA we were only there for the one day and we certianly got the tour of a life time. Thanks Don you were great.......

Perfect Introduction to the city. Our full day walking tour with Jesssica was the perfect way to get introduced to the different Buenos Aires neighborhoods and key sights. We started in San Telmo and ended our tour in Recoletta. This really helped us the next few days as we re- visited some of the neighborhoods. Jessica is a font of knowledge. We would definitely recommend this tour on your first day in BA!

Excellent Historical City Centre tour - Definitely Recommend!. My husband and I did a half day walking tour of Buenos Aires with Don of Buenos Tours on Feb 27, 2015. We had just flown overnight from Dallas and felt like this would be a good way to see the city (otherwise we would have just gone to the hotel and slept). We are so glad we found out about Buenos Tours from Cruise Critic because we had a wonderful time with Don! He is an excellent guide and gave us insight into both the history and the customs in the city. The "walking" is not strenuous but is the perfect way to get a feel for the city. His restaurant recommendations were spot on as was his guidance on exchanging currency at the best rate.Buenos Tours was easy to work with and we were able to set it up by email before we left home. We would definitely recommend Buenos Tours and Don!

Wonderful introduction to the city. We had a great one-day tour (including Boca) with Ceri. It was a wonderful introduction to the city, which we'd never visited before. Ceri was very knowledgeable and personable, and he made a real effort to tailor the day to our interests and provide useful information, not just about tourist sites but also about practical matters for navigating the city on our own. We were also extremely impressed with the efficiency and responsiveness of BuenosTours. We booked the tour at the last minute (sending an email on Sunday to request a Monday tour) and almost immediately heard back from Justine, who managed to arrange a tour and answer all our questions within just an hour or so. I am very grateful for her diligence--I never expected to be able to book such an excellent tour without more advance notice. We were very fortunate to encounter both Justine (by email) and Ceri (in person).

What a day!. The information given by Buenostours on their website and in emails was and is just great.
We did a tour with Oliver while in Buenos Aires on Celebrity Infinity.
He was entertaining, very informative, managed our time perfectly... we could not have had a better day!
Thank you Buenostours!!!

Great Day in Buenos Aires!. We did a half day tour of La Boca and San Telmo with Jack. Great introduction to the city and Jack had a lot of great information to share, really seemed to know his stuff. Highly recommended, I enjoyed the private tour format felt like we really got to appreciate the places we saw.

Great walking tours. We booked two private walking tours of BA. One to Recoleta and Retiro with Richard and the other to La Boca and San Telmo with Quincy. Both Richard and Quincy were extremely knowledgable about Buenos Aires and Argentina and happy to answer all our questions. As well as showing us around, both of them shared personal information about life in Buenos Aires. We really enjoyed the time we spent with both of them. The booking process was easy and we were met at our hotel. I would recommend Buenos Tours to any visitor to Buenos Aires.

Definitely would recommend this experience. Our group had two half-day tours with Richard. He was VERY knowledgeable, and he geared our tours to what he knew we would be interested in. He gave us information about the history, the culture, what it's like to live in Buenos Aires, and took us to local cafes and restaurants that we would not have known about otherwise. He recommended a fabulous restaurant for our group for dinner. Our original plans got changed because of flight issues, and he worked with us to make sure we still had a great experience. ABSOLUTELY would recommend Buenos Tours and Richard!

Great way to see BA!. I booked the full day walking tour after seeing all of the positive reviews on TripAdvisor, and I am glad a did! With a limited time in Buenos Aires, this tour was a great way to see the city and experience all the highlights with a knowledgeable and friendly guide. It felt more like I was visiting the city with a friend than it did a rigid guided tour. I would recommend Buenos Aires tours to anyone traveling to Buenos Aires!

A brilliant day with Ceri !!. We went a day early to BA before going of on a cruise to learn more about the city. Booking was very simple and efficient via the internet and arrangements for collection from our hotel were clearly defined. Ceri our guide arrived exactly on time and took us on our tour of a wonderful atmospheric city. He was personable, very knowledgeable and had an obvious passion for the city. We had a comprehensive tour and Ceri was very easy to talk to and to listen to as we visited all the districts. It was obvious that tours can be tailor made to your particular interests.We would not hesitate to recommend this company and specially Ceri as an excellent guide.

Places most tourists don't get to see. My husband and I were on a cruise in South America that started in Buenos Aires and were looking for some sort of private walking tour we could do with a guide. Our guide, Jack, was a young man from the US who had been living there for 2 years. He was a great guide and took us to places we would not have seen on our own and I highly recommend him--he spoke fluent Spanish and was very knowledgeable about all the places he took us to. We did the four-hour tour and that was a perfect amount of time. We even stopped for coffee and to rest in the oldest cafe in town that was simply beautiful.

A little disappointed.... Our initial contact with BuenosTours was excellent: they responded quickly and professionally. We explained via e-mail that we only had one afternoon in BA and said we were specifically interested in Recoleta Cemetery and having lunch at Café Tortoni. Based on the great response, we booked our private, half-day tour. During the booking process, we also mentioned we were specifically interested in Recoleta Cemetery and having lunch at Café Tortoni, as well as our need to be back at our hotel by 5pm that day.Our guide met us at our hotel on-time and was a very nice guy. However, when he went over what we would be doing on our tour, we were surprised that we were not going to Recoleta until the end of the tour, but assumed he knew best.Throughout the tour, we did mention a couple of times how Recoleta Cemetery was a focal point of our visit... but as time went on, we finally had to come right out and ask him if we could go to the Cemetery without doing the rest of his tour first. He seemed almost upset about that, saying we'd have time to do all the tour and Recoleta and be done by 5pm. We reiterated that we needed to be AT the hotel by 5pm (and not done the tour by 5pm) and insisted we go straight to the Cemetery at that point, which we did.However, by the time we got to the Cemetery, we did NOT have enough time there (about a half hour). We definitely wished we had more time there, and were disappointed that we did not... and then had to rush to our hotel by taxi to be there by 5pm.Don't get us wrong, we enjoyed our tour and got to see a lot of BA and were given a lot of information, but... we booked a PRIVATE tour with specific requirements and in the end felt that it was our guide's tour and not "our" tour, customized to us.Our recommendation would to be to use BuenosTours, but if you have specific requirements, make sure they will be met. In hindsight, we should have insisted we start at the Cemetery so that we could have spent all the time we wanted to there, and then done as much of the other part of the tour that time permitted (not the other way around).

Another great review!. We truly enjoyed our half- and full-day tours with Jessica in Buenos Aires. She was personable, informative, and flexible. Correspondence with the company was also excellent. I highly recommend this company to all visitors, and thank our friends at tripadvisor for steering us in the right direction!

Great tour and overview of Buenos Aires!. My husband and I were visiting Buenos Aires for the first time and only had a weekend to spend in the city, so we wanted to make the most of our time. We found BuenosTours on TripAdvisor and had a fantastic tour experience! Our guide was Jessica and we can't say enough about how friendly, fun, and informative she was as a tour guide. Although I'm sure she leads tours most days of the week, she was just as enthusiastic as if it were her first time leading a tour.We had a beautiful, relatively cool day in order to wander around the city. Jessica met us in our hotel lobby promptly at the appointed time and then we took a cab to the start of the walking tour. We explored many different parts of the city and stopped a few times for breaks including a traditional cafe experience, empanadas, and ice cream! The tour's pace was perfect and we ended up covering a fair amount of ground by foot and even took the subway to reach one of our final destinations. We hit city and neighborhood highlights such as the Pink House (we even briefly ducked inside), San Telmo, and of course the famous Recoleta Cemetery. We're so glad we spent our first day on this tour because it gave the perfect overview of the city. We then went back and further explored a few areas on our own the next day. This tour is worth every penny - book it!

Superb, personalized and efficient custom tours. From our initial contact with Justine via email she was able to map out a series of tours, Tango tickets, airport transportation and luggage storage over the course of a week. Our guide Ceri made our walking tours interesting by tailoring them to our interests and personal desires. We saw as much of the city as possible but also experienced architecture,cafe life, transportation, and the delightful experience of being guided by someone who has enthusiastically embraced Argentina full on while acknowledging her certain and exasperating flaws!

A great day!. We just spent a day with Jessica taking a walking tour of Buenos Aires. We had a great day. There were four of us and we started in La Bocca, not to be missed. We walked allover and took a few buses with the locals. She speaks perfect English and Spanish. Also she knows the history possibly better than some localsWe went to one of her favorite spots for lunch which was delicious and historic.A highly recommended tour and tour guide.

full day tour. Great tour with our American guide, Don. He has lived here long enough to be very knowledgable about the city and it's history. Never did we feel rushed, went on our pace, if we wanted to stop, fine, no problem. 1 of the best guided walikg tours we have taken

Excellent company that gives great, personal service. Jessica was an absolutely terrific tour guide, knowledgeable, enthusiastic and realistic about the life and realities of Buenos Aires. She toured us through La Boca, San Telmo and the Microcentre, all in 3.5 hours. Her approach was conversational, responding candidly to questions about life in Buenos Aires, We came away from the tour with a much deeper appreciation of the history, culture and politics of BA.We can't speak highly enough about the service that we received. Minor problems in booking the tour were speedily handled by Justine. When our scheduled tour was rained out, they were able to reschedule us with Jessica despite being completely booked. I don't know they did it, but we certainly appreciated it.

Great service and wonderful way to see the city. My first contact with this company was with Justine via email... She made sure I was comfortable with all of the arrangements and that we got the tour we wanted... And went above and beyond... And included helping to make my birthday a little bit more special.Quincy was our guide and we spent the day showing us all of the interesting places and facts of the south part of city. It was like having a friend show us around.We had a little snafu and Alan handled it quickly and to my satisfaction... Great company to deal with all around.

Professional and Personal -. We had a great day w. Ceri and really enjoyed walking, talking, exploring, and learning. It is hard to beat a personalized tour...especially when you hit it off with the guide. Ceri's knowledge was fantastic - about BA and the world at large. Our conversations covered just about as much ground as the tour. He made a point of personalizing the tour based on our discussions and helped us in immeasurable ways with advice on the city, that we put into action the following days we were there. In fact we bumped into Ceri a few days later in San Telmo and it was like meeting an old friend again. Our interactions with Buenos Tours was friendly and trusting...booking, changing, followup, etc. TOP MARKS ALL ROUND

Fabulous two days. We had two days of tours - one in the South with Ceri and one in the North with Jessica. We thoroughly enjoyed both days. We learnt so much, the pace was superb and we ate at lovely cafes and restaurants. Both Ceri and Jessica were so friendly, easygoing and happy to tailor the tour to our interests. I wholeheartedly recommend them to any newcomer to the city! Fabulous experience!! Thank you so much!

Great way to see Buenos Aires. We had planned on walking around on our own in the two days before we left for Antarctica, but after reading the very positive reviews, we decided at the last minute to see if there were any guides available. The customer service was fantastic, and we were able to book 2 half day tours, rather than a single full day tour (We were emailing them from the lobby of our hotel in BA). Don showed up in an hour, and we set off to see the historic parts of the city, including Recoleta Cemetery. Don brought such depth of knowledge and color to the tour that we really felt like we knew the city. He was great to talk with, and we enjoyed every minute. It was a great way to spend the afternoon following the overnight flight from the US.For our second half day, we had Quincy as our guide for La Boca and continuing through San Telmo and the historic city center. We didn't think that anybody could be better than Don, but Quincy was just as great. She really gave us a good feel for the city, and when we came back from our cruise, we were able to retrace some of the paths she had showed us to spend more time in some of the places she showed us.We are very glad we split it into two half day tours - it gave us some time on our own to wander around after the tours. Both Quincy and Don obviously love the city, and we started to really like it, as well. They gave us advice on restaurants and other places to see. I can't think of a better way to get an introduction to the city. There was a group tour staying at the same hotel, and their bus passed us 2-3 times while we were walking. They all seemed so disconnected from the city, sitting in a bus, rather than walking amongst the people.We also booked the Piazzolla Tango Show through BuenosTours and it was outstanding.

Best day in Buenos Aires. We did the whole day tour plus La Boca. Highly recommended for anyone only having limited time or a great way to get an overview and revisit some barrios for deeper exploration. Our tour guides, Quincy and Jessica, are both US expats who have live in BA for six years, thus communication was not problem and their knowledge of the city and its history was thorough. They're also great people with whom to spend several hours exploring the city. All dealings with the company were via email and a pleasure. They responded very rapidly to questions and also supplied a laundry list of ways to spend the remainder of our time. In fact their website is a fantastic resource for any BA visitor, with important and up to date info about the city.

A day in BA with Ceri!. After a late flight from Lima, and barely any sleep, we had previously booked a tour of BA the same day of our arrival. That morning we had met our guide Ceri at our hotel in Palermo for a full day walking tour, and it was definitely worth the eight hours we had spent with him, even though we were sleep deprived, and exhausted. Ceri had shown us Buenos Aires, just as we wanted to see it. Our time together felt more as if we had come to visit a friend, rather than a tour guide. From showing us all of the beautiful neighborhoods, markets, and secret little gems that BA has to offer, he showed us such a wonderful experience that it made us fall in love with the city. Ceri made our trip to BA even more memorable, and we are so glad that we had booked a tour, and met such an amazing, and interesting person to introduce us to this extraordinary city. Thank you Ceri! V&J

Great walking tour, company and guide is very helpful. they are everything that they advertise. We took a half day tour with Jessica of the downtown, Recoleta and cemetery. She was great and very helpful in trying to help us get our coats that we left on the plane. She was very informative and gave us lots of insight to Buenos Aires. We highly recommend her and the company. The company is very easy to work with. They give lots of information for pre planning. I was very impressed with the way they run their business. They deliver on what they promise.

Terrific Day Tour Walking in Buenos Aires. We were in Buenos Aires for two days before heading for Antarctica. We like walking and had limited time, so we decided on a full-day walking tour, including La Boca, San Telmo, the Center and Recoleta. Our guide, Richard, was WONDERFUL! He's a transplanted New Yorker who has lived in BA for the last ten years. He loves showing people around and is just a terrific person. He's also a film maker and took us for a brief detour to his studio in San Telmo. We set out to see a number of the basic sights, but as the day went on and we shared our specific interests, he modified the tour accordingly and took us to places off the set tour route. He also had great recommendations for things we could do the next day on our own (we would highly recommend both the Evita Museum and the MALBA), as well as giving us some good restaurant recommendations. BuenosTours would be at the top of my list for good walking day tours; my Fitbit said we covered almost 8 miles and it was a joy (a couple of taxi rides and a bus ride also moved us from area to area). In fact, we're now planning a trip to Patagonia next Jan and we plan to stop in BA again, where we'll definitely have Richard give us the post-graduate day tour in Buenos Aires! Mike and Roz P

Two wonderful tours of Buenos Aires. Our guide, Ceri was great. He met us at our hotel. We had a 3 hr. afternoon tour, followed, the next day by a full day tour. We enjoyed his expertise in the history and architecture of this beautiful city. We especially enjoyed our private tour of the Ricoleta and The Cemetery. Ceri was helpful with shopping... and chose the perfect cafe and restaurant for us to dine. We had a very good experience touring with him.

Professional & friendly walking tours. We had been to BA before, doing 2 full-day bus tours, so this time we wanted to do some selected areas in greater depth. We did City Centre (with Isabel), Recoleta/Retiro (with Ceri) and then an awesome all-day Ferry/Walk/Train trip to Tigre (Isabel). They know this city in depth, they know the history and the culture, they speak excellent local Spanish, and we just felt like we were visiting old friends. The walking was mostly level and the distances were comfortable. This is a First Class little tour company!

Wonderful asset. We used BuenosTours for a full day tour of Buenos Aires and found them to be excellent. It was a great way to see the city with our guide, Jessica. Buenos Aires is very spread out and would be difficult for a first time visitor to logically see in one day. I highly recommend the BuenosTours folks as a way for first time visitors to become familiar with the city

Two Great Neighborhood Tours with Jessica. We reserved the San Telmo/La Boca 1/2-day tour with Buenos Tours, and had such a great experience with the booking process (responsiveness, courtesy, restaurant recommendations, etc.) that we decided to also book the Recoleta/Retiro tour for another day. We had Jessica as a guide for both tours, and she provided excellent insight on all of the areas we visited and even allowed us to stray off the normal tour schedule in La Boca for a visit to the Qunquela Martin Museum. The tours were not rushed or superficial, so it was nice to get all of the information in a more relaxed and unscripted fashion. It was also cool to have an ex-pat's perspective on Buenos Aires and compare Argentinian events and culture to the USA. I highly recommend this company, and Jessica as a guide. Their rates are incredibly reasonable, and you won't be disappointed.

Insightful . Had a smashing full day tour with Richard. A great introduction to BA on all sorts of levels. Richard was the perfect guide - felt more like a friend in a couple of minutes than a guide. Had a great empanadas stop for lunch and some delicious Italian gelato for afternoon tea. Wld definitely recommend this to help you put BA into perspective. Good luck with the documentary Richard!

BuenosTours: a class act!. Due to health issues, we had to reluctantly cancel the 4 tours we had arranged with BuenosTours. This was done a mere 3 days before our 1st scheduled tour. The response was gracious and professional, just as all of our previous communications had been. We are experienced travelers and are totally impressed with this company. We intend to engage them in the future!

Excellent San Telmo/La BocaTour With Richard!!. We booked the half-day San Telmo/La Boca Tour with Richard on our very first day in Buenos Aires and it was very good! Being a native English speaker and having lived in the San Telmo area of BsAs for quite long time, Richard was very helpful and not only he gave a lot of information on the area, he also helped us negotiate on the prices, gave many tips on where to exchange our money, showed us some nice cafes and places to hang out if we go back there later etc.. The tour with Richard was well worth the price and it was really fun. Highly recommended!

Best Tour of Buenos Aires - Buenos Tours!. We booked the half day historic city center tour and enjoyed it thoroughly. Our guide was Jack, and he was knowledgeable, informative, and fun to spend the afternoon with while learning about BA. Originally, we booked the tour for later in the afternoon on the day of our arrival but due to mechanical and other problems, our flights got delayed and we never made the first scheduled tour. We can't thank Buenos Tours enough for their helpfulness in making last minute changes to accommodate us on the following day at a time that was convenient for us. We loved the sites on the tour, lunch at the Cafe Tortoni, and learning about the fascinating history of BA. Thank you, Buenos Tours and Jack, for a wonderful introduction to Buenos Aires!

Great tour of Boca / San Telmo with Richard!. Two of us had an interesting and enjoyable time touring this area with Richard - highly recommended! These communities are best suited to touring as a very small group. Richard's extensive knowledge from having lived in both areas over a number of years enabled us to visit a number of unique out-of-the-way spots that we never would have come across on our own, nor been able to visit as part of a large group. Along the way we also met several skilled artisans in their little workshops, which was great, but never felt that we were getting steered or influenced in any way to buy. We were however very impressed with the unique quality of the work and plan to return to some to make purchases. This is a great tour to do on a week-day if possible, to get oriented prior to returning on Sunday for the big San Telmo market. Richard is a very knowledgeable, interesting, and personable guy; and we chatted about everything from politics to film-making to art in the tour context. If we only had more time we would have loved to do another tour with him, such as the photographer tour.If you found this review useful kindly click on Helpful YES.

Best Investment & Experience Ever While in Buenos Aires...Thank You JESSICA!!. We booked 3 walking tours (Center of the City, Boca & San Telmo, and Recoleta) with Jessica during our stay and we are sooooo glad we did. It would have been impossible to get to know and feel Buenos Aires without our Jessica. This young lady spoiled us with her knowledge, kindness and personality. She is an absolute Gem! When it came to say good bye on our 3rd day, we felt lost without her...not to mention, sad : ( Buenos Tours and their Private Walking Tours with Professional and Enthusiastic Tour Guides,are a winning combination. An absolute must!

Absolutely fantastic. The walking tour with Jesssica was one of the real highlights of our trip to South America. Erudite, witty, incredibly well-informed and absolutely charming, Jessica brought to life the history of Buenos Aires in a way that could never be gleaned from a guide book. I wholeheartedly recommend her.

Ceri is remarkable. Our tour of BA was lead by a remarkable young man, Ceri. He was a quick witted Canadian punster enamoured with BA , it's people and their culture. He moved effortlessly from subject to subject and site to site making an 8 hour / 8 mile walking tour of BA to be monumentally entertaining and making us wish we had more time with both Ceri and BA. The city is remarkable and friendly when viewed with someone whose in love with it. His enthusiasm is infectious and his command of facts about the city leads to constant intrigue. We always felt safe and watched over even in BA's most colorful neighborhoods. The tour was a good value and the email followup was concise and helpful as was their blog.

One of the best tour companies I have ever worked with!. I have dealt over the years with many different tour companies and I must say this one was the best! Justine and her colleagues were exceptional! They answered all my questions without hesitation. Jessica, our tour guide, deserves a 10 star rating! Because of her we saw everything in Buenos Aires in eight hours! We walked, took the taxi, subway and bus! The various modes of transportation gave us an in depth cultural experience. Jessica took us every place we wanted to go and then some! My camera was not working and Jessica took pictures of us and emailed them to me when I got home, she also went to various camera shops to see if it could be fixed....not many tour guides would do that! She took us for a coffee break,great lunch and even escorted us back to the cruise pier! Her energy was like the energizer bunny....it was an experience of a life time!!

Just Excellent. From making the booking on-line to the day of the tour, everything was handled so professional and Burenos Tours went above and beyond our expectations.They delivered exactly what they promised, made the booking process very easy. We had 2 guides, Don in the morning and Jess in the afternoon. They were fabulous. Both were able to provide extensive historical information, as well as stories and also personal experiences.I would highly recommend BuenosTours - you won't be disappointed!

Awesome walking tour. My girlfriend and I were traveling from Australia and wanted to see some sites in BA. We had Ceri as our guide and he was very good. Not only did he know where to go and what to see in terms of tourist attractions, he also gave us plenty of tips on where to go out of a night in town. We will definitely use him again next time!!

La Boca, San Telmo with Ceri. We went for a 1/2 day tour of La Boca and San Telmo with Ceri in late December. To put this in context, we spent 2 weeks in Santiago / BA / MonteVideo / Rio doing this sort of thing with our two kids (15 and 17).It's crazy, really, the extent to which these guys went to make everything go smoothly. I'm not sure I've ever seen such a professional response, and certainly not in South America (sorry SA, but your customer service ability is 20 years or so behind Europe and North America. Too many companies, too many minor problems for it to be a coincidence. But these guys are an exception!)First of all, they sent a confirmation email with pictures of the driver and guide attached (ie. so we would recognize them), with every possible logistical question answered and a bunch of links to more information. We got picked up at our B&B (this in itself was impressive, as literally every taxi we took in BA had trouble finding it, despite our showing them a map and it being on an apparently normal street, a few blocks from the downtown airport) and driven to La Boca where Ceri was waiting for us.He took us on approx. 45 minutes in La Boca, then a public bus to San Telmo for another hour or so, ending up in a wine shop just off Plaza de Mayo, where he had a chilled bottle waiting for us. We hung out there with him for 20 minutes drinking it.Those are flawless logistical details. It goes without saying that Ceri's knowledge of BA, both currently and historically, seemed to be encyclopedic. What was even more impressive was his obvious love of BA specifically and travelling in general (he's from Canada and spoke flawless English and Spanish and seemed to be on a first name basis with half the people in La Boca).He's the kind of guy I occassionally meet travelling who makes me wish I could/had spend/t a lot more time actually living in different countries, instead of just visiting them. Lastly, he was great with our kids, and went out of his way to make them feel comfortable and engaged.It's really hard to think of anything Ceri or this company could have done better.

Private Photo Tour with Richard. From the initial email to the actual tour, their communication was very prompt and responsive. We had a great half-day private photo/walking tour through many areas of Buenos Aires with Richard. He provided excellent background on many of my many curiosities as it was my first time in Argentina. It was also helpful that he was extremely patient while we took our many photos of the cities vivid scenes. Kudos also go to him for taking us to a pretty fantastic coffee shop/cafe in Mercado de San Telmo. We even ventured back on our own to some of the same places (especially the coffee shop) thanks to gaining experience and familiarity in his tour. Highly recommend taking this tour if you want are looking for a guided walking tour.

Full day tour with Richard. Had a great experience and learned a lot on this tour. Richard and the staff could not have been more accommodating. Scheduled this for the first day in Buenos Aires. The flight from Miami was delayed two hours and needed to change the start time of the tour. Emailed Penelope and Richard. Richard was fine with starting the tour two hours later and still wanted to give us a full eight hour tour. Richard is enthusiastic and knowledgeable. He gave us a lot of good ideas on what else to see in the city. Have done a lot of tours all over the world and Richard is one of the best guides!

Outstanding Experience. Buenos Tours was very efficient and professional to deal with. Our guide Ceri made our trip to Buenos Aires memorable. He was knowledgeable, creative, and extremely entertaining. He really listened to our interests and varied the tour based on our individual desires. We had planned on one day, but were so satisfied we signed on for another. Our visit to a Milonga was particularly exciting and not something that most tourists would know about without a guide like Ceri. We could not ask for a better guide and highly recommend Buenos Tours.

Fantastic overview of the city. Our family had a wonderful day walking tour with Jessica. Her friendly nature and wonderful information bought the city alive. we were able to experience the hidden things that we never would have experienced on our own. we learnt so much about Buenos Aires in the day and loved every minute of it. Who would have thought a cemetery could be so interesting. Thanks Jessica, our family of 4 had a fantastic day with you.

Highly Recommend Tour and Highly Recommend Oliver!. My wife and I did an all day walking tour with Oliver. The day started with him picking us up at our hotel. He was very prompt, and greeted us with a huge smile which he kept the rest of the day. From the get go, he made us feel so comfortable, and the tour felt like a tour given by a long time friend.In seven hours, I felt like Oliver was able to show us a complete overview of Buenos Aires. He took us to several distinct neighborhoods, each with their own special feel. He showed us things like street art, hidden churches, and local lunch spots, which we would never have been able to find on our own, and which made our day special. He also took us to several historical sites like the Pink House and the cemetery where Eva Peron (and several other notable BA figures) are buried. At each site, he provided us with entertaining history lessons, and was able to answer any questions we had.All in all, I highly recommend Buenos Tours, and I highly recommend Oliver if he is available.

I did not even go on the tour and I can still highly recommend them. The communications with Buenos Tours were fantastic. Before I booked, I had several requests, including to pick my guide (I thought I'd get along better with a woman, so I chose Jessica), to start the tour a bit later, etc. Buenos Tours was very quick to respond and more than accommodating with what I suspect were pretty unusual demands. (No doubt most people just take what they get, but as this was my first trip to BA and as I only had one day, I wanted to get the most out of it). After I booked, I received several emails from them asking what my interests were so that they could tailor the tour to me, in addition to several tips for what else to do in BA. I ended up booking a tango evening through them as well.I was really looking forward to my tour as well as the tango dinner, until fate intervened and I came down with a terrible case of strep throat. I had to cancel at the last moment - and I do mean the very last moment. In fact, due to some email difficulties, they did not receive my cancellation until the evening before my tour (and after the bus had come to pick me up for my tango dinner). I felt awful for cancelling so late, but my poor health left me with no other choice. I could not talk or swallow and my fever was such that I was starting to hallucinate.Long story short, the folks at Buenos Tours were more than understanding. They issued me a full refund on the tour, were able to negotiate a 50% refund on the tango dinner (even though the theatre had a strict no cancellation policy), and they were very kind in wishing me a quick recovery.I have never before left feedback for a tour I did not even go on, but the customer service of Buenos Tours was so superb - and so rare - that I felt obliged to do so.I am sure the tour would have been fantastic, and I will definitely be in touch with them the next time I am in Buenos Aires. I am fully convinced that this is an A+++ company, which is sadly hard to find these days.

1/2 day BA tour w/ Richard was fab. Great 1/2 day tour in BA w/ Richard. Saw some sites, stopped for a coffee in a great cafe, went to Recoleto, then empanadas in a great resto. Richard is very knowledgeable and super friendly and made sure we had a good time despite starting out in a downpour. Terrific.

A Great Introduction to Buenos Aires. This company is first rate. Quick to answer emails, a friendly and knowledgeable guide, (Richard), a tour tailor-made to your requirements, fantastic places to visit and wonderful stories and background to complete the package. In our full day walking tour, we were introduced to San Telmo and its market, shops and wine stores, Plaza de Mayo with the Pink Palace the and the Metropolitan Cathedral, the Recoleta Cemetery, history on the founders and liberators of Argentina, a break for coffee at the preferred coffee house of the current Pope, a wonderful lunch stop, and the mansions on Alvear. We rode the bus and took taxis to and from our hotel. There was more, but suffice it to say that it was a great introduction to the city with someone who knows the places to go and who speaks the language. Good value for money as well.We also booked Piazzollo Tango through BA Tours and had an enjoyable and memorable evening.

Very good walking tour. Very friendly service, contacted us very fast thru email. Answered all questions promptly. Richard was very knowledgeable. Gave us interesting insights. Custom designed the walking tour according to what we wanted. Showed us around San Telmo market. Gave us recommendations on restaurants, bars, things to do. Would recommend them strongly.

Best good will ambassador. I found and contacted a few companies while searching for a transfer service and possible tour while in Buenos Aires. Justine at BUENOS TOURS responded promptly to my email and far surpassed any company I have ever dealt with. Not only did she supply me with helpful information about tours that her company provides BUT, if her company was not what we needed she also supplied me with information about a company that would service my needs!!!!! She also offered me tips (information) about BA that visitors will find very helpful. WOW--I truly admire her for going above and beyond what was necessary to assist me, a POSSIBLE client. I recommend Buenos Tours not only for touring while in BA, but for winning the gold star as the best good will ambassador in BA!!!!!!

Information packed day tour. My brother and I recently visited Buenos Aires. We hired Buenos Tours to give the two of us a tour of this magnificent city. Jessica was our guide. She's an American who has been living in BA for some seven years. She was remarkably knowledgeable about all things Buenos Aires. I can only guess that she knows more about Buenos Aires history and culture than most native-born folks. She had majored in Latin American studies and, as I recall, Spanish as well. And, she was very friendly as well. She took an interest in what we wanted to know and, since we are Jewish, she made it a point to weave her knowledge of Jews in Buenos Aires into the tour.Jessica picked us up at our hotel and we took a taxi to the start of 7ish hour tour. I'm terrible at remembering names of places but we saw A LOT in those seven hours. The day was packed but not rushed. And, we stopped for "lunch" which we turned into an appetizer break, and later had ice cream.We booked the tour just a day in advance, we paid online, and the office handled our logistics perfectly.I give a 5 star review to Jessica and to Buenos tours but I'd give more stars if I could.

THE BEST TOUR COMPANY IN BUENOS AIRES!!!!. OMG! I can't begin to tell you how wonderful BuenosTours is. All of the guides are brilliant and extremely engaging! Setting up tours with them is a breeze and they accommodate even the pickiest of travelers. And when I say picky, I mean down to the minute picky. They go out of their way to make sure you have a wonderful experience in BA. They will pick up tickets for you to local shows and will transport you safely to your desired destination. They were on time or early EVERY TIME. They are SUPER quick to respond to email/phone and they always make sure you have all the information (plus some AWESOME suggestions) you need, ample time before the event. One of the biggest perks to this company is that they really got to know the group and made suggestions based on what they thought we would like. They made it personal and fun and an UNFORGETTABLE experience! Do not even consider another touring company, it would be a shame and a total waste of time!

Private Tour. Ceri our guide met us at the cruise terminal, he had put together a great tour, we covered so much, very interesting tour fun but very informative, it's a must for anyone to do a tour with this company. We had lunch tradition food great atmosphere. The day was fun, weather was great, company the best. Anyone reading this and wondering should we book a tour, book it quick not to be disappointed. Thanks for such a great time, here's to the next time we visit.

Enthusiastic, knowledgable guides. Five friends and I engaged BuenosTours for two half-day excursions to Recoleta/Retiro and La Boca/San Telmo. The company has a great website full of detailed information. Booking the tours via e-mail was easy. Our guides Richard (Recoleta/Retiro) and Jessica (La Boca/San Telmo) shared their amazing experiences living in this vibrant, complex city. We enjoyed many small moments: a bus ride, a visit to a perfume maker, interesting discussions about politics, history and culture.

the best way to discover the city. A very cold and very wet Sunday in October, not necessarily the best day to do a walking tour of Buenos Aires for hours... Truly, Jessica my guide for the day managed to transcend the very inclement elements and introduce to me a vibrant city. An ex-pat living for a long time in B.A. Jessica is able to share her true love for the city, mixed with the realism of an outsider loving and forgiving look.I particularly enjoyed our conversations on the daily life, economy, and hopes of portelenos, a great day, even if it rained cats and dogs. Imagine this summer...

This is the way to see Buenos Aires!. we spent a fabulous day with Jessica! She was on time, professional and friendly. Itdidn't even feel like a tour, more like a knowledgeable friend showing us around a city she loves. We covered all the key areas and mixed fun street fairs, with history, lore, custom and great traditional food. I'd highly recommend this tour and Jessica to anyone coming to BA!

Fantastic tour of Buenos Aires. We really loved our tour with Jessica - she was a great guide - super knowledgeable and chatty. We learnt a lot about the city in a few hours. This is a perfect way to start off your trip to BA by getting an overview of the history and culture before exploring on your own.

A very good start to my visit to Buenos Aires. My experience was very professional. From the online booking to the payment and tour, I was very happy with my private tour. I had asked for a history and architecture private tour, and Jessica fit the bill. She was on time, knowledgeable, interesting and friendly. It was like walking around with a new friend. And the email confirmation that included her picture for me was an excellent idea. I recommend this company.

Awesome tour of Buenos Aires. we had Jessica and we really enjoyed our tour. It was raining all day but we soldiered on Anyway. Jessica knew all the history and was very informative. Would recommend to anyone coming to Buenos Aires for the first time

Retiro & Recoleta Private Walking Tour. Finding myself alone in Buenos Aires for a day and hardly knowing the city at all led me to book this private tour and it was the best decision. From the moment of my 1st email enquiry the process was so well organised and the response to my enquiry was incredibly prompt. I met my guide, Richard, at the designated place and from there we walked and chatted and it was hanging out with a friend. He is extremely knowledgable with all the facts and and obviously very passionate about this city. I loved that he didn't seem to adhere to a strict schedule or itinerary. The cemetery is fascinating and it is particularly worthwhile walking through with Richard as he points out various graves, explaining who was who, the historical importance and any curious little intrigues. Walking round Retiro was also fascinating, learning of the past grandeur of all the mansions, the families who occupied them and the lifestyles they must have led. At the end of the 3 hours I felt I had a wonderful insight into the life and history of Buenos Aires.

Must Do while in BA!!!. We've just returned to our hotel after an information filled walking tour with Ceri. His local knowledge and very informative 'presentation' was brilliant. We did the full day walk (about 7.5 hours) and it was worth every cent. From being met promptly in our hotel foyer, to having a tailor made walk centred around the information you provide at booking, the day is filled with hidden gems of little known facts and insider information that is priceless. Not rushed in any way, we were able to stroll through various parts of old and new BA, stopping to admire the architecture and statues around the city. We stopped for lunch at a great little restaurant in Recoleta where we had the tastiest selection of Empanadas we've had while here.If there is one thing you do while visiting this history filled city, this would have to be it!! Thanks Ceri, was an exceptional experience.

GREAT 2 days with Buenos Tours. My husband and I spent 2 days talking the north & south with Buenos Tours. Our guide Richard was wonderful for the first day - made sure to tailor the tour to things that interested us, was very knowledgable and really went above and beyond for us (checked on us the next day and sent us follow up suggestions for the rest of our stay). Oliver was also great on our additional day, and he had communicated with Richard to know about us ahead of time. The highlight was the cemetary tour with Oliver as he included some really interesting (and spooky!) stories that aren't often told and is an excellent story teller. He is an actor as well so this really added to the experience when hearing about the history, etc. Overall, we really felt taken care of and that we got the most out of our short visit.The bookings team is also great - they were super fast via email with responses and sent a photo of each guide so we knew who to look out for (clever!). They are pricier than other companies out there but well worth it to us.Highly recommend!
Terrific tour!. BuenosTours walking tour was a wonderful way to learn about a delightful city. Our guide Richard was knowledgeable, gracious and entertaining. Terrific tour!

Excellent tours and personal service. We went on the Recoleta / Centro and the La Boca / SanTelmo tours in early August with Jessica. She was fabulous and extremely knowledgeable about BA and kept us enthralled with interesting stories about the history, culture and characters in BA history and present.Will treasure the memories and look forward to seeing the photos in a few weeks!Thanks for a great time!

A Great Insider's look at Buenos Aires. We booked with BuenosTours after reading a recommendation online in the Guardian. Getting in touch was easy and the booking experience both simple and intuitive. Excitedly we embarked with our guide, Ceri, and had a most wonderful, unique, and really 'insider's point of view' visit to La Boca and San Telmo. Though I had been to BA several times on my own on business, there is no way I could have created such a superb and personal visit. My family was elated, privy to things that many locals don't know, and absorbed more about the city than I had on several prior visits combined. Bravo, Bravo and an ecstatic two thumbs up!

Great way to get to know B/A. We took this tour and enjoyed it immensely. Justine was extremely knowledgeable about the history, architecture and politics of the area ( Recoleta). Walking is a pleasant and leisurely way to really get familiar with an area. I highly recommend this tour.

Informative and entertaining. I visted B.A. with a group of 8 (family), and we decided to take the full-day tour split into two days. Our guide Oliver was super organized and clearly knew a lot about the city, and we were able to learn so much more about the iconic sites than we would have touring on our own, guidebooks in hand. He also gave great recommendations for where to see and eat after.

Fantastic tour of La Boca and San Telmo. Ceri was an excellent guide on our tour of La Boca and San Telmo. Aswell as telling us about the history of the areas, he helped out withpurchases in San Telmo market, took us to the Pope's favourite caféfor tea, and went well over the time allocated for the tour. We allhad a brilliant afternoon! He also gave us a recommendation for amilonga venue, which we went to another afternoon and really enjoyed.Many thanks, Ceri!From Kate, Rachel and Immy

World travelers stamp of approval. My husband and I have traveled for over 50 years and we can honestly say this entire operation from the initial answering of our first email to our last tour (we took 4 half day tours) was top shelf. Justine was efficient in planning our days, fitting us with the perfect match for tour people, and even provided concierge white glove service in obtaining ballet tickets for us!!!! She exuded confidence and made me feel that this would be a wonderful, fulfilling experience.We had both Oliver and Ceri for our guides. They were prompt , informative, witty, flexible to shop or stop ,entertaining and knowledgeable. We would give this company a real seal of approval from picky Miami people.

BEST VACATION INVESTMENT, EVER!. BuenosTours did not disappoint. On time, smart, witty, informative, fun, and overall an excellent investment while on vacation in Buenos Aires. It doesn't get any better than this. Take it form a hardcore New Yorker, this tour is a great vacay tool when trying to squeeze in all of the historical sights while also leisurely enjoying the city over a couple of days. You won't be sorry and for the price, it is BEYOND worth it. Ask for Oliver, he was AMAZING!

Half Day Private Guided Walking Tour of the Historical Center of Buenos Aires for 2 people. Excellent tour. Our guide, Ceri, was extremely knowledgeable and professional. We walked around the centre of the city for about 4 hours. I would definitely recommend using BuenosTours and Ceri. Excellent experience.

Great way to tour Buenos Aires. Our group of 5 joined Jessica for a full day private walking tour around Buenos Aires and left the city with beautiful memories. We were lucky to have Jessica as our guide. She is very friendly and knowledgeable and made us feel right at ease with her. She picked us from our B&B in Palermo and we got to San Telmo in two taxis, where we started the walking tour at a leisurely pace. As our group had very little time in Buenos Aires, we travelled around in taxis to our destinations all the time.
