I´d highly recommend a private walking tour to anyone who doesn´t just want to see the various attractions (which definitely are worth a visit), but is also interested in getting a better understanding of life in BA.

Excellent walking tour. My wife and I had a great private walking tour (7 hours) in Buenos Aires - our guide, Oliver, was a great guy and very knolegeable, and we covered many interesting sights. The place we went for lunch was so good (best empanadas we have ever had in South America, and inexpensive too) that we returned on our own the next day! If you want a close-up of BA, experiencing the sights and sounds and not being in a vehicle (and traffic in BA is pretty bad!) this is the tour to take. Highly recomended.

The Best Tour in Buenos Aires. Olilver and Jesse were just terrrific guides, each on separate days in Buenos Aires. Both are from the U.S. and lived in BA for almost a decade. They are very bright, knowledgeable, and flexible about what you want to do on your tour. They provided not only information about the sites in BA but provided insightful information about the economic, political, and fascinating historical comparisons with the U.S. and other countries.

Perfect 2 days in BA. I had 2 great days "hanging out" with Jessica on my private walking tour. I felt like I was walking around with a friend and I couldn't have had a better tour guide. Jessica has a very easy going personality which made the day flew by. I didn't feel like I needed to cut the tour short nor was I bored. The tour was very informative and I learned a lot about the city. Jessica was able to help me get on the subway back to my hotel all on my own and wrote great directions. For someone who gets lost a lot, once I was able to learn the subway system, I went back to some of the places I visited with Jessica on my own and just sat and watched people. As a solo traveler, I concerned about safety, but I didn't feel that was an issue for me in BA and Jessica gave me great insight about the argentine Culture and way of life. I am so glad I booked the tour. I use tripadvisor a lot for my planning of trips and I would most definitely recommend this tour. If you don't like to walk, the crowded uninformative tour bus is your other option. Jessica, thanks for a great 2 days and I hope you make it to Brazil soon! Take care ~~Lia

Excellent customer service. Have nothing but praise for Alan at Buenostours.com. He saved my visit to Buenos Aires when I discovered on the Saturday, that I had actually made a booking for the show I wanted to see for the day before, the Friday (Senior moment). Alan was so helpful when I contacted him, offering to try and change the booking for that evening. This he managed to do! So I would thoroughly recommend this company.

So glad we did this.. We have never done a private city tour in any of our other travels, and we now plan to whenever possible. We just hope that other tours will be as good as this one was. Oliver was a great tour guide, really knew his facts and history. We highly recommend this company.

Superb tour done by a quality guide. I just had to get out of my slumber to write this review for the guide I had with Buenos Tours... perfect English, friendly, humorous and generous manner, amazing sights including off the beaten path and most importantly, informative without being boring. The best I've been on!

Amazing Full-Day Tour with Jessica. My husband and I took a full-day walking tour with Jessica of Buenos Tours. We had such a wonderful time with her! She is so incredibly knowledgeable about the city - my husband can be a bit of "history fact junky," and Jessica provided him with countless fun historical facts that kept him on his toes all day. Buenos Aires is such a large city, and we really feel like Jessica showed us all of the key sites. She was engaging and personable, and we loved the cafe and lunch spots that she showed us as well. I would not hesitate to recommend Jessica as a tour guide!

consider full day over half day tour. We signed up for a half day tour of the historical Centro on our first afternoon in Buenos Aires. We found our guide, Oliver, an ex-pat, to be personable and informative. He answered our questions but did not seem as engaged as we would have wished--asking no questions of us, for example, about our interests or what we hoped to see and learn about during our visit to Argentina. Upon our return home, I reread a number of the reviews on TripAdvisor, and feel in retrospect that this particular tour itinerary may not have been the best choice--San Telmo and/or Recoleta (which we happily explored later on our own) might have been better. Alternatively, a longer tour might have provided a richer experience. On the 3-hour walking tour of Centro some sites were treated in a very cursory way and we might have gotten more out of a more extended visit (e.g., to the explore the tunnels and do the tour at Manzana de las Luces rather than simply walking in and out of one building). We did spend time in the interior of the cathedral and enjoyed that part of the tour and Oliver's more detailed explanation of particular features of that site. All in all, a good experience--but a bit disappointing given our high expectations.

Buenos Aires Private Walking Tour. Excellent tour!! Our guides were very knowledgeable about their city. They were not only fun, but interesting as well. Made the city of Buenos Aires come alive for us as we probably would not have gone into some of these areas by ourselves. We broke the tour up into two days instead of doing the whole 7 1/2 hours in one day. They meet you in your hotel and away you go! Be sure you wear comfortable walking shoes and bring your camera! Highly recommend Jessica and AlanMaureen & Jim El Paso, Texas

Full-Day Tour of Buenos Aires with Jessica. Jessica was wonderful. She planned a tour that was very interesting and informative for us, and adjusted the details to our liking as we proceeded. We saw all of the highlights of Buenos Aires, and incorporated lunch and beverage stops along the way. I would recommend Jessica for any future tours.Sincerely,Rodger Ballati

Two great walking tours. We recently booked Buenos Tours for 2 different half day tours. Our first one was with Oliver touring the Historical City Center and the second one was with Jessica who led us though Ritiro and into Recoleta Cemetery. Both guides were very knowledgeable about Buenos Aires and we covered a lot a ground in the 4 hours. It was interesting to see and hear about Buenos Aires from the perspective of two ex-pats who have lived in the city for some time. It really was similar to having an old friend show us around their adopted city. Our mid tour breaks were perfect and we learned enough from both guides to be comfortable about later navigating on our own. I would highly recommend taking a private walking tour with Buenos Tours. The value for the money was great, the quick response to my questions about the tours before I booked was very helpful, and both tours were a lot a fun.

In depth tour of Buenos Aires. This was a great walking tour of Buenos Aires. It covered 4 areas in depth--San Telmo, Retiro, Monserrat and Recoleta, and lasted a full 7 1/2 hours. Our tour guide was Oliver. He arrived at the hotel right on time, and we hopped in a taxi to San Telmo, arriving just outside of the San Telmo market. Oliver really had a good knowledge of history of each area we walked through, and provided both the official and unofficial versions of historical events. (The unofficial versions were probably more accurate!). We stopped for coffee at the Tortoni cafe and had an empanada lunch at a charming restaurant. I would highly recommend this company and Oliver's tour as a way to get an in depth view of the main areas of Buenos Aires.

Buenos Aires Private Walking Tour. We had a full day walking tour with Oliver. They are sufficient on booking and confirming the tour before we arrived, on time and well spoken English. Gave us a very interesting and relaxing day and covered all the important places. We can recommend them any time and it was value fo our money.

Buenos Aires Walking Tour. I arranged for a private Sunday morning walking tour of Retiro, Recoleta and their environs. Our guide, Chance, arrived at our hotel on time. We took a quick taxi to the area where our walking tour would begin. It was a beautiful, relatively quiet morning, and we enjoyed our tour very much. Chance provided a unique perspective of life in Buenos Aires, and he imparts information very easily. The best way to get to know a city is by walking, and BuenosTours will be the company that I recommend to my friends. A private tour is worth every penny!

A Day Spent With a New/Old Friend. We had a full day walking tour with Jessica. Jessica was punctual andwell presented. She was intelligent and thoughtful in her appraisal ofBuenos Aires and Argentina. She gave us an interesting and broad viewof BA in our walk. Walking the streets of BA with Jessica, enjoyingcoffee and lunch with her was like spending the day with an old friendwho'd moved to Argentina many years ago and we were all catchingup.Thanks Jess for making our stay in Buenos Aires so enjoyable. If you enjoy walking, talking, learning, sharing and smiling then book a tour with Buenos Tours. They were helpful from the first contact until the end. By booking this walking tour we had no problems walking the rest of BA during our next three days there. We also did the Tango show which really wasn't our thing but the theatre was gorgeous, the food quite good and we met a lovely table of French people so it was not a bad night.

Great way to get a feel for Buenos Aires, Argentina!. We truly enjoyed our full day walking tour in Buenos Aires, Argentina with Jessica, our guide from Buenos Tours. We felt safe, learned a lot, and got some great cultural experiences as well. We were so glad we booked our tour on our first day in town - that way we were very comfortable getting around on our own the next two days. Jessica is very knowledgeable and attentive to her clients' needs. We loved having a private tour that moved at our own pace. The price of the tour seemed reasonable to us and we even got some great recommendations for things to do on our next two days.

Best Guided Tours in Buenos Aires. We learned about BuenosTours from friends who had used their services previously and recommended the company very highly. My husband and I scheduled two half-day tours due to the guides' schedules. Although most visitors may select a full day tour, our half-day tours worked very well. Our guides were Oliver and Alan. Both are fully bilingual, knowledgeable and well informed about the area's history, customs, politics, architecture, arts- they readily answered any question we asked. Both gave us excellent recommendations for restaurants and other places of interest to visit on our own. We could not have been more pleased.

The walking tour to take!. Took two tours with Alan & both were excellent. He really knows the facts about the places you see. He was also very helpful in explaining how to use the taxi's & the trains. Highly recommend this company & Alan. Was going to take all three tours but ran out of time, will pick up the third tour next time in Buenos Aires.

BuenosTours - Buenos Aires full day walking tour. Great tour.Our guide, Alan knows his stuff & delivers it bright & cheerfully. Got a good sense of the history through to today's issues such as the almost daily streetdemonstration in the plaza De Mayo. Got to see things that we wouldn't have or understood without him. We're not fluent in Spanish so he was a must. Choice of coffee at historical Tortoni's and lunch were great - food & history. Too many unforgetables to list here. Finished up at the cemetary with intrigue & history surrounding Evita. Flexible with options regarding time. Felt safe, relaxed and informed at all times.Please pass on our regards to him for a day to be remembered.Cheers,Helen & Tony

Excellent Guide - Interesting Conversations. Jessica was our guide. It turned out that we had already seen the major attractions that are on this day long tour as we had already spent 3 days in BA prior to our final week there. Jessica took this in stride and worked with our own interests to let us do exactly what we wanted to do. The pacing of the tour and Jessica's knowledge of the the city and its people was excellent and all of the questions we had as a result of the 3 weeks we were in Argentina prior to taking this tour were answered. Our contacts with the office in booking the tour and change the date were all done efficiently and professionally. We recommend this service to anyone who would like a personal tour and we recommend that you take a personal tour if there is any way you can make this work with your finances.

Buenos Tours Review. My husband and I booked tours from California before we left for Buenos Aires in December. We booked the LaBoca and San Telmo tour as well as the City tour. Alan and Oliver were our guides respectively. I can't convey how fantastic the tours were. We saw Buenos Aires in a way that could never be duplicated on a large commercial tour. We learned the history of the City and what it is like to now live in BA. Both young men were articulate, informative, gracious and a delight to be with. Kudos to them and the tour company!!!!

Highlight of our visit!. Our tour guide, Alan, was wonderful. The tour was one of the highlights of our visit--fun and informative. Even my daughter, who had been in Buenos AIres for three months already, learned a lot. In addition, when our tour was interrupted by tremendous rain andflooding, Alan not only (spmewhat heroically) found a taxi for us, hemet us again the following morning so we could finish the tour. A wonderful tour!

Excellent walking of Buenos Aires in every respect. We discovered Buenos Tours searching the net (buenostours.com) and booked by email. We just completed our tour today (2-2-2013) with Oliver as our guide who proved an excellent, knowledgeable and personable guide. We walked through several neighborhoods and saw numerous important sights, lunched at an elegant vintage restaurant and ended the tour at the Cemetary where many historical figures are buried. All four of us loved this tour and highly recommend it.

Excellent way of seeing Buenos Aires. My husband & I did a 4 hour walking tour with Oliver of Buenos Tours in January as we only had the day and evening in Buenos Aires before joining our cruise the following day. Isabel, who had dealt with our emails at Buenos Tours had advised us that as we didn't land at EZE until 8.30am it was unlikely that we would get to our hotel until 11.00am (how right she was) the 4 hour walk would be our best option. Oliver was an excellent guide, enthusiastic, knowledgeable, informative and helpful. We learned a lot about his adopted city's culture and history in a short time. The pace was perfect for 2 very jet lagged people and we had a perfect coffee stop at Cafe Tortoni. We were really pleased we had booked the tour and Oliver was outstanding. Isabel had organised everything perfectly including our Tango/Dinner show at Piazzolla Tango that evening. We were very impressed and pleased with the service offered by Buenos Tours.

Great full day walking tour with Alan in BA. We spent a full day with Alan in early January. The walking tour was not only informative, but it was also great fun!! He has a great deal of local (and historical) knowledge of the city, which he clearly loves to share. His enthusiasm is contagious. He tolerated a lot of questions and also made suggestions about what to do with our remaining days in this fantastic city. Our experience would not have been nearly as satisfying without the knowledge which he so freely shared. We would highly recommend this great tour with Alan, or any of the other guides. Wear comfortable shoes and be prepared to put on a few miles!!

Great tour and city. Being our first time in Buenos Aires and only there for 2 nights, we decided to do an all day walking tour with Buenos Tours. We are so glad we did. Olivier was fun and very informative. You could tell he loved his adopted city. We saw lots of lovely buildings and to learn the history behind then was fascinating. We certainly saw so much more and would highly recommend you take one of their private walking tours too.

Private tour of Buenos Aires. My husband and I and another couple took the all-day, private walking tour of Buenos Aires with Oliver of Buenos Tours a few weeks ago. We were extremely pleased with everything about the tour. Oliver was outstanding, very knowledgeable, and we learned and saw so much. The pace was perfect, the itinerary was well thought out, the sites were exciting to see, and the café and restaurant were welcome stops. Oliver made the tour enjoyable and educational, and we highly recommend Buenos Tours and our guide, Oliver. The next day, we walked around parts of Buenos Aires on our own and kept running into places that Oliver had showed us and remembered what he had said about them.

A terrific way to spend the day.... My wife and I recently did a privately guided full day walking tour of BA and could have not asked for a better guide in Jessica. Her knowledge of the neighborhoods of BA was informative and her love of exceptional ice cream (dulce de leche variations rocks) was awesome. I have worked in BA many years ago and getting re-familiarise with the town with Jessica was excellent.

Buenos Tours - Private Walking Tour. What a great time we had with Oliver and Jessica, exploring the most historic and most beautiful neighborhoods in Buenos Aires. Both of our guides were pleasant and knowledgeable and our itinerary well planned. The price of the tour was very reasonable. Not only was the tour great, but the tour staff (Isabel and Alan) assisted us in resolving a personal problem we encountered to our great satisfaction. I'd do it again and encourage you to try Buenos Tours!

Money Well Spent. We took the half day Recoleta tour today and it was well worth the cost. Jessica was astounding in her knowledge of Buenos Aires and the many different attractions she showed us during the tour. Starting in Retiro and ending at the Recoleta cemetery she taught us about the city and the many famous people who lived and died

A necessity to appreciate Buenos Aires. What a great tour! Alan, our guide, was professional yet likeable and friendly. While he's super-knowledgeable about Buenos Aires' history and architecture, the tour never felt like a list of facts, but rather a series of vignettes with reoccurring characters and themes.We took the full day tour, beginning in La Boca. In one day, we were able to weave our way through San Telmo, Microcentro (downtown), Plaza de Mayo, Retiro, and Recoleta. We went inside famous buildings of all sorts, from churches to government buildings. We had a relaxing coffee break at the famous Cafe Tortoni and a nice empanada and salad lunch in a charming Recoleta restaurant. Our tour finished at the Recoleta Cemetery, where Alan expertly weaved his way through the maze of mausoleums, highlighting the famous (Eva Perón) and the not-so-famous-but-interesting (a domestic servant buried just outside her employers' mausoleum). Having done all of these things, I am both surprised and delighted that the tour never felt hurried.As a two year resident of Buenos Aires, I experienced the tour in a different way from other tourists. I didn't really need Alan's accurate translations, and I already had been to most of the locations on the tour. But, for me, it was an eye-opening experience. Anyone can get a map and walk around a city. But to really understand what you are seeing, from the cannon balls embedded in a historical church tower to the graffiti painted the day before by some politically active youth, one needs a guide. Moreover, I now finally understand who all those old men on the Argentine currency are.The private tour format is a huge advantage. During our tour, we saw plenty of other tourists in large groups following lazily behing their guide. The were talking amongst themselves and had little or no connection to the guide. For us it was completely different: an engaging, personal and memorable experience.

super tour with awesome tour guide. We had the full day tour with Alan and it was great. He really knows his stuff and is particularly knowledgeable about the history of Argentina. We started ag Boca and finished at the cemetary. Usually I would not think of a cemtary as all that interesting, but this was, especially because of Alan's knowledge. I would highly recommend this tour to my friends and relatives.

Great way to get an overview of the city. When travelling to new cities in Europe we usually try to find a group tour our first day to get a decent idea of where the attractions are prior to setting off on our own. Since I couldn't find that option in Buenos Aires, we decided to do a private tour with Buenos Tours. We did the full-day tour, although split over two days, with Jessica. She gave us a really good idea of the city, both in terms of attractions and the history. She also gave us recommendations of things to do after finishing our tour with her, and several restaurant suggestions that (of the couple we tried) were truly excellent I highly recommend using this company at the start of your trip to Buenos Aires.

Fabulous Introduction to Buenos Aires. We booked the full day tour (split over two days). The tour was great. My wife and I were very impressed with Alan, his company and the special (read personal) attention we, as his "guests", received. The tour was a fabulous introduction to BA and gave us both the confidence and knowledge to take on such a great City.Since we are both in our sixties, we elected to split the one day tour over two half days...turned out to be a great idea, and Buenos Aires Private Walking Tours was very accommodating. BA can be quite overwhelming and hot so relax and enjoy!The second half of our tour was with Oliver. Oliver was equally entertaining and knowledgable...With Alan being a Brit and Oliver being an American the communication will be perfect with the comfort of being with someone who knows the city, the language and the culture...Great job guys!

Expertise, fun, and an excellent introduction. I was VERY impressed with my walking tour. I opted for a full day tour. Since I only had one full day in Buenos Aires I put all of my eggs in this basket and I couldn't be happier. The tour highlighted the best aspects of the city while creating a learning experience that wasn't annoying for a second. Normally I just want a tour guide to get me around and point things out. This was so much more and so well executed that it seemed seamless. My guide made sure that she met me at my hotel doorstep and left me there when we were finished. No worrying about finding my way around or getting ripped off by taxi's. She took care of it all. She spoke English and Spanish fluently. I really can't believe how much of the city we were able to see. Quite an accomplishment. If you are worried that a full day may be too strenuous well don't be! They expertly place subway rides on 100 year old wood carts, lunches at famous cafe's, and leisurely walks throughout the tour. My guide also helped tailor the tour to my likes and wants. Something you don't typically see. Usually they are rigid schedules that you can't deviate from. She went the extra mile to make sure that it was perfect. If I could do it all over again I wouldn't change a thing!

Above and beyond. This tour was fabulous, Alan was knowledgeable and covered a great many things in a quick tour. We happened to have a very rainy day and Alan really went above and beyond to make sure that we had a great experience, hailing a cab in ankle deep flood waters and returning the next morning to show us Recoleta Cemetery in the beautiful sunshine. What a great way to get to know a city and a great company to support.

First day? do this. We were flying around the world to get here and I chose this for our first day in hopes of keeping us moving and awake. It turned out to be an excellent choice to accomplish both....and a great intro to BA. We did the full 7 hr walking tour. Seems like a lot but in the timeframe we had coffee at a truly charming cafe, lunch with what would turn out to be our first of MANY empanadas and leisurely strolls around a lot of BA's best sights. You will still have plenty to do on your own in remaining days but we hit a lot of the highlights. This groups knows what it's doing.

A Good Afternoon Walk. After checking a number of sources includng Tripadvisor, I selected Buenos Tours for the half day Recoleta tour. And this was an excellent pick.The sign up process on their website is very good and also provides links to other information and resources about Buenos Aires.Jessica arrived promptly at the appointed hour at our hotel in Recoleta and we took a cab to Plaza San Martin. From there we walked around the area and then headed back to Recoleta. We learned a lot about the areas we were passing through and got a broader perspective on Buenos Aires and its history. A nice touch was a stop at La Biela, a coffee shop with a lot of history and some interesting locals enjoying the place. We concluded with the Recoleta cemetary where history abounds. Jessica was of great help in locating and describing the most important features and locations there.On a walk like this a guide is a must for two reasons. First, a do it yourself walk with your head in a guidebook wouldn't come near to gaining an understanding of the locale. And second, there is a lot of petty crime, and some not so petty, in Buenos Aires. Having a guide with local knowledge provides a buffer to that.High marks for Buenos Tours.

Excellent Walking Tours. I had 4 days in Buenos Aires and after reading many positive reviews, decided to book my sightseeing trips with Buenos Tours. I am very glad I did so. I had two half day tours, the first day with Alan and the second with Oliver. Both tours were top notch and I was really impressed by the knowledge and professionalism of Alan & Oliver. The tours were easy paced and included the important sights, historic background, humerous anecdotes and coffee stops at a historic cafe and typical outdoor pizzeria. I had booked the tour for myself & my wife but she had to cancel at the very last minute. Without me asking, Alan offered a full refund of her cost, which shows that this organization is all about making your trip to BA a memorable experience. I have been to many countries all over the world and can say that the Buenos Tour guides were the best I have experienced. I hope I get an opportunity for another walking tour with Buenos Tours in the future. F. Vatcha - Maryland, USA

Great half day Recoleta tour. We took the half day Recoleta tour with Alan on our first day in Buenos Aires. He was very helpful and informative, and the tour was very relaxed and pleasant. He was able to easily answer all our questions and make recommendations on what other sights we should see on our short trip here. He gave us great insight into the Recoleta area, and the cemetery tour was so much more valuable with his input. And, we loved the midway stop for gelato!

Way to go. Having only one day in BA before leaving on an overland excursion we wanted to get the most out of our visit. After a lot of research we settled on Buenos Tours full day walking tour. What a good choice. Oliver met us at our hotel in the morning for the San Telmo walk then handed us over to Jessica for Recoleta in the afternoon. Both were so nice, easy to talk to and very informative. Whilst there was a lot of walking and we are not exactly young at no stage did we find it difficult. It was a great day and really good value for money - highly recommended.

the only way to get anything out of BA in 3 days!. We just got back from three days in BA after an extensive stay in another province. We wanted to break up our return and get a bit of the city's culture. It had been 12 years since I'd been to BA and had friends with us who had never been there, so we thought the tours was the way to go. They were a real highlight of our overall Argentine experience. Alan and his team do a great job of communicating before you book, after you book and prior to arrival and the tour dates to prepare you so you get everything you possibly can out of the experience. We had four people so it was really cost effective because they were running a special of "pay for three and the fourth is free". We did a tour our first two mornings: San Telmo and La Boca one day and Retiro/Recoleta the second with the cemetery being a big highlight. After the first day, we knew how to use the subway and bus system thanks to those being the way we got around for the first tour. Alan lead one and Jessica the other - both excellent tour guides. We also took the company's recommendation for a tango/dinner show and it was excellent. Everything came off without a hitch, we were picked up at our accommodation by private car and taken to the show and returned afterwards as part of the price. Also a real thank you to Isabelle who communicated by email very effectively. Such a pleasure to deal with professional friendly services in a foreign city. They left us with the feeling that if we needed anything while we were there, we could have rang them for advice.

Well worth it!!. This was the highlight of our trip to BA. We did both the San Telmo and Recoleta tours on different days. It's a great way to get comfortable with Buenos Aires if you have not been here before. The tour allows you to ask cultural questions about BA and learn the do's and dont's. The guides are very helpful on restaurant recommendations as well as other things to do in BA. Great job BA Tours!

Friendly and informative. I was worried about my very limited Spanish skills, so I decided to schedule some English-speaking tours to help me get oriented, and bring some structure to my visit. I had over a week in BA, so I decided to do three separate 3-hour tours vs. a single 7-hour tour. This gave me something to do every day and allowed going a bit more in depth with each neighborhood. The tours themselves were great - my guide would meet me at my hotel, and we would then walk, cab, subway or bus our way to the tour route. Midway through, we'd have a break in a notable cafe; we'd rest our feet, have some friendly conversation and a snack, and I'd learn more about the venue and surrounding area. The excursions were excellent for me as a solo traveler, and I think they could be even more fun with one or more additional people.I had two guides; Jessica for two tours, and Oliver for one. They were both very good, and Jessica was truly outstanding. In the end, I got a fantastic introduction to many major landmarks, learned a lot of the city's and nation's history, and also benefited from practical tips on how to use public transportation, make/keep change, etc. There were a couple of places I ended up going back to for more in-depth exploration on my own, and I probably never would've discovered them if relying solely on guidebooks. This was money and time well spent, without a doubt!

Fascinating walking tour of Buenos Aires. Our guide, Allan, met us at our hotel. He is a British citizen who moved to BA to study Spanish and fell in love with the area. This is evident in his intelligent and humourous tour. His grasp of history is excellent. I am a history buff and knew bits of the Argentine story, but during our walking tour Allan wove it all together so we came to understand the development of not only the city but the country, along with the Argentine character.Allan's insider tips are also great for getting the most out of your time and money.We have taken many tours and this was one of the best.

Alan www.buenostours.com. In Buenos Aires, Argentina on the 28th September at 8.45 - 4.00 Pm., my wife and I arranged a private walking tour with Alan from his company Buenostours [see website above].We were met at our hotel and over the next 7 hours visited many "out of the way" places in the capital city, rode the oldest train, had coffee at the oldest cafe and lunch at an authentic Argentinean pizzeria. One of the many highlights was a guided tour of the Teatro Colon a magnificent Opera house, being among one of the best in the world with a special & for us a lucky female guide who sang two arias for the tour group - very special indeed. Alan organized the tickets in advance, planned the tour and was extremely pleasant and informative to be with. For anyone wishing to spend a great day walking around this magnificent city with a guide, we would highly recommend contacting Alan in advance of your visit or after arrival. Tim & Gail Mew, Melbourne, Australia.

7 hour walking tour of Buenos Aires. This was my first time to B.A but as I only had 2 days there i wanted a tour which was flexible to cover my interests but also ensured I'd get to see all the important attractions. My guide was Jessica a native of NJ who'd been living in B.A for a few years. So it was great as she gave me examples in the US i could relate to and she spoke fluent Spanish. What really made the trip was that Jessica was so well informed about the history and architecture of the city and took me to some off the beaten path places. She also answered all my questions very patiently and really helped me to have a great day out!!

Amazing. Taking a walking tour with Buenos Tours more than exceeded our expectations! From the first contact with Alan, owner of Buenos Tours, until the end of our time in Buenos Aires, this was by far the most interesting tour we took there! Learning about the historical development of the city with the many personal stories, drama, myths, and legends gave us a true impression of the Argentine Culture. Digesting the causes of the rise and fall of the area neighborhoods from the working class La Boca situated along the old port to Recoleta, sipping tea at elegant cafés, and VIP seating for Tango shows, was just a taste of our some of the experiences we had with Alan. Alan’s knowledge of every inquiry whether architectural or cultural was truly impressive because it is sometimes difficult to portray the past in the present due to dramas or biased interpretations. Leaving us with a lot more knowledge and a sense of mystery combined with English humor made this tour more valuable, interesting, and enjoyable than any other we have taken. Alan’s insider tips and resources for other attractions, events, transportation, and even lodging proved to be invaluable and even his contacts even helped saved us money when booking other activities in the city. Thank you Buenos Tours and Alan for a most memorable and unforgettable experience, one we will not soon forget!

A PRIVATE WALKING TOUR OF BUENOS AIRES. I have been to Buenos Aires on U.S. government programs at least ten times. For the first time ever, my wife joined me for four days. As I had never "done tourism" in Buenos Aires, I looked into a guided walking tour, and signed up with Buenos Tours. We were able to arrange the date and the time for our convenience, and the price was fine. Our guide, Jessica, while originally from the U.S., has lived and studied and worked in Buenos Aires for five years. My wife and I agree that Jessica was the best guide we have ever had in that she was extremely knowledgeable, objective, and a fond of relevant (for me, politics and for my wife, history and culture) information. My wife and I have traveled extensively in Latin America and Europe, and have a good basis for comparison.

terrific. I am an american who was travelling with two sons in their 20s. Finding the helpful buenos tours website was a good thing for a non-native spanish speaker.our tour with jessica was just terrific. she was very knowledgable and took us to several places that we never would have found on our own. A mate shop in san telmo where my boys bought gourds and straws, and great lunch restaurant. the tour itself served as a perfect overview of the city, from san telmo to plaza de mayo to retiro to recollata. we did it on the day after our flight recovery day and it as just right, allowing a few more syas to explore the city. Thank you Jessica and thank you Alan!

four days in BA: a perfect guide for a real taste of the city. I recently went on a tour from Buenos Aires to La Paz with my teen-age daughter and a friend...so three women who wanted to get a feel of the real BA before the full immersion into the adventure of the highlands.We wanted to avoid package tours of the city or "guide and private car" services which seem very expensive.We were lucky to find a lady guide (Elisabet Jeckel) who was with us most of the time. She perfectly understood our needs and made our visit really enjoyable. Besides the classical sights of the center,La Boca, san Telmo we went to the Feira de Mataderos, travelled by bus, walked around,ate at market stalls and mixed up with the local people. Also saw a Tango show at the wonderful Caffè Tortoni with dinner at a very reasonable price.It was perfect. Elisabet is knowledgeable,organized, patient, flexible, helpful, friendly and you don't have to spend a fortune to enjoy the city..

Best way to start my visit in Buenos Aires!. I had a couple days free on my recent trip to Buenos Aires and decided to go on a walking tour of the city. I booked a tour with Buenos Tours. A major appeal was the fact that my guide, Alan, met me at my hotel to start the day. Once on our way we covered several parts of the city including San Telmo, Monserat, historic city center and Recoleta. Alan was a walking encyclopedia on the history of the city. Being a teacher I loved this part of the tour. Since I was on a 7 hour tour we had a midmorning café and medialunias and later empanadas for lunch. It was great and both restaurants were classics. The best part is that Alan gave me several handwritten notes for follow up to other places I wanted to see. This was a great way to learn about the city and be familiar enough with it to go exploring on my own.

Left lacking. I really enjoy seeing a new city on foot with a knowledgeable guide, and have hired private guides in many cities. Jessica ably took me around La Boca, Caminito and the briefest sampling of San Telmo. Our plans were complicated by a subway strike that aggravated the existing horrific travel, so we spent most of our time in a cab trying to get to La Boca. Highlight was the cafe La Federal, in San Telmo where we had an enjoyable coffee break. Not a great value for the money spent.

What a great way to see BA!. I am a solo female travelling in BA and booked the 7 hour walking tour.Jessica met me at my hotel lobby, then we caught a taxi to San Telmo where our tour started.Jessica's experience, knowledge and passion for BA was amazing.The 7 hour tour itself was an easy pace that covered areas San Telmo, Reitro, Centre, the cemetry and much more.I would highly recommend this tour, it gave me a great insight to the city, including history on events that made BA to what it is today, catching the train and Jessica even helped me buy a sim card for my phone including adding credit.Best value for money!

A Great Way to See Buenos Aires. After a last minute travel cancellation of my colleague - I found myself (and my terrible spanish) heading to BsAs alone. Thank goodness I found Buenos Tours here on TripAdvisor! Alan answered all of my questions prior to my arrival and helped craft a tour plan that worked best for my schedule. Jessica met me at my hotel right on time and we headed right on out to the bustling streets. Her depth of knowledge was incredible as was her ability to put up with my many questions and my many dry observations of the city (my wife says it's a non-stop stream of words...)! She quickly demystified the large city as well as providing intimate details to the incredible history of Argentina. I highly recommend Buenos Tours - and specifically Jessica for anyone who comes to Buenos Aires. There service is incredible and well worth the cost!

A great way to see La Boca and San Telmo. Jessica shared her knowledge of these fascinating historical districts with us on our three hour tour, and we felt very safe and well informed. Tour was well paced, with a quick coffee break at a great coffeee house, and lots to see. It was also nice to be met and accompanied by Jessica from our apartment. Try to take this tour on a Sunday when the markets are on, to get maximum benefit. We now feel much more confident about getting out and about in Buenos Aires on our own!

Perfect Introduction. Choosing Buenos Tours for our very first morning in Buenos Aires was a great decision. One could easily be overwhelmed by a city of 13 million people, especially when your native language is not Spanish. After our tour we were comfortably and confidently navigating Buenos Aires with a familiarity that was hard to believe after only one day. Jessica met the three of us in our hotel lobby, on time, and we headed out to learn and enjoy Buenos Aires. We took a taxi to San Telmo and started to learn about the founding of the city, immigration, cultures, economy, wars, politics, religion, architecture and traditions. All of this was done as we walked through fascinating areas, stopping for coffee, drinking Mate, we toured churches, walked cobblestone streets past small brightly painted wooden houses all the way up to massive mansions. We visited Plaza de Mayo where she pointed out and described every significant building and told us about many of the events that had taken place there in the past and explained the protest signs that were there on the day of our tour. We used the Subte (subway) and we were immediately comfortable with its simplicity. We ate at a couple of really good restaurants and we worked our way through many neighborhoods until we toured the amazingly beautiful Recoleta Cemetery where she brought us to many of the most famous tombs of major military and political figures, including Evita’s.  I asked Jessica no less than 100 questions throughout the tour and she had a deep knowledge of every subject. She was born in the US, so she knew what we were likely to find interesting about Buenos Aires. She certainly has a long list of sites to show you, but she also does a great job of listening to your questions to customize the tour to your tastes.  I highly recommend that you take this tour as early as possible on your visit to Buenos Aires; it will enhance the rest of your stay. Wear comfortable shoes because it is a seven hour tour on cobblestone streets and sometimes rough sidewalks.
Really Nice Day. We did a six hour walking tour with Jessica. She is extremely knowledgeable about Buenos Aires, and we really enjoyed everything about the tour.

Outstanding Value. Our day with Buenos Tours more than met our expectations. Jessica took us to places that tourists never see and we also viewed all the main tourist attractions. We learned so much about the city and its culture. We enjoyed a delicious lunch in a charming restaurant filled with local folks. We learned about Argentine history and culture and enjoyed walking through many different neighborhoods, some totally upscale and some not so much, but each one fascinating.Don't miss the opportunity to experience the true Buenos Aires with Jessica.Also, we were upset when we had to make a last minute schedule change and Alan was wonderfully flexible and made rapid alterations to assure us of a comfortable time that fit our new schedule.

Top Notch Tour - Worth Every Penny!!. I took this tour during a stopover in Buenos Aires in August of 2010. Jessica was my tour guide (although Alan answered all of my questions via email prior to making the reservation and was very helpful). Jessica was incredibly knowedgeable. She arrived on time at my B&B. She showed me all of the main historical sights in the downtown area, including the Casa Rosada, Plaza de Mayo, Avenida 9 de Julio, etc. She was also able to navigate throught the line to have lunch at Cafe Tortini. Later on we took the Metro to Plaza Dorego and took a walking tour through San Telmo. I love to walk around cities and soak everything in, but doing so in a faraway place can be challenging. I also enjoy a good conversation. But I like to be able to converse with someone who knows the region and history. Jessica met both of these qualities! She helped me to navigate the city and she was very knowlegable. I learned a lot about Buenos Aires from her and I also enjoyed her company. I highly reccommend this tour. I did not have a lot of time to spend in Buenos Aires, but felt like I got to experience in the city because of Buenos tours.(FYI - the date of my review says August 2011 but I came in August 2010)

Great way to see BsAs in a day. This review is a bit late in coming, my wife and I were in BsAs week of March 21 and took the all day walking tour with Alan. Alan met us at our hotel in microcenter took a taxi to St. Elmo and proceeded on a 9 hour stroll through this great City. Alan was a great guide explaining a lot of the history and politics of not only BaAs but of Argentina and this area of South America. Stopped for coffee in the AM and then for lunch in the afternoon. Saw a bunch of sights and ended at the fantastic cemetery around 6pm. Alan provided great recommendations for dining and a tango show, an oh yeah, the best ice cream in the continent.

Best Tour of BsAs. We did a whole day walking tour with Alan. The tour was excellent, just enough information to not overload us. This was certainly the best tour I've taken of Buenos Aires, where many of the tours claim to be bilingual but have a terrible translation. Alan gave us a great layout of the city as well as recommendations for the rest of the week. If you don't have time for a full day tour, I highly recommend the tour of the Recoleta Cemetery- Extremely well done.

Excellent Value. My husband and I booked two days of tours with Buenos Tours per recommendations from Trip Advisor users. We found our guide, Jessica, was great and knowledgeable. We followed her suggestions and were very pleased. She was able to provide good perspective about social and political conditions without bias. I highly recommend reading Buenos Tours website link regarding walking tour safety. I read it and followed the recommendations. My purse was stolen the first full day and since I followed the recommendations, the thieves got nothing of value. I still felt violated but we did not have get a replacement passport or cancel any credit cards thanks to the Buenos Tours pointers.

An Interesting and fun tour of the cemetery.. We had Alan, an English ex-pat who has obviously soaked up the history of the City in the time he's lived here. He told us kooky facts and fun anecdotes about some of the mausoleums and was glad to answer any questions we had. Highly recommend the tour if you want to learn some solid history of the City and country through dead folks.

Buenos Aires Private Walking Tour. Our day with Jessica, our tour guide, was fantastic. She met us at our hotel then we took a cab to city centre, where the real tour started. In seven hours we had a good city overview, including vignettes of its history. We also were introduced to some city 'treasures' to which we returned later to spend more time. She was able and willing to adjust the snack and lunch stops to meet our dining preferences - we're not huge eaters - but still maintain authentic Buenos Aires dining. We will not hesitate to recommend Jessica and Buenos Tours to anyone coming to Buenos Aires - she certainly puts a lot of energy into the full day - that's a tough gig. We saw and learned so much that we would not have done so without her.

Excellent day with Buenos Tours. we arrived via a cruise ship for the day in February 2012. Jessica was waiting for us at the Sheraton and we were on our way. The entire day was informative, interesting, and mainly fun. We now realize we need to come back to Buenos Aries to spend more time. I've written about our day in Buenos Aries with Buenos Tours, check it out.... http://vickiesadventure.blogspot.ca/2012/02/buenos-aries-february-22.html

Insightful, approachable & fun. We had a tour of the Recoleta cemetery with Alan - an excellent experience. He was insightful, clearly highly knowledgeable and gave just the right level of detail. I won't hesitate to get in touch for another installment the next time I visit BA.

Excellent tour. Learned a lot. Must do it see sites and history!. Took the tour Friday March 30 at 11a with Oliver. He was very prompt and he met us at our apartment in Recoleta. We took a taxi ride to the start of our tour. The actual walk has many stops and lots of information so you aremt tired and all can keep us. I took the tour with my 18 yr old daughter and my mother. This was my second time and I even enjoyed this time more than the first. Oliver was funny, knowlegable and really was a great guide. Alan the owner wil respond very quickly to all emails. We also made a stop at Cafe tortoni for a treat. I wont tell all the tour surprises but spend the money. You wont be disappointed and you will really learn somethng! I have done it twice and this is my first review of it. If I had other new visitors with me I would do it again!

Excellent tour. Just returned to my hotel, after a very nice day walking the streets of BA with Alan.I decided to book the tour after spending a couple of days at a convention. Booking and payment went effortless, emails were replied to promptly.Touring the city for seven hours sounds long, but as the saying goes: Time flies when you¹re having fun.If you¹re up for it share a "mate" with your guide, the Argentinean drink that is, not a male friend ;-)Alan, thank you again, I¹ll be sure to recommend your tour to anyone visiting BA in the future

Superb, knowledgable, insightful, English speaking master tour guide!!. Alan provided us with a superb tour experience! Arrangements were seamless and easy via the internet. He was at our hotel lobby at the appointed time and gave us a wonderful, full tour. We saw areas and places we would not have found on our own. Alan gave us insights into BA history, politics and culture. He was also helpful in suggesting places to see and things to do during our time in Argentina. We highly recommend Alan and his company!!

Amazing!!!. By far this 7 hour walking tour was the best way to see and learn about Buenos Aires. Jessica is an amazing guide. Full of knowledge and charm. She took us places that we would of never went by ourselves.. We had a conversation with other passengers from our cruise, that took an excursion offered by cruise line and were told that it was a terrible choice. WE on other hand had a great fun time.. I felt that I can use another 7 hours, city is wonderful and private walking tour is the way to go.. Thanks you so much!!

An insider's look at wonderful corners of Buenos Aires. We just returned from Buenos Aires where we spent two days touring with Alan and Jessica of Buenos Tours. They shared their vast knowledge of this fascinating city-----the architectural gems, classic cafes, political and cultural history......restaurant suggestions...and tips for using public transport. Wonderful guides!

Fabulous Buenos Aires tour. Just came back from Buenos Aires and during our brief stay we did a three hour walking tour of La Boca and San Telmo one day, and a seven hour walking tour of other parts of the city the next day with guides from Buenos Tours. Both guides (Jessica and Alan) were terrific...smart, entertaining, well-informed, knowledgeable. The tours felt like we were visiting the city with local friends rather than a standard tour guide. Both were native English speakers which really enhanced the experience. I felt like I learned more about Buenos Aires in a few hours than in all the reading I had done in advance. Highly recommend this company!

Must do walking tour. Our walking tour was fantastic and Oliver was an impeccable guide. His knowledge was vast, he was discreet and all seeing on the street and he kept us all engaged for the entire tour. Very impressed! It's a much better way to see the city than sitting on a bus all day. Thanks again, we'll be sure to recommend Buenos tours to our friends.

This tour is a MUST for first time visitors to Buenos Aires!. My husband and I had the extreme pleasure of meeting, Jessica of Buenos Aires Private Walking Tours, our first morning in BA. From the first moment Jessica met us at our rental apartment, we were comfortable, excited and intrigued. As Jessica expertly guided us through the beautiful center of BA, we soon realized that starting our stay in BA with her was invaluable! Jessica has a great sense of humor, is very smart, and has a fabulous knowledge of the history of BA and what's going on now. The 3 hour tour flew by; we didn't want it to be over! Consequently, we booked Jessica for another tour of a different part of the city two days later.......and once again, the tour was phenomenal! If you are visiting BA, this is a must!

A wealth of information and very interactive. We found it on the net and had had speedy and informative replies, before arriving in Buenos Aires. Alan, the owner, arrived promptly at our hotel and then proceeded to walk taxi and train us through the city. He was very knowledgable on the history, politics and economics of the city and country. We gained a depth of knowledge and insight of Argentina that would have been impossible, in such a short time, on our own. A very enjoyable excursion

Great Tour!. We took the 7 hour private tour for 3 on our 2nd day- it set the tone for our trip. I know, 7 hours, but it went by rather quickly because of how it was spaced and the breaks provided. We got a great sense of of BA, the history and what we wanted to spend more time doing. Our guide, Jessica, was great! She provided tips about restaurants, day trips and BA culture and language.

Fabulous introduction to a vibrant city!. My husband and I vacationed in Buenos Aires in January 2012. As part of our planning, I went online looking for city tours. I was looking for something private, preferably on foot, which would give us a great overview of the important parts of the city, and touch on various topics (history, architecture, artists, food, city life, pop culture, etc). I found the website for Buenos Tour online after a google search of "Buenos Aires Walking Tours".Alan, the business owner and tour manager, responded promptly to me when I emailed to inquire for more info on the trip. After a few email exchanges back and forth, my husband and I settled on the 7 hour walking tour of the city. (This tour would be appropriate for any individual hoping to get a great feel for the layout of the city, and to get a wonderful overview (and answers to specific questions) about Buenos Aires. Don't let the "7 hour" length scare you away - it is a very comfortable pace, many opportunities to rest, and many stops where the tour guide will point out interesting things to look at and offer some background information.)We had had the distinct pleasure of spending our first full day in BA doing a 7 hour walking tour with Jessica - a cheerful, young, and extremely knowledgable ex-pat American. She met us at our hotel, and we went off from there. Jessica was friendly, entertaining, and informative - we peppered her with questions all day about politics, culture (historic and pop), food, daily life, you-name-it, and she had intelligent answers for everything. We were very pleased with the tour route - many very interesting stops along the whole way, some at very obvious locations (Pink House, for example, and the Recoleta Cemetary), and some at spots that you would have never come across on your own. Food stops were also great - South American style hot chocolate and medialunas at Cafe Tortoni mid-morning, a great treat and Jessica offerred us many very interesting tidbits about the cafe, its history, and its famous clientelle. Lunch stop was a local restaurant in the Recoleta area - empanadas and provoleta - and a cold beer for the hot day! Recoleta Cemetary was our last stop, and Jessica navigated us through the maze of mausoleums, pointing out various interesting "residents" and offering historical information and ghost stories to boot! Should we ever make our way back down, or ever hear of someone who is on their way for a holiday, we will not hesitate to recommend Buenos Tours (and Jessica especially!). We hope Buenos Tours expands into other parts of South America, too - we'd love to have the same opportunity in another one of South America's beautiful cities!

A fantastic way to get the feel of a city and its people. This was a 7 hour walking tour of Buenos Aires. Jessica was our tour guide (an American so English wasn't a problem) and it was a real pleasure to take the tour. She had so many interesting stories and we felt that we really had seen the best of the city. A great way to kick off two days in Buenos Aires

We Walked Our Legs to Stumps...and Loved It!!. Our private tour guide, Jessica took us on a thorough and interesting tour of several of the various sections of Buenos Aires. We love to walk...so this tour was made for us. We really enjoyed being able to ask questions at any time...and be able to hear and understand the answers. It was also extremely interesting to get the view point of a US expat living in Buenos Aires long term. We spent our full 7 hours walking...not countings a mid-day coffee and a late/long lunch at a unique local restaurant with regional specialties. We feel that you can only truly get to know a city on foot...and it was certainly true in this case. To take this tour, you need to be capable of walking several miles. If you can...we highly recommend it as the best way to see Buenos Aires up close and personal.

From Hollywood (Palermo) to Evita's Balcony. My partner, Mark, and I were in Buenas Aires for Christmas through New Year's. We decided a walking tour would be the best way to see the highlights of BA and burn off some ot the calories from the flight down to Argentina. We pre-booked with Buenos Tours and easily paid through Paypal. Our guide, Jessica, was kind enough to meet us at our hotel in Palermo Hollywood and we caught a cab downtown. I don't want to spoil the tour because not knowing what we were going to see next was part of the appeal. Suffice it to say whether you are intereted in art, architecture, historic monuments and landmarks, mass transportation, or grande cafe's, you will see it all . Our guides, Jessica and Oliver, were unflappable regardless of scope of questioning. Their knowledge of Buenas Aires from the Aboriginals to current sentiment on politicals was awesome. Without reservation, we recommend this tour, it is well worth the price!

a wonderful day in buenos aires. just spent a day with jessica and had a wonderful time walking through the neighborhoods of buenos aires. we thoroughly enjoyed the day and would recommend jessica and this tour to anyone wishing to see the city privately at a very reasonable cost.

A fascinating insight into a fabulous city!. Earlier this year I visited Buenos Aires on a business trip and decided to take a walking tour. I was dithering between doing a standard group tour or splashing out a bit extra for a private tour. I've always had good experiences with private tours before so I went with Buenos Tours, which was recommended by a friend, and was very glad I did! I was met at my hotel by Alan, a friendly young man from England who has lived in Buenos Aires for several years. He took me around the city on a three hour tour, answered all of my questions, and gave me an insight into the city that I simply could not have got from guidebooks or group tours. His knowledge was infallible, and he made the tour feel very relaxed and informal. If you want an interesting, friendly tour, without having to worry about other people on the tour, then this is for you.

Excellent guide, well structured tour that took in all the things that make BA a great city to visit.. Just a quick note to say how much we enjoyed our day with you exploring the layout and history of Buenos Aires. We both felt that we got to understand the development and growth of the city so much more by spending the day with you than we could ever have wandering about with a guidebook. You brought out the details behind the facts and your extensive knowledge of all those small details in the cities history made everything we saw come alive. The remainder of our visit was certainly enriched by having that head start and we enjoyed the remaining time in BA immensely. Our trip Colonia made for the perfect antidote to the bustle of BA and I can heartily agree on the suggestion to spend a night in the town and enjoy it without the tourists. We are now thinking about a return trip to see the rest of Argentina, (or at least a large swath of it) since it has so much to offer.

Great Tour. We took a full day private walking tour. Alan is an excellent guide and brought the city to life with interesting facts and anecdotes. He provided real local insight including recommendations of some great cafes and restaurants.I would highly recommend this tour to anyone visiting Buenos Aires.

Buenos Aires Walking Tour. 3 of us did the Walking Tour of Buenos Aires on our recent cruise around Sth America. Our tour guide was Jessica. The private tour was great as we did it at our own pace and not herded around in a group of 30 or more like on a big bus tour. Jessica was very informative and easy to understand...no foreign accent. She was also very flexiblble as we had to change our original booking due to a change in the ship itinerery,Alan organised our tour and was always very prompt in his reply emails to our enquiries.The cost of the private tour was very cheap ($100 for the 3 of us ) as the cruise ship tours can be very expensive for what you get. We got to see heaps of BA and the time just flew by as it was so interesting.We highly recommend Buenos Aires Walking Tours to all travellers visiting this great city.Many thanks to Jessica and Alan from The Aussies

Wonderful way to start your Trip in Buenos Aires -- Jessica was GREAT!. We loved our tour with Jessica from Buenos Walking Tours (Jessica [jessica@buenostours.com])...outstanding overview of all the key sights and history. We did this our first day and it gave us a reference point for the rest of the week. Jessica was knowledgable, friendly and down to earth. WE would highly recommend her!

Great Tour & Guide. We were only in Buenos Aires for 2 days so my wife and I wanted to find out about and see as much of the city as possible in the limited time we had. After reviewing the options we decided on a personal walking tour with this company.They do various tours but we elected to do the Day Tour. This was a 7 hour private tour and the cost was US $200 - this covered up to 3 people. (US $300 for 4 - 7 people). This is the total for the group and not per person. The tour will be for your party only. They do not mix groups together or add other people. We made payment in advance via PayPal.We were staying at Hotel Madero in the fabulous harbour area full of its new hotels, restaurants, etc. Our guide was Alan who met us at our hotel at 9:30. After brief introductions we set of on our walk - Alan, myself and my wife.We are both fit and good walkers but the pace was not strenuous. The time just flew past and the sights we saw are too many to list. What I can say is that Alan is highly knowledgable and delivers the information in a relaxed manner. He took as to great places such as markets, old buildings, museums, churches, trip on the underground and the most wonderful cemetry. The dead are really very interesting! His knowledge of the city, the people, the history, architecture, etc. is excellent. On our tour we also visited an excellent cafe and a great local restaurant - Alan's recommendations for drinks and food at these places were spot on.At the end of our tour Alan also gave us recommendations for an ice cream shop and a restaurant. We visited both and loved them - can't remember the name if the ice cream shop but it was just along from the red phone boxes on the street corner. The restaurant was La Brigada.As I mentioned the time just flew past and we both thoroughly enjoyed it. Although expensive for 2 people we thought it good value - and much better than sitting on a tour bus! So unless you are on a tight budget I would encourage you to do this tour - and you will never do a bus tour again!

Well worth it!. We took a 7 hour walking tour on our second day in the city and another 3-hour tour a few days later. Our guide was Jessica and she was knowledgeable, friendly and incredibly helpful. she gave us lists of restaurants, bars, and shopping that made the rest of our stay in Buenos Aires fantastic. Her recommendations were our favorite restaurant and bar. Her stories about history and polotics gave life to what is a very beautiful city.

fabulous walking tour--best introduction to Buenos Aires. We took the 7 hour walking tour with Alan as our guide. It was a wonderful and thorough introduction to the city--we felt we received an enormous wealth of historical information, which we really like--and saw a great slice of the city, including riding the oldest subway cars in South America and having a coffee at a really cool old coffee shop. We would HIGHLY recommend this tour company and Alan.

Great Personal Tour Guide. We arranged our trip to Buenos Aires with the assistance of Mercedes Arando, Opera- tions Coordinator at 1st Class Argentina, [---] She assisted us with airport pick up, a private tour of Buenos Aires, tango shows, restaurants and jaunts to Iguasu Falls and she did an excellent job. She loves the city and is very knowledgeable about it's history. She met our every need and was prompt, answered phone calls and reached out to us when our plane trip was cancelled due to the weather. We recommend her highly.

This walking tour was fantastic - one of the best things we did in Buenos Aires!. Jessica gave us a fantastic walking tour of Buenos Aires! Reflecting back after our trip, we agreed that the tour was one of the highlights. We took the tour on our first day, which was great because Jessica provided so much information and answered so many questions for us about the city. We really felt like we had a good orientation that made the rest of our visit much more worthwhile than it might have been otherwise. We highly recommend Buenos Aires Private Walking Tours.

Make this your first day in BA. Fantastic and comprehensive tour. Way more education and information than I expected. Guide was fun and very informative.It was fun reviewing my photo's on my return and sharing my new knowledge and a story or two.Make it your first day and you will enjoy your time much better the rest of your trip.

Highly recommend.. We arrived in BA with our 5 children, ages 2-13. Since there's no group tour that caters to crazy people, we hired Alan to show us the highlights and tell us a little of the history. Worth every penny. He wasn't a bit rattled by all of the kids, and was very knowledgeable about the city. Because he was so good at getting around, we were able to see a lot more with him than we would ever have managed on our own. And he gave us lots of helpful suggestions for the rest of our trip. Completely gracious and charming guy -- if he could manage us, I'm sure he could give a good tour to any group!

Must do tour of Recoleta & Retiro. We've just got back from a really great holiday to Buenos Aires. The place is quite magnificent with Parisian mansions, wide boulevards, great restaurants and wine, and the world's most amazing cemetery. We took Alan's personal tour of the Recoleta and Retiro area which was one of the best decisions we made. The area is full of intrigue and surprises that you only start to learn about as you walk around with Alan. He has a calm and easy-going manner that belies his excellent knowledge and passion for the city. He clearly tailored our tour around things that we found interesting, and helped us gain a true understanding of the city and how it has evolved. We travel a lot and never take guided tours but after seeing Buenos Tours was recommended by so many people we made the reservation - all I can say is don't hesitate, it is great value and you learn so much more than is puiblished in the travel guidebooks. Finally, dont forget to ask Alan about his ice-cream recommendation, there are several excellent gelato shops in the city, but he knows where the best is!

A fantastic introduction to the famous sites and history of Buenos Aires.. Allan at Buenos Aires Tours provides a personalized walking tour of this great city with particular knowledge of the intertwining of Argentine and British history. We subsequently revisited a number of the places and buildings we visited on our walk, armed with the background and history of each place. Allan provides a most informative commentary as you walk through the city and at times the wry observations of a British philosopher who has lived and worked in Buenos Aires for some years.One of our most enjoyable afternoons and highly recommended.

Do not miss this tour. If you are visiting Buenos Aires, the biggest mistake you could make is to not take the 7 hour walking tour. I only had two days in Buenos Aires and it was the best decision I made while in S. America. Alan is terrific ... very friendly and extremely knowledgeable, and of course English speaking which is helpful if you are not Spanish speaking. It was the perfect start to my vacation. I would recommend Buenos Tours in a heartbeat.

Great way to tour the city. 7 hours goes by very quickly when you are walking around different areas of the city learning the history, architecture, and culture of Buenos Aires. Tour was by an Ex-pat from the US who was very knowledgeable, spoke great English and Spanish, and seemed to enjoy what she was doing.

An excellent way to tour a beautiful city. A great day and tour that has allowed me to better appreciate the history and culture of Buenos Aires and Argentina better than I had before. There are many interesting parallels to the United State that I had not previously realized. As promised, Jessica has a wealth of knowledge of Buenos Aires and readily answered any and all questions. I also enjoyed her personal interactions with the people at all the stops. It helped me feel like part of the Buenos Aires scene.

Great tour, go for it!. We took two of the private walking tours with Jessica in two diferent days and they were both very good. Jessica was very friendly, professional and on time. She also has a very strong background in history, this girl knows what she is talking about! Having someone like that with you for a nice walk is such a priviledge. We took the tour through the center and the one in the Recoleta plus cemetery and they were highlights on this trip. I definitely wouldn't get all the information Jessica provided us in books or on the internet. She gave us excellent explanations about the history, politics and architecture of the city. So this tour was definetely worth the money. I think you definetely experience the city in a diferent way once you know a little bit more about it and i think the diference between this tour and the others is that they present the information in a very cool and interesting way leaving out the uncessary and boring parts - awesome. The cemetery tour is a MUST, just do it! Alan was very eficient handling the booking, so in the end we were very happy with their service. Thanks guys for a great experience!

Buenos Tours is highly recommended for any English-speaking person visiting BsAs, whether the visit is short or long!. Buenos Tours was the perfect way to start our 3+ week stay in Buenos Aires. Jessica (our guide) was able to give us a very comprehensive tour of some major parts of the city and we were able to take notes of what we wanted to go back and hit later in our visit, which is very valuable. The tour helped us to get our bearings and feel more comfortable navigating the city (including taxis and the subte) making us feel more confident and excited to head out on our own as our trip progressed. The best parts about Buenos Tours is the size--the walking groups are small and only consist of those people that you sign-up with in your group (in my case, it was just the three of us!). This means that there is plenty of time for questions, photos, customization of the tour, and having longer or shorter stops based on preferences. We were given choices of when to eat (whether we wanted to follow an Argentine or typical United States schedule) and where to eat. It is customization like this and the small group size of the tour that made it truly valuable. Also worth noting is that the tour guide meets you at wherever you are staying in the city, in my case a private residence. This is incredibly helpful and valuable, as this was our first experience getting a Radio Taxi and it was nice to have a seasoned veteran help us out and teach us the cultural tricks. All in all, enough good things cannot be said about Buenos Tours. The tour guide was knowledgeable, friendly, professional, on-time, and very much on-point. The cost was incredibly reasonable, the sights were perfect, and it was the best way for my small group to feel comfortable in the city right off the bat. Our 7-hour tour seemed to pass very quickly because we were all having so much fun, learning a lot, and being so engaged by our tour guide. Highly recommended! It will definitely be remembered as a highlight of my trip to Buenos Aires.

Like touring a city with a best friend.. On a short stopover in Buenos Aires we had the best guided city walk you could ever have. Jessica introduced us to the the history, the politics and the beauty of the old city. (plus a few markets) We even stopped for a coffee at the most fascinating old world cafe.That night it only got better when we went to a Tango show which included a great dinner, drinks and incredible dancing.Thank you Alan for organising all of this and making our short visit so memorable.Russell

Buenos Aires Walking Tour. I and a freind of mine planned a visit to Buenos Aires for a few days in conjunction with travel elsewhere in Argentina. After looking at a number of different tour options, we chose Buenos Aires Private Walking Tours. We weren't sure what to expect because their website indicates its a group of expatriates, writers and travel guides who conduct private tours. We were not disappointed. Our guide Jessica arrived at our hotel on time and provided a great three hour tour. She is originally from New Jersey but currently lives in Buenos Aires, has degrees in Spanish and Latin American history, and was able to share so many personal insights about the people of Argentina and the history of the area. She helped us learn how to use the subway and gave us directions to other landmarks. We also booked other tours with one of the large tour bus companies but this tour far surpassed those and was well worth the money. I would highly recommend booking a tour with this company if planning a visit to the area. The service was excellent.

Great way to see the sights. We took a 3 hour tour of Buenos Aires with Jessica, our guide. It was the perfect introduction to Buenos Aires. We were traveling with 2 children, ages 12 and 9, and she made sure that the sights we saw were interesting to them as well. She pointed out a 200-year old rubber tree, shared some ghost stories at Recoleta Cemetery, and pointed out red phone booths and mailboxes that marked some of the British contributions to the city. Her love of the city is evident in her deep knowledge of its history. When we return to Buenos Aires (I am sure we will), we will surely call on Buenos Tours again.

Our 7 hour walking tour with Alan was a terrific way to start our vacation!. My husband and I were promptly met by Alan at our hotel upon arriving from the airport for our 7 plus hour walking tour. I had hired him via TripAdvisor and paid a downpayment of $40 via PayPal. He emailed us a few times and we got to "know" him before we left. We were given a terrific tour of the city. Having lived there many years before I knew a little bit and it was obvious to myself and my husband that he really knew his facts and history. He is a wealth of information and has a friendly easy going way about him and seems to be well liked by the cafe and restaurant we visited with him. Since we were staying for over a week, he gave us good security tips and what else to see and do.

a terrific introduction to the city. Alan is a wonderful guide. He arrived promptly,and was organized yet quite relaxed.. In just a few hours we learned quite a bit about many important Buenos Aires buildings and Argentine history, visited a grand and lovely cafe and even learned how to navigate the subway system. I highly recommend his tour.

Best money spent on my vacation!. Joined up with Alan for a 4 hour walking tour of downtown historical Buenos Aires and La Boca. Without a shadow of a doubt it was the best use of my vacation dollars ever! Being a bit of a history buff myself, I pumped Alan with obscure question after obscure question. He had answers for all of them. Standing in front of the Pink House and hearing Alan explain how, when and where Peron and Evita spoke to the crowds and how Maradona raised the World Cup from the same balcony sent chills down my spine. I leaned up against a 400 year old wall. I touched San Martin's tomb. I went for latte in a century old coffee shop. I listened to accordian (or whatever they call it) in La Boca just like the immigrants would have at the turn of the century. My sister, who lives in BA and has been on numerous bus tours, learned more about the city in 4 hours than she has in 10 years. Alan was a real gentleman and was full of knowledge and good British humour. DO NOT leave Buenos Aires without going on a tour with Alan or one of his associates. It's worth every penny! Don MundyVancouver, Canada

Our BA walking tour was outstanding. Jessica from Bergen County, New Jersey was our guide in Buenos Aires. She lives in BA, speaks fluent Spanish and gave six of us a wonderful seven hour walking tour in the city. We saw the major sights: the Pink House, Santa Domingo Church, Recoletta Cemetery and much more. It was nice to have an American guide who knows and appreciates her new city. She took us on the subway which was fun and she used the Argentine money to give us history lessons: very clever. All in all it was a great day and we highly recommend Jessica as a guide for a visit to Buenos Aires.

Far exceeded our expectations!. We met Alan at the beginning of February on our 2 day trip to Buenos Aires. I had read so many amazing things about these tours on trip advisor and they were all true!!We originally wanted to do the 7 hour walking tour, however, all their tour guides were booked up for the only 2 days we had in the city! I was so disappointed!!So, Alan himself said that he could be available for a few hours, he allowed us to do one of their 3 hour tours and add on an hour of our choice!So we ended up doing a 4 hour tour (3 hour city center tour - wow!
