So informative and interesting! - a quick visit to the San Telmo market, and the Recoleta cemetery)DO NOT go to the Recoleta cemetery without Alan or one of his tour guides!!! You will get lost, and you will not know what you are looking at!!! It is an AMAZING cemetery with so many interesting stories and history to be known!!The tour delivered everything it promised and more! Alan even helped us find a currency exchange that was open on a SUNDAY and gave us directions to all the best ice cream places!!! We felt like we were leaving behind a friend!! Thank you Alan!! There's no way we could have seen so much of Buenos Aires without you!!

An excellent tour. I asked for a tailor made tour of Recoleta Cemetery/La Boca/Historic centre all in four hours. Jessica was extremely knowledgable and personable, she did a great job of fitting all these sights into the time. The booking was handled efficiently and the details communicated clearly in advance. Jessica met me at my hotel promptly and took me on a very interesting tour. Highly recommended.

More Than a Tour - A Great Experience!. My husband and I have been to Buenos Aires a number of times and always schedule a tour with Buenos Tours. They are professional, reliable, knowledgeable and fun! We highly recommend the Recoleta Tour. Our guide was Alan and he took us through this upscale barrio of Buenos Aires where we experienced beautiful architecture, quiet streets and cafes. The most spectacular part of this 3 hour tour is the walk through the Recoleta Cemetery. While the tombs are magnificent to admire, even better is the history Alan reveals with each gravesite. An experience that will transport you back in time. In addition to his knowledge of the city's history Alan shares his personal experiences living in Buenos Aires, cultural nuances and best of all his favorite places to dine! Many tours are canned responses, not with Buenos Aires Tours; Alan and all the guides cater the tour to your interests. With so many activities to experience this is truly one tour that will provide you with the essence of the city. My husband and I travel extensively and have taken many city tours. Alan is terrific! He is passionate about life and history and will make the city come alive.

Don't Miss This!. The 7-hour walking tour was exactly what I was hoping for and it was easily the best day of my stay in BA. Jessica, the guide, was an American expat who has lived in BA for 3 years and has a degree in literature and history. She was extremely knowledgeable and personable and the perfect resource for anyone that wants to understand more about the history and the culture of BA. The tour was worth every penny, highly recommended.

Fantastic, fun and educational!. Had a great day with guide Jessica from Buenos Tours. Amazingly knowledgeable - wasn't a question we asked that she didn't know the answer to. Fantastic way to get to know and understand the city. A fair bit of walking, but well worth the effort. Great choice of coffee shop and local lunch restaurant. Would highly recommend it. Painless to book, and very speedy communication. 5*

A great introduction to Buenos Aires. On a three week tour of Argentina, my friend and I had about a day and half in BA and we wanted to make the most of it. We booked the 7 hour walking tour with BuenosTours and enjoyed every minute of it. Jessica, our guide, was a young American student who had a clear affection for her adopted city and its history. I've given walking tours myself and you can tell when someone is just reading a script versus sharing their enthusiasm. At the end of the day, we were tired but I had an understanding of the how the city is laid out and its history. It was also fascinating to hear about Jessica's experiences living in BA. We also went to the Piazzolla Tango show recommended by BuenosTours. A tango show might be touristy but I thought this one was excellent. The theater is beautiful. Many styles of tango were danced. The dances were interspersed with songs and it was a very entertaining show.

Great experience with Alan and Buenos Tours. Highly recommended!. My wife and I visited Buenos Aires as part of a 3 country trip for our honeymoon. Buenos Aires was our second stop and we did a lot of research to find a walking tour of Buenos Aires that was in English. We read many good reviews of Buenos Tours and sure enough, the reviews held true! Alan was a fabulous host of the city and was extremely accomodating. He stopped for pictures, answered any and all questions and really gave us a real great firsthand experience of Buenos Aires. He met us at our hotel and took us all over the city for a good 6-8 hours worth of sightseeing.We rode on the city's first subway car (found out Buenos Aires was one of the first 7 cities in the world to have an underground subway system), had a snack at the city's most famous cafe, ate some amazing Empanadas at a smaller restaurant and many other things.I'd recommend Alan and this tour to anyone else visiting Buenos Aires. He's lived there for 5+ years and knows the city in and out. Top notch experience....

outstanding Recoleta/Retiro tour. We easily scheduled a tour with Buenos Tours online and received prompt confirmation of our booking, complete with a photo of our tour guide, Jessica, who met us promptly in our hotel lobby as promised. Jessica was knowledgeable, friendly and ever so accomodating. She also gave us great hints about what else to do and see in BA, places to eat and information about how to get around the city using the subway. It was a great introduction to Buenos Aires!

Excellent way to see Buenos Aires. I had a morning in Buenos Aires between the end of my conference and the flight. Jessica from Buenos Tours took me on a three-hour walking tour that covered the founding of the city to the present day.This was a great way to become acquainted with the history and architecture of the city. Jessica was a charming and knowledgable guide. She knew the history of the city, pointed out architectural highlights and talked about the politics both past and present.

Friendly, knowledgeable tourgide provides a detailed and entertaining orientation to Buenos Aires. Buenos Tours’ seven-hour private walking tour of central Buenos Aires was the perfect orientation to the city on our first full day there, not to mention being a completely enjoyable day with our guide (and company founder) Alan, a young Brit full of enthusiasm for the city. Alan not only provided the facts and figures of the key tourist sites, he shared enough of his expat experience in BA that we parted at the end of the day well supplied with recommendations and prepared to dive deep into porteño life for the remainder of our holiday. The tour began in San Telmo and worked its way to the Plaza de Mayo and its environs, eventually taking us through Retiro and Recoleta on foot and by subway before concluding with a walk through Recoleta cemetery. Alan’s wide-ranging and impressively deep narration encompassed topics from architecture to history to politics, economics, urban planning, culture, society and more – all relevant to where we were standing at that moment and placing Buenos Aires in its proper (and highly entertaining) context.Alan displayed sensitivity to our tastes and desires, and as he got to know us over the course of the day his recommendations for activities, places and events dovetailed nicely with what we wanted to learn. These included a peripatetic wine tasting in Palermo (http://www.winetoururbano.com.ar) that provided an excellent introduction both to Argentine wine and to the Palermo Soho neighborhood, a café in Boedo that gave us the perfect tourist-free porteño experience, advice on attending a Boca Juniors football game, and much more. He also taught us how to board a city bus (which is an oddly overcomplicated transaction in BA), and advised us which bus lines would serve our needs.In true Buenos Tours form, as Alan made his goodbye he pointed across the street toward a bar he likes that brews its own beer. And by then we really needed to sit down so it was much appreciated.Thanks, Alan!

Best walking tour for local insight into BsAs. Spent three hours with Jessica walking around the historic areas of BsAs. Wonderful knowledge of the history of the city. But the REAL gem of this tour was being able to talk with Jessica about her experience living in the city and her interpretation of local customs, politics, etiquette, etc. 100% recommended for anyone coming to BsAs for the first time.

BuenosTours makes the city SPARKLE for you!. Three of us took the 7 hour private guided day walking tour around Buenos Aires with our BuenosTours guide, Jessica. I have never enjoyed myself more on any tour! Jessica immediately got to know us and made us feel like we were walking around with an old friend who just happened to live in Buenos Aires! She answered any question we could throw her way and then gave us really interesting and fun information about each place we saw in Buenos Aires. Like any big city, it's a large place and seems kind of cold at first if you don't know anybody. However, having a guide who knows the place instantly makes Buenos Aires sparkle! I would recommend this tour for any audience. The guides will fit it to your interests and I promise you won't be disappointed!

Stunningly interesting and brilliantly guided!. Best and most interesting history lesson via Alan ever! This was my 3 rd time back in Argie visiting my family and because of the private tour I am fascinated by the history. Alan collected my son and I at our hotel and we made use of the tube, old subway and bus-enjoyed tea at Cafe Tortini and ended the tour at Casa Rosada. Brilliant and extremely professional, orginized and stunningly interesting! Alan, you know your niche!! Regards, Yvette. (South-Africa)

Fantabulous. Alan collected me at my BB and this was so comforting to me. BA was awsome the best thing to do when you arrive is to go for a walking tour with Alan. Tennis shoes, water, Camera & money (small change) Get lots of small change. The Subte & busses are so cheap and paid with nickel. Taxis are very affordable. The 7hour tour with Alan was so worth it. We covered alot and there was a lot to hear & see about BA. Tortonis was cool. Alteno Awsomely beautiful. Restuarant c\o Viamonte & Rodriguez Pena meat was so good. You have to buy 2prs of Tango shoes. Could eat tons of Dulce de Leche! Havanna Alfajor a must. La Defense, Caminito, Recoleta, La Boca, Puerto Madero.Retiro. All a must to see. To walk was safe, keep your valuables close to your body and not in bags with easy accessible pockets. Leather shoes are good buys. Check your change from small side cafes where you buy sweets and cooldrinks. When using a taxi, make sure the car is clean, driver has a name tag hanging on the back seat, use Radio Taxi. If in doudt don't use the driver but most are very good with change and slips. If I had more time I would have definitely done more tours with Alan. The tours are VERY informative with lots of good details. Alan always notified me that he was on his way. Very friendly and polite and I had lots of fun with him. He is very attentive to detail and is punctual with emails. I would certainly recommend Buenos Aires Private Walking Tours as a starting point in BA. You won't regret the time with Alan.

7 hour walking tour of Buenos Aires. For a two week holiday in Buenos Aries, I looked up an introduction to the city via BuenosTours (www.buenostours.com). Alan is the founder of the tour group and has multiple other well experienced guides working with him taking individuals (or small parties) around BA for private walking tours. The amount I was able to learn about the culture, turbulent political history, food, architecture and also activities of this remarkable city and surrounding areas in that 7 hours (1 day) has set up my fortnight to be a highly productive and fascinating period to understand this place well. I have been able to smatter my schedule with dates/times with upcoming activities to truly immerse myself in the culture during this stay. Alan is able to highlight some very key reasons why this city has formed like it has and delves into the underbelly of BA to provide a rare and somewhat unique insight his five years of living in the city (from his UK upbringing) has afforded him and his clients. I highly recommend contacting Alan and booking him or one of his team members for a wonderful introduction to Argentina, specifically, Buenos Aires. Regards,Scott Crank

Best Guided Tour Experience - Buenos Aires. We arrived into Buenos Aires early on a Friday morning and immediately met with Jessica, a guide with Buenos Tours who was US ex pat living in Argentina, who took us on a walking tour of Buenos Aires for 7+ hours. The tour was a great way for us to orient ourselves into the bustling elegance and style of this great city. Jessica's knwoledge of Buenos Aires goes beyond that of most tour guides, and she was both professional, likeable, and genuine. Also, Alan at Buenos Tours who owns/manages the operation is a great resource and makes it easy to schedule a tour and provide you with links and refences of other things to see and do in Buenos Aires. Finally Jessica listened to our needs and desires while on vacation and assisted our efforts to line up activities and experiences that will always be remembered long after the 35mm's have been developed and credit cards paid.

Knowledgeable, flexible, excellent tours!. We contacted Buenos Tours without prior notice and asked them to arrange two walking tours for the next day and the day after. They were very accommodating and quickly connected us to Jessica, a student of history that was able to not only show us many interesting sights, but explain a good deal of the history behind them and the Argentinian culture. It was a fascinating look inside past and present Argentina, and we learned a great deal that made our stay more interesting and meaningful. The prices were fair and the service excellent. We recommend Buenos Tours and especially Jessica to anyone interested in a deeper understanding of Argentina.

110% Satisfied with Buenos Tours. I have booked a tour of Buenos Aires through Buenos Tours on two separate occasions, and I can't recommend them enough. The first time around I booked a private, full-day walking tour with Alan, and he absolutely delivered! He engaged all of us with a highly informative and well-planned tour. Alan's pleasant, easy-going style mixed with a touch of classic British wit resulted in an outing that was truly memorable. My parents raved about the tour, and I scheduled a second tour for my dad and his wife when they returned for a visit a year later. Jessica, an American expat living in Buenos Aires, was the guide for the second tour, and she was also very friendly and extremely knowledgeable about the city. Buenos Tours is a first rate operation - don't hesitate to use their services.

Buenos Tours, Walking Tours in Buenos Aires.. While in Buenos Aires our group of 13 went on 2 different walking tours with Alan & Melanie of Buenos Tours. (www.buenostours.com)They were wonderuful tour guides speaking fluent English. Alan from England and Melanie from USA but originally from Argentina. They went over and above their duties and showed us so many wonderful sights. I would and will strongly recommend this company and specifically Alan & Melanie.
